RECIPE 54: Apple Hand Pies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 hand pies
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 2 large green apples - peeled
• cored
• and cut into chunks
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• ¼ cup white sugar
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• or to taste
• 1 teaspoon water
• or more if needed (Optional)
• 1 pound prepared pie dough
• cut into 4 pieces
• 1 egg
• 2 teaspoons milk
• 1 teaspoon white sugar
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat; let butter brown to a light golden color and smell toasted, about 1 minute
2. Stir apples into hot butter; sprinkle with 1/4 cup white sugar, brown sugar, and salt
3. Cook and stir apple mixture until apples are softened, about 5 minutes
4. Mix in cinnamon and water; continue cooking until apples are soft and sticky, 1 to 2 more minutes
5. Spread apple filling onto a plate to cool
6. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
7. Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment paper
8. Form a dough piece into a ball, place on a floured work surface, and roll into a circle about 8 inches in diameter
9. Spoon 1/3 to 1/2 cup apple filling in the center
10. Fold dough over filling, leaving about 1 inch of dough on the bottom side visible below the top side
11. Gently press dough closed around filling, using your fingertips
12. Fold the overhanging bottom part of dough up over the top edge, working your way around the crust, and pinch the overhang tightly to the top part of the crust
13. Crimp the edge tightly closed, pinching a little bit of dough with the thumb and forefinger of one hand and using your index finger on the other hand to push a small notch into the pinched dough
14. Continue pinching and notching all the way around until crust is tightly crimped together
15. Repeat with remaining dough and filling
16. Transfer pies onto prepared baking sheet
17. Whisk egg with milk in a small bowl until thoroughly combined
18. Brush top of each hand pie with egg mixture and sprinkle with about 1/4 teaspoon white sugar
19. Cut 3 small vent holes in the top of each pie
20. Bake in the preheated oven until pies are golden brown and filling is bubbling, 25 to 30 minutes
21. Let cool for at least 15 minutes before serving
22. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 42g 54%, Saturated Fat 13g 64%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 754mg 33%, Total Carbohydrate 82g 30%, Dietary Fiber 6g 23%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 5mg 27%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 4mg 19%, Potassium 215mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234374/apple-hand-pies/

============================================================

RECIPE 55: Amazing Apple Butter
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 6 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 hrs 25 mins
Total Time: 10 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Fruit Butter Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 pounds apples
• quartered
• 4 cups unsweetened apple juice
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground cloves
• ½ teaspoon ground allspice
• 6 half-pint canning jars with lids and rings

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine apples and apple juice in a stockpot; bring to a boil
2. Reduce heat and cook at a simmer until apples are soft and mushy, 20 to 30 minutes
3. Spoon apples into a food mill and process into puree while discarding the cores and peels remaining in the mill
4. Transfer process apples to a slow cooker
5. Cook on High with the lid off until the moisture evaporates and the volume reduces by about half, overnight to 24 hours
6. Stir sugar, apple cider vinegar, cinnamon, cloves, and allspice through the apple puree
7. Continue cooking on High until mixture mounds on a chilled plate without any water separating from the edges, another 2 to 6 hours
8. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
9. Pack the apple butter into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
10. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
11. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
12. Top with lids, and screw on rings
13. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
14. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder
15. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
16. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
17. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process 5 to 10 minutes
18. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
19. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
20. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 5mg 23%, Calcium 8mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 127mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229892/amazing-apple-butter/

============================================================

RECIPE 56: Easy Apple Cinnamon Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 large muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Apple Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 egg
• ⅓ cup vegetable oil
• ⅓ cup milk
• 2 apples - peeled
• cored and chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease 6 large muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners
3. Make muffins: Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl
4. Mix in egg, oil, and milk
5. Fold in chopped apples
6. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling just below the rim
7. Make topping: Place sugar, butter, flour, and cinnamon into a small bowl; mash mixture with a fork and sprinkle over unbaked muffins
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes
9. Kelly McCulley

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 29g 37%, Saturated Fat 12g 61%, Cholesterol 73mg 24%, Sodium 441mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 79g 29%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 47g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 110mg 8%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 131mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/24352/easy-apple-cinnamon-muffins/

RECIPE 57: Debbie's Amazing Apple Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 eggs
• 2 cups white sugar
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 2 cups apples
• peeled and diced
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons salt
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• or more to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan
3. Beat eggs, sugar, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl; stir in apples
4. Mix flour, salt, baking powder, and cinnamon in a separate bowl; add to apple mixture and stir just until evenly combined
5. Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes
7. Cover loaf pan with aluminum foil; continue baking until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 15 minutes more
8. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack
9. Aaron Brown

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 37mg 12%, Sodium 412mg 18%, Total Carbohydrate 63g 23%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 43g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 39mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 70mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/231288/debbies-amazing-apple-bread/

RECIPE 58: Mom's Apple Fritters
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 quart vegetable oil for deep-frying
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ⅔ cup milk
• 2 large eggs
• beaten
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• 3 cups apples - peeled
• cored and chopped
• 1 cup cinnamon sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat oil in a deep fryer or electric skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl
3. Pour in milk, eggs, and oil; stir until well blended
4. Mix in apples until evenly distributed
5. Working in small batches to prevent overcrowding, drop spoonfuls of batter into the deep fryer and fry in hot oil until golden all over, about 5 minutes
6. Use a slotted spoon to transfer fritters to a paper towel-lined plate
7. Toss warm fritters with cinnamon sugar in a bowl until well coated
8. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 98mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 35mg 3%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 41mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/90295/moms-apple-fritters/

RECIPE 59: Easy Apple Crisp with Pie Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 8x8-inch dish
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 3.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Apple Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (21 ounce) can apple pie filling
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 cup margarine
• ¼ cup brown sugar
• 2 cups all-purpose flour

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread pie filling in an 8x8-inch baking dish
3. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg
4. Cream together margarine and sugar
5. Cut in flour with a pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
6. Sprinkle mixture over pie filling
7. Bake in the preheated oven until the topping is brown and crisp and the filling is hot and bubbly, about 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 31g 39%, Saturated Fat 5g 27%, Sodium 398mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 67g 25%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 31mg 2%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 119mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/22917/easy-apple-crisp-with-pie-filling/

RECIPE 60: Apple Strudel Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Apple Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 2 large eggs
• 1 ¼ teaspoons vanilla
• 1 ½ cups chopped apples

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan
3. Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl
4. Beat together sugar, butter, and eggs in a large bowl until smooth
5. Mix in vanilla
6. Stir in apples, then gradually blend in flour mixture
7. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin pan
8. Make topping: Mix brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon in a small bowl
9. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs
10. Sprinkle over each muffin top
11. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 20 minutes
12. Let sit 5 minutes before transferring muffins to a wire rack to cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 12%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 54mg 18%, Sodium 255mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 24g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 33mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 63mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/33157/apple-strudel-muffins/

RECIPE 61: Delicious Cinnamon Baked Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon butter
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• 3 teaspoons vanilla sugar
• 3 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 6 large apples - peeled
• cored
• and sliced
• 3 ½ tablespoons water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a large baking dish with butter
3. Mix brown sugar, vanilla sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a small bowl
4. Layer about 1/3 of the apples in the prepared baking dish; sprinkle with 1/3 of the sugar mixture
5. Repeat layers twice more
6. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes
7. Pour water over apples and continue baking until tender, about 15 minutes more

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 62: Waldorf Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Waldorf Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup mayonnaise
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• 3 apples -- peeled
• cored
• and chopped
• 1 cup thinly sliced celery
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• ½ cup raisins (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk together mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice, and salt in a serving bowl
2. Stir in apples, celery, walnuts, and raisins
3. Cover and chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve

RECIPE 63: Apple-Cranberry Crostada
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 6 to 8 - servings
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons butter
• 2 pounds Granny Smith apples (or other firm
• crisp apples)
• peeled
• quartered
• cored and sliced 1/4-inch thick
• 1 pound Macintosh apples (or other soft-textured apples that fall apart when cooked)
• peeled
• quartered
• cored
• and sliced 1/4-inch thick
• ½ cup sugar
• ½ cup dried cranberries
• 1 sheet frozen puff pastry
• thawed but still cold (follow package directions)
• 1 egg white
• lightly beaten
• 1 tablespoon sugar
• 1 cup Optional: Ice cream or lightly sweetened whipped cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat
2. Add apples, 1/2 cup sugar and cranberries; cover and cook until apples release their liquid, about 5 minutes
3. Remove lid and continue to cook, stirring frequently, until soft apples fall apart and juices thicken to a thin-syrup consistency, about 5 minutes longer
4. Pour onto a large-lipped cookie sheet or jellyroll pan and cool to room temperature. (Can be refrigerated in an airtight container up to 5 days.) Adjust oven rack to low position and heat oven to 400 degrees
5. Open puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured work surface
6. Roll into a rectangle, about 10 by 16 inches
7. Transfer to a large cookie sheet. (I suggest lining the sheet with parchment paper; this ensures the crostada doesn't stick and allows easy cleanup.) Spread cooked apples over pastry, leaving a 2-inch border
8. Fold up pastry borders over apples
9. Unfold corners and form ruffled creases to keep dough from overlapping
10. Brush pastry border with egg white and sprinkle with the remaining 1 Tb. sugar
11. Bake until pastry is golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes
12. Serve warm or at room temperature with optional ice cream or whipped cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 7g 34%, Cholesterol 19mg 6%, Sodium 128mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 60g 22%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 40g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 8mg 42%, Calcium 35mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 245mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/76931/apple-cranberry-crostada/

============================================================

RECIPE 64: Apple Pie by Grandma Ople
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 small Granny Smith apples
• or as needed
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• ¼ cup water
• 1 (9 inch) double-crust pie pastry
• thawed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Peel and core apples, then thinly slice
2. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
3. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat
4. Add flour and stir to form a paste; cook until fragrant, about 1 to 2 minutes
5. Add both sugars and water; bring to a boil
6. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes
7. Remove from the heat
8. Press one pastry into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie pan
9. Roll out remaining pastry so it will overhang the pie by about 1/2 inch
10. Cut pastry into eight 1-inch strips
11. Place sliced apples into the bottom crust, forming a slight mound
12. Lay four pastry strips vertically and evenly spaced over apples, using longer strips in the center and shorter strips at the edges
13. Make a lattice crust: Fold the first and third strips all the way back so they're almost falling off the pie
14. Lay one of the unused strips perpendicularly over the second and fourth strips, then unfold the first and third strips back into their original position
15. Fold the second and fourth vertical strips back
16. Lay one of the three unused strips perpendicularly over top
17. Unfold the second and fourth strips back into their original position
18. Repeat Steps 6 and 7 to weave in the last two strips of pastry
19. Fold and trim excess dough at the edges as necessary, and pinch to secure
20. Slowly and gently pour sugar-butter mixture over lattice crust, making sure it seeps over sliced apples
21. Brush some onto lattice, but make sure it doesn't run off the sides
22. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes
23. Reduce the temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue baking until apples are soft, 35 to 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 9g 46%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 124mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 52g 19%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 5mg 27%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 156mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12682/apple-pie-by-grandma-ople/

============================================================

RECIPE 66: Apple Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch pan
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Apple Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 cups all-purpose apples
• peeled
• cored and sliced
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ cup water
• 1 cup quick-cooking oats
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• ¼ teaspoon baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ cup butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Place sliced apples in a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. Mix white sugar, 1 tablespoon flour, and cinnamon together; sprinkle over apples
4. Pour water evenly over apples
5. Combine oats, 1 cup flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and baking soda in a large bowl
6. Add melted butter and mix with a fork until crumbly; sprinkle evenly over apple mixture
7. Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown and apples are bubbling around the edges, about 45 minutes
8. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 98mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 61g 22%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 44g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 4mg 21%, Calcium 36mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 162mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12409/apple-crisp-ii/

RECIPE 67: Apple Pie Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 40
Yield: 5 9-inch pies
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 18 cups thinly sliced apples
• 3 tablespoons lemon juice
• 10 cups water
• 4 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 cup cornstarch
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Toss apples with lemon juice in a large bowl and set aside
2. Pour water into a Dutch oven over medium heat
3. Combine sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg in a bowl; add to water, stir well, and bring to a boil
4. Boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly
5. Add apples and return to a boil
6. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until apples are tender, 6 to 8 minutes
7. Cool for 30 minutes
8. Ladle into 5 freezer containers, leaving 1/2 inch of headspace
9. Cool at room temperature no longer than 1 1/2 hours
10. Seal and freeze
11. Can be stored for up to 12 months
12. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 61mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 16%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 63mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12681/apple-pie-filling/

RECIPE 68: Easy Apple Crisp with Oat Topping
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Apple Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 apples - peeled
• cored
• and sliced
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• divided
• 1 cup brown sugar
• ¾ cup old-fashioned oats
• ¾ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup cold butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Toss apples with white sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in a medium bowl to coat; pour into a 9-inch square baking dish
3. Mix brown sugar, oats, flour, and 1 teaspoon cinnamon in a separate bowl
4. Cut in cold butter with 2 knives or a pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs; spread over apples and pat down gently until even
5. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and sides are bubbling, about 40 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 15g 74%, Cholesterol 61mg 20%, Sodium 177mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 99g 36%, Dietary Fiber 8g 27%, Total Sugars 63g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 10mg 48%, Calcium 69mg 5%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 360mg 8%

RECIPE 69: Easy Apple Cider
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Cider Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle apple cider
• 3 cinnamon sticks
• 1 teaspoon whole allspice
• 1 teaspoon whole cloves
• ⅓ cup brown sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine apple cider and cinnamon sticks in a slow cooker
2. Place allspice and cloves onto the center of an 8-inch square piece of cheesecloth
3. Gather edges of the cheesecloth together and tie to secure; place in the slow cooker
4. Stir in brown sugar
5. Cook on High until it comes to a boil
6. Reduce heat to Low and keep warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 31mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 16%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 20mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/42022/easy-apple-cider/

RECIPE 70: Apple-Cranberry Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8-inch crisp
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds Granny Smith apples - peeled
• cored and thinly sliced
• ¾ cup cranberries
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C.) Butter an 8-inch square baking dish
2. Mix apples, cranberries, white sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large bowl
3. Place in an even layer in the prepared baking dish
4. In the same bowl, combine oats, flour, and brown sugar for topping
5. Add butter pieces and mix with a fork until crumbly
6. Stir in pecans
7. Sprinkle topping over apples in the baking dish
8. Bake in the preheated oven until apples are tender and topping is golden brown, 40 to 50 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 47mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 16%, Dietary Fiber 4g 16%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 7mg 36%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 207mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/41893/apple-cranberry-crisp/

============================================================

RECIPE 71: Old-Fashioned Apple Dumplings
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 recipe pastry for double-crust pie
• 6 large Granny Smith apples
• peeled and cored
• ½ cup butter
• ¾ cup brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 3 cups water
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Butter a 9x13-inch pan
3. Roll pastry into a 24x16-inch rectangle on a lightly floured surface
4. Cut into six 8-inch squares
5. Place an apple on each pastry square with the cored opening facing upward
6. Cut butter into 8 pieces; place 1 piece in the opening of each apple; reserve the remaining butter for sauce
7. Divide brown sugar between apples, poking some inside each cored opening and the rest around the base of each apple
8. Sprinkle cinnamon and nutmeg over apples
9. Using slightly wet fingertips, bring one corner of the pastry square up to the top of the apple, then bring the opposite corner to the top and press together
10. Bring up the two remaining corners, and seal
11. Slightly pinch the dough at the sides to completely seal in the apple
12. Repeat with the remaining apples and place in the prepared baking dish
13. Combine water, white sugar, vanilla extract, and reserved butter in a large saucepan
14. Place over medium heat, and bring to a boil
15. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes
16. Carefully pour the sauce over the dumplings
17. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes
18. Place each apple dumpling in a dessert bowl, and spoon some of the sauce over the top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 35g 45%, Saturated Fat 15g 74%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 434mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 148g 54%, Dietary Fiber 7g 23%, Total Sugars 115g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 11mg 53%, Calcium 52mg 4%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 319mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/46232/old-fashioned-apple-dumplings/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup butter
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon
• 4 Granny Smith apples - peeled
• cored
• and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat
2. Add sugar and cinnamon; stir until sugar dissolves
3. Add apples and cook until softened, 5 to 8 minutes
4. Melissa Goff

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 30%, Saturated Fat 15g 73%, Cholesterol 61mg 20%, Sodium 165mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 39g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 7mg 35%, Calcium 49mg 4%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 174mg 4%

RECIPE 73: Apple Turnovers
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 turnovers
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• 4 cups water
• 4 Granny Smith apples - peeled
• cored and sliced
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 1 cup brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• 1 tablespoon water
• 1 (17.25 ounce) package frozen puff pastry sheets
• thawed
• 1 cup confectioners' sugar
• 1 tablespoon milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine the lemon and 4 cups water in a large bowl
2. Place the sliced apples in the water to keep them from browning
3. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat
4. Drain water from apples, and place them into the hot skillet
5. Cook and stir for about 2 minutes
6. Add brown sugar, and cinnamon, and cook, stirring, for 2 more minutes
7. Stir together cornstarch and 1 tablespoon water
8. Pour into the skillet, and mix well
9. Cook for another minute, or until sauce has thickened
10. Remove from heat to cool slightly
11. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
12. Unfold puff pastry sheets, and repair any cracks by pressing them back together
13. Trim each sheet into a square
14. Then cut each larger square into 4 smaller squares
15. Spoon apples onto the center of each squares
16. Fold over from corner to corner into a triangle shape, and press edges together to seal
17. Place turnovers on a baking sheet, leaving about 1 inch between them
18. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until turnovers are puffed and lightly browned
19. Cool completely before glazing
20. To make the glaze, mix together the confectioners' sugar, milk and vanilla in a small bowl
21. Adjust the thickness by adding more sugar or milk if necessary
22. Drizzle glaze over the cooled turnovers
23. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 33%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 184mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 80g 29%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 50g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 5mg 26%, Calcium 42mg 3%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 161mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/59124/apple-turnovers/

============================================================

RECIPE 74: Apple Crisp - Perfect and Easy
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 8-inch square dish
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Apple Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups apples - peeled
• cored
• and sliced
• 1 cup sifted all-purpose flour
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup butter
• softened

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease an 8-inch square baking dish
3. Arrange apple slices evenly in the prepared baking dish
4. Sift flour, sugar, cinnamon, and salt into a bowl
5. Cut in butter using a pastry blender, or 2 knives, until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal; sprinkle over apples
6. Bake in the preheated oven until topping is golden, 40 to 45 minutes
7. Cool slightly before serving. naples34102

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 20%, Saturated Fat 10g 49%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 207mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 13mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 77mg 2%

RECIPE 75: The Best Caramel Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Caramel Apple Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 large tart apples
• 8 wooden chopsticks for handles
• 2 cups packed brown sugar
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 cup light corn syrup
• 1 cup butter
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil
2. Dip apples in boiling water for a few seconds, using a slotted spoon, then dry with paper towels to remove any wax from the peels
3. Set apples aside to cool completely, about 30 minutes
4. Insert sticks into the bottom of each cooled apple through the core for a handle
5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
6. Stir brown sugar, sweetened condensed milk, corn syrup, and butter together in a saucepan over medium-high heat
7. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, then reduce heat to medium
8. Cook until a candy thermometer reads 248 degrees F (120 degrees C), stirring constantly to prevent burning, about 25 to 30 minutes
9. A teaspoon of caramel dropped in a glass of cold water, should form a firm ball
10. Remove caramel from heat and stir in vanilla extract
11. Working quickly, dip each apple into the hot caramel to completely coat the apple and about 1/2 inch of the wooden handle
12. Sprinkle apples with any desired toppings while still hot
13. Let caramel apples cool on the prepared baking sheet, about 1 hour
14. Use caution, caramel is very hot

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 28g 35%, Saturated Fat 17g 87%, Cholesterol 78mg 26%, Sodium 269mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 142g 51%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 113g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 11mg 55%, Calcium 210mg 16%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 491mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228210/the-best-caramel-apples/

============================================================

RECIPE 76: Mulligatawny Soup
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Soup Recipes/Chicken Soup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup chopped onion
• 2 stalks celery
• chopped
• 1 carrot
• diced
• ¼ cup butter
• 1 ½ tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons curry powder
• 4 cups chicken broth
• ½ apple
• cored and chopped
• ¼ cup white rice
• 1 skinless
• boneless chicken breast half - cut into cubes
• 1 pinch dried thyme
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• ½ cup heavy cream
• heated

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium heat
2. Add onions, celery, and carrot and sauté until soft, 5 to 7 minutes
3. Add flour and curry, and cook 5 more minutes, stirring frequently
4. Add chicken broth, mix well, and bring to a boil
5. Reduce heat and simmer for about 30 minutes
6. Add apple, rice, chicken, thyme, salt, and pepper
7. Simmer until rice is tender, 15 to 20 minutes
8. Just before serving, stir in hot cream
9. TheBritishBaker

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 20%, Saturated Fat 10g 48%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 734mg 32%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 186mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13087/mulligatawny-soup-i/

RECIPE 77: Sauteed Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 4 cups
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup butter
• 4 large tart apples - peeled
• cored and sliced 1/4 inch thick
• ½ cup cold water
• 2 teaspoons cornstarch
• ½ cup brown sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat; add apples and cook, stirring constantly, until almost tender, 6 to 7 minutes
2. Mix water and cornstarch together in a small bowl until cornstarch is dissolved; pour over apples
3. Stir in brown sugar and cinnamon
4. Bring to a boil for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally
5. Remove from heat and serve warm. dotdash meredith food studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 45mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 18mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 128mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/21672/sauteed-apples/

RECIPE 78: Homemade Apple Cider
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 gallon
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 3 hrs
Total Time: 7 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Juice Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 large apples
• quartered
• water
• to cover
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• 1 tablespoon ground allspice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place apples in a large stockpot; cover with water by at least 2 inches
2. Stir in sugar, cinnamon, and allspice
3. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat
4. Boil, uncovered, for 1 hour
5. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 2 hours
6. Strain apple mixture through a fine-mesh sieve; discard solids
7. Drain cider again through a cheesecloth-lined sieve
8. Refrigerate cider until cold, about 4 hours
9. LaDonna Langwell

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 4mg 21%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 98mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/211772/homemade-apple-cider/

RECIPE 79: Canned Apple Pie Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 56
Yield: 7 quarts
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 cup cornstarch
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 10 cups water
• 2 teaspoons salt
• 3 tablespoons lemon juice
• 2 drops yellow food coloring
• 6 pounds apples

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large pan
2. Add water and salt and mix well
3. Bring to a boil and cook until thick and bubbly
4. Remove from heat and add lemon juice and food coloring
5. Sterilize canning jars, lids, and rings by boiling them in a large pot of water
6. Peel, core, and slice apples
7. Pack the sliced apples into hot canning jars, leaving a 1/2 inch of headspace
8. Fill jars with hot syrup, and gently remove air bubbles with a knife
9. Put lids on and process in a water bath canner for 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 85mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 5mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 54mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15942/canned-apple-pie-filling/

RECIPE 80: Easy Apple Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (14.1 ounce) package pastry for a 9-inch double-crust pie
• ¾ cup white sugar
• or more to taste
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 6 cups thinly sliced apples
• 1 tablespoon butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
2. Line a 9-inch pie dish with one pastry crust; set second one aside
3. Combine 3/4 cup sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl
4. Add more sugar if your apples are tart
5. Layer apple slices in the prepared pie dish, sprinkling each layer with cinnamon-sugar mixture
6. Dot top layer with small pieces of butter
7. Cover with top crust
8. Bake pie on the lowest rack of the preheated oven for 10 minutes
9. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue baking until golden brown and filling bubbles, 30 to 35 minutes more
10. Serve warm or cold. dotdash meredith food studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 128mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 4mg 22%, Calcium 11mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 117mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12324/apple-pie-i/

RECIPE 81: Apple Crumb Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 cups thinly sliced apples
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice (Optional)
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ cup raisins (Optional)
• ½ cup chopped walnuts (Optional)
• 1 (9 inch) pie shell
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• 3 tablespoons butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Place sliced apples in a large bowl; sprinkle with lemon juice
3. Mix white sugar, 2 tablespoons flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg together in a small bowl; sprinkle mixture over apples and toss until evenly coated
4. Stir in raisins and walnuts; transfer mixture into pie shell
5. Mix 1/2 cup flour and brown sugar together in a small bowl
6. Blend in butter with a fork until mixture is crumbly; sprinkle over apple filling
7. Cover top of pie loosely with aluminum foil
8. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes
9. Remove foil and bake until top is golden brown and filling is bubbly, about 25 to 30 minutes more
10. Cool on a wire rack before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 11mg 4%, Sodium 139mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 70g 25%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 49g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 6mg 28%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 261mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15587/apple-crumb-pie/

RECIPE 82: Caramel Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 caramel apples
Prep Time: 8 mins
Cook Time: 2 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Caramel Apple Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 apples
• 6 wooden craft sticks
• cooking spray
• 1 (14 ounce) package individually wrapped caramels
• unwrapped
• 2 tablespoons milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Remove the stem from each apple and press a craft stick into the top
2. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray
3. Place caramels and milk in a microwave-safe bowl; microwave for 2 minutes, stirring once
4. Set aside to cool briefly
5. Roll each apple quickly in caramel sauce until well coated
6. Place on prepared sheet to set

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 83: German Apple Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/German/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup vegetable oil
• 2 eggs
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 4 cups apples - peeled
• cored and diced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 9x13-inch cake pan
3. Beat oil and eggs in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until creamy
4. Add sugar and vanilla; beat well
5. Stir together flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt in a bowl
6. Slowly add flour mixture to egg mixture; mix until combined
7. The batter will be very thick
8. Fold in apples by hand using a wooden spoon
9. Spread batter into the prepared pan
10. Bake cake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes
11. Cool cake on a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 12%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 107mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 41mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7915/german-apple-cake-i/

RECIPE 84: Awesome Sausage, Apple and Cranberry Stuffing
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Stuffing and Dressing Recipes/Sausage Stuffing and Dressing Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ¾ cups cubed white bread
• 1 ½ cups cubed whole wheat bread
• 1 pound ground turkey sausage
• 1 cup chopped onion
• ¾ cup chopped celery
• 2 ½ teaspoons dried sage
• 1 ½ teaspoons dried rosemary
• ½ teaspoon dried thyme
• 1 Golden Delicious apple
• cored and chopped
• ¾ cup dried cranberries
• ⅓ cup minced fresh parsley
• 1 cooked turkey liver
• finely chopped
• ¾ cup turkey stock
• 4 tablespoons unsalted butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread white and whole wheat bread cubes in a single layer on a large baking sheet
3. Bake in the preheated oven until evenly toasted, 5 to 7 minutes
4. Transfer toasted bread cubes to a large bowl
5. Cook sausage and onions in a large skillet over medium heat, stirring and breaking up lumps, until evenly browned, 6 to 8 minutes
6. Add celery, sage, rosemary, and thyme; cook and stir until flavors blend, about 2 minutes
7. Pour sausage mixture over bread in bowl
8. Mix in chopped apple, dried cranberries, parsley, and liver
9. Drizzle with turkey stock and melted butter; mix lightly
10. Allow stuffing to cool completely before loosely stuffing a turkey
11. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 80mg 27%, Sodium 548mg 24%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 13g, Vitamin C 9mg 44%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 3mg 17%, Potassium 268mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13651/awesome-sausage-apple-and-cranberry-stuffing/

============================================================

RECIPE 85: Apple Hand Pies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 hand pies
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 2 large green apples - peeled
• cored
• and cut into chunks
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• ¼ cup white sugar
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• or to taste
• 1 teaspoon water
• or more if needed (Optional)
• 1 pound prepared pie dough
• cut into 4 pieces
• 1 egg
• 2 teaspoons milk
• 1 teaspoon white sugar
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat; let butter brown to a light golden color and smell toasted, about 1 minute
2. Stir apples into hot butter; sprinkle with 1/4 cup white sugar, brown sugar, and salt
3. Cook and stir apple mixture until apples are softened, about 5 minutes
4. Mix in cinnamon and water; continue cooking until apples are soft and sticky, 1 to 2 more minutes
5. Spread apple filling onto a plate to cool
6. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
7. Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment paper
8. Form a dough piece into a ball, place on a floured work surface, and roll into a circle about 8 inches in diameter
9. Spoon 1/3 to 1/2 cup apple filling in the center
10. Fold dough over filling, leaving about 1 inch of dough on the bottom side visible below the top side
11. Gently press dough closed around filling, using your fingertips
12. Fold the overhanging bottom part of dough up over the top edge, working your way around the crust, and pinch the overhang tightly to the top part of the crust
13. Crimp the edge tightly closed, pinching a little bit of dough with the thumb and forefinger of one hand and using your index finger on the other hand to push a small notch into the pinched dough
14. Continue pinching and notching all the way around until crust is tightly crimped together
15. Repeat with remaining dough and filling
16. Transfer pies onto prepared baking sheet
17. Whisk egg with milk in a small bowl until thoroughly combined
18. Brush top of each hand pie with egg mixture and sprinkle with about 1/4 teaspoon white sugar
19. Cut 3 small vent holes in the top of each pie
20. Bake in the preheated oven until pies are golden brown and filling is bubbling, 25 to 30 minutes
21. Let cool for at least 15 minutes before serving
22. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 42g 54%, Saturated Fat 13g 64%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 754mg 33%, Total Carbohydrate 82g 30%, Dietary Fiber 6g 23%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 5mg 27%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 4mg 19%, Potassium 215mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234374/apple-hand-pies/

============================================================

RECIPE 86: Amazing Apple Butter
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 6 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 hrs 25 mins
Total Time: 10 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Fruit Butter Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 pounds apples
• quartered
• 4 cups unsweetened apple juice
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground cloves
• ½ teaspoon ground allspice
• 6 half-pint canning jars with lids and rings

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine apples and apple juice in a stockpot; bring to a boil
2. Reduce heat and cook at a simmer until apples are soft and mushy, 20 to 30 minutes
3. Spoon apples into a food mill and process into puree while discarding the cores and peels remaining in the mill
4. Transfer process apples to a slow cooker
5. Cook on High with the lid off until the moisture evaporates and the volume reduces by about half, overnight to 24 hours
6. Stir sugar, apple cider vinegar, cinnamon, cloves, and allspice through the apple puree
7. Continue cooking on High until mixture mounds on a chilled plate without any water separating from the edges, another 2 to 6 hours
8. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
9. Pack the apple butter into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
10. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
11. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
12. Top with lids, and screw on rings
13. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
14. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder
15. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
16. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
17. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process 5 to 10 minutes
18. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
19. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
20. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 5mg 23%, Calcium 8mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 127mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229892/amazing-apple-butter/

============================================================

RECIPE 87: Easy Apple Cinnamon Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 large muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Apple Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 egg
• ⅓ cup vegetable oil
• ⅓ cup milk
• 2 apples - peeled
• cored and chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease 6 large muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners
3. Make muffins: Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl
4. Mix in egg, oil, and milk
5. Fold in chopped apples
6. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling just below the rim
7. Make topping: Place sugar, butter, flour, and cinnamon into a small bowl; mash mixture with a fork and sprinkle over unbaked muffins
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes
9. Kelly McCulley

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 29g 37%, Saturated Fat 12g 61%, Cholesterol 73mg 24%, Sodium 441mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 79g 29%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 47g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 110mg 8%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 131mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/24352/easy-apple-cinnamon-muffins/

RECIPE 88: Debbie's Amazing Apple Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 eggs
• 2 cups white sugar
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 2 cups apples
• peeled and diced
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons salt
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• or more to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan
3. Beat eggs, sugar, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl; stir in apples
4. Mix flour, salt, baking powder, and cinnamon in a separate bowl; add to apple mixture and stir just until evenly combined
5. Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes
7. Cover loaf pan with aluminum foil; continue baking until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 15 minutes more
8. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack
9. Aaron Brown

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 37mg 12%, Sodium 412mg 18%, Total Carbohydrate 63g 23%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 43g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 39mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 70mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/231288/debbies-amazing-apple-bread/

RECIPE 89: Mom's Apple Fritters
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 quart vegetable oil for deep-frying
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ⅔ cup milk
• 2 large eggs
• beaten
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• 3 cups apples - peeled
• cored and chopped
• 1 cup cinnamon sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat oil in a deep fryer or electric skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl
3. Pour in milk, eggs, and oil; stir until well blended
4. Mix in apples until evenly distributed
5. Working in small batches to prevent overcrowding, drop spoonfuls of batter into the deep fryer and fry in hot oil until golden all over, about 5 minutes
6. Use a slotted spoon to transfer fritters to a paper towel-lined plate
7. Toss warm fritters with cinnamon sugar in a bowl until well coated
8. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 98mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 35mg 3%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 41mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/90295/moms-apple-fritters/

RECIPE 90: Easy Apple Crisp with Pie Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 8x8-inch dish
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 3.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Apple Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (21 ounce) can apple pie filling
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 cup margarine
• ¼ cup brown sugar
• 2 cups all-purpose flour

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread pie filling in an 8x8-inch baking dish
3. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg
4. Cream together margarine and sugar
5. Cut in flour with a pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
6. Sprinkle mixture over pie filling
7. Bake in the preheated oven until the topping is brown and crisp and the filling is hot and bubbly, about 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 31g 39%, Saturated Fat 5g 27%, Sodium 398mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 67g 25%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 31mg 2%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 119mg 3%

RECIPE 91: Apple Strudel Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Apple Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 2 large eggs
• 1 ¼ teaspoons vanilla
• 1 ½ cups chopped apples

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan
3. Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl
4. Beat together sugar, butter, and eggs in a large bowl until smooth
5. Mix in vanilla
6. Stir in apples, then gradually blend in flour mixture
7. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin pan
8. Make topping: Mix brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon in a small bowl
9. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs
10. Sprinkle over each muffin top
11. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 20 minutes
12. Let sit 5 minutes before transferring muffins to a wire rack to cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 12%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 54mg 18%, Sodium 255mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 24g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 33mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 63mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/33157/apple-strudel-muffins/

RECIPE 92: Delicious Cinnamon Baked Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon butter
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• 3 teaspoons vanilla sugar
• 3 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 6 large apples - peeled
• cored
• and sliced
• 3 ½ tablespoons water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a large baking dish with butter
3. Mix brown sugar, vanilla sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a small bowl
4. Layer about 1/3 of the apples in the prepared baking dish; sprinkle with 1/3 of the sugar mixture
5. Repeat layers twice more
6. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes
7. Pour water over apples and continue baking until tender, about 15 minutes more

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 2%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 9mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 6g 21%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 10mg 49%, Calcium 29mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 240mg 5%

RECIPE 93: Waldorf Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Waldorf Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup mayonnaise
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• 3 apples -- peeled
• cored
• and chopped
• 1 cup thinly sliced celery
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• ½ cup raisins (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk together mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice, and salt in a serving bowl
2. Stir in apples, celery, walnuts, and raisins
3. Cover and chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve

RECIPE 94: Apple-Cranberry Crostada
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 6 to 8 - servings
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons butter
• 2 pounds Granny Smith apples (or other firm
• crisp apples)
• peeled
• quartered
• cored and sliced 1/4-inch thick
• 1 pound Macintosh apples (or other soft-textured apples that fall apart when cooked)
• peeled
• quartered
• cored
• and sliced 1/4-inch thick
• ½ cup sugar
• ½ cup dried cranberries
• 1 sheet frozen puff pastry
• thawed but still cold (follow package directions)
• 1 egg white
• lightly beaten
• 1 tablespoon sugar
• 1 cup Optional: Ice cream or lightly sweetened whipped cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat
2. Add apples, 1/2 cup sugar and cranberries; cover and cook until apples release their liquid, about 5 minutes
3. Remove lid and continue to cook, stirring frequently, until soft apples fall apart and juices thicken to a thin-syrup consistency, about 5 minutes longer
4. Pour onto a large-lipped cookie sheet or jellyroll pan and cool to room temperature. (Can be refrigerated in an airtight container up to 5 days.) Adjust oven rack to low position and heat oven to 400 degrees
5. Open puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured work surface
6. Roll into a rectangle, about 10 by 16 inches
7. Transfer to a large cookie sheet. (I suggest lining the sheet with parchment paper; this ensures the crostada doesn't stick and allows easy cleanup.) Spread cooked apples over pastry, leaving a 2-inch border
8. Fold up pastry borders over apples
9. Unfold corners and form ruffled creases to keep dough from overlapping
10. Brush pastry border with egg white and sprinkle with the remaining 1 Tb. sugar
11. Bake until pastry is golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes
12. Serve warm or at room temperature with optional ice cream or whipped cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 7g 34%, Cholesterol 19mg 6%, Sodium 128mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 60g 22%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 40g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 8mg 42%, Calcium 35mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 245mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/76931/apple-cranberry-crostada/

============================================================

RECIPE 95: Apple Pie by Grandma Ople
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 small Granny Smith apples
• or as needed
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• ¼ cup water
• 1 (9 inch) double-crust pie pastry
• thawed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Peel and core apples, then thinly slice
2. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
3. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat
4. Add flour and stir to form a paste; cook until fragrant, about 1 to 2 minutes
5. Add both sugars and water; bring to a boil
6. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes
7. Remove from the heat
8. Press one pastry into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie pan
9. Roll out remaining pastry so it will overhang the pie by about 1/2 inch
10. Cut pastry into eight 1-inch strips
11. Place sliced apples into the bottom crust, forming a slight mound
12. Lay four pastry strips vertically and evenly spaced over apples, using longer strips in the center and shorter strips at the edges
13. Make a lattice crust: Fold the first and third strips all the way back so they're almost falling off the pie
14. Lay one of the unused strips perpendicularly over the second and fourth strips, then unfold the first and third strips back into their original position
15. Fold the second and fourth vertical strips back
16. Lay one of the three unused strips perpendicularly over top
17. Unfold the second and fourth strips back into their original position
18. Repeat Steps 6 and 7 to weave in the last two strips of pastry
19. Fold and trim excess dough at the edges as necessary, and pinch to secure
20. Slowly and gently pour sugar-butter mixture over lattice crust, making sure it seeps over sliced apples
21. Brush some onto lattice, but make sure it doesn't run off the sides
22. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes
23. Reduce the temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue baking until apples are soft, 35 to 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 9g 46%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 124mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 52g 19%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 5mg 27%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 156mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12682/apple-pie-by-grandma-ople/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Applesauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 apples - peeled
• cored and chopped

• ¼ cup white sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine apples, water, sugar, and cinnamon in a saucepan; cover and cook over medium heat until apples are soft, about 15 to 20 minutes
2. Allow apple mixture to cool, then mash with a fork or potato masher until it is the consistency you like
3. Photo by cookin'mama. cookin mama

RECIPE 97: Apple Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch pan
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Apple Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 cups all-purpose apples
• peeled
• cored and sliced
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ cup water
• 1 cup quick-cooking oats
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• ¼ teaspoon baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ cup butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Place sliced apples in a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. Mix white sugar, 1 tablespoon flour, and cinnamon together; sprinkle over apples
4. Pour water evenly over apples
5. Combine oats, 1 cup flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and baking soda in a large bowl
6. Add melted butter and mix with a fork until crumbly; sprinkle evenly over apple mixture
7. Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown and apples are bubbling around the edges, about 45 minutes
8. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 98mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 61g 22%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 44g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 4mg 21%, Calcium 36mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 162mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12409/apple-crisp-ii/

RECIPE 98: Apple Pie Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 40
Yield: 5 9-inch pies
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 18 cups thinly sliced apples
• 3 tablespoons lemon juice
• 10 cups water
• 4 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 cup cornstarch
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Toss apples with lemon juice in a large bowl and set aside
2. Pour water into a Dutch oven over medium heat
3. Combine sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg in a bowl; add to water, stir well, and bring to a boil
4. Boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly
5. Add apples and return to a boil
6. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until apples are tender, 6 to 8 minutes
7. Cool for 30 minutes
8. Ladle into 5 freezer containers, leaving 1/2 inch of headspace
9. Cool at room temperature no longer than 1 1/2 hours
10. Seal and freeze
11. Can be stored for up to 12 months
12. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 61mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 16%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 63mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12681/apple-pie-filling/

RECIPE 99: Easy Apple Crisp with Oat Topping
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Apple Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 apples - peeled
• cored
• and sliced
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• divided
• 1 cup brown sugar
• ¾ cup old-fashioned oats
• ¾ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup cold butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Toss apples with white sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in a medium bowl to coat; pour into a 9-inch square baking dish
3. Mix brown sugar, oats, flour, and 1 teaspoon cinnamon in a separate bowl
4. Cut in cold butter with 2 knives or a pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs; spread over apples and pat down gently until even
5. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and sides are bubbling, about 40 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 15g 74%, Cholesterol 61mg 20%, Sodium 177mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 99g 36%, Dietary Fiber 8g 27%, Total Sugars 63g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 10mg 48%, Calcium 69mg 5%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 360mg 8%

RECIPE 100: Easy Apple Cider
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Cider Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle apple cider
• 3 cinnamon sticks
• 1 teaspoon whole allspice
• 1 teaspoon whole cloves
• ⅓ cup brown sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine apple cider and cinnamon sticks in a slow cooker
2. Place allspice and cloves onto the center of an 8-inch square piece of cheesecloth
3. Gather edges of the cheesecloth together and tie to secure; place in the slow cooker
4. Stir in brown sugar
5. Cook on High until it comes to a boil
6. Reduce heat to Low and keep warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 31mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 16%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 20mg 0%

RECIPE 101: Apple-Cranberry Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8-inch crisp
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds Granny Smith apples - peeled
• cored and thinly sliced
• ¾ cup cranberries
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C.) Butter an 8-inch square baking dish
2. Mix apples, cranberries, white sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large bowl
3. Place in an even layer in the prepared baking dish
4. In the same bowl, combine oats, flour, and brown sugar for topping
5. Add butter pieces and mix with a fork until crumbly
6. Stir in pecans
7. Sprinkle topping over apples in the baking dish
8. Bake in the preheated oven until apples are tender and topping is golden brown, 40 to 50 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 102: Old-Fashioned Apple Dumplings
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 recipe pastry for double-crust pie
• 6 large Granny Smith apples
• peeled and cored
• ½ cup butter
• ¾ cup brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 3 cups water
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Butter a 9x13-inch pan
3. Roll pastry into a 24x16-inch rectangle on a lightly floured surface
4. Cut into six 8-inch squares
5. Place an apple on each pastry square with the cored opening facing upward
6. Cut butter into 8 pieces; place 1 piece in the opening of each apple; reserve the remaining butter for sauce
7. Divide brown sugar between apples, poking some inside each cored opening and the rest around the base of each apple
8. Sprinkle cinnamon and nutmeg over apples
9. Using slightly wet fingertips, bring one corner of the pastry square up to the top of the apple, then bring the opposite corner to the top and press together
10. Bring up the two remaining corners, and seal
11. Slightly pinch the dough at the sides to completely seal in the apple
12. Repeat with the remaining apples and place in the prepared baking dish
13. Combine water, white sugar, vanilla extract, and reserved butter in a large saucepan
14. Place over medium heat, and bring to a boil
15. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes
16. Carefully pour the sauce over the dumplings
17. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes
18. Place each apple dumpling in a dessert bowl, and spoon some of the sauce over the top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 35g 45%, Saturated Fat 15g 74%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 434mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 148g 54%, Dietary Fiber 7g 23%, Total Sugars 115g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 11mg 53%, Calcium 52mg 4%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 319mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/46232/old-fashioned-apple-dumplings/

============================================================

INGREDIENTS:

• 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon
• 4 Granny Smith apples - peeled
• cored
• and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat
2. Add sugar and cinnamon; stir until sugar dissolves
3. Add apples and cook until softened, 5 to 8 minutes
4. Melissa Goff

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 30%, Saturated Fat 15g 73%, Cholesterol 61mg 20%, Sodium 165mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 39g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 7mg 35%, Calcium 49mg 4%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 174mg 4%
