RECIPE 104: Apple Turnovers
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 turnovers
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• 4 cups water
• 4 Granny Smith apples - peeled
• cored and sliced
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 1 cup brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• 1 tablespoon water
• 1 (17.25 ounce) package frozen puff pastry sheets
• thawed
• 1 cup confectioners' sugar
• 1 tablespoon milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine the lemon and 4 cups water in a large bowl
2. Place the sliced apples in the water to keep them from browning
3. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat
4. Drain water from apples, and place them into the hot skillet
5. Cook and stir for about 2 minutes
6. Add brown sugar, and cinnamon, and cook, stirring, for 2 more minutes
7. Stir together cornstarch and 1 tablespoon water
8. Pour into the skillet, and mix well
9. Cook for another minute, or until sauce has thickened
10. Remove from heat to cool slightly
11. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
12. Unfold puff pastry sheets, and repair any cracks by pressing them back together
13. Trim each sheet into a square
14. Then cut each larger square into 4 smaller squares
15. Spoon apples onto the center of each squares
16. Fold over from corner to corner into a triangle shape, and press edges together to seal
17. Place turnovers on a baking sheet, leaving about 1 inch between them
18. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until turnovers are puffed and lightly browned
19. Cool completely before glazing
20. To make the glaze, mix together the confectioners' sugar, milk and vanilla in a small bowl
21. Adjust the thickness by adding more sugar or milk if necessary
22. Drizzle glaze over the cooled turnovers
23. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 33%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 184mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 80g 29%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 50g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 5mg 26%, Calcium 42mg 3%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 161mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/59124/apple-turnovers/

============================================================

RECIPE 105: Apple Crisp - Perfect and Easy
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 8-inch square dish
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Apple Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups apples - peeled
• cored
• and sliced
• 1 cup sifted all-purpose flour
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup butter
• softened

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease an 8-inch square baking dish
3. Arrange apple slices evenly in the prepared baking dish
4. Sift flour, sugar, cinnamon, and salt into a bowl
5. Cut in butter using a pastry blender, or 2 knives, until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal; sprinkle over apples
6. Bake in the preheated oven until topping is golden, 40 to 45 minutes
7. Cool slightly before serving. naples34102

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 20%, Saturated Fat 10g 49%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 207mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 13mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 77mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229274/apple-crisp-perfect-and-easy/

============================================================

RECIPE 106: The Best Caramel Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Caramel Apple Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 large tart apples
• 8 wooden chopsticks for handles
• 2 cups packed brown sugar
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 cup light corn syrup
• 1 cup butter
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil
2. Dip apples in boiling water for a few seconds, using a slotted spoon, then dry with paper towels to remove any wax from the peels
3. Set apples aside to cool completely, about 30 minutes
4. Insert sticks into the bottom of each cooled apple through the core for a handle
5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
6. Stir brown sugar, sweetened condensed milk, corn syrup, and butter together in a saucepan over medium-high heat
7. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, then reduce heat to medium
8. Cook until a candy thermometer reads 248 degrees F (120 degrees C), stirring constantly to prevent burning, about 25 to 30 minutes
9. A teaspoon of caramel dropped in a glass of cold water, should form a firm ball
10. Remove caramel from heat and stir in vanilla extract
11. Working quickly, dip each apple into the hot caramel to completely coat the apple and about 1/2 inch of the wooden handle
12. Sprinkle apples with any desired toppings while still hot
13. Let caramel apples cool on the prepared baking sheet, about 1 hour
14. Use caution, caramel is very hot

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 28g 35%, Saturated Fat 17g 87%, Cholesterol 78mg 26%, Sodium 269mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 142g 51%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 113g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 11mg 55%, Calcium 210mg 16%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 491mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228210/the-best-caramel-apples/

============================================================

RECIPE 107: Mulligatawny Soup
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Soup Recipes/Chicken Soup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup chopped onion
• 2 stalks celery
• chopped
• 1 carrot
• diced
• ¼ cup butter
• 1 ½ tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons curry powder
• 4 cups chicken broth
• ½ apple
• cored and chopped
• ¼ cup white rice
• 1 skinless
• boneless chicken breast half - cut into cubes
• 1 pinch dried thyme
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• ½ cup heavy cream
• heated

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium heat
2. Add onions, celery, and carrot and sauté until soft, 5 to 7 minutes
3. Add flour and curry, and cook 5 more minutes, stirring frequently
4. Add chicken broth, mix well, and bring to a boil
5. Reduce heat and simmer for about 30 minutes
6. Add apple, rice, chicken, thyme, salt, and pepper
7. Simmer until rice is tender, 15 to 20 minutes
8. Just before serving, stir in hot cream
9. TheBritishBaker

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 20%, Saturated Fat 10g 48%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 734mg 32%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 186mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13087/mulligatawny-soup-i/

RECIPE 108: Sauteed Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 4 cups
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup butter
• 4 large tart apples - peeled
• cored and sliced 1/4 inch thick
• ½ cup cold water
• 2 teaspoons cornstarch
• ½ cup brown sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat; add apples and cook, stirring constantly, until almost tender, 6 to 7 minutes
2. Mix water and cornstarch together in a small bowl until cornstarch is dissolved; pour over apples
3. Stir in brown sugar and cinnamon
4. Bring to a boil for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally
5. Remove from heat and serve warm. dotdash meredith food studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 45mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 18mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 128mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/21672/sauteed-apples/

RECIPE 109: Homemade Apple Cider
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 gallon
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 3 hrs
Total Time: 7 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Juice Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 large apples
• quartered
• water
• to cover
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• 1 tablespoon ground allspice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place apples in a large stockpot; cover with water by at least 2 inches
2. Stir in sugar, cinnamon, and allspice
3. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat
4. Boil, uncovered, for 1 hour
5. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 2 hours
6. Strain apple mixture through a fine-mesh sieve; discard solids
7. Drain cider again through a cheesecloth-lined sieve
8. Refrigerate cider until cold, about 4 hours
9. LaDonna Langwell

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 4mg 21%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 98mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/211772/homemade-apple-cider/

RECIPE 110: Canned Apple Pie Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 56
Yield: 7 quarts
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 cup cornstarch
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 10 cups water
• 2 teaspoons salt
• 3 tablespoons lemon juice
• 2 drops yellow food coloring
• 6 pounds apples

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large pan
2. Add water and salt and mix well
3. Bring to a boil and cook until thick and bubbly
4. Remove from heat and add lemon juice and food coloring
5. Sterilize canning jars, lids, and rings by boiling them in a large pot of water
6. Peel, core, and slice apples
7. Pack the sliced apples into hot canning jars, leaving a 1/2 inch of headspace
8. Fill jars with hot syrup, and gently remove air bubbles with a knife
9. Put lids on and process in a water bath canner for 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 85mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 5mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 54mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15942/canned-apple-pie-filling/

RECIPE 111: Easy Apple Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (14.1 ounce) package pastry for a 9-inch double-crust pie
• ¾ cup white sugar
• or more to taste
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 6 cups thinly sliced apples
• 1 tablespoon butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
2. Line a 9-inch pie dish with one pastry crust; set second one aside
3. Combine 3/4 cup sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl
4. Add more sugar if your apples are tart
5. Layer apple slices in the prepared pie dish, sprinkling each layer with cinnamon-sugar mixture
6. Dot top layer with small pieces of butter
7. Cover with top crust
8. Bake pie on the lowest rack of the preheated oven for 10 minutes
9. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue baking until golden brown and filling bubbles, 30 to 35 minutes more
10. Serve warm or cold. dotdash meredith food studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 128mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 4mg 22%, Calcium 11mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 117mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12324/apple-pie-i/

RECIPE 112: Apple Crumb Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 cups thinly sliced apples
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice (Optional)
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ cup raisins (Optional)
• ½ cup chopped walnuts (Optional)
• 1 (9 inch) pie shell
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• 3 tablespoons butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Place sliced apples in a large bowl; sprinkle with lemon juice
3. Mix white sugar, 2 tablespoons flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg together in a small bowl; sprinkle mixture over apples and toss until evenly coated
4. Stir in raisins and walnuts; transfer mixture into pie shell
5. Mix 1/2 cup flour and brown sugar together in a small bowl
6. Blend in butter with a fork until mixture is crumbly; sprinkle over apple filling
7. Cover top of pie loosely with aluminum foil
8. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes
9. Remove foil and bake until top is golden brown and filling is bubbly, about 25 to 30 minutes more
10. Cool on a wire rack before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 11mg 4%, Sodium 139mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 70g 25%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 49g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 6mg 28%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 261mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15587/apple-crumb-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 113: Caramel Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 caramel apples
Prep Time: 8 mins
Cook Time: 2 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Caramel Apple Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 apples
• 6 wooden craft sticks
• cooking spray
• 1 (14 ounce) package individually wrapped caramels
• unwrapped
• 2 tablespoons milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Remove the stem from each apple and press a craft stick into the top
2. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray
3. Place caramels and milk in a microwave-safe bowl; microwave for 2 minutes, stirring once
4. Set aside to cool briefly
5. Roll each apple quickly in caramel sauce until well coated
6. Place on prepared sheet to set

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 164mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 70g 25%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 57g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 7mg 33%, Calcium 104mg 8%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 295mg 6%

RECIPE 114: German Apple Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/German/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup vegetable oil
• 2 eggs
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 4 cups apples - peeled
• cored and diced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 9x13-inch cake pan
3. Beat oil and eggs in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until creamy
4. Add sugar and vanilla; beat well
5. Stir together flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt in a bowl
6. Slowly add flour mixture to egg mixture; mix until combined
7. The batter will be very thick
8. Fold in apples by hand using a wooden spoon
9. Spread batter into the prepared pan
10. Bake cake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes
11. Cool cake on a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 12%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 107mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 41mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7915/german-apple-cake-i/

RECIPE 115: Awesome Sausage, Apple and Cranberry Stuffing
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Stuffing and Dressing Recipes/Sausage Stuffing and Dressing Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ¾ cups cubed white bread
• 1 ½ cups cubed whole wheat bread
• 1 pound ground turkey sausage
• 1 cup chopped onion
• ¾ cup chopped celery
• 2 ½ teaspoons dried sage
• 1 ½ teaspoons dried rosemary
• ½ teaspoon dried thyme
• 1 Golden Delicious apple
• cored and chopped
• ¾ cup dried cranberries
• ⅓ cup minced fresh parsley
• 1 cooked turkey liver
• finely chopped
• ¾ cup turkey stock
• 4 tablespoons unsalted butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread white and whole wheat bread cubes in a single layer on a large baking sheet
3. Bake in the preheated oven until evenly toasted, 5 to 7 minutes
4. Transfer toasted bread cubes to a large bowl
5. Cook sausage and onions in a large skillet over medium heat, stirring and breaking up lumps, until evenly browned, 6 to 8 minutes
6. Add celery, sage, rosemary, and thyme; cook and stir until flavors blend, about 2 minutes
7. Pour sausage mixture over bread in bowl
8. Mix in chopped apple, dried cranberries, parsley, and liver
9. Drizzle with turkey stock and melted butter; mix lightly
10. Allow stuffing to cool completely before loosely stuffing a turkey
11. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 80mg 27%, Sodium 548mg 24%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 13g, Vitamin C 9mg 44%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 3mg 17%, Potassium 268mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13651/awesome-sausage-apple-and-cranberry-stuffing/

RECIPE 116: Apple Hand Pies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 hand pies
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 2 large green apples - peeled
• cored
• and cut into chunks
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• ¼ cup white sugar
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• or to taste
• 1 teaspoon water
• or more if needed (Optional)
• 1 pound prepared pie dough
• cut into 4 pieces
• 1 egg
• 2 teaspoons milk
• 1 teaspoon white sugar
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat; let butter brown to a light golden color and smell toasted, about 1 minute
2. Stir apples into hot butter; sprinkle with 1/4 cup white sugar, brown sugar, and salt
3. Cook and stir apple mixture until apples are softened, about 5 minutes
4. Mix in cinnamon and water; continue cooking until apples are soft and sticky, 1 to 2 more minutes
5. Spread apple filling onto a plate to cool
6. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
7. Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment paper
8. Form a dough piece into a ball, place on a floured work surface, and roll into a circle about 8 inches in diameter
9. Spoon 1/3 to 1/2 cup apple filling in the center
10. Fold dough over filling, leaving about 1 inch of dough on the bottom side visible below the top side
11. Gently press dough closed around filling, using your fingertips
12. Fold the overhanging bottom part of dough up over the top edge, working your way around the crust, and pinch the overhang tightly to the top part of the crust
13. Crimp the edge tightly closed, pinching a little bit of dough with the thumb and forefinger of one hand and using your index finger on the other hand to push a small notch into the pinched dough
14. Continue pinching and notching all the way around until crust is tightly crimped together
15. Repeat with remaining dough and filling
16. Transfer pies onto prepared baking sheet
17. Whisk egg with milk in a small bowl until thoroughly combined
18. Brush top of each hand pie with egg mixture and sprinkle with about 1/4 teaspoon white sugar
19. Cut 3 small vent holes in the top of each pie
20. Bake in the preheated oven until pies are golden brown and filling is bubbling, 25 to 30 minutes
21. Let cool for at least 15 minutes before serving
22. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 42g 54%, Saturated Fat 13g 64%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 754mg 33%, Total Carbohydrate 82g 30%, Dietary Fiber 6g 23%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 5mg 27%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 4mg 19%, Potassium 215mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234374/apple-hand-pies/

============================================================

RECIPE 117: Amazing Apple Butter
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 6 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 hrs 25 mins
Total Time: 10 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Fruit Butter Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 pounds apples
• quartered
• 4 cups unsweetened apple juice
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground cloves
• ½ teaspoon ground allspice
• 6 half-pint canning jars with lids and rings

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine apples and apple juice in a stockpot; bring to a boil
2. Reduce heat and cook at a simmer until apples are soft and mushy, 20 to 30 minutes
3. Spoon apples into a food mill and process into puree while discarding the cores and peels remaining in the mill
4. Transfer process apples to a slow cooker
5. Cook on High with the lid off until the moisture evaporates and the volume reduces by about half, overnight to 24 hours
6. Stir sugar, apple cider vinegar, cinnamon, cloves, and allspice through the apple puree
7. Continue cooking on High until mixture mounds on a chilled plate without any water separating from the edges, another 2 to 6 hours
8. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
9. Pack the apple butter into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
10. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
11. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
12. Top with lids, and screw on rings
13. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
14. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder
15. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
16. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
17. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process 5 to 10 minutes
18. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
19. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
20. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 5mg 23%, Calcium 8mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 127mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229892/amazing-apple-butter/

============================================================

RECIPE 118: Easy Apple Cinnamon Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 large muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Apple Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 egg
• ⅓ cup vegetable oil
• ⅓ cup milk
• 2 apples - peeled
• cored and chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease 6 large muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners
3. Make muffins: Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl
4. Mix in egg, oil, and milk
5. Fold in chopped apples
6. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling just below the rim
7. Make topping: Place sugar, butter, flour, and cinnamon into a small bowl; mash mixture with a fork and sprinkle over unbaked muffins
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes
9. Kelly McCulley

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 29g 37%, Saturated Fat 12g 61%, Cholesterol 73mg 24%, Sodium 441mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 79g 29%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 47g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 110mg 8%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 131mg 3%

RECIPE 119: Debbie's Amazing Apple Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 eggs
• 2 cups white sugar
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 2 cups apples
• peeled and diced
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons salt
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• or more to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan
3. Beat eggs, sugar, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl; stir in apples
4. Mix flour, salt, baking powder, and cinnamon in a separate bowl; add to apple mixture and stir just until evenly combined
5. Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes
7. Cover loaf pan with aluminum foil; continue baking until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 15 minutes more
8. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack
9. Aaron Brown

RECIPE 120: Mom's Apple Fritters
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 quart vegetable oil for deep-frying
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ⅔ cup milk
• 2 large eggs
• beaten
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• 3 cups apples - peeled
• cored and chopped
• 1 cup cinnamon sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat oil in a deep fryer or electric skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl
3. Pour in milk, eggs, and oil; stir until well blended
4. Mix in apples until evenly distributed
5. Working in small batches to prevent overcrowding, drop spoonfuls of batter into the deep fryer and fry in hot oil until golden all over, about 5 minutes
6. Use a slotted spoon to transfer fritters to a paper towel-lined plate
7. Toss warm fritters with cinnamon sugar in a bowl until well coated
8. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 121: Easy Apple Crisp with Pie Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 8x8-inch dish
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 3.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Apple Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (21 ounce) can apple pie filling
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 cup margarine
• ¼ cup brown sugar
• 2 cups all-purpose flour

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread pie filling in an 8x8-inch baking dish
3. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg
4. Cream together margarine and sugar
5. Cut in flour with a pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
6. Sprinkle mixture over pie filling
7. Bake in the preheated oven until the topping is brown and crisp and the filling is hot and bubbly, about 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 31g 39%, Saturated Fat 5g 27%, Sodium 398mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 67g 25%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 31mg 2%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 119mg 3%

RECIPE 122: Apple Strudel Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Apple Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 2 large eggs
• 1 ¼ teaspoons vanilla
• 1 ½ cups chopped apples

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan
3. Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl
4. Beat together sugar, butter, and eggs in a large bowl until smooth
5. Mix in vanilla
6. Stir in apples, then gradually blend in flour mixture
7. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin pan
8. Make topping: Mix brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon in a small bowl
9. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs
10. Sprinkle over each muffin top
11. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 20 minutes
12. Let sit 5 minutes before transferring muffins to a wire rack to cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 12%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 54mg 18%, Sodium 255mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 24g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 33mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 63mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/33157/apple-strudel-muffins/

============================================================

RECIPE 123: Delicious Cinnamon Baked Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon butter
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• 3 teaspoons vanilla sugar
• 3 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 6 large apples - peeled
• cored
• and sliced
• 3 ½ tablespoons water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a large baking dish with butter
3. Mix brown sugar, vanilla sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a small bowl
4. Layer about 1/3 of the apples in the prepared baking dish; sprinkle with 1/3 of the sugar mixture
5. Repeat layers twice more
6. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes
7. Pour water over apples and continue baking until tender, about 15 minutes more

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 2%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 9mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 6g 21%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 10mg 49%, Calcium 29mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 240mg 5%

RECIPE 124: Waldorf Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Waldorf Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup mayonnaise
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• 3 apples -- peeled
• cored
• and chopped
• 1 cup thinly sliced celery
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• ½ cup raisins (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk together mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice, and salt in a serving bowl
2. Stir in apples, celery, walnuts, and raisins
3. Cover and chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve

RECIPE 125: Microwave Baked Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 apples
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 2 teaspoons butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Core apples, leaving the bottom intact
2. Mix brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg together in a bowl
3. Spoon half of the sugar mixture into each apple and put 1 teaspoon butter on each top
4. Place apples in a deep, microwave-safe casserole dish and cover
5. Microwave until tender, 3 1/2 to 4 minutes
6. Let apples sit for 2 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 3g 15%, Cholesterol 11mg 4%, Sodium 33mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 7mg 35%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 183mg 4%

RECIPE 126: German Apple Pancake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Pancake Recipes/Baked Pancake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 eggs
• ½ cup unbleached all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon sugar
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 cup milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
• melted
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ¼ cup unsalted butter
• ½ cup white sugar
• divided
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 large tart apple - peeled
• cored and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine eggs, flour, 1 tablespoon sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl; gradually mix in milk, stirring constantly
2. Add vanilla, melted butter, and 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
3. Let batter stand for 30 minutes or overnight
4. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
5. Melt butter in a 10-inch oven-proof skillet, brushing butter up on the sides of the pan
6. Combine 1/4 cup sugar, cinnamon, and 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg in a small bowl; sprinkle sugar mixture over the butter
7. Line the pan with apple slices
8. Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup sugar over apples
9. Place pan over medium-high heat until the mixture bubbles, then gently pour batter mixture over apples
10. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes
11. Reduce heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and bake for 10 minutes more
12. Slide pancake onto a serving platter and cut into wedges

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 31%, Saturated Fat 14g 68%, Cholesterol 237mg 79%, Sodium 182mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 52g 19%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 37g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 138mg 11%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 243mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/23900/german-apple-pancake/

============================================================

RECIPE 127: Apple Cinnamon Oatmeal Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Apple Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup quick-cooking oats
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• 1 tablespoon melted butter
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper liners
3. Make topping: Mix oats, brown sugar, melted butter, and cinnamon in a small bowl; set aside
4. Make muffins: Whisk together oats, flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl
5. Whisk together applesauce, milk, oil, egg, and vanilla extract in a medium bowl
6. Stir applesauce mixture into flour mixture until all ingredients are moistened
7. Fold in chopped apple
8. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups about 2/3 full; sprinkle oat topping mixture evenly over each muffin
9. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean, about 15 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 19mg 6%, Sodium 210mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 30g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 56mg 4%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 111mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/244987/apple-cinnamon-oatmeal-muffins/

RECIPE 128: Applesauce Pork Chops
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Pork Chop Recipes/Baked/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 tablespoon butter
• 1 apple - peeled
• cored
• and sliced
• ¼ cup chopped onion
• 2 (1/2-inch thick) pork chops
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ground black pepper to taste
• ¾ cup applesauce
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground mustard
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir apple and onion in melted butter until tender, about 5 minutes
3. Transfer apple and onion mixture to a bowl
4. Place pork chops in the same skillet over medium heat; cook until pork chops are browned, about 5 minutes per side
5. Place pork chops in a 9x9-inch baking dish; season with salt and black pepper
6. Mix applesauce, brown sugar, mustard, and cinnamon into apple and onion mixture
7. Spoon over pork chops
8. Bake, covered, in the preheated oven until pork chops are no longer pink in the center, 30 to 45 minutes
9. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 8g 40%, Cholesterol 78mg 26%, Sodium 674mg 29%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 24g, Vitamin C 6mg 31%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 586mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229254/applesauce-pork-chops/

============================================================

RECIPE 129: All-Day Apple Butter
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 128
Yield: 4 pints
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 11 hrs
Total Time: 11 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Fruit Butter Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 5 ½ pounds apples - peeled
• cored and finely chopped
• 4 cups white sugar
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
• ¼ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place apples in a slow cooker
2. Mix sugar, cinnamon, cloves, and salt in a medium bowl; pour over apples and mix well
3. Cover and cook on High for 1 hour
4. Reduce heat to Low and cook, stirring occasionally, until mixture is thickened and dark brown, 9 to 11 hours
5. Uncover and continue cooking on Low for 1 hour
6. Stir with a whisk to increase smoothness if desired
7. Spoon mixture into sterile containers, cover, and refrigerate or freeze
8. Allrecipes Magazine

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 9g 3%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Potassium 21mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/21205/all-day-apple-butter/

RECIPE 130: Easy Morning Glory Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Carrot Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ¼ cups white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 2 cups shredded carrots
• 1 apple - peeled
• cored and shredded
• ½ cup raisins
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• ½ cup unsweetened flaked coconut
• 3 large eggs
• 1 cup vegetable oil
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners
3. Mix flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together in a large bowl; stir in carrots, apple, raisins, walnuts, and coconut
4. Beat eggs, oil, and vanilla together in a separate bowl
5. Stir egg mixture into the carrot mixture until just moistened
6. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full
7. Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 20 minutes
8. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes
9. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 33%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 47mg 16%, Sodium 289mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 27mg 2%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 159mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/20995/easy-morning-glory-muffins/

RECIPE 131: Apple Oatmeal Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8-inch pan
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup brown sugar
• 1 cup rolled oats
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup butter
• melted
• 3 cups apples - peeled
• cored and chopped
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease an 8-inch square pan
3. Place brown sugar, oats, flour, and butter in a large bowl; mix until crumbly
4. Place 1/2 of the crumb mixture in the bottom of the prepared pan
5. Spread apples evenly over crumb mixture
6. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon; top with remaining crumb mixture
7. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 91mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 65g 24%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 44g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 43mg 3%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 146mg 3%

RECIPE 132: Veronica's Apple Pancakes
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Pancake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup shredded tart apple
• 1 cup milk
• ¼ cup butter
• melted
• 1 large egg
• 1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 1 ¼ teaspoons baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine apple, milk, butter, and egg in a large bowl
2. Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder, and cinnamon in a separate bowl
3. Stir flour mixture into apple mixture until just combined
4. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat
5. Drop batter by 1/4 cup spoonfuls onto the hot griddle and cook until bottom is lightly browned
6. Flip and cook until browned on the other side
7. Repeat with remaining batter

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 9g 43%, Cholesterol 82mg 27%, Sodium 238mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 2mg 8%, Calcium 153mg 12%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 188mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/23095/veronicas-apple-pancakes/

RECIPE 133: Spiced Applesauce Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ cups applesauce
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 2 large eggs
• 3 tablespoons milk
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ¼ teaspoon ground allspice
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan
3. Combine applesauce, sugar, oil, eggs, and milk in a large bowl; beat well
4. Sift in flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and salt; stir until smooth
5. Fold in pecans
6. Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 188mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 29mg 2%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 80mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17683/spiced-applesauce-bread/

RECIPE 134: Baked Apple Roses
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 apple roses
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Bread/Yeast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 large red apple
• cored and very thinly sliced
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 sheet frozen puff pastry
• thawed
• ¼ cup melted butter
• 1 large egg
• 2 teaspoons water
• 1 teaspoon confectioners' sugar (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Adjust an oven rack to the middle position
3. Butter two (6 to 8-ounce) ramekins and dust with white sugar
4. Place apple slices on a microwave-safe plate, overlapping slightly if necessary
5. Microwave on high until slices slightly soften, about 45 seconds
6. Cover the plate with plastic wrap and a kitchen towel
7. Mix together sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl
8. Roll puff pastry sheet to less than 1/8-inch thickness
9. Using a pizza cutter, cut two (3x12-inch) rectangles
10. Reserve remaining pieces for another use
11. Spread melted butter over dough; sprinkle with a generous amount of cinnamon sugar
12. Place apple slices along one long edge of dough, about 1/4 inch beyond the edge, overlapping slices slightly
13. Fold the bottom half of dough over apple slices to form a long "folder" of dough with rounded edges of apple slices exposed
14. Beat together egg and water in a small bowl
15. Brush surface of dough with egg wash
16. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar
17. Starting at one end, roll dough to form a rose-shaped pastry
18. Seal roll with end of dough strip
19. Transfer roses to the prepared ramekins
20. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar
21. Bake on the middle rack in the preheated oven until well browned, about 45 minutes
22. Use tongs to remove the ramekins to a baking sheet to cool for 5 to 10 minutes
23. Remove apple roses from the ramekins and finish cooling on a wire rack
24. Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 71g 91%, Saturated Fat 27g 135%, Cholesterol 143mg 48%, Sodium 496mg 22%, Total Carbohydrate 96g 35%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 12g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 49mg 4%, Iron 4mg 21%, Potassium 229mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/244198/baked-apple-roses/

============================================================

RECIPE 135: Gramma's Apple Bread Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Bread Pudding Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups soft bread cubes
• 2 cups peeled and sliced apples
• ¼ cup raisins
• 1 ¾ cups milk
• 1 cup brown sugar
• ¼ cup margarine
• 2 large eggs
• beaten
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 7x11-inch baking dish
3. Make pudding: Combine bread, apples, and raisins in a large bowl
4. Combine milk, brown sugar, and margarine in a small saucepan over medium heat
5. Cook and stir until margarine is melted
6. Pour over bread mixture in the bowl; mix until evenly coated
7. Pour bread mixture into the prepared baking dish
8. Whisk together eggs, cinnamon, and vanilla in a small bowl
9. Pour egg mixture over bread mixture in the baking dish
10. Bake in the preheated oven until the center is set and apples are tender, 40 to 50 minutes
11. Meanwhile, make vanilla sauce: Mix together milk, margarine, white sugar, and brown sugar in a saucepan
12. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and stir in vanilla
13. Serve over pudding

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 52mg 17%, Sodium 372mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 59g 21%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 47g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 154mg 12%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 233mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/27138/grammas-apple-bread-pudding/

============================================================

RECIPE 136: Dutch Apple Pie with Oatmeal Streusel
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/Dutch/

INGREDIENTS:
• 5 cups apples - peeled
• cored and sliced
• ⅔ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ¼ teaspoon ground allspice
• 1 (9 inch) frozen pie crust
• 2 tablespoons butter
• aluminum foil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Make the apple pie: Place apple slices in a large bowl
3. Mix white sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and allspice together in a separate bowl until combined; sprinkle over apples and toss until evenly coated
4. Remove pie shell from freezer; pour apple mixture into pie shell and dot with butter
5. Lay a sheet of aluminum foil lightly on top of filling, but do not seal
6. Bake pie in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
7. Meanwhile, make the streusel topping: Mix flour, oats, brown sugar, lemon zest, and cinnamon in a medium bowl until combined
8. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly
9. Remove pie from oven and sprinkle streusel on top
10. Reduce heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
11. Return pie to oven and bake until streusel is browned and apples are tender, 30 to 35 minutes more
12. Cover loosely with aluminum foil to prevent excess browning

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 10g 50%, Cholesterol 38mg 13%, Sodium 210mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 63g 23%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 4mg 18%, Calcium 33mg 3%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 159mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15683/dutch-apple-pie-with-oatmeal-streusel/

============================================================

RECIPE 137: Baked Apples
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 tart green apples
• ½ cup brown sugar
• 4 tablespoons butter
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Remove core from the top of each apple, leaving a well
3. Stuff each apple with 2 tablespoons brown sugar and 1 tablespoon butter
4. Place in a shallow baking dish and sprinkle with cinnamon
5. Bake in the preheated oven until sugar begins to caramelize and apples are tender, 15 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 91mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 41g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 7mg 35%, Calcium 45mg 3%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 197mg 4%

RECIPE 138: Mincemeat
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 12-ounce jars
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/UK and Ireland/English/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground cloves
• 1 teaspoon ground ginger
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 teaspoon ground allspice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Prepare mixed spice: Combine cinnamon, cloves, ginger, nutmeg, and allspice in a bowl
2. Reserve 1 heaped teaspoon for the mincemeat
3. Store the rest in a small jar for a later use
4. Immerse two clean, 12-ounce jars in simmering water until mincemeat is ready
5. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water
6. Prepare mincemeat: Combine apple, sultanas, sugar, currants, raisins, and butter in a saucepan
7. Cook over low heat and stir gently until butter has melted
8. Stir in chopped almonds, orange zest, 1 teaspoon mixed spice, and cinnamon
9. Bring mixture to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, 5 to 10 minutes
10. Remove from heat and set mincemeat aside to cool down for 30 minutes
11. Stir in brandy
12. Spoon into sterilized jars

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 3g 13%, Cholesterol 10mg 3%, Sodium 33mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 151mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/260314/mincemeat/

============================================================

RECIPE 139: Instant Pot Meatloaf
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Meatloaf Recipes/Beef Meatloaf Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds ground beef
• 1 cup dry bread crumbs
• ½ cup diced onion
• ½ apple - peeled
• cored
• and diced
• 1 egg
• 2 teaspoons garlic powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make the meatloaf: Mix beef, bread crumbs, onion, apple, egg, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until evenly blended
2. Shape the beef mixture into a loaf and place on a large piece of aluminum foil
3. Fold the foil up and around the edges of the meatloaf, creating a makeshift loaf pan
4. Pour 1/2 cup water into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and place the steam rack inside with the handles up
5. Place the meatloaf on top of the rack
6. Close and lock the lid; seal the vent
7. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 25 minutes
8. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
9. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
10. Release cooker pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to the manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes
11. Unlock and remove the lid
12. Transfer meatloaf, still on the rack, to a baking sheet
13. Broil meatloaf in the oven until browned, about 5 minutes
14. Meanwhile, make the topping: Combine ketchup, mustard, and brown sugar in a small bowl
15. Brush over meatloaf and broil again until caramelized, 1 to 2 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 6g 28%, Cholesterol 71mg 24%, Sodium 466mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 22g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 44mg 3%, Iron 3mg 16%, Potassium 338mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/265169/instant-pot-meatloaf/

============================================================

RECIPE 140: Old Fashioned Apple Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 (9 inch) unbaked pie crusts
• 7 cups peeled
• cored and sliced apples
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 2 tablespoons butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Line a 9-inch pie plate with bottom crust
3. Combine apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg in a bowl
4. Place mixture into the prepared pie plate
5. Dot with butter
6. Cover with top crust and seal
7. Cut holes in top crust to allow venting
8. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
9. Reduce the oven temperature to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and bake until crust is golden brown and apples are tender, 40 for 50 minutes
10. Cool and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 374mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 61g 22%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 4mg 22%, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 155mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12583/old-fashioned-apple-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 141: Quick Puff Pastry Apple Strudel
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 medium apples - peeled
• cored
• and chopped
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ½ cup raisins
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• ½ (17.5 ounce) package frozen puff pastry
• thawed
• 1 large egg
• lightly beaten
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Combine apples, 3/4 cup sugar, raisins, walnuts, and cinnamon in a large bowl for the filling
3. Dust a flat work surface lightly with flour
4. Unroll puff pastry and sprinkle lightly with flour
5. Roll out slightly and mark into 3 equal sections
6. Spoon filling into the central section then fold over the section on the left and brush with egg
7. Fold the right section on top, just like a letter
8. Make shallow diagonal cuts in the top layer of the apple strudel
9. Brush with egg and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon sugar
10. Bake in the preheated oven until apple strudel is puffed up and golden, 25 to 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 23mg 8%, Sodium 87mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 54g 20%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 34g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 4mg 18%, Calcium 29mg 2%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 214mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/261603/quick-puff-pastry-apple-strudel/

RECIPE 142: Fried Apple Pies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Vintage Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon salt
• ½ cup shortening
• chilled
• ½ cup cold water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make pastry: Sift flour and salt together in a large bowl
2. Cut in shortening with 2 knives or a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs
3. Add cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing with a fork, until flour mixture is moistened
4. Do not add more water than you need: when you squeeze a handful of moistened pastry mixture, it should form a ball
5. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes
6. Make filling: Place apples in a saucepan
7. Combine sugar and cinnamon; pour over apples and toss to coat
8. Cook, covered, in a saucepan on low heat until soft; mash with a fork to make thick applesauce
9. Set aside to cool
10. Roll dough on a lightly floured surface to 1/8-inch thick; cut out eight 4-inch rounds with a large cookie cutter
11. Place 1 heaping tablespoon of applesauce in the center of each pastry round
12. Moisten edges with cold water, fold in half, and press the edge with a fork to seal
13. Repeat with remaining pastry and filling
14. Heat oil in a deep fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
15. Lower pies carefully into the hot oil in batches
16. Fry until golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes on each side
17. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain
18. Repeat with remaining pies

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 68g 87%, Saturated Fat 10g 52%, Sodium 292mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 35g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 2mg 8%, Calcium 8mg 1%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 71mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12680/fried-apple-pies/

============================================================

RECIPE 143: Skillet Apples with Cinnamon
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup butter
• 8 apples
• cored and chopped
• ½ cup brown sugar
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat
2. Add apples, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg
3. Sauté in hot butter until tender and golden, 10 to 15 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 62mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 44g 16%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 37g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 9mg 43%, Calcium 30mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 224mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/236250/skillet-apples-with-cinnamon/

RECIPE 144: Grandma's Iron Skillet Apple Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Apple Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup butter
• 1 cup brown sugar
• 5 Granny Smith apples -- peeled
• cored
• quartered
• and thinly sliced
• 3 (9 inch) refrigerated prerolled pie crusts
• 1 cup white sugar
• divided
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• divided
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon butter
• cut into small chunks

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Place 1/2 cup butter into a 9-inch cast iron skillet; place the skillet in the preheated oven until butter is melted
3. Remove the skillet and sprinkle with brown sugar; return to the oven to heat while you prepare the apples
4. Remove the skillet from the oven; arrange 1 refrigerated pie crust on top of brown sugar
5. Top pie crust with 1/2 of the sliced apples
6. Sprinkle 1/2 cup of white sugar and 1 teaspoon of cinnamon on top
7. Place second pie crust over apples; top second crust with remaining apples and sprinkle with 1/2 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon
8. Top with third crust; sprinkle with 1/4 cup sugar and dot with 1 tablespoon of butter
9. Cut 4 slits into the top crust for steam to escape
10. Bake in the preheated oven until the apples are tender and the crust is golden brown, about 45 minutes
11. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 34g 43%, Saturated Fat 17g 86%, Cholesterol 49mg 16%, Sodium 396mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 108g 39%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 70g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 4mg 22%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 138mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/213569/grandmas-iron-skillet-apple-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 145: Apple Chips
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Snacks/Kids/Healthy/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 Golden Delicious apples
• cored and thinly sliced
• 1 ½ teaspoons white sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 225 degrees F (110 degrees C)
2. Arrange apple slices in a single layer on a metal baking sheet
3. Mix together sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl; sprinkle over apple slices
4. Bake in the preheated oven until apples are dried and edges curl, 45 minutes to 1 hour
5. Use a metal spatula to transfer chips to a wire rack until cool and crispy

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 7g 3%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 2mg 12%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 35mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/233281/apple-chips/

RECIPE 146: Apple Jelly
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 100
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 day 1 hrs
Rating: 3.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ½ pounds apples
• cored and diced
• 3 cups water
• or as needed
• 7 ½ cups white sugar
• ½ teaspoon butter
• 1 (2 ounce) package powdered fruit pectin

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place apples in a large pot; cover with water
2. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover, and simmer until apples are slightly tender, about 5 minutes
3. Crush cooked apples and simmer for 5 more minutes
4. Transfer crushed apples to a sieve or cheesecloth
5. Let drip into a bowl until all liquid has drained, pressing gently to release all the juice
6. Measure 5 cups apple juice, adding water if necessary to have the exact amount
7. Stir sugar into juice; add butter to reduce foaming
8. Bring juice mixture to a rolling boil, stirring constantly
9. Stir in pectin; boil for exactly 1 minute to dissolve pectin, stirring constantly
10. Remove from heat
11. Skim off excess foam with a metal spoon
12. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
13. Ladle apple jam into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/8 inch of the top
14. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
15. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
16. Top with lids, and screw on rings
17. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
18. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder
19. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
20. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
21. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process for 5 minutes
22. Carefully remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
23. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lids do not move up or down at all)
24. Let stand at room temperature for 24 hours
25. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Cholesterol 0mg 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 17g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 1mg 0%, Potassium 17mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228810/apple-jelly/

============================================================

RECIPE 147: Easy Apple Coleslaw
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Apple Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups chopped cabbage
• 1 unpeeled red apple
• cored and chopped
• 1 unpeeled Granny Smith apple
• cored and chopped
• 1 carrot
• grated
• ½ cup finely chopped red bell pepper
• 2 green onions
• finely chopped
• ⅓ cup mayonnaise
• ⅓ cup brown sugar
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine cabbage, red apple, green apple, carrot, red bell pepper, and green onions in a large bowl
2. Mix together mayonnaise, brown sugar, and lemon juice in a small bowl
3. Pour dressing over cabbage mixture; mix until evenly coated

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Cholesterol 3mg 1%, Sodium 108mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 33mg 167%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 206mg 4%

RECIPE 148: Easy Apple Strudel
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Bread/Yeast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 Granny Smith apple - peeled
• cored and coarsely shredded
• 3 Granny Smith apples - peeled
• cored and sliced
• 1 cup brown sugar
• 1 cup golden raisins
• 1 sheet frozen puff pastry
• thawed
• 1 egg
• ¼ cup milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Place shredded and chopped apples in a large bowl
4. Stir in brown sugar and golden raisins; set aside
5. Place puff pastry on the prepared baking sheet
6. Roll lightly with a rolling pin
7. Arrange apple filling down one side of pastry lengthwise
8. Fold pastry lengthwise over apple mixture; dampen edges of pastry with water, then press or crimp edges to seal
9. Whisk egg and milk together; brush on top of pastry
10. Cut 2 or 3 slits on the crust to allow steam to escape
11. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 35 to 40 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 32mg 11%, Sodium 130mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 88g 32%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 62g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 6mg 28%, Calcium 70mg 5%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 406mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/47821/easy-apple-strudel/

RECIPE 149: Pork Tenderloin with Apples and Onions
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Pork/Pork Tenderloin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 (1 1/2 pound) pork tenderloins
• 2 teaspoons vegetable oil
• 1 teaspoon sea salt
• 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
• divided
• or more as needed
• 3 medium Granny Smith apples - peeled
• cored
• and sliced into eighths
• 2 medium sweet onions
• sliced vertically
• 3 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme
• divided
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
• or to taste
• 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
• 1 cup chicken stock
• 1 tablespoon butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Trim silver skin from pork tenderloins; pat dry using paper towels
3. Rub 2 teaspoons vegetable oil over tenderloins, then rub with sea salt
4. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large, oven-proof skillet over medium heat until it shimmers
5. Cook tenderloins in hot oil, rotating to brown all sides, about 10 minutes
6. Transfer pork to a large plate
7. Add remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to any drippings in the skillet
8. Cook apples and onions in hot oil, stirring occasionally, until onions turn translucent, about 5 minutes; add more oil if the skillet gets dry
9. Season with 1 teaspoon thyme and black pepper; stir gently to combine
10. Remove from heat
11. Use a pastry brush to spread Dijon mustard evenly over tenderloins
12. Sprinkle with remaining 2 teaspoons thyme
13. Nestle tenderloins into the skillet with apple mixture
14. Roast, uncovered, in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of tenderloins reads at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), about 15 minutes
15. Remove the skillet from the oven and transfer pork to a large platter
16. Cover with aluminum foil and let rest
17. Meanwhile, pour chicken stock into a saucepan and cook over medium-high heat until reduced by half, 8 to 10 minutes
18. Pour into the skillet with apple mixture
19. Cook over medium-high heat until boiling, about 5 minutes; stir in butter until melted
20. Slice pork and serve over apple mixture

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 104mg 35%, Sodium 563mg 24%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 36g, Vitamin C 7mg 34%, Calcium 24mg 2%, Iron 5mg 30%, Potassium 704mg 15%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/275977/pork-tenderloin-with-apples-and-onions/

============================================================

RECIPE 150: Oliebollen (Dutch Doughnuts)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 dozen
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Bread/Pastries/Doughnuts/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (0.6 ounce) cake compressed fresh yeast
• 1 cup lukewarm milk
• 2 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons salt
• 1 large egg
• ¾ cup dried currants
• ¾ cup raisins
• 1 medium Granny Smith apple - peeled
• cored and finely chopped
• 1 quart vegetable oil for deep-frying
• 1 cup confectioners' sugar for dusting

DIRECTIONS:
1. Break up compressed yeast and stir into warm milk
2. Let stand for a few minutes to dissolve
3. Sift flour and salt into a large bowl
4. Stir in yeast mixture and egg until smooth
5. Stir in currants, raisins, and apple
6. Cover the bowl and set in a warm place to rise until doubled in volume, about 1 hour
7. Heat oil in a deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
8. Use two metal spoons to shape scoops of dough into 12 balls
9. Drop them carefully into the hot oil and fry until golden brown, about 8 minutes
10. Remove doughnuts with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels
11. Dust doughnuts with confectioners' sugar
12. Transfer to a serving platter and dust with more confectioners' sugar

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 405mg 18%, Total Carbohydrate 46g 17%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 44mg 3%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 240mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/46299/oliebollen-dutch-doughnuts/

============================================================

RECIPE 151: Classic Cherries Jubilee
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons cornstarch
• ¼ cup cold water
• ¼ cup orange juice
• 1 pound Bing or other dark
• sweet cherries
• rinsed and pitted (or use frozen pitted cherries)
• ½ teaspoon finely grated orange zest
• 3 cups vanilla bean ice cream
• ¼ teaspoon cherry extract
• ¼ cup brandy

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk sugar and cornstarch together in a wide saucepan
2. Stir in water and orange juice; bring to a boil over medium-high heat, whisking until thickened
3. Stir in cherries and orange zest; return to a boil, then reduce heat, and simmer for 10 minutes
4. While cherries are cooking, spoon ice cream into serving bowls
5. Remove cherries from heat and stir in cherry extract
6. Pour in brandy and ignite with a long lighter
7. Gently shake the pan until blue flame has extinguished itself
8. Spoon cherries over ice cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 5g 23%, Cholesterol 29mg 10%, Sodium 54mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 42g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 11mg 56%, Calcium 98mg 8%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 323mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/74422/classic-cherries-jubilee/

============================================================

RECIPE 152: Fresh Cherry Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup butter
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 ¾ cups white sugar
• divided
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 cup milk
• 2 cups pitted sour cherries
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Place butter in a 9x13-inch baking dish, and place in the oven to melt while the oven is preheating
3. Remove as soon as butter has melted, about 5 minutes
4. Stir together 1 cup flour, 1 cup sugar, and baking powder in a medium bowl
5. Mix in milk until well blended, then pour the batter into the pan over the melted butter
6. Do not stir
7. Rinse out the bowl from the batter, and dry
8. Place cherries into the bowl, and toss with remaining 3/4 cup sugar and 1 tablespoon flour
9. Distribute the cherry mixture evenly over the batter
10. Do not stir
11. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 50 to 60 minutes
12. A toothpick inserted into the cobber should come out clean
13. Allrecipes Magazine

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 22mg 7%, Sodium 94mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 49mg 4%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 90mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/72815/fresh-cherry-cobbler/

RECIPE 153: Cherry Pie Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 4 cups
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fillings/Fruit Fillings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups pitted tart red cherries
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¼ cup cornstarch

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place cherries into a saucepan over medium heat
2. Cover and cook, stirring often, until cherries release their juices and come to a simmer, 10 to 15 minutes
3. Whisk sugar with cornstarch in a bowl until combined; pour mixture into hot cherries and juice
4. Stir until thoroughly combined
5. Bring to a simmer over low heat; cook until thickened, about 2 minutes
6. Remove from heat and let cool before using as pie filling

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 54g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 47g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 7mg 34%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 217mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/218432/cherry-pie-filling/

RECIPE 154: Best Boiled Fruitcake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 8-inch cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 2 hrs 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 12 ounces candied mixed fruit
• 1 cup milk
• ¾ cup butter
• 5 ounces glace cherries
• roughly chopped
• 2 ounces candied mixed citrus peel
• 2 ounces chopped walnuts
• 1 teaspoon ground allspice
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• 12 ounces sifted self-rising flour
• 2 large eggs

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C)
2. Line an 8-inch deep cake pan with parchment paper
3. Place sugar, candied mixed fruit, milk, butter, cherries, citrus peel, walnuts, allspice, and baking soda in a medium-sized saucepan
4. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 5 minutes
5. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly
6. Stir flour and eggs into fruit mixture
7. Pour batter into the prepared pan
8. Wrap the outside of the pan with brown paper or newspaper
9. Bake cake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes
10. Reduce temperature to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and continue baking cake for 1 1/2 hours
11. Let cake sit at room temperature for 5 minutes, then invert it onto a wired rack
12. Remove parchment paper, flip cake, and allow to cool completely on the rack
13. Cake may be stored wrapped in foil and in an airtight container for up to 6 months

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 25%, Saturated Fat 10g 49%, Cholesterol 76mg 25%, Sodium 621mg 27%, Total Carbohydrate 99g 36%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 159mg 12%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 130mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7870/best-boiled-fruitcake/

============================================================

RECIPE 155: Old Fashioned Cocktail
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 1
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 5 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Cocktail Recipes/Whiskey Drinks Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 sugar cube
• 1 teaspoon water
• 1 dash bitters
• 2 fluid ounces whiskey (rye or bourbon)
• 1 lemon twist
• ½ cup ice cubes
• or as needed
• 1 orange slice
• for garnish
• 1 maraschino cherry
• for garnish

DIRECTIONS:
1. Muddle sugar cube, water, and bitters in an old fashioned glass for 1 minute
2. Pour in whiskey; stir for 1 minute
3. Squeeze lemon twist over the glass and drop it in
4. Add ice cubes
5. Garnish with orange slice and maraschino cherry; serve with a swizzle stick

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 7mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 7g 3%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 4g, Calcium 8mg 1%, Potassium 12mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/221320/old-fashioned-cocktail/
