RECIPE 156: Pineapple Upside-Down Bundt Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 10-inch bundt cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• cooking spray with flour
• ½ cup melted butter
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• 1 (8 ounce) can pineapple rings
• 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• 1 (15.25 ounce) package yellow cake mix
• 1 (3.5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix
• ¼ cup whole milk
• or more as needed
• ⅓ cup vegetable oil
• 3 large eggs

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 10-inch fluted tube pan (such as Bundt) with cooking spray with flour
3. Pour melted butter into the bottom of the prepared pan
4. Sprinkle brown sugar evenly on top
5. Drain pineapple rings over a measuring cup; reserve juice
6. Cut rings in half
7. Alternate placing halved pineapple rings and maraschino cherries around the pan
8. Combine cake mix and pudding mix in a large mixing bowl
9. Pour enough milk into the reserved pineapple juice to make 1 cup of liquid; add to cake and pudding mixture
10. Pour in vegetable oil
11. Mix on low speed, adding 1 egg at a time, until blended
12. Increase speed to medium; mix until thoroughly combined and smooth, about 2 minutes
13. Pour batter over pineapples and cherries in the pan
14. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes
15. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 7g 34%, Cholesterol 63mg 21%, Sodium 477mg 21%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 37g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 2mg 10%, Calcium 82mg 6%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 85mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/272616/pineapple-upside-down-bundt-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 157: Grandma's Skillet Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Pineapple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 stick butter
• 1 ½ cups packed brown sugar
• 1 (20 ounce) can sliced pineapple
• 1 (4 ounce) jar cherries
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 2 large eggs
• 1 cup milk
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Melt 1 stick butter in the bottom of a cast iron skillet over medium heat, about 3 minutes
3. Remove from heat and sprinkle brown sugar evenly over butter
4. Add pineapple slices to the skillet in a decorative layer with a cherry in the middle of each pineapple ring
5. Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl
6. Cream sugar and 1/2 cup butter together in a bowl
7. Add eggs and mix
8. Add flour mixture and milk in an alternating fashion
9. Add vanilla extract and mix well
10. Pour mixture evenly over pineapples in the skillet
11. Bake in the preheated oven until cake is golden brown, about 40 minutes
12. Let cake cool in the skillet for 10 minutes before inverting onto a serving plate
13. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 10g 52%, Cholesterol 73mg 24%, Sodium 340mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 77g 28%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 61g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 5mg 24%, Calcium 116mg 9%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 113mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/273774/grandmas-skillet-pineapple-upside-down-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 158: Chocolate-Covered Cherries
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 60
Yield: 60 pieces
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 60 maraschino cherries with stems
• 3 tablespoons butter
• softened
• 3 tablespoons corn syrup
• 2 cups sifted confectioners' sugar
• 1 pound chocolate confectioners' coating

DIRECTIONS:
1. Drain cherries and set on paper towels to dry
2. Stir together butter and corn syrup in a medium bowl until smooth
3. Mix in confectioners' sugar and knead to form a dough
4. Wrap each cherry in about 1 teaspoon dough
5. Chill in the refrigerator until firm
6. Melt confectioners' coating in a heavy saucepan over low heat
7. Holding onto the stem, dip each cherry into coating and place on waxed paper-lined sheet trays
8. Chill in the refrigerator until coating is set
9. Store in an airtight container in a cool place

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 1g, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 55mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/24698/chocolate-covered-cherries/

============================================================

RECIPE 159: Thirty Day Friendship Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 2 9x13-inch cakes
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 19 days 19 hrs 2 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups Friendship Fruit Starter
• 1 (15 ounce) can sliced peaches with juice
• 2 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 (15 ounce) can pineapple chunks with juice
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 (10 ounce) jars maraschino cherries
• 2 ½ cups white sugar
• 2 (18.25 ounce) packages yellow cake mix
• 2 (3.4 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix
• 1 ⅓ cups vegetable oil
• 8 eggs
• 2 cups golden raisins
• 2 cups chopped walnuts
• 2 cups flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Day One: In a large glass jar or bowl, combine 2 cups of the starter with 1 can of the sliced peaches and their juice (each slice chopped into 4 pieces)
2. Add 2 1/2 cups of the white sugar and stir once every day for 10 days
3. When not stirring mixture, keep it covered with a paper towel, foil, or a loose lid
4. Let sit at room temperature
5. Don't refrigerate it or cover it airtight
6. A pan of water underneath the jar or bowl will keep the ants out
7. Day Ten: Add 1 can of chunk pineapple and its juice
8. Cut each chunk of pineapple in half
9. Stir in 1/2 cup of white sugar
10. Stir once everyday for 10 days
11. The color should change, and the mixture should foam when stirred
12. Day Twenty: Slice each cherry in half, and stir in
13. Add 2 1/2 cups of the white sugar
14. Stir once every day for the final 10 days
15. The cherries will give the juice back its pinkish color
16. Day Thirty: Drain fruit and reserve it and the liquid
17. The fruit will be used in the cake
18. Pour the liquid into 3 glass or ceramic pint jars
19. One for you to start your next cake, and two for friends
20. Cake must be started within 3 days after receiving the starter, or you should freeze the starter to use at a later date
21. Do not use plastic or metal containers to store liquid! Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
22. Grease and flour two 9x13-inch baking pans
23. It's best to mix the two cakes separately
24. Combine 1 box of the cake mix, 1 box of the instant vanilla pudding, 2/3 cup of the vegetable oil, and 4 of the eggs
25. Stir, then add 1/2 of the drained reserved fruit from the starter
26. Stir, then add 1 cup of the golden raisins, 1 cup of the chopped nuts and 1 cup of the coconut
27. Stir until all ingredients are combined
28. The batter will be stiff
29. Pour batter into the prepared cake pan
30. Repeat for cake number two
31. Bake cakes at in the preheated oven for 55 to 65 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 17%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 220mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 20%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 39g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 45mg 3%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 121mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7900/thirty-day-friendship-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 160: Old Time Mincemeat Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 45 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 7 days 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Mincemeat Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ pounds round steak
• cut into small pieces
• 1 cup apple cider
• 4 Granny Smith apples - peeled
• cored and finely diced
• 1 ⅓ cups white sugar
• 2 ½ cups dried currants
• 2 ½ cups raisins
• ½ pound chopped candied mixed fruit peel
• ½ cup butter
• 1 (16 ounce) jar sour cherry preserves
• 1 teaspoon ground ginger
• ½ teaspoon ground cloves
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 (16 ounce) can pitted sour cherries
• drained with liquid reserved
• 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie
• 2 tablespoons heavy cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a Dutch oven, combine beef and apple cider
2. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer
3. Cover and cook for about 20 minutes, or until meat is tender
4. Remove meat and coarsely chop, then return it to the pot
5. Stir in chopped apples, sugar, currants, raisins, citrus peel, butter and cherry preserves
6. Add ginger, cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon and salt
7. Let simmer, uncovered, over low heat until mixture is very thick, about 90 minutes
8. Stir in cherries and remove from heat
9. Refrigerate tightly covered for at least a week before using
10. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
11. Put filling in unbaked pie shell and place pastry on top
12. Crimp edges and poke several holes in top pastry
13. Brush top with cream and sprinkle with sugar
14. Bake in preheated oven for 40 minutes, or until golden brown

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 38g 48%, Saturated Fat 16g 78%, Cholesterol 80mg 27%, Sodium 521mg 23%, Total Carbohydrate 181g 66%, Dietary Fiber 9g 32%, Total Sugars 82g, Protein 21g, Vitamin C 33mg 164%, Calcium 78mg 6%, Iron 6mg 31%, Potassium 970mg 21%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/22621/old-time-mincemeat-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 161: Baked Ham with Sweet Glaze
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 1 10-pound ham
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Ham/Whole/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (10 pound) fully-cooked
• bone-in ham
• 4 cups boiling water
• or as needed
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 2 tablespoons dry mustard powder
• ¼ cup honey
• 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice
• or as needed
• 1 (20 ounce) can pineapple chunks
• drained
• 1 (10 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• drained
• toothpicks

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Place ham on a rack set in a roasting pan, and carefully pour about 1/2 inch of boiling water into the pan beneath the ham
3. Bake the ham in the preheated oven for 2 hours, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the meat (do not touch the bone) reads at least 140 degrees F (60 degrees C.) Reduce oven heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C.) In a bowl, mix together the brown sugar, flour, dry mustard, honey, and lemon juice as needed to make a thick, smooth paste
4. Brush the ham generously with glaze
5. Skewer 1 pineapple chunk and 1 maraschino cherry per toothpick, and insert the decorated picks all over the ham
6. Return the ham to the oven, and roast for 15 minutes
7. Baste the ham, fruit and all, with glaze and juices that have collected in the bottom of the pan, return to the oven, and roast for an additional 15 minutes
8. Let the ham rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 33g 42%, Saturated Fat 12g 60%, Cholesterol 218mg 73%, Sodium 146mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 66g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 46mg 4%, Iron 3mg 15%, Potassium 920mg 20%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/214000/baked-ham-with-sweet-glaze/

============================================================

RECIPE 162: Fresh Cherry Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 dozen
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ⅓ cup vegetable oil
• ⅓ cup milk
• 1 egg
• ½ teaspoon almond extract
• 1 cup fresh pitted and quartered sweet cherries
• 1 tablespoon white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Line a muffin tin with paper liners
3. Mix flour, 3/4 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl
4. Whisk oil, milk, egg, and almond extract together in a small bowl
5. Pour into flour mixture; stir gently until incorporated
6. Fold cherries into the batter
7. Spoon batter into the muffin cups, filling each 2/3 of the way full
8. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon sugar on top
9. Bake muffins in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes
10. Transfer to a wire rack to cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 187mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 60mg 5%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 60mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/254770/fresh-cherry-muffins/

RECIPE 163: Easy Fruit Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch cobbler
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¾ cup milk
• ¼ cup butter
• 2 cups sliced fresh peaches

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Melt butter in a 9 x 9 inch baking dish
3. Blend together flour, baking powder, sugar, and milk
4. Pour batter in baking dish over the butter
5. Sprinkle fruit on top of the batter, do not stir
6. Bake for 1 hour or until golden brown

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 174mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 34g 12%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 14mg 69%, Calcium 102mg 8%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 64mg 1%

RECIPE 164: Pineapple Glaze for Ham
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Ham Glaze Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (15.25 ounce) can sliced pineapple
• drained with juice reserved
• 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• drained
• 1 cup brown sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Before baking ham, place pineapple slices on ham with toothpicks and place cherries in center of pineapple
2. In a medium microwave safe bowl combine brown sugar and reserved pineapple juice
3. Mix together and microwave for about 5 minutes, until mixture is thick
4. Pour some of this glaze over the ham about every 15 minutes in the last hour of baking, until all is used

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 7mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 21g, Vitamin C 3mg 16%, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 31mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17116/pineapple-glaze-for-ham/

RECIPE 165: Door County Cherry Bounce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 quart
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 19 days 17 hrs 12 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Liqueur Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups pitted tart cherries (such as Door County cherries)
• ⅓ cup white sugar
• or to taste
• 1 cup vodka
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Put cherries in a clean, 1-quart glass jar; add sugar
2. Fill the rest of the jar with vodka
3. Place lid on jar and shake
4. Store jar in a cool, dark area for 1 to 4 months, shaking jar occasionally

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 166: English Trifle
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Yield: 1 bowl
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/UK and Ireland/English/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 (8 or 9 inch) white cake layers
• baked and cooled
• 2 pints fresh strawberries
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 pint fresh blueberries
• 2 bananas
• ¼ cup orange juice
• 1 (3.5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix
• 2 cups milk
• 1 cup heavy whipping cream
• ¼ cup blanched slivered almonds
• 12 maraschino cherries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Slice strawberries and sprinkle them with sugar
2. Cut the bananas into slices and toss with orange juice
3. Combine pudding mix with milk and mix until smooth
4. Cut the cake into 1 inch cubes
5. Use half of the cake cubes to line the bottom of a large glass bowl
6. Layer half of the strawberries followed by half of the blueberries, and then half of the bananas
7. Spread half of the pudding over the fruit
8. Repeat layers in the same order
9. In a medium bowl, whip the cream to stiff peaks and spread over top of trifle
10. Garnish with maraschino cherries and slivered almonds

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 31%, Saturated Fat 9g 43%, Cholesterol 29mg 10%, Sodium 537mg 23%, Total Carbohydrate 98g 36%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 63g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 36mg 182%, Calcium 234mg 18%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 371mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8445/english-trifle/

============================================================

RECIPE 167: Simple Summer Smoothie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Drinks/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 banana
• 1 cup frozen strawberries
• 1 cup frozen blueberries
• 1 cup frozen cherries
• 4 ice cubes
• ½ cup orange juice
• ¾ cup vanilla yogurt
• ½ teaspoon honey (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the banana, strawberries, blueberries, cherries, and ice cubes into a blender
2. Pour in the orange juice, vanilla yogurt, and honey
3. Puree until smooth

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 2%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 34mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 43mg 214%, Calcium 101mg 8%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 420mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/172463/simple-summer-smoothie/

RECIPE 168: The Best Cherry Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 48 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 23 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Cherry Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (15 ounce) package double crust ready-to-use pie crust
• 3 cups cherries
• pitted
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• ¼ teaspoon almond extract
• 2 tablespoons salted butter
• cut into bits

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil
3. Place bottom pie crust into a 9-inch pie pan; made pricks along the bottom with a fork
4. Bake in the preheated oven until pie crust is lightly browned, about 8 minutes
5. Remove crust from oven and cool for 5 minutes
6. Combine cherries, sugar, cornstarch, and almond extract together in a bowl
7. Pour cherry mixture into the prepared pie pan; dot with butter
8. Cover with top crusts, crimp the edges to seal, and cut vents into the top with a sharp knife
9. Place the pie on a foil-covered baking sheet
10. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes
11. If it is browning too fast cover the pie with an aluminum foil tent
12. Continue baking until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly, 10 to 20 minutes
13. Place on a wire rack to cool, about 15 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 25%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 274mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 53g 19%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 154mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/254501/the-best-cherry-pie/

RECIPE 169: Homemade Old Fashioned Mix
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 48 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Cocktail Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups water
• 3 cups white sugar
• 3 clementine oranges
• quartered
• 5 maraschino cherries
• or more to taste
• 1 cinnamon stick
• 2 tablespoons bitters
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring water and sugar to a boil in a saucepan; remove from heat
2. Stir oranges, cherries, and cinnamon stick into sugar mixture
3. Cover saucepan and steep for 1 hour
4. Remove fruit and cinnamon stick from mixture using a slotted spoon; stir in bitters

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 16g 6%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 13g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Potassium 12mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/233524/homemade-old-fashioned-mix/

RECIPE 170: Fresh Cherry Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 - 9x13 inch dish
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups pitted sour cherries
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 4 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 cup old-fashioned oats
• 1 cup brown sugar
• ½ cup butter
• ½ cup shortening

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. In a large bowl, combine cherries, 1 1/2 cups white sugar, and 4 tablespoons flour
3. Pour into 9x13 inch baking dish
4. In a medium bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups flour, oats, and brown sugar
5. Cut in butter and shortening until crumbly
6. Sprinkle over cherries
7. Bake in preheated oven for 45 to 50 minutes, or until topping is golden brown

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 33%, Saturated Fat 11g 54%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 90mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 92g 34%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 62g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 8mg 39%, Calcium 41mg 3%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 228mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/50341/fresh-cherry-crisp/

RECIPE 172: Cherry Dump Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 (21 ounce) cans cherry pie filling
• 1 (15.25 ounce) package white cake mix
• ¼ cup butter
• melted
• ½ cup coarsely chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread cherry pie filling over the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking pan
3. Stir cake mix and butter together into a gooey, clumpy mixture
4. Break into pieces between your fingers and crumble evenly on top of the cherry filling
5. Sprinkle pecans on top
6. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown on top, 35 to 40 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Cholesterol 10mg 3%, Sodium 284mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 84mg 6%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 166mg 4%

RECIPE 173: Chocolate Covered Cherry Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 18 cookies
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Chocolate Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 1 egg
• 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ½ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon baking soda
• ¼ teaspoon baking powder
• 1 (10 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• ½ cup sweetened condensed milk
• 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)
2. Beat sugar and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
3. Add egg and vanilla; beat well
4. Stir in flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking soda, and baking powder until smooth
5. Roll dough into walnut-size balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets
6. Make an indentation with your thumb in the center of each cookie
7. Drain cherries and reserve juice
8. Place a cherry in the indentation of each cookie ball
9. Combine chocolate chips with condensed milk in a saucepan over low heat; stir until chocolate is melted
10. Stir in 4 teaspoons of cherry juice
11. Drizzle or spoon about 1 teaspoon of chocolate cherry mixture over each cherry to cover
12. Bake in the preheated for 10 minutes
13. Cool on the baking sheets briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 6g 28%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 100mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 39mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 159mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/9979/chocolate-covered-cherry-cookies-ii/

============================================================

RECIPE 174: Baked Fresh Cherry Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Cherry Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie
• 4 tablespoons quick-cooking tapioca
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup white sugar
• 4 cups pitted cherries
• ¼ teaspoon almond extract
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 ½ tablespoons butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C)
2. Place bottom crust in pie pan
3. Set top crust aside, covered
4. In a large mixing bowl combine tapioca, salt, sugar, cherries, and extracts
5. Let stand 15 minutes
6. Turn out into bottom crust and dot with butter
7. Cover with top crust, flute edges and cut vents in top
8. Place pie on a foil-lined cookie sheet--in case of drips! Bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown
9. Let cool for several hours before slicing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 6mg 2%, Sodium 286mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 61g 22%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 5mg 26%, Calcium 17mg 1%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 193mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12245/baked-fresh-cherry-pie/

RECIPE 175: Dried Cherry Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch round cake
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Coffee Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup chopped dried cherries
• ½ cup hot water
• ½ teaspoon almond extract
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 (8 ounce) container vanilla yogurt
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 1 egg
• 1 egg white
• ¼ cup chopped pecans
• 1 tablespoon white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine cherries, hot water, and almond extract: let stand 20 minutes
2. Drain cherries, and pat dry between layers of paper towels
3. In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, baking powder, and 1 cup white sugar
4. Add yogurt, eggs, and oil
5. Fold in cherries
6. Pour batter into a greased and floured 9 inch round cake pan
7. Stir pecans and 1 tablespoon white sugar together
8. Sprinkle on top of batter in pan
9. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 minutes, or until wooden pick comes out clean
10. Cool in pan on wire rack 10 minutes
11. Serve warm, or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 154mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 14%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 88mg 7%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 78mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7436/dried-cherry-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 176: Chef John's Classic Rice Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup uncooked long-grain white rice
• ¼ teaspoon kosher salt
• 1 cup water
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 ⅓ cups milk
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 large egg yolk
• 1 tablespoon cold butter
• 2 tablespoons dried cherries
• chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place rice, salt, and water into a saucepan
2. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat
3. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook until tender, about 20 minutes
4. Remove from heat; sprinkle with sugar and pour in milk
5. Stir with a whisk until until the thin layer of cooked-on starch at the bottom of the pan is cleared and incorporated into the mixture, 2 or 3 minutes
6. Place pan over medium heat, stirring frequently, until it reaches your desired of level of doneness and creaminess, 8 to 10 minutes
7. The longer it cooks, the thicker and stickier it will be
8. Remove from heat
9. Add vanilla and cinnamon
10. Very quickly whisk in the egg yolk (to prevent it from cooking)
11. Whisk for about 1 more minute
12. Add butter and dried cherries; stir thoroughly
13. Transfer warm pudding to serving dishes
14. Cool to room temperature
15. Cover and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, 3 to 4 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 180mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 14%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 114mg 9%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 156mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/257425/chef-johns-classic-rice-pudding/

============================================================

RECIPE 177: BC Cherry Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 40
Yield: 4 half pints
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups pitted
• chopped fresh cherries
• ½ cup unsweetened apple juice
• 2 teaspoons lemon juice
• 2 (2 ounce) packages powdered fruit pectin
• 3 cups white sugar
• 4 half pint canning jars with lids and rings

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place cherries, apple juice, lemon juice, and pectin into a large saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil, and mix in the sugar
2. Cook the jam at a rolling boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly
3. Remove from heat and skim off any foam
4. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
5. Pack the cherry jam into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
6. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
7. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
8. Top with lids, and screw on rings
9. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
10. Bring to a boil over high heat, then carefully lower the jars into the pot using a holder
11. Leave a 2 inch space between the jars
12. Pour in more boiling water if necessary until the water level is at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
13. Bring the water to a full boil, cover the pot, and process for 15 minutes, or the time as recommended by your county Extension agent
14. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
15. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
16. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 29mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/218434/bc-cherry-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 178: Cherry Chicken Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Salad/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cooked
• boneless chicken breast halves
• diced
• ⅓ cup dried cherries
• ⅓ cup diced celery
• ⅓ cup toasted
• chopped pecans
• ⅓ cup low-fat mayonnaise
• 1 tablespoon buttermilk
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon ground black pepper
• ⅓ cup cubed apples (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, dried cherries, celery, nuts, mayonnaise, milk, salt and pepper and apple if desired
2. Toss together well and refrigerate until chilled
3. Serve on toasted cracked wheat bread or croissants

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 16%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 356mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 24g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 34mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 230mg 5%

RECIPE 179: Clafoutis aux Cerises (Classic Clafouti)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8-inch dessert
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/French/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups milk
• ½ vanilla bean
• split (Optional)
• 1 teaspoon unsalted butter
• 4 cups cherries (with pits)
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 pinch salt
• ½ cup white sugar
• 3 eggs
• 3 tablespoons heavy cream
• 2 tablespoons white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine milk and vanilla bean in a pot and steep for at least 1 hour
2. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
3. Grease an 8-inch baking dish with butter
4. Spread out cherries in the bottom of the prepared baking dish
5. Combine 1/2 cup flour, 1/2 cup sugar and salt in a bowl
6. Add eggs one at a time; beat with an electric mixer after each addition until smooth and creamy
7. Remove vanilla bean from milk and discard
8. Add milk to egg mixture
9. Pour in heavy cream; mix until smooth
10. Pour mixture evenly over cherries
11. Bake in the preheated oven until top of clafoutis is golden, 45 to 50 minutes
12. Remove from the oven and sprinkle 2 tablespoons sugar on top
13. Let cool slightly before serving so that the clafoutis is set
14. Serve warm or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 74mg 25%, Sodium 64mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 5mg 26%, Calcium 78mg 6%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 266mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/259161/clafoutis-aux-cerises-classic-clafouti/

============================================================

RECIPE 180: Sweet Polish Cherry Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x12-inch cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 3.9/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/Eastern European/Polish/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 tablespoon butter
• 2 cups pitted sweet cherries
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• ½ cup olive oil
• 4 eggs
• 1 (6 ounce) container plain yogurt
• 1 tablespoon olive oil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. In a mixing bowl, whisk 1 cup sugar, flour, baking powder, and baking soda together until evenly combined
3. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat
4. Cook and stir the pitted cherries in the butter until they are tender, sprinkling them with 1 tablespoon of sugar, 8 to 10 minutes
5. Form a well in the center of the dry ingredients, and pour in 1/2 cup olive oil, eggs, and yogurt; use your fingers to lightly stir the liquid ingredients into the flour mixture to make a soft dough
6. Scrape the batter into a 9x12-inch baking dish
7. Drizzle the batter with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, and top with the cherries
8. Bake in the preheated oven until the cake is set and golden on top, about 40 minutes
9. A toothpick inserted into the center of the cake should come out clean

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 17%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 229mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 16%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 89mg 7%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 138mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/218433/sweet-polish-cherry-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 181: Cherry Winks
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 30
Yield: 5 dozen
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup shortening
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 eggs
• 2 tablespoons milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 ¼ cups sifted all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 1 cup dates
• pitted and chopped
• ⅓ cup maraschino cherries
• chopped
• 2 ½ cups crushed cornflakes cereal
• 10 maraschino cherries
• quartered

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease baking sheets
3. Cream the shortening with the sugar
4. Blend in the eggs, milk and vanilla
5. Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt
6. Add the flour mixture to the creamed mixture and mix well
7. Stir in the chopped pecans, chopped dates and 1/3 cup maraschino cherries
8. Shape teaspoonful sized chunks of dough into balls
9. Roll each ball in the crushed corn flakes
10. Place balls on the prepared baking sheets and top each cookie with 1/4 maraschino cherry
11. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 10 to 12 minutes
12. Let cool completely before storing in airtight containers

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 13mg 4%, Sodium 98mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 72mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/11223/cherry-winks/

============================================================

RECIPE 182: Cherry Ham Glaze
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Ham Glaze Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons water
• ¼ cup white vinegar
• 2 tablespoons light corn syrup
• 1 (12 ounce) jar cherry preserves
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir together water, vinegar, corn syrup, preserves, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg in a saucepan over medium-high heat
2. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes
3. Brush 1/4 to 1/3 cup of this glaze over your ham about 30 minutes before it is finished baking
4. Stir any ham drippings into the remaining glaze and serve alongside the sliced ham

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 11mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 23mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/44746/cherry-ham-glaze/

RECIPE 183: No Bake Fruitcake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 1 to 12 - x inch cake
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pound halved candied cherries
• 4 cups chopped pecans
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• 1 cup raisins
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 (12 ounce) package vanilla wafers
• crushed

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large bowl mix the candied cherries, chopped pecans, sweetened condensed milk, coconut milk, flaked coconut, raisins, vanilla, and crushed vanilla wafers
2. Batter will be very stiff
3. Place into pan and store in the refrigerator

RECIPE 184: Vanilla Cherry Ice Cream
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 4 cups
Prep Time: 3 hrs 15 mins
Total Time: 5 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups heavy cream
• 1 cup milk
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
• 1 teaspoon almond extract
• 2 cups fresh cherries
• pits removed and cut in half

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine the cream, milk, and sugar in a bowl
2. Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved
3. Stir in the vanilla and almond extract
4. Add the cherries
5. Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions
6. Transfer to a freezer-safe container and freeze for at least 2 hours before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 29%, Saturated Fat 14g 71%, Cholesterol 84mg 28%, Sodium 35mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 80mg 6%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 174mg 4%

RECIPE 185: Dump Cake V
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 18 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (21 ounce) can cherry pie filling
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• 1 (18.25 ounce) package yellow cake mix
• 1 cup margarine
• melted
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• ½ cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish
3. In the prepared dish, layer the cherry pie filling and the drained pineapple
4. Sprinkle the dry cake mix over the top, covering evenly
5. Pour the melted margarine over the cake mix, and sprinkle the top with the coconut and chopped walnuts
6. Bake 50 to 60 minutes in the preheated oven, until browned and bubbly

RECIPE 186: Ice Box Fruitcake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Yield: 1 to 10 - inch ring
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 1 cup chopped walnuts
• 1 cup chopped raisins
• 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• drained and chopped
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 (12 ounce) package vanilla wafers
• crushed

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a medium bowl, stir together the pecans, raisins, walnuts, cherries, condensed milk and vanilla wafers
2. Dough will be very thick, you will need to use your hands
3. Form dough into a ring shape on top of a dinner plate
4. Wrap in many layers of plastic wrap and/or aluminum foil
5. Allow to age in the refrigerator for at least a week
6. The flavors will have a chance to blend and all of the milk will be absorbed into the cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 10mg 3%, Sodium 111mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 46g 17%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 106mg 8%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 297mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17562/ice-box-fruitcake/

RECIPE 187: Crushed Pineapple Fruitcake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Yield: 1 tube cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 10 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Pineapple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup butter
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 eggs
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon almond extract
• 3 cups golden raisins
• ½ cup red candied cherries
• 1 cup candied mixed fruit peel
• 1 (15 ounce) can crushed pineapple with juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Line an angel food pan with parchment paper and brush with melted butter
2. Cream butter or margarine, and then beat in sugar
3. Beat in eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition
4. Stir in extract
5. Mix in flour, baking powder, and salt
6. Stir in raisins, cherries, pineapple, and mixed peel
7. Cover bowl and let sit at room temperature, 8 hours to overnight
8. Bake at 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) for 2 1/2 hours with a pan of hot water placed on the lowest rack of your oven during baking
9. Brush warm cake with some melted butter

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 53mg 18%, Sodium 324mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 75g 27%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 40g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 69mg 5%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 303mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7673/crushed-pineapple-fruitcake/

RECIPE 188: Cherry Pound Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 to 8 inch tube pan
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 3 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup butter
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 4 eggs
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 teaspoon almond extract
• 1 cup maraschino cherries
• drained and halved
• ¼ cup all-purpose flour

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour an 8 inch tube pan
3. Mix together the flour, baking powder, and salt; set aside
4. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, cream cheese, and sugar until light and fluffy
5. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla and almond extract
6. Beat in the flour mixture, mixing just until incorporated
7. Dredge cherries in 1/4 cup flour, then fold into batter
8. Spread into prepared pan
9. Bake in the preheated oven for 80 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean
10. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 31%, Saturated Fat 14g 72%, Cholesterol 123mg 41%, Sodium 375mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 50g 18%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 6g, Calcium 85mg 7%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 102mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/52607/cherry-pound-cake/

RECIPE 189: Almond Tortoni
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Nut Dessert Recipes/Almond Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 egg white
• ¼ cup confectioners' sugar
• 1 cup heavy cream
• 1 teaspoon sherry wine or Marsala
• 1 teaspoon almond extract
• 1 cup almond macaroon crumbs
• ½ cup ground almonds
• 6 red maraschino cherries
• chopped
• 6 green maraschino cherries
• chopped
• ¼ cup slivered almonds
• 4 maraschino cherries
• halved for garnish

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a small bowl, beat egg white until foamy
2. Gradually beat in sugar, and continue beating until thick and glossy; set aside
3. Whip cream in a large bowl
4. Carefully fold in sherry, almond extract, macaroon crumbs, ground almonds, and chopped red and green cherries
5. Gently fold egg white into cream mixture
6. Spoon into 8 paper baking cups placed in medium size muffin tray
7. Sprinkle with slivered almonds
8. Cover muffin tray with clear plastic wrap, then wrap with aluminum foil
9. Freeze overnight
10. To serve: Let sit for 5 minutes at room temperature, then garnish with maraschino cherry halves

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 26mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 54mg 4%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 137mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/50950/almond-tortoni/

RECIPE 190: Ground Cherry Pie II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups ground cherries
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• 2 tablespoons water
• 1 (9 inch) pie shell
• 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 3 tablespoons white sugar
• 2 tablespoons butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Wash ground cherries and place in unbaked pie shell
3. Mix brown sugar and 1 tablespoon flour and sprinkle over cherries
4. Sprinkle water over top
5. Mix together 3 tablespoons flour and 3 tablespoons sugar
6. Cut butter in until crumbly
7. Top cherry mixture with crumbs
8. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, reduce temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and continue to bake for 25 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 3g 13%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 127mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 34g 12%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 5mg 24%, Calcium 20mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 41mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12671/ground-cherry-pie-ii/

RECIPE 191: Paleo Almond Date Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 dozen
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Nut Dessert Recipes/Almond Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups blanched almond flour
• 1 cup pitted and chopped dates
• ½ cup chopped dried cherries
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• 2 tablespoons chia seeds
• or more to taste
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon sea salt
• ½ cup coconut oil
• 1 egg
• 2 tablespoons maple syrup
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper
3. Combine almond flour, dates, cherries, walnuts, chia seeds, baking soda, and sea salt in a large bowl; whisk to blend
4. Add coconut oil, egg, maple syrup, and vanilla extract; blend well with a spoon or fork until dough comes together
5. Scoop dough onto prepared baking sheets with a small cookie scoop
6. Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 15 minutes
7. Turn off oven and let cookies sit with oven door closed, about 10 minutes more
8. Remove from oven and let cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 67mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 13mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 68mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/246422/paleo-almond-date-cookies/

RECIPE 192: Cherry Cream Cheese Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Yield: 1 tube cake
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Pound Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract
• 4 eggs
• 2 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup candied cherries
• halved
• ¼ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Cream the cream cheese, butter or margarine, sugar, and vanilla together until smooth
3. Beat in eggs one at a time
4. Sift together 2 1/4 cup flour, baking powder, and salt; fold into cream cheese mixture
5. Dredge cherries in 1/4 cup flour, and fold into batter
6. Sprinkle pecans over the bottom of an ungreased 10 inch angel food tube pan
7. Bottom should be completely covered
8. Add a few more pecans if necessary
9. Spoon batter into pan on top of nuts
10. Bake for about 75 minutes, or until an inserted wooden pick comes out clean
11. Allow cake to cool in pan
12. Run knife around outside edge and center tube
13. Ease cake out of pan, and onto plate

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 30%, Saturated Fat 13g 63%, Cholesterol 106mg 35%, Sodium 242mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 6g, Calcium 60mg 5%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 90mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7704/cherry-cream-cheese-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 193: Maraschino Cherry Nut Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9-inch cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 3.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (10 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• 2 ¼ cups sifted cake flour
• 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• divided
• ½ cup shortening
• 1 ⅓ cups white sugar
• 3 egg whites
• room temperature
• ⅔ cup milk
• room temperature
• ½ cup chopped pecans
• ¾ cup butter
• room temperature
• 6 cups sifted confectioners' sugar
• divided
• ⅓ cup milk
• 6 drops red food coloring
• 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract
• 12 maraschino cherries
• with stems

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and lightly flour two 8- or 9-inch round cake pans or one 9x13-inch cake pan
3. Reserve 1/4 cup maraschino cherry juice
4. Coarsely chop cherries to make 1/2 cup
5. Sift cake flour, baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon salt and set aside
6. Beat shortening in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium-high speed for 30 seconds
7. Add white sugar and beat until well combined
8. Add egg whites, one at a time, beating well after each
9. Combine 2/3 cup milk and reserved 1/4 cup cherry juice
10. Add the flour and milk mixture alternately to the shortening mixture, beating on low speed after each addition until just combined
11. Stir in the chopped cherries and nuts
12. Pour batter into prepared pans
13. Bake in the preheated oven until cake springs back when lightly touched with a finger or a tester comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes for round cakes (or 30 to 35 minutes for a 9x13 inch pan)
14. Cool cakes in pans on a wire rack for 10 minutes, then invert onto a wire rack to cool completely
15. To make frosting: Beat butter in a large bowl until fluffy
16. Gradually add 3 cups sifted confectioners' sugar; beat well
17. Slowly beat in 1/3 cup milk, vanilla, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt
18. Gradually beat in the remaining 3 cups sifted confectioners' sugar
19. Beat in additional milk (1 to 2 tablespoons) if needed, to make the frosting spreading consistency
20. If desired, tint the frosting pink by adding 6 drops red food coloring
21. Once the cake is completely cool, frost with butter frosting and decorate with maraschino cherries with stems

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 31%, Saturated Fat 10g 50%, Cholesterol 32mg 11%, Sodium 304mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 114g 41%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 82g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 97mg 7%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 135mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7330/maraschino-cherry-nut-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 194: Bing Cherry Congealed Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 9
Yield: 6 to 10 servings
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Dessert Salad Recipes/Jell-O® Salad/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (16.5 ounce) can pitted Bing cherries
• drained
• juice reserved
• 1 (15 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained with juice reserved
• 1 (6 ounce) package cherry Jell-O®
• 1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese
• 6 fluid ounces cola-flavored carbonated beverage
• 1 cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a sauce pan, combine reserved cherry juice and pineapple juice to equal 1 cup
2. Bring to boil, add gelatin and whisk together
3. Remove from heat and add cream cheese and blend together until smooth
4. Add cola and beat until mixture becomes fluffy
5. Fold in cherries, pineapple, and nuts
6. Pour into molded container, chill 6 to 8 hours or until firm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 10mg 3%, Sodium 116mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 35g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 6mg 29%, Calcium 30mg 2%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 185mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13700/bing-cherry-congealed-salad/

RECIPE 195: Cherry Cheese Pie I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/No-Bake Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (9 inch) prepared graham cracker crust
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 cups frozen whipped topping
• thawed
• 1 (21 ounce) can cherry pie filling

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a medium mixing bowl, beat together softened cream cheese and sugar until light and fluffy
2. Fold in whipped topping and blend until mixture is smooth
3. Spread into graham cracker crust and spoon pie filling over top
4. Cover with plastic wrap and chill 2 hours before serving

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 196: Cherry Pie with Almond Crumb Topping
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Cherry Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust (see footnote for recipe link)
• ½ cup slivered almonds
• ½ cup light brown sugar
• ⅓ cup rolled oats
• ⅓ cup all-purpose flour
• ¾ teaspoon salt
• 6 tablespoons cold
• unsalted butter
• cut into pieces
• 2 pounds cherries
• pitted
• ½ lemon
• juiced
• ⅓ cup white sugar
• or more to taste
• ¼ cup cornstarch

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil
3. Roll out pie crust and lay into a 9-inch pie pan
4. Combine almonds, brown sugar, oats, flour, and salt in a large bowl
5. Work butter into the almond mixture with your fingers, breaking up any large pieces, until incorporated completely
6. Cover and chill for 15 minutes
7. Combine cherries, lemon juice, white sugar, and cornstarch
8. Stir until well coated and no dry lumps remain, 3 to 4 minutes
9. Pour cherries and any accumulated juices into the prepared pie pan
10. Press down into the pan
11. Crumble oat mixture over the top
12. Place the pan on the prepared baking sheet
13. Bake in the preheated oven until cherries are bubbling and the crust and crumble topping are browned, about 1 hour 15 minutes
14. Let cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 167g 215%, Saturated Fat 63g 315%, Cholesterol 183mg 61%, Sodium 3214mg 140%, Total Carbohydrate 503g 183%, Dietary Fiber 39g 140%, Total Sugars 306g, Protein 43g, Vitamin C 105mg 526%, Calcium 457mg 35%, Iron 15mg 83%, Potassium 2879mg 61%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228047/cherry-pie-with-almond-crumb-topping/

============================================================

RECIPE 197: Cherry Cheesecake Brownies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup butter
• 2 cups white sugar
• ⅔ cup cocoa powder
• 4 eggs
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 cup gluten-free all purpose baking flour
• ½ teaspoon gluten-free baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan
3. Melt butter in the microwave, about 1 minute
4. Stir in sugar and cocoa powder
5. Blend in 4 eggs, one at a time, using an electric mixer; add vanilla extract
6. Combine flour (see Cook's Note), baking powder, and salt in a small bowl, and add to the batter
7. Mix until well combined and pour into the prepared baking pan
8. Level with a knife or spatula
9. Beat together cream cheese, sugar, and 1 egg in a second bowl until smooth
10. Dollop the cream cheese mixture on top of the brownie batter
11. Separate cherries from the jelled filling and dollop them over the cream cheese mixture, saving leftover jelly for another use if desired
12. Swirl together using a knife
13. Bake in the preheated oven until brownies are set and edges pull away from the sides of the pan, 35 to 45 minutes
14. Remove from the oven and cool thoroughly before cutting into bars

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 10g 50%, Cholesterol 93mg 31%, Sodium 183mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 16%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 31mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 152mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/274193/cherry-cheesecake-brownies/

============================================================

RECIPE 198: Fruity Sweet and Sour Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 2 cups
Prep Time: 1 mins
Cook Time: 9 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup white sugar
• or to taste
• ½ cup white vinegar
• or more to taste
• ½ cup maraschino cherry juice
• ½ cup pineapple juice
• 1 ½ tablespoons cornstarch
• ¼ cup cold water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix the sugar, vinegar, maraschino cherry juice, and pineapple juice in a saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar
2. Place the cornstarch in a small bowl, and stir the water into it to make a smooth paste
3. Stir the cornstarch paste into the juice mixture, and bring to a simmer
4. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens, about 1 minute

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Total Sugars 7g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 22mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/108206/fruity-sweet-and-sour-sauce/

RECIPE 199: Marshmallow Log
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups flaked coconut
• 2 cups miniature colored marshmallows
• 2 cups crushed graham crackers
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 cup chopped walnuts
• 10 candied cherries
• quartered

DIRECTIONS:
1. Sprinkle coconut evenly on a sheet of waxed paper
2. In a medium bowl, stir together marshmallows, graham cracker crumbs, condensed milk, walnuts, and cherries
3. Shape into a log; place on waxed paper and roll in coconut
4. Wrap with waxed paper and refrigerate until firm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 11mg 4%, Sodium 170mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 17%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 107mg 8%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 231mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/22995/marshmallow-log/

RECIPE 200: Preserved Cherries
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 4 half-pint jars
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds fresh cherries
• stems removed
• 4 cups water
• ¾ cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Inspect 8 half-pint jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones
2. Immerse in simmering water for 10 minutes to sterilize
3. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water
4. Fill sterilized jars with cherries up to the "neck" of the jar
5. Pour water into a large pan and bring to a boil
6. Add sugar and keep boiling until sugar dissolves
7. Pour hot simple syrup over cherries into the jars up to 1/8-inch from the top
8. Run a clean knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars to remove any air bubbles
9. Wipe rims with a moist paper towel to remove any spills
10. Top with lids and tightly screw on rings
11. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
12. Bring to a boil and lower jars 2 inches apart into the boiling water using a holder
13. Pour in more boiling water to cover jars by at least 1 inch
14. Bring to a rolling boil, cover, and process for 20 minutes
15. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart
16. Let rest for 24 hours without moving the jars
17. Gently press the center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down
18. Remove the rings for storage and store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 4mg 20%, Calcium 10mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 128mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/265814/preserved-cherries/

============================================================

RECIPE 201: Cherry Chicken
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
• 1 (4 pound) whole chicken
• cut into 8 pieces
• salt and pepper to taste
• ½ cup all-purpose flour for dusting
• 1 (15 ounce) can pitted dark cherries packed in water
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• 1 orange - with peel
• quartered and thinly sliced
• ½ cup slivered almonds
• toasted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
2. Season chicken with salt and pepper, then coat with flour
3. Fry in hot oil until browned, turning as needed
4. Reduce heat to medium, cover, and cook until meat is tender and juices run clear, about 25 minutes
5. Remove chicken from the skillet; pour off all but 1/4 cup drippings
6. Return the skillet to medium heat and stir in cherries, reserving some cherry liquid for later
7. Stir in sugar and bring to a boil
8. Dissolve cornstarch in reserved cherry liquid, then stir into the skillet
9. Cook, stirring gently, until thickened
10. Add orange slices and almonds to the skillet, then return chicken pieces to the skillet
11. Spoon sauce over chicken to coat; simmer over low heat for 5 to 10 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 62g 79%, Saturated Fat 14g 70%, Cholesterol 222mg 74%, Sodium 751mg 33%, Total Carbohydrate 85g 31%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 43g, Protein 63g, Vitamin C 25mg 125%, Calcium 122mg 9%, Iron 5mg 30%, Potassium 790mg 17%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/92782/cherry-chicken/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------

Yield: 1 9-inch pie

• thawed

RECIPE 203: Sour Cherry Pudding Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup milk
• 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
• 1 tablespoon baking powder
• 3 cups pitted tart red cherries
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¼ teaspoon almond extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. In a bowl, stir together flour, 1 cup sugar, milk, oil, and baking powder to make a smooth batter; scrape batter into the prepared baking dish
4. In a separate bowl, stir cherries with 1 cup sugar and almond extract; spoon over batter
5. Bake in the preheated oven until cake is lightly browned and a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 93mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 21%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 40g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 79mg 6%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 135mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/218437/sour-cherry-pudding-cake/

RECIPE 204: Black Forest Cheesecakes
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cheesecake Recipes/Chocolate Cheesecake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 12 chocolate sandwich cookies with creme filling
• 2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese
• softened
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ⅓ cup baking cocoa
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 large eggs
• 1 (21 ounce) can cherry pie filling
• ½ cup whipped topping

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C)
2. Line muffin cups with paper or foil liners
3. Remove top from each sandwich cookie; crush tops and set aside
4. Place creme-topped cookies in the prepared muffin cups, creme-side up
5. Beat cream cheese, sugar, cocoa, and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer until fluffy
6. Mix in eggs until blended
7. Fill the prepared muffin cups 3/4 full; sprinkle 1/4 cup reserved cookie crumbs on top
8. Discard remaining crumbs or save for another use
9. Bake in the preheated oven until set, 20 to 25 minutes
10. Cool completely; cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours
11. Top each cheesecake with 2 tablespoons cherry filling and a dollop of whipped topping just before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 9g 47%, Cholesterol 74mg 25%, Sodium 183mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 48mg 4%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 167mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/222647/black-forest-cheesecakes/

RECIPE 205: Fresh Fig Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8-inch layer cake
Prep Time: 40 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Fig Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup butter
• softened
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 cup fat-free evaporated milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ¼ teaspoon almond extract
• 1 cup chopped fresh figs
• 2 cups chopped fresh figs
• ¼ cup packed brown sugar
• ¼ cup water
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spray two 8-inch round cake pans with vegetable oil spray
3. In a medium bowl, sift together flour, salt and baking powder
4. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter with the sugar until fluffy
5. Add egg and beat well
6. Add flour mixture alternately with the evaporated milk
7. Fold in vanilla and almond extracts and 1 cup chopped figs
8. Divide into two prepared 8-inch round cake pans
9. Bake in preheated oven until cake springs back when lightly touched with a fingertip and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes
10. Cool cake layers on wire rack
11. To make the filling: In a saucepan, combine 2 cups chopped figs, brown sugar, water and lemon juice
12. Bring to a boil
13. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until thickened, about 20 minutes
14. Spread thinly between cooled cake layers and on top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 40mg 13%, Sodium 357mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 72g 26%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 46g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 198mg 15%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 306mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8290/fresh-fig-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 206: Fig Preserves
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 64
Yield: 64 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 16 cups fresh figs
• 1 tablespoon baking soda
• 12 cups boiling water
• 8 cups white sugar
• 4 cups water
• 1 lemon
• sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large mixing bowl place figs and sprinkle with baking soda
2. Pour the boiling water over the figs and soak for 1 hour
3. Drain figs and rinse thoroughly with cold water
4. In a large Dutch oven combine the sugar and the 4 cups of water; bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes
5. Add the figs and lemon slices to the syrup in the Dutch oven and cook for 1 hour, stirring occasionally
6. Spoon figs into hot, sterilized jars and spoon syrup over figs, leaving 1/2 inch of head space
7. Top jars with lids and screw bands on tightly
8. Process for 10 minutes in a hot water bath

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 59mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 3mg 16%, Calcium 32mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 125mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/20854/fig-preserves/

============================================================

RECIPE 207: Elegant Fig Appetizers with Goat Cheese and Almonds
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 24 appetizers
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 3 mins
Total Time: 18 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Fruit/

INGREDIENTS:
• 12 fresh figs
• halved
• 4 ounces herbed goat cheese (chevre)
• 24 almonds
• 1 tablespoon honey
• 2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven broiler for high heat
2. Place the fig halves, cut side up, on a baking sheet
3. Top each half with about 1/2 teaspoon goat cheese
4. Place one almond on each, press to push the cheese slightly into each fig
5. Broil the figs in the preheated oven until the cheese is soft and the almonds are turning a rich shade of brown, 2 to 3 minutes
6. Remove from the broiler and let cool for 5 minutes
7. Arrange the figs on a serving platter and drizzle with honey and balsamic vinegar
8. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 50mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 52mg 4%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 150mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/143662/elegant-fig-appetizers-with-goat-cheese-and-almonds/
