RECIPE 210: Strawberry Fig Preserve
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 6 half pints
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups mashed fresh ripe figs
• 3 cups white sugar
• 2 (3 ounce) packages strawberry flavored gelatin (such as Jell-O®)
• 6 half pint canning jars with lids and rings

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat figs, sugar, and strawberry gelatin together in a saucepan over medium-high heat; bring to a rolling boil
2. Cook fig mixture, stirring frequently, for 4 minutes; remove from heat
3. Sterilize jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
4. Pour hot fig mixture into hot, sterilized jars, filling to within 1/2 inch of the top
5. Run a knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
6. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
7. Top with lids and screw on rings
8. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
9. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder
10. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
11. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
12. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process for 15 minutes
13. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
14. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
15. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 14mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 6%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 4mg 0%, Potassium 24mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234310/strawberry-fig-preserve/

============================================================

RECIPE 211: Fig and Onion Spread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Chutney Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup olive oil
• 1 large red onion
• chopped
• 2 cups chopped fresh Black Mission figs
• ¼ cup aged balsamic vinegar
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat; stir onion in the hot oil
2. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover saucepan, and cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is softened and caramel-colored, 20 to 25 minutes
3. Stir figs into onion; cook and stir until figs begin to lose their shape and have softened into onion, 10 to 15 minutes
4. Pour balsamic vinegar into fig-onion mixture; cook until all the liquid has evaporated, 5 to 10 minutes
5. Stir sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, into fig-onion mixture until desired sweetness is reached
6. Serve warm or chilled

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 3%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 5g 2%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 43mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234218/fig-and-onion-spread/

============================================================

RECIPE 212: Figs and Toasted Almonds Brie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Cheese/Baked Brie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup brown sugar
• 2 tablespoons water
• 6 fresh figs
• stemmed and quartered
• 1 (14 ounce) round 4 1/4-inch diameter round Brie cheese
• ½ cup toasted almonds
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 C)
2. Heat brown sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat until sugar is completely dissolved
3. Add figs and vanilla, and cook until softened, about 10 minutes
4. Stir in almonds and vanilla
5. Place brie wheel in a baking dish, and pour fig mixture over the top
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes, or until softened but not melted
7. Serve with water crackers

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 33mg 11%, Sodium 211mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 90mg 7%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 160mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/55148/figs-and-toasted-almonds-brie/

============================================================

RECIPE 213: Fresh Fig Oatmeal Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¾ cups fresh figs
• 3 eggs
• ½ cup applesauce
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup brown sugar
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• ¼ cup flax seed meal
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• 1 ¼ cups old-fashioned oats

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease 24 muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners
3. Place half of the figs in a blender; blend until smooth
4. Chop remaining figs with a sharp knife
5. Beat eggs, applesauce, white sugar, and brown sugar together with an electric mixer in a bowl until frothy
6. Mix in flour, blended and chopped figs, flax meal, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, and baking powder
7. Slowly add flour with mixer on low; fold in oats
8. Spoon batter into muffin cups
9. Bake in preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, 20 to 25 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Cholesterol 23mg 8%, Sodium 80mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 65mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/254797/fresh-fig-oatmeal-muffins/

RECIPE 214: Fresh Figs and Chicken Thighs in Shallot-Balsamic Reduction
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 chicken thighs
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Thigh Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 skinless
• boneless chicken thighs
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
• 10 fresh figs
• stemmed and quartered
• 1 ½ cups chicken broth
• ¼ cup balsamic vinegar
• 1 large shallot
• sliced lengthwise
• 1 tablespoon minced fresh rosemary
• fresh rosemary
• for garnish

DIRECTIONS:
1. Pat chicken thighs dry and season both sides with salt and pepper
2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering
3. Add chicken thighs and cook, 3 to 4 minutes on each side
4. Add figs, chicken broth, balsamic vinegar, and shallot
5. Bring contents to a boil, cover, reduce heat, and let simmer until chicken thighs are no longer pink in the centers and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the centers reads at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 8 minutes
6. Transfer thighs to a serving plate and keep warm
7. Remove figs from the skillet using a slotted spoon and place them around the chicken on the plate
8. Add minced rosemary to the skillet contents, increase heat to medium-high, and allow contents to come to a full boil to create a the reduction
9. Continue to boil, stirring often, until liquid reduces to approximately 1 cup, 8 to 10 minutes
10. Drizzle balsamic reduction over chicken and figs and garnish with rosemary sprigs
11. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 44mg 15%, Sodium 281mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 5%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 13g, Vitamin C 2mg 10%, Calcium 34mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 286mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/275369/fresh-figs-and-chicken-thighs-in-shallot-balsamic-reduction/

============================================================

RECIPE 215: Fig and Honey Jam with Walnuts
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 48 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups Mission figs
• stemmed
• 2 cups honey
• 1 cup water
• ¼ cup butter
• 3 tablespoons lemon juice
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 teaspoon ground cloves
• 1 teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon grated fresh ginger
• 1 cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine figs, honey, water, butter, lemon juice, cinnamon, vanilla extract, cloves, salt, and ginger in a large pot; bring to a boil
2. Reduce heat and simmer until figs are soft, about 1 hour 15 minutes
3. Blend figs with an immersion blender until mixture reaches desired consistency
4. Stir in walnuts
5. Cook until flavors combine, about 15 minutes
6. Remove pot from heat and pour fig mixture into a container; transfer to the refrigerator

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 3%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Cholesterol 3mg 1%, Sodium 56mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 10mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 53mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/256649/fig-and-honey-jam-with-walnuts/

RECIPE 216: Fresh Fig Freezer Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 96
Yield: 96 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 5 cups white sugar
• 3 cups stemmed and coarsely chopped figs
• ⅓ cup lemon juice
• 2 (3 ounce) pouches liquid pectin (such as CERTO®)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix sugar and figs together in a large glass or plastic bowl; set aside for sugar to slightly dissolve, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes
2. Stir lemon juice and pectin together in a glass or plastic bowl
3. Stir lemon juice mixture into fig mixture until sugar is fully dissolved
4. Pour fig mixture into sterilized plastic canning containers, leaving 1/4 inch at the top
5. Cover containers and refrigerate or freeze

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 11g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Potassium 18mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234169/fresh-fig-freezer-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 217: Fig-Ricotta Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9-inch loaf cake
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Fig Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• nonstick cooking spray
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 ½ cups whole-milk ricotta cheese
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¾ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 3 large eggs
• at room temperature
• 1 ½ teaspoons almond extract
• 4 fresh figs
• chopped into 1/2-inch pieces
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• 4 fresh fig slices
• 1 teaspoon confectioners' sugar
• or as needed (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spray a 9-inch loaf pan with nonstick cooking spray
3. Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl
4. Beat ricotta cheese, sugar, and butter together in a bowl using an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth, about 2 minutes
5. Beat in eggs, one at a time, followed by almond extract
6. Beat in flour mixture on low speed, scraping down the sides of the bowl until combined; beat batter for about 30 seconds more
7. Place chopped figs into a bowl, sprinkle 1 tablespoon flour over, and stir to coat
8. Fold figs into the batter
9. Pour into the prepared loaf pan
10. Place fig slices on top of the batter, down the center
11. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, 45 to 60 minutes
12. Remove from the oven and place on a wire rack to cool
13. Remove from the pan once the cake has cooled, 20 to 30 minutes
14. Dust with confectioners' sugar

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 24%, Saturated Fat 11g 55%, Cholesterol 103mg 34%, Sodium 421mg 18%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 190mg 15%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 181mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/275368/fig-ricotta-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 218: August Fig Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 2 dozen cookies
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Fig Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• ½ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup golden brown sugar
• 1 egg
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup fresh figs
• halved
• ½ cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease two baking sheets
3. Mix butter, white sugar, and brown sugar by hand in a bowl
4. Add egg and vanilla extract; stir to combine
5. Combine flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt together in a separate bowl; stir into sugar mixture
6. Scoop the meat out of figs and reserve 2 tablespoons
7. Chop figs and scooped middles
8. Fold chopped figs and walnuts into the cookie dough
9. Drop spoonfuls of batter on the prepared baking sheet
10. Top each mound with small amounts of reserved fig pulp
11. Bake in the preheated oven until the cookie edges are lightly browned, 12 to 15 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 15%, Saturated Fat 5g 27%, Cholesterol 36mg 12%, Sodium 106mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 28mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 67mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228557/august-fig-cookies/

RECIPE 219: Fig and Prosciutto Appetizer Bites
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 25
Yield: 25 bites
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Wraps and Rolls/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 ounces honey-flavored goat cheese
• 3 ounces prosciutto
• 2 fresh figs
• thinly sliced
• 2 leaves fresh basil
• cut into thin strips
• ⅛ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place goat cheese on a sheet of plastic wrap
2. Top with another sheet of plastic wrap and use a rolling pin to flatten into a 4x8-inch rectangle
3. Remove the top sheet of plastic wrap and cover goat cheese with slices of prosciutto, slightly overlapping the edges
4. Cover prosciutto with a new sheet of plastic wrap and flip both sheets over so the goat cheese layer is now facing up
5. Remove top sheet of plastic wrap
6. Cover goat cheese evenly with figs, basil, and black pepper
7. Starting from the long edge, roll tightly to form a log
8. Wrap log in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 2 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 3%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 7mg 2%, Sodium 89mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 1g 0%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 15mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/268661/fig-and-prosciutto-appetizer-bites/

============================================================

RECIPE 220: Fig Cake I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 1 - 9x13 inch pan
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Fig Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground cloves
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 cup butter
• 3 eggs
• beaten
• 1 cup buttermilk
• 1 cup chopped fresh figs
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• ½ cup butter
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup evaporated milk
• ½ teaspoon baking soda

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13 inch pan
3. Mix together the flour, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, 1 teaspoon baking soda, baking powder and salt
4. In a large bowl, cream together 1 cup butter and 1 1/2 cup sugar until light and fluffy
5. Stir in the eggs
6. Beat in the flour mixture alternately with the buttermilk, mixing just until incorporated
7. Fold in the chopped figs and pecans
8. Pour batter into prepared pan
9. Bake in the preheated oven for 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean
10. Allow to cool
11. To make the icing: In a large saucepan, mix together butter, sugar, evaporated milk and baking soda
12. Bring to a boil, stirring until sugar is dissolved
13. Then cook without stirring until the mixture turns brown, or until it reaches the soft ball stage on a candy thermometer (234 degrees F - 115 degrees C)
14. Cool to lukewarm (110 degrees F)
15. Pour into a small bowl and beat until it thickens to spreading consistency
16. Quickly spread icing onto the cooled cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 11g 54%, Cholesterol 74mg 25%, Sodium 333mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 14%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 66mg 5%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 121mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/21074/fig-cake-i/

============================================================

RECIPE 221: Blueberry-Fig Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 jar
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup blueberries
• 2 cups quartered fresh figs
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ½ cup water
• 1 tablespoon lime juice
• ½ teaspoon balsamic vinegar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mash blueberries with a fork in a small bowl
2. Transfer to a 3 1/2-quart pot
3. Add figs, sugar, water, lime juice, and balsamic vinegar
4. Lightly pulse with an immersion blender until mostly smooth, with some chunks remaining for texture
5. Place the pot on the stove over medium-high heat
6. Stir continuously as it comes to a boil
7. Reduce heat to low, and stir periodically, until thickened, 20 to 25 minutes
8. Check doneness by dropping a small spoonful of jam onto a frozen plate
9. Let sit for 1 to 2 minutes; if jam appears to gel, it is ready
10. Continue cooking if jam appears thin and runny
11. When jam has thickened, remove from heat and allow to cool slightly, about 10 minutes
12. Pour jam into a clean jar with a hermetic seal
13. Allow to cool completely before refrigerating

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 11mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 68mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/275586/blueberry-fig-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 222: Pear-Fig Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Salad/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups torn romaine lettuce
• 6 fresh figs
• quartered
• 1 large ripe but firm pear
• peeled and thinly sliced
• ¼ cup toasted pecans
• chopped
• ¼ cup shredded Gruyere cheese
• 1 small red onion
• thinly sliced
• 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
• 3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
• salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine romaine lettuce, figs, pear, pecans, Gruyere cheese, and onion in a large bowl
2. Drizzle evenly with olive oil and vinegar
3. Season with salt and pepper
4. Toss lightly and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 9mg 3%, Sodium 73mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 27g 10%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 9mg 43%, Calcium 131mg 10%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 340mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/263850/pear-fig-salad/

RECIPE 223: Stuffed Leg of Lamb with Balsamic-Fig-Basil Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 lamb roast
Prep Time: 50 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Lamb/Leg/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup coarsely chopped prunes
• ¼ cup currants
• 2 tablespoons creme de cassis liqueur
• 1 ½ tablespoons minced fresh rosemary
• 1 ½ tablespoons minced fresh thyme
• ½ teaspoon ground coriander
• 1 ¼ teaspoons salt
• 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
• 1 (4 pound) boneless leg of lamb
• rolled and tied
• ½ cup chopped roasted and salted almonds
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint
• 3 cloves garlic
• cut into thirds
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• ½ cup balsamic vinegar
• 5 tablespoons butter
• 3 tablespoons honey
• ⅓ cup thinly sliced
• stemmed Calimyrna figs
• 5 teaspoons chopped fresh basil
• 6 leaves mint
• 6 leaves basil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Combine the chopped prunes and currants with the creme de cassis in a small bowl, and set aside
3. In another small bowl, combine the rosemary, thyme, coriander, salt, and pepper; set aside
4. Untie and unroll the lamb, lay it out flat on the work surface
5. Trim off excess fat, and cut any thick parts open so that it is evenly thick and somewhat rectangular in shape
6. Sprinkle half of the herb mixture over the lamb
7. Mix the almonds and chopped mint into the prune mixture; spread evenly over the lamb
8. Roll up starting at one of the short sides, and tie with kitchen twine in 1-inch intervals
9. Cut 9 slits about 1-inch deep into the top of the lamb, and insert a slice of garlic in each
10. Rub with olive oil, and sprinkle with the remaining herb mixture
11. Place lamb seam-side up on a rack set in a roasting pan
12. Roast in the preheated oven to desired doneness
13. For medium-rare, a thermometer inserted into the center will read 140 degrees F (60 degrees C)
14. Remove lamb from the oven and cover with foil
15. Allow to rest for 15 minutes while proceeding with the recipe
16. While the lamb is resting, bring the balsamic vinegar to a boil in a small saucepan over high heat
17. Boil until the vinegar has reduced by half, 4 to 5 minutes
18. Once reduced, stir in the butter, honey, and sliced figs
19. Stir until the butter has melted, then remove from the heat, stir in the chopped basil and set aside
20. To serve, remove the twine from the lamb and cut into 1/2 inch thick slices
21. Arrange on a warm serving platter and drizzle with the fig sauce, garnish with mint and basil leaves

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 40g 51%, Saturated Fat 15g 76%, Cholesterol 147mg 49%, Sodium 649mg 28%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 11%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 38g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 86mg 7%, Iron 4mg 21%, Potassium 691mg 15%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/112260/stuffed-leg-of-lamb-with-balsamic-fig-basil-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 224: Bourbon Fig Compote
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 7 ounces dried Mission figs
• diced
• ¼ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup bourbon whiskey
• ¼ cup balsamic vinegar
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• 1 pinch salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine figs, sugar, whiskey, balsamic vinegar, lemon juice, and salt in a small saucepan; bring to a boil
2. Reduce heat and simmer until liquid reduces by half, about 30 minutes
3. Cool before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 3mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 16g 6%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 26mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 124mg 3%

RECIPE 225: Chicken Tenders with Balsamic-Fig Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pound chicken tenders
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• ¼ cup all-purpose flour
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 tablespoon butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Season chicken with salt and pepper on both sides and lightly coat with flour, shaking off excess
2. Heat olive oil and butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat
3. Add chicken to the skillet and cook until tenders are golden brown, no longer pink in the centers, and juices run clear, 5 to 6 minutes, flipping halfway through
4. Transfer to a plate and cover loosely with aluminum foil to keep warm
5. Add shallot and garlic to the same skillet and cook until softened, about 2 minutes
6. Add red wine and balsamic and let simmer until reduced by half, 3 to 5 minutes
7. Stir in figs, thyme, Dijon mustard, honey, and salt; bring to a boil
8. Reduce heat to low or medium-low and let simmer until thickened, about 3 minutes
9. Remove from heat and stir in butter
10. Spoon sauce over warm chicken tenders, or add chicken back into the skillet to briefly reheat, and serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 80mg 27%, Sodium 456mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 27g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 46mg 4%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 432mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/275396/chicken-tenders-with-balsamic-fig-sauce/

RECIPE 226: Fabulous Fig Scones
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 scones
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Scone Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup whole wheat pastry flour
• ½ cup old-fashioned rolled oats
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ cup canola oil
• 1 egg
• lightly beaten
• ¼ cup honey
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 cup diced fresh figs

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly sprinkle flour over paper
3. Whisk flour, oats, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl
4. Whisk oil and egg together in a separate bowl until smooth; add honey and mix well
5. Mix oil mixture into flour mixture just until batter is moistened
6. Sprinkle sugar over figs in a bowl and toss to coat; fold into batter
7. Transfer batter to the middle of the prepared baking sheet and form into a 7-inch circle
8. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
9. Score the batter into 8 sections and continue baking until scones are cooked through and lightly browned on top, about 20 minutes more
10. Cut into 8 scones and slide every other scone back from the circle to allow cooling

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Cholesterol 21mg 7%, Sodium 276mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 89mg 7%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 114mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/244480/fabulous-fig-scones/

============================================================

RECIPE 227: Burrata Bruschetta with Figs
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Bruschetta Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 12 Black Mission figs
• halved lengthwise
• 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
• 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
• 6 ounces Burrata cheese
• thickly sliced
• 6 (1/2 inch thick) slices Italian bread
• toasted
• sea salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate
2. Place figs, skin-side down, on grill
3. Cook until figs start to swell and bubble, 2 to 4 minutes
4. Whisk together balsamic vinegar and olive oil until completely combined, about 1 minute
5. Place Burrata cheese on top of each piece of toast
6. Spread figs around bread and drizzle with balsamic vinegar mixture
7. Season with sea salt and black pepper to taste

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 30mg 10%, Sodium 364mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 5g 19%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 78mg 6%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 388mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/222338/burrata-bruschetta-with-figs/

RECIPE 228: Fig Cake II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 to 10 - inch tube pan
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Fig Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 teaspoon ground allspice
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 3 eggs
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 cup vegetable oil
• 1 cup buttermilk
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 2 teaspoons hot water
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup canned figs with juice
• chopped
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup buttermilk
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• 1 tablespoon light corn syrup
• ¼ cup butter
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 10 inch tube pan
3. Sift together the flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice
4. Dissolve 1 teaspoon baking soda in 2 teaspoons hot water; set aside
5. In a large bowl, beat eggs with electric mixer until thick and lemon colored
6. Beat in 1 1/2 cups sugar and 1 cup oil
7. Combine buttermilk and dissolved baking soda
8. Beat in the flour mixture alternately with buttermilk mixture
9. Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla, figs, and nuts
10. Pour into prepared pan
11. Bake in the preheated oven for 70 to 75 minutes
12. Remove from pan and pour hot Buttermilk Icing over warm cake
13. To make Buttermilk Icing: In a heavy saucepan, combine 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup buttermilk, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, corn syrup and butter
14. Bring to a boil and cook to soft ball stage (240 degrees F/ 115 degrees C)
15. Remove from stove and stir in vanilla
16. Pour over warm cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 29%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 43mg 14%, Sodium 323mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 49g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 113mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/25577/fig-cake-ii/

RECIPE 229: Delish Black Mission Figs!
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Meat and Poultry/Pork/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 Black Mission figs
• cut in half
• ¼ cup crumbled goat cheese
• or as needed
• 3 slices prosciutto
• trimmed of all fat and cut into strips
• 2 tablespoons honey
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
2. Arrange fig halves, cut sides up, on a baking sheet
3. Top each fig half with goat cheese; lay prosciutto strips atop goat cheese layer
4. Broil figs in the preheated oven until prosciutto is crisp and goat cheese is melted, 3 to 5 minutes
5. Transfer the warm figs to a serving platter and drizzle with honey

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 21mg 7%, Sodium 283mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 78mg 6%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 260mg 6%

RECIPE 231: Black Mission Fig Preserves
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 1 13-ounce jar
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups fresh Black Mission figs
• stemmed and halved
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup water
• 1 tablespoon lime juice
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground ginger
• ⅛ teaspoon ground white pepper
• 1 13-ounce jar with lid

DIRECTIONS:
1. Scoop the flesh from the figs with a spoon and discard the peels
2. Bring sugar and water to a boil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar has dissolved
3. Stir in fig pulp, lime juice, cinnamon, ginger, and white pepper
4. Cook, stirring often, until a candy thermometer reads 210 degrees F (100 degrees C), about 20 minutes
5. While preserves are cooking, sterilize jar and lid in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
6. Pack the hot preserves into the sterilized jar to within 1/4 inch of the top
7. Top the jar with the sterilized lid and let cool before storing preserves in the refrigerator

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 8mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 45mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228523/black-mission-fig-preserves/

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 5 mins
Rating: 4.8/5

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups cranberry juice

• 1 banana
• 2 fresh figs

DIRECTIONS:
1. Process the cranberry juice, strawberries, blueberries, watermelon, banana, and figs in a blender until smooth and creamy
2. Enjoy immediately or keep cool in refrigerator

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 106mg 528%, Calcium 30mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 362mg 8%

RECIPE 233: Zurie's Fresh Fig Compote Over Cream Cheese
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Cheese Dips and Spreads Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅔ cup brown sugar
• ¼ cup water
• 1 pinch salt
• 2 cups fresh figs
• stemmed and quartered
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat a saucepan over medium heat; add brown sugar, water, salt, and figs
2. Cook and stir until sugar has dissolved and figs have softened, about 10 minutes
3. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla extract
4. Cool for 5 minutes
5. Place cream cheese on a platter; pour fig mixture over cream cheese

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 6g 31%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 87mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 21g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 146mg 3%

RECIPE 234: Fig and Ricotta Crostini
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 24 crostini
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Canapes and Crostini Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 French baguette
• cut into 1/2 inch slices
• 1 (15 ounce) container ricotta cheese
• 12 fresh basil leaves
• cut into thin strips
• 8 black mission figs
• cut in quarters
• ¼ cup aged balsamic vinegar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Place the baguette slices on an ungreased, foil-lined baking sheet
3. Bake the bread in the preheated oven until the bottoms are brown, about 5 minutes; flip and bake until crisp, 5 minutes
4. Remove the pan from the oven
5. Spread 1 tablespoon of ricotta on each slice of toasted bread
6. Place a few ribbons of basil on each, arrange a slice of fig on top, and drizzle the finished crostini with balsamic vinegar

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 11mg 4%, Sodium 292mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 30g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 127mg 10%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 176mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/143560/fig-and-ricotta-crostini/

RECIPE 235: Risotto with Fresh Figs and Prosciutto
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Rice/Risotto Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups vegetable broth
• 6 tablespoons butter
• divided
• 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil
• 1 green onion
• finely chopped
• 1 (12 ounce) package Arborio rice
• ½ cup dry white wine
• 14 small fresh figs
• divided
• 4 thin slices prosciutto
• finely chopped
• 1 cup grated Pecorino-Romano cheese
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat vegetable stock in a large pot and keep warm over low heat
2. Heat 2 tablespoons butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-low heat
3. Add green onion; cook and stir until softened, about 1 minute
4. Pour in rice and stir until coated in butter and oil and starting to toast, 2 to 3 minutes
5. Increase heat and pour in wine
6. Simmer until alcohol has evaporated and the wine is mostly absorbed
7. Reduce heat to medium and stir in 1 ladle of boiling broth
8. Continue stirring until the rice has absorbed the liquid and turned creamy
9. Once the liquid has been fully absorbed, add the next ladle
10. Repeat this process, stirring constantly until all liquid has been used or rice is tender yet firm to the bite (al dente)
11. Stirring in the broth should take 12 to 15 minutes in all
12. Meanwhile, chop 10 figs
13. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a medium skillet and cook chopped figs until soft and coated in butter, 4 to 5 minutes
14. Crush figs gently with a wooden spoon while cooking
15. Stir in prosciutto
16. Add fig-prosciutto mixture to the risotto when there are about 5 minutes left to cook
17. Remove risotto from heat; stir in remaining 2 tablespoons butter and grated Pecorino romano cheese
18. Let stand for a few minutes
19. Divide risotto evenly onto 4 plates, garnishing each with a whole fig before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 30g 38%, Saturated Fat 16g 82%, Cholesterol 72mg 24%, Sodium 1083mg 47%, Total Carbohydrate 100g 36%, Dietary Fiber 6g 22%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 17g, Vitamin C 4mg 18%, Calcium 320mg 25%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 362mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/266191/risotto-with-fresh-figs-and-prosciutto/

============================================================

RECIPE 236: Fig and Rosemary Cranberry Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Cranberry Sauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup water
• 1 cup dark brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons maple extract
• 1 (12 ounce) package fresh cranberries
• 10 dried Mission figs
• chopped
• 1 (5 inch) fresh rosemary sprig

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring water, brown sugar, and maple extract to a boil in a non-reactive saucepan
2. Add cranberries and figs
3. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes
4. Add rosemary and cook until sauce is thickened, about 5 minutes more
5. Carefully remove rosemary sprig and discard
6. Remove pot from the burner and let cool, about 10 minutes
7. Pour sauce into a bowl and refrigerate until ready to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 12mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 17%, Dietary Fiber 5g 17%, Total Sugars 41g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 6mg 29%, Calcium 62mg 5%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 243mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/276836/fig-and-rosemary-cranberry-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 237: Mamma K's Fig Preserves with a Twist
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 36
Yield: 3 1-pint jars
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups fresh figs
• stemmed and quartered
• 3 cups white sugar
• 1 lemon
• thinly sliced and seeds removed
• 2 (3 ounce) packages strawberry-flavored Jell-O® mix
• 3 1-pint canning jars with lids and rings
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix figs, sugar, lemon slices, and strawberry gelatin in a large pot
2. Let stand for 1 hour
3. Bring to a boil and cook over medium heat, stirring often to prevent burning, until foam has disappeared and the preserves are thickened, 25 to 40 minutes
4. Sterilize jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
5. Pack the fig preserves into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
6. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
7. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
8. Top with lids, and screw on rings
9. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
10. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder
11. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
12. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
13. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process for 10 minutes
14. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
15. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
16. Store in a cool, dark area, and wait at least 2 days before opening

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 19mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 37mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228522/mamma-ks-fig-preserves-with-a-twist/

============================================================

RECIPE 238: Prosciutto-Wrapped Chicken with Figs and Goat Cheese
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• divided
• 2 shallots
• chopped
• 1 clove garlic
• minced
• 1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
• ¾ cup soft goat cheese
• ½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese
• ½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• 6 figs
• chopped
• 1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil
• 6 skinless
• boneless chicken breast halves
• 12 large
• thin slices prosciutto

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread 1 tablespoon olive oil on a baking sheet
3. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir shallots until translucent, about 3 minutes
4. Stir garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper into shallots; cook and stir until fragrant, about 2 minutes
5. Transfer shallot mixture to a bowl; stir in goat cheese, mozzarella cheese, cream cheese, figs, and basil until well combined
6. Pound each chicken breast on a work surface until thin
7. Spoon about 1/4 cup goat cheese mixture onto the middle of each piece of chicken
8. Roll chicken around the filling and wrap 2 pieces prosciutto around each chicken roll, covering the opening with 1 layer of prosciutto
9. Place chicken rolls onto the prepared baking sheet, seam-side down
10. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes; turn chicken and continue baking until chicken is no longer pink in the center and prosciutto is crisp, about 20 minutes more
11. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
12. Let chicken stand for 5 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 31%, Saturated Fat 11g 57%, Cholesterol 114mg 38%, Sodium 567mg 25%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 34g, Vitamin C 3mg 14%, Calcium 179mg 14%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 429mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/257350/prosciutto-wrapped-chicken-with-figs-and-goat-cheese/

============================================================

RECIPE 239: Fresh Fig and Prosciutto Pasta Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 3.9/5
Category: /Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Pasta Sauces/Creamy/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup milk
• 6 thin slices prosciutto
• cut into thin strips
• 6 fresh figs
• stemmed and quartered
• 1 tablespoon lemon zest
• ¼ teaspoon lemon pepper seasoning
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat butter in a saucepan over low heat; gradually stir flour into melted butter until smooth and bubbly, 2 to 4 minutes
2. Add salt; stir to combine
3. Remove from heat; gradually stir in milk until smooth
4. Return white sauce to stovetop; bring to a boil
5. Reduce heat and simmer over low heat
6. Cook and stir prosciutto and figs in a non-stick pan over medium heat until warm, about 5 minutes
7. Stir lemon zest and lemon pepper seasoning into the white sauce
8. Serve figs and prosciutto atop sauce

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 30mg 10%, Sodium 592mg 26%, Total Carbohydrate 21g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 4mg 18%, Calcium 102mg 8%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 274mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228556/fresh-fig-and-prosciutto-pasta-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 240: Momma's Fresh Fig Preserves
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 40
Yield: 5 half pint-sized jars
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 3 hrs 5 mins
Total Time: 15 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 cups quartered fresh figs
• 3 cups white sugar
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• ½ teaspoon grated fresh ginger
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• ¼ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring figs, sugar, lemon juice, ginger, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt to a simmer in a saucepan over medium heat
2. Reduce heat and cook at a low simmer, stirring every 20 minutes, until desired consistency, 3 to 4 hours
3. Inspect 5 or 6 half pint-sized jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones
4. Immerse in simmering water until fig preserves are ready
5. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water
6. Pack fig preserves into hot, sterilized jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top
7. Run a clean knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars to remove any air bubbles
8. Wipe rims with a moist paper towel to remove any residue
9. Top with lids and screw rings on tightly
10. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
11. Bring to a boil and lower jars 2 inches apart into the boiling water using a holder
12. Pour in more boiling water to cover jars by at least 1 inch
13. Bring to a rolling boil, cover, and process for 10 minutes
14. Remove the jars from the stockpot and let rest, several inches apart, for 12 to 24 hours
15. Press the center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down
16. Remove the rings for storage and store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 15mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 59mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/283447/mommas-fresh-fig-preserves/

============================================================

RECIPE 241: Fig and Whiskey Cupcakes
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 cupcakes
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Fig Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup fresh figs
• finely chopped
• ½ cup whiskey
• 1 ⅔ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon cream of tartar
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cloves
• ½ cup white sugar
• ⅓ cup vegetable oil
• ¼ cup brown sugar
• 1 egg
• ½ cup buttermilk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Soak figs in whiskey in a bowl for at least 30 minutes
2. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
3. Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners
4. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, cream of tartar, and cloves in a bowl
5. Blend white sugar, oil, and brown sugar together in a separate bowl using an electric mixer
6. Add egg and mix until creamy
7. Mix in buttermilk and vanilla extract
8. Reserve 1 tablespoon of fig mixture for frosting, and mix remainder into batter
9. Beat in flour mixture until just combined
10. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full
11. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean, 15 to 20 minutes
12. Remove from the oven and transfer to wire racks to cool completely, about 30 minutes
13. Beat cream cheese and shortening together in a bowl using an electric mixer until creamy
14. Add powdered sugar slowly, 1 cup at a time, until creamy
15. Add vanilla extract
16. Slowly drizzle in reserved fig mixture; mix frosting until combined
17. Pipe frosting onto cooled cupcakes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 33%, Saturated Fat 9g 43%, Cholesterol 35mg 12%, Sodium 264mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 81g 29%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 66g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 62mg 5%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 97mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/276835/fig-and-whiskey-cupcakes/

============================================================

RECIPE 242: Figs with Caramelized Onions and Goat Cheese
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 40
Yield: 40 crackers
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Snacks/Cracker Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup canola oil
• 1 large yellow onion
• cut into thin slices
• ¼ cup small dried Mission figs
• 6 ounces goat cheese
• softened
• 40 crackers

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat a skillet over medium heat; add oil
2. Add onion; cook and stir until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes
3. Reduce heat to low and continue cooking and stirring until onion is very tender and dark brown, about 40 minutes more
4. Remove from heat and cool
5. While the onion is cooling, cut the figs lengthwise into 1/4-inch rounds
6. Layer 1/4 teaspoon goat cheese, 1/4 teaspoon caramelized onions, and 1 or 2 fig slices on each cracker

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 3mg 1%, Sodium 54mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 3g 1%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 18mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 21mg 0%

RECIPE 243: Arugula-Fig Salad with Creamy Gorgonzola
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Arugula Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil

• 1 tablespoon orange blossom water
• or more to taste
• 1 tablespoon orange juice
• 1 teaspoon grated orange zest

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine olive oil, lemon juice, orange blossom water, orange juice, and orange zest in a glass jar and shake dressing until emulsified
2. Arrange arugula on a salad platter, place figs on top, then top with Gorgonzola cheese and scatter the crushed pistachios over to garnish
3. Season with salt and pepper
4. Pour the dressing over the salad and serve immediately

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins

• 1 cup red wine

• 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat figs, red wine, sugar, honey, red pepper flakes, and salt in a small saucepan over medium heat

RECIPE 245: Slow Cooker Cranberry Fig Pork
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 4 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 4 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Pork Chop Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 (4 ounce) pork chops
• 1 cup frozen cranberries
• 3 canned figs
• 1/4 cup juice reserved
• ½ cup apple juice
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
• ¼ teaspoon dried rosemary

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat
2. Sear pork chops in the hot skillet until lightly browned, about 1 minute per side
3. Transfer seared pork chops to the slow cooker
4. Combine cranberries, figs, reserved fig juice, apple juice, brown sugar, salt, black pepper, and rosemary in a saucepan; bring to a boil
5. Pour cranberry mixture over pork chops
6. Cook on High for 4 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 6%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 36mg 12%, Sodium 170mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 15g, Vitamin C 4mg 22%, Calcium 29mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 301mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234391/slow-cooker-cranberry-fig-pork/

RECIPE 246: Dolce Pesca (Sweet Peaches)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/Italian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 fresh figs
• ½ cup pine nuts
• 4 peaches
• halved and pitted
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 cup white wine
• ½ cup brandy

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with foil
3. Place the figs and pine nuts in the bowl of a food processor and pulse until fine
4. Place the halved peaches onto the prepared baking sheet, cut side up
5. Sprinkle evenly with the white sugar
6. Pour the white wine over the peaches, and stuff them with the fig mixture
7. Pour the brandy over the peaches
8. Bake in the preheated oven until browned, about 15 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 6%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Sodium 4mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 16g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 22mg 108%, Calcium 20mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 148mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/172369/dolce-pesca-sweet-peaches/

RECIPE 248: Watermelon Lemonade
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 6 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Lemonade Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup water
• 4 cups cubed watermelon
• 3 cups cold water
• ½ cup fresh lemon juice
• 6 cups ice cubes

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the watermelon into a blender
2. Cover, and puree until smooth
3. Strain through a fine mesh sieve
4. Bring sugar and 1/2 cup water to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes
5. Remove from heat
6. Stir in 3 cups of cold water and the lemon juice
7. Divide the ice into 12 glasses, and scoop 2 to 3 tablespoons of watermelon puree over the ice, then top with the lemonade
8. Gently stir before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 3mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 9mg 44%, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 70mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/214907/watermelon-lemonade/

============================================================

RECIPE 249: Watermelon Ice Pops
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 ice pops
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Frozen Dessert Recipes/Popsicle Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups watermelon
• seeded and diced
• ½ cup water
• 1 tablespoon honey
• 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
• 1 tablespoon white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Blend watermelon, water, honey, lemon juice, and sugar together in a blender until smooth
2. Pour mixture into ice pop molds and freeze until solid, about 2 hours
3. Run hot water over ice pop molds for a few seconds to unmold

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 8g 3%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 4mg 21%, Calcium 4mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 48mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/242400/watermelon-ice-pops/

• 1 large seedless watermelon

• thinly sliced
• 12 mint leaves
• sliced thinly
• ¼ cup olive oil
• 2 tablespoons white balsamic vinegar
• 1 pinch coarse salt
• or to taste
• 1 pinch ground black pepper
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Gently mix watermelon, tomatoes, feta cheese, onion, and mint in a large bowl

RECIPE 253: Simple Watermelon Sorbet
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Frozen Dessert Recipes/Sorbet Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup water
• ¼ cup lemon juice
• 3 cups cubed seeded watermelon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine sugar, water, and lemon juice in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes
2. Remove from heat and refrigerate until cooled, about 30 minutes
3. Blend watermelon in a blender or food processor until pureed
4. Stir pureed watermelon into sugar mixture
5. Transfer watermelon mixture to an ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 30g 11%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 8mg 41%, Calcium 5mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 74mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/233892/simple-watermelon-sorbet/

RECIPE 254: Refreshing Cucumber Watermelon Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Salad/Vegetable Salad Recipes/Cucumber Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 small red onion
• halved and sliced into thin half-moons
• 2 tablespoons lime juice
• or more to taste
• 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
• 1 seedless watermelon
• cut into cubes
• 3 baby cucumbers
• seeded and cut into cubes
• 1 cup crumbled feta cheese
• ½ cup mint leaves
• sliced thinly

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix red onion with lime juice in a bowl; set side to marinate at least 10 minutes
2. Stir olive oil into mixture
3. Toss watermelon, baby cucumbers, and feta cheese together in a large bowl
4. Pour the red onion mixture over the watermelon mixture; toss to coat
5. Sprinkle mint over the salad; toss

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 8%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 13mg 4%, Sodium 172mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 39mg 194%, Calcium 110mg 8%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 529mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/222728/refreshing-cucumber-watermelon-salad/

RECIPE 255: Refreshing Watermelon Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 15
Yield: 15 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Watermelon Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons lime juice
• 1 cup sliced red onion
• cut lengthwise
• 15 cups cubed watermelon
• 3 cups cubed English cucumber
• 1 (8 ounce) package feta cheese
• crumbled
• ½ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• cracked black pepper
• sea salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a small bowl, pour lime juice over red onions
2. Allow to marinate while assembling the salad
3. Gently combine the watermelon, cucumber, feta cheese, and cilantro in a large bowl
4. Season with black pepper
5. Toss watermelon salad with marinated onions and season with sea salt just before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 4%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 182mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 15mg 75%, Calcium 93mg 7%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 243mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/111853/refreshing-watermelon-salad/

RECIPE 256: Watermelon Basil Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup basil leaves
• 4 cups 1/2-inch cubes watermelon
• 2 teaspoons lemon juice
• ¼ teaspoon kosher salt
• ¼ teaspoon chili powder

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stack basil leaves on top of each other and roll tightly into a log
2. Slice lengthwise into thin ribbons
3. Combine basil slices and watermelon in a large bowl
4. Drizzle lemon juice over watermelon
5. Mix salt and chili powder together in a small bowl; sprinkle over watermelon and toss to combine
6. Chill salad before serving, at least 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 122mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 0g 0%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 0g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 5mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 14mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/254422/watermelon-basil-salad/

3. Squeeze lime juice over spiced watermelon

RECIPE 258: Watermelon Sherbet
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 quart
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 4 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Frozen Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups diced seedless watermelon
• 1 cup white sugar
• 3 tablespoons lemon juice
• 1 dash salt
• ¼ cup cold water
• 1 (.25 ounce) envelope unflavored gelatin
• 1 cup chilled heavy cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine the watermelon, sugar, lemon juice, and salt in a large mixing bowl; stir to coat evenly
2. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerator for 30 minutes
3. Blend the mixture in a blender until smooth; return to the bowl
4. Pour the cold water into a saucepan
5. Sprinkle the gelatin over the cold water; let stand 1 minutes
6. Place the saucepan over low heat; cook for 2 minutes
7. Stir the gelatin mixture into the blended watermelon mixture
8. Add the heavy cream; beat with an electric hand mixer at medium speed until the mixture is fluffy
9. Transfer the mixture into an ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacturer's directions until it reaches "soft-serve" consistency
10. Transfer ice cream to a one- or two-quart lidded plastic container; cover surface with plastic wrap and seal
11. For best results, ice cream should ripen in the freezer for at least 2 hours or overnight

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 7g 35%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 63mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 9mg 45%, Calcium 26mg 2%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 115mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215568/watermelon-sherbet/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Antipasto Recipes/

• 1 (8 ounce) package fresh mozzarella cheese
• cut into small pieces
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
• salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Trim basil leaves into small circles about 1 inch in diameter
2. Thread watermelon and mozzarella cheese on toothpicks, sandwiching a basil leaf in between
3. Arrange on a serving plate
4. Pour olive oil and balsamic vinegar over toothpicks
5. Sprinkle salt and black pepper on top

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 263: Jewel's Watermelon Margaritas
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Cocktail Recipes/Tequila Drinks Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup water
• 3 strips orange zest
• 2 cups cubed seeded watermelon
• ¾ cup white tequila
• ¼ cup lime juice
• 1 pinch salt or sugar for rimming glasses
• 1 lime
• cut into wedges
• 2 cups crushed ice
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring 1/2 cup sugar, water, and orange zest in a small saucepan to boil, stirring constantly
2. Simmer until sugar is dissolved, about 3 minutes
3. Remove simple syrup from heat and allow to cool completely
4. Place watermelon in a blender or food processor
5. Pulse until pureed
6. Stir watermelon puree into a large pitcher with simple syrup, tequila, and lime juice
7. Place a small amount of salt or sugar into a saucer
8. Rub edge of margarita glasses with a lime wedge to moisten
9. Lightly dip the rim of the glass into the saucer to rim the glass; tap off excess salt or sugar
10. Fill rimmed glasses with crushed ice; pour margarita mixture into glasses and garnish with lime wedges to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 42mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 36mg 180%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 154mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/221229/jewels-watermelon-margaritas/

============================================================

RECIPE 264: Watermelon Preserves
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 40
Yield: 5 cups
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 14 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 14 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 3.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds watermelon
• 3 cups white sugar
• 3 lemons - rinsed
• sliced and seeded

DIRECTIONS:
1. Remove the green rind from watermelon, and dice white part into small cubes, leaving the red flesh mostly intact
2. Remove seeds
3. In a heavy stockpot, combine 4 cups of prepared watermelon, sugar, and lemons
4. Bring to a boil over medium heat, and let the mixture boil slowly for 2 hours, stirring occasionally
5. The temperature of the mixture should be at 220 degrees F (105 degrees C) so the jam will set
6. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
7. Pack the jam into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
8. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
9. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
10. Top with lids, and screw on rings
11. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
12. Bring to a boil over high heat, then carefully lower the jars into the pot using a holder
13. Leave 2 inches of space between the jars
14. Pour in more boiling water if necessary until the water level is at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
15. Bring the water to a full boil, cover the pot, and process for 10 minutes
16. Remove the jars from the stockpot and let rest, several inches apart, for 12 to 24 hours
17. Press the center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down
18. Remove the rings for storage and store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 8mg 41%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 38mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/35899/watermelon-preserves/

============================================================

RECIPE 266: Polynesian Watermelon Drink ('Otai)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Punch Recipes/Non-Alcoholic Punch Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 seedless watermelon
• halved and sliced
• 3 cups water
• 1 (15.25 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk
• ½ cup shredded coconut
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• or to taste
• ½ lime
• juiced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Grate watermelon with a fork from the rind into a large bowl, leaving no large chunks
2. Stir water, pineapple, evaporated milk, and coconut into the grated watermelon
3. Add sugar; stir until dissolved
4. Squeeze lime juice into the watermelon mixture

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 9mg 3%, Sodium 48mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 35mg 176%, Calcium 117mg 9%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 574mg 12%

RECIPE 267: Summer Fruit Salad with a Lemon, Honey, and Mint Dressing
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Strawberry Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups cubed seeded watermelon
• 2 cups sliced fresh strawberries
• 2 large fresh peaches
• cut into cubes
• 2 large nectarines
• cut into cubes
• 1 red Anjou pear
• cut into cubes
• 1 cup seedless grapes
• halved
• 2 lemons
• juiced
• ¼ cup minced fresh mint (chocolate mint preferred)
• ½ lemon
• zested
• 1 tablespoon honey (fireweed honey preferred)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine watermelon, strawberries, peaches, nectarines, pear, and grapes in a large mixing bowl
2. Whisk lemon juice, mint, lemon zest, and honey together in a small bowl; drizzle over the fruit mixture and toss to coat
3. Refrigerate 1 hour before serving

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 268: 100% Fruit "Cake"
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 seedless watermelon
• 2 cups strawberries
• hulled and sliced
• 1 cantaloupe - seeded
• peeled
• and sliced (Optional)
• 1 fresh pineapple - peeled
• cored
• and sliced (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. To create the base tier of the cake, cut 3 slices of watermelon, 1 to 2 inches thick, crossways through the center of the melon
2. Trim the rind from the watermelon slices, and place the largest slice onto a cake plate
3. Alternate layering sliced strawberries, slices of cantaloupe, and slices of fresh pineapple; follow with the second-largest watermelon slice
4. Repeat once more to make a layered fruit stack that looks like a cake
5. Thinly slice a few pieces of remaining melon and pineapple
6. With cookie cutters or a sharp knife, cut remaining fruit slices into decorative shapes
7. Decorate the cake tiers with the cut fruit shapes and remaining berries
8. Refrigerate until serving time
9. To serve, slice the cake with a sharp knife, one wedge at a time, and set the wedge onto a plate

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 18mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 59g 21%, Dietary Fiber 4g 16%, Total Sugars 48g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 120mg 602%, Calcium 59mg 5%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 934mg 20%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/218890/100-fruit-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 269: Watermelon Lime Agua Fresca
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 2 1/2 quarts
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Juice Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 cups water
• divided
• 5 cups peeled
• cubed
• and seeded watermelon
• ½ cup white sugar
• or more to taste
• ⅓ cup lime juice
• or more to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine 1 cup water, watermelon, and sugar in a blender; process until smooth
2. Pour into a large pitcher; stir in lime juice and remaining 7 cups water
3. Taste; adjust sugar or lime juice
4. Refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 7mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 16g 6%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 9mg 43%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 97mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/246117/watermelon-lime-agua-fresca/

============================================================

RECIPE 270: Watermelon Goat Cheese Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 serving
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• Ground pepper
• to taste
• 4 cups spring mix
• 4 cups seedless watermelon
• diced
• ½ (4 ounce) log Montchevre® honey goat cheese
• ½ cup hazelnuts
• chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, vinegar, salt, and pepper
2. In a large bowl, gently toss spring mix and watermelon together with vinaigrette
3. Top with goat cheese and hazelnuts to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 17%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 91mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 9g 3%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 13mg 65%, Calcium 31mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 240mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/265185/watermelon-goat-cheese-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 271: Watermelon Fruit Bowl
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 20 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Fruit/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 large watermelon
• 1 cantaloupe
• halved and seeded
• 1 honeydew melon
• halved and seeded
• 2 (15 ounce) cans mandarin oranges
• drained
• 2 (20 ounce) cans pineapple chunks
• drained
• 2 cups halved fresh strawberries
• 2 cups seedless grapes
• ½ cup water
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons grated lemon zest

DIRECTIONS:
1. With a large, sharp knife, remove the top 1/4 section of the watermelon
2. With a melon baller, scoop flesh from inside of watermelon, removing as many seeds as possible
3. Leave 1/2 inch of flesh inside the shell of the watermelon
4. Scoop cantaloupe and honeydew in the same manner, removing as much flesh as possible, and discarding the rinds
5. Refrigerate fruits separately until ready to assemble
6. In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, bring water and sugar to a boil
7. Remove from heat, and continue stirring until sugar has completely dissolved
8. Add lemon zest, and set aside to cool
9. To serve, place watermelon balls, cantaloupe, honeydew, oranges, pineapple, strawberries, and grapes, in a large mixing bowl
10. Pour syrup over, and toss thoroughly
11. Transfer mixture to watermelon bowl, and serve
12. Set aside any fruit mixture that will not fit
13. There will be enough fruit to refill the bowl

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 23mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 17%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 40g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 75mg 377%, Calcium 41mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 683mg 15%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/38521/watermelon-fruit-bowl/

============================================================

INGREDIENTS:

• seeded and cubed
• 4 cucumbers
• trimmed and cut into chunks
• 2 limes
• juiced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Run watermelon and cucumber pieces through a juicer following the manufacturer's instructions, and place the juice into a pitcher
2. Stir in lime juice, and serve
3. Melissa Goff

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 9mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 36mg 180%, Calcium 72mg 6%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 702mg 15%

RECIPE 273: Heavenly Honeydew Juice
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (5 pound) honeydew melon
• quartered and seeded
• 2 cups ice cubes
• 1 cup water
• 3 tablespoons white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Scrape flesh from honeydew melon quarters into a blender; add ice cubes, water, and sugar
2. Blend until smooth and sugar has dissolved
3. Serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 69mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 15%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 37g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 68mg 338%, Calcium 24mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 856mg 18%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/232448/heavenly-honeydew-juice/
