RECIPE 342: Lemon Meringue Cheesecake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 9-inch cake
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 5 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cheesecake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups shortbread cookie crumbs
• ¼ cup melted butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Make the crust: Mix cookie crumbs and melted butter together in a bowl until evenly combined; press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan
3. Make the filling: Beat cream cheese, sour cream, and sugar together in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy
4. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition
5. Mix in lemon juice, lemon zest, and vanilla until smooth, scraping the bottom and sides of the bowl as needed
6. Spread mixture over crust in the springform pan
7. Bake in the preheated oven until almost set in the center, about 1 hour
8. Let cool to room temperature, about 1 hour, then refrigerate until completely cooled, at least 3 to 4 hours
9. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
10. Make the meringue: Beat egg whites in a bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form
11. Beat in sugar and cream of tartar until mixture is glossy and stiff peaks form
12. Spread lemon curd over chilled cheesecake
13. Mound whipped egg whites over top and spread until curd is completely covered
14. Bake in the preheated oven until meringue is golden brown, about 10 minutes
15. Remove from the oven and chill, uncovered, in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or up to 1 day before serving
16. Don't cover the meringue or it may collapse

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 29g 37%, Saturated Fat 15g 77%, Cholesterol 130mg 43%, Sodium 305mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 52g 19%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 67mg 5%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 138mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/244929/lemon-meringue-cheesecake/

============================================================

RECIPE 343: Real Aioli
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 2/3 cup
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 large cloves fresh garlic
• peeled and sliced
• ½ teaspoon kosher salt
• or other course-grain salt
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• or more to taste
• ½ cup light
• extra-virgin olive oil
• 1 teaspoon water to adjust texture
• or more as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place garlic slices in a mortar with kosher salt
2. Mash with the pestle into a fine paste, 4 or 5 minutes
3. Mix in lemon juice
4. Add a teaspoon of olive oil; stir and mash until oil is incorporated
5. Add another teaspoon and mix in thoroughly
6. Continue incorporating olive oil, teaspoon by teaspoon, mashing and stirring until aioli thickens up
7. If the aioli gets thicker than you like, add a few drops of water

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 3g 13%, Sodium 161mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 1g 0%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 0g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 2mg 8%, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 15mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/255815/real-aioli/

============================================================

RECIPE 344: Amazing Lemon Scones
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 scones
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Scone Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• ⅓ cup white sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda
• ⅓ teaspoon salt
• ¾ cup cold butter
• cut into pieces
• 9 tablespoons milk
• 3 tablespoons lemon juice
• 2 ½ teaspoons lemon zest
• 1 ½ teaspoons vinegar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Make the scones: Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl
3. Cut in cold butter with 2 knives or a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs
4. Whisk milk, lemon juice, lemon zest, and vinegar in a small bowl; stir into flour mixture until dough is moistened
5. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead briefly, 5 or 6 turns
6. Pat or roll dough out into a 1-inch-thick round
7. Cut into 10 wedge-shaped pieces; arrange 1 inch apart on a baking sheet
8. Bake in the preheated oven until bottom edges are golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes
9. Cool scones on a wire rack for 15 minutes
10. Meanwhile, make the glaze: Stir confectioners' sugar, melted butter, lemon juice, and vanilla together in a bowl until smooth
11. Stir water into sugar mixture, 1 tablespoon at a time, to make a glaze; drizzle glaze over warm scones

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 26%, Saturated Fat 13g 65%, Cholesterol 54mg 18%, Sodium 488mg 21%, Total Carbohydrate 62g 23%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 5mg 23%, Calcium 70mg 5%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 79mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229571/amazing-lemon-scones/

============================================================

RECIPE 345: Baked Banana Chips
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 2 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 2.3/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Snacks/Snack Chip Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 just-ripe bananas
• sliced in 1/10-inch-thick rounds
• or more as needed
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 225 degrees F (110 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Spread banana slices out onto the prepared baking sheet, making sure slices are not touching
4. Brush with lemon juice
5. Bake in the preheated oven for 90 minutes
6. Check bananas, lifting slices up to separate from the paper once or twice
7. Continue baking until bananas are dried out, 30 to 90 minutes more
8. Let bananas cool until crispy, at least 5 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 27g 10%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 12mg 58%, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 426mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/261342/baked-banana-chips/

RECIPE 346: Lemon Garlic Chicken
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 3
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/Pan-Fried Chicken/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 3 skinless
• boneless chicken breast halves
• 1 ½ teaspoons salt
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground black pepper
• 2 tablespoons garlic powder
• divided
• 1 lemon
• juiced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat
2. Season chicken with salt and pepper; place in melted butter
3. Cook chicken, flipping frequently, until browned, about 5 minutes
4. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon garlic powder over chicken; cook for 2 minutes
5. Flip and sprinkle remaining 1 tablespoon garlic powder on the second side; cook for 2 minutes
6. Pour lemon juice over each side of chicken and cook until no longer pink in the center, 5 to 10 minutes more
7. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 13%, Saturated Fat 6g 28%, Cholesterol 85mg 28%, Sodium 1275mg 55%, Total Carbohydrate 5g 2%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 25g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 271mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/240993/lemon-garlic-chicken/

RECIPE 347: Slow Cooker Lemon Garlic Chicken
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 3 hrs 15 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon dried oregano
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 2 pounds skinless
• boneless chicken breast halves
• ¼ cup water
• 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
• 2 cloves garlic
• minced
• 1 teaspoon chicken bouillon granules
• 1 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix together oregano, salt, and pepper in a small bowl
2. Rub spice mixture all over chicken breasts
3. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat
4. Cook chicken in butter until lightly browned, 3 to 5 minutes per side
5. Place chicken in a slow cooker
6. Mix water, lemon juice, garlic, and bouillon in the same skillet; bring to boil
7. Pour over chicken in the slow cooker
8. Cover and cook on Low for 6 hours or High for 3 hours
9. Add parsley to the slow cooker 15 to 30 minutes before the end of cook time
10. Rebekah Pope

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Cholesterol 88mg 29%, Sodium 348mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 1g 0%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 0g, Protein 30g, Vitamin C 4mg 21%, Calcium 22mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 212mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/18032/slow-cooker-lemon-garlic-chicken-ii/

============================================================

RECIPE 348: Pear Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 64
Yield: 8 half-pint jars
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 ½ cups mashed ripe pears
• ¼ cup lemon juice
• 3 tablespoons powdered fruit pectin
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground cloves
• ½ teaspoon ground allspice
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 7 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 teaspoon butter
• 8 half-pint canning jars with lids and rings
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix pears, lemon juice, fruit pectin, cinnamon, cloves, allspice, and nutmeg in a large heavy pot; bring to a boil, stirring constantly
2. Add sugar all at once, stirring, and bring back to a full rolling boil
3. Boil for 1 minute
4. Mix in butter to settle foam
5. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
6. Pack the pear jam into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
7. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
8. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
9. Top with lids, and screw-on rings
10. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
11. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder
12. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
13. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
14. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process for 10 minutes
15. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
16. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
17. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Cholesterol 0mg 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Potassium 16mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228625/pear-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 349: Refreshing Cucumber Lemonade
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Lemonade Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup water
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 cucumber
• sliced
• 6 lemons
• juiced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make the simple syrup: Combine water and sugar together in a saucepan over medium heat; heat until just about to boil and sugar has dissolved
2. Place in refrigerator until cool, about 30 minutes
3. Blend cucumber in a blender or food processor until mashed into a pulp
4. Pour cucumber pulp into a fine mesh strainer placed over a bowl; allow to sit until you have about 2/3 cup of cucumber juice in the bowl, about 15 minutes
5. Stir simple syrup, cucumber juice, and lemon juice together in a pitcher
6. Serve cold

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 8mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 46g 17%, Dietary Fiber 8g 29%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 131mg 657%, Calcium 116mg 9%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 348mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/197751/refreshing-cucumber-lemonade/

============================================================

RECIPE 350: Air-Fried Crumbed Fish
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 fillets
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Seafood/Fish/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup dry bread crumbs
• ¼ cup vegetable oil
• 4 flounder fillets
• 1 egg
• beaten
• 1 lemon
• sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an air fryer to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)
2. Place bread crumbs and oil into a shallow bowl; stir until mixture becomes loose and crumbly
3. Dip fish fillets into egg; shake off any excess
4. Dip fillets into bread crumb mixture; coat evenly and fully
5. Lay coated fillets gently in the air fryer basket; cook in the preheated air fryer until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 12 minutes
6. Garnish with lemon slices; serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 3g 16%, Cholesterol 107mg 36%, Sodium 309mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 27g, Vitamin C 22mg 108%, Calcium 89mg 7%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 415mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/260624/air-fried-crumbed-fish/

RECIPE 351: Mom's Peach Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Peach Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups sliced fresh peaches
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup brown sugar
• ½ cup cold butter
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup rolled oats

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Arrange sliced peaches evenly in an 8x8-inch baking dish
3. Mix flour, brown sugar, butter, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl using a pastry cutter until crumbly
4. Fold oats into flour mixture; sprinkle mixture evenly over peaches, pressing down lightly
5. Bake in the preheated oven until crispy and golden brown on top, about 30 minutes
6. Dotdash Meredith Food Studio

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 162mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 27mg 137%, Calcium 32mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 89mg 2%

RECIPE 352: Peach Pie the Old Fashioned Two Crust Way
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Peach Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (14.1 ounce) package pastry for a double-crust 9-inch pie
• 1 egg
• beaten
• 5 cups sliced peeled peaches
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 2 tablespoons butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Line the bottom and sides of a 9-inch pie plate with one pie crust
3. Lightly brush crust with egg to prevent dough from becoming soggy later
4. Set second crust aside
5. Place peaches in a large bowl, sprinkle with lemon juice, and mix gently
6. Mix together sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt in a separate bowl
7. Pour over peaches and mix until combined
8. Pour into pie crust and dot with butter
9. Cover filling with remaining pie crust
10. Flute the edges to seal or use a fork dipped in egg to press them down
11. Brush remaining egg on top, then cut several slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape
12. Bake pie in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
13. Reduce the heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until crust is brown and juice begins to bubble through the vents, 30 to 35 more minutes
14. If the edges brown too fast, cover them with strips of aluminum foil about halfway through baking
15. Cool pie for 15 minutes before slicing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 25%, Saturated Fat 6g 31%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 358mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 59g 21%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 36mg 180%, Calcium 22mg 2%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 81mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/87979/peach-pie-the-old-fashioned-two-crust-way/

============================================================

RECIPE 353: Peach Dump Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cake Mix Cake Recipes/Dump Cake/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 (16 ounce) cans peaches in heavy syrup
• 1 (18.25 ounce) package yellow cake mix
• ½ cup butter
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Empty peaches into a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. Cover peaches with dry cake mix and press down firmly
4. Cut butter into small pieces and scatter on top of cake mix
5. Sprinkle top with cinnamon
6. Bake in the preheated oven until top of cake is golden brown, about 45 minutes
7. Munni Alexander

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 11mg 4%, Sodium 171mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 32mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 53mg 1%

RECIPE 354: Quick and Easy Peach Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 cobbler
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Cobblers/Peach Cobbler Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• melted
• 1 cup self-rising flour
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup milk
• 2 (16 ounce) cans sliced peaches in heavy syrup

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Mix self-rising flour, sugar, and milk together in a bowl until well combined and no lumps remain
3. Pour melted butter into a 9- or 10-inch cast iron skillet
4. Pour flour-milk mixture over top
5. Carefully pour peaches and syrup into the skillet
6. Use a spatula to spread peaches evenly around the pan
7. Bake in the preheated oven until the crust turns golden brown, 30 to 45 minutes
8. Remove from the oven and let cool for about 10 minutes before serving
9. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 22mg 7%, Sodium 201mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 61mg 5%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 110mg 2%

RECIPE 356: Old Fashioned Peach Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 1 9x13-inch dish
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 4 tablespoons white sugar
• divided
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 cup shortening
• 1 large egg
• ¼ cup cold water
• 1 tablespoon butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make crust: Sift together flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt in a medium bowl
2. Work in shortening with a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs
3. Whisk together egg and cold water in a small bowl
4. Sprinkle over flour mixture; work with hands to form dough into a ball
5. Wrap with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes
6. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
7. Roll out 1/2 of the chilled dough to 1/8-inch thickness
8. Place in a 9x13-inch baking dish, covering the bottom and halfway up the sides
9. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes
10. Make filling: Mix peaches, orange juice, and lemon juice in a large saucepan
11. Add butter and cook over medium-low heat until butter is melted
12. Stir together sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a bowl; mix into peach mixture until combined
13. Pour into baked crust
14. Roll remaining dough to 1/4-inch thickness
15. Cut into 1/2-inch-wide strips
16. Weave strips into a lattice over peaches
17. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon sugar, then drizzle with melted butter
18. Bake in the preheated oven until top crust is golden brown, 35 to 40 minutes
19. Danielle K

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 26mg 9%, Sodium 177mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 44g 16%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 31mg 156%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 69mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/19897/old-fashioned-peach-cobbler/

============================================================

RECIPE 357: Classic Bisquick Peach Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 8x8-inch dish
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Everyday Cooking/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup Original Bisquick® mix
• 1 cup milk
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ cup butter or margarine
• melted
• 1 (29 ounce) can sliced peaches
• drained
• 1 cup sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Stir together Bisquick mix, milk, and nutmeg in an ungreased 8x8-inch baking dish
3. Stir in melted butter or margarine until blended
4. Stir together peaches and sugar in a bowl until combined; spoon over batter
5. Bake in the preheated oven until golden, 50 to 60 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 25%, Saturated Fat 11g 56%, Cholesterol 44mg 15%, Sodium 383mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 63g 23%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 50g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 91mg 7%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 266mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234261/classic-bisquick-peach-cobbler/

RECIPE 359: Easy Batter Fruit Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 55 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 tablespoons butter
• ¾ cup all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup sugar
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ¾ cup milk
• 2 cups of sliced fresh peaches or nectarines
• or whole blueberries
• strawberries
• raspberries
• blackberries or a combination of fruits (or a 12-ounce package of frozen berries)
• 1 tablespoon sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Adjust the oven rack to the upper-middle position
3. Put butter in an 8-inch square or 9-inch round pan; place in the oven until butter is melted
4. Remove the pan from the oven and set aside
5. Whisk flour, 3/4 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl
6. Whisk in milk until a smooth batter forms
7. Pour batter into the prepared pan, then scatter fruit over batter
8. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon sugar
9. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is lightly browned and fruit bubbles, 50 to 60 minutes
10. Serve warm or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 16%, Saturated Fat 8g 40%, Cholesterol 34mg 11%, Sodium 371mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 65g 24%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 47g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 28mg 138%, Calcium 136mg 10%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 119mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/88354/easy-batter-fruit-cobbler/

============================================================

RECIPE 360: Peach Preserves
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 64
Yield: 8 cups
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 12 fresh peaches
• pitted and chopped
• 4 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 (2 ounce) package dry pectin

DIRECTIONS:
1. Crush 1 cup of chopped peaches in the bottom of a large saucepan
2. Add remaining peaches and set the pan over medium-low heat
3. Bring to a low boil and cook until peaches become liquid with a few bits of peach left, about 20 minutes
4. Pour cooked peaches into a bowl, then measure 6 cups peaches back into the pan
5. Add sugar and bring to a boil over medium heat
6. Gradually stir in dry pectin; boil for 1 minute
7. Remove from heat and transfer to hot, sterilized jars
8. Top with lids and screw rings on tightly
9. Process in a hot water bath canner for 10 minutes
10. Let cool, then store on a shelf in a cool, dark place

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 6%, Total Sugars 15g, Vitamin C 8mg 39%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Potassium 6mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/21351/peach-preserves/

============================================================

RECIPE 361: Georgia Peach Homemade Ice Cream
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 32
Yield: 1 gallon
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 4 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ pounds fresh peaches - peeled
• pitted and chopped
• 1 pint half-and-half cream
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 cups whole milk
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Working in batches, purée peaches with half-and-half and sugar in a blender or food processor
2. Mix together peach mixture, sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla in a gallon ice cream freezer container
3. Pour enough whole milk into the container to reach the fill line, about 2 cups
4. Pour mixture into an ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes
5. Transfer to an airtight container and freeze until firm, about 4 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 42mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 12mg 61%, Calcium 104mg 8%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 135mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/38236/georgia-peach-homemade-ice-cream/

============================================================

RECIPE 362: Easy Peach Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• room temperature
• 1 cup self-rising flour
• 1 cup milk
• 1 (15 ounce) can peaches

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. In a one-quart baking dish or 9 inch square pan, cream together sugar and butter
3. Mix in flour and milk until smooth
4. Pour peaches and their juice over the top
5. Bake 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 363: Peach Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 16 muffins
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 ¼ cups vegetable oil
• 3 eggs
• lightly beaten
• 2 cups white sugar
• 2 cups peeled
• pitted
• and chopped peaches

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease the bottoms and sides of 16 muffin cups, or line with paper liners
3. In a large bowl, mix the flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt
4. In a separate bowl, mix the oil, eggs, and sugar
5. Stir the oil mixture into the flour mixture just until moist
6. Fold in the peaches
7. Spoon into the prepared muffin cups
8. Bake 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean
9. Cool 10 minutes before turning out onto wire racks to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 3g 15%, Cholesterol 35mg 12%, Sodium 238mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 44g 16%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 7mg 35%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 45mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/74658/peach-muffins/

============================================================

RECIPE 364: Peach Pie with Frozen Peaches
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 peach pie
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Peach Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 sheets refrigerated pie crust
• 2 teaspoons all-purpose flour
• or as needed
• 2 pounds sliced frozen peaches
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• 1 large egg
• beaten
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 1 tablespoon coarse sparkling sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Allow pie crusts to sit at room temperature about 15 minutes if recommended by manufacturer
2. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
3. Remove plastic packaging from pie crusts and gently unroll one piece on a floured work surface
4. Dust the dough with flour on both sides
5. Fit the dough inside a 9-inch pie pan, shaping and gently stretching it to the top edge of the pie pan
6. Stir together frozen peach slices, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl (see note.) Pour peach mixture into the unbaked pie crust and gently level out the top of the peaches with the back of a spoon
7. Peach slices will still be frozen
8. Gently unroll the second piece of dough on the floured work surface
9. Fit the second dough circle on top of the peaches, and allow an even amount to hang over the edge of the pan, all the way around
10. Brush the top of the pie with beaten egg, discarding any excess egg
11. Fold the edges of the top crust under, using the edge of the pan for a guide
12. Press the top crust and the bottom crust together to form a crimped edge
13. Lightly cover the crimped edge of the pie with strips of aluminum foil or with pie crust shields, to prevent over-browning
14. Cut several slits in the top crust with a sharp knife
15. Sprinkle sparkling sugar over the crust
16. Place the pie on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven until the pie is browned and bubbly, about 1 hour
17. Cool on a rack about 30 minutes and serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 23mg 8%, Sodium 304mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 37mg 185%, Calcium 20mg 2%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 71mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/284448/peach-pie-with-frozen-peaches/

============================================================

RECIPE 365: Award Winning Peaches and Cream Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 10 - inch pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Peach Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 (3 ounce) package non-instant vanilla pudding mix
• 3 tablespoons butter
• softened
• 1 egg
• ½ cup milk
• 1 (29 ounce) can sliced peaches
• drained and syrup reserved
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease sides and bottom of a 10 inch deep-dish pie pan
3. In a medium mixing bowl, mix together flour, salt, baking powder and pudding mix
4. Mix in butter, egg and milk
5. Beat for 2 minutes
6. Pour mixture into pie pan
7. Arrange the peach slices on top of the pudding mixture
8. In a small mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy
9. Add 1/2 cup sugar and 3 tablespoons reserved peach syrup
10. Beat for 2 minutes
11. Spoon mixture over peaches to within 1 inch of pan edge
12. Mix together 1 tablespoon sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and sprinkle over top
13. Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, until golden brown
14. Chill before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 9g 47%, Cholesterol 67mg 22%, Sodium 422mg 18%, Total Carbohydrate 54g 20%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 42g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 84mg 6%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 169mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15142/award-winning-peaches-and-cream-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 366: Peaches and Cream, Literally
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 fresh peaches
• or as needed
• ⅓ cup white sugar
• or to taste
• ¼ cup water
• 1 ½ cups heavy cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Cut each peach in half along the crease, twist open, and remove the pit
2. Peel and slice
3. Cut slices in half to get roughly 2 cups of sliced peaches
4. Bring sugar and water to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat
5. Boil until a syrup forms, about 3 minutes
6. Stir in peaches until coated
7. Bring syrup back to a light simmer, about 1 minute
8. Immediately remove from heat and pour mixture into a bowl
9. Transfer peaches into a large bowl using a slotted spoon
10. Pour in heavy cream and stir to combine
11. Divide mixture between serving glasses, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until completely chilled and cream has absorbed all the peach flavor, at least 3 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 33g 42%, Saturated Fat 21g 103%, Cholesterol 122mg 41%, Sodium 38mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 42mg 212%, Calcium 70mg 5%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 100mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/274821/peaches-and-cream-literally/

============================================================

RECIPE 367: Nana's Southern Pickled Peaches
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 40
Yield: 5 quarts
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 13 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups white sugar
• 1 cup white vinegar
• 1 cup water
• 2 tablespoons whole cloves
• 4 pounds fresh clingstone peaches
• blanched and peeled
• 5 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks

DIRECTIONS:
1. Inspect 5 quart-sized jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones
2. Immerse in simmering water until peaches are ready
3. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water
4. At the same time, combine sugar, vinegar and water in a large pot, bring to a boil
5. Boil until syrupy, about 5 minutes
6. While the sugar mixture is boiling, press 1 to 2 cloves into each peach
7. Place peaches into the boiling syrup
8. Boil until peaches are tender, about 20 minutes
9. Spoon peaches into hot, sterilized jars, and top with liquid, filling to within 1/2 inch of the rim
10. Insert a cinnamon stick in each jar
11. Wipe the rims with a clean dry cloth, and seal with lids and rings
12. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
13. Bring to a boil and lower jars 2 inches apart into the boiling water using a holder
14. Pour in more boiling water to cover jars by at least 1 inch
15. Bring to a rolling boil, cover, and process for 10 minutes to seal, or consult times recommended by your local extension
16. Remove the jars from the stockpot and let rest, several inches apart, for 12 to 24 hours
17. Press the center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down
18. Remove the rings for storage and store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 15mg 73%, Calcium 11mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 14mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/72126/nanas-southern-pickled-peaches/

============================================================

RECIPE 368: Blueberry and Peach Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 9
Yield: 1 8-inch square dish
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen sliced peaches(such as Cascadian Farm®)
• thawed and drained
• 1 (10 ounce) package frozen blueberries(such as Cascadian Farm®)
• thawed and drained
• 2 teaspoons lemon juice
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 2 tablespoons white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Gently stir peaches, blueberries, and lemon juice together in an 8-inch square baking dish
3. Stir 2 tablespoons flour and white sugar into the fruit mixture
4. Stir oats, brown sugar, 1/4 cup flour, almonds, cinnamon, and nutmeg together in a small bowl
5. Mash butter into the oats mixture with a pastry cutter or a fork until the mixture is crumbly; sprinkle over the fruit to cover
6. Bake in preheated oven until the fruit is bubbling and the topping is golden brown, about 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 43mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 61mg 304%, Calcium 27mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 164mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/239090/blueberry-and-peach-crisp/

============================================================

RECIPE 369: Easy Peach Cobbler with Canned Peaches
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cobbler
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 3.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Cobblers/Peach Cobbler Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 (29 ounce) cans sliced peaches in juice
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 cup sugar
• ¾ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 1 cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Pour peaches and juice into a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. Combine flour, sugar, and butter in a bowl; mix and knead with hands until crumbly
4. Sprinkle over the peaches, then scatter pecans over top
5. Bake in the preheated oven until topping is golden brown and peaches are bubbly, 45 minutes to 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 23mg 8%, Sodium 6mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 177mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/285159/easy-peach-cobbler-with-canned-peaches/

RECIPE 370: Easy Fruit Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch cobbler
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¾ cup milk
• ¼ cup butter
• 2 cups sliced fresh peaches

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Melt butter in a 9 x 9 inch baking dish
3. Blend together flour, baking powder, sugar, and milk
4. Pour batter in baking dish over the butter
5. Sprinkle fruit on top of the batter, do not stir
6. Bake for 1 hour or until golden brown

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 174mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 34g 12%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 14mg 69%, Calcium 102mg 8%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 64mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12148/easy-fruit-cobbler/

RECIPE 371: Butter Biscuit Peach Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 (29 ounce) cans peaches
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ½ cup brown sugar
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon nutmeg
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 (16 ounce) can refrigerated buttermilk biscuit dough (such as Pillsbury Grands!®)
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon
• 1 pinch white sugar
• 1 pinch ground nutmeg
• 1 pastry for a 9-inch pie crust

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Mix peaches, 3/4 cup white sugar, brown sugar, butter, cornstarch, vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, and salt in a large pot over medium heat; cook and stir until sugars are dissolved and butter is melted, about 5 minutes
3. Sprinkle each biscuit with 1 pinch cinnamon, 1 pinch white sugar, and 1 pinch nutmeg
4. Flatten biscuits on a lightly floured surface using a rolling pin
5. Cut each flattened biscuit into 12 to 15 small squares; stir into peach mixture
6. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 10 minutes
7. Pour peach-biscuit mixture into a 9x13-inch baking dish and allow to thicken for 2 to 3 minutes; cover or decorate with pie crust
8. Cover dish with a sheet of aluminum foil and place dish on a baking sheet
9. Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, 45 minutes to 1 hour
10. Cool before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 9g 45%, Cholesterol 25mg 8%, Sodium 552mg 24%, Total Carbohydrate 73g 27%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 46g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 6mg 30%, Calcium 50mg 4%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 313mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234306/butter-biscuit-peach-cobbler/

============================================================

RECIPE 372: Easy Peach Cobbler with Cake Mix
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 12 fresh peaches
• pitted and sliced
• 1 cup water
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 (18.25 ounce) package white cake mix
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• ½ cup butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread peach slices evenly into a 9x13 inch baking dish
3. If using canned peach juice, pour 1 cup of it over peach slices
4. If using fresh peaches, combine water and sugar in a small bowl
5. Stir to dissolve, then pour mixture over peaches
6. Sprinkle cinnamon over peach slices, followed by dry cake mix
7. Top cake mix with pats of cream cheese
8. Dot cobbler with butter or margarine
9. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes, until golden

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 10g 49%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 397mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 21%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 46g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 42mg 210%, Calcium 112mg 9%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 108mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15046/easy-peach-cobbler-with-cake-mix/

RECIPE 373: GA Peach Pound Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 to 10 - inch tube pan
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup butter or margarine
• softened
• 2 cups white sugar
• 4 eggs
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 2 cups fresh peaches
• pitted and chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Butter a 10 inch tube pan and coat with white sugar
3. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy
4. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well with each addition, then stir in the vanilla
5. Reserve 1/4 cup of flour for later, and sift together the remaining flour, baking powder and salt
6. Gradually stir into the creamed mixture
7. Use the reserved flour to coat the chopped peaches, then fold the floured peaches into the batter
8. Spread evenly into the prepared pan
9. Bake for 60 to 70 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean
10. Allow cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, before inverting onto a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 77mg 26%, Sodium 196mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 44g 16%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 7mg 34%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 52mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17635/ga-peach-pound-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 374: White Peachy Sangria
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 20 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Sangria Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 (750 milliliter) bottles moscato wine
• 4 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite®)
• 1 cup brandy
• 1 cup peach schnapps
• 2 fresh peaches
• pitted and sliced
• 1 (16 ounce) package fresh strawberries
• sliced
• 2 mangos - peeled
• seeded
• and sliced
• ½ fresh pineapple - peeled
• cored
• and cut into chunks
• 1 (6 ounce) container fresh raspberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir moscato wine, lemon-lime soda, brandy, peach schnapps, peaches, strawberries, mangos, pineapple chunks, and raspberries together in a large container and chill 8 hours or overnight

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 24mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 30mg 148%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 228mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/223329/white-peachy-sangria/

RECIPE 375: Southern Peach Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup butter
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¾ cup self-rising flour
• ¾ cup milk
• 1 (29 ounce) can sliced peaches in light syrup

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Place butter in a deep 2 quart baking dish and place in oven to melt
3. In a medium bowl, mix sugar and flour
4. Stir in milk, a little at a time, until wholly incorporated
5. Pour carefully over melted butter in dish
6. Spoon peaches and syrup over batter
7. Bake in preheated oven 35 to 45 minutes, until crust is puffed and golden

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 8g 38%, Cholesterol 32mg 11%, Sodium 245mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 50g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 40g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 73mg 6%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 151mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/22778/southern-peach-cobbler/

RECIPE 376: Peach Ice Cream
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 32
Yield: 4 quarts
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 4 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 large eggs
• beaten
• 3 ½ cups white sugar
• 10 fresh peaches
• pitted and chopped
• 4 cups heavy cream
• 2 cups half-and-half cream
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• ¾ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix together eggs and sugar in a large bowl until smooth; purée peaches in a blender or food processor and stir 5 cups purée into egg mixture
2. Stir in cream, half-and-half, vanilla, and salt, and mix well
3. Pour mixture into an ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes
4. Transfer to an airtight container and freeze until firm, about 4 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 8g 41%, Cholesterol 81mg 27%, Sodium 86mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Total Sugars 24g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 13mg 67%, Calcium 44mg 3%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 66mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/20120/peach-ice-cream/

============================================================

RECIPE 377: Crisp Peach Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 large fresh peaches
• pitted and cut into eighths
• 1 lemon
• zested and juiced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Place a baking sheet on the rack under the middle rack to catch drips
3. Generously butter a 2-inch deep (2-quart) baking dish
4. Place peach sections into prepared baking dish
5. Sprinkle with lemon juice and zest
6. Stir butter and sugar together in a mixing bowl
7. Mix until creamed and resembles a sugary, buttery paste, 4 to 5 minutes
8. Add oats and flour; stir until flour and oats are incorporated into the butter-sugar mixture and mixture resembles coarse crumbs, 4 to 5 minutes
9. Pour in milk; stir until mixture is wet and creamy, like a thick spreadable batter, 3 to 4 minutes
10. Drop batter by spoonful on top of the peaches
11. Spread batter evenly over the surface of the peaches
12. Sprinkle 1/4 cup sugar on the batter
13. Spritz with water until sugar is wet and surface glistens
14. Bake in preheated oven on middle rack until browned and crispy, about 45 minutes
15. Let cool at least 30 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 16%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 33mg 11%, Sodium 279mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 62g 23%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 45g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 43mg 214%, Calcium 111mg 9%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 105mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/259043/crisp-peach-cobbler/

============================================================

RECIPE 378: Baked Peaches 'n Cream
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 teaspoons brown sugar
• 2 tablespoons butter
• cut into 8 pieces
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon
• or more to taste
• 4 ripe peaches
• halved and pitted
• 4 scoops vanilla ice cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Arrange brown sugar, 1 teaspoon per peach, in a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. Top each brown sugar mound with a piece of butter and a sprinkle of cinnamon
4. Place a peach half, cut-side down, on top of brown sugar-butter
5. Bake in the preheated oven until peaches are soft, 15 to 20 minutes
6. Plate 2 warm peaches per serving and top with 1 scoop vanilla ice cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 25mg 8%, Sodium 63mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 42mg 210%, Calcium 48mg 4%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 85mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/241994/baked-peaches-n-cream/

RECIPE 379: Peach and Blackberry Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch dish
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups peeled and sliced fresh peaches
• 1 cup fresh blackberries
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• ½ cup butter
• melted
• 1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Mix peaches, blackberries, 1/4 cup sugar, cinnamon, and lemon juice in a bowl
3. Pour butter into a 9x13-inch glass baking dish and evenly coat the bottom and sides
4. Whisk flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl; mix in milk, stirring just to moisten dry ingredients
5. Pour batter into prepared baking dish and distribute fruit mixture evenly over the batter
6. Bake in the preheated oven until cobbler is golden brown, about 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 22mg 7%, Sodium 243mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 21mg 107%, Calcium 84mg 6%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 83mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/223305/peach-and-blackberry-cobbler/

RECIPE 380: Freezer Peach Pie Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 55 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fillings/Fruit Fillings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups sliced peaches
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• 1 tablespoon MINUTE Tapioca
• 1 dash Dash of nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place sliced peaches in a bowl with sugar, cornstarch, tapioca, and nutmeg
2. Toss until evenly coated and sugar is mostly dissolved
3. Transfer peaches to a 9 inch foil-lined pie plate
4. Cover with another piece of foil and freeze immediately to prevent peaches from discoloring
5. Once frozen solid, remove peaches from pie plate, with foil, and transfer to a zipper locked plastic bag for later use
6. When ready to use, line a pie plate with prepared crust and place frozen peaches on top
7. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
8. Bake in the preheated oven on the bottom rack for 20 minutes
9. Lower heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue baking for another 30 to 35 minutes, or until completely warmed through

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 2mg 10%, Calcium 5mg 0%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 171mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/75611/freezer-peach-pie-filling/

RECIPE 382: Peach Cake II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 1 - 9x13 inch pan
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 egg
• beaten
• 1 ¾ cups white sugar
• 1 cup vegetable oil
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 2 cups fresh peaches - peeled
• pitted
• and sliced
• ½ cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan
3. In a large bowl, combine the eggs, sugar, oil, flour, salt, cinnamon, baking soda, peaches and pecans
4. Mix thoroughly by hand
5. Pour into prepared 9x13 inch pan and bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 50 minutes or until done

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 23mg 8%, Sodium 159mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 5mg 23%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 33mg 1%

RECIPE 383: Peach Upside Down Cake I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 9
Yield: 8 inch square cake
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup butter
• ½ cup packed light brown sugar
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 5 fresh peaches - peeled
• pitted and halved
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• 1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Melt 1/4 cup butter or margarine in an 8-inch square pan
3. Sprinkle with brown sugar and nutmeg
4. Arrange peach halves, cut side down, in pan
5. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy
6. Beat in egg
7. Stir together flour, baking powder and salt
8. Add flour mixture to creamed mixture alternately with milk, beating well after each addition
9. Spread batter over peaches
10. Bake in preheated oven until lightly browned on top, 35 to 40 minutes
11. Remove cake from oven, and let stand in pan for 5 minutes; invert onto serving platter

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 21%, Saturated Fat 10g 51%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 366mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 23mg 117%, Calcium 103mg 8%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 86mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7446/peach-upside-down-cake-i/

RECIPE 384: Peach Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Peach Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 fresh peaches
• pitted and sliced
• ⅓ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¼ cup butter
• 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix flour, sugar and butter into crumb stage
2. Place one crust in the bottom of a 9 inch pie plate
3. Line the shell with some sliced peaches
4. Sprinkle some of the butter mixture on top of the peaches, then put more peaches on top of the the crumb mixture
5. Continue layering until both the peaches and crumbs are gone
6. Top with lattice strips of pie crust
7. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes, or until crust is golden
8. Allow pie to cool before slicing
9. Best when eaten fresh

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 280mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 52mg 262%, Calcium 22mg 2%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 77mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12347/peach-pie/

RECIPE 385: Best Peach Cobbler Ever
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cobbler
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (29 ounce) can sliced peaches
• 2 tablespoons butter
• melted
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon
• 1 pinch ground nutmeg
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• ½ cup water
• 1 cup milk
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 pinch salt
• ½ cup butter
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C.) In a large bowl, combine sliced peaches with juice, 2 tablespoons melted butter, a pinch of cinnamon and a pinch of nutmeg
2. Dissolve cornstarch in water, then stir into peach mixture; set aside
3. In another bowl, combine milk, sugar, flour, baking powder and salt
4. Beat until smooth - mixture will be thin
5. Melt 1/2 cup butter in a 9x13 inch pan
6. Pour batter over melted butter
7. Spoon peaches over batter
8. Sprinkle top with additional cinnamon and nutmeg
9. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour, or until knife inserted comes out clean

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 18mg 6%, Sodium 138mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 2mg 10%, Calcium 51mg 4%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 128mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12320/best-peach-cobbler-ever/

============================================================

RECIPE 386: Peach Cobbler VI
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9x9-inch cobbler
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup brown sugar
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ¾ cup milk
• ½ cup margarine
• melted
• 1 (29 ounce) can sliced canned peaches
• drained
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x9-inch baking dish
3. In a large bowl, combine flour, brown sugar, white sugar, baking powder, salt, and vanilla
4. Pour milk into dry ingredients, and then stir in melted margarine
5. Mix thoroughly
6. Pour mixture into prepared baking pan
7. Arrange peaches on top and sprinkle with cinnamon
8. Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, about 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 383mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 100mg 8%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 201mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/18469/peach-cobbler-vi/

RECIPE 387: Easy Stovetop Peach Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (29 ounce) can sliced peaches
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon (Optional)
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 (9 ounce) package yellow cake mix
• 4 teaspoons margarine

DIRECTIONS:
1. Discard 1/2 of the juice from the peaches and pour the rest into a saucepan
2. Sprinkle the top with cinnamon and sugar
3. Empty the cake mix on top of the peaches in an even layer
4. Place the margarine on top of the cake mix in the center
5. Cover sauce pan with a lid and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat
6. Once you see steam escaping the saucepan, reduce heat to medium-low, and continue cooking for 10 minutes
7. Do not lift the lid during this time! Remove from heat and allow to stand with the lid on for 15 minutes before serving
8. The cake mix should look like dumplings

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 1mg 0%, Sodium 311mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 41g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 74mg 6%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 213mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/139349/easy-stovetop-peach-cobbler/

RECIPE 388: Single Crust Peach Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Peach Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons butter
• softened
• ⅓ cup all-purpose flour
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 6 fresh peaches - pitted
• skinned
• and sliced
• 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch single crust pie

DIRECTIONS:
1. Cream sugar and butter or margarine together
2. Add flour and nutmeg; mix until mealy
3. Spread 1/2 of mixture in pie crust
4. Arrange peaches on top of crumb mixture
5. Sprinkle remaining crumb mixture on top of peaches
6. Bake at 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) for ten minutes
7. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
8. Continue baking for 40 minutes, or until brown

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 140mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 31mg 157%, Calcium 13mg 1%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 46mg 1%

RECIPE 389: Fresh Peach Cobbler I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 4 cups sliced fresh peaches
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Combine 1/2 cup sugar, cornstarch, and cinnamon in a saucepan and whisk to mix
3. Stir in sliced peaches (see Editor's Note) and lemon juice, tossing until peaches are evenly coated
4. Cook filling over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and boils
5. Boil 1 minute
6. Pour mixture into an ungreased 2-quart casserole dish
7. Keep mixture hot in oven while you make the topping
8. In a medium bowl combine flour, 1 tablespoon sugar, baking powder, and salt
9. Mix thoroughly, then cut in shortening until mixture looks like fine crumbs
10. Add milk and stir until mixture is evenly moistened
11. Remove peach filling from oven and drop dough onto peaches in 6 equal-size spoonfuls
12. Return cobbler to oven and bake until topping is golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 328mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 37mg 185%, Calcium 106mg 8%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 83mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15148/fresh-peach-cobbler-i/

RECIPE 390: Marie's Peach Dump Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins

Rating: 4.3/5

• undrained

• sliced into pats
• or more if needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with margarine
3. Pour peaches and heavy syrup into the prepared baking dish
4. Spread cake mix evenly over peaches
5. Arrange butter pats in even rows on the cake mix

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 391: Peachy Bread Pudding with Caramel Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 - 9x13 inch baking dish
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Bread Pudding Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups fresh peaches - peeled
• pitted and halved
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 3 eggs
• lightly beaten
• 1 ¼ cups hot water
• ¼ cup butter
• melted
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 4 cups French bread
• torn into small pieces

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. Chop the peaches and lightly mash them in a mixing bowl
4. Combine the sweetened condensed milk and the eggs; add them to the peaches and mix well
5. Stir in the hot water, melted butter, cinnamon, and vanilla
6. Stir the French bread into to the custard mixture until the bread is completely moistened
7. Turn the pudding into the prepared baking dish
8. Bake until a knife inserted in the center of the pudding comes out clean, about 1 hour and 10 minutes
9. While the pudding is baking, combine the brown sugar, 1/2 cup butter, corn syrup, and rum in a saucepan
10. Bring to a boil over medium heat and simmer for 3 to 4 minutes or until just slightly thickened
11. Let cool slightly
12. Remove the pudding from the oven and let it cool for about ten minutes before serving
13. Serve warm with the caramel sauce
14. Cool and cover any leftover pudding and store it in the refrigerator

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 25%, Saturated Fat 12g 58%, Cholesterol 106mg 35%, Sodium 450mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 61g 22%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 36g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 12mg 61%, Calcium 158mg 12%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 249mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/174599/peachy-bread-pudding-with-caramel-sauce/

RECIPE 392: Peach and Tomato Caprese Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
• 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
• 1 teaspoon flaked salt
• divided
• 2 large heirloom tomatoes
• thinly sliced
• 2 ripe peaches - halved
• pitted
• and sliced into half moons
• 6 leaves fresh basil
• 1 (8 ounce) ball fresh mozzarella
• thinly sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and 1 pinch flaked salt together in a bowl until dressing is smooth
2. Alternate tomato slices, peach slices, basil leaves, and mozzarella slices in layers on a platter
3. Drizzle dressing over salad and sprinkle remaining flaked salt on top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 9g 46%, Cholesterol 45mg 15%, Sodium 569mg 25%, Total Carbohydrate 8g 3%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 11g, Vitamin C 33mg 163%, Calcium 341mg 26%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 237mg 5%

RECIPE 393: Baked Peaches
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (16 ounce) package frozen peach slices
• ⅓ cup brown sugar substitute
• ¼ cup pecans
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread peach slices into a baking dish in a single layer
3. Stir brown sugar substitute, pecans, flour, and vanilla extract together; spread over the peach slices
4. Bake in preheated oven until the peaches are heated through, 20 to 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Sodium 11mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 21g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 71mg 357%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 120mg 3%

RECIPE 394: Banana Peach Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 5x9-inch loaf
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Breakfast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• 1 tablespoon instant hot chocolate mix
• 3 bananas
• peeled
• 1 large fresh peach - peeled
• pitted
• and diced
• ¼ cup milk
• 2 eggs
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• ½ cup chopped walnuts (Optional)
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease the bottom of a 5x9-inch loaf pan
3. Beat white sugar and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
4. Add brown sugar and hot chocolate mix; stir well
5. Place bananas, peach, milk, eggs, and vanilla extract in a blender; blend until smooth
6. Stir into butter mixture until well incorporated
7. Mix flour, walnuts, baking soda, and salt together in a separate bowl; stir into banana-butter mixture until flour mixture is just moistened
8. Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan
9. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of bread comes out clean, 50 to 60 minutes
10. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before transferring bread to a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 4g 21%, Cholesterol 39mg 13%, Sodium 279mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 11%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 6mg 28%, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 137mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229003/banana-peach-bread/

============================================================

RECIPE 395: Bananerberry Smoothie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Drinks/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup fresh strawberries
• 1 banana
• sliced
• 1 cup fresh peaches
• 1 cup apples
• 1 ½ cups vanilla ice cream
• 1 ½ cups ice cubes
• ½ cup milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a blender combine strawberries, banana, peaches, apples, and ice cream
2. Blend until smooth
3. Add ice, pour in milk and blend again until smooth
4. Serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 16%, Saturated Fat 8g 38%, Cholesterol 48mg 16%, Sodium 109mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 58g 21%, Dietary Fiber 5g 19%, Total Sugars 45g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 78mg 392%, Calcium 224mg 17%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 698mg 15%

RECIPE 396: Grandma's Peach French Toast
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 9 hrs
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 9 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/French Toast Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 2 tablespoons water
• 1 (29 ounce) can sliced peaches
• drained
• 12 (3/4 inch thick) slices day-old French bread
• 5 eggs
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a saucepan, stir together the brown sugar, butter and water
2. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently
3. Pour the brown sugar mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish, and tilt the dish to cover the entire bottom
4. Place peaches in a layer over the sugar coating, then top with slices of French bread
5. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs and vanilla
6. Slowly pour over the bread slices to coat evenly
7. Sprinkle cinnamon over the top
8. Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight
9. Remove the dish from the refrigerator about 30 minutes before baking to come to room temperature
10. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
11. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the bread is golden brown
12. Spoon out portions to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 8g 42%, Cholesterol 147mg 49%, Sodium 276mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 51g 19%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 60mg 5%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 242mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/72662/grandmas-peach-french-toast/

============================================================

RECIPE 397: Fresh Peach Pie I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 pie
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Peach Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (9 inch) pie shell
• baked
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup water
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• 1 tablespoon butter
• 2 cups fresh peaches
• pitted and mashed
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 4 cups fresh peaches - pitted
• skinned
• and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine sugar, water, cornstarch, butter or margarine, mashed peaches, and nutmeg in a saucepan
2. Cook over medium heat until clear and thick
3. Stir in vanilla
4. Fill pie shell with sliced fresh peaches, alternating with the glaze
5. Refrigerate

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 3g 15%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 136mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 44g 16%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 41mg 206%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 49mg 1%

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 8 cups
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Salsa Recipes/Peach Salsa Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 mangos
• peeled
• seeded and chopped
• 2 small peaches
• halved
• pitted
• and cut into 1/2-inch dice
• 1 cup diced fresh pineapple
• 4 tomatoes
• chopped
• 1 white onion
• diced
• 1 red bell pepper
• diced
• 1 yellow bell pepper
• diced
• 1 cup chopped fresh cilantro
• or to taste
• 1 clove garlic
• minced
• 1 small jalapeno pepper
• minced
• 2 tablespoons lime juice
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• or to taste
• ¾ cup water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the mango, peach, pineapple, tomato, onion, red pepper, yellow pepper, and cilantro in a mixing bowl

RECIPE 399: Grandma's Peach Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 1 (15 ounce) can peaches in heavy syrup
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• divided
• ½ cup brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ¼ teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup milk
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon baking powder
• 1 pinch salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Place 1/2 cup butter in a casserole dish
3. Place casserole dish in the preheating oven until butter is melted
4. Mix remaining 1/4 cup butter, peaches, 1/2 cup white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla extract together in a bowl
5. Spread over melted butter in the casserole dish
6. Mix remaining 1 cup white sugar, milk, flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl to make a smooth batter
7. Pour over peach mixture
8. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 45 minutes
9. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 9g 46%, Cholesterol 39mg 13%, Sodium 133mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 46g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 2mg 8%, Calcium 105mg 8%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 125mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/257540/grandmas-peach-cobbler/
