RECIPE 400: Homemade Peach Tea
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 cups
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 3.6/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Tea/Iced Tea Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup water
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 slices fresh peach
• or more to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix 1 cup water, sugar, and peach slices together in a saucepan; bring to a boil
2. Reduce heat to medium and simmer, crushing peach slices as you stir, until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes
3. Remove saucepan from heat, cover, and allow peaches to infuse syrup, about 30 minutes
4. Strain to remove peach slices
5. Bring 6 cups remaining water to a boil in a separate pot
6. Remove from heat, add tea bags, cover, and steep for about 5 minutes
7. Remove tea bags from the pot, pour in peach syrup, and cool to room temperature
8. Refrigerate until ready to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 8mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 34g 12%, Total Sugars 34g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Potassium 17mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/245306/homemade-peach-tea/

============================================================

RECIPE 401: Spicy Peach Chutney
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 96
Yield: 6 - 1/2 pints
Prep Time: 8 hrs
Cook Time: 2 hrs
Total Time: 10 hrs
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Chutney Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 pounds sliced peeled peaches
• 1 cup raisins
• 2 cloves garlic
• minced
• ½ cup chopped onion
• 5 ounces chopped preserved ginger
• 1 ½ tablespoons chili powder
• 1 tablespoon mustard seed
• 1 teaspoon curry powder
• 4 cups packed brown sugar
• 4 cups apple cider vinegar
• ¼ cup pickling spice

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large heavy pot, stir together the peaches, raisins, garlic, onion, preserved ginger, chili powder, mustard seed, curry powder, brown sugar and cider vinegar
2. Wrap the pickling spice in a cheesecloth bag, and place in the pot
3. Bring to a boil, and cook over medium heat uncovered until the mixture reaches your desired consistency
4. It will take about 1 1/2 hours to get a good thick sauce
5. Stir frequently to prevent scorching on the bottom
6. Remove the spice bag, and ladle into hot sterilized jars
7. Wipe the rims with a clean moist cloth
8. Seal with lids and rings, and process in a barely simmering water bath for 10 minutes, or the time recommended by your local extension for your area
9. The water should cover the jars completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 6mg 32%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 42mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/75320/spicy-peach-chutney/

============================================================

RECIPE 402: Pear Tarte Tatin
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/French/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (15 ounce) package ready-to-use refrigerated pie crust
• ⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ teaspoon ground ginger
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 5 firm pears
• 2 tablespoons good quality bourbon whiskey
• 4 tablespoons unsalted butter
• ⅔ cup white sugar
• 1 pinch salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Remove refrigerated pie crust from package, and follow manufacturer's suggestions for unrolling crust
2. Combine nutmeg, ginger, and 2 tablespoons sugar in a small bowl
3. Peel, quarter, and core 4 pears
4. Slice each quarter into 3 slices, from core end to bottom, and place in a large bowl
5. Cut remaining pear in half; peel, and core one half and add to the bowl
6. Peel, core, and slice the other half as directed above and add to the bowl
7. Drizzle pears with bourbon and sprinkle with spice-sugar mix, tossing to evenly coat
8. Melt butter in a 9-inch cast-iron skillet over medium heat
9. Add 2/3 cup white sugar and salt to the melted butter, stirring to combine until mixture bubbles, 2 to 3 minutes
10. Place the single pear half in the center of the skillet
11. Fan remaining pear slices around the center, core end to the outside of the skillet and stem end toward the center
12. If possible, turn the pieces in the same direction
13. Keep adding pear slices, filling in any gaps, until they are all in the skillet
14. Reduce heat to medium-low
15. Cook, undisturbed, until pears are fork-tender and color develops to the liquid, about 20 minutes
16. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
17. Place a baking sheet on a rack in the lower third of the oven
18. Remove skillet from heat and place unbaked pie shell on top of the fruit, using a fork to tuck the edges of the pie shell toward the bottom of the skillet
19. Place skillet on the prepared baking sheet in the preheated oven
20. Reduce temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
21. Bake until crust is brown, 28 to 30 minutes
22. Remove from oven
23. Place a heat-safe plate, larger than the skillet, upside down over the crust
24. Use oven mitts to grab the plate and skillet together and quickly flip the skillet contents onto the plate; this move is tricky and requires some forearm strength and dexterity
25. After the flip, if the contents are not centered on the plate, use a spatula to gently move to the center
26. Add any fruit that remained in the skillet, and drizzle any remaining liquid over the top of the tarte tatin
27. Allow to sit 15-20 minutes, then serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 22g 28%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 274mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 58g 21%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 4mg 22%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 158mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/269514/pear-tarte-tatin/

============================================================

RECIPE 403: Pear Sour Cream Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Pear Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (9 inch) pie crust pastry
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 cup sour cream
• ¼ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 egg
• beaten
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 4 large pears - peeled
• cored and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Roll out the pastry and transfer it to a 9-inch pie plate
3. Trim any extra dough and crimp the edge
4. Combine 1/2 cup sugar, sour cream, 1/4 cup flour, egg, vanilla, and salt in a bowl until blended
5. Fold in the pears
6. Pour the mixture into the pie plate and bake the pie for 15 minutes
7. While the pie is baking, prepare the topping: mix the 2/3 cup flour, 1/3 cup sugar, melted butter, and rolled oats together in a bowl
8. Remove the pie from the oven and sprinkle with the crumble topping
9. Return the pie to the oven and bake until the filling is set and the crust is brown, about 20 minutes more
10. Allow to cool and set before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 29g 38%, Saturated Fat 14g 70%, Cholesterol 73mg 24%, Sodium 355mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 86g 31%, Dietary Fiber 7g 24%, Total Sugars 42g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 6mg 31%, Calcium 75mg 6%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 309mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/176287/pear-sour-cream-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 404: Sour Cream Pear Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 55 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Pear Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup sugar
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 egg
• beaten
• 1 cup sour cream
• 2 (15 ounce) cans pears
• drained and chopped
• 1 (9 inch) graham cracker crust
• ½ cup sugar
• ⅔ cup butter
• ⅔ cup all-purpose flour

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. In a medium bowl, stir together 3/4 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon flour, cinnamon and salt
3. Mix in the egg and sour cream until smooth
4. Add pears, and stir gently until coated
5. Pour the mixture into a graham cracker crust
6. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven
7. While the pie is baking, make the topping in a medium bowl
8. Stir together the sugar and flour
9. Cut in butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
10. Sprinkle topping over the pie
11. Bake for an additional 30 minutes
12. Cool completely before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 30g 38%, Saturated Fat 15g 76%, Cholesterol 77mg 26%, Sodium 327mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 74g 27%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 53g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 2mg 10%, Calcium 60mg 5%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 195mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/54694/sour-cream-pear-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 405: Pear and Chocolate Tart
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch tart
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Tarts/Fruit Tart Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 shortcrust pastry crust
• 6 ½ ounces 70% dark chocolate
• chopped
• 1 ½ cups ground almonds
• 2 eggs
• ½ cup superfine sugar
• 6 ½ tablespoons butter
• softened
• 3 pears - peeled
• cored
• and quartered

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Roll pastry out to 1/4 inch thickness and use it to line a 9-inch tart dish
3. Prick the pastry with a fork and then place into the freezer for 20 minutes to prevent pastry from rising during baking
4. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
5. Set crust aside
6. Reduce oven temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
7. Heat a saucepan about 1/3-full of water to a low simmer, about 5 minutes, then reduce heat to lowest setting
8. Place a heat-proof bowl over the pan in such a way that it does not touch the water
9. Add chocolate to the bowl and allow to melt
10. Limit stirring to an absolute minimum to prevent chocolate from separating
11. Mix ground almonds, eggs, sugar, and butter together in a bowl
12. Add warm melted chocolate and stir to combine
13. Pour chocolate mixture into the baked pastry crust
14. Arrange pears on top of the tart by pressing them into the chocolate mixture
15. Bake in the hot oven until pastry is golden and mixture is firm, 35 to 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 37g 47%, Saturated Fat 10g 51%, Cholesterol 73mg 24%, Sodium 203mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 53g 19%, Dietary Fiber 7g 26%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 74mg 6%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 291mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/273033/pear-and-chocolate-tart/

============================================================

RECIPE 406: Pear Pie III
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Pear Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust
• 2 pears - peeled
• cored and cut in half
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¼ cup butter
• ¼ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
• 2 eggs
• beaten

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Press the pie pastry into the bottom and up the sides of a 9 inch pie plate
3. Flute the edges
4. Place the pear halves cut side down in the pie crust with the small ends toward the center
5. In a medium bowl, mix the butter and sugar together until smooth, then beat in the eggs one at a time until light and fluffy
6. Stir in flour and vanilla
7. Pour over the top of the pears
8. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, until pears are soft and custard is set in the center
9. Cool completely before slicing and serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 176mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 102mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/91511/pear-pie-iii/

RECIPE 407: Rustic Autumn Fruit Tart
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8-inch tart
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Tarts/Fruit Tart Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup butter
• chilled
• ½ cup cream cheese
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 2 apples - peeled
• cored
• and thinly sliced
• 1 pear - peeled
• cored and sliced
• ¼ cup orange juice
• ⅓ cup brown sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ¼ teaspoon ground cardamom
• 1 ½ tablespoons cornstarch
• ½ cup apricot jam
• warmed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Cut the cold butter and cream cheese into the flour with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. (This can also be done in a food processor: pulse the cold butter into the flour until the mixture resembles cornmeal; add the cream cheese and pulse until it's the size of small peas.) When you squeeze a handful of the mixture, it should form a ball
2. Shape the dough into a round disk, wrap it in plastic, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour
3. Toss the sliced apples and pear with the orange juice
4. Whisk together the brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, cardamom, and cornstarch
5. Toss the fruit with the sugar-spice mixture and set aside
6. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
7. Set out an 8-inch tart pan, or, if you'll be making a free-form tart (galette), lightly grease a baking sheet
8. Roll the pastry out on a lightly floured work surface to form a 10-inch circle
9. Transfer the dough to the tart pan or baking sheet
10. Arrange the fruit decoratively in the tart pastry
11. If you're baking the tart on a baking sheet, leave a 2-inch rim of dough and fold it up over the edge of the fruit (the pastry folds will overlap)
12. Bake the tart in the preheated oven until the crust is browned and the filling is bubbly, about 30 minutes
13. Remove the tart from the oven and brush it with the apricot jam

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 11g 53%, Cholesterol 47mg 16%, Sodium 137mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 51g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 24g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 8mg 41%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 152mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/93779/rustic-autumn-fruit-tart/

============================================================

RECIPE 408: Cheddar Pear Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Vintage Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup brown sugar
• ½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese
• ¼ cup butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Combine the flour, 1/2 cup brown sugar, and Cheddar cheese
3. Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
4. Toss the sliced pears with the lemon juice
5. Combine the 1/2 cup brown sugar, cornstarch, and cinnamon in a separate bowl
6. Add the sugar mixture to the pears and toss to coat
7. Transfer the pears to the pie crust and top with the crumble mixture
8. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden brown, about 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 9g 47%, Cholesterol 30mg 10%, Sodium 281mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 87g 32%, Dietary Fiber 7g 24%, Total Sugars 52g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 8mg 41%, Calcium 123mg 9%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 291mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/176269/cheddar-pear-pie/

RECIPE 409: Hasselback Pear Tart
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 10-inch square tart pan
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Tarts/Fruit Tart Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 sheet frozen puff pastry - thawed
• unfolded
• and lightly rolled
• 2 Bartlett pears
• halved and cored
• 2 d'Anjou pears
• halved and cored
• 1 red pear
• halved and cored
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• ½ lemon
• juiced
• ½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• ½ cup confectioners' sugar
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 tablespoon turbinado sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Fit puff pastry into a 10-inch square tart pan with removable sides
3. Place a pear half, cut-side down, onto a work surface
4. Place a chopstick above and below the pear half, so the pear is framed on the top and bottom
5. Thinly slice the pear half lengthwise, stopping when the knife hits the chopstick and leaving the bottom 1/4 inch of the pear intact
6. Repeat with the remaining pear halves
7. Place hasselbacked pears in a bowl; add white sugar and lemon juice and gently toss to coat
8. Let hasselbacked pears stand for 5 minutes
9. Mix cream cheese, confectioners' sugar, and vanilla extract together in a bowl; spread over puff pastry
10. Arrange hasselbacked pears over cream cheese layer, cutting some of the halves into quarters if needed to fit them in
11. Slightly fan out each pear and drizzle any accumulated juices from the pear bowl over pears
12. Sprinkle turbinado sugar over tart
13. Bake in the preheated oven until crust is puffed and lightly browned and juices are bubbling, about 35 minutes
14. Cool tart for 15 minutes before slicing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 118mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 16%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 10mg 49%, Calcium 29mg 2%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 175mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/255904/hasselback-pear-tart/

============================================================

RECIPE 410: Scandinavian Pear Tart
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch tart
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Tarts/Fruit Tart Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• cooking spray
• ½ cup white sugar
• 3 tablespoons butter
• softened
• ¾ cup all-purpose flour
• ⅓ cup finely chopped almonds

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Coat a 9-inch fluted tart pan with a removable bottom with cooking spray
3. Beat sugar and butter together in a small bowl until crumbly
4. Beat in flour and almonds
5. Press over the bottom and up the sides of the prepared tart pan
6. Beat cream cheese in another small bowl until smooth
7. Beat in sugar, egg, and vanilla extract
8. Spread over the crust
9. Arrange pear slices over the cream cheese layer
10. Combine sugar, cardamom, and cinnamon in a small bowl
11. Sprinkle over the pears
12. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
13. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
14. Continue baking until filling is set and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads 160 degrees F (71 degrees C), 15 to 20 minutes
15. Cool tart on a wire rack for 1 hour
16. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before slicing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 9g 46%, Cholesterol 63mg 21%, Sodium 124mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 45mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 137mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/276769/scandinavian-pear-tart/

============================================================

RECIPE 411: Maple-Pear Tarte Tatin
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch tart
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Tarts/Fruit Tart Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ (17.3 ounce) package frozen puff pastry
• thawed
• ¼ cup butter
• ⅓ cup brown sugar
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 pinch ground nutmeg
• ¼ cup maple syrup
• 4 firm pears - peeled
• cored
• and halved
• or more as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Roll puff pastry out on a lightly floured surface to 1/4-inch thickness; place in the refrigerator
3. Melt butter in a 9-inch cast iron skillet over medium heat; stir in brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg and cook and stir until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes
4. Stir maple syrup into brown sugar mixture; cook, stirring, until mixture begins to bubble
5. Remove skillet from heat
6. Place one pear half, cut side up, into the center of skillet
7. Cut remaining pear halves in half again; arrange pear quarters around the center pear, cut sides up
8. Place skillet over medium-low heat; cook pears, basting with syrup mixture, until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes
9. Remove skillet from heat
10. Remove puff pastry from refrigerator; place pastry over pears, tucking edges of pastry around pears inside skillet
11. Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is puffed and golden, about 20 minutes; allow to cool for 5 minutes
12. Place a serving plate over skillet; invert to remove tart (skillet will still be hot)
13. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 122mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 4mg 18%, Calcium 27mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 152mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/245135/maple-pear-tarte-tatin/

============================================================

RECIPE 412: Bartlett Pear Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 3.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Pear Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (9 inch) pie crust pastry
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• ½ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup brown sugar
• 1 ½ tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ teaspoon ground allspice
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon
• 2 eggs
• 5 Bartlett pears
• peeled and chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Press pie crust pastry into a 9-inch pie dish and refrigerate while preparing filling
3. Beat butter, white sugar, brown sugar, flour, nutmeg, allspice, salt, and cinnamon together in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth
4. Beat eggs, 1 at a time, into butter mixture until incorporated; fold in pears
5. Pour filling into chilled crust
6. Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set in the middle, 30 to 35 minutes
7. Cool completely before serving, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 26%, Saturated Fat 10g 48%, Cholesterol 77mg 26%, Sodium 212mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 4mg 22%, Calcium 33mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 176mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/235661/bartlett-pear-pie/

RECIPE 413: French Pear Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 45 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/French/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 large pears
• peeled and sliced
• 1 lemon
• juiced
• ⅔ cup white sugar
• ½ teaspoon grated nutmeg
• 1 (9 inch) unbaked single pie crust
• ½ cup butter
• ½ cup brown sugar
• 1 cup all-purpose flour

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
2. Sprinkle pears with lemon juice in a bowl
3. Mix white sugar and nutmeg in a separate small bowl; sprinkle over pears and mix thoroughly
4. Fit pie crust into the bottom of a 9-inch pie dish
5. Cut butter, brown sugar, and flour together in a bowl using a pastry cutter until mixture resembles crumbs
6. Spoon pear mixture into pie shell and sprinkle top with brown sugar mixture
7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
8. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until filling is bubbling and crumble topping is lightly browned, about 35 more minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 25%, Saturated Fat 9g 46%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 203mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 73g 26%, Dietary Fiber 6g 22%, Total Sugars 41g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 9mg 46%, Calcium 31mg 2%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 241mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/230571/french-pear-pie/

RECIPE 414: Autumn Spiced Apple and Pear Hand Pies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 16 3-inch pies
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Pear Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 large Pink Lady apple - peeled
• cored and diced
• 1 large Bartlett pear - peeled
• cored and diced
• ¼ cup brown sugar
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
• 2 teaspoons cornstarch
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 egg
• 1 tablespoon water
• 1 recipe pastry for a 9-inch double crust pie
• 2 tablespoons coarse granulated sugar
• or as needed (Optional)
• ½ cup dark chocolate chips (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Stir apple, pear, brown sugar, vanilla extract, cornstarch, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt together in a bowl
4. Whisk egg and water together in a small bowl
5. Roll pastry out on a lightly floured surface; cut into circles with a 3- to 4-inch round cookie cutter
6. Spoon a small amount of apple mixture onto center of each pastry circle; fold circles in half and press firmly to seal edges
7. Crimp with a fork, if desired
8. Place pies on prepared baking sheet
9. Cut 3 small slits in top of each hand pie with a sharp knife
10. Brush surface of pies with egg mixture; sprinkle with decorating sugar
11. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly golden, about 25 minutes; allow pies to cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes
12. Melt chocolate chips in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in 15-second intervals, stirring after each melting, 1 to 2 minutes
13. Drizzle melted chocolate over pies

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 12mg 4%, Sodium 75mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 11mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 64mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/244986/autumn-spiced-apple-and-pear-hand-pies/

============================================================

RECIPE 415: Pear Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Pear Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust
• 3 cups sliced Bartlett pears
• 1 cup sour cream
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 1 egg
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• ½ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Press pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish
3. Arrange pear slices in the pie crust
4. Stir sour cream, 1/2 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons flour, egg, vanilla extract, and salt together in a bowl; pour over pears
5. Mix 1/2 cup flour, butter, 1/4 cup sugar, and cinnamon together in a bowl until topping resembles coarse crumbs
6. Bake pie in the preheated oven for 35 minutes
7. Sprinkle topping onto pie and continue baking until topping is golden brown, about 10 more minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 33%, Saturated Fat 13g 66%, Cholesterol 66mg 22%, Sodium 369mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 17%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 53mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 154mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234491/pear-pie/

RECIPE 416: Pear Pie II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Pear Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust
• 3 eggs
• ⅓ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon almond extract
• ¼ cup melted butter
• 3 pears - peeled
• cored and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C.) In a large bowl, combine eggs, flour, sugar, almond extract and melted butter
2. Pour into unbaked pie crust
3. Arrange sliced pears in spokes radiating from center
4. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, then reduce temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for 25 to 35 minutes, or until custard is firm
5. Cool completely before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 8g 41%, Cholesterol 113mg 38%, Sodium 247mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 69g 25%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 44g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 4mg 22%, Calcium 29mg 2%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 187mg 4%

RECIPE 417: Pear and Hazelnut Frangipane Tart
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch tart
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour (or gluten-free flour mix)
• 1 teaspoon sugar
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 8 tablespoons cold unsalted butter
• cut into 1/2-inch cubes
• 3 tablespoons cold water
• or more as needed
• Reynolds® Parchment Paper
• Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine the flour, sugar and salt in a food processor
2. Add the cold butter and pulse ten times until the butter is the size of large peas
3. Add 3 tablespoons of cold water and pulse until it comes together
4. Turn onto a lightly floured work surface and bring the dough together, forming a disk
5. Wrap in Reynolds® Parchment Paper and refrigerate for at least 45 minutes
6. On a lightly floured work surface, roll the dough to 1/8-inch thickness
7. Fill a 9-inch tart mold or rectangle tart mold with the dough
8. Cut off excess from the top and refrigerate for another 15 minutes
9. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F
10. Cover the top of the dough with Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil and weigh down with pie weights or dry beans
11. Bake for 15 minutes
12. Remove the foil and pie weights and let cool
13. Combine the hazelnuts and sugar in the food processor
14. Pulse to a fine powder
15. Add the butter, egg, flour, vanilla, rum and salt
16. Process until it comes together as a paste
17. Spread the mixture over the partially baked tart
18. On the top, arrange the pear slices in a pattern
19. Bake the tart for 30 to 35 minutes until golden brown
20. Let it cool for 10 minutes before slicing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 31g 39%, Saturated Fat 15g 77%, Cholesterol 84mg 28%, Sodium 206mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 46g 17%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 33mg 3%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 194mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/245237/pear-and-hazelnut-frangipane-tart/

============================================================

RECIPE 418: French Puff Pastry Tart with Pears and Chocolate
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/French/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 1 cup blanched almond flour
• 2 eggs
• 1 sheet frozen puff pastry
• thawed
• 4 ounces milk chocolate
• chopped
• 3 pears - peeled
• cored and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Line a tart pan with parchment paper
2. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
3. Combine butter and 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar in a large bowl; beat using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy
4. Mix in almond flour
5. Add eggs 1 at a time and mix until well combined
6. Line a tart pan with the puff pastry and prick with a fork all over
7. Place chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water
8. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until melted, about 5 minutes
9. Cool slightly
10. Cover puff pastry with melted chocolate
11. Carefully pour egg mixture on top of the chocolate on the puff pastry without mixing the 2 layers
12. Arrange pear slices on top of the tart
13. Bake in the preheated oven until pastry has puffed up and is golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 36g 46%, Saturated Fat 14g 68%, Cholesterol 80mg 27%, Sodium 106mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 51g 18%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 45mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 165mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/267990/french-puff-pastry-tart-with-pears-and-chocolate/

============================================================

RECIPE 419: Frangipane Pear Tart
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch tart
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Tarts/Fruit Tart Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups water
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons honey
• 1 vanilla bean
• split lengthwise
• 1 cinnamon stick
• 5 pods cardamom
• crushed
• 4 Conference pears - peeled
• halved
• and cored

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine water, 1 cup white sugar, honey, vanilla bean, cinnamon stick, and cardamom in a large saucepan
2. Bring to a simmer over medium heat
3. Add pears; reduce heat and simmer until pears are translucent or easily pierced with a knife, about 10 minutes
4. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature
5. Combine 1 1/2 cup flour, confectioners' sugar, and salt in a bowl
6. Cut in 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon butter until mixture is crumbly
7. Mix in egg yolk until dough sticks together in large clumps
8. Grease a 9-inch tart pan with a removable bottom
9. Press dough evenly into the pan
10. Freeze for 30 minutes
11. Reserve leftover dough for patching cracks
12. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
13. Grease the shiny side of a piece of aluminum foil with butter; place butter-side down over the pastry
14. Transfer tart pan to a baking sheet
15. Bake in the preheated oven, using leftover dough to patch any cracks, until dough looks dry and light brown, about 20 minutes
16. Peel off aluminum foil; let pastry cool
17. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
18. Combine 2/3 cup white sugar and 1/3 cup butter in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
19. Mix in ground almonds
20. Add egg, egg yolk, 2 teaspoons flour, and cornstarch; beat until frangipane is smooth
21. Beat in almond extract and vanilla extract
22. Spread frangipane evenly over the pastry
23. Drain pear halves and dry with paper towels
24. Cut lengthwise into even slices
25. Place 1 pear half on a spatula and gently fan out slices
26. Place on frangipane
27. Repeat with remaining pear halves
28. Bake in the preheated oven until frangipane is firm to the touch, 40 to 45 minutes
29. Cool on a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 31%, Saturated Fat 14g 69%, Cholesterol 104mg 35%, Sodium 171mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 94g 34%, Dietary Fiber 4g 15%, Total Sugars 66g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 5mg 23%, Calcium 79mg 6%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 330mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/256822/frangipane-pear-tart/

============================================================

RECIPE 420: d'Anjou Pear and Almond Tarts
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 18 3-inch tarts
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Tarts/Fruit Tart Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 18 (3 inch) unbaked tart shells
• 7 tablespoons brown sugar
• 2 tablespoons butter
• melted
• 1 teaspoon pear-flavored white balsamic vinegar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 3 large ripe d'Anjou pears - peeled
• cored
• and diced
• 3 tablespoons chopped almonds

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Place tart shells on a baking sheet
3. Stir brown sugar, melted butter, balsamic vinegar, and cinnamon together in a bowl; stir in pears and chopped almonds until completely coated
4. Spoon pear mixture into tart shells
5. Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 101mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 30g 11%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 2mg 8%, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 57mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/241123/danjou-pear-and-almond-tarts/

RECIPE 421: Creamy Pear Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 55 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Pear Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅓ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 4 cups peeled and sliced pears
• 1 cup sour cream
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• ½ teaspoon lemon extract
• ½ teaspoon almond extract
• 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie shell

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. In a large bowl, stir together the white sugar and 2 tablespoons flour
3. Add pears, and toss to coat
4. Stir in the sour cream and vanilla, lemon and almond extracts until the pears are evenly coated
5. Pour into the unbaked pie shell
6. In a small bowl, mix together 1/4 cup flour and brown sugar
7. Mix in the butter with your fingers until the mixture is crumbly
8. Sprinkle evenly over the top of the pie
9. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce the temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
10. Bake for an additional 45 minutes, or until pears are tender

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 155mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 15%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 48mg 4%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 166mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/47915/creamy-pear-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 422: Jump Rope Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Pear Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 recipe pastry for a double crust 9-inch pie
• 1 cup white sugar
• 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• or more as needed
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 pinch freshly grated nutmeg
• 2 cups peeled
• cored and sliced apples
• 1 cup peeled
• pitted and sliced peaches
• 1 cup peeled
• cored and sliced pears
• 1 cup pitted and sliced plums
• 1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger root
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Line a 9-inch pie plate with pastry
3. Whisk sugar, flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg together in a small bowl; sprinkle 1/4 cup of sugar mixture over pastry in pie plate
4. Stir apples, peaches, pears, plums, and ginger together in a bowl; sprinkle with lemon juice and stir to distribute
5. Place fruit mixture in pie plate; sprinkle with remaining sugar mixture
6. Cover with pastry, pinch to seal top and bottom crusts together, and cut a few slits in top pastry with a sharp knife
7. Alternatively, cover with a lattice crust
8. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes; reduce temperature to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) and continue baking until crust is golden and filling has thickened, about 35 minutes
9. Cool completely before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Sodium 235mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 58g 21%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 12mg 59%, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 128mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/245114/jump-rope-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 423: Dethbert's Pear Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 2 pies
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 2.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Pear Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 2 cups finely shredded mild Cheddar cheese
• 1 cup butter
• softened

DIRECTIONS:
1. Sift flour, sugar, and salt into a mixing bowl
2. Stir grated Cheddar cheese into the flour mixture using a fork
3. Stir in butter using a wide spoon until mixture becomes crumbly
4. Set topping mixture aside at room temperature
5. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
6. Place pie crusts in their tins onto a baking sheet to catch drips; place crusts 1 inch apart
7. Sift sugar, cornstarch, and salt into a small bowl
8. Place pears in a large mixing bowl
9. When oven is hot, sprinkle sugar mixture over pears and stir to combine
10. Pour filling evenly into the 2 pie crusts
11. Divide topping mixture in half and add to the top of each pie in 4 to 6 dollops; use a wide knife to spread evenly
12. Bake on the middle rack of the preheated oven for about 18 minutes; the pears will produce a lot of liquid and will bubble over
13. Check pies and cover with aluminum foil if crust or topping is getting dark
14. Bake about 7 minutes more

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 31%, Saturated Fat 12g 61%, Cholesterol 45mg 15%, Sodium 397mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 52g 19%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 6mg 28%, Calcium 121mg 9%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 196mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/268820/dethberts-pear-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 424: Coffee-Dusted Pear Galette
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 2.0/5
Category: /Desserts/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons white granulated sugar
• 1 teaspoon fine sea salt
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• frozen
• 7 tablespoons ice-cold water
• or more as needed
• divided
• 1 large egg
• beaten (for egg wash)
• 1 tablespoon turbinado sugar
• 1 sheet Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil
• 1 sheet Reynolds® Parchment Paper

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the flour, sugar and salt
2. Using a box grater, grate the cold butter atop the flour mixture
3. Working quickly and using your hands, break the butter bits into the flour until they're evenly distributed and resemble the size of small peas
4. Add 4 tablespoons of water and mix
5. The mixture will be shaggy at this point
6. From here, add 1 tablespoon of water at a time until the dough comes together (generally about 3 additional tablespoons)
7. Flour a work surface and dump the dough onto it
8. Knead a few times until it comes together
9. Form dough into a disk
10. Wrap the disk in plastic wrap and transfer to the refrigerator to chill for at least 1 hour, ideally overnight
11. Just before the dough is ready to remove from the fridge, mix together the filling
12. In a medium bowl, toss together the pear slices, brown sugar, cocoa powder, coffee grounds, vanilla extract and salt
13. Remove the disk of dough from the refrigerator and allow to come to room temperature for 10 minutes
14. Liberally flour a work surface and rolling pin
15. Begin to roll the dough to a 16-inch round, being sure to rotate it every so often to avoid sticking, Using the bottom of a bowl or plate that measures about 6 inches in diameter, cut out 3 circles
16. Re-roll the scraps to get 1 additional circle
17. Arrange the pears slices neatly in a circular pattern in the center of each of the pie crust rounds, leaving about 1 1/2 inch clear at the edges
18. Fold over the edges to cover about 1/2 inch of the filling
19. Repeat with the remaining rounds
20. Transfer the galettes to a baking sheet lined with Reynolds® Parchment Paper and place in the freezer to chill for 15 minutes
21. Meanwhile, preheat your oven to 400 degrees F
22. Lastly, brush the pie crust edges with the egg wash and sprinkle with turbinado sugar
23. Transfer to the oven to bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until the edges are golden brown
24. Check on the galettes periodically
25. If at any time the crusts' edges are getting too brown, take a piece of Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil and tent over the edges
26. When the edges are golden brown, remove from the oven
27. Serve warm with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of your favorite vanilla ice cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 15g 76%, Cholesterol 108mg 36%, Sodium 509mg 22%, Total Carbohydrate 67g 24%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 4mg 18%, Calcium 45mg 3%, Iron 8mg 44%, Potassium 235mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/244894/coffee-dusted-pear-galette/

============================================================

RECIPE 425: Grandma's Pear Preserves
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 6 half pints
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 12 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 3.9/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 cups peeled
• cored
• and sliced pears
• 1 cup water
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• 1 (2 ounce) package powdered fruit pectin
• 8 cups white sugar
• ½ cup brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons ground allspice
• 2 teaspoons ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Inspect six 8-ounce jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones
2. Immerse in simmering water for 10 minutes
3. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm, soapy water
4. Meanwhile, combine pears, water, and lemon juice in a large saucepan
5. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes
6. Stir in pectin, and bring to a full boil
7. Stir in white sugar; boil and stir until sugar is dissolved, about 1 minute
8. Remove from heat; stir in brown sugar, allspice, and nutmeg
9. Pack pear preserves into hot, sterilized jars, filling to within 1/2 inch of the top
10. Run a clean knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars to remove any air bubbles
11. Wipe rims with a moist paper towel to remove any residue
12. Top with lids and screw rings on tightly
13. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
14. Bring to a boil and lower jars 2 inches apart into the boiling water using a holder
15. Pour in more boiling water to cover jars by at least 1 inch
16. Bring to a rolling boil, cover, and process for 10 minutes
17. Remove the jars from the stockpot and let rest, several inches apart, for 12 to 24 hours
18. Press the center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down
19. Remove the rings for storage and store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 5mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 30mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/53839/grandmas-pear-preserves/

============================================================

RECIPE 426: Pear Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 64
Yield: 8 half-pint jars
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 ½ cups mashed ripe pears
• ¼ cup lemon juice
• 3 tablespoons powdered fruit pectin
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground cloves
• ½ teaspoon ground allspice
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 7 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 teaspoon butter
• 8 half-pint canning jars with lids and rings
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix pears, lemon juice, fruit pectin, cinnamon, cloves, allspice, and nutmeg in a large heavy pot; bring to a boil, stirring constantly
2. Add sugar all at once, stirring, and bring back to a full rolling boil
3. Boil for 1 minute
4. Mix in butter to settle foam
5. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
6. Pack the pear jam into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
7. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
8. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
9. Top with lids, and screw-on rings
10. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
11. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder
12. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
13. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
14. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process for 10 minutes
15. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
16. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
17. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Cholesterol 0mg 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Potassium 16mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228625/pear-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 427: Apple and Pear Crumble
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups rolled oats
• 1 ½ cups brown sugar
• divided
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• 2 cups peeled and diced apples
• 2 cups peeled and diced pears
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ cup sliced almonds
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Mix oats, 3/4 cup brown sugar, flour, and butter together in a bowl until crumbly
3. Mix apples, pears, remaining 3/4 cup brown sugar, and cinnamon together in a separate bowl; spread into the bottom of a 9x9-inch glass pan
4. Sprinkle oat mixture atop apple-pear mixture; top with almonds
5. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden brown, about 40 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 20%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 91mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 55g 20%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 34g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 3mg 16%, Calcium 58mg 4%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 230mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229252/apple-and-pear-crumble/

RECIPE 428: Roquefort Pear Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup pecans
• ¼ cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make the pecans: Combine pecans and sugar in a skillet over medium heat
2. Cook, stirring gently, until sugar has melted and pecans are caramelized, 5 to 7 minutes
3. Carefully transfer nuts onto a sheet of waxed paper to cool
4. While the nuts are cooling, make the dressing: Whisk oil, vinegar, sugar, mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper together in a bowl
5. Make the salad: Layer lettuce, pears, Roquefort cheese, avocado, and green onions in a large serving bowl
6. Pour dressing over top
7. Break cooled pecans into pieces and sprinkle over salad

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 32g 41%, Saturated Fat 8g 38%, Cholesterol 21mg 7%, Sodium 654mg 28%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 7g 26%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 18mg 91%, Calcium 203mg 16%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 478mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/34613/roquefort-pear-salad/

RECIPE 429: Prickly Pear Jelly
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 3 pints
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 38 mins
Total Time: 1 day 58 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 27 prickly pears (cactus fruit)
• ¼ cup lemon juice
• 1 (1.75 ounce) package fruit pectin (such as Sure-Jell®)
• 4 ½ cups white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Simmer 3 pint-size jars in a large pot of water until ready for use
2. Wash lids and rings in warm soapy water
3. Slice ends off each prickly pear
4. Make 1 long vertical slit down each one
5. Use the slit to hold the skin and peel off
6. Discard peel
7. Place peeled pears in a blender; puree in batches until liquefied
8. Press puree through a fine-mesh sieve set over a bowl
9. Discard pulp and seeds
10. Measure out 3 cups prickly pear juice, lemon juice, and pectin into a large pot
11. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly
12. Add sugar and return to a boil, stirring constantly
13. Let cook, about 3 minutes
14. Remove from heat
15. Pour prickly pear mixture into hot jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top
16. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
17. Top with lids and screw on rings
18. Place a rack in the bottom of a stockpot and fill halfway with water
19. Bring to a boil and lower jars 2 inches apart into the boiling water using a holder
20. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
21. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the stockpot, and process for 15 minutes
22. Remove the jars from the pot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, and let cool, at least 24 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 6mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 49g 18%, Dietary Fiber 4g 15%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 17mg 87%, Calcium 65mg 5%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 259mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/254409/prickly-pear-jelly/

============================================================

RECIPE 430: Fresh Pear Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 to 10 - inch bundt cake
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Spice Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups peeled
• cored and chopped pears
• 2 cups white sugar
• 3 cups sifted all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground cloves
• 4 egg whites
• ⅔ cup canola oil
• 1 cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine the pears and the sugar and let stand for one hour
2. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
3. Spray a 10 inch bundt pan with non-stick cooking spray
4. Slightly beat the egg whites and combine them with the oil, chopped pecans and pear mixture
5. Stir the flour, salt, baking soda, nutmeg, cinnamon and cloves
6. Stir in the pear mixture
7. Pour batter into the prepared bundt pan
8. Bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 1 hour and 10 minutes
9. Remove from oven ant let cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes before removing form pan

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 25%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Sodium 371mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 67g 24%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 39g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 20mg 2%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 158mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8212/fresh-pear-cake/

RECIPE 431: Classic Pear Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/Pear Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup rolled oats
• ⅓ cup brown sugar
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon finely chopped crystallized ginger
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ cup butter
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons finely chopped crystallized ginger
• 8 cups peeled and sliced pears
• 1 pint vanilla ice cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease a 2 quart casserole dish or 9 inch square baking dish
3. In a medium bowl, stir together the oats, brown sugar, 1/2 cup flour, 1 teaspoon crystallized ginger, and cinnamon
4. Stir in the butter until the mixture is crumbly with pea sized lumps
5. In a separate bowl, stir together the white sugar, 2 tablespoons flour and 2 teaspoons of crystallized ginger
6. Add the sliced pears, and toss to blend
7. Transfer to the prepared baking dish
8. Spread with the oat topping
9. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, until pears are soft and topping is golden brown
10. Cool slightly before serving with vanilla ice cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 8g 40%, Cholesterol 40mg 13%, Sodium 97mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 81g 29%, Dietary Fiber 9g 32%, Total Sugars 47g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 10mg 50%, Calcium 104mg 8%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 457mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/91539/classic-pear-crisp/

============================================================

RECIPE 432: Pear or Apple Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 9
Yield: 9 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cobblers/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 pears
• cored and cut into 1/2-inch slices
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• ⅓ cup maple syrup
• 2 tablespoons melted butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Toss pears and lemon juice together in a bowl until coated; spread into a 9x9-inch baking dish
3. Pour maple syrup and 2 tablespoons melted butter over pear mixture; toss to coat
4. Mix oats, brown sugar, 1/2 cup melted butter, flour, and cinnamon together in a bowl until crumbly; sprinkle over pear mixture
5. Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden and pears are tender, about 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 17%, Saturated Fat 8g 41%, Cholesterol 34mg 11%, Sodium 100mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 55g 20%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 190mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/233068/pear-or-apple-cobbler/

RECIPE 433: Pear Vinaigrette
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 1/2 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Salad Dressing Recipes/Vinaigrette Dressing Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ripe pear - peeled
• cored
• and chopped
• ½ cup white wine
• 1 clove garlic
• chopped
• 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
• ¼ cup white balsamic vinegar
• 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
• ¼ teaspoon sea salt
• ½ cup olive oil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Blend the pear, white wine, garlic, Dijon mustard, white balsamic vinegar, black pepper, and sea salt in a blender until well combined; drizzle the olive oil into the mixture in a thin, steady stream while continuing to blend
2. Blend a few seconds longer until the salad dressing is thick and creamy

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Sodium 60mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 4g 1%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 5mg 0%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 31mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/218334/pear-vinaigrette/

RECIPE 434: Pear Bread I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 2 -8x5 inch loaves
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Breakfast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• ¼ teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• ¾ cup vegetable oil
• 3 eggs
• 2 cups white sugar
• 2 cups peeled shredded pears
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large mixing bowl combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon
2. Make a well in the center of the bowl
3. In a separate bowl combine the oil, eggs, sugar, grated pears, pecans, and vanilla
4. Add to well of dry ingredients
5. Stir until just moistened
6. Spoon batter into 2 greased and floured 8x5x3 inch loaf pans
7. Bake in a preheated 325 degree F (165 degrees C) oven for one hour and 15 minutes
8. Cool on wire rack before removing from the loaf pans

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 28mg 9%, Sodium 196mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 75mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7214/pear-bread-i/

============================================================

RECIPE 435: Pear Honey
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 64
Yield: 4 pints
Prep Time: 45 mins
Cook Time: 3 hrs
Total Time: 3 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 cups peeled
• cored and chopped pears
• 1 cup unsweetened pineapple juice
• 8 cups white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place chopped pears into a large pot, and pour pineapple juice over them to prevent them from browning
2. Stir in sugar, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat
3. Stir frequently to prevent scorching
4. When the pears are at a full boil, reduce heat to medium, and cook until the mixture is the color and texture of honey
5. The longer you cook it, the thicker it gets
6. Cooking time is usually 2 to 3 hours
7. Ladle into hot sterile jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top
8. Wipe rims with a clean damp cloth, and seal jars with lids and rings
9. Process in a boiling water canner for 10 minutes, or the amount of time recommended by your local extension for your area

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Potassium 30mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/75639/pear-honey/

============================================================

RECIPE 436: Curried Butternut Squash and Pear Soup
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Soup Recipes/Fruit Soup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (2 pound) butternut squash
• 3 tablespoons unsalted butter
• 1 onion
• diced
• 2 cloves garlic
• minced
• 2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger root
• 1 tablespoon curry powder
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 4 cups reduced sodium chicken broth
• 2 firm ripe Bartlett pears
• peeled
• cored
• and cut into 1 inch dice
• ½ cup half and half

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Cut squash in half lengthwise; discard seeds and membrane
4. Place squash halves, cut sides down, on the prepared baking sheet
5. Roast in preheated oven until very soft, about 45 minutes
6. Scoop the pulp from the peel, and reserve
7. Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium heat
8. Stir in the onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, and salt
9. Cook and stir until the onion is soft, about 10 minutes
10. Pour the chicken broth into the pot, and bring to a boil
11. Stir in the pears and the reserved squash, and simmer until the pears are very soft, about 30 minutes
12. Pour the soup into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full
13. Hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, and carefully start the blender
14. Puree in batches until smooth
15. Return the soup to the pot, stir in the half and half, and reheat

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 888mg 39%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 7g 24%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 29mg 145%, Calcium 99mg 8%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 591mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/189936/curried-butternut-squash-and-pear-soup/

============================================================

RECIPE 437: Pear Butter
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 32
Yield: 2 pints
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 mins
Total Time: 31 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 pounds medium pears
• quartered and cored
• 2 cups sugar
• 1 teaspoon grated orange zest
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ¼ cup orange juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place pears into a large pot over medium heat, and add just enough water to cover the bottom of the pot and keep them from sticking, about 1/2 cup
2. Cook until the pears are soft, about 30 minutes
3. Press pears through a sieve or food mill, and measure out 2 quarts of the pulp
4. Pour the pear pulp and sugar into a large saucepan and stir to dissolve sugar
5. Stir in the orange zest, nutmeg and orange juice
6. Cook over medium heat until the mixture is thick enough to mound in a spoon
7. When the mixture begins to thicken, stir frequently to prevent scorching on the bottom
8. This will take about 1 hour
9. Ladle the pear butter into hot sterile jars, leaving 1/4 inch of headspace
10. Remove air bubbles by sliding a metal spatula around where the pear butter touches the glass
11. Wipe jar rims clean, and seal with lids and rings
12. Process for 10 minutes in a boiling water bath
13. The water should cover the jars by 1 inch
14. Check with your local extension for exact processing times for your area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 72mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/75545/pear-butter/

============================================================

RECIPE 438: Grilled Brie and Pear Sandwich
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 1
Yield: 1 sandwich
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Sandwich Recipes/Grilled Cheese/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons butter
• softened
• 2 thick slices French bread
• 6 thin slices Brie cheese
• or more to taste
• 12 fresh thyme leaves
• or to taste
• 1 pinch cracked black pepper
• 6 slices pear (such as Bosc)
• salt to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Generously butter one side of each slice of bread
2. Heat a skillet over medium heat
3. Place bread slices butter-side down into hot skillet
4. Arrange Brie cheese slices on top of each piece of bread
5. Sprinkle thyme and cracked black pepper over the top
6. Spread pear slices in a single layer over the Brie cheese on one slice of bread and top with a pinch of salt
7. Flip the slice of bread without pears onto the slice of bread with the pear slices
8. Continue cooking sandwich until cheese and pear are heated through and cheese is melted, 2 to 3 minutes per side
9. Transfer to a plate and cut into halves

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 41g 53%, Saturated Fat 26g 128%, Cholesterol 121mg 40%, Sodium 998mg 43%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 6g 23%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 22g, Vitamin C 23mg 116%, Calcium 209mg 16%, Iron 5mg 30%, Potassium 375mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/237472/grilled-brie-and-pear-sandwich/

============================================================

RECIPE 439: Pear Relish
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 192
Yield: 8 pints
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Relish Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 12 large pears
• 3 large onions
• coarsely chopped
• 3 large green bell peppers
• seeded and coarsely chopped
• 4 jalapeno peppers
• coarsely chopped
• 2 cups apple cider vinegar
• 2 cups white sugar
• 9 ounces prepared mustard
• 1 tablespoon salt
• 10 (1 pint) canning jars with lids and rings
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place pears into a large stock pot, add water to cover, and boil until tender, about 20 minutes
2. Drain and cool
3. When pears are cool, peel, core, and coarsely chop
4. Place pears, onions, green bell peppers, and jalapeno peppers into a food processor, working in batches if necessary, and chop the pears and vegetables finely
5. Transfer pears and vegetables, including any juice, to a large pot
6. Stir vinegar, sugar, prepared mustard, and salt into the pear mixture and bring to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until flavors have blended and relish is thickened, about 1 hour
7. Sterilize jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
8. Pack pear relish into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
9. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
10. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
11. Top with lids and screw on rings
12. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
13. Bring to a boil over high heat, then carefully lower the jars into the pot using a holder
14. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
15. Pour in more boiling water if necessary until the water level is at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
16. Bring the water to a full boil, cover the pot, and process for about 20 minutes or the amount of time recommended for your area
17. Remove the jars from the stockpot and cool
18. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
19. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 52mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 5g 2%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 28mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/222276/pear-relish/

============================================================

RECIPE 440: Cranberry Sauce Extraordinaire
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Cranberry Sauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup water
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 (12 ounce) package fresh cranberries
• 1 orange
• peeled and pureed
• 1 apple - peeled
• cored and diced
• 1 pear - peeled
• cored and diced
• 1 cup chopped dried mixed fruit
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a medium saucepan, boil water and sugar until the sugar dissolves
2. Reduce the heat to simmer, and stir in cranberries, pureed orange, apple, pear, dried fruit, pecans, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg
3. Cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cranberries burst
4. Remove from heat, and let cool to room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Sodium 100mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 13mg 65%, Calcium 24mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 220mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13643/cranberry-sauce-extraordinaire/

RECIPE 441: Pear and Blue Cheese Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (10 ounce) bag mixed field greens
• ½ cup sliced red onion (Optional)
• 1 Bosc pear
• cored and sliced
• ½ cup chopped candied pecans
• ½ cup crumbled blue cheese
• ¼ cup maple syrup
• ⅓ cup apple cider vinegar
• ½ cup mayonnaise
• 2 tablespoons packed brown sugar
• ¾ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
• ¼ cup walnut oil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the salad greens in a large bowl
2. Add the red onion, pear, pecans, and blue cheese, and toss to mix evenly
3. To make the dressing, place the maple syrup, vinegar, mayonnaise, brown sugar, salt, and pepper in a blender, and blend thoroughly
4. With the motor running, slowly pour in the walnut oil
5. Blend until mixture becomes creamy, about 1 minute
6. Pour over salad mixture, and toss to coat greens evenly
7. Serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 30g 39%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 631mg 27%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 10mg 48%, Calcium 106mg 8%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 367mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/147395/pear-and-blue-cheese-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 442: Lime Pear Gelatin Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 4 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Dessert Salad Recipes/Jell-O® Salad/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (.6 ounce) package sugar-free lime Jell-O®
• 1 cup boiling water
• 1 (15.25 ounce) can pear halves in juice
• 1 (3 ounce) package reduced-fat cream cheese
• softened
• 1 ½ cups reduced-fat frozen whipped topping
• thawed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk together the lime gelatin and boiling water in a large bowl until the gelatin dissolves
2. Pour the mixture into the container of a blender, and add the pear halves and cream cheese
3. Cover and blend until smooth
4. Pour back into the bowl, and gently whisk in the whipped topping
5. Transfer to a mold or serving bowl, cover and refrigerate until firm, at least 4 hours
6. To unmold, dip the mold briefly into hot tap water to loosen the gelatin, then invert onto a plate

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 11mg 4%, Sodium 148mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 18mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 86mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/156739/lime-pear-gelatin-salad/

RECIPE 443: Apple-Cranberry Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon stone-ground mustard
• 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
• ¼ cup olive oil
• 1 apple
• diced
• 1 pear
• diced
• ¼ cup dried cranberries
• 1 (10 ounce) package mixed baby greens
• ¼ cup crumbled blue cheese
• 2 tablespoons chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk the mustard and vinegar together in a small bowl
2. Drizzle in the olive oil while whisking to create a dressing; set aside
3. Place the apple, pear, cranberries, baby greens, blue cheese, and walnuts into a large salad bowl
4. Toss gently to mix, then pour on the dressing, and toss to coat

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 6mg 2%, Sodium 161mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 16mg 81%, Calcium 84mg 6%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 269mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/171402/apple-cranberry-salad/

RECIPE 444: Winter Fruit Salad with Lemon Poppyseed Dressing
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Cranberry Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup lemon juice
• 2 teaspoons diced onion
• 1 teaspoon Dijon-style prepared mustard
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ⅔ cup vegetable oil
• 1 tablespoon poppy seeds
• 1 head romaine lettuce
• torn into bite-size pieces
• 4 ounces shredded Swiss cheese
• 1 cup cashews
• ¼ cup dried cranberries
• 1 apple - peeled
• cored and diced
• 1 pear - peeled
• cored and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a blender or food processor, combine sugar, lemon juice, onion, mustard, and salt
2. Process until well blended
3. With machine still running, add oil in a slow, steady stream until mixture is thick and smooth
4. Add poppy seeds, and process just a few seconds more to mix
5. In a large serving bowl, toss together the romaine lettuce, shredded Swiss cheese, cashews, dried cranberries, apple, and pear
6. Pour dressing over salad just before serving, and toss to coat

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 26%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 9mg 3%, Sodium 201mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 21g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 13mg 64%, Calcium 103mg 8%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 193mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13482/winter-fruit-salad-with-lemon-poppyseed-dressing/

============================================================

RECIPE 445: Pear and Gorgonzola Cheese Pizza
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 pizza
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pizza Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (16 ounce) package refrigerated pizza crust dough
• 4 ounces sliced provolone cheese
• 1 Bosc pear
• thinly sliced
• 2 ounces chopped walnuts
• 2 ½ ounces Gorgonzola cheese
• crumbled
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
2. Place pizza crust dough on a medium baking sheet
3. Layer with Provolone cheese
4. Top cheese with Bosc pear slices
5. Sprinkle with walnuts and Gorgonzola cheese
6. Bake in the preheated oven 8 to 10 minutes, or until cheese is melted and crust is lightly browned
7. Remove from heat
8. Top with chives and slice to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 19mg 6%, Sodium 585mg 25%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 12g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 164mg 13%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 78mg 2%

RECIPE 446: Apple Pear Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Fruit Butter Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 pears
• cut into chunks
• 3 apples
• cut into chunks
• ½ cup water
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat a skillet over medium heat; add pears, apples, water, and vanilla extract to the hot skillet
2. Cover and simmer fruit mixture for 10 minutes; remove lid and cook until most of liquid is evaporated and fruit is softened, 10 to 15 more minutes
3. Remove skillet from heat and transfer fruit mixture and any remaining liquid to a food processor
4. Process until smooth; stir in cinnamon
5. Serve warm or refrigerate up to 4 days

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 6mg 30%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 155mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229225/apple-pear-sauce/
