RECIPE 447: Blue Cheese, Walnut, and Pear Pizza
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 pizza
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pizza Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pre-baked pizza crust
• 2 cloves garlic
• minced
• 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
• 2 sprigs fresh rosemary
• chopped
• ¼ cup white wine vinegar
• ½ cup olive oil
• ¼ cup crumbled blue cheese
• salt and pepper to taste
• ¼ cup crumbled blue cheese
• ⅓ cup shredded mozzarella cheese
• 2 pears - peeled
• cored and sliced
• ¼ cup toasted walnut pieces

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Place the pizza crust on a pizza pan
3. Bake in the preheated oven until just crisp, about 5 minutes
4. Meanwhile, combine the garlic, Dijon mustard, rosemary, and vinegar in a food processor or blender
5. Turn on, and drizzle in the olive oil slowly until the dressing has thickened
6. Quickly pulse in 1/4 cup of blue cheese; season to taste with salt and pepper
7. Spread the vinaigrette over the pizza crust
8. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of blue cheese evenly over the crust, followed by the mozzarella cheese
9. Arrange the sliced pears over the cheese, and sprinkle with the toasted walnuts
10. Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese has melted and is bubbly, 7 to 10 minutes
11. Let cool slightly before cutting into slices

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 28g 36%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 537mg 23%, Total Carbohydrate 34g 13%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 12g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 122mg 9%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 128mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/216536/blue-cheese-walnut-and-pear-pizza/

============================================================

RECIPE 448: Poached Pears Belle Helene
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 pears
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/French/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 cups water
• 1 lemon
• zested and juiced
• 4 Bosc pears - cored
• peeled
• stems left on
• 1 vanilla bean
• 3 cups sugar
• 1 cup prepared hot fudge topping
• or as needed
• 1 cup vanilla ice cream
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place water in a heavy pot
2. Stir in zest and juice of 1 lemon
3. Place pears in pot
4. Split the vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out the seeds
5. Add the seeds and split pods to the poaching liquid
6. Pour in sugar
7. Bring pot to a simmer over medium-high heat; stir gently to dissolve sugar with minimal jostling of the pears
8. Reduce heat so pears continue cooking over a steady, gentle simmer
9. Pears need to stay submerged, so place a small plate over them in the pot to keep them under the liquid
10. Simmer until pears are just tender, 20 to 25 minutes. (Remove plate to test the pears for doneness.) Remove pot from heat and let pears cool to room temperature in the poaching liquid
11. Transfer pears and vanilla beans to a storage container and cover with some of the poaching liquid
12. Cover and refrigerate until pears are thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight
13. Reserve all of the poaching liquid (see footnote)
14. Heat hot fudge sauce in a saucepan over medium heat until warm
15. Dip base of pear into the chocolate and spoon chocolate along the sides except for the top inch or so of the pear
16. Place dipped pears in individual serving bowls with another generous spoonful of syrup and a small scoop of vanilla ice cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 17%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 252mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 241g 88%, Dietary Fiber 9g 31%, Total Sugars 213g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 29mg 144%, Calcium 171mg 13%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 491mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/245028/poached-pears-belle-helene/

============================================================

RECIPE 449: Fruit Leather
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 sheet
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 5 hrs
Total Time: 5 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup sugar
• ¼ cup lemon juice
• 4 cups peeled
• cored and chopped apple
• 4 cups peeled
• cored and chopped pears

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 150 degrees F (65 degrees C)
2. Cover a baking sheet with a layer of plastic wrap or parchment paper
3. In the container of a blender, combine the sugar, lemon juice, apple and pear
4. Cover and puree until smooth
5. Spread evenly on the prepared pan
6. Place the pan on the top rack of the oven
7. Bake for 5 to 6 hours, leaving the door to the oven partway open
8. Fruit is dry when the surface is no longer tacky and you can tear it like leather
9. Roll up on the plastic wrap and store in an airtight jar

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 88mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/62151/fruit-leather/

RECIPE 450: Cranberry Pear Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup olive oil
• ¼ cup balsamic vinegar
• 1 tablespoon dark brown sugar
• 2 ½ teaspoons minced garlic
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
• 6 cups mixed baby greens
• 3 pears
• thinly sliced
• 1 cup dried cranberries
• 1 cup toasted pecans
• ¾ cup cubed Havarti cheese
• ½ cup toasted sliced almonds

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk olive oil, balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, garlic, salt, and black pepper in a medium bowl
2. Combine greens, pears, cranberries, pecans, and Havarti cheese in a large bowl
3. Pour balsamic vinegar dressing over salad and toss
4. Garnish with almonds to serve

RECIPE 451: Summer Fruit Salad with a Lemon, Honey, and Mint Dressing
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Strawberry Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups cubed seeded watermelon
• 2 cups sliced fresh strawberries
• 2 large fresh peaches
• cut into cubes
• 2 large nectarines
• cut into cubes
• 1 red Anjou pear
• cut into cubes
• 1 cup seedless grapes
• halved
• 2 lemons
• juiced
• ¼ cup minced fresh mint (chocolate mint preferred)
• ½ lemon
• zested
• 1 tablespoon honey (fireweed honey preferred)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine watermelon, strawberries, peaches, nectarines, pear, and grapes in a large mixing bowl
2. Whisk lemon juice, mint, lemon zest, and honey together in a small bowl; drizzle over the fruit mixture and toss to coat
3. Refrigerate 1 hour before serving

RECIPE 452: Gorgonzola Pear Pasta
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pasta/

INGREDIENTS:
• 9 ounces penne pasta
• 2 tablespoons butter
• ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese
• 3 tablespoons crumbled Gorgonzola cheese
• ½ cup heavy whipping cream
• 1 large pear
• peeled and cubed
• ½ cup chopped toasted walnuts
• ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a rolling boil
2. Cook penne in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes; drain
3. Return drained pasta to the pot; stir butter, Parmesan cheese, and Gorgonzola cheese into pasta and place over medium heat; cook until the cheese is completely melted
4. Pour cream into pasta mixture; stir
5. Remove from heat and fold in pear
6. Top with walnuts
7. Season with pepper and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 69g 88%, Saturated Fat 29g 146%, Cholesterol 147mg 49%, Sodium 712mg 31%, Total Carbohydrate 237g 86%, Dietary Fiber 28g 99%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 74g, Vitamin C 5mg 26%, Calcium 389mg 30%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 333mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/206356/gorgonzola-pear-pasta/

RECIPE 453: Duck Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 cups
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/

INGREDIENTS:
• 5 cups coarsely chopped mixed fruit (apples
• plums
• and pears)
• 1 cup water
• ¾ cup apple juice
• 1 teaspoon soy sauce
• 1 tablespoon apricot preserves
• ½ cup packed light brown sugar
• ½ teaspoon garlic powder
• ½ teaspoon dry mustard

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place fruit in a stock pot over medium high heat
2. Add water, apple juice, soy sauce, apricot preserves, brown sugar, garlic powder, and dry mustard
3. Bring to a simmer, stirring frequently to dissolve brown sugar
4. Reduce heat, and continue simmering for 40 minutes, or until fruit is completely soft
5. Remove from heat and allow to cool
6. Blend sauce in a food processor or blender until completely smooth, adjusting consistency with additional water, if desired
7. Cover, and refrigerate until ready to use

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 48mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 20%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 118mg 589%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 256mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/67532/duck-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 454: Christmas Plum Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 20 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 5 hrs
Total Time: 5 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/UK and Ireland/English/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup whole wheat flour
• 2 ½ cups fresh bread crumbs
• 4 ounces shredded suet
• 3 eggs
• beaten
• 1 small carrot
• grated
• 1 apple - peeled
• cored and shredded
• ½ cup dark brown sugar
• ½ cup chopped blanched almonds
• 2 ounces preserved stem ginger in syrup
• chopped
• ⅛ cup ground almonds
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• ⅜ cup halved candied cherries
• ⅓ cup raisins
• ⅜ cup dried currants
• ⅜ cup golden raisins
• 4 ounces candied mixed fruit peel
• chopped
• 4 plums
• pitted and chopped
• 1 lemon
• juiced and zested
• 1 ½ teaspoons mixed spice
• ¾ teaspoon baking powder
• ½ cup ale

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large bowl, combine flour, bread crumbs, suet, eggs, carrot, apple, brown sugar, chopped blanched almonds, stem ginger, ground almonds, cherries, raisins, currants, golden raisins, mixed peel, plums, lemon juice and zest, mixed spice, baking powder and ale
2. Let each family member take a turn stirring and make a wish
3. If you have used more dry fruit than fresh, add a little extra ale to make the mixture less stiff
4. Grease 2 large or 4 small pudding basins
5. Fill with pudding mixture about 7/8 full
6. Cover tightly with greased waxed paper, then foil; secure with string
7. Stand pudding on a trivet in a large pot of boiling water that reaches halfway up the sides of the pudding basin
8. Steam puddings over medium-low heat in boiling water 10 hours for large puddings, 5 hours for small puddings, topping off water regularly until quite firm and set
9. If not serving immediately, let cool completely, then replace covers with fresh waxed paper and foil and store in a cool, dry place, basting from time to time with rum or brandy, for up to 3 months
10. To serve, reheat by steaming 2 to 3 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 32mg 11%, Sodium 69mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 6mg 31%, Calcium 50mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 201mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/24227/christmas-plum-pudding/

============================================================

RECIPE 455: Plum Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 2-quart baking dish
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Cobblers/

INGREDIENTS:
• 12 plums
• pitted and halved
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup water
• 2 tablespoons tapioca
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 2 ¼ cups all-purpose baking mix
• 3 tablespoons white sugar
• ⅔ cup milk
• 3 tablespoons margarine
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. In a 2 quart baking dish, stir together plums, 1 cup sugar, water, tapioca and cinnamon
3. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. (You can also cook the plum mixture in the microwave for 15 minutes.) Raise oven temperature to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
4. In a medium bowl, stir together baking mix, 3 tablespoons sugar, milk and melted margarine to form a biscuit dough
5. Drop dough by spoonfuls onto plum mixture
6. Bake in preheated oven 10 minutes, until golden brown
7. Let cool slightly before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 3g 16%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 641mg 28%, Total Carbohydrate 86g 31%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 55g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 13mg 63%, Calcium 113mg 9%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 310mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/24053/plum-pudding/

============================================================

RECIPE 456: My Mother-in-Law's Plum Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup pitted
• chopped plums
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• ½ cup margarine
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 eggs
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon baking soda
• ⅓ cup plain yogurt
• ¼ cup brown sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spray a 9x5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray, or line with parchment paper
3. Sprinkle chopped plums with 1 tablespoon of flour in a bowl, and toss to coat
4. In a large bowl, beat the margarine, white sugar, and vanilla extract with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
5. Beat in the eggs
6. In another bowl, sift together 1 1/2 cup of flour with salt and baking soda
7. Stir the dry ingredients into the egg mixture, alternating with yogurt until the mixture forms a smooth batter
8. Lightly stir in the flour-coated plums, and pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan
9. Sprinkle the top of the batter with brown sugar
10. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes
11. Remove from oven, and let cool in the pan 10 to 15 minutes before removing from pan for slicing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 3g 13%, Cholesterol 47mg 16%, Sodium 343mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 51g 19%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 39mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 112mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215130/my-mother-in-laws-plum-bread/

============================================================

RECIPE 457: Old Fashioned Prune Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 Bundt or tube pan
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Coffee Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup vegetable oil
• 3 eggs
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon ground allspice
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 cup buttermilk
• 1 ¼ teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 cup prunes
• pitted and chopped
• 1 ½ cups chopped pecans
• ¾ cup butter
• ¾ cup buttermilk
• 1 ½ teaspoons dark corn syrup
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour Bundt or tube pan
3. In a medium bowl, mix together flour, soda, salt, allspice, cinnamon and nutmeg
4. In a large bowl, combine oil, eggs and 1 1/2 cup sugar
5. Beat 2 minutes at medium speed
6. Add flour mixture, alternating with 1 cup buttermilk, starting and ending with dry ingredients. beat well after each addition
7. Stir in prunes, pecans and 1 1/4 teaspoon vanilla
8. Pour into greased and floured bundt or tube pan and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 1 hour or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the center
9. Make large, deep holes in hot cake and pour topping in holes and on top of cake a little at a time, giving it time to soak in
10. For the topping: In saucepan, over medium heat, cook butter, 3/4 cup buttermilk, corn syrup and 1 1/2 cup sugar until sugar and butter melt
11. Remove from heat and add 2 teaspoons vanilla and stir

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 42g 53%, Saturated Fat 11g 56%, Cholesterol 78mg 26%, Sodium 438mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 80g 29%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 59g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 76mg 6%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 264mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8323/old-fashioned-prune-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 458: Baby Food: Plum
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 1/2 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Everyday Cooking/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 plums - peeled
• pitted
• and cut into small chunks

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer
2. Bring water to a boil
3. Add plums, cover, and steam until tender, about 10 minutes
4. Transfer plums to a food processor and blend, adding water from the saucepan as needed, until desired consistency is reached
5. Allow pureed plums to reach room temperature before serving or freezing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Total Carbohydrate 5g 2%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 4mg 21%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 69mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/247144/baby-food-plum/

RECIPE 459: Easy Plum Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• at room temperature
• 2 large eggs
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 pinch salt
• 12 medium Italian plums
• halved and pitted
• 1 ½ tablespoons cinnamon sugar
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 10-inch springform pan
3. Combine sugar and butter in a large bowl and beat with an electric mixer until creamy
4. Add eggs, 1 at a time, and beat well after each addition
5. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl and sift on top of the butter mixture
6. Mix to combine
7. Transfer batter into the prepared springform pan and smooth out
8. Set plums inside batter, cut-side up, and sprinkle evenly with cinnamon sugar
9. Bake in preheated oven on the lowest rack until a skewer comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes
10. Serve warm or cool to room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 77mg 26%, Sodium 100mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 9mg 47%, Calcium 52mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 193mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/283464/easy-plum-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 460: Tangy Plum Liqueur
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 80
Yield: 10 cups
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 21 days 1 hrs
Rating: 3.7/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Liqueur Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 16 cups black or red plums
• pitted and cut into eighths
• 3 ¼ cups white sugar
• divided
• 3 cups 100 proof vodka
• 1 ½ tablespoons vanilla extract
• divided
• 1 orange peel in pieces
• divided

DIRECTIONS:
1. Layer half the plums into the bottom of a very large jar with a lid, pressing the plums down as tightly as possible
2. Pour half the sugar over the plums, then half the vodka over the sugar
3. Sprinkle on half the vanilla extract, and place about half the orange peel pieces into the jar
4. Layer the rest of the plums into the jar, pressing them down, and top them with the remaining sugar, vodka, vanilla extract, and orange peel pieces
5. Screw on the jar lid
6. Using an unscented candle, drip a coating of wax around the jar lid to prevent leaking
7. Cover the jar with a dark-colored towel
8. Place the jar on its side in a dark, cool place, and turn the jar every day for 21 days, replacing the towel to keep out light
9. After 21 days, strain out the liqueur from the plums and peel with a fine strainer lined with cheesecloth, and bottle the liqueur in attractive bottles with tight-fitting caps

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 16%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 53mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215134/tangy-plum-liqueur/

============================================================

RECIPE 461: Plum Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• ⅔ cup butter
• 2 eggs
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 3 tablespoons milk
• ½ teaspoon lemon zest
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• ¼ cup packed brown sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ⅓ cup chopped hazelnuts
• 1 teaspoon lemon zest
• 3 tablespoons butter
• 5 cups plums
• pitted and sliced
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¼ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. To Make Crust: In a large bowl combine 3 cups flour, 3/4 cups white sugar, baking powder, and 1/8 teaspoon salt
3. Mix thoroughly, then cut in 2/3 cup butter or margarine with a pastry blender, until pieces are the size of small peas
4. Stir in eggs, vanilla extract, milk and lemon zest
5. Mix just until all ingredients are combined
6. Allow dough to rest in refrigerator
7. To Make Streusel Topping: In a medium bowl mix 1/2 cup flour, brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon salt, chopped nuts, and grated lemon zest
8. Work in butter or margarine with fingers until all ingredients are well combined
9. To Make Fruit Filling: Place pitted and sliced fruit in a large bowl
10. In a small bowl, mix remaining sugar, flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg until thoroughly combined
11. Pour over fruit and stir gently until all fruit is evenly coated
12. Roll out pie crust and place in a 9 inch pie pan
13. Trim and flute edges, then pour in fruit filling
14. Evenly cover fruit with streusel topping and bake in preheated oven for 45 to 55 minutes
15. Serve warm, or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 13g 67%, Cholesterol 99mg 33%, Sodium 424mg 18%, Total Carbohydrate 109g 40%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 62g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 11mg 53%, Calcium 136mg 10%, Iron 4mg 20%, Potassium 303mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15834/plum-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 462: Plum Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch cake
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Coffee Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 eggs
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon lemon zest
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• 1 ¼ cups plums
• pitted and quartered

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour one 9-inch tube pan
3. Separate the eggs
4. In a small bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form, and set aside
5. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar
6. Beat in the egg yolks and the lemon zest
7. Stir together the flour and baking powder and then blend the flour mixture into the creamed mixture
8. Gently fold in the egg whites
9. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan
10. There will only be a little over an inch of batter
11. Arrange the plums, skin side down, attractively over the batter
12. Bake in preheated oven until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes
13. Transfer to a cooling rack and allow to cool before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 17%, Saturated Fat 8g 40%, Cholesterol 100mg 33%, Sodium 139mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 3mg 14%, Calcium 35mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 86mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7792/plum-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 463: Roasted Pork Tenderloin with Fresh Plum Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Pork/Pork Tenderloin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pork tenderloin
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• 1 red onion
• sliced
• 2 shallots
• sliced
• 3 fresh thyme sprigs
• or more to taste
• 2 firm plums
• pitted and each cut into 4 wedges
• 1 cup water
• 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
• 1 teaspoon cold butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Generously season pork tenderloin with salt and black pepper
3. Heat oil in a large, oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat
4. Cook tenderloin until browned on all sides, 2 to 4 minutes per side
5. Transfer tenderloin to a plate
6. Saute onion with a pinch of salt in the same skillet until just softening, 3 to 5 minutes
7. Add shallots, reduce heat to medium, and cook and stir until shallots and onion are golden brown and caramelized, about 10 minutes
8. Stir thyme into onion mixture; place tenderloin over onion mixture, and set plum quarters, skin-side down, around pork tenderloin
9. Transfer skillet to preheated oven
10. Cook until pork is slightly pink in the center, about 20 minutes
11. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
12. Transfer pork and plums to a plate
13. Place skillet over medium-high heat and pour water and balsamic vinegar into onion mixture
14. Bring mixture to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon
15. Cook and stir until liquid is reduced by half, 5 to 10 minutes; remove from heat
16. Whisk butter into mixture until melted and sauce is shiny
17. Pour sauce over pork and plums

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 4g 21%, Cholesterol 104mg 35%, Sodium 182mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 37g, Vitamin C 16mg 81%, Calcium 54mg 4%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 929mg 20%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/239147/roasted-pork-tenderloin-with-fresh-plum-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 464: Plum Kuchen
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Coffee Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons margarine
• 2 eggs
• beaten
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 10 Italian plums
• halved and pitted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour an 7x11-inch baking dish
3. Beat 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons margarine together in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy
4. Mix eggs, 1 cup flour, baking powder, and salt into creamed margarine mixture; stir in vanilla
5. Pour batter into the prepared baking dish
6. Arrange plums, skin side-down, atop batter
7. Mix 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup flour, 3 tablespoons margarine, and cinnamon together in a bowl until crumbly; spoon over batter and plums
8. Bake in the preheated oven until plums are softened, about 35 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 153mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 44g 16%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 5mg 26%, Calcium 36mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 118mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/233232/plum-kuchen/

RECIPE 465: Plum Pudding Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Dessert Sauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons margarine
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• 2 cups milk
• 2 teaspoons all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine margarine, sugar and the egg
2. Pour in milk and cook until mixture begins to bubble; be careful not to scald
3. Stir in flour and vanilla; mix well and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 56mg 19%, Sodium 130mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Total Sugars 44g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 152mg 12%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 206mg 4%

RECIPE 466: Plum Clafouti
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/French/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 tablespoons white sugar
• divided
• 14 Italian prune plums
• halved and pitted
• 3 eggs
• 1 ⅓ cups milk
• ⅔ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons grated lemon zest
• 2 teaspoons vanilla
• 1 pinch salt
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Butter a 10 inch pie plate, and sprinkle 1 tablespoon of sugar over the bottom
3. Arrange the plum halves, cut side down, so that they cover the entire bottom of the pie plate
4. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of sugar over the top of the plums
5. In a blender, combine the remaining 3 tablespoons of sugar, eggs, milk, flour, lemon zest, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt
6. Process until smooth, about 2 minutes
7. Pour over the fruit in the pan
8. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes in the preheated oven, or until firm and lightly browned
9. Let stand 5 minutes before slicing
10. Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 73mg 24%, Sodium 63mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 35g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 12mg 58%, Calcium 68mg 5%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 282mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/41234/plum-clafouti/

============================================================

RECIPE 467: Plum Butter
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 32
Yield: 4 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 6 hrs 45 mins
Total Time: 18 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Fruit Butter Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 ½ pounds plums
• pitted and diced
• ¼ cup water
• or as needed
• 1 cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place plums in a large stockpot and add enough water to cover the bottom of stockpot; cook over very low heat, stirring occasionally, until plums are broken down, about 2 hours
2. Remove stockpot from heat and cool for 2 hours
3. Return stockpot to stovetop over low heat; cook gently for 2 to 3 hours
4. Remove from heat and keep at room temperature, 8 hours to overnight
5. Cook plums over low heat, stirring occasionally, about 2 hours
6. Remove from heat and let stand at room temperature for 2 hours
7. Bring plums to a boil; add sugar, lower heat, and simmer until thickened, about 15 minutes
8. Sterilize jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
9. Pack plum butter into hot jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top
10. Run a clean knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars to remove any air bubbles
11. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
12. Top with lids and screw on rings
13. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
14. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder
15. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
16. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
17. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process for 15 minutes
18. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
19. Press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
20. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 6mg 31%, Calcium 4mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 101mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/255523/plum-butter/

============================================================

RECIPE 468: Plum Blueberry Upside Down Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch round cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Blueberry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 3 tablespoons margarine
• ¼ cup brown sugar
• ⅓ cup margarine
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ¾ cup milk
• 4 black plums
• pitted and thinly sliced
• ¾ cup blueberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9 inch cake pan
3. Combine the flour, baking powder and salt
4. In the prepared pan, combine 3 tablespoons margarine and brown sugar
5. Place pan inside the preheated oven until the margarine melts and begins to bubble
6. In a large bowl, cream together the 1/3 cup margarine and 1 cup white sugar until light and fluffy
7. Beat in the egg, then stir in the vanilla
8. Beat in the flour mixture alternately with the milk, mixing just until incorporated
9. Arrange plums around the edges of the prepared pan, overlapping slightly
10. Distribute the blueberries in the center
11. Pour batter into prepared pan, covering fruit completely
12. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean
13. Allow to cool 15 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 196mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 55mg 4%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 94mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/23730/plum-blueberry-upside-down-cake/

RECIPE 469: Spicy Oven-Roasted Plums
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Everyday Cooking/Vegan/Side Dishes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 plums
• halved and pitted
• ½ cup orange juice
• 2 tablespoons packed brown sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ⅛ teaspoon cumin
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cardamom
• ¼ cup toasted slivered almonds (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease a shallow baking dish with cooking spray
3. Place plums, cut-side up, in a single layer in the prepared baking dish
4. Whisk together orange juice, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, cumin, and cardamom in a bowl; drizzle over plums
5. Bake in the preheated oven until plums are hot and sauce is bubbly, about 20 minutes
6. Top with toasted almonds

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Sodium 3mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 22mg 109%, Calcium 34mg 3%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 221mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/147069/spicy-oven-roasted-plums/

RECIPE 470: Pork with Plum Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Pork Chop Recipes/Boneless/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
• 4 boneless pork chops
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 1 large clove garlic
• minced
• ¼ cup soy sauce
• 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• ¼ teaspoon ground ginger
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cloves
• 5 fresh plums
• pitted and coarsely chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
2. Season pork chops with salt and pepper; cook in hot oil until browned, about 2 minutes per side
3. Remove pork chops to a plate
4. Reduce the heat to medium; cook and stir garlic in the skillet just until fragrant, 10 to 20 seconds
5. Pour in soy sauce, red wine vinegar, brown sugar, ginger, and cloves; bring to a boil
6. Stir the mixture until the brown sugar dissolves; add plums
7. Cover the skillet, reduce the heat, and simmer the mixture until the sauce has thickened and plums are very soft, about 45 minutes
8. Mash plums with a potato masher to an applesauce-like texture
9. Place pork chops back into the pan and cook in the sauce until no longer pink in the middle, 10 to 15 minutes
10. A meat thermometer inserted into the middle of a chop should read 145 degrees (63 degrees C)

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 59mg 20%, Sodium 938mg 41%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 25g, Vitamin C 9mg 43%, Calcium 35mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 529mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215128/pork-with-plum-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 471: Prune Whip
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 4 cups
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ⅓ cups pitted prunes
• ⅓ cup water
• ⅓ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 6 egg whites
• ¼ teaspoon cream of tartar

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a medium saucepan, simmer the prunes in water until soft, drain and puree
2. Combine the puree in a saucepan with the sugar and heat until the sugar dissolves
3. Add the lemon juice and vanilla
4. Beat the egg whites until frothy, add the cream of tarter, and beat until stiff
5. Fold the prune puree into the egg whites
6. Pour into a buttered and sugared 2 quart baking dish and bake in a preheated 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) oven until nicely browned
7. Refrigerate and serve chilled with whipping cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 57mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 35g 13%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 22mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 359mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/14265/prune-whip/

============================================================

RECIPE 472: Fresh Fruit Frangipane Tart
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/French/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 puff pastry rectangles

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Place 1 piece of puff pastry on a baking sheet lined with a silicone mat or parchment paper
3. Lightly moisten one of the short edges with water
4. Connect the end of other puff pastry to the moistened edge
5. Press pieces together to form a long rectangle, trimming off loose ends with a dough scraper as needed
6. Cut third puff pastry piece lengthwise into 1-inch strips
7. Moisten the outer edges of the long rectangle with your finger; stick pastry strips on top
8. Poke shallow holes all over bottom of dough using a fork
9. Do not prick the raised border
10. Bake pastry shell in the preheated oven until it starts to turn golden brown, about 15 minutes
11. Remove from oven
12. Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
13. Readjust the borders and push the bottom down with the flat side of a fork
14. Let cool completely while preparing filling
15. Place butter and 1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar in a bowl; smear together using a spatula until combined
16. Whisk in egg until mixture is creamy
17. Add almond flour, salt, vanilla extract, and almond extract
18. Mix thoroughly
19. Cut each pluot into 6 wedges
20. Fill pastry shell with almond paste
21. Stick pluots snugly, but not too deeply, into filling
22. Bake in the preheated oven until browned and almond filling is set, 30 to 40 minutes
23. Transfer tart onto a wire rack and let cool completely, at least 40 minutes
24. Combine apricot jam and water in a microwave-safe bowl
25. Bring to a boil in the microwave
26. Let cool until warm
27. Brush glaze over cooled tart

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 6g 31%, Cholesterol 29mg 10%, Sodium 204mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 10mg 1%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 41mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/265860/fresh-fruit-frangipane-tart/

============================================================

RECIPE 473: Plum Dumplings
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 25 dumplings
Prep Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/

INGREDIENTS:
• 25 Italian prune plums
• 3 tablespoons sugar
• 2 large potatoes
• peeled and quartered

DIRECTIONS:
1. To pit the plums, slice them almost in half, open, and remove pit
2. Place about 1/3 teaspoon of sugar in the hollow of each plum; close the plum, and place in a bowl
3. Place potatoes in a large pot with enough water to cover
4. Bring to a boil, and cook until tender
5. When cool enough to handle, mash potatoes with a fork or potato masher
6. You will need 1 cup of mashed potatoes
7. Set aside, and keep warm
8. To make the dough, sift the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together into a pile on a breadboard
9. Make a well in the center; add 1 cup mashed potatoes, egg yolks, and shortening into the well, and work in until the dough is pliable and smooth
10. When dough is thoroughly kneaded, roll it out onto a floured board to a thickness of about 1/4 inch
11. Cut into roughly 4-inch rounds with a biscuit cutter
12. Holding one piece of dough in your hand, place a whole pitted plum in the center
13. Place another piece of dough on top, and press to seal the edges of the dough together
14. Make sure there are no leaks, or the plum will come out during cooking
15. To cook, bring a deep pot of salted water to boil
16. Place dumplings in water, and boil gently for about 10 minutes
17. Meanwhile, to make the sauce, melt butter in a large frying pan over medium heat
18. Stir in brown sugar. (If you like, stir in some of the juice that collects in the bowl of pitted plums.) Stir in a small amount of bread crumbs to slightly thicken the sauce
19. When dumplings are done, remove them from boiling water, and place them in the frying pan, and turn to coat the dumplings
20. Serve hot with extra sauce poured over them

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 7g 36%, Cholesterol 86mg 29%, Sodium 236mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 94g 34%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 53g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 30mg 151%, Calcium 75mg 6%, Iron 3mg 16%, Potassium 661mg 14%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/90225/plum-dumplings/

============================================================

RECIPE 474: Damson Plum Cardamom Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 100
Yield: 12 pints
Cook Time: 5 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 7 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 5 pounds fresh Damson or Damask plums
• 1 cup water
• 12 whole cardamom pods
• 4 cups white sugar
• ¼ teaspoon butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a sink full of cool water, rinse and de-stem the plums
2. Place them in a thick-bottomed pan suitable for slow cooking and deep enough to allow frothing when the plums begin to boil
3. Add the water and cardamom pods and bring the mixture to a low boil over medium heat
4. Turn heat to low for a slow simmer and allow the fruit to cook down uncovered for 1 1/2 hours
5. Allow the plums to cool
6. To pit the plums, strain the cooled plums with a colander, pressing the juice out with your hands and collecting it in a large bowl
7. Pick up the pit-and-fruit slurry in the colander by small handfuls and squeeze the plum pulp and skins gently into the bowl with the syrup, retaining the pits in the palm of your hand and then discarding them
8. Put the plums back into the original pot with the sugar and butter
9. Cook at a very low simmer until the mixture begins to thicken, about 4 hours
10. To test for adequate development of pectin, drop a spoonful of the jam on a plate and put it in the refrigerator for a few minutes: the mixture should be soft-set and no longer syrupy
11. Ladle the hot jam into hot, sterile jars, wipe the rims clean, place sterile lids on, and tighten the screw caps
12. Allow the jars to cool to room temperature and check to be sure that each jar has sealed

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 37mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/210194/damson-plum-cardamom-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 475: Fresh Fruit Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup sliced fresh peaches
• ¾ cup peeled
• cored and sliced apple
• ¾ cup peeled
• cored and sliced pear
• ½ cup blueberries
• ½ cup pitted and sliced cherries
• ½ cup pitted and sliced plums
• 1 egg
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup milk
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 tablespoons butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 2 quart baking dish
3. Arrange the peaches, apple, pear, blueberries, cherries, and plums in the prepared baking dish
4. In a medium bowl, beat egg, sugar, and milk
5. In a separate bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, and salt; stir into the egg mixture
6. Stir in vanilla and melted butter
7. Cover the fruit with the batter mixture
8. Bake 30 minutes in the preheated oven
9. Cobbler should be bubbly and lightly browned
10. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 3g 15%, Cholesterol 42mg 14%, Sodium 320mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 54g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 14mg 71%, Calcium 75mg 6%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 157mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12279/fresh-fruit-cobbler/

RECIPE 476: Prune Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 bundt cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Bundt Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup pitted prunes
• ½ cup water
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 tablespoon ground allspice
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup vegetable oil
• 1 cup buttermilk
• 2 eggs
• lightly beaten
• 1 ½ cups chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine prunes and water in a small saucepan over medium-high heat
2. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until prunes are tender, about 5 minutes
3. Drain and set aside
4. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
5. Grease and flour a fluted tube pan (such as a Bundt®)
6. Mix flour, 1 1/2 cups sugar, allspice, baking soda, nutmeg, cinnamon, and salt together in a mixing bowl
7. Combine vegetable oil, 1 cup buttermilk, and eggs in a separate bowl; pour them into the flour mixture
8. Mix until fully incorporated
9. Use an electric mixer to blend in the drained prunes; the mixer will break them up a bit
10. Stir in the chopped pecans
11. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in preheated oven until a tester comes out clean, about 45 minutes
12. Remove cake from oven and allow it to cool for at least 10 minutes on a wire rack
13. To make icing, combine 1 cup sugar, margarine, 1/2 cup buttermilk, vanilla extract, and corn syrup in a saucepan and bring it to a boil over medium-high heat
14. Boil for a full 5 minutes, stirring occasionally
15. Invert cake onto a platter and pour hot icing over the cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 37g 47%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 29mg 10%, Sodium 336mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 73g 27%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 51g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 69mg 5%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 252mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229642/prune-cake/

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 1
Yield: 1 serving
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Cereals/Oatmeal Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup water
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 5 dried pitted prunes
• chopped
• 1 teaspoon sugar substitute (such as Splenda)
• ¼ cup oat bran

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine water, cinnamon, prunes, and sugar substitute in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil; stir in the oat bran and boil for 2 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Sodium 10mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 7g 25%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 48mg 4%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 451mg 10%

RECIPE 478: Banana Plum Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/Banana Bread/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup margarine
• softened
• 2 eggs
• 2 ¾ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• 1 ½ cups mashed ripe bananas
• 1 cup plums
• pitted and chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. In a large bowl, mash the sugar and margarine together until creamy, and beat in the eggs
4. In a separate bowl, sift the flour with baking powder and baking soda
5. Stir the flour mixture into the egg mixture in thirds, alternating with the mashed bananas until the batter is smooth and well combined
6. Gently fold in the plums, and place the batter into the prepared baking dish
7. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 214mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 48mg 4%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 168mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215139/banana-plum-bread/

============================================================

RECIPE 479: Rachel's Sugar Plum Spice Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 120
Yield: 10 12-ounce jars
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 red plums
• pitted and chopped
• 2 cups chopped fresh pineapple
• ½ cup apple juice
• ½ (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate
• 1 lemon
• juiced
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cloves
• 1 teaspoon ground allspice
• 1 (1.75 ounce) package powdered fruit pectin
• 1 tablespoon butter
• 8 cups white sugar
• 4 drops red food coloring

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the plums, pineapple, apple juice, orange juice concentrate, and lemon juice into a large pot over medium-low heat, cover, and cook until the plums are soft, 15 to 20 minutes
2. Mash the plums and pineapple with a potato masher until thoroughly broken up, but leave small chunks of fruit in the mixture
3. With the fruit mixture at a slow simmer, stir in the cloves, allspice, pectin, and butter (to reduce foaming)
4. Raise heat to high and bring the mixture to a full, rolling boil for 1 minute, stirring constantly
5. Mix in the sugar, stirring constantly, and cook for 1 more minute at a full, rolling boil
6. Remove from heat, stir in red food coloring until even in color, and skim off any foam
7. Sterilize 12-ounce canning jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
8. Pack the plum jam into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
9. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
10. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
11. Top with lids, and screw on rings
12. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
13. Bring to a boil over high heat, then carefully lower the jars into the pot using a holder
14. Leave a 2 inch space between the jars
15. Pour in more boiling water if necessary until the water level is at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
16. Bring the water to a full boil, cover the pot, and process for 10 minutes
17. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
18. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
19. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Cholesterol 0mg 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 5%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 4mg 20%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Potassium 24mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215135/rachels-sugar-plum-spice-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 480: Grandma Skeet's Prune Kolaches
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 20 kolaches
Prep Time: 55 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Bread/Yeast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup warm water
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 egg
• 2 tablespoons butter
• room temperature
• 3 cups bread flour
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 3 teaspoons bread machine yeast

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the warm water, salt, egg and 2 tablespoons butter in the pan of a bread machine
2. Add bread flour, and pour 1/4 cup sugar on the edge of the pan
3. Make a shallow hole in the flour and add the yeast
4. Close the lid, and set machine for the DOUGH cycle
5. While the dough is mixing, combine the prunes, prune juice, 1/4 cup sugar, cinnamon, cloves and lime juice in a saucepan
6. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, and simmer until prunes are soft and the sauce has thickened, about 15 minutes
7. Remove from heat and blend in a mixer or food processor until smooth
8. When the bread machine signals the end of the dough cycle, transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface
9. Divide the dough into 20 small egg-sized pieces
10. Cover with greased plastic wrap, and set aside for 10 minutes
11. In a small bowl, mix together 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup flour
12. Stir in melted butter and 1 teaspoon cinnamon to make a crumbly streusel
13. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
14. Grease a large baking sheet or line it with parchment paper
15. Shape the kolache dough into balls and place them on the prepared baking sheet
16. Press a shallow hole in the center of each one, and fill with prune filling
17. Top each of the kolaches with streusel
18. Let the kolaches rest until doubled in size, about 20 minutes
19. Bake until the tops are lightly browned, 14 to 16 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 139mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 17%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 21mg 2%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 241mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/65237/grandma-skeets-prune-kolaches/

============================================================

RECIPE 481: Potato Plum Dumplings
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 dumplings
Prep Time: 35 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/Austrian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 large russet potatoes
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 tablespoon butter
• softened
• 2 eggs
• beaten
• ¼ cup farina
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• or as needed
• 12 Italian prune plums
• 12 cubes white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• melted
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 cup dry bread crumbs
• additional melted butter and sugar for garnish (optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Scrub potatoes, and place them into a large pot with enough water to cover. bring to a boil, and cook until tender, about 40 minutes
2. Drain, and cool
3. When potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel, and press through a ricer into a large bowl
4. Set aside to cool
5. This part of the process can be done as much as one day in advance
6. In a large bowl, mix together the prepared potatoes, salt, egg, and 1 tablespoon of butter until well blended
7. Gradually stir in the farina, and then the flour
8. If dough is still wet, more flour can be mixed in
9. Turn dough out onto a floured surface, and knead until smooth, about 5 to 10 minutes
10. Split open each plum where it cracks, and remove the pit
11. Replace each pit with a sugar cube, and close
12. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to 1/4 inch thickness
13. Cut into twelve 3 inch squares
14. Place one plum into each square, and bring the corners around to the top
15. Pinch together all of the seams to seal
16. Bring a large pot of water to a slow boil
17. Place about 4 dumplings into the water at a time
18. Once they float to the surface, continue to cook them for about 5 more minutes
19. Transfer cooked dumplings to a covered bowl, and keep warm
20. Melt the remaining 1/2 cup of butter in a small skillet over medium heat
21. Stir in bread crumbs, and 1/4 cup of sugar
22. Continue to cook and stir until browned
23. Remove the bread crumbs to a plate, and roll warm dumplings in the mixture until entirely coated
24. To serve, place a dumpling or two on a plate, sprinkle with a little sugar and a little extra melted butter, if desired

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 54mg 18%, Sodium 244mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 53g 19%, Dietary Fiber 4g 16%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 31mg 153%, Calcium 44mg 3%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 668mg 14%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/48308/potato-plum-dumplings/

============================================================

RECIPE 482: Zwetschgendatschi (German Plum Sheet Cake)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 16 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/German/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 ¾ cups all-purpose flour
• 4 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons vanilla sugar
• 2 pinches salt
• 1 ⅓ cups unsalted butter
• room temperature and cut into chunks
• 2 large eggs
• 2 ¼ pounds Italian prune plums
• halved and pitted
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
• room temperature and cut into chunks
• 1 tablespoon sliced almonds (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine flour and baking powder in a large bowl
2. Mix in 1 cup sugar, vanilla sugar, and salt
3. Add 1 1/3 cups butter and eggs
4. Knead everything into a smooth dough
5. Shape dough into a ball, press flat, cover, and chill in the refrigerator 1 hour to overnight
6. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
7. Grease a baking sheet with butter
8. Cut halved plums in half again, without cutting all the way through, so they fan out
9. Roll pastry dough out on a lightly floured work surface
10. Line the bottom and sides of the prepared baking sheet with dough
11. Mix 2 tablespoons sugar and cinnamon together in a bowl
12. Arrange plums side by side on the pastry dough; very small plums should overlap
13. Dot plums with 2 tablespoons butter and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar and almonds
14. Bake in the preheated oven until pastry crust is lightly browned, 30 to 40 minutes
15. Remove from oven
16. Allow plum cake to cool, then cut into squares
17. Serve lukewarm or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 11g 55%, Cholesterol 68mg 23%, Sodium 153mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 51g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 6mg 31%, Calcium 88mg 7%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 157mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/265475/zwetschgendatschi-german-plum-sheet-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 483: Far Breton
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/French/

INGREDIENTS:
• 9 ounces pitted prunes
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• ⅝ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon vanilla sugar
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 pinch salt
• 4 eggs
• 3 cups whole milk
• 2 tablespoons rum

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
2. Grease a shallow 2 quart baking dish
3. Place the pitted prunes in a saucepan with enough water to cover
4. Bring to a simmer, and cook until the prunes are tender but still hold their shape, about 10 minutes
5. Drain the prunes and arrange them in the bottom of the prepared baking dish
6. Whisk together the flour, white sugar, vanilla sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl
7. Whisk in the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition
8. Gradually pour in the milk, stirring vigorously with a wooden spoon until combined
9. Stir in the rum
10. Pour the batter evenly over the prunes
11. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
12. Reduce the oven temperature to 400 degrees F, and bake until the filling is firm, has risen a little, and the top is browned, about 30 minutes
13. Serve warm or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 3g 13%, Cholesterol 102mg 34%, Sodium 134mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 53g 19%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 34g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 169mg 13%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 416mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/134592/far-breton/

============================================================

RECIPE 484: Drozdzowka (Polish Yeast Plum Cake)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/Eastern European/Polish/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup whole milk
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 2 (0.6 ounce) cakes cake yeast
• 1 ⅓ cups margarine
• ½ cup dry bread crumbs
• 4 eggs
• 1 ⅛ cups white sugar
• 8 cups all-purpose flour
• 4 teaspoons vanilla sugar
• 1 cup whole milk
• or as needed
• 6 cups fresh plums
• pitted and quartered
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ½ cup butter
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a saucepan over very low heat, warm up 1/2 cup of milk to no more than 100 degrees F (38 degrees C); stir in 1 tablespoon of flour and 1 tablespoon of sugar
2. Remove from heat and transfer to a bowl
3. Crumble the cake yeast into the milk mixture, and gently stir until the mixture becomes creamy
4. Cover the pan with a cloth, and set aside in a warm place until the yeast forms a spongy texture, 20 to 30 minutes
5. Melt margarine in a saucepan over low heat; remove from heat and allow to cool to lukewarm
6. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
7. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish, and sprinkle with bread crumbs
8. Place eggs and 1 1/8 cup sugar into a blender, and process until the mixture is yellow and fluffy
9. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together 8 cups of flour with vanilla sugar
10. Stir in the egg mixture, activated yeast mixture, and lukewarm margarine; start kneading 1 cup milk, or as needed, into the dough, a little at a time, until the dough stops sticking to your fingers and becomes smooth and even
11. Knead for at least 15 minutes, working to incorporate as much air as possible into the dough as you knead
12. Press the dough evenly into the prepared baking sheet, and arrange the plums over the top of the dough
13. In a bowl, cut together 1 1/2 cup flour, the butter, and 1/2 cup of sugar with a pastry cutter until the mixture resembles fine crumbs; sprinkle the streusel mixture over the plums
14. Dust streusel with cinnamon, if desired
15. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, 1 hour to 1 hour and 10 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 20%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Cholesterol 43mg 14%, Sodium 179mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 61g 22%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 4mg 20%, Calcium 41mg 3%, Iron 3mg 15%, Potassium 162mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215136/drozdzowka-polish-yeast-plum-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 485: Judy's Brown Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 200
Yield: 15 half-pint jars
Prep Time: 2 hrs
Cook Time: 3 hrs
Total Time: 6 hrs
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 cups peeled
• cored
• and roughly chopped tart apples
• 10 cups pitted and halved fresh prune plums
• 5 cups chopped onions
• 6 cups malt vinegar
• 5 cups white sugar
• ½ cup salt
• ½ cup Worcestershire sauce
• 4 cloves garlic
• minced
• 2 teaspoons ground ginger
• 2 teaspoons ground nutmeg
• 2 teaspoons ground allspice
• 2 teaspoons ground cayenne pepper
• 15 half-pint canning jars with lids and rings

DIRECTIONS:
1. Working in batches, place the apples, plums and onions into the work bowl of a food processor, and grind until fine
2. Transfer the ground fruit and onions into a large pot, and stir in the malt vinegar, sugar, salt, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, ginger, nutmeg, allspice, and cayenne pepper until the mixture is well combined
3. Bring to a simmer over low heat, and simmer until brown and thickened, about 3 to 4 hours
4. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
5. Pack the sauce into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
6. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
7. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
8. Top with lids, and screw on rings
9. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot, and fill halfway with water
10. Bring to a boil over high heat, then carefully lower the jars into the pot using a holder
11. Leave a 2 inch space between the jars
12. Pour in more boiling water if necessary until the water level is at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
13. Bring the water to a full boil, cover the pot, and process for 10 minutes
14. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
15. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
16. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 9mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 8g 3%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 2mg 12%, Calcium 4mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 39mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215124/judys-brown-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 486: Plum Custard Kuchen
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 9
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch square pan
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Coffee Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ cup butter
• 2 tablespoons heavy cream
• 1 egg
• 2 ½ cups pitted and sliced plums
• ½ cup heavy cream
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. In a large bowl, mix flour, 1 tablespoon sugar and baking powder in a bowl
3. Cut in butter until mixture looks like coarse crumbs
4. Stir in 2 tablespoons whipping cream and 1 egg
5. Press in bottom of ungreased 9-inch square pan and arrange plums over the top
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes
7. While cake is baking, in a bowl, combine 1/2 cup whipping cream, 1/2 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1 egg
8. Beat well, and pour mixture over plums and bake an additional 20 to 30 minutes or until custard is set
9. Serve warm or cool
10. Store in refrigerator

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 11g 54%, Cholesterol 91mg 30%, Sodium 135mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 11%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 5mg 23%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 118mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/26053/plum-custard-kuchen/

============================================================

RECIPE 487: Pork Tenderloin with Balsamic Plum Reduction
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Pork/Pork Tenderloin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pork tenderloin
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 1 ½ plums
• pitted and chopped
• 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• 1 tablespoon honey
• 2 tablespoons blueberry juice (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with foil
3. Season the pork tenderloin with salt and pepper
4. Heat olive oil in a heavy skillet over high heat until the oil shimmers; gently lay the tenderloin into the hot oil
5. After about 1 minute, gently loosen the meat from the bottom of the skillet, if necessary
6. Cook until the pork is seared a golden brown color, about 3 minutes per side
7. Transfer the pork to the lined baking sheet
8. Roast the seared tenderloin in the preheated oven until a thermometer inserted into the center of the pork reads at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), about 15 minutes
9. Remove the pork from the oven and allow to rest for 10 minutes before slicing into medallions
10. Cook the plums, balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, honey, and blueberry juice in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring often, until the plums are soft, about 10 minutes
11. Transfer the sauce to a blender and blend until smooth
12. Return the sauce to the saucepan and simmer until reduced and thickened to the consistency of apple butter, about 5 more minutes
13. Spoon plum sauce over the sliced pork to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 49mg 16%, Sodium 42mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 18g, Vitamin C 2mg 12%, Calcium 11mg 1%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 334mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215141/pork-tenderloin-with-balsamic-plum-reduction/

============================================================

RECIPE 488: Plum Pudding II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 2 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup butter
• ⅓ cup brown sugar
• 1 cup milk
• 12 dates
• pitted and chopped
• ½ cup raisins
• ¼ cup dried currants
• ¼ cup candied mixed fruit peel
• chopped
• 1 orange
• zested
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 cup self-rising flour
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 pinch salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Well grease a pudding mold
2. In a large saucepan combine butter, sugar, milk, dates, raisins, currants, mixed fruit peel and zest of the orange; bring to a boil
3. Remove from heat and stir in baking soda
4. Sift in the flour, cinnamon and salt; mix gently until blended
5. Pour into prepared pudding mold
6. Cover with a double layer of greased wax paper and steam for 2 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 27%, Cholesterol 24mg 8%, Sodium 549mg 24%, Total Carbohydrate 55g 20%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 10mg 50%, Calcium 149mg 11%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 275mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/24302/plum-pudding-ii/

============================================================

RECIPE 489: Peach and Plum Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9-inch square cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 3.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon unsalted butter
• or as needed
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• divided
• 1 stick unsalted butter
• room temperature
• 2 extra large eggs
• 1 cup plain yogurt
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 5 medium ripe plums
• pitted and sliced
• 3 large ripe peaches - peeled
• pitted
• and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Butter a 9-inch square baking pan
3. Beat 1 cup sugar and 1 stick butter together using an electric mixer until light and fluffy
4. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating after each addition
5. Add yogurt and vanilla extract; mix until batter is smooth
6. Add flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt to the batter and mix until just combined
7. Combine remaining 1/2 cup sugar and cinnamon in a separate bowl
8. Spread batter evenly into the prepared pan and sprinkle with 1/2 of the cinnamon-sugar mixture
9. Top batter with plums and peaches; sprinkle with remaining cinnamon-sugar mixture
10. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 45 minutes to 1 hour, making sure not to overbake
11. Serve warm or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 12%, Saturated Fat 6g 28%, Cholesterol 58mg 19%, Sodium 273mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 17%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 17mg 85%, Calcium 78mg 6%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 142mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/275173/peach-and-plum-cake/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Fillings/Fruit Fillings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 1 (16 ounce) can stewed prunes
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
• 1 tablespoon lime juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Chop pecans and prunes together in a blender or food processor, stir in the sugar, cinnamon, cloves and lime juice
2. Use as a filling for cookies or pastries

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 7g 3%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 62mg 1%
