RECIPE 491: Plum Chipotle Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 128
Yield: 8 half-pint jars
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Total Time: 4 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/

INGREDIENTS:
• 5 quarts very ripe plums
• pitted
• or as needed
• 4 cloves garlic
• pressed
• 1 onion
• finely chopped
• 6 cups white sugar
• ½ cup apple cider vinegar
• 2 tablespoons Southwest chipotle seasoning
• 1 tablespoon roasted garlic seasoning
• 1 jalapeno pepper
• finely chopped (remove seeds for milder flavor if desired)
• 7 teaspoons salt
• 1 teaspoon liquid smoke flavoring
• 8 half-pint canning jars with lids and rings

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the plums, a few at a time, into a colander set over a large bowl
2. With gloved hands, squeeze the plums in the colander, forcing the juice through the holes of the colander
3. Discard spent pulp, and repeat to produce 8 cups of plum juice
4. Pour 3/4 cup of plum juice into a small saucepan with garlic and onion, place over medium heat, and bring to a boil
5. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes
6. Pour the juice-onion mixture into a large pot, and add the remaining 7 1/2 cups of plum juice
7. Stir in the sugar, apple cider vinegar, Southwest chipotle seasoning, roasted garlic seasoning, jalapeno pepper, salt, and liquid smoke flavoring until the sugar and salt have dissolved
8. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, reduce heat to a simmer, and cook the sauce down until thickened, about 1 1/2 hours
9. Stir frequently to prevent burning
10. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
11. Pack the sauce into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
12. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
13. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
14. Top with lids, and screw on rings
15. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
16. Bring to a boil over high heat, then carefully lower the jars into the pot using a holder
17. Leave a 2 inch space between the jars
18. Pour in more boiling water if necessary until the water level is at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
19. Bring the water to a full boil, cover the pot, and process for 10 minutes
20. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
21. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
22. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 179mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 14%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 45mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215144/plum-chipotle-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 492: Fruit-Stuffed Pork Loin
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 stuffed pork loin roast
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Pork/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup chopped pitted prunes
• ¾ cup chopped dried apricots
• 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger
• 1 teaspoon grated orange zest
• ½ teaspoon ground cumin
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 1 (4 pound) boneless pork loin roast
• butterflied
• ¼ cup packed brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons cider vinegar
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon mustard powder
• ½ cup water
• 1 teaspoon cornstarch
• 1 tablespoon water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Mix prunes, apricots, ginger, orange zest, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, and cinnamon in a bowl; season with salt and black pepper
3. Open pork roast and spoon stuffing down the center; fold meat over stuffing and tie securely in several places with kitchen twine
4. Set roast onto a rack in a roasting pan
5. Combine brown sugar, flour, cider vinegar, 1 teaspoon cumin, and mustard powder into a paste; spread brown sugar mixture over the roast
6. Bake in the preheated oven until a meat thermometer inserted into center of stuffing reads 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), about 1 1/2 hours
7. Transfer roast to a serving platter and tent with aluminum foil while you make gravy
8. Skim fat from roasting pan and transfer defatted drippings into a small saucepan
9. Pour 1/2 cup water into roasting pan and scrape up and dissolve any browned bits of food into water; pour into saucepan with pan juices
10. Bring pan juices to a boil over medium heat
11. Dissolve cornstarch in 1 tablespoon water in a small bowl and whisk cornstarch mixture into pan juices, stirring constantly until thickened, about 1 minute
12. Strain gravy into a gravy boat
13. Serve gravy with roast

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 7g 36%, Cholesterol 110mg 37%, Sodium 85mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 9%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 38g, Vitamin C 2mg 10%, Calcium 53mg 4%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 831mg 18%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/230418/fruit-stuffed-pork-loin/

============================================================

RECIPE 493: Plum Flummery
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 5
Yield: 5 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Mousse Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups plums
• pitted and sliced
• 1 tablespoon water (Optional)
• 1 (.25 ounce) package unflavored gelatin
• ½ cup hot water (Optional)
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• ½ cup evaporated milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the plums into a saucepan over medium-low heat, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the plums are soft, 5 to 10 minutes
2. If the mixture becomes too thick or starts to burn, add a tablespoon of water
3. Remove from heat, and allow to cool
4. Dissolve the gelatin in 1/2 cup of hot water in a bowl, and stir in the cooled plums, sugar, and lemon juice
5. Mix until the gelatin and sugar have dissolved
6. Chill the plum mixture in refrigerator until it begins to thicken, about 30 minutes
7. Whip the evaporated milk in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until thick, then gently spoon the whipped milk into the plum mixture
8. Beat again with electric mixer until the dessert is fluffy and well combined
9. Chill for at least 3 hours before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 3%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 7mg 2%, Sodium 30mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 10mg 48%, Calcium 72mg 6%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 188mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215145/plum-flummery/

============================================================

RECIPE 494: Ponche de Frutas (Fruit Punch)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 20 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 oranges
• juiced
• 3 lemons
• juiced
• ½ pound seedless green grapes
• halved
• ½ pound plums
• pitted and chopped into small bite-size pieces
• 1 fresh pineapple - peeled
• cored and chopped into small bite-size pieces
• 1 cup white sugar
• 4 cups strong brewed black tea
• chilled
• 4 cups crushed ice

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large punch bowl, combine orange juice, lemon juice, grapes, plums and pineapple
2. Stir in sugar
3. Pour in tea and crushed ice

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 21g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 40mg 198%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 151mg 3%

RECIPE 495: Rogaliki (Polish Jam-Filled Crescents)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 40
Yield: 40 rogaliki
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/Eastern European/Polish/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ½ ounces compressed fresh yeast
• 7 tablespoons milk
• 5 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• or more as needed
• 2 ¼ cups unsalted butter
• at room temperature
• 4 tablespoons sour cream
• 4 tablespoons white sugar
• 2 eggs
• 3 egg yolks
• 1 ½ cups plum jam
• 2 ½ cups confectioners' sugar
• 2 tablespoons water
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir milk and yeast together in a bowl until smooth
2. Set aside until foamy, about 10 minutes
3. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
5. Combine flour, butter, sour cream, sugar, eggs, and egg yolks in a large bowl
6. Stir in yeast mixture
7. Mix well using an electric mixer at first, then using your hands
8. Turn out dough onto a floured work surface and knead until smooth, adding more flour, 1 tablespoon at a time, if dough is sticking to your hands
9. Form dough into a long log and cut into 1 1/2-inch rounds
10. Cover rounds with a cloth
11. Roll each round of dough into a thin circle
12. Cut the circle into six triangles, as you would a pizza
13. Place 1 teaspoon jam at the wider end of each triangle, then roll up like a croissant
14. Place on the prepared baking sheet
15. Repeat until all the dough is used up
16. Bake in the preheated oven until rogaliki have risen and are golden brown, about 20 minutes
17. Remove from oven and cool completely, about 30 minutes
18. Place confectioners' sugar in a bowl and stir in water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until a drizzling consistency is reached
19. Drizzle icing over cooled rogaliki

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 7g 35%, Cholesterol 53mg 18%, Sodium 9mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 3g, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 47mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/262728/rogaliki-polish-jam-filled-crescents/

============================================================

RECIPE 496: Zwetschekuchen (German Plum Tart)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9-inch tart
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 5 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/German/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ⅓ cups white sugar
• 1 teaspoon grated fresh lemon peel
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon
• 1 cup butter
• cut into chunks
• 2 eggs
• 2 egg yolks
• 1 teaspoon water
• if needed
• 3 pounds Italian prune plums
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the flour, 1 1/3 cup of sugar, lemon peel, cinnamon, and butter into the work bowl of a food processor, and process until the mixture turns grainy
2. Stop the machine, add eggs and egg yolks, and process in the machine until the mixture gathers itself up into one dough ball
3. If the dough doesn't ball up, stop the machine, sprinkle several drops of water onto the dough, and process again
4. Place the dough into a covered container and refrigerate at least 3 hours or preferably overnight
5. The next day, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
6. Allow the dough to rest at room temperature for about 30 minutes to warm up
7. Roll out the dough on a well-floured surface to make a 9 1/2-inch circle
8. Dough will be rich and sticky
9. Scrape up the dough circle, and press into a 9-inch pie dish
10. Quarter and slice the plums, and place skin sides down onto the dough in a neat ring, starting at the outer edge and working in a neat row towards the center
11. Bake in the preheated oven until the plums are bubbling hot and the crust starts to brown, about 45 minutes
12. Allow the tart to cool, and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of sugar before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 10g 52%, Cholesterol 106mg 35%, Sodium 123mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 68g 25%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 11mg 55%, Calcium 27mg 2%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 243mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215133/zwetschekuchen-german-plum-tart/

============================================================

RECIPE 497: Plum Buckle
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Coffee Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 7 cups pitted and quartered plums
• ⅔ cup butter
• softened
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 2 eggs
• 3 cups sifted all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 2 cups milk
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• ¼ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. Place the plums into the bottom of the prepared baking dish
4. In a large bowl, mash together 2/3 cup butter with 1 1/2 cup of white sugar until the mixture is smooth and creamy
5. Beat in eggs, one at a time
6. Stir in 3 cups of flour, the baking powder, and salt
7. Mix in the milk and vanilla extract to make a smooth batter
8. Pour the batter over the plums
9. Mix 1 cup of sugar, 1/2 cup of butter, 1/4 cup of flour, and cinnamon together in a bowl to make a crumbly topping; spread over the batter
10. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 12g 61%, Cholesterol 82mg 27%, Sodium 337mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 81g 29%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 53g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 9mg 46%, Calcium 117mg 9%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 268mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215132/plum-buckle/

============================================================

RECIPE 498: Zucchini Plum Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 loaves
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Breakfast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups shredded zucchini
• 1 cup vegetable oil
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• 3 eggs
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 cup whole wheat flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• 3 cups chopped plums
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line 2 bread pans with parchment paper or spray with cooking spray
3. Whisk zucchini, oil, 1 cup white sugar, brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract together in a bowl until well mixed
4. Combine all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and baking powder together in a separate bowl
5. Gradually stir flour mixture into zucchini mixture until batter is just combined; fold in plums
6. Pour batter into the prepared pans
7. Mix 1 tablespoon white sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon together in a small bowl; sprinkle over batter
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour
9. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 23mg 8%, Sodium 172mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 113mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234327/zucchini-plum-bread/

============================================================

RECIPE 499: Spinach Pomegranate Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Spinach Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (10 ounce) bag baby spinach leaves
• rinsed and drained
• ½ cup walnut pieces
• ½ cup crumbled feta
• ¼ medium red onion
• sliced very thin
• ¼ cup alfalfa sprouts (Optional)
• ½ cup pomegranate seeds
• or to taste
• 4 tablespoons balsamic vinaigrette

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place spinach into a salad bowl
2. Top with walnuts, feta, red onion, alfalfa sprouts, and pomegranate seeds
3. Drizzle with vinaigrette

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 6g 31%, Cholesterol 28mg 9%, Sodium 585mg 25%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 5%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 24mg 118%, Calcium 245mg 19%, Iron 3mg 19%, Potassium 596mg 13%

RECIPE 500: Chiles en Nogada (Mexican Stuffed Poblano Peppers in Walnut Sauce)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 poblano peppers

DIRECTIONS:
1. Roast poblano chiles over an open flame on a gas stove or grill until the skin is black and charred on all sides, turning often, 10 to 15 minutes
2. Place the charred chiles in a plastic bag or in a large bowl covered with plastic wrap
3. Allow to sit for 5 to 10 minutes, then open and peel off the skin
4. Cut a slit in each chile lengthwise and remove the seeds
5. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat
6. Add onion and garlic and cook until soft and translucent, 3 to 4 minutes
7. Add ground pork and cook until browned, breaking up with a spoon while cooking, about 7 minutes
8. Mix in tomatoes, plantain, apple, peach, parsley, candied orange peel, pine nuts, raisins, almonds, cloves, salt, and pepper
9. Simmer until filling is cooked through and flavors are well combined, about 10 minutes
10. Combine walnuts, milk, goat cheese, sugar, and cinnamon stick in a blender; blend until walnut sauce is smooth and creamy
11. Fill each poblano chile with the pork filling and place on a plate
12. Spoon walnut sauce over chile and sprinkle with pomegranate seeds and parsley
13. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 51g 65%, Saturated Fat 13g 66%, Cholesterol 86mg 29%, Sodium 227mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 9g 30%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 34g, Vitamin C 107mg 533%, Calcium 231mg 18%, Iron 4mg 24%, Potassium 1220mg 26%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/259373/chiles-en-nogada-mexican-stuffed-poblano-peppers-in-walnut-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 502: Brenda's Apple and Pomegranate Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 medium apples - peeled
• cored and sliced
• ½ pomegranate
• skin and light-colored membrane removed
• ½ cup brown sugar
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ cup rolled oats
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. In a large bowl, toss together the apples, pomegranate seeds, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg
4. Spread evenly into the prepared pan
5. In the same bowl, stir together the oats, flour and sugar
6. Rub in the butter between your fingers until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
7. Sprinkle over the top of the fruit
8. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the apples are soft
9. Let stand 10 minutes before serving
10. Serve warm or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 7mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 32mg 2%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 152mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/77493/brendas-apple-and-pomegranate-crisp/

RECIPE 503: Pomegranate Holiday Cocktail
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 cocktails
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 5 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Cocktail Recipes/Vodka Drinks Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups ice
• or as needed
• 2 fluid ounces vodka
• 2 fluid ounces pomegranate juice
• 1 lime
• juiced
• ½ fluid ounce orange-flavored liqueur
• 2 ½ fluid ounces club soda
• or as needed
• 1 teaspoon pomegranate seeds
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Fill 2 highball glasses and a cocktail shaker with ice
2. Add vodka, pomegranate juice, lime juice, and orange-flavored liqueur to the cocktail shaker and secure the lid
3. Place one hand on the lid and one hand on the shaker; shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker frosts, about a slow count to 10
4. Pour evenly into the prepared glasses
5. Top with soda and pomegranate seeds; stir before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 15mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 10mg 50%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 44mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/276186/pomegranate-holiday-cocktail/

RECIPE 504: Pomegranate Jelly
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 176
Yield: 11 8-ounce glasses
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 7 ½ cups white sugar
• 4 cups pomegranate juice
• 2 lemons
• juiced
• 1 (6 fluid ounce) container liquid pectin

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine sugar and pomegranate and lemon juices in a large stainless steel saucepan
2. Bring to boil over high heat; at once, stir in liquid pectin
3. Bring to a full rolling boil and boil for exactly 30 seconds
4. Remove from heat and skim off foam
5. Ladle into hot, sterilized jars to within about 1/4 inch of the top
6. Seal, then process in a boiling water canner for 5 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 11g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 1mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 4mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/9399/pomegranate-jelly/

RECIPE 505: Lamb Braised in Pomegranate
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Lamb/Chops/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 pounds lamb shoulder blade chops
• salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• 1 onion
• sliced
• 1 pinch salt
• 4 cloves garlic
• sliced
• 2 cups pomegranate juice
• ⅓ cup aged balsamic vinegar
• 8 fresh mint leaves
• ¼ teaspoon dried rosemary
• ¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes
• 1 tablespoon honey
• or more to taste
• 2 tablespoons pomegranate seeds
• 1 tablespoon sliced fresh mint leaves
• 1 tablespoon pumpkin seeds

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
2. Generously season lamb chops with salt and black pepper
3. Heat vegetable oil in a Dutch oven over high heat
4. Place lamb chops in Dutch oven and cook until browned on all sides, about 8 minutes
5. Transfer lamb to a plate and reduce heat to medium
6. Stir onion and a pinch of salt into the Dutch oven; cook until onions are slightly golden, about 3 minutes
7. Stir in garlic and cook for 30 seconds
8. Pour pomegranate juice into the Dutch oven and scrape any browned bits off of the bottom of the pot
9. Pour in balsamic vinegar, increase heat to high, and bring to a boil
10. Stir mint leaves, rosemary, and red pepper flakes into pomegranate juice mixture
11. Continue to boil until liquid is reduced by half, about 10 minutes
12. Return lamb and any accumulated juices to the Dutch oven, spoon pomegranate mixture over lamb, and cover
13. Cook in the preheated oven until lamb is fork tender, about 2 hours
14. Transfer lamb to a plate and set the Dutch oven on the stovetop over high heat
15. Bring pomegranate mixture to a boil; cook, skimming any fat that accumulates, until liquid is reduced by 1/3, about 5 minutes
16. Stir in honey and season with salt and black pepper
17. Return lamb to the Dutch oven; stir to combine
18. Garnish with pomegranate seeds, sliced mint leaves, and pumpkin seeds
19. Chef John/Allrecipes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 34g 44%, Saturated Fat 14g 69%, Cholesterol 135mg 45%, Sodium 190mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 35g, Vitamin C 4mg 21%, Calcium 46mg 4%, Iron 3mg 16%, Potassium 540mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/222191/lamb-braised-in-pomegranate/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------

Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5

• minced

• ¼ teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper
• ¼ teaspoon ground paprika

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a bowl, stir together the soy sauce, ketchup, pomegranate molasses, honey, sunflower seed oil, mustard, garlic, sea salt, black pepper, and paprika to make a smooth paste

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 266mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 6g 2%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 28mg 1%

RECIPE 507: Yummy Pomegranate Vinaigrette Dressing
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Salad Dressing Recipes/Vinaigrette Dressing Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup olive oil
• 1 cup pomegranate juice
• 1 cup rice vinegar
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons chopped shallots
• 1 ¼ teaspoons chopped garlic
• 1 teaspoon ground white pepper
• kosher salt to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place olive oil, pomegranate juice, rice vinegar, white sugar, shallots, garlic, white pepper, and salt in a blender
2. Blend until smooth, about 2 minutes

RECIPE 508: Middle Eastern Rice Pilaf with Pomegranate
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Rice Side Dish Recipes/Pilaf/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 onion
• finely chopped
• 1 cup long-grain rice
• 2 ¼ cups hot vegetable broth
• 4 saffron threads
• 1 pinch ground allspice
• 3 tablespoons unsalted shelled pistachios
• 1 tablespoon butter
• 1 large pomegranate
• peeled and seeds separated
• salt and freshly ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat and cook onion until soft and translucent
2. Add rice and toast until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes
3. Pour in hot vegetable broth and bring to a boil
4. Add saffron and allspice, reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, about 20 minutes
5. Toast pistachios in a skillet over medium heat until nuts start to turn golden brown and become fragrant, 5 to 10 minutes
6. Stir butter into the cooked rice
7. Remove from heat and mix in pistachios and pomegranate seeds
8. Fluff with fork and season with salt and pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 3g 16%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 351mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 59g 21%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 9mg 44%, Calcium 49mg 4%, Iron 3mg 16%, Potassium 385mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/260447/middle-eastern-rice-pilaf-with-pomegranate/

RECIPE 509: Pear and Pomegranate Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 salads
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 2 mins
Total Time: 12 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups green leaf lettuce
• rinsed and torn
• 1 Bartlett or Anjou pear
• ⅓ cup pomegranate seeds
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• 2 tablespoons pomegranate juice
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• 1 teaspoon prepared Dijon-style mustard
• ½ tablespoon honey
• ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Divide the lettuce between two bowls
2. Halve and core the pear, then cut each half in slices
3. Divide the pear slices and pomegranate seeds among the two bowls and mix gently
4. Combine the vegetable oil, pomegranate juice, lemon juice, mustard, honey, and pepper in a saucepan
5. Bring to a boil over high heat; reduce heat and simmer, stirring frequently, until the dressing thickens slightly, about 2 minutes
6. Pour the warm dressing over the salads and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Sodium 88mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 22mg 111%, Calcium 41mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 280mg 6%

RECIPE 512: Spiced Pears and Pomegranate
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 pears - peeled
• cored and cut into wedges
• 1 pomegranate
• skin and light-colored membrane removed
• 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
• 2 tablespoons light brown sugar
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 2 tablespoons finely chopped almonds (Optional)
• 4 sprigs fresh mint leaves for garnish (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the sliced pears and pomegranate seeds into a bowl
2. Toss with lemon juice to coat
3. Combine the brown sugar, nutmeg, and cinnamon in a small cup or bowl, then mix into the fruit
4. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to blend the flavors
5. Serve in individual dishes, and garnish with a sprinkling of chopped almonds and a sprig of mint

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 6g 20%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 13mg 63%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 329mg 7%

RECIPE 513: Chef John's Sweet Potato Biscuits
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 large or 12 regular biscuits
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Biscuits/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 large orange-fleshed sweet potato
• peeled
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• ½ cup buttermilk
• 3 ¼ cups self-rising flour
• 1 ½ sticks unsalted butter
• frozen
• 1 tablespoon melted butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Cut sweet potato in half lengthwise
2. Cut each in half again lengthwise, then in half cross-wise
3. Cut each piece in half to make about 16 evenly sized chunks
4. Transfer into pot; cover with water and add salt
5. Bring to a simmer on high heat; reduce heat to medium-low and cook until potatoes are tender, about 17 minutes
6. Drain thoroughly; return to pot and mash potatoes
7. You will need 1 1/2 cups mashed sweet potatoes
8. Cool thoroughly
9. Transfer cooled mashed potatoes to a mixing bowl
10. Add brown sugar and buttermilk
11. Mix together until well combined
12. Place self-rising flour in a separate mixing bowl
13. Grate frozen butter into flour, tossing with a fork to coat with flour after each addition of about 1/3 to 1/2 stick
14. This will prevent butter from clumping
15. Mixture should look like floury pieces of butter
16. Add sweet potato mixture
17. Toss with a fork until evenly distributed, but don't overmix
18. Transfer mixture onto a lightly floured work surface
19. Push and press mixture together into a rectangular shape, about 1 1/2 inches thick
20. Dough will be floury and a bit crumbly
21. Fold rectangle into thirds, lifting up one-third and folding onto the middle and doing the same with the other side
22. Dust with a bit of flour if sticking
23. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
24. Line a rimmed baking sheet with a silicone mat
25. Press dough into a rectangle again, about 1 inch thick
26. Repeat the tri-fold step
27. Press out into a rectangle, about 1 inch thick
28. Trim off the rough edges to square off the sides; this will maximize rising
29. Cut into 8 equal portions
30. Transfer to prepared baking pan, spacing biscuits evenly
31. Brush tops lightly with 1 tablespoon melted butter
32. Bake in preheated oven until browned, 20 to 25 minutes
33. Cool slightly before serving
34. Mix 4 tablespoons butter (room temperature), pomegranate syrup, and pomegranate juice together in a small bowl
35. Spread on warm biscuits
36. Sprinkle with a few pomegranate seeds for garnish

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 16g 79%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 1037mg 45%, Total Carbohydrate 52g 19%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 2mg 8%, Calcium 215mg 17%, Iron 3mg 15%, Potassium 290mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/261792/chef-johns-sweet-potato-biscuits/

============================================================

RECIPE 514: Spinach and Persimmon Salad with Goat Cheese and Pomegranate
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Spinach Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 Fuyu persimmon
• peeled and cored
• 2 cups roughly chopped spinach
• 3 tablespoons pomegranate seeds
• 2 ounces goat cheese
• crumbled
• 1 tablespoon sliced almonds

DIRECTIONS:
1. Slice persimmon into 1/4-inch rounds, then slice each round into quarters
2. Place chopped spinach into a salad bowl
3. Top with persimmon quarters, pomegranate seeds, goat cheese, and sliced almonds
4. Whisk together olive oil, orange juice, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper in a small bowl
5. Drizzle vinaigrette over salad and toss lightly to coat
6. Serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 31%, Saturated Fat 8g 40%, Cholesterol 22mg 7%, Sodium 295mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 29mg 145%, Calcium 147mg 11%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 443mg 9%

RECIPE 515: Pavlova with Winter Fruits
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 3
Yield: 3 pavlovas
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Pavlova Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 egg whites
• at room temperature
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup superfine sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons cornstarch
• ½ teaspoon orange blossom water (Optional)
• ½ teaspoon white vinegar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C)
2. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Invert a small bowl onto the parchment paper and trace the rim with a pencil
4. Repeat twice more
5. Flip parchment paper over
6. Beat egg whites in a large bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks begin to form
7. Gradually add white sugar, with the mixer running
8. Whisk superfine sugar and cornstarch in a small bowl
9. Gradually beat into the meringue
10. Continue beating meringue until stiff, glossy peaks form
11. Beat in orange blossom water and vinegar
12. Spoon meringue into the traced circles
13. Make the borders higher than the center, to leave room for the filling
14. Bake meringues in the preheated oven until firm and dry to the touch, about 1 hour
15. Meanwhile, make the lemon curd
16. Fill a medium saucepan with 1 inch of water and bring to a bare simmer
17. Whisk lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, egg yolks, and salt together in a glass bowl
18. Set the bowl over the simmering water
19. Cook, whisking constantly, until curd foams, then thickens, about 10 minutes
20. Remove the bowl from the simmering water
21. Gradually whisk in coconut oil until melted and incorporated
22. Strain the curd through a fine-mesh sieve; discard solids left in the strainer
23. Press a sheet of plastic wrap directly onto the surface to prevent a skin from forming
24. Transfer to the refrigerator
25. Turn off oven and keep meringues inside until completely dry, about 1 hour
26. Combine heavy cream, confectioners' sugar, and orange blossom water in a bowl
27. Beat with an electric mixer until soft peaks form
28. Spoon lemon curd into the center of the cooled meringues
29. Mound whipped cream over the curd
30. Arrange grapefruit, orange, and persimmon slices on top
31. Sprinkle pomegranate seeds over the top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 49g 63%, Saturated Fat 32g 161%, Cholesterol 382mg 127%, Sodium 227mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 133g 48%, Dietary Fiber 7g 26%, Total Sugars 111g, Protein 13g, Vitamin C 140mg 701%, Calcium 187mg 14%, Iron 3mg 17%, Potassium 592mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/269274/pavlova-with-winter-fruits/

============================================================

RECIPE 516: Cranberry-Pomegranate Mimosa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 1
Yield: 1 glass
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 5 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Drinks/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• or as needed
• 3 frozen cranberries
• 1 fluid ounce cranberry-pomegranate juice (such as Ocean Spray®)
• 1 fluid ounce orange juice
• 2 fluid ounces champagne

DIRECTIONS:
1. Fill a small plate with 1/4 inch of water
2. Pour sugar onto a second small plate, making a depth of 1/8 to 1/4 inch
3. Gently dip the rim of a champagne glass into the water
4. Raise the glass to allow excess water to drip off, then dip the rim into the sugar
5. Twist the glass to ensure the entire rim is coated
6. Discard remaining sugar
7. Place cranberries in the bottom of the champagne glass
8. Add cranberry-pomegranate juice, orange juice, and champagne

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 8mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 34g 13%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 16mg 82%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 126mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/276187/cranberry-pomegranate-mimosa/

RECIPE 517: Holiday Cranberry-Pomegranate Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (12 ounce) bag fresh cranberries
• rinsed and sorted
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup orange juice
• 1 teaspoon orange zest
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
• 2 cinnamon sticks
• 1 pomegranate
• peeled and seeds separated

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix the cranberries, sugar, orange juice, orange zest, ground cloves, and cinnamon sticks together in a saucepan
2. Bring to a boil
3. Lower heat to medium, and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring constantly
4. Remove from the heat and cool
5. Stir the pomegranate seeds into the cranberry mixture, and refrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight
6. Remove the cinnamon sticks before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 8mg 38%, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 51mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/130578/holiday-cranberry-pomegranate-sauce/

RECIPE 518: Pomegranate Stew with Chicken (Khoresh Fesenjan)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Stews/Chicken/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 ½ pounds chicken legs
• cut up
• 1 white onion
• thinly sliced
• ½ pound walnuts
• toasted and finely ground in a food processor
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 4 cups pomegranate juice
• ½ teaspoon cardamom (Optional)
• 2 tablespoons sugar (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
2. Place chicken and onions in skillet, and cook 20 minutes, stirring occasionally
3. Mix in pureed walnuts, salt, pomegranate juice, and cardamom
4. Bring to a boil
5. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally. (If the sauce becomes too thick, stir in 1/4 cup warm water.) Mix in sugar, adjust seasoning, and simmer 30 minutes more

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 39g 50%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 64mg 21%, Sodium 445mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 95g 35%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 83g, Protein 24g, Vitamin C 7mg 33%, Calcium 51mg 4%, Iron 4mg 20%, Potassium 329mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/85118/pomegranate-stew-with-chicken-khoresh-fesenjan/

============================================================

RECIPE 519: Cranberry Pomegranate Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 5 cups
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Cranberry Sauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 large tart apples
• 2 pomegranates
• peeled and seeds separated
• 1 (16 fl oz) bottle pomegranate juice
• 2 cups white sugar
• 2 large oranges
• 2 (12 ounce) bags fresh cranberries
• rinsed and sorted
• 1 cup pecans
• chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Peel and core apples, and put peelings and cores in a small saucepan with pomegranate seeds, 1/2 cup juice, and 1/2 cup sugar
2. Bring to a boil, and then reduce heat to simmer
3. Cook for 30 minutes
4. Chop the peeled apples, and place in a large saucepan
5. Remove zest from half of one orange, chop very fine, and add to apples
6. Peel oranges, chop coarsely, and add to pan along with cranberries and remaining juice and sugar
7. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to simmer, and cook for 30 minutes
8. Remove small pan from heat, and strain juice into larger pan
9. Cool solids slightly, and then push though a sieve to remove seeds and peels, adding remaining pulp to larger pan
10. Stir in nuts, if desired
11. Cook about 10 minutes longer
12. Serve warm, room temperature, or chilled

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 14mg 68%, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 124mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/130639/cranberry-pomegranate-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 520: Smokey Butternut Squash Soup
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 3.7/5
Category: /Soup Recipes/Vegetable Soup Recipes/Squash Soup Recipes/Butternut Squash Soup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 butternut squash - peeled and cut into cubes
• seeds removed and reserved
• ½ shallot
• diced
• 3 tablespoons canola oil
• divided
• 2 teaspoons smoked paprika
• 1 ½ teaspoons chili powder
• 1 ½ teaspoons chipotle chile powder
• 1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 6 fresh Brussels sprouts
• cored and separated into leaves
• 2 tablespoons maple syrup
• 1 ½ cups almond milk
• ¼ cup crumbled goat cheese
• or to taste
• seeds of 1 pomegranate

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Line a roasting pan with a large sheet of aluminum foil
3. Toss butternut squash, shallot, 2 tablespoons canola oil, paprika, chili powder, chipotle powder, and ginger together in a bowl until evenly mixed and coated
4. Pour into prepared roasting pan and wrap aluminum foil around squash mixture
5. Bake in the preheated oven until squash is tender, 30 to 40 minutes
6. Heat 1 tablespoon canola oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium heat
7. Cook and stir reserved butternut squash seeds, pinch salt, and pinch ground black pepper in the skillet until lightly toasted, 5 minutes
8. Add Brussels sprouts leaves and cook, stirring occasionally, until leaves are slightly crispy and seeds are browned, 10 to 15 minutes
9. Stir maple syrup into seed mixture and immediately remove from heat
10. Pour butternut squash mixture and almond milk into a blender no more than half full
11. Cover and hold lid down; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend
12. Puree in batches until soup is smooth
13. Pour butternut squash soup into bowls and top with squash seeds and Brussels sprouts mixture, pomegranate seeds, and goat cheese

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 92mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 6g 21%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 63mg 314%, Calcium 189mg 15%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 990mg 21%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/235260/smokey-butternut-squash-soup/

============================================================

RECIPE 521: Pomegranate Grenadine
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 32
Yield: 32 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Syrup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups pomegranate juice
• divided
• 1 cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine 3 cups pomegranate juice and sugar together in a saucepan; heat to 244 degrees F (118 degrees C) or until a small amount of mixture dropped into cold water forms a firm ball
2. Remove saucepan from heat and cover with a lid; let cool until pan is cool enough to touch
3. Stir remaining 1 cup pomegranate juice into mixture
4. Refrigerate

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Total Sugars 11g, Calcium 0mg 0%, Potassium 0mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/237763/pomegranate-grenadine/

============================================================

RECIPE 522: Halloumi Three-Bean Salad with Pomegranate-Harissa Vinaigrette
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Salad/Beans/Three Bean Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 7 ounces halloumi cheese
• cut into 1-inch slabs
• 2 tablespoons pomegranate vinegar
• 1 tablespoon honey
• 1 ½ teaspoons harissa
• or more to taste
• 3 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 pinch freshly ground black pepper
• 1 cup black beans
• drained and rinsed
• 1 cup kidney beans
• drained and rinsed
• 1 cup white beans
• drained and rinsed
• ⅓ cup chopped red onion
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat
2. Cook each halloumi slab on all 4 sides, about 5 minutes
3. Set aside and allow to cool slightly; cut into 1/4-inch cubes
4. While cheese is cooking, whisk pomegranate vinegar, honey, harissa, olive oil, and black pepper together in a dressing jar
5. Combine black beans, kidney beans, white beans, onion, mint, and cilantro in a bowl and toss with a spoon
6. Add cooked halloumi
7. Drizzle vinaigrette dressing over salad and toss to coat
8. Cover and allow to sit at room temperature at least 15 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 5g 23%, Cholesterol 19mg 6%, Sodium 464mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 6g 20%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 11g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 46mg 4%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 246mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/266602/halloumi-three-bean-salad-with-pomegranate-harissa-vinaigrette/

============================================================

RECIPE 523: Salmon with Pomegranate Glaze
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 fillets
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 11 mins
Total Time: 36 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Seafood Main Dishes/Salmon/Salmon Fillet Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅓ cup pomegranate juice
• 1 tablespoon soy sauce
• or to taste
• 1 clove garlic
• sliced
• 4 (6 ounce) fillets salmon
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• ½ pomegranate
• peeled and seeds separated

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk pomegranate juice, soy sauce, and garlic together in a shallow non-reactive bowl until marinade is well mixed
2. Add salmon and turn to coat
3. Cover and marinate for 15 minutes
4. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; add garlic from the marinade and cook until lightly browned, 1 to 2 minutes
5. Pour in the marinade and cook until reduced and thickened to a glaze, 4 to 5 minutes
6. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate
7. Cook salmon on the preheated grill until flesh flakes easily with a fork, about 3 minutes per side
8. Serve salmon topped with glaze and garnished with pomegranate seeds

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 29%, Saturated Fat 4g 21%, Cholesterol 83mg 28%, Sodium 307mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 30g, Vitamin C 8mg 39%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 606mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/258360/salmon-with-pomegranate-glaze/

============================================================

RECIPE 524: Apple, Pomegranate, and Pecan Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup pomegranate juice
• 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
• 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
• 1 teaspoon honey
• ¼ cup canola oil
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• ⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper
• 2 medium Granny Smith apples
• cored and chopped
• 1 (5 ounce) package baby spinach
• ⅔ cup pomegranate seeds
• ⅓ cup candied pecans
• ¼ cup crumbled feta cheese

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine pomegranate juice, balsamic vinegar, Dijon, and honey in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until combined
2. Keep the blade running and slowly pour canola oil in through the food chute until smooth
3. Add salt and pepper and set dressing aside
4. Toss apples, spinach, pomegranate seeds, pecans, and feta cheese together in a large bowl
5. Drizzle dressing on top and toss until well combined

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 7mg 2%, Sodium 187mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 8mg 39%, Calcium 60mg 5%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 234mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/281968/apple-pomegranate-and-pecan-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 525: Creamy Pomegranate Ice Cream
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Frozen Dessert Recipes/Ice Cream/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup heavy cream
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup pomegranate juice
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 pinch salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir together the heavy cream and sugar
2. Stir in the pomegranate juice, vanilla extract, and salt
3. Add the mixture to an ice cream maker and freeze according to the manufacturer's directions

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 9g 46%, Cholesterol 54mg 18%, Sodium 17mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Total Sugars 39g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 26mg 2%, Potassium 32mg 1%

RECIPE 526: Spiced Pomegranate Syrup
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 cup syrup
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Syrup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup pomegranate juice
• ¾ cup Shiraz or other dry red wine
• 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cloves
• ⅛ teaspoon ground ginger
• 1 tablespoon butter
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• divided

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine the pomegranate juice, wine, and lemon juice in a bowl
2. Whisk in the cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves and ginger
3. Crumble in half of the brown sugar and whisk mixture until sugar dissolves
4. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat and swirl to coat the pan
5. Immediately pour in the juice/spice mixture and increase the heat to high
6. Bring mixture to a boil while whisking to prevent scorching
7. Reduce heat to medium and, while stirring, add the remaining brown sugar a little at a time
8. Cook and stir until mixture thickens to a syrupy consistency or when it can coat the back of a spoon
9. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly and continue to cool, 5 to 10 minutes
10. Stir and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 3%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 21mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 2mg 12%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 72mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/159556/spiced-pomegranate-syrup/

============================================================

RECIPE 527: Roasted Pork Shoulder with Pomegranate Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Pork/Pork Shoulder Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (3 pound) bone-in pork shoulder roast
• 2 teaspoons minced garlic
• kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 2 pomegranates with the seeds removed
• ½ cup water
• 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
• 2 tablespoons turbinado sugar
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Season the pork roast with garlic, kosher salt, and pepper
3. Place in a roasting pan
4. Bake the roast for 1 hour in the preheated oven
5. While the roast is baking, combine the pomegranate seeds and water in a large saucepan
6. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, until the pomegranate seeds have broken down and released their juices
7. Press through a strainer to get as much juice as possible
8. You should have about 3/4 cup of juice
9. Pour the juice from the pomegranate into a saucepan and bring to a boil
10. Simmer over medium heat until reduced by half
11. Remove from the heat and mix in the balsamic vinegar, sugar, and cinnamon
12. After the roast has been in the oven for 45 minutes, baste it with pomegranate sauce, using a brush to apply it to the top and sides
13. Continue to roast the pork, basting every 10 minutes, until the internal temperature has reached 180 degrees F (80 degrees C), about 30 minutes
14. Remove from the oven, tent with foil, and allow to rest for 20 minutes before carving and serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 33%, Saturated Fat 9g 47%, Cholesterol 136mg 45%, Sodium 200mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 21g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 42g, Vitamin C 6mg 28%, Calcium 52mg 4%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 761mg 16%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/153265/roasted-pork-shoulder-with-pomegranate-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 528: Holiday Pomegranate Mignonette
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons champagne vinegar
• 1 tablespoon pomegranate juice
• ½ shallot
• minced
• ½ teaspoon fresh cracked pepper
• 1 pinch white sugar
• 1 tablespoon pomegranate seeds

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk vinegar, pomegranate juice, shallot, pepper, and white sugar together in a bowl until sugar dissolves
2. Add pomegranate seeds, cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 4g 1%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 4mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 40mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/236576/holiday-pomegranate-mignonette/

RECIPE 529: Freekeh Salad with Tahini Dressing
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 3.7/5
Category: /Salad/Grains/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup freekeh
• 2 cups chicken broth
• 3 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
• 1 tablespoon tahini
• 1 teaspoon honey
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• ½ cup pomegranate seeds
• ¼ cup red onion
• minced
• 2 tablespoons minced fresh mint
• 2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley
• ½ cup crushed pistachios

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir freekeh in a medium-sized saucepan over medium-high heat until lightly toasted and fragrant, about 3 minutes
2. Add broth and bring to a simmer
3. Cover pan and cook until water is absorbed, about 20 minutes
4. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes
5. Transfer freekeh to a bowl to cool
6. Meanwhile, whisk vinegar, tahini, and honey together in a small bowl
7. Slowly drizzle in olive oil and whisk until combined
8. Season with salt and pepper
9. Add pomegranate seeds, onion, mint, and parsley to the bowl with the cooked freekeh
10. Drizzle in the dressing and toss to coat
11. Season with additional salt and pepper, if desired
12. Refrigerate 30 minutes
13. Top with pistachios right before serving so they don't soften

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 464mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 6g 22%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 4mg 20%, Calcium 28mg 2%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 199mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/270199/freekeh-salad-with-tahini-dressing/

============================================================

• drained

• peeled and seeds separated

3. Toss gently by hand to mix

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 531: Pomegranate Relish
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 5
Yield: 4 to 6 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Relish Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pomegranates
• 3 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 shallot
• minced
• 1 tablespoon lime juice
• salt and pepper to taste
• ½ cup fresh cilantro
• chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Juice the pomegranates retaining the seeds and juice
2. Heat oil in a small skillet over medium heat
3. Saute shallots until golden
4. Stir in pomegranate juice and seeds, lime juice, salt and pepper
5. Cook for about 3 minutes, or until slightly reduced
6. Remove from heat and stir in cilantro
7. Serve at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 7mg 34%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 221mg 5%

RECIPE 532: Khoresht Fesenjaan (Chicken with Pomegranate Sauce)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 3 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 4 medium red onions
• thinly sliced
• 3 pounds bone-in chicken pieces
• 2 cups hot water or as needed
• 2 ½ cups pomegranate juice
• 4 cups chopped walnuts
• 2 tablespoons freshly ground cardamom
• 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon
• 1 medium butternut squash
• seeded and cubed
• ¼ teaspoon saffron powder
• 1 teaspoon salt
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat the oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat
2. Stir in sliced onions; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes
3. Reduce heat to medium-low, and continue cooking and stirring until the onion is very tender and dark brown, 15 to 20 minutes more
4. Raise heat to medium-high
5. Add chicken pieces, and fry until lightly browned on the outside
6. Pour in the water, and bring to a boil
7. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, adding more water if necessary to keep the mixture from drying out
8. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (65 degrees C)
9. Combine the walnuts and pomegranate juice in the container of a blender or food processor
10. Process into liquid. (This can be done in small batches if necessary.) Add walnut-pomegranate mixture to the simmering chicken
11. Season with cardamom, cinnamon, saffron powder, and salt
12. Stir in the cubed squash
13. Transfer the entire mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish
14. Bake, loosely covered, for 2 1/2 hours in the preheated oven
15. Serve with white rice

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 52g 66%, Saturated Fat 9g 44%, Cholesterol 85mg 28%, Sodium 281mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 49g 18%, Dietary Fiber 6g 22%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 29g, Vitamin C 29mg 143%, Calcium 126mg 10%, Iron 4mg 20%, Potassium 823mg 18%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/49450/khoresht-fesenjaan-chicken-with-pomegranate-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 533: Persimmon, Pomegranate, and Massaged Kale Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Kale Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup raw macadamia nuts
• 2 tablespoons maple syrup
• divided
• 1 pinch salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Toss macademia nuts with 1 tablespoon maple syrup and pinch of salt; spread on baking sheet
4. Toast macademia nuts in the preheated oven until lightly golden, about 5 minutes
5. Remove from oven and coat with 1 tablespoon maple syrup
6. Whisk orange juice, lemon juice, 1 tablespoon maple syrup, and ground black pepper together in a small bowl to make dressing
7. Place kale pieces, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large bowl; massage with your hands until kale is tender, 3 to 5 minutes
8. Add persimmon slices and dressing and toss to mix
9. Top with pomegranate seeds and maple-roasted macademia nuts

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Sodium 429mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 6g 22%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 285mg 1,426%, Calcium 332mg 26%, Iron 5mg 27%, Potassium 1185mg 25%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/245726/persimmon-pomegranate-and-massaged-kale-salad/

RECIPE 534: Zesty Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Salad/Vegetable Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 small potato
• cut into cubes
• ½ cup finely chopped cabbage
• ¼ cup fresh pomegranate seeds
• ½ carrot
• cut into matchsticks
• 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• 1 clove garlic
• minced
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon brown sugar
• ¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place potato cubes into a small pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil
2. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, 5 to 10 minutes
3. Drain and let cool, about 10 minutes
4. Combine cooled potato, cabbage, pomegranate seeds, and carrot in a large bowl
5. Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, brown sugar, and red pepper flakes in a small bowl until well-mixed
6. Poured over potato mixture and toss to combine

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 3%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Sodium 604mg 26%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 29mg 147%, Calcium 30mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 527mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/254539/zesty-salad/

RECIPE 535: Quinoa Salad with Broccoli, Nuts, and Pomegranate
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Salad/Grains/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups water
• 1 cup quinoa
• 1 cube vegetable bouillon
• 2 cups broccoli florets
• ½ cup finely diced red onion
• ½ cup finely chopped Brazil nuts
• 1 large pomegranate
• seeded
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• or to taste
• 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
• or to taste
• 1 teaspoon honey
• or to taste
• salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine water, quinoa, and vegetable bouillon in a saucepan
2. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat
3. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until quinoa has doubled in size and looks like transparent little pearls, 25 to 30 minutes
4. Meanwhile, cook broccoli in boiling water until tender, 5 to 10 minutes
5. Drain and rinse under cold water
6. Drain and rinse quinoa under cold water
7. Combine quinoa, broccoli, red onion, Brazil nuts, and pomegranate seeds in a large bowl
8. Drizzle with olive oil, vinegar, and honey and season with salt and pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 22g 28%, Saturated Fat 6g 31%, Sodium 28mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 18%, Dietary Fiber 6g 22%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 11g, Vitamin C 47mg 235%, Calcium 53mg 4%, Iron 3mg 19%, Potassium 604mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/263464/quinoa-salad-with-broccoli-nuts-and-pomegranate/

============================================================

RECIPE 536: Healthy Apple and Kale Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 3
Yield: 3 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 3.0/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Kale Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 ounces kale
• shredded
• 2 Honeycrisp apples
• thinly sliced
• 1 pomegranate
• seeds only
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• Dressing:
• 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• 1 shallot
• thinly sliced
• 1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme
• ground black pepper to taste
• 1 pinch crushed red pepper flakes

DIRECTIONS:
1. Massage kale with your hands until leaves have softened, about 2 minutes
2. Place in a large bowl
3. Add apples, pomegranate seeds, and cinnamon
4. Stir together olive oil, lemon juice, shallot, thyme, pepper, and red pepper flakes in a small bowl
5. Pour dressing over kale salad and toss to combine

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Sodium 47mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 5g 19%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 128mg 640%, Calcium 151mg 12%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 842mg 18%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/276587/healthy-apple-and-kale-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 537: Pomegranate Glazed Carrots
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Vegetables/Carrots/Glazed Carrot Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 tablespoon butter
• 3 cups peeled
• sliced carrots
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• ¼ cup orange juice
• ¼ cup pomegranate juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat
2. Cook and stir carrots in the hot butter until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes; season with salt and black pepper
3. Stir orange juice and pomegranate juice into carrots, bring to a simmer, and reduce heat to low
4. Simmer carrots until tender, stirring occasionally, 10 to 12 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 84mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 13mg 66%, Calcium 33mg 3%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 325mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229672/pomegranate-glazed-carrots/

RECIPE 538: World's Best Guacamole
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Guacamole Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup minced onion
• 2 limes
• juiced
• 2 serrano chile peppers
• or to taste
• 2 limes
• juiced
• salt to taste
• 4 ripe avocados
• peeled and pitted
• ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• ¼ cup pomegranate seeds
• divided
• 1 sprig cilantro for garnish

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine the onion with the juice of 2 limes in a small bowl; allow the onion to soak in the lime juice for 2 hours
2. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve and discard the lime juice
3. Set the onions aside
4. Grind the serrano chile peppers, the juice of 2 limes, and salt together in a food processor until smooth; add the avocado and continue processing until creamy and smooth
5. Transfer the mixture into a small serving bowl; fold the soaked onions, chopped cilantro, and about half the pomegranate seeds into the avocado mixture
6. Top with the remaining pomegranate seeds and garnish with the cilantro sprig to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 25%, Saturated Fat 3g 15%, Sodium 12mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 11g 38%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 29mg 143%, Calcium 34mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 724mg 15%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/213698/worlds-best-guacamole/

RECIPE 539: Persimmon Bread I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 loaf
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Breakfast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 eggs
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 cup persimmon pulp
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ cup raisins

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Oil a 9 x 4 inch pan
3. In a small bowl, combine flour, cinnamon, salt, nuts, and raisins
4. In a large bowl, blend eggs, sugar, and oil
5. Mix baking soda into pulp, and add to sugar mixture
6. Fold in flour mixture
7. Pour batter into prepared pan
8. Bake for 75 minutes, or until tester inserted in the center comes out clean

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 27g 34%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 430mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 73g 27%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 26mg 132%, Calcium 44mg 3%, Iron 3mg 18%, Potassium 313mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/6701/persimmon-bread-i/

RECIPE 540: Persimmon Bread II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 3 - 6x3 inch loaves
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Breakfast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup persimmon pulp
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• 3 cups white sugar
• 1 cup vegetable oil
• 4 eggs
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 ½ teaspoons salt
• ⅔ cup water
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease three 6x3 inch loaf pans
3. In a small bowl, stir together the persimmon pulp and baking soda
4. Let stand 5 minutes to thicken the pulp
5. In a medium bowl, combine sugar, oil, eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt
6. Blend until smooth
7. Mix in persimmon pulp and water alternately with flour
8. Fold in nuts
9. Divide batter into the prepared pans, filling each pan 2/3 full
10. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean
11. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 262mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 7mg 33%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 81mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/6964/persimmon-bread-ii/

============================================================

RECIPE 541: Fuyu Persimmon Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• ¼ cup lemon juice
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 (14.1 ounce) package 9-inch pie crusts
• 3 pounds Fuyu persimmons - peeled
• cored
• and sliced
• 1 tablespoon cinnamon sugar
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Melt butter in a saucepan
3. Stir in flour to form a paste
4. Add white sugar, brown sugar, lemon juice, and cinnamon; bring to a boil
5. Reduce heat and simmer until sugar is dissolved
6. Line a 9-inch pie plate with 1 crust
7. Fill with sliced persimmons, mounding them slightly in the center
8. Pour sugar-butter mixture over the persimmons
9. Sprinkle cinnamon sugar over the second pie crust
10. Cut into strips
11. Make an X with the 2 longest strips in the center of the pie
12. Alternate horizontal and vertical strips, weaving them in an over-and-under pattern
13. Use the shortest strips for the edges of the lattice
14. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes
15. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
16. Continue baking until crust is golden brown, about 45 minutes more
17. Cool pie completely on a wire rack, about 2 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 22g 28%, Saturated Fat 9g 45%, Cholesterol 24mg 8%, Sodium 199mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 87g 32%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 93mg 464%, Calcium 55mg 4%, Iron 5mg 26%, Potassium 474mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/268441/fuyu-persimmon-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 542: Easy Persimmon Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 16 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 12 ounces persimmon flesh
• cut into small chunks
• 5 ounces white sugar
• 3 ounces persimmon skin
• finely sliced
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• ¾ ounce lemon zest
• finely sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine persimmon flesh, sugar, persimmon skin, lemon juice, and lemon zest in a small pot over medium heat; bring to a boil
2. Reduce heat to low and simmer until persimmon flesh softens and jam thickens, about 10 minutes
3. Cool jam until set, about 30 minutes
4. Transfer to an airtight container and store in the refrigerator

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 20mg 101%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 87mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/256073/easy-persimmon-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 543: Persimmon Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 3.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Custard and Cream Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch single crust pie
• 2 eggs
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ cup white sugar
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 2 cups half-and-half cream
• 1 cup persimmon pulp
• 2 tablespoons butter
• melted
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
2. Place a sheet pan on the lowest oven rack to preheat
3. Combine eggs, cinnamon, sugar, and salt
4. Whisk in cream, persimmon pulp, melted butter, and lemon juice
5. Pour into unbaked pie shell
6. Bake for 10 minutes on preheated sheet pan
7. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake an additional 30 minutes, or until center is almost set but still slightly jiggly
8. Cool completely before slicing
9. Serve with whipped cream, if desired

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 8g 42%, Cholesterol 77mg 26%, Sodium 253mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 20mg 101%, Calcium 83mg 6%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 203mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12536/persimmon-pie/

RECIPE 544: Old-Fashioned Persimmon Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch dish
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/

INGREDIENTS:
• cooking spray
• 4 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon cinnamon
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup brown sugar
• 3 eggs
• beaten
• 2 cups milk
• 2 ½ cups persimmon pulp
• 6 tablespoons butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
2. Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray
3. In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, white sugar, and brown sugar until thoroughly combined
4. In a large bowl, beat the eggs and milk together until smooth, and add the flour mixture, alternating with the persimmon pulp in several additions, mixing well after each addition
5. Stir in the melted butter
6. Scrape the batter into the prepared baking dish
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the pudding comes out clean, about 1 hour
8. Allow to cool before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 23%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 324mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 85g 31%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 37g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 32mg 162%, Calcium 115mg 9%, Iron 4mg 20%, Potassium 301mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/218656/old-fashioned-persimmon-pudding/

============================================================

RECIPE 545: Persimmon Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Fruits and Vegetables/Fruits/Persimmons/

INGREDIENTS:
• nonstick cooking spray
• 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 2 cups sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 2 cups persimmon pulp
• 1 cup milk
• 2 large eggs
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
2. Spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with nonstick spray and dust with flour
3. Whisk together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl
4. Whisk together persimmon pulp, milk, eggs, and vanilla in a separate bowl until smooth
5. Fold the persimmon mixture into the flour mixture until no dry lumps remain; pour batter into the prepared pan
6. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 50 to 75 minutes
7. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove from the pan, and allow to cool completely on a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Cholesterol 25mg 8%, Sodium 249mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 51g 18%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 19mg 97%, Calcium 41mg 3%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 145mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/163497/persimmon-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 546: Soft Persimmon Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 36
Yield: 3 dozen
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Drop Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground cloves
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 2 ripe persimmons
• pureed
• 1 large egg
• 1 cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease or line a baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and salt together in a bowl
4. Cream sugar with butter
5. Beat in persimmons and egg
6. Add flour mixture and mix until combined
7. Stir in chopped nuts
8. Drop by teaspoonfuls, 2 inches apart, onto the prepared baking sheet
9. Bake in the preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 12mg 4%, Sodium 88mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 30mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/11113/persimmon-cookies-ii/
