RECIPE 547: Spiced Persimmon Butter
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 64
Yield: 4 half-pint jars
Prep Time: 40 mins
Cook Time: 10 hrs
Total Time: 10 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Fruit Butter Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 20 ripe Fuyu persimmons
• peeled and coarsely chopped
• 1 medium lemon
• juiced
• ¼ cup agave syrup
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place persimmons into a slow cooker and drizzle lemon juice over top
2. Cover and cook on High for about 2 hours
3. Open the slow cooker and mash persimmons with a potato masher
4. Stir in agave, cinnamon, and cloves
5. Set the cooker to Low and cook, uncovered, 8 hours to overnight, stirring several times if possible, to prevent burning during the long cooking period
6. At the end of the cook time, inspect 4 (or more) half-pint jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones
7. Immerse in simmering water until persimmon mixture has finished cooking
8. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water
9. Purée persimmon mixture with an immersion blender until smooth
10. If you don't have an immersion blender, purée mixture in batches in a blender, pulsing each batch a few times before leaving it on to purée
11. Pack persimmon butter into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
12. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
13. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
14. Top with lids, and screw on rings
15. Allow the jars to cool to room temperature, then store in the refrigerator

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 4g 1%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 6mg 28%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 25mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/213759/spiced-persimmon-butter/

============================================================

RECIPE 548: Old-Fashioned Persimmon Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 4 to 5 dozen
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup shortening
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon ground cloves
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 cup raisins
• 1 cup chopped walnuts
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup persimmon pulp

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Cream together the shortening and sugar
3. Add egg and vanilla; mix well
4. Sift together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, cloves, cinnamon, and nutmeg
5. Stir flour mixture into creamed sugar mixture
6. Stir in the raisins, chopped nuts, 1/4 teaspoon salt and persimmon pulp; mix well
7. Drop by the teaspoonful on greased or parchment lined cookie sheet
8. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes
9. Transfer to wire racks to cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 45mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 10mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 56mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/9518/persimmon-cookies/

RECIPE 549: Persimmon Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 19 mins
Total Time: 34 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 egg
• 1 cup persimmon pulp
• ½ cup canola oil
• ⅓ cup milk
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• ½ cup walnuts
• ⅓ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin
3. Beat egg in a bowl
4. Stir in persimmon pulp, oil, and milk
5. Combine flour, walnuts, sugar, salt, baking powder, and cinnamon in a separate bowl
6. Stir flour mixture into persimmon mixture; mix until just moistened
7. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full
8. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and tops spring back when lightly touched, 19 to 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 244mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 11%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 13mg 65%, Calcium 48mg 4%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 122mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/260654/persimmon-muffins/

RECIPE 550: Persimmon Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Bar Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup persimmon pulp
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 egg
• beaten
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 1 cup raisins
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
• 1 cup chopped walnuts
• 1 cup confectioners' sugar
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease a 10x15 inch jelly roll pan
3. In a small bowl, stir together persimmon pulp and baking soda; set aside
4. In a separate bowl, mix together egg, white sugar, vegetable oil and raisins
5. In a large bowl, stir together flour cinnamon, nutmeg, salt and cloves
6. Stir persimmon mixture and egg mixture into the dry ingredients
7. Fold in walnuts
8. Spread batter into prepared pan
9. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes
10. Meanwhile, combine confectioners' sugar and lemon juice
11. Stir until sugar is dissolved
12. Remove bars from oven and spread with glaze

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 21%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 307mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 55g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 14mg 72%, Calcium 26mg 2%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 176mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/25222/persimmon-bars/

============================================================

RECIPE 551: Persimmon Oatmeal Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 dozen cookies
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Oatmeal Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¾ cups rolled oats
• 1 ½ cups sifted all-purpose flour
• ½ cup English toffee-flavored baking bits (such as Heath®)
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
• 1 cup brown sugar
• ¾ cup butter
• 1 egg
• 1 cup persimmon puree
• 1 teaspoon vanilla

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line baking sheets with parchment paper
3. Whisk oats, flour, toffee bits, baking soda, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, and cloves together in a bowl
4. Beat brown sugar and butter together in a bowl with an electric mixer until creamy, 2 minutes
5. Beat in egg
6. Beat persimmon puree and vanilla into butter mixture
7. Mix flour mixture into persimmon mixture until dough is just moistened and no streaks of flour or oats remain
8. Drop spoonfuls of dough 1 1/2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets
9. Bake cookies in the preheated oven until slightly browned on the edges, 8 to 12 minutes
10. Cool on the baking sheet for 10 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Cholesterol 27mg 9%, Sodium 221mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 7mg 33%, Calcium 18mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 78mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/235252/persimmon-oatmeal-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 552: Banana and Persimmon Cinnamon Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Banana Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ripe bananas
• peeled
• 1 Hachiya persimmon
• peeled
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ⅓ cup coconut oil
• melted
• 1 egg
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Line 6 muffin cups with paper liners
3. Mash bananas and persimmon together in the bowl of a stand mixer
4. Add 3/4 cup sugar, coconut oil, egg, and vanilla extract, 1 at a time, mixing well after each addition
5. Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together in a separate bowl
6. Stir flour mixture into banana mixture using a spoon just until batter is combined
7. Fill each muffin cup 3/4-full with batter
8. Mix 1 tablespoon sugar and cinnamon together in a bowl; sprinkle over batter
9. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean, 18 to 23 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 11g 57%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 328mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 62g 22%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 6mg 31%, Calcium 81mg 6%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 170mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/239997/banana-and-persimmon-cinnamon-muffins/

============================================================

RECIPE 553: Persimmon Cheesecake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 cheesecake
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 22 mins
Total Time: 5 hrs 47 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cheesecake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups chopped walnuts
• ⅓ cup brown sugar
• 3 tablespoons melted butter
• 2 cups pureed persimmons
• 3 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese
• softened
• 1 ¼ cups white sugar
• ¾ cup sour cream
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground ginger
• 6 eggs
• 1 ¼ cups sour cream
• 3 tablespoons white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Chop the walnuts in a food processor until fine
3. Mix together in a bowl with the brown sugar and melted butter
4. Press the mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan
5. Bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes
6. Set aside to cool completely
7. Combine the persimmons, cream cheese, 1 1/4 cup sugar, 3/4 cup sour cream, cinnamon, and ginger in a food processor
8. Blend in processor until smooth, stopping occasionally to scrape edges of food processor bowl with a spatula
9. Add the eggs, one at a time, and process until fully incorporated
10. Pour the mixture over the cooled crust
11. Bake in the preheated oven until mostly set with the center being slightly jiggly, 60 to 75 minutes
12. While the cheesecake is baking, whisk together the 1 1/4 sour cream, 3 tablespoon white sugar, and vanilla extract
13. Spread evenly over the cheesecake while still hot and return to oven another 10 minutes
14. Allow to cool completely
15. Loosely cover with aluminum foil and refrigerate 4 to 8 hours or overnight before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 44g 56%, Saturated Fat 21g 105%, Cholesterol 179mg 60%, Sodium 244mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 49g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 12g, Vitamin C 26mg 132%, Calcium 136mg 10%, Iron 3mg 15%, Potassium 362mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/157884/persimmon-cheesecake/

============================================================

RECIPE 554: Spinach and Persimmon Salad with Goat Cheese and Pomegranate
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Spinach Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 Fuyu persimmon
• peeled and cored
• 2 cups roughly chopped spinach
• 3 tablespoons pomegranate seeds
• 2 ounces goat cheese
• crumbled
• 1 tablespoon sliced almonds

DIRECTIONS:
1. Slice persimmon into 1/4-inch rounds, then slice each round into quarters
2. Place chopped spinach into a salad bowl
3. Top with persimmon quarters, pomegranate seeds, goat cheese, and sliced almonds
4. Whisk together olive oil, orange juice, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper in a small bowl
5. Drizzle vinaigrette over salad and toss lightly to coat
6. Serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 31%, Saturated Fat 8g 40%, Cholesterol 22mg 7%, Sodium 295mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 29mg 145%, Calcium 147mg 11%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 443mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/277227/spinach-and-persimmon-salad-with-goat-cheese-and-pomegranate/

============================================================

RECIPE 555: Butternut Squash Soup with Persimmon
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Soup Recipes/Vegetable Soup Recipes/Squash Soup Recipes/Butternut Squash Soup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 onion
• finely chopped
• 2 carrots
• peeled and cubed
• 1 bay leaf
• 2 pounds butternut squash- peeled
• seeded and cubed
• ½ cup dry white wine
• 4 cups chicken broth
• 2 persimmons
• diced
• 1 tablespoon white wine vinegar
• 1 pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat and cook onion until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes
2. Add carrots and bay leaf and cook an additional 5 minutes
3. Add butternut squash and keep cooking, 5 more minutes
4. Pour white wine into the pot and allow to evaporate
5. Add chicken broth, bring to a boil, and add persimmons
6. Cover and simmer until squash is soft, about 20 minutes
7. Remove bay leaf and puree with an immersion blender until smooth
8. Season with vinegar, salt, and pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 817mg 36%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 10%, Dietary Fiber 4g 15%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 41mg 204%, Calcium 89mg 7%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 659mg 14%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/261408/butternut-squash-soup-with-persimmon/

============================================================

RECIPE 556: Persimmon Chocolate Chip Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 33
Yield: 33 cookies
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Chocolate Chip Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• 1 cup white sugar
• 3 Hachiya persimmons
• pulp extracted
• 1 egg
• 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 2 ½ cups chocolate chips

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Beat butter, sugar, and persimmon pulp together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy; beat in eggs and vanilla extract
4. Sift flour, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl; add gradually to persimmon mixture until dough is thoroughly combined
5. Stir in chocolate chips
6. Drop spoonfuls of dough 1 inch apart onto lined baking sheet
7. Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, 10 to 13 minutes
8. Cool on the baking sheet for 1 minute before removing to a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 12%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 152mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 2mg 8%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 70mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/245566/persimmon-chocolate-chip-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 557: Pavlova with Winter Fruits
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 3
Yield: 3 pavlovas
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Pavlova Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 egg whites
• at room temperature
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup superfine sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons cornstarch
• ½ teaspoon orange blossom water (Optional)
• ½ teaspoon white vinegar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C)
2. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Invert a small bowl onto the parchment paper and trace the rim with a pencil
4. Repeat twice more
5. Flip parchment paper over
6. Beat egg whites in a large bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks begin to form
7. Gradually add white sugar, with the mixer running
8. Whisk superfine sugar and cornstarch in a small bowl
9. Gradually beat into the meringue
10. Continue beating meringue until stiff, glossy peaks form
11. Beat in orange blossom water and vinegar
12. Spoon meringue into the traced circles
13. Make the borders higher than the center, to leave room for the filling
14. Bake meringues in the preheated oven until firm and dry to the touch, about 1 hour
15. Meanwhile, make the lemon curd
16. Fill a medium saucepan with 1 inch of water and bring to a bare simmer
17. Whisk lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, egg yolks, and salt together in a glass bowl
18. Set the bowl over the simmering water
19. Cook, whisking constantly, until curd foams, then thickens, about 10 minutes
20. Remove the bowl from the simmering water
21. Gradually whisk in coconut oil until melted and incorporated
22. Strain the curd through a fine-mesh sieve; discard solids left in the strainer
23. Press a sheet of plastic wrap directly onto the surface to prevent a skin from forming
24. Transfer to the refrigerator
25. Turn off oven and keep meringues inside until completely dry, about 1 hour
26. Combine heavy cream, confectioners' sugar, and orange blossom water in a bowl
27. Beat with an electric mixer until soft peaks form
28. Spoon lemon curd into the center of the cooled meringues
29. Mound whipped cream over the curd
30. Arrange grapefruit, orange, and persimmon slices on top
31. Sprinkle pomegranate seeds over the top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 49g 63%, Saturated Fat 32g 161%, Cholesterol 382mg 127%, Sodium 227mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 133g 48%, Dietary Fiber 7g 26%, Total Sugars 111g, Protein 13g, Vitamin C 140mg 701%, Calcium 187mg 14%, Iron 3mg 17%, Potassium 592mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/269274/pavlova-with-winter-fruits/

============================================================

RECIPE 558: Gingered Apple-Persimmon Compote
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/

INGREDIENTS:
• 5 overripe Fuyu persimmons
• mashed
• 1 small Granny Smith apple
• peeled and diced
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon freshly grated ginger
• ½ lemon
• juiced
• ½ teaspoon lemon zest

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat mashed persimmons in a saucepan over medium heat
2. Stir apple, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger, lemon juice, and lemon zest into persimmons
3. Bring mixture to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until sauce is desired consistency and flavors blend, 10 to 15 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 22mg 112%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 138mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/235253/gingered-apple-persimmon-compote/

RECIPE 559: Persimmon Upside Down Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch cake
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Upside-Down Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons margarine
• ¼ cup brown sugar
• 4 large ripe persimmons
• peeled and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9-inch round cake pan
3. Place the margarine and brown sugar in the cake pan and transfer the pan to the hot oven until the sugar is melted and bubbly, about 5 minutes
4. Remove from the oven; arrange the persimmon slices over the topping in the cake pan
5. Beat the butter and sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy
6. The mixture should be noticeably lighter in color
7. Stir in the persimmon pulp
8. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves
9. Gradually add the flour mixture to the batter, stirring just to mix
10. The batter will be stiff, since the only liquid comes from the persimmon pulp
11. Stir in the pecans and lemon zest
12. Spoon the cake batter evenly over the persimmon slices and return the cake pan to the preheated oven
13. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes
14. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before inverting the cake right-side-up on a serving platter

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 9g 43%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 484mg 21%, Total Carbohydrate 81g 29%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 47mg 237%, Calcium 110mg 8%, Iron 4mg 20%, Potassium 301mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215811/persimmon-upside-down-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 560: Nonnie's Persimmon Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups persimmon pulp
• 2 cups white sugar
• 2 eggs
• beaten
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 ½ cups buttermilk
• ¼ cup heavy cream
• 1 tablespoon honey
• 4 tablespoons butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spray a 9x13 inch baking pan lightly with nonstick spray; set aside
3. Mix the persimmon pulp with the 2 cups sugar in a large bowl; set aside
4. Whisk together the eggs and baking soda in a small bowl
5. Add the egg mixture to the persimmon mixture and beat well; set aside
6. Whisk together the 1 cup flour, salt, baking powder, and cinnamon in a bowl
7. Stir 1/4 of the flour mixture to the persimmon mixture
8. Add 1/4 of the buttermilk and mix well
9. Continue alternating flour and buttermilk, adding 1/4 each time, and mixing well after each addition, until all of the flour mixture and buttermilk are incorporated
10. Stir in cream, honey, and melted butter until well combined
11. Pour the pudding batter into the prepared pan
12. Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 1 hour
13. While baking, do not stir; Turn off the oven at the end of the baking time, but do not remove the pudding from the oven
14. Meanwhile, when the pudding has about 10 minutes of baking time left, make the sauce
15. Boil the water in a small saucepan
16. Whisk 1/2 cup sugar and 1 tablespoon flour together, and whisk sugar mixture into the boiling water, whisking until smooth
17. Boil the sauce for 5 minutes and remove from heat
18. Stir in vanilla
19. Pour the sauce mixture evenly over the pudding, and leave the pudding to cool in the warm oven for 20 more minutes, being sure that the oven is off so that the pudding does not continue to cook

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 49mg 16%, Sodium 209mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 67g 24%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 45g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 26mg 131%, Calcium 76mg 6%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 200mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/95191/nonnies-persimmon-pudding/

============================================================

RECIPE 561: Freezer Persimmon Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 6 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 3.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 5 cups pureed persimmons
• 3 cups white sugar
• ¼ cup fresh lemon juice
• ½ teaspoon grated orange zest
• 1 pinch ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, combine persimmon puree, sugar, lemon juice, orange zest and nutmeg
2. Boil for 30 minutes, or until slightly thickened
3. Pour into sterilized jars and seal
4. Store in the freezer

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 21g 8%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 17mg 84%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 78mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/24747/freezer-persimmon-jam/

RECIPE 562: Fuyu Persimmon and Burrata Caprese Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Salad/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 Fuyu persimmon
• stem removed and sliced into rounds
• 1 (4 ounce) ball burrata cheese
• 1 ½ teaspoons balsamic glaze
• 1 ½ teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil
• 5 leaves fresh basil
• or more to taste
• 1 pinch freshly ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place persimmon rounds on a platter
2. Cut burrata ball into 5 or 6 pieces, ensuring that each piece has some of the firm outer shell (mozzarella) as well as some of the creamy inside (stracciatella and cream)
3. Distribute burrata pieces around persimmon rounds
4. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and olive oil
5. Scatter basil leaves on top and sprinkle with pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 20%, Saturated Fat 9g 43%, Cholesterol 40mg 13%, Sodium 140mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 6g 2%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 9mg 43%, Calcium 8mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 49mg 1%

RECIPE 563: Cranberry Persimmon Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 2 loaves
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/Cranberry Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups ripe Hachiya persimmon pulp
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• 2 cups brown sugar
• 4 eggs
• ⅔ cup vegetable oil
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 cups fresh cranberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease 2 loaf pans
3. Stir persimmon pulp and baking soda together in a large bowl
4. Let stand until pulp is thickened, about 5 minutes
5. Add sugar, eggs, oil, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt
6. Blend until smooth
7. Mix in flour and fold in cranberries
8. Divide batter between the prepared pans, filling each 2/3 full
9. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour
10. Let cool in the pans for 10 minutes before moving to a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 37mg 12%, Sodium 261mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 13mg 65%, Calcium 28mg 2%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 117mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/261513/cranberry-persimmon-bread/

============================================================

RECIPE 564: Gram's Persimmon Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 egg
• 1 cup persimmon pulp
• ½ cup canned sweetened condensed milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 tablespoon melted butter
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
2. Butter a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish
3. In a large bowl, whisk together the egg, persimmon pulp, sweetened condensed milk, vanilla and melted butter
4. Combine the sugar, flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon; whisk into the persimmon batter until well blended
5. Pour into the prepared baking dish
6. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the pudding is set and the top is lightly browned

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 67mg 22%, Sodium 1008mg 44%, Total Carbohydrate 115g 42%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 71g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 40mg 199%, Calcium 139mg 11%, Iron 3mg 18%, Potassium 378mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/95568/grams-persimmon-pudding/

RECIPE 565: Granny Franny's Persimmon Curry Chili
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 55 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Chili Recipes/Beef Chili Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pound ground beef
• or more to taste
• 1 yellow onion
• chopped
• 1 (15 ounce) can seasoned diced tomatoes
• 1 (15 ounce) can diced tomatoes with jalapeno peppers
• 1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans
• 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans
• 1 (15 ounce) can black beans
• 1 (15 ounce) can chicken broth
• 1 (15 ounce) can chili with beans (Optional)
• ⅔ cup tangy coconut and chili vindaloo sauce (such as Maya Kaimal®)
• ⅓ cup ketchup
• 2 tablespoons tomato paste
• 1 ripe persimmon
• chopped
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes
• ½ teaspoon ground cumin
• ½ teaspoon chili powder

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place ground beef and onion in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir until brown and crumbled, 5 to 10 minutes
2. Drain; place into a large pot
3. Mix seasoned diced tomatoes, diced tomatoes with jalapeno peppers, pinto beans, kidney beans, black beans, chicken broth, chili, curry sauce, ketchup, tomato paste, persimmon, salt, red pepper flakes, cumin, and chili powder into the pot
4. Bring beef mixture to a boil; reduce heat to medium
5. Simmer until flavors combine, about 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 36mg 12%, Sodium 1224mg 53%, Total Carbohydrate 30g 11%, Dietary Fiber 10g 36%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 18g, Vitamin C 12mg 61%, Calcium 96mg 7%, Iron 6mg 31%, Potassium 643mg 14%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/255376/granny-frannys-persimmon-curry-chili/

RECIPE 566: Roasted Persimmon-Burrata Focaccia
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Cheese/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 precooked 9-inch focaccia flatbread
• 1 Fuyu persimmon
• peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch rounds
• 4 teaspoons olive oil
• divided
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 2 sprigs fresh rosemary
• leaves stripped
• ½ cup burrata cheese

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Lay persimmon slices onto the prepared baking sheet
4. Drizzle with 2 teaspoons olive oil and sprinkle salt on top
5. Sprinkle 1/2 the rosemary leaves over the persimmon slices
6. Roast in the preheated oven for 20 minutes
7. Turn persimmon slices over and roast 10 minutes more
8. Remove baking sheet from the oven and increase temperature to 200 degrees C
9. Place focaccia on a baking sheet
10. Bake focaccia in the hot oven until warmed through, about 5 minutes
11. Remove from oven and top focaccia with roasted persimmon slices
12. Tear burrata cheese using your hands and lay evenly on the focaccia, avoiding the persimmon slices
13. Reserve about 1 tablespoon rosemary leaves and sprinkle the rest on top
14. Return focaccia to the hot oven and bake until warmed and burrata cheese has melted slightly, about 5 minutes
15. Top with reserved fresh rosemary leaves and drizzle remaining 2 teaspoons olive oil on top
16. Slice and serve hot

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 31g 40%, Saturated Fat 12g 62%, Cholesterol 45mg 15%, Sodium 2067mg 90%, Total Carbohydrate 118g 43%, Dietary Fiber 6g 23%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 29g, Vitamin C 8mg 42%, Calcium 183mg 14%, Iron 7mg 39%, Potassium 294mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/269164/roasted-persimmon-burrata-focaccia/

============================================================

RECIPE 567: Persimmon Cookies IV
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 36
Yield: 3 dozen
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Drop Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground ginger
• 1 cup butter
• 2 cups white sugar
• 2 eggs
• 2 cups persimmon pulp

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Whisk the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and ginger in a bowl; set aside
3. Beat the butter and sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth
4. Add the eggs one at a time, allowing each egg to blend into the butter mixture before adding the next
5. Beat in the persimmon pulp
6. Mix in the flour mixture until just incorporated
7. Drop spoonfuls of the dough 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets
8. Bake in the preheated oven until slightly puffed and golden brown, about 12 minutes
9. Cool on the pan for 5 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Cholesterol 24mg 8%, Sodium 111mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 9mg 43%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 62mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/84158/persimmon-cookies-iv/

RECIPE 568: Persimmon Bread III
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 loaves
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 ½ cups wheat flour
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ½ cup oatmeal
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 teaspoon ground allspice
• ½ teaspoon ground cloves
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• 2 cups ripe Hachiya persimmon pulp
• ½ cup applesauce
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 3 eggs

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. In a bowl, stir together the sugar, wheat flour, all-purpose flour, oatmeal, salt cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, cloves, and baking soda, until well mixed
3. In a separate bowl, stir persimmon pulp with applesauce, vegetable oil, and eggs until well blended
4. Combine the wet and dry ingredients, stirring until free of lumps
5. Divide batter between two greased 9x5 inch loaf pans
6. Bake in the preheated oven for one hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaves comes out clean

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 168mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 14%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 13mg 66%, Calcium 20mg 2%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 98mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/67111/persimmon-bread-iii/

RECIPE 569: Persimmon Raisin Yeast Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 to 1 1/2 - pound loaf
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 3 mins
Total Time: 8 mins
Rating: 3.5/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Breakfast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup very ripe persimmon pulp
• 9 tablespoons water
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 1 ½ teaspoons white sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons salt
• 2 cups bread flour
• 1 cup whole wheat flour
• 2 tablespoons wheat germ
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 2 ½ teaspoons active dry yeast
• ⅓ cup raisins

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place all ingredients except raisins in your bread machine's baking pan in the order recommended by the manufacturer
2. Use the basic or white cycle
3. You may need to add an extra tablespoon of water during kneading If your machine has a Fruit setting, add the raisins at the signal, or about 5 minutes before the kneading cycle has finished

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 3%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 307mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 7mg 33%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 137mg 3%

RECIPE 570: Deep Dish Persimmon Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8-inch deep dish pie
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup light brown sugar
• packed
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• ⅛ teaspoon sea salt
• 6 cups Fuyu persimmons
• peeled and thinly sliced
• 10 graham crackers
• crushed
• ¼ cup butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Combine brown sugar, cinnamon, cornstarch, and sea salt in a small bowl
3. Spread half of the persimmons into an 8-inch deep pie plate
4. Sprinkle with half of the the sugar mixture
5. Repeat with the remaining persimmons and sugar mixture
6. Mix graham cracker crumbs and melted butter until evenly combined
7. Spread crust evenly over persimmons
8. Bake until crust is golden brown and persimmons are tender, about 45 minutes
9. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 125mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 74g 27%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 116mg 582%, Calcium 66mg 5%, Iron 5mg 29%, Potassium 573mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/212695/deep-dish-persimmon-pie/

RECIPE 571: Persimmon Raisin Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 60
Yield: 60 cookies
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 12 mins
Total Time: 32 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Raisin/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 cup shortening
• 2 eggs
• 4 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 2 teaspoons ground nutmeg
• 2 cups persimmon pulp
• 2 cups raisin paste
• 2 cups chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease two baking sheets
3. Cream the sugar and shortening together in a large mixing bowl until light and fluffy
4. Beat in the eggs, one at a time
5. Stir in the flour, salt, baking soda, cinnamon, and nutmeg, blending thoroughly
6. Mix in the persimmon pulp, raisin paste, and walnuts
7. Drop by spoonfuls onto prepared cookies sheets, and spread out slightly
8. Bake in preheated oven until cookie top springs back when touched, 12 to 15 minutes
9. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 6mg 2%, Sodium 84mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 6mg 28%, Calcium 13mg 1%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 118mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/146401/persimmon-raisin-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 572: Harriet Davis's Indiana Persimmon Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch baking pan
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups buttermilk
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• 2 cups persimmon pulp
• 2 cups white sugar
• 2 eggs
• well beaten
• ¼ cup heavy whipping cream
• ¼ cup butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Combine buttermilk and baking soda together in a bowl
3. Combine flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a separate bowl
4. Mix persimmon pulp and sugar together in a large bowl
5. Beat in eggs
6. Add buttermilk mixture alternately with flour mixture, stirring until combined
7. Stir in heavy cream and melted butter
8. Pour batter into a 9x13-inch baking pan
9. Bake in the preheated oven until edges pull away from the sides of the pan and cracks begin to appear in the center, 25 to 30 minutes
10. Chill until serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 49mg 16%, Sodium 243mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 60g 22%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 26mg 131%, Calcium 81mg 6%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 202mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/255797/harriet-daviss-indiana-persimmon-pudding/

RECIPE 573: Persimmon Pudding Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/No-Bake Pie Recipes/Pudding Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons butter
• melted
• 2 cups persimmon pulp
• 2 cups white sugar
• 3 eggs
• lightly beaten
• 1 ¼ cups buttermilk
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Spread melted butter evenly over the bottom of a baking dish
3. Beat persimmon pulp and sugar together in a bowl; beat in eggs
4. Beat in buttermilk and baking soda
5. Sift flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt together in a bowl
6. Gradually add flour mixture to persimmon mixture, stirring until well incorporated; stir in vanilla extract
7. Pour persimmon batter into prepared baking dish
8. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly golden and cooked through, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 79mg 26%, Sodium 452mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 96g 35%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 52g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 39mg 196%, Calcium 112mg 9%, Iron 3mg 19%, Potassium 302mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/235254/persimmon-pudding-pie/

RECIPE 574: Christmas Cranberry-Persimmon Loaf
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/Cranberry Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground ginger
• or more to taste
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• or more to taste
• ½ cup chopped toasted walnuts
• ½ cup dried cranberries
• 2 large eggs
• ¾ cup light brown sugar
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 4 ripe Fuyu persimmons
• chopped into small pieces

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan and dust the bottom with flour
3. Mix flour, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, ginger, and nutmeg together in a small bowl
4. Add walnuts and cranberries; toss or mix using your fingers to ensure cranberries don't stick together
5. Whisk eggs, brown sugar, and oil together in a medium bowl until eggs are well beaten
6. Stir in persimmon pieces followed by flour mixture
7. Pour into the prepared loaf pan
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean, 1 hour and 15 minutes to 1 1/2 hours
9. Remove from the oven and let cool on a wire rack for 15 minutes
10. Slide a knife around the sides and slide loaf out onto the rack to finish cooling, 15 to 30 minutes more, before cutting

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 17%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 218mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 34g 12%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 6mg 28%, Calcium 31mg 2%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 97mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/276892/christmas-cranberry-persimmon-loaf/

RECIPE 575: Paleo Persimmon Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 slices
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/No-Bake Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ teaspoon olive oil
• 3 cups pecans
• 20 pitted dates
• ¼ cup agave nectar
• 6 ripe persimmons
• 2 tablespoons chopped pecans
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• for garnish

DIRECTIONS:
1. Lightly grease an 8-inch pie pan with olive oil
2. Blend 3 cups pecans and dates in a food processor until finely ground, about 1 minute
3. Pour agave nectar over nut mixture and process until fully incorporated, about 30 seconds
4. Press nut mixture evenly into prepared pie pan
5. Peel and pit persimmons, then puree in food processor until smooth
6. Pour over crust and smooth out
7. Garnish with chopped pecans and cinnamon

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 31g 40%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 7g 24%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 13mg 65%, Calcium 46mg 4%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 371mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228719/paleo-persimmon-pie/

RECIPE 576: Persimmon, Pomegranate, and Massaged Kale Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Kale Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup raw macadamia nuts
• 2 tablespoons maple syrup
• divided
• 1 pinch salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Toss macademia nuts with 1 tablespoon maple syrup and pinch of salt; spread on baking sheet
4. Toast macademia nuts in the preheated oven until lightly golden, about 5 minutes
5. Remove from oven and coat with 1 tablespoon maple syrup
6. Whisk orange juice, lemon juice, 1 tablespoon maple syrup, and ground black pepper together in a small bowl to make dressing
7. Place kale pieces, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large bowl; massage with your hands until kale is tender, 3 to 5 minutes
8. Add persimmon slices and dressing and toss to mix
9. Top with pomegranate seeds and maple-roasted macademia nuts

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Sodium 429mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 6g 22%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 285mg 1,426%, Calcium 332mg 26%, Iron 5mg 27%, Potassium 1185mg 25%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/245726/persimmon-pomegranate-and-massaged-kale-salad/

RECIPE 577: Auntie's Persimmon Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 36
Yield: 36 cookies
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 14 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 14 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Drop Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups persimmon pulp
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground cloves
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 egg
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 1 cup golden raisins

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a Silpat® nonstick baking mat
3. Mash persimmon pulp in a small bowl and stir in baking soda to let mixture congeal
4. Beat white sugar and 1/2 cup butter with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy
5. Stir flour, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and salt together in a second bowl
6. Mix egg into the persimmon mixture
7. Add persimmon mixture and flour mixture to the creamed butter mixture and stir well to combine
8. Fold pecans and raisins into the batter
9. Drop batter onto the prepared baking sheet using a medium cookie scoop
10. Bake in the preheated oven until slightly browned and puffy, 13 to 15 minutes
11. Remove from oven and cool completely on wire racks, about 30 minutes
12. Mix confectioners' sugar, maple syrup, 1 tablespoon melted butter, vanilla extract, and salt in a bowl until maple glaze is smooth
13. Place a sheet of parchment paper under the wire rack to catch the drips
14. Drizzle maple glaze onto the cookie tops using a spoon
15. Let set until glaze hardens, about 30 minutes
16. Cut green belt candy into small leaf shapes using kitchen scissors
17. Combine white chocolate and shortening in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl and melt in the microwave in 15-second intervals, stirring after each melting, 1 to 3 minutes
18. Drip some melted white chocolate over each cookie using a spoon
19. Place one red candy-coated chocolate piece in the middle of each cookie and add a green belt leaf to each side
20. Let set until frosting hardens, about 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 105mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 27g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 7mg 34%, Calcium 28mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 96mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/261480/aunties-persimmon-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 578: Persimmon Cookies III
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 72
Yield: 6 dozen
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 12 mins
Total Time: 32 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Spice Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup shortening
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• 1 cup persimmon pulp
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup raisins
• ½ cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease cookie sheets
3. In a large bowl, cream together the shortening and sugar
4. Beat in the egg and persimmon pulp
5. Combine the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves and salt; stir into the persimmon mixture
6. Fold in raisins and walnuts
7. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto the prepared cookie sheets
8. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are firm
9. Let cool on the cookie sheets for 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 3%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Cholesterol 3mg 1%, Sodium 29mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 6g 2%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 4mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 20mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/26210/persimmon-cookies-iii/

RECIPE 579: Sandra's Persimmon Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup persimmon pulp
• 1 egg
• beaten
• 1 ¼ cups white sugar
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 ¼ cups milk
• ¼ teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ¼ cup butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Butter one 9x13 inch baking pan
2. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
3. In a blender, combine persimmon pulp, egg, sugar, flour, milk, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, salt and butter
4. Blend until smooth
5. Pour into baking pan and bake for 30 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out with just crumbs but no batter stuck to it

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 9g 44%, Cholesterol 83mg 28%, Sodium 478mg 21%, Total Carbohydrate 110g 40%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 66g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 39mg 195%, Calcium 191mg 15%, Iron 3mg 18%, Potassium 353mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13665/sandras-persimmon-pudding/

RECIPE 580: Spicy Persimmon Chutney
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 32
Yield: 4 cups
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Chutney Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups cider vinegar
• 1 cup chopped onion
• 1 large Granny Smith apple - peeled
• cored and chopped
• 1 cup golden raisins
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup lemon juice
• 1 green chile pepper
• seeded and minced
• 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root
• 1 tablespoon lemon zest
• 1 teaspoon ground coriander seed
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cloves
• 4 Fuyu persimmons
• peeled and chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine cider vinegar, onion, apple, raisins, sugar, lemon juice, green chile, ginger, lemon zest, coriander, and cloves in a large saucepan
2. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally
3. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until mixture thickens, stirring frequently, about 25 minutes
4. Add persimmons and simmer until the persimmons are tender, about 5 to 10 minutes
5. Remove from the heat and let cool completely
6. Cover and refrigerate

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 8mg 38%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 75mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/9210/spicy-persimmon-chutney/

RECIPE 581: Sweet Persimmon Fireside Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 16 bars
Rating: 3.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Bar Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• ½ cup cake flour
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground ginger
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon lemon zest
• 2 ripe persimmons
• pureed
• 1 egg
• ¼ cup confectioners' sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease one 9x13 inch baking pan
3. Sift together all-purpose flour, cake flour, cinnamon, ginger, baking soda and salt
4. In a medium bowl, cream butter, sugar, and lemon rind until fluffy and smooth
5. Blend in egg and persimmon pulp and mix until well combined
6. Gradually stir in the flour mixture and mix until well blended
7. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly
8. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown
9. Remove from the oven and let cool
10. When the bars are completely cool, sift confectioners' sugar over the top and cut into bars

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 27mg 9%, Sodium 81mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 40mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/11479/sweet-persimmon-fireside-cookies/

RECIPE 582: Banana Chocolate Chip Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/Banana Bread/Chocolate Banana Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 3 ripe bananas
• mashed
• 1 tablespoon milk
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• or to taste
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• 2 large eggs
• 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan, preferably glass
3. Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a bowl
4. Stir bananas, milk, and cinnamon in another bowl
5. Beat sugar and butter together in a third bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy; add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition
6. Stir banana mixture into butter mixture; mix in flour mixture until just blended
7. Fold in chocolate chips; pour batter into the prepared loaf pan
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 70 minutes
9. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack before slicing
10. My Hot Southern Mess

RECIPE 584: Banana Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Banana Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 3 large bananas
• mashed
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• ⅓ cup butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners
3. Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl; set aside
4. Mix bananas, sugar, egg, and melted butter in a separate large bowl until well combined; fold in flour mixture until smooth
5. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full
6. Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 25 to 30 minutes
7. Cool briefly in the tin, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely

RECIPE 586: Janet's Rich Banana Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/Banana Bread/Banana Nut Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• melted
• 2 eggs
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup sour cream
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• 2 medium bananas
• sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan
3. Stir sugar and melted butter together in a large bowl
4. Add eggs and vanilla; mix well
5. Combine flour, baking soda, and salt; stir into butter mixture until smooth
6. Fold in banana slices, sour cream, and walnuts; transfer into the prepared pan
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean, about 1 hour
8. Cool loaf in the pan for 10 minutes before inverting onto a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 587: Bananas Foster
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Banana Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup butter
• ⅔ cup dark brown sugar
• 3 ½ tablespoons rum
• 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 3 bananas
• peeled and sliced lengthwise and crosswise
• ¼ cup coarsely chopped walnuts
• 1 pint vanilla ice cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a large, deep skillet over medium heat
2. Stir in brown sugar, rum, vanilla, and cinnamon; bring to a low boil
3. Place bananas and walnuts in the pan
4. Cook until bananas have softened, 1 to 2 minutes
5. Serve at once over vanilla ice cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 31%, Saturated Fat 12g 62%, Cholesterol 60mg 20%, Sodium 146mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 73g 27%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 61g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 8mg 41%, Calcium 133mg 10%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 537mg 11%

RECIPE 588: Banana Cream Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Custard and Cream Pies/Banana Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ⅓ cup all-purpose flour
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 2 cups milk
• 3 egg yolks
• beaten
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 1 ¼ teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 (9 inch) baked pastry shell
• cooled
• 4 bananas
• sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Combine sugar, flour, and salt in a saucepan
3. Gradually stir in milk
4. Cook, stirring constantly, over medium heat until mixture boils and thickens
5. Continue to cook and stir for 2 more minutes, then remove from the heat
6. Place egg yolks in a medium bowl; whisk in a small amount of the hot milk mixture until smooth, then gradually whisk egg yolk mixture into the saucepan
7. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, for 2 more minutes
8. Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla
9. Fill pastry shell with sliced bananas; pour pudding mixture on top to cover
10. Bake in the preheated oven until filling sets, 12 to 15 minutes
11. Chill pie for 1 hour before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 89mg 30%, Sodium 224mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 5mg 27%, Calcium 88mg 7%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 335mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12151/banana-cream-pie-i/

============================================================

RECIPE 589: Banana Oat Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Banana Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups unbleached all-purpose flour
• 1 cup rolled oats
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 egg
• ¾ cup milk
• ⅓ cup vegetable oil
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup mashed bananas

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C)
2. Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners
3. Combine flour, oats, sugar, baking powder, soda, and salt in a medium bowl; set aside
4. Beat egg lightly in a large bowl
5. Whisk in milk, oil, and vanilla
6. Stir in mashed bananas
7. Add the flour mixture and stir until just combined
8. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full
9. Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, 18 to 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 296mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 30g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 72mg 6%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 137mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/6714/banana-oat-muffins/

RECIPE 590: Extreme Banana Nut Bread 'EBNB'
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 9x5-inch loaves
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/Banana Bread/Banana Nut Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• 2 cups mashed overripe bananas
• 4 large eggs
• beaten
• 1 cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour two 9x5-inch loaf pans
3. Sift flour, baking soda, and salt into a large bowl
4. Cream sugar and butter together in a separate bowl
5. Stir in bananas, eggs, and walnuts until well blended
6. Pour wet ingredients into flour mixture and stir just until blended
7. Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared pans
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a paring knife inserted into the crown of each loaf comes out clean, 60 to 70 minutes
9. Remove from the oven and let loaves cool in the pans for at least 5 minutes
10. Turn out onto a cooling rack, and let cool completely, about 30 minutes
11. Slice and serve
12. For more intense flavor, wrap each loaf in aluminum foil to keep in the moisture, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving
13. Josie Rivera-Abdo

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 6g 28%, Cholesterol 51mg 17%, Sodium 268mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 30g 11%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 114mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/67937/extreme-banana-nut-bread-ebnb/

============================================================

RECIPE 591: Ultimate Banana Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Banana Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 pinch ground nutmeg
• 3 bananas (ripe or very ripe work best)
• ½ cup white sugar
• ⅓ cup butter
• melted
• ¼ cup lightly packed brown sugar
• 1 large egg
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ¼ cup chopped walnuts (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a muffin tin
3. Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg together in a small bowl
4. Mash bananas in a large bowl
5. Mix in white sugar, melted butter, brown sugar, egg, and vanilla extract
6. Fold in flour mixture until just combined
7. Fold walnuts into the batter
8. Divide batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups
9. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 29mg 10%, Sodium 286mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 146mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/257206/ultimate-banana-muffins/

RECIPE 592: Banana Crumb Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 muffins
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Banana Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 3 bananas
• mashed
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ⅓ cup butter
• melted
• 1 egg
• lightly beaten

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease or line 10 muffin cups with paper liners
3. Prepare muffins: Mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl
4. Beat bananas, white sugar, melted butter, and egg together in a separate bowl; stir the banana mixture into the flour mixture just until combined
5. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full
6. Prepare crumb topping: Mix brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon together in a small bowl
7. Use a fork to mix in 1 tablespoon butter until mixture is crumbly; sprinkle topping over muffins
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 18 to 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Cholesterol 38mg 13%, Sodium 353mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 46g 17%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 3mg 16%, Calcium 43mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 168mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17652/banana-crumb-muffins/

RECIPE 593: Banana Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Banana Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups mashed bananas
• 2 teaspoons lemon juice
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 2 ⅛ cups white sugar
• ¾ cup butter
• 3 eggs
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 ½ cups buttermilk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan
3. Make cake: Mix mashed bananas with lemon juice in a small bowl
4. Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl
5. Cream sugar and butter in a large bowl until light and fluffy, 3 to 4 minutes
6. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla
7. Beat in flour mixture alternately with buttermilk
8. Stir in banana mixture
9. Pour batter into the prepared pan
10. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 1 hour
11. Remove cake from the oven and place it directly into the freezer for 45 minutes
12. This will make the cake very moist
13. Meanwhile, make frosting: Cream butter and cream cheese until smooth
14. Beat in vanilla
15. Add confectioners sugar and beat on low speed until combined, then on high until frosting is smooth
16. Spread frosting on cooled cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 24%, Saturated Fat 11g 57%, Cholesterol 79mg 26%, Sodium 299mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 69g 25%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 50g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 153mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8333/banana-cake-vi/

============================================================

RECIPE 596: Banana Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 (9x13-inch) dish
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/Pudding/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• at room temperature
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix
• 3 cups cold skim milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping
• thawed
• ½ (12 ounce) package vanilla wafers
• 4 bananas
• sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Beat cream cheese in a large bowl until fluffy
2. Beat in condensed milk, then pudding mix
3. Gradually mix in cold milk until smooth, followed by vanilla
4. Fold in 1/2 of the whipped topping
5. Line the bottom of a 9x13-inch dish with vanilla wafers
6. Arrange sliced bananas evenly on top
7. Cover with pudding mixture
8. Top with remaining whipped topping
9. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 20%, Saturated Fat 10g 49%, Cholesterol 33mg 11%, Sodium 334mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 55g 20%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 37g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 4mg 22%, Calcium 191mg 15%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 397mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/21398/banana-pudding-iv/

RECIPE 598: A-Number-1 Banana Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 2 8-inch round layers
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Banana Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon baking soda
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¾ cup light brown sugar
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 2 eggs
• 4 ripe bananas
• mashed
• ⅔ cup buttermilk
• ½ cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour two 8-inch round pans
3. Whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt in a small bowl; set aside
4. Cream white sugar, brown sugar, and butter in a large bowl until light and fluffy
5. Beat in eggs, one at a time
6. Mix in mashed bananas
7. Add flour mixture alternately with buttermilk, mixing well after each addition
8. Stir in chopped walnuts
9. Pour batter into the prepared pans
10. Bake in the preheated oven until cake springs back when gently pressed, about 30 minutes
11. Remove cake layers from the oven and place them on a damp tea towel to cool
12. Charice Lecointe

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 6g 28%, Cholesterol 52mg 17%, Sodium 324mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 4mg 18%, Calcium 41mg 3%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 237mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7754/a-number-1-banana-cake/

RECIPE 599: Banana Sour Cream Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 32
Yield: 4 7x3-inch loaves
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/Banana Bread/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ¼ cups white sugar
• divided
• 3 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• divided
• ¾ cup butter
• 6 very ripe bananas
• mashed
• 1 (16 ounce) container sour cream
• 3 eggs
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 4 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 3 teaspoons baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup chopped walnuts (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
2. Grease four 7x3-inch loaf pans
3. Mix 1/4 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon together in a small bowl until well combined; dust the greased pans lightly with sugar mixture
4. Beat remaining 3 cups sugar and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth
5. Add mashed bananas, sour cream, eggs, vanilla, and remaining 2 teaspoons cinnamon; continue to beat until well-blended
6. Add flour, baking soda, and salt; mix until just combined
7. Stir in walnuts and divide batter evenly into the prepared pans
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 35mg 12%, Sodium 200mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 30mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 144mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/6984/banana-sour-cream-bread/

RECIPE 600: The Best Banana Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 15
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/Banana Bread/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup margarine
• softened
• 2 eggs
• 1 ½ cups mashed banana
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan
3. Beat sugar and margarine in a bowl until smooth
4. Beat in eggs, then bananas
5. Add flour and baking soda, stirring just until combined
6. Pour into the prepared pan
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick in the center comes out clean, about 1 hour
8. Remove from the pan and let cool
9. Store in the refrigerator or freeze

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 603: Southern Style Banana Split Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch pan
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Banana Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups graham cracker crumbs
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¼ pound butter
• melted
• 2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese
• 1 ½ cups confectioners' sugar
• 4 bananas
• sliced
• 1 (15 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• 1 (16 ounce) container frozen whipped topping
• thawed
• 1 (16 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• drained
• 12 ounces crushed peanuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine graham cracker crumbs, white sugar, and melted butter in a large bowl; mix well
2. Press into a 9x13-inch cake pan; refrigerate until chilled, about 30 minutes
3. Beat together cream cheese and confectioners' sugar in the large bowl until smooth; spread over chilled graham cracker crust
4. Layer sliced bananas and crushed pineapple over cream cheese mixture; cover with whipped topping
5. Top with cherries and chopped nuts
6. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour and serve chilled

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 46g 59%, Saturated Fat 23g 117%, Cholesterol 61mg 20%, Sodium 262mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 79g 29%, Dietary Fiber 4g 15%, Total Sugars 51g, Protein 12g, Vitamin C 7mg 34%, Calcium 66mg 5%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 490mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15439/southern-style-banana-split-cake/

RECIPE 604: Chocolate Banana Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Chocolate Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ¼ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup canola oil
• ¼ cup milk
• 1 egg
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 large very ripe bananas
• mashed
• ¾ mini semisweet chocolate chips

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line a12-cup muffin tin with paper liners
3. Combine flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl
4. Whisk sugar, oil, milk, egg, and vanilla extract together in a separate bowl until smooth; stir into flour mixture until just moistened
5. Fold in bananas and chocolate chips
6. Divide batter among the muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 219mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 27g 10%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 2mg 10%, Calcium 48mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 139mg 3%

Cook Time: 30 mins

• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 2 cups mashed ripe bananas
• 1 cup canola oil
• 1 cup coconut milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper liners
3. Mix flour, white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, nutmeg, and salt together in a large bowl
4. Stir bananas, canola oil, and coconut milk together in a separate bowl; stir banana mixture into flour mixture until just combined
5. Divide batter among the muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full
6. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes

RECIPE 607: Sarah's Banana Bread Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Banana Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 1 large egg
• 3 ripe bananas
• mashed
• ¼ cup chopped walnuts
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners
3. Mix sugar, oil, and egg in a large bowl until light and creamy
4. Stir in bananas and walnuts
5. Add flour, baking soda, and salt; stir until completely smooth
6. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full
7. Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 30 to 40 minutes
