RECIPE 670: Mango Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds ripe mangoes
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• ¾ cup water
• 3 saffron threads (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make 4 to 5 slits in mangoes and microwave on High until soft, 1 to 2 minutes
2. Cool, then remove the peel and inner seed; place mango pulp in a large bowl
3. Use a fork or potato masher to mash the pulp well
4. Stir together sugar and water in a large saucepan over low heat, and bring to a boil
5. When the mixture begins boiling, increase heat to medium-high
6. Continue boiling until fine, soft threads form, 270 degrees F (135 degrees C)
7. Stir in mango pulp, add saffron threads, and boil until the mixture thickens, about 5 minutes
8. Pour cooked jam into sterilized jars and seal according to canning directions

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 11mg 53%, Calcium 4mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 59mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/142747/mango-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 671: Mango-Habanero Chicken Wings
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 30 wings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 33 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 53 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Meat and Poultry/Chicken/

INGREDIENTS:
• 30 chicken wing sections
• 1 (12 ounce) can mango nectar
• ¼ cup brown sugar
• 6 habanero peppers
• stemmed
• 2 tablespoons soy sauce
• 1 tablespoon sriracha hot chili sauce
• 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
• 1 stick butter
• 3 cloves garlic
• minced
• 2 tablespoons honey
• 1 cup cornstarch
• 2 cups vegetable oil for frying

DIRECTIONS:
1. Rinse chicken wings and pat dry with paper towels
2. Place wings on a baking sheet and refrigerate to dry a bit more
3. Combine mango nectar, brown sugar, habanero peppers, soy sauce, sriracha sauce, and vinegar in a food processor
4. Mix until peppers are pureed; seeds will still be visible
5. Remove food processor lid carefully; the pepper fumes can be strong
6. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat
7. Add minced garlic; cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds
8. Add the mango-habanero mixture immediately; bring to a simmer, stirring frequently
9. Reduce heat to medium-low; add honey
10. Simmer, stirring frequently, until sauce is reduced by 75% and thickened to a glaze, 45 minutes to 1 hour
11. Remove from heat
12. Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C)
13. Heat oil in a deep-fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
14. Coat wings lightly with cornstarch
15. Place 5 to 6 wings in the hot oil; fry until golden brown and crispy, about 8 minutes
16. Place wings on a paper towel to absorb excess oil; transfer to the preheated oven to keep warm
17. Repeat until all wings have been fried and drained
18. Place wings in a large bowl
19. Pour half the sauce over the wings and mix, coating the wings with the sauce
20. Continue adding the remaining sauce until you have coated the wings to your liking

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 29g 37%, Saturated Fat 11g 53%, Cholesterol 80mg 27%, Sodium 367mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 19g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 177mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/261293/mango-habanero-chicken-wings/

============================================================

RECIPE 672: Mahi Mahi with Coconut Rice and Mango Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Caribbean/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 ½ teaspoons soy sauce
• 2 teaspoons lemon juice
• 1 clove garlic
• crushed
• 2 teaspoons red pepper flakes
• 1 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper
• ½ teaspoon minced fresh ginger root
• 2 tablespoons chopped green onion (Optional)
• salt to taste
• 4 (4 ounce) mahi mahi fillets
• 2 cups uncooked jasmine rice
• 2 cups water
• 1 cube chicken bouillon
• 1 tablespoon butter (Optional)
• ¾ (14 ounce) can coconut milk
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons butter (Optional)
• 1 ½ tablespoons white sugar
• 1 ½ cups fresh mango
• cubed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk together the olive oil, soy sauce, lemon juice, garlic, red pepper flakes, black pepper, ginger, green onion, and salt in a bowl
2. Add the mahi mahi and toss to evenly coat
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour
4. Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack in the middle of the oven
5. Bring the rice, water, chicken bouillon, and 1 tablespoon butter to a boil in a saucepan over high heat
6. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the liquid has been absorbed, about 20 minutes
7. Pour in the coconut milk and 2 tablespoons of sugar
8. Stir, and simmer uncovered until the rice has absorbed most of the coconut milk
9. While the rice is cooking, remove the mahi mahi from the marinade, and shake off excess
10. Discard the remaining marinade
11. Place fish in a large baking dish in a single layer
12. Broil in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily with a fork, 10 to 15 minutes
13. If the fish browns too quickly, cover the baking dish with a sheet of aluminum foil
14. Melt 1 1/2 teaspoons butter and 1 1/2 tablespoons of sugar in a skillet over medium-high heat
15. When the mixture begins to bubble, stir in mango cubes
16. Cook and stir until mango is tender, about 5 minutes
17. Serve by placing a mahi mahi fillet over a scoop of hot rice and top with the mango salsa

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 29g 37%, Saturated Fat 18g 91%, Cholesterol 94mg 31%, Sodium 549mg 24%, Total Carbohydrate 107g 39%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 31g, Vitamin C 21mg 106%, Calcium 81mg 6%, Iron 8mg 43%, Potassium 888mg 19%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/214541/mahi-mahi-with-coconut-rice-and-mango-salsa/

============================================================

RECIPE 673: Mango Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 2 8x4x2-inch loaves
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Breakfast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 3 eggs
• ¾ cup softened butter
• 1 ¼ cups white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 cups chopped mango
• ½ cup shredded coconut
• ¼ cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour 2 loaf pans
3. Sift flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together in a large bowl; make a well in the center
4. Whisk eggs, butter, sugar, and vanilla extract together in a separate bowl
5. Fold mango, coconut, and walnuts into the egg mixture; pour resulting mixture into the well in the center of the flour and mix well
6. Pour batter into prepared loaf pans and let sit at room temperature for 20 minutes
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour
8. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 58mg 19%, Sodium 312mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 6mg 29%, Calcium 17mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 83mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/222325/mango-bread/

============================================================

RECIPE 674: White Peachy Sangria
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 20 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Sangria Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 (750 milliliter) bottles moscato wine
• 4 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite®)
• 1 cup brandy
• 1 cup peach schnapps
• 2 fresh peaches
• pitted and sliced
• 1 (16 ounce) package fresh strawberries
• sliced
• 2 mangos - peeled
• seeded
• and sliced
• ½ fresh pineapple - peeled
• cored
• and cut into chunks
• 1 (6 ounce) container fresh raspberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir moscato wine, lemon-lime soda, brandy, peach schnapps, peaches, strawberries, mangos, pineapple chunks, and raspberries together in a large container and chill 8 hours or overnight

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 24mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 30mg 148%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 228mg 5%

RECIPE 675: Maui Girl's Mango Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• pastry for a double-crust 9-inch pie
• 4 cups peeled and sliced mango
• ½ cup white sugar
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• 2 teaspoons lemon juice
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 tablespoon butter
• cut into small chunks

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Line a 9-inch pie pan with half of the pie pastry
3. Combine mango, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and cinnamon in a bowl; stir until the sugar has dissolved
4. Transfer mango mixture into the prepared pie pan
5. Dot the mixture with the butter, then cover with the top crust
6. Pinch the edges of the top and bottom crusts together to seal
7. Cut several vents on the top crust
8. Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is golden brown and the juices are bubbling, about 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 246mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 50g 18%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 24mg 118%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 161mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/219459/maui-girls-mango-pie/

RECIPE 676: Healthy Fish Tacos with Mango Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 tacos
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 mango - peeled
• seeded
• and chopped
• 2 avocados - peeled
• pitted
• and chopped
• 1 cup chopped tomato
• ½ cup diced red onion
• ½ cup diced red pepper
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
• 2 tablespoons canola oil
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• 1 lime
• juiced
• 1 teaspoon cider vinegar
• 1 dash hot pepper sauce
• or to taste
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 8 taco shells
• 4 (6 ounce) mahi mahi fillets
• cut into 1-inch slices
• 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
• 1 teaspoon paprika
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 2 tablespoons olive oil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir mango, avocado, tomato, red onion, red pepper, parsley, canola oil, brown sugar, lime juice, cider vinegar, hot pepper sauce, salt, and ground black pepper together in a bowl
2. Refrigerate salsa for at least 1 hour
3. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
4. Heat taco shells in preheated oven until crisp, about 5 minutes
5. Season mahi mahi with 1 teaspoon ground black pepper, paprika, and 1/2 teaspoon salt
6. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
7. Cook mahi mahi in olive oil until fish flakes easily, about 3 minutes per side
8. Place mahi mahi slices in taco shells and top with mango salsa

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 3g 13%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 290mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 6g 20%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 19g, Vitamin C 30mg 152%, Calcium 50mg 4%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 778mg 17%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/233899/healthy-fish-tacos-with-mango-salsa/

RECIPE 677: Sweet and Kickin' Mango-Habanero Hot Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 128
Yield: 1 gallon or more
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Wing Sauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
• 1 large sweet onion
• chopped
• 7 ripe mangoes
• cored and chopped
• 1 fresh peach
• chopped (Optional)
• ⅓ cup honey
• 15 habanero peppers
• stemmed
• or more to taste
• ¼ cup yellow mustard
• 2 ½ tablespoons salt
• 2 ½ tablespoons paprika
• 1 ½ tablespoons ground white pepper
• 1 tablespoon ground cumin
• ⅓ teaspoon ground allspice
• ¼ cup light brown sugar
• 1 ½ cups white vinegar
• ½ cup apple cider vinegar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat
2. Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes
3. Combine the onion, mangoes, peach, honey, habanero peppers, and mustard in a food processor
4. Process until smooth; mix in salt, paprika, white pepper, cumin, and allspice
5. Add brown sugar; continue to process until well combined
6. Pour mango-habanero mixture into a large saucepan
7. Bring to a boil
8. Add white vinegar and apple cider vinegar, stirring frequently until thoroughly combined
9. Boil until thickened, 10 to 12 minutes
10. Pour sauce into jars or containers

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 142mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 3g 1%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 16%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 23mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/261294/sweet-and-kickin-mango-habanero-hot-sauce/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------

• ½ small Thai chile pepper
• minced
• 1 clove garlic
• crushed
• 1 teaspoon hot chile paste (such as sambal oelek)
• 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro

DIRECTIONS:

RECIPE 682: Easy Mango Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 fluted tube pan
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cake Mix Cake Recipes/Yellow Cake/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ripe mango
• 1 (18.25 ounce) box yellow cake mix
• 3 eggs
• ½ cup water
• ¼ cup vegetable oil
• 2 tablespoons lime zest

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a fluted tube pan (such as Bundt®)
3. Peel mango with a vegetable peeler or paring knife
4. Cut flesh into small pieces and squeeze pit for juice
5. Collect all juice from chopping and squeezing pit and reserve for glaze
6. Smash mango in a bowl using a potato masher or fork
7. Measure 1 cup smashed mango, reserving the rest for the glaze
8. Beat 1 cup smashed mango, cake mix, eggs, water, vegetable oil, and lime zest together in a bowl using an electric mixer for 2 minutes; pour into the prepared pan
9. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes
10. Cool cake in pan for 5 minutes
11. Invert cake onto a wire rack to cool completely
12. Combine butter, lime juice, about 1 tablespoon reserved juice from mango, and rum together in a bowl
13. Stir confectioners' sugar into butter mixture until desired consistency is reached; fold smashed mango into glaze
14. Spoon glaze over cooled cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 3g 13%, Cholesterol 50mg 17%, Sodium 308mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 41g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 5mg 27%, Calcium 68mg 5%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 76mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/242236/easy-mango-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 683: Easy Mango Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 firm green mangoes - peeled
• pitted
• and cut into matchsticks
• ¼ purple onion
• thinly sliced
• ¼ red bell pepper
• thinly sliced
• 3 sprigs cilantro
• or more to taste
• leaves removed and stems discarded
• 2 tablespoons lime juice
• 2 tablespoons fish sauce
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• 1 tablespoon crushed peanuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix mangoes, onion, red bell pepper, and cilantro leaves together in a bowl
2. Whisk lime juice, fish sauce, and brown sugar together in a separate bowl until the sugar is dissolved; pour over the mango mixture and toss to coat
3. Top salad with peanuts

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 568mg 25%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 34mg 168%, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 200mg 4%

RECIPE 684: Mango Sorbet
------------------------------------------------------------

Yield: 6 cups

RECIPE 685: Delightfully Exotic Mango Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9x13-inch pan
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Sheet Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups canned sweetened mango pulp
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup margarine
• 2 medium eggs
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 2 tablespoons whole almonds
• or as desired (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. Beat mango pulp, sugar, margarine, and eggs together in a bowl using an electric mixer on medium speed until light and well mixed, 3 to 5 minutes
4. Sift flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a bowl
5. Stir mango mixture into flour mixture just until batter is combined
6. Pour batter into the prepared baking dish
7. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes
8. Gently press almonds into batter
9. Continue baking until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean, about 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 37mg 12%, Sodium 296mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 4g, Calcium 43mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 54mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/242162/delightfully-exotic-mango-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 686: Blackened Tuna Steaks with Mango Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 steaks
Prep Time: 45 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Seafood/Fish/Tuna/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 2 tablespoons lime juice
• 2 cloves garlic
• minced
• 4 tuna steaks
• 1 fresh mango - peeled
• pitted
• and chopped
• ¼ cup finely chopped red bell pepper
• ½ Spanish onion
• finely chopped
• 1 green onion
• chopped
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
• 1 jalapeno pepper
• seeded and minced
• 2 tablespoons lime juice
• 1 ½ teaspoons olive oil
• 2 tablespoons paprika
• 1 tablespoon cayenne pepper
• 1 tablespoon onion powder
• 2 teaspoons salt
• 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
• 1 teaspoon dried thyme
• 1 teaspoon dried basil
• 1 teaspoon dried oregano
• 1 tablespoon garlic powder
• 4 tablespoons olive oil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk together the olive oil, lime juice, and garlic in a bowl
2. Rub the tuna steaks with the mixture
3. Place the steaks in a sealable container and chill in refrigerator 3 hours
4. Combine the mango, bell pepper, Spanish onion, green onion, cilantro, and jalapeno pepper in a bowl; stir
5. Add the lime juice and 1 1/2 teaspoons olive oil and toss to combine
6. Chill in refrigerator 1 hour
7. Stir together the paprika, cayenne pepper, onion powder, salt, pepper, thyme, basil, oregano, and garlic powder in a bowl
8. Remove the tuna steaks from the refrigerator and gently rinse with water and then dip each side of each steak in the spice mixture to coat
9. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
10. Gently lay the tuna steaks into the hot oil
11. Cook the tuna on one side for 3 minutes; remove to a plate
12. Pour the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil into the skillet and let it get hot
13. Lay the tuna with the uncooked side down into the skillet and cook another 3 minutes; remove from heat immediately
14. Spoon about 1/2 cup of the mango salsa onto each of 4 plates
15. Lay the tuna steaks atop the salsa and serve immediately
16. Charlotte's Mom

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 77mg 26%, Sodium 1233mg 54%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 4g 15%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 42g, Vitamin C 38mg 190%, Calcium 85mg 7%, Iron 4mg 20%, Potassium 1096mg 23%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/103535/blackened-tuna-steaks-with-mango-salsa/

============================================================

RECIPE 689: Fresh Mango Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 dozen muffins
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 3.9/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 pinch salt
• 3 eggs
• ¼ cup heavy whipping cream
• ¼ cup unsalted butter
• melted
• 3 cups mango - peeled
• seeded
• and cubed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners
3. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl
4. Beat eggs, cream, and butter until smooth in another large bowl
5. Stir flour mixture into egg mixture until batter is moistened
6. Fold mango into batter until just combined
7. Evenly divide batter into prepared muffin cups
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 25 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 64mg 21%, Sodium 102mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 12mg 58%, Calcium 63mg 5%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 103mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/232577/fresh-mango-muffins/

RECIPE 690: Mango Cilantro Slaw
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Salad/Coleslaw Recipes/With Mayo/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons white wine vinegar
• 2 tablespoons canola oil
• 2 tablespoons honey
• 2 tablespoons mayonnaise
• ½ teaspoon celery seed (Optional)
• ½ teaspoon poppy seeds (Optional)
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
• 1 (10 ounce) package finely shredded cabbage
• 1 firm
• ripe mango - peeled
• seeded
• and cut into 1/2-inch pieces
• ⅓ cup chopped cilantro
• 3 green onions
• chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk vinegar, oil, honey, mayonnaise, celery seed, poppy seeds, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl until smooth and creamy
2. Add cabbage, mango, cilantro, and green onions; toss until well-combined
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until flavors blend, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 3mg 1%, Sodium 338mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 17mg 83%, Calcium 30mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 136mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/238205/mango-cilantro-slaw/

RECIPE 692: Mango, Peach and Pineapple Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 8 cups
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Salsa Recipes/Peach Salsa Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 mangos
• peeled
• seeded and chopped
• 2 small peaches
• halved
• pitted
• and cut into 1/2-inch dice
• 1 cup diced fresh pineapple
• 4 tomatoes
• chopped
• 1 white onion
• diced
• 1 red bell pepper
• diced
• 1 yellow bell pepper
• diced
• 1 cup chopped fresh cilantro
• or to taste
• 1 clove garlic
• minced
• 1 small jalapeno pepper
• minced
• 2 tablespoons lime juice
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• or to taste
• ¾ cup water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the mango, peach, pineapple, tomato, onion, red pepper, yellow pepper, and cilantro in a mixing bowl
2. Stir in the garlic, jalapeno, lime juice, salt, sugar, and water
3. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving

RECIPE 693: Real Indian Mango Chutney
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Chutney Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ¼ cups diced fresh mango
• ¼ cup salt
• 2 ½ cups water
• 2 ⅓ cups white sugar
• 2 cups vinegar
• ½ cup raisins
• ½ cup chopped pitted dates
• 2 cinnamon sticks
• 2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger root
• 2 teaspoons crushed garlic
• 2 teaspoons ground dried chile pepper
• 10 half-pint canning jars with lids and rings

DIRECTIONS:
1. Put mango into a large bowl
2. Sprinkle salt over the mango
3. Pour water over the mango
4. Let mango soak for 1 hour to overnight
5. Drain and discard liquid from the mango
6. Stir sugar and vinegar together in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil
7. Add drained mango to the liquid; stir to coat
8. Stir raisins, dates, cinnamon sticks, ginger, garlic, and ground dried chile pepper into the mango mixture; bring again to a boil, stirring occasionally
9. Reduce heat to low and simmer mixture until thickened, about 1 hour
10. Remove from heat to cool completely
11. Sterilize jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
12. Pack chutney into hot, sterilized jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top
13. Run a knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
14. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
15. Top with lids and screw on rings
16. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
17. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder
18. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
19. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
20. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process for 15 minutes
21. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool
22. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
23. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 27g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 5mg 23%, Calcium 8mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 71mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/237069/real-indian-mango-chutney/

============================================================

RECIPE 694: Mango Chutney
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 240
Yield: 4 quarts
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Chutney Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups distilled white vinegar
• 6 cups white sugar
• 6 cups brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 2 teaspoons ground ginger
• 4 teaspoons ground allspice
• 1 teaspoon ground cloves
• 2 teaspoons ground nutmeg
• 5 small red hot chile peppers
• seeded and chopped
• 1 teaspoon kosher salt
• 2 large onions
• chopped
• 3 cloves garlic
• chopped
• 1 cup golden raisins
• 1 cup raisins
• ½ cup fresh ginger root
• chopped
• 16 cups sliced
• semi-ripe mangos
• ½ cup sliced almonds

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large saucepan combine vinegar, white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, ground ginger, allspice, cloves, nutmeg, chile peppers and salt
2. Bring to a boil; boil for 1/2 hour
3. Stir in onions, garlic, golden raisins, raisins and ginger and boil for another 1/2 hour
4. Stir in mangos (and almonds if using), reduce heat to low and simmer for 1/2 hour
5. Pour mixture into sterilized jars, to 1/2 inch below lid level, and seal

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 13mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 5mg 23%, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 35mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/19842/mango-chutney/

============================================================

RECIPE 695: Smoked Salmon Poke Bowl
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Salad/Seafood Salad Recipes/Salmon Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup soy sauce
• 3 green onions
• thinly sliced
• 1 tablespoon black sesame oil
• 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
• 1 teaspoon grated ginger
• ½ teaspoon garlic
• minced
• 12 ounces smoked salmon
• chopped
• 2 cups cooked brown rice
• ¼ cup diced mango
• ¼ cup diced cucumber
• ¼ cup diced avocado
• ¼ cup sliced fresh strawberries
• 1 teaspoon black sesame seeds
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine soy sauce, green onions, sesame oil, rice vinegar, ginger, and garlic in a bowl
2. Mix until thoroughly combined
3. Add salmon and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour
4. Divide brown rice among 4 serving bowls
5. Top with salmon, mango, cucumber, avocado, and strawberries
6. Sprinkle black sesame seeds on top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 1576mg 69%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 10%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 20g, Vitamin C 12mg 62%, Calcium 44mg 3%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 355mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/268086/smoked-salmon-poke-bowl/

RECIPE 697: Mango Salsa Salmon
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Seafood Main Dishes/Salmon/Salmon Steak Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 (6 ounce) salmon steaks
• 3 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 large red onion
• diced
• 2 cloves garlic
• peeled and minced
• 2 tomatoes
• diced
• 1 sprig fresh cilantro
• chopped
• 2 mangos - peeled
• seeded
• and diced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven broiler
2. Line a broiler pan with foil
3. Broil salmon steaks on the prepared pan 12 minutes, or until easily flaked with a fork
4. Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat, and saute onion until tender
5. Stir in garlic, tomatoes, and cilantro
6. Cook until heated through, 1 to 2 minutes, and remove from heat
7. Mix in the mangos
8. Serve over the salmon steaks

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 29g 37%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 99mg 33%, Sodium 107mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 35g, Vitamin C 46mg 232%, Calcium 49mg 4%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 980mg 21%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/47658/mango-salsa-salmon/

RECIPE 698: Spicy Mango Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 medium mangos - peeled
• seeded
• and cubed
• ¼ cup fresh lime juice
• 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
• 1 tablespoon red pepper flakes
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
• 2 tablespoons chopped shallots
• salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the mango cubes into a serving bowl
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the lime juice and olive oil
3. Season with red pepper flakes, cilantro, shallots, salt and pepper
4. Whisk briefly, then pour over the mangos
5. Stir to coat, then cover and refrigerate for about 30 minutes to blend the flavors before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Sodium 4mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 9%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 43mg 215%, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 274mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/85165/spicy-mango-salad/

RECIPE 699: Mango-Pineapple Chutney
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 servings
Prep Time: 35 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Chutney Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
• 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
• 1 large sweet onion
• minced
• 4 inch piece fresh ginger root
• peeled and minced
• 1 large yellow bell pepper
• diced
• 3 large ripe mangoes
• peeled
• pitted
• and diced
• 1 small pineapple
• peeled and diced
• ½ cup brown sugar
• 1 ½ tablespoons curry powder
• ½ cup apple cider vinegar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat
2. Stir in the red pepper flakes and cook until they begin to sizzle, then stir in the minced onion
3. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally until the onions have softened, about 20 minutes
4. Remove the lid, increase the heat to medium, and stir in the ginger and yellow bell pepper
5. Cook and stir until the ginger is fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes
6. Stir in the mangoes, pineapple, brown sugar, curry powder, and vinegar
7. Bring to a simmer, and cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally
8. Cool the chutney completely when done and store in airtight containers in the refrigerator

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 4mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 31mg 154%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 129mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/166016/mango-pineapple-chutney/

============================================================

RECIPE 700: Mexican Mango and White Fish Ceviche
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Seafood/Ceviche Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds white fish
• cut into small cubes
• 4 limes
• juiced
• ½ orange
• juiced
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 1 green chile pepper
• chopped
• 2 mangoes
• cut into cubes
• 5 green onions
• chopped
• 3 tomatoes
• seeded and chopped
• ½ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine white fish, lime juice, orange juice, oil, and chile pepper in a glass or ceramic bowl
2. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 90 minutes
3. Mix in mangoes and green onions, cover, and chill for 10 minutes more
4. Gently fold in tomatoes and cilantro
5. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Cholesterol 45mg 15%, Sodium 57mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 10g 4%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 15g, Vitamin C 33mg 163%, Calcium 43mg 3%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 442mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/263627/mexican-mango-and-white-fish-ceviche/

RECIPE 701: Simple Mango Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 4 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup hot water
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 (.25 ounce) packages powdered gelatin (such as Knox®)
• 26 ounces canned mango pulp
• 1 ½ cups evaporated milk
• 1 cup cold water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine hot water, sugar, and powdered gelatin in a small bowl; stir until sugar and gelatin are dissolved
2. Mix mango pulp, evaporated milk, and cold water together in a large bowl
3. Pour in hot water mixture and stir well
4. Refrigerate until set, at least 4 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 3g 15%, Cholesterol 18mg 6%, Sodium 80mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 68g 25%, Dietary Fiber 4g 15%, Total Sugars 40g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 168mg 13%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 193mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/255086/simple-mango-pudding/

RECIPE 702: Mommy's Mango Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Cobblers/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 mangoes - peeled
• seeded
• and sliced
• 2 cups water
• ½ cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Combine mangoes, water, and 1/2 cup white sugar in a saucepan over medium heat; simmer until sugar is dissolved, 5 to 6 minutes
3. Drain syrup from mangoes, reserving syrup
4. Beat 2 cups sugar and butter together in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy
5. Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together in a separate bowl until combined
6. Slowly mix flour mixture, alternating with milk, into creamed butter mixture, beating well after each addition
7. Stir vanilla extract into batter; pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish
8. Arrange mangoes on top of the batter and pour 2 cups reserved syrup over mangoes
9. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cobbler comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 22mg 7%, Sodium 278mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 76g 28%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 58g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 28mg 139%, Calcium 131mg 10%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 214mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/238485/mommys-mango-cobbler/

============================================================

RECIPE 703: Mangonada Jell-O Shots
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 20 shots
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 4 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup water
• 2 (.25 ounce) packages unflavored gelatin
• 2 cups mango puree
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• 1 cup vodka
• 1 teaspoon chamoy sauce
• or to taste
• 1 teaspoon chile-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®)
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat water and gelatin in a small saucepan over medium-high heat; whisk until dissolved, about 5 minutes
2. Add mango purée, sugar, and lemon juice; whisk until dissolved, about 5 minutes
3. Remove from heat to cool slightly, about 5 minutes
4. Whisk vodka into cooled mango gelatin until combined
5. Add a few drops chamoy and a sprinkle Tajin to twenty (2-ounce) cups
6. Fill each cup evenly with mango gelatin and sprinkle with more Tajin
7. Let set in the refrigerator for 4 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 28mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 5g 2%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 1mg 0%, Potassium 2mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/277691/mangonada-jell-o-shots/

============================================================

RECIPE 705: Blackened Salmon Tacos with Chunky Mango Avocado Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 tacos
Prep Time: 40 mins
Cook Time: 9 mins
Total Time: 49 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Taco Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ripe mangoes - peeled
• pitted
• and diced
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted
• and diced
• 1 orange bell pepper
• diced
• 1 jalapeno pepper
• seeded and diced
• 1 lime
• juiced
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 tablespoon sweet and spicy seafood rub
• or to taste
• ½ teaspoon chili powder
• or to taste
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 2 skin-on salmon fillets
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• or as needed
• divided
• 6 corn tortillas
• 3 large limes
• cut into wedges

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine mangoes, avocado, orange bell pepper, and jalapeno in a large bowl to make salsa
2. Add lime juice, cilantro, and salt; mix to combine
3. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate
4. Sprinkle seafood rub, chili powder, salt, and black pepper over 1 side of each salmon steak; rub in with your fingers until evenly distributed
5. Coat the bottom of a large skillet with olive oil and heat over medium-high heat
6. Add salmon skin-side down and cook until skin is crisp, 4 to 5 minutes
7. Flip salmon and carefully peel off skin
8. Season top with seafood rub, chili powder, salt and black pepper
9. Continue cooking until lightly browned on the second side and salmon flakes easily with a fork, 4 to 5 minutes
10. Slice each salmon fillet lengthwise to create 6 pieces
11. Lightly oil another skillet over medium heat
12. Pan-fry corn tortillas, one at a time, until heated through and pliable, about 30 seconds per side
13. Place 1 piece of salmon on each tortilla
14. Top with salsa
15. Squeeze a wedge of lime on top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 19mg 6%, Sodium 342mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 7g 26%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 82mg 410%, Calcium 62mg 5%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 565mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/246845/blackened-salmon-tacos-with-chunky-mango-avocado-salsa/

============================================================

RECIPE 706: Pineapple Mango Habanero Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 64
Yield: 8 half-pint jars
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 9 hrs
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ pounds fresh mangos
• cut into chunks
• 1 pound fresh pineapple
• cut into chunks
• ½ cup cider vinegar
• 4 cups white sugar
• 1 (3 ounce) pouch liquid pectin
• 4 habanero chiles - stemmed
• halved
• and seeded

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine mangos, pineapple, and cider vinegar in a stockpot over medium-high heat
2. Bring to a simmer; mash mangos and pineapple to a chunky consistency with a potato masher
3. Stir in sugar until dissolved
4. Stir liquid pectin and habanero chile halves into the stockpot
5. Bring to a rolling boil, stirring frequently
6. Cook, stirring frequently, until jam thickens, about 2 minutes
7. Remove chile halves
8. Discard 6 chile halves; chop 2 halves and stir back into the stockpot
9. Sterilize 8 half-pint jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
10. Ladle hot jam into the hot, sterilized jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top
11. Run a clean knife around the insides of the jars to remove any air bubbles
12. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
13. Top with the lids and screw on the rings
14. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
15. Bring to a boil and lower jars into boiling water using a holder, spacing them 2 inches apart
16. Pour in more boiling water to cover jars by at least 1 inch
17. Bring water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process for 10 minutes
18. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool, about 8 hours
19. Press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 6%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 7mg 33%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Potassium 30mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/256924/pineapple-mango-habanero-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 707: Easy Fish Tacos with Mango-Pineapple Slaw
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 tacos
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pound cod fillets
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• ½ cup red wine vinegar
• ¼ cup reduced-fat mayonnaise
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 1 tablespoon salt
• 1 tablespoon ground black pepper
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 3 cups shredded cabbage
• ½ cup chopped fresh mango
• ½ cup chopped fresh pineapple
• ½ cup chopped red onion
• ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• 1 fresh jalapeno pepper
• chopped
• 8 (8 inch) flour tortillas

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Place cod fillets on a large sheet of aluminum foil; pour lemon juice over fish and season with salt and black pepper
3. Fold foil around fish and seal to create a pouch; place pouch in a baking dish
4. Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 20 minutes
5. Meanwhile, whisk vinegar, mayonnaise, sugar, 1 tablespoon salt, 1 tablespoon black pepper, and garlic powder in a bowl until smooth
6. Combine cabbage, mango, pineapple, red onion, cilantro, and jalapeño in a large bowl
7. Pour dressing over vegetables and fruit; toss to combine
8. Cover and refrigerate slaw until ready to serve
9. Divide fish evenly among flour tortillas
10. Spoon slaw over fish to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 27mg 9%, Sodium 1308mg 57%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 16g, Vitamin C 24mg 118%, Calcium 100mg 8%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 338mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/221937/easy-fish-tacos-with-mango-pineapple-slaw/

============================================================

RECIPE 708: Jerk Chicken Egg Rolls with Mango-Habanero Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Prep Time: 45 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Wraps and Rolls/Egg Roll Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 mango
• peeled and diced
• ¾ cup water
• 1 tablespoon seasoned rice vinegar
• 1 clove garlic
• minced
• 1 pinch salt
• ½ cup brown sugar
• divided
• 2 habanero peppers
• seeded and minced
• 2 tablespoons water
• 1 teaspoon cornstarch

DIRECTIONS:
1. For the habanero sauce: Combine mango with 3/4 cup water, rice vinegar, garlic, and salt in a small saucepan
2. Add most of the brown sugar, reserving 1 teaspoon
3. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low; cook for 5 minutes
4. Add habanero peppers and simmer for 2 minutes
5. Mix 2 tablespoon water with cornstarch; stir slurry into the saucepan
6. Cook over medium-high until thick, 3 to 5 minutes
7. Leave mixture chunky or blend for a smoother texture
8. For the filling: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat
9. Add chicken thighs and sauté until browned, 5 to 7 minutes; sprinkle jerk seasoning over chicken
10. Add shallot and garlic; cook and stir until shallot begins to soften, about 3 minutes
11. Reduce heat to medium; add cabbage, carrots, and reserved sugar
12. Cook until cabbage is translucent but still a little crunchy, 3 to 5 minutes
13. Taste for seasoning
14. Let mixture cool
15. Heat remaining vegetable oil in a pan over medium-high heat
16. Fry plantains until they start to brown, about 5 minutes
17. Transfer plantains onto a paper towel and let cool
18. Separate and place egg roll wrappers onto your work surface
19. Mix egg with water for egg wash
20. Lay out one wrapper with a corner pointed toward you
21. Use a slotted spoon to add some of the chicken and cabbage mixtures across the center
22. Sprinkle plantain bits on top
23. Use your finger or a pastry brush to lightly moisten edges of wonton wrappers with egg wash
24. Fold one corner of the wrapper over filling onto the opposite corner to form a triangle
25. Press edges together to seal
26. Fill and fold remaining egg rolls
27. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat
28. Fry egg rolls in batches in hot oil, turning occasionally, until golden brown, about 5 minutes
29. Remove and drain on paper towels or a rack
30. Serve with mango-habanero sauce

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 35mg 12%, Sodium 294mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 35g 13%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 11g, Vitamin C 32mg 159%, Calcium 59mg 5%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 385mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/269709/jerk-chicken-egg-rolls-with-mango-habanero-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 709: Coconut-Lime Cheesecake with Mango Coulis
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch cheesecake
Prep Time: 35 mins
Cook Time: 55 mins
Total Time: 9 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cheesecake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup sweetened flaked coconut
• ¾ cup crushed gingersnap cookies
• 3 tablespoons melted butter
• 2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese
• softened
• 1 (10 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 2 eggs
• 1 tablespoon lime zest
• 2 tablespoons lime juice
• 1 tablespoon coconut extract
• 2 cups cubed fresh mango
• 1 teaspoon white sugar
• or more to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease a 9-inch springform pan
3. Combine coconut, gingersnap cookies, and melted butter in a bowl; mix until evenly moistened
4. Press cookie mixture into the bottom and slightly up the sides of the prepared pan
5. Bake crust in the preheated oven until browned and set, about 10 minutes
6. Set aside to cool
7. Reduce oven heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
8. Beat softened cream cheese in a mixing bowl until smooth
9. With the beater set to medium-low, slowly pour condensed milk into the bowl, mixing only until just blended and stopping to scrape the sides of the bowl as necessary
10. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition; scrape the sides of the bowl as necessary
11. Pour about 1/2 of the cream cheese batter into a separate bowl
12. Stir lime zest and lime juice into portion in the new bowl; pour batter over crust in the springform pan, smoothing into an even layer
13. Stir coconut extract through remaining cream cheese batter; pour over lime-flavored batter in the springform pan, smoothing into an even layer
14. Bake in the preheated oven until top of cheesecake springs back when gently pressed, about 45 minutes
15. Turn oven heat off, but leave cheesecake inside with the oven door slightly ajar until the oven cools completely
16. Refrigerate until thoroughly chilled
17. Prepare mango coulis by puréeing mango with sugar in a blender until smooth
18. If too thick, add 1 teaspoon water at a time, using just enough to make it pourable
19. Drizzle over cheesecake when plated

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 32g 41%, Saturated Fat 20g 98%, Cholesterol 131mg 44%, Sodium 311mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 15mg 73%, Calcium 161mg 12%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 318mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/214465/coconut-lime-cheesecake-with-mango-coulis/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5

• peeled
• seeded and chopped
• 1 tablespoon butter
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• 1 teaspoon orange juice
• 3 tablespoons water

DIRECTIONS:

2. Stir until the mixture thickens
3. Remove from heat and serve

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 712: Macadamia-Crusted Sea Bass with Mango Cream Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Seafood/Fish/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ mango - peeled
• seeded and diced
• ½ cup heavy cream
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• ½ cup chopped macadamia nuts
• ¼ cup seasoned bread crumbs
• 1 teaspoon olive oil
• ½ teaspoon black pepper
• 1 pinch red pepper flakes
• 1 pound fresh sea bass
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 2 cloves minced garlic
• 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a food processor, combine macadamia nuts, bread crumbs, 1 teaspoon olive oil, black pepper, and red pepper flakes
2. Process until smooth
3. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
4. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine mango, cream, and lemon juice
5. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until thickened
6. Season fish with salt and black pepper
7. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and crushed garlic in a large skillet over medium heat
8. Sear the sea bass on both sides, and remove from heat
9. Transfer fish to preheated oven, and roast until cooked through
10. Cover the sea bass with macadamia crust, and return to the oven until crust browns
11. Top with the mango cream sauce

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 31g 40%, Saturated Fat 10g 51%, Cholesterol 87mg 29%, Sodium 222mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 24g, Vitamin C 9mg 46%, Calcium 66mg 5%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 448mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/39583/macadamia-crusted-sea-bass-with-mango-cream-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 713: Caribbean Fish With Mango Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 5
Prep Time: 45 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Caribbean/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 tablespoon paprika
• 2 teaspoons curry powder
• 2 teaspoons ground cumin
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground allspice
• 1 teaspoon ground ginger
• 1 teaspoon ground coriander
• ¾ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
• ¼ teaspoon ground fennel seed (Optional)
• ⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix together paprika, curry powder, cumin, allspice, ginger, coriander, salt, black pepper, fennel, and cayenne pepper in a bowl; set aside
2. In a bowl, lightly toss mango, pineapple, red bell pepper, black beans, red onion, and cilantro in a bowl; pour lime juice over mango mixture and toss again
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate until chilled, at least 30 minutes
4. Whisk together egg and milk in a bowl
5. In a separate shallow bowl, stir panko crumbs with coconut
6. Stir about 1 tablespoon of the spice mix, or to taste, into the panko crumb mixture
7. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat
8. Dip tilapia fillets into egg mixture, then press gently into panko crumb mixture to coat both sides of fillets
9. Brush off any loose crumbs, then lay fillets into the hot oil
10. Pan-fry until fish is opaque inside and golden brown outside, 3 to 5 minutes per side
11. Serve with mango salsa

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 80mg 27%, Sodium 646mg 28%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 30g, Vitamin C 51mg 253%, Calcium 107mg 8%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 822mg 17%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/218348/caribbean-fish-with-mango-salsa/

RECIPE 714: Chamoyada
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 1
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup fresh or frozen mango cubes
• 1 (6 ounce) can pineapple juice
• ½ lime
• 2 teaspoons chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®)
• 2 tablespoons chamoy (Mexican chili fruit condiment)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine mango and pineapple juice in a blender; blend until smooth
2. Rub lime wedge around the rim of a glass, then dip in 1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning
3. Juice lime into the glass; add 1 tablespoon chamoy and remaining 1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning
4. Pour 1/2 of the mango-pineapple mixture into the prepared glass
5. Add remaining 1 tablespoon chamoy sauce and top with remaining mango-pineapple mixture

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 968mg 42%, Total Carbohydrate 58g 21%, Dietary Fiber 6g 23%, Total Sugars 44g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 73mg 363%, Calcium 50mg 4%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 513mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/280507/chamoyada/

============================================================

RECIPE 715: Peach-Mango-Habanero Wing Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Wing Sauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 large mango
• peeled and pitted
• 1 small fresh peach
• halved and pitted
• 2 habanero peppers
• stemmed
• ¼ cup unsalted butter
• 4 cloves garlic
• minced
• ½ cup brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
• 1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger root
• salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Blend mango, peach, and habanero peppers in a food processor or blender until smooth
2. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir garlic until fragrant, about 1 minute
3. Add mango mixture, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, ginger, salt, and pepper; reduce heat to low and simmer until sauce is smooth and slightly thickened, about 8 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 9mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 8g 3%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 6mg 31%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 49mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/238076/peach-mango-habanero-wing-sauce/

------------------------------------------------------------

• quartered

• seeded
• and cubed

DIRECTIONS:

RECIPE 721: Bourbon-Mango Pulled Pork
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 6 hrs
Total Time: 6 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Pulled Pork/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 mangos
• 1 (4 pound) pork shoulder roast
• 2 tablespoons ground black pepper
• 1 teaspoon kosher salt
• 1 teaspoon chipotle chile powder
• ¼ cup balsamic vinegar
• 2 cups water
• 1 teaspoon chipotle chile powder
• 2 teaspoons honey
• 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger bourbon whiskey
• 2 (12 ounce) bottles barbeque sauce

DIRECTIONS:
1. Peel the mangos and remove the pits
2. Place the pits into a slow cooker, then roughly chop the mango and set aside
3. Place the pork shoulder into the slow cooker, and season with the black pepper, kosher salt, and 1 teaspoon chipotle powder; pour in the balsamic vinegar and water
4. Cover, and cook on Low 5 to 8 hours until the meat is very tender
5. Once done, drain the pork, discarding the cooking liquid and mango pits, and shred with two forks
6. While the pork is cooking, puree the chopped mango in a blender until smooth, then pour into a saucepan along with the honey, 1 teaspoon chipotle powder, and whiskey
7. Bring to a simmer
8. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring frequently until the mango has reduced and darkened slightly, about 10 minutes
9. Stir in the barbeque sauce, and remove from the heat
10. Return the shredded pork to the slow cooker, and stir in the mango barbeque sauce
11. Cover, and cook on High 1 to 2 hours until the pork absorbs the barbeque sauce

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 68mg 23%, Sodium 996mg 43%, Total Carbohydrate 35g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 24g, Vitamin C 13mg 63%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 528mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/163001/bourbon-mango-pulled-pork/

============================================================

RECIPE 722: Chicken, Avocado and Mango Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Salad/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• ¼ cup water
• ⅓ cup lime juice
• ½ cup chili garlic sauce
• 4 cups shredded
• cooked chicken
• 2 medium mangos - peeled
• seeded and diced
• 2 avocados - peeled
• pitted and diced
• 1 (10 ounce) package spring lettuce mix

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a saucepan over medium-high heat, stir together the brown sugar and water
2. Bring to a boil, then pour into a medium bowl
3. Stir in the garlic chili sauce and lime juice
4. Set the dressing aside
5. In a large bowl, toss together the chicken, mangos and avocados
6. Arrange the spring salad mix on serving plates, then top with a few spoonfuls of the chicken mixture
7. Pour dressing over the top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 21%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 55mg 18%, Sodium 698mg 30%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 5g 19%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 19g, Vitamin C 31mg 153%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 526mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/75019/chicken-avocado-and-mango-salad/

RECIPE 723: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 1
Yield: 1 cocktail
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 5 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Cocktail Recipes/Rum Drinks Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup crushed ice
• 2 fluid ounces pineapple juice
• 1 fluid ounce light rum
• 1 fluid ounce blue Curacao liqueur
• 1 fluid ounce cream of coconut
• 1 pineapple slice
• 1 maraschino cherry

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine crushed ice, pineapple juice, rum, blue Curacao, and cream of coconut in a blender
2. Puree on high speed until smooth
3. Pour into a chilled highball glass
4. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a maraschino cherry
5. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Sodium 31mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 49g 18%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 43g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 20mg 99%, Calcium 20mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 128mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/222550/blue-hawaiian-cocktail/

RECIPE 724: Brown Sugar and Pineapple Glazed Ham
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Ham/Whole/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (6 pound) fully-cooked
• bone-in ham
• 1 fresh pineapple
• 2 (6 ounce) cans pineapple juice
• 1 cup brown sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Place ham, cut-side down, into a roasting pan
3. Cut skin off pineapple with a sharp knife and slice off any brown spots or skin left behind
4. Cut pineapple into 1/2-inch-thick rings and use a round cutter to remove cores
5. Pin rings onto ham with toothpicks
6. Bake ham in the preheated oven for 30 minutes
7. While ham bakes, mix pineapple juice and brown sugar in a microwave-safe bowl
8. Microwave on medium power until glaze is boiling and slightly thickened
9. Work carefully because glaze will be sticky and very hot
10. Pour 1/2 of the glaze evenly over ham and pineapple rings
11. Bake ham for 30 minutes more, then pour remaining glaze over ham
12. Continue baking ham until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of ham reads 140 degrees F (60 degrees C), 30 to 60 minutes more. dotdash meredith food studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 33%, Saturated Fat 9g 45%, Cholesterol 99mg 33%, Sodium 68mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 16g 6%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 24g, Vitamin C 14mg 70%, Calcium 21mg 2%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 492mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/214002/brown-sugar-and-pineapple-glazed-ham/

============================================================

RECIPE 725: Jamaican Rum Punch
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 7 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Punch Recipes/Adult Punch Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups pineapple juice
• 2 ½ cups orange juice
• 1 cup 151 proof rum (such as Bacardi®)
• ½ cup dark rum (such as Meyer's®)
• ¼ cup coconut-flavored rum (such as Malibu®)
• ¼ cup fresh lime juice
• 3 tablespoons grenadine syrup
• 1 orange
• sliced
• 1 lime
• sliced
• 1 lemon
• sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir pineapple juice, orange juice, 151 proof rum, dark rum, coconut-flavored rum, lime juice, and grenadine syrup together in a punch bowl
2. Float orange slices, lime slices, and lemon slices in the punch
3. Ladle the punch into ice filled glasses, or chill the punch in the refrigerator until ready to serve
4. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 10mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 30g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 73mg 365%, Calcium 50mg 4%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 350mg 7%

RECIPE 726: T.G.I. Friday's Jack Daniels Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 cup
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 head garlic
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 1 ⅓ cups dark brown sugar
• 1 cup pineapple juice
• ⅔ cup water
• ¼ cup teriyaki sauce
• 1 tablespoon soy sauce
• 3 tablespoons lemon juice
• 3 tablespoons minced white onion
• 1 tablespoon bourbon whiskey
• 1 tablespoon crushed pineapple
• ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Cut about 1/2-inch off top of garlic head
3. Trim root, so garlic sits flat
4. Remove outer layers of papery skin, leaving enough so cloves remain intact
5. Place garlic into a small baking dish, drizzle olive oil on top, and cover with a lid or aluminum foil
6. Roast garlic in the preheated oven until cloves are soft and fragrant, about 1 hour
7. Stir brown sugar, pineapple juice, water, teriyaki sauce, and soy sauce together in a saucepan and bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and keep at a simmer
8. Squeeze sides of garlic until pasty roasted garlic emerges
9. Measure 2 teaspoons roasted garlic into the saucepan and whisk until incorporated
10. Reserve remaining roasted garlic for another use
11. Stir lemon juice, onion, bourbon whiskey, pineapple, and cayenne pepper into sauce
12. Bring to a simmer and cook until liquid reduces by half and turns thick and syrup-like, 40 to 50 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 467mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 8mg 42%, Calcium 42mg 3%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 142mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/242231/tgi-fridays-jack-daniels-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 727: Easy Pineapple Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Pineapple Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 cups white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• 2 large eggs
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple with juice
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13-baking dish
3. Mix together flour, white sugar, and baking soda for cake in a large bowl and make a well in the center
4. Add eggs, crushed pineapple with juice, and vanilla; mix until well-combined
5. Pour into the prepared baking dish
6. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into cake comes out clean, about 45 minutes
7. Meanwhile, combine cream cheese and butter for frosting in a mixing bowl; beat until smooth
8. Add confectioners' sugar and vanilla; beat until creamy
9. Spread frosting on warm cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 5g 23%, Cholesterol 36mg 12%, Sodium 166mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 59mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15857/easy-pineapple-cake/

RECIPE 728: Frog Eye Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 9 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Pasta Salad/Fruit Pasta Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¾ cups unsweetened pineapple juice
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 eggs
• beaten
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 2 ½ teaspoons salt
• divided
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• 1 (16 ounce) package acini di pepe pasta
• 3 (11 ounce) cans mandarin oranges
• drained
• 2 (20 ounce) cans pineapple tidbits
• drained
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping
• thawed
• 1 cup miniature marshmallows
• 1 cup shredded coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine pineapple juice, sugar, eggs, flour, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a saucepan
2. Stir and cook over medium heat until thickened
3. Remove from heat; stir in lemon juice
4. Let cool to room temperature, about 1 hour
5. Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add oil and remaining 2 teaspoons salt
6. Add pasta and cook until al dente, 5 to 7 minutes
7. Drain and rinse under cold water
8. Combine cooked pasta, cooled egg mixture, mandarin oranges, pineapple tidbits, crushed pineapple, and whipped topping in a large bowl; mix well
9. Refrigerate until chilled, 8 hours to overnight
10. Before serving, add marshmallows and coconut; toss and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 37mg 12%, Sodium 648mg 28%, Total Carbohydrate 114g 41%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 75g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 30mg 150%, Calcium 55mg 4%, Iron 3mg 18%, Potassium 388mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/14439/frog-eye-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 729: Pineapple Upside Down Cupcakes
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 cupcakes
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Upside-Down Cake Recipes/Pineapple Upside-Down Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• cooking spray
• ½ cup butter
• melted
• 1 ½ cups brown sugar
• 24 maraschino cherries
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• 1 (18.25 ounce) package pineapple cake mix (such as Duncan Hines® Pineapple Supreme)
• 1 ⅓ cups pineapple juice
• ⅓ cup vegetable oil
• 3 eggs
• 1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar for dusting
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Move an oven rack to the middle of the oven
3. Spray 24 muffin cups with cooking spray
4. Spoon 1 teaspoon melted butter into the bottom of each sprayed muffin cup
5. Spoon 1 tablespoon brown sugar into each muffin cup
6. Press a maraschino cherry into the center of the brown sugar in each muffin cup
7. Spoon a heaping tablespoon of crushed pineapple on top and compact it with the back of a spoon into an even layer
8. Mix pineapple cake mix, pineapple juice, vegetable oil, and eggs in a large bowl with an electric mixer on low speed until moistened, about 30 seconds
9. Increase speed to medium; mix for 2 minutes
10. Pour batter into the muffin cups, filling them to the top; do not overfill
11. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean, about 20 minutes
12. Line a work surface with waxed paper
13. Allow cupcakes to cool at least 5 minutes before inverting muffin cups onto the waxed paper; serve with pineapple and cherry sides up
14. Sprinkle cupcakes lightly with confectioners' sugar before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 33mg 11%, Sodium 174mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 4mg 18%, Calcium 22mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 90mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/220808/pineapple-upside-down-cupcakes/

============================================================

RECIPE 730: Brazilian Grilled Pineapple
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 wedges
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Side Dish/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 pineapple - peeled
• cored
• and cut into 6 wedges

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate
2. Whisk brown sugar and cinnamon together in a bowl; transfer into a large resealable plastic bag
3. Add pineapple wedges to the bag; shake well to coat each wedge
4. Grill pineapple wedges on the preheated grill until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes per side

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 13mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 66g 24%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 58g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 109mg 543%, Calcium 68mg 5%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 300mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/235932/brazilian-grilled-pineapple/

RECIPE 731: Ham with Pineapple
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 4 hrs
Total Time: 4 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Ham/Whole/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (12 pound) bone-in ham
• ½ cup whole cloves
• 1 (20 ounce) can pineapple rings in heavy syrup
• 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• 1 (4 ounce) jar chopped maraschino cherries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C)
2. Place ham in a roasting pan
3. Use a sharp knife to score ham rind with a diamond pattern
4. Press a clove into the center of each diamond
5. Drain juice from pineapple rings into a medium bowl; stir in lemon-lime soda and brown sugar
6. Coat ham with juice mixture and arrange pineapple rings on ham
7. Place a maraschino cherry in the center of each pineapple ring and secure with a toothpick
8. Bake uncovered, basting frequently with pan juices, in the preheated oven until the internal temperature of the ham is 160 degrees F (72 degrees C), 4 to 5 hours
9. Be sure the meat thermometer does not touch the bone
10. Remove toothpicks before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 36g 46%, Saturated Fat 13g 65%, Cholesterol 133mg 44%, Sodium 2564mg 111%, Total Carbohydrate 16g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 47g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 35mg 3%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 630mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/45000/ham-with-pineapple/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------

Prep Time: 5 mins

Category: /Side Dish/Stuffing and Dressing Recipes/Vegetarian Stuffing and Dressing Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup margarine

• drained

• cubed

DIRECTIONS:

RECIPE 735: Grilled Pineapple
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Pineapple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 fresh pineapple - peeled
• cored and cut into 1 inch rings
• 3 tablespoons melted butter
• ¼ teaspoon honey
• 1 dash hot pepper sauce
• salt to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place pineapple rings in a large resealable plastic bag
2. Add butter, honey, hot pepper sauce, and salt
3. Seal the bag and shake to coat evenly
4. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight
5. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil grate
6. Grill pineapple rings until heated through and grill marks appear, 2 to 3 minutes per side

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 23mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 5g 2%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 19mg 95%, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 44mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/51294/grilled-pineapple/

RECIPE 736: Pineapple Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x9-inch crisp
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Pineapple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 (20 ounce) cans crushed pineapple
• drained
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 cup brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 egg
• ½ cup butter
• melted
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread well-drained pineapple into a 9x9-inch square baking pan
3. Mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and egg in a medium bowl until well combined and crumbly
4. Spoon mixture evenly over pineapple
5. Pour melted butter over mixture, then sprinkle with cinnamon
6. Bake in the preheated oven until top is lightly browned and filling is bubbly, 40 to 45 minutes
7. Serve hot or cold

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 32mg 11%, Sodium 192mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 35g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 9mg 45%, Calcium 49mg 4%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 150mg 3%
