RECIPE 738: Easy Pineapple Chicken
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/Stir-Fry/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons soy sauce
• 3 tablespoons olive oil
• divided
• ½ teaspoon paprika
• salt to taste
• 1 pound boneless
• skinless chicken breast
• cut into strips
• 1 red bell pepper
• cubed
• 1 bunch scallions
• trimmed and sliced into 1/2-inch lengths
• 1 (12 ounce) can pineapple chunks
• drained and juice reserved
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine soy sauce, 2 tablespoons olive oil, paprika, and salt in a bowl
2. Add chicken strips and let marinate while preparing the remaining ingredients
3. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in a wok over medium-high heat
4. Add bell pepper and stir-fry for 3 minutes
5. Add scallions and cook for 2 more minutes
6. Remove chicken from marinade and add to the wok; discard marinade
7. Cook, stirring occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center, 10 to 15 minutes
8. Combine pineapple juice and cornstarch in a bowl; mix together
9. Add pineapple chunks to the skillet and cook for 2 to 3 minutes
10. Pour in pineapple juice mixture and bring to a boil
11. Simmer until sauce has thickened, about 3 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 783mg 34%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 26g, Vitamin C 57mg 284%, Calcium 69mg 5%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 548mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/262797/easy-pineapple-chicken/

============================================================

RECIPE 739: Old Fashioned Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 10-inch round cake
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Pineapple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup butter
• 1 cup packed light brown sugar
• 1 (20 ounce) can sliced pineapple
• 10 maraschino cherries
• halved
• 1 cup sifted cake flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 4 large eggs
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon butter
• melted
• 1 teaspoon almond extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Melt 1/2 cup butter over very low heat in a 10-inch heavy skillet with a heat-resistant handle or a cast iron pan
3. Remove from heat; sprinkle brown sugar evenly into the skillet
4. Arrange pineapple slices to cover the bottom of the skillet
5. Distribute cherries around pineapples; set aside
6. Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl; set aside
7. Separate eggs; place whites in a large mixing bowl and yolks in a smaller bowl
8. Beat egg whites on medium speed until soft peaks form
9. Add white sugar gradually, beating well after each addition
10. Beat until medium-stiff peaks form
11. Beat egg yolks at high speed until very thick and yellow
12. Using a wire whisk or rubber scraper, gently fold egg yolks and flour mixture into whites with an over-and-under motion until blended
13. Fold 1 tablespoon melted butter and almond extract into batter, then spread batter evenly over pineapple in the skillet
14. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes
15. Loosen cake edges with a table knife
16. Cool cake for 5 minutes before inverting it onto a serving plate
17. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 85mg 28%, Sodium 183mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 55g 20%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 43g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 5mg 24%, Calcium 52mg 4%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 69mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7622/old-fashioned-pineapple-upside-down-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 740: Singapore Sling Cocktail
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 1
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 5 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Cocktail Recipes/Gin Drinks Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups ice
• divided
• 4 fluid ounces pineapple juice
• 1 ½ fluid ounces gin
• ½ fluid ounce cherry-flavored brandy
• ½ fluid ounce lime juice
• ½ fluid ounce grenadine syrup
• ¼ fluid ounce triple sec
• ¼ fluid ounce Benedictine® liqueur
• 1 slice fresh pineapple
• 1 maraschino cherry

DIRECTIONS:
1. Fill a Collins glass with 1 cup ice and place in the freezer
2. Combine pineapple juice, gin, cherry-flavored brandy, lime juice, grenadine, triple sec, and Bénédictine in a cocktail shaker
3. Add 1 cup ice, cover, and shake until chilled
4. Strain into the prepared Collins glass
5. Garnish with pineapple slice and cherry
6. Talin Alton

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 10mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 44g 16%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 44mg 220%, Calcium 28mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 257mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/221894/singapore-sling-cocktail/

RECIPE 741: Pineapple Upside-Down Bundt Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 10-inch bundt cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• cooking spray with flour
• ½ cup melted butter
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• 1 (8 ounce) can pineapple rings
• 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• 1 (15.25 ounce) package yellow cake mix
• 1 (3.5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix
• ¼ cup whole milk
• or more as needed
• ⅓ cup vegetable oil
• 3 large eggs

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 10-inch fluted tube pan (such as Bundt) with cooking spray with flour
3. Pour melted butter into the bottom of the prepared pan
4. Sprinkle brown sugar evenly on top
5. Drain pineapple rings over a measuring cup; reserve juice
6. Cut rings in half
7. Alternate placing halved pineapple rings and maraschino cherries around the pan
8. Combine cake mix and pudding mix in a large mixing bowl
9. Pour enough milk into the reserved pineapple juice to make 1 cup of liquid; add to cake and pudding mixture
10. Pour in vegetable oil
11. Mix on low speed, adding 1 egg at a time, until blended
12. Increase speed to medium; mix until thoroughly combined and smooth, about 2 minutes
13. Pour batter over pineapples and cherries in the pan
14. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes
15. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 7g 34%, Cholesterol 63mg 21%, Sodium 477mg 21%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 37g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 2mg 10%, Calcium 82mg 6%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 85mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/272616/pineapple-upside-down-bundt-cake/

------------------------------------------------------------

• peeled

RECIPE 743: Hawaiian Meatballs
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Meatball Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pound ground beef
• ½ teaspoon ground ginger
• ¼ teaspoon garlic powder
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make the meatballs: Mix ground beef, ginger, garlic powder, and black pepper together in a large bowl until well combined
2. Shape into 1 1/2-inch balls
3. Sauté meatballs in a large skillet over medium-high heat until browned, about 10 minutes
4. While the meatballs are cooking, prepare the sauce: Pour pineapple juice into a liquid measuring cup, and reserve pineapple chunks; add enough water to pineapple juice to make 1 cup
5. Mix brown sugar and cornstarch in a small bowl
6. Transfer meatballs to a plate, reserving the pan drippings
7. Add pineapple juice and brown sugar mixtures to the warm pan drippings
8. Stir in vinegar and soy sauce and bring to a boil
9. Cook until sauce thickens, 2 to 3 minutes
10. Return meatballs to the skillet; add pineapple chunks, and green pepper
11. Simmer until meatballs are no longer pink inside, about 10 minutes
12. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C)

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 68mg 23%, Sodium 279mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 19g, Vitamin C 29mg 147%, Calcium 33mg 3%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 327mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/274276/hawaiian-meatballs/

============================================================

RECIPE 744: Baked Pineapple Casserole
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Casseroles/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 4 large eggs
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon (Optional)
• 1 pinch ground nutmeg (Optional)
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple with juice
• 5 slices white bread
• torn

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a medium-sized casserole dish
3. Beat sugar and butter in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until creamy
4. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then stir in cinnamon and nutmeg
5. Mix in crushed pineapple and bread until incorporated; transfer to the prepared baking dish
6. Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and lightly browned on top, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 25%, Saturated Fat 11g 55%, Cholesterol 165mg 55%, Sodium 162mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 59g 21%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 48g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 9mg 45%, Calcium 60mg 5%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 190mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/18246/baked-pineapple-casserole/

RECIPE 745: Grandma's Skillet Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Pineapple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 stick butter
• 1 ½ cups packed brown sugar
• 1 (20 ounce) can sliced pineapple
• 1 (4 ounce) jar cherries
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 2 large eggs
• 1 cup milk
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Melt 1 stick butter in the bottom of a cast iron skillet over medium heat, about 3 minutes
3. Remove from heat and sprinkle brown sugar evenly over butter
4. Add pineapple slices to the skillet in a decorative layer with a cherry in the middle of each pineapple ring
5. Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl
6. Cream sugar and 1/2 cup butter together in a bowl
7. Add eggs and mix
8. Add flour mixture and milk in an alternating fashion
9. Add vanilla extract and mix well
10. Pour mixture evenly over pineapples in the skillet
11. Bake in the preheated oven until cake is golden brown, about 40 minutes
12. Let cake cool in the skillet for 10 minutes before inverting onto a serving plate
13. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 10g 52%, Cholesterol 73mg 24%, Sodium 340mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 77g 28%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 61g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 5mg 24%, Calcium 116mg 9%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 113mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/273774/grandmas-skillet-pineapple-upside-down-cake/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------

Yield: 10 servings

• drained thoroughly

• drained thoroughly

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix fruit cocktail, pineapple, mandarin oranges, and marshmallows together in a large bowl; add sour cream and stir to coat fruit completely
2. Refrigerate 4 hours to overnight

RECIPE 747: Pineapple Sweet and Sour Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups pineapple juice
• divided
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¾ cup ketchup
• or more to taste
• ⅔ cup apple cider vinegar
• 2 tablespoons soy sauce
• or more to taste
• 2 tablespoons crushed pineapple
• or more to taste
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk 1/4 cup pineapple juice and cornstarch together in a small bowl until smooth
2. Combine cornstarch mixture, remaining 1 3/4 cup pineapple juice, sugar, ketchup, vinegar, soy sauce, crushed pineapple, and garlic powder in a large pot over high heat
3. Cook, stirring frequently, until sauce comes to a gentle boil
4. Reduce heat and continue to simmer until sauce is clear and reaches desired consistency, 15 to 25 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 160mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 5mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 67mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/247116/pineapple-sweet-and-sour-sauce/

RECIPE 748: Thai Pineapple Chicken Curry
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/Thai/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 quart water
• 2 cups uncooked jasmine rice
• ¼ cup red curry paste
• 2 (13.5 ounce) cans coconut milk
• divided
• 2 skinless
• boneless chicken breast halves - cut into thin strips
• 1 ½ cups sliced bamboo shoots
• drained
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 3 tablespoons fish sauce
• ½ red bell pepper
• julienned
• ½ green bell pepper
• julienned
• ½ small onion
• chopped
• 1 cup pineapple chunks
• drained

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring water and rice to a boil in a pot
2. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 25 minutes
3. Whisk together curry paste and 1 can coconut milk in a bowl
4. Transfer to a wok and mix in remaining coconut milk, chicken, bamboo shoots, sugar, and fish sauce
5. Bring to a boil and cook until chicken juices run clear, 15 minutes
6. Mix bell peppers and onion into the wok
7. Continue cooking until peppers are tender, about 10 minutes
8. Remove from heat and stir in pineapple
9. Serve over cooked rice

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 35g 44%, Saturated Fat 25g 125%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 781mg 34%, Total Carbohydrate 78g 28%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 20g, Vitamin C 27mg 135%, Calcium 65mg 5%, Iron 7mg 39%, Potassium 546mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/86005/thai-pineapple-chicken-curry/

RECIPE 749: Pineapple-Infused Vodka
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 17
Yield: 17 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 days 10 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Cocktail Recipes/Vodka Drinks Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 fresh pineapple
• peeled and sliced
• 1 (750 milliliter) bottle vodka (such as Stolichnaya®)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stack pineapple slices in a circle around the edges of a large glass jar, leaving the center open
2. Pour vodka into jar, completely covering pineapple
3. Seal jar and store in a cool, dark place for 10 days
4. Remove pineapple and strain vodka through a mesh strainer back into a jar; seal and refrigerate

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 38mg 192%, Calcium 10mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 88mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/238576/pineapple-infused-vodka/

RECIPE 750: Pineapple Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 pie
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Custard and Cream Pies/Pineapple Pie/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple with juice
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• 2 tablespoons milk
• 1 tablespoon white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. In a medium saucepan combine sugar, cornstarch, pineapple with juice, and lemon juice
3. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened, then allow to boil 1 minute
4. Cool slightly and pour mixture into pastry-lined pie pan
5. Cover with top crust and seal
6. Make a few steam vents in crust, then brush with milk and sprinkle with sugar
7. Place in preheated oven and bake for 35 minutes
8. Serve chilled or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 0mg 0%, Sodium 236mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 55g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 8mg 38%, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 123mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15903/pineapple-pie-iii/

RECIPE 751: Pineapple Pork Chops
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Pork Chop Recipes/Boneless/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 4 boneless pork chops
• 1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth
• 2 tablespoons soy sauce
• 1 tablespoon vinegar
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• 2 tablespoons cornstarch
• ½ cup pineapple juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, and brown the pork chops about 5 minutes on each side
2. Remove chops from the skillet, and set aside
3. Mix the chicken broth, soy sauce and vinegar into the skillet, and bring to a boil
4. Return the pork chops to the skillet, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes
5. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
6. Remove chops from the skillet, reserving broth mixture, and set aside
7. In a bowl, blend the brown sugar, cornstarch, and pineapple juice
8. Mix into the skillet with the chicken broth mixture
9. Bring to a boil
10. Serve with the cooked pork chops

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 39mg 13%, Sodium 910mg 40%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 6%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 15g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 22mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 268mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/69660/pineapple-pork-chops/

============================================================

RECIPE 752: Pineapple Upside Down Cake from DOLE®
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Everyday Cooking/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (20 ounce) can DOLE® Pineapple Slices
• 2 tablespoons margarine
• melted
• ¼ cup packed brown sugar
• 8 maraschino cherries
• 1 (9 ounce) package yellow cake mix

DIRECTIONS:
1. Spray pan with non-stick cooking spray
2. Drain pineapple
3. Stir together melted margarine and brown sugar in 8-inch cake pan
4. Place pineapple slices in sugar mixture
5. Place cherry in center of each pineapple slice and in the center of the pan
6. Prepare cake mix according to the package directions
7. Pour cake batter evenly over pineapple
8. Bake at 350 degrees F, 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean
9. Cool 5 minutes
10. Loosen edges and turn out onto serving platter

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Cholesterol 1mg 0%, Sodium 246mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 50mg 4%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 45mg 1%

RECIPE 754: Baked Ham with Sweet Glaze
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 1 10-pound ham
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Ham/Whole/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (10 pound) fully-cooked
• bone-in ham
• 4 cups boiling water
• or as needed
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 2 tablespoons dry mustard powder
• ¼ cup honey
• 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice
• or as needed
• 1 (20 ounce) can pineapple chunks
• drained
• 1 (10 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• drained
• toothpicks

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Place ham on a rack set in a roasting pan, and carefully pour about 1/2 inch of boiling water into the pan beneath the ham
3. Bake the ham in the preheated oven for 2 hours, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the meat (do not touch the bone) reads at least 140 degrees F (60 degrees C.) Reduce oven heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C.) In a bowl, mix together the brown sugar, flour, dry mustard, honey, and lemon juice as needed to make a thick, smooth paste
4. Brush the ham generously with glaze
5. Skewer 1 pineapple chunk and 1 maraschino cherry per toothpick, and insert the decorated picks all over the ham
6. Return the ham to the oven, and roast for 15 minutes
7. Baste the ham, fruit and all, with glaze and juices that have collected in the bottom of the pan, return to the oven, and roast for an additional 15 minutes
8. Let the ham rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 33g 42%, Saturated Fat 12g 60%, Cholesterol 218mg 73%, Sodium 146mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 66g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 46mg 4%, Iron 3mg 15%, Potassium 920mg 20%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/214000/baked-ham-with-sweet-glaze/

============================================================

RECIPE 755: Zucchini Pineapple Bread I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 loaves
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Zucchini Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 eggs
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 cup vegetable oil
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ¾ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• 2 cups grated zucchini
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt
2. In a large bowl, mix oil, eggs, vanilla, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg
3. Blend in pineapple and zucchini
4. Stir flour mixture into zucchini mixture
5. Pour batter into two greased and floured 9 x 5 inch loaf pans
6. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 1 hour
7. Cool on wire racks

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 219mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 27g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 28mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 66mg 1%

• chopped

• seeded and minced

RECIPE 757: Instant Pot® Ham
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 small ham
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Ham/Whole/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (2 pound) frozen whole ham
• 1 (16 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• ¼ cup dark brown sugar
• 2 tablespoons maple syrup
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• 2 tablespoons water
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place ham on a trivet and set it inside a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®)
2. Pour crushed pineapple over ham
3. Sprinkle brown sugar and drizzle maple syrup on top
4. Secure the lid with vent closed
5. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 35 minutes
6. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
7. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes
8. Remove ham and trivet
9. Cut ham into slices and place on a plate
10. Select Saute setting on the pressure cooker
11. Mix cornstarch with water until smooth
12. Stir mixture into the pot, bring to a boil, and stir until thickened
13. Pour sauce over the ham

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 8g 38%, Cholesterol 64mg 21%, Sodium 1461mg 64%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 21g, Vitamin C 45mg 225%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 440mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/267260/instant-pot-ham/

============================================================

RECIPE 758: Hawaiian Cole Slaw
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 16 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Coleslaw Recipes/With Mayo/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (8.5 ounce) package coleslaw mix
• 1 (15 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• ½ cup finely chopped onion
• ½ cup mayonnaise
• ¼ cup apple cider vinegar
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon dried cilantro
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix coleslaw mix, pineapple, and onion together in a bowl
2. Whisk mayonnaise, vinegar, brown sugar, cilantro, salt, and pepper together in a bowl until dressing is smooth
3. Pour dressing over coleslaw mixture and toss to coat
4. Refrigerate

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 116mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 8g 3%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 8mg 40%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 75mg 2%

RECIPE 759: Delicious Pineapple Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 16 muffins
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 3.9/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• 1 egg
• beaten
• ¾ cup milk
• ¼ cup butter
• melted
• ¼ cup butter
• melted
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ⅓ cup packed brown sugar
• ½ cup all-purpose flour

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour muffin pans, or line with paper liners
3. In a large bowl, stir together 2 cups flour, white sugar, baking powder and salt
4. Drain pineapple, reserving 1/4 cup juice
5. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients, and pour in the reserved juice, egg, milk, and 1/4 cup melted butter
6. Mix just until blended
7. In a separate bowl, stir together the cinnamon, brown sugar, 1/2 cup flour, and 1/4 cup melted butter to make the topping
8. Spoon batter into muffin cups, then spoon crushed pineapple over the batter and sprinkle with the cinnamon topping
9. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until a toothpick inserted in the crown of the muffin comes out clean

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 8%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 28mg 9%, Sodium 187mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 61mg 5%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 68mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/69664/delicious-pineapple-muffins/

============================================================

RECIPE 760: Instant Pot Tacos al Pastor
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 9 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Taco Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 pounds pork butt
• cut into 2-inch cubes
• 2 cups pineapple juice
• ¼ cup white vinegar
• 1 medium orange
• juiced
• 1 medium lime
• juiced
• 1 cup chopped onion
• 4 cloves garlic
• chopped
• 2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
• 1 tablespoon chili powder
• 1 teaspoon cumin
• 1 ½ teaspoons salt
• ½ teaspoon ground black pepper
• 1 (1.41 ounce) package sazon seasoning with achiote
• vegetable oil as needed
• 20 ounces pineapple chunks
• drained
• 12 (10 inch) flour tortillas
• ½ cup chopped red onion
• pico de gallo salsa
• 1 medium avocado
• diced (Optional)
• ⅛ cup chopped cilantro
• 1 lime
• cut into wedges

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place pork in a large lidded container
2. Combine pineapple juice, vinegar, orange juice, lime juice, onion, garlic, chipotle peppers, chili powder, cumin, salt, pepper, and sazon in a blender; blend until smooth
3. Pour sauce over the pork and make sure all chunks of meat are covered
4. Seal the container and marinate for at least 8 hours or up to 24 hours
5. Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Saute function
6. Add vegetable oil and heat until hot
7. Add chunks of marinated pork and brown on all sides, reserving extra sauce, about 5 minutes
8. You may need to work in batches depending on the size of your Instant Pot
9. Turn off Saute mode and pour reserved sauce over the pork
10. Close and lock the lid
11. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 35 minutes
12. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
13. Release pressure first using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 10 minutes
14. Release remaining pressure using the manufacturer's quick release method, about 5 minutes
15. Unlock and remove the lid
16. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
17. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil
18. Remove the pork chunks from the pot using tongs or a slotted spoon, and place them on the baking sheet
19. Reserve the sauce in the Instant Pot® for now
20. Use forks to coarsely shred the pork, removing and discarding any excess fatty chunks
21. Spread meat out evenly on the prepared baking sheet
22. Add pineapple chunks to the baking sheet with the meat, then place the baking sheet under the broiler
23. Broil until the tips of the meat and pineapple are beginning to get a little brown and crispy, about 5 minutes
24. Remove from the oven
25. Use a spoon to drizzle the reserved sauce from the Instant Pot over the meat to moisten it and add some more of the marinade flavor
26. Create tacos by portioning the pork and pineapple chunks on flour tortillas
27. Add chopped red onion, pico de gallo salsa, avocado, and cilantro
28. Garnish with lime wedges

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 43mg 14%, Sodium 1339mg 58%, Total Carbohydrate 54g 20%, Dietary Fiber 5g 17%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 22g, Vitamin C 16mg 79%, Calcium 128mg 10%, Iron 4mg 20%, Potassium 550mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/270608/instant-pot-tacos-al-pastor/

============================================================

RECIPE 761: Baked Pineapple
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 7
Yield: 7 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Pineapple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons cornstarch
• ¼ cup cold water
• 2 eggs
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
• 1 tablespoon butter
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x9 inch baking dish
3. In a mixing bowl, mix together the pineapple, sugar, cornstarch, water, eggs and vanilla
4. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish
5. Dot the mixture with butter and sprinkle with cinnamon
6. Bake in a preheated 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven for 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 57mg 19%, Sodium 55mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 44g 16%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 41g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 8mg 38%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 122mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/18452/baked-pineapple/

RECIPE 762: Easy Sweet and Sour Chicken
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon garlic powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon ground black pepper
• 1 pound skinless
• boneless chicken breast halves
• cut into 1-inch cubes
• 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
• divided
• 3 celery ribs
• sliced
• 2 green bell peppers
• diced
• 1 onion
• chopped
• ½ cup ketchup
• ½ cup lemon juice
• ½ cup crushed pineapple with syrup
• ⅓ cup packed brown sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine flour, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper in a shallow dish
2. Roll and coat chicken cubes in flour mixture
3. Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
4. Cook and stir chicken in hot oil until not longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 8 to 10 minutes; remove and set aside
5. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the same skillet over medium heat
6. Cook and stir celery, green peppers, and onion in heated oil until slightly tender, about 5 minutes
7. Return chicken to the skillet
8. Whisk ketchup, lemon juice, pineapple, and brown sugar in a bowl; pour into the skillet; bring to a boil
9. Cook and stir chicken and vegetables in sauce until heated through, 2 to 3 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 17%, Saturated Fat 3g 13%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 870mg 38%, Total Carbohydrate 49g 18%, Dietary Fiber 5g 19%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 27g, Vitamin C 78mg 390%, Calcium 143mg 11%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 1147mg 24%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/220314/easy-sweet-and-sour-chicken/

============================================================

RECIPE 763: World's Best Cream Cheese and Pineapple Dip
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Fruit Dip/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• 2 cups crushed pineapple
• drained with juice reserved
• 1 teaspoon onion powder
• 2 cloves garlic
• peeled and crushed

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a medium bowl, mix together cream cheese, crushed pineapple, onion powder and garlic
2. Mix in reserved juice from pineapple as desired
3. Chill in the refrigerator until serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 10mg 3%, Sodium 28mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 4g 1%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 2mg 10%, Calcium 11mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 37mg 1%

RECIPE 764: Precious Pineapple Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 8-inch layer cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Pineapple Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup margarine
• softened
• 3 large eggs
• 1 (18.25 ounce) package yellow cake mix
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple with juice
• ½ cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour three 8-inch round pans
3. Cream margarine in a large bowl until smooth
4. Blend in eggs
5. Add cake mix and pineapple with juice; mix until smooth
6. Stir in pecans
7. Pour batter into the prepared pans
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 20 to 30 minutes
9. Cool cakes in pans on wire racks for 5 minutes
10. Run a table knife around the edges to loosen
11. Invert carefully onto cooling racks
12. Let cool completely, about 1 hour
13. To make frosting: Beat margarine and cream cheese in a medium bowl until smooth
14. Gradually blend in the confectioners' sugar
15. Mix in pecans
16. Spread frosting onto the cooled cake layers
17. Stack layers; frost top and sides

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 34g 44%, Saturated Fat 8g 42%, Cholesterol 68mg 23%, Sodium 532mg 23%, Total Carbohydrate 83g 30%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 5mg 24%, Calcium 99mg 8%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 177mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/19077/precious-pineapple-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 765: Sweet and Sour Chicken III
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pound skinless
• boneless chicken breast meat - cubed
• 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
• ½ cup sliced green bell pepper
• ½ cup sliced red bell pepper
• 1 cup carrot strips
• 1 clove garlic
• minced
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• ¼ cup low sodium soy sauce
• 1 (8 ounce) can pineapple chunks
• juice reserved
• 1 tablespoon vinegar
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground ginger

DIRECTIONS:
1. Brown chicken in oil in a large skillet over medium high heat
2. Add green bell pepper, red bell pepper, carrot and garlic and stir fry for 1 to 2 minutes
3. In a small bowl, combine cornstarch and soy sauce and mix together; pour mixture into the skillet, along with the pineapple and liquid, vinegar, sugar and ginger
4. Stir together and bring to a full boil

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 59mg 20%, Sodium 603mg 26%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 24g, Vitamin C 31mg 157%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 394mg 8%

RECIPE 766: Ham and Pineapple Dinner
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Ham/Brown Sugar/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 2 ½ cups cooked and cubed ham
• 2 green onions
• chopped
• 1 cup pineapple chunks
• drained
• 1 ⅓ cups pineapple juice
• 4 teaspoons cider vinegar
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons prepared mustard
• 2 tablespoons cornstarch

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat
2. Saute the ham, onions and pineapple chunks in the butter for about 5 minutes
3. In a separate medium bowl, combine the pineapple juice, vinegar, brown sugar, mustard and cornstarch
4. Stir this together well and pour over the ham mixture in the skillet
5. Stir well and allow to heat through and thicken, about 5 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 16%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 1259mg 55%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 20g, Vitamin C 16mg 80%, Calcium 40mg 3%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 540mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17801/ham-and-pineapple-dinner/

------------------------------------------------------------

Yield: 20 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Sangria Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 (750 milliliter) bottles moscato wine

• 1 cup peach schnapps

• pitted and sliced

• sliced
• 2 mangos - peeled
• seeded
• and sliced
• ½ fresh pineapple - peeled
• cored
• and cut into chunks
• 1 (6 ounce) container fresh raspberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir moscato wine, lemon-lime soda, brandy, peach schnapps, peaches, strawberries, mangos, pineapple chunks, and raspberries together in a large container and chill 8 hours or overnight

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 24mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 30mg 148%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 228mg 5%

RECIPE 768: Pineapple Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 -9x5x3 inch loaf
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 eggs
• ½ cup melted butter
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup crushed pineapple with juice
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 3 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ¾ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease one 9x5x3 inch loaf pan
3. Beat eggs slightly
4. Add butter and sugar
5. Beat smooth
6. Stir in pineapple and vanilla
7. In separate bowl put flour, baking powder, soda, salt, and walnuts
8. Stir well and pour into pineapple mixture
9. Stir to moisten
10. Pour into greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan
11. Bake in 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for 1 hour
12. Test with toothpick
13. Let stand 10 minutes
14. Remove from pan
15. Cool and wrap

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 6g 28%, Cholesterol 51mg 17%, Sodium 387mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 86mg 7%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 90mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/6937/pineapple-bread/

RECIPE 769: Pineapple Glaze for Ham
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Ham Glaze Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (15.25 ounce) can sliced pineapple
• drained with juice reserved
• 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• drained
• 1 cup brown sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Before baking ham, place pineapple slices on ham with toothpicks and place cherries in center of pineapple
2. In a medium microwave safe bowl combine brown sugar and reserved pineapple juice
3. Mix together and microwave for about 5 minutes, until mixture is thick
4. Pour some of this glaze over the ham about every 15 minutes in the last hour of baking, until all is used

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 7mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 21g, Vitamin C 3mg 16%, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 31mg 1%

RECIPE 770: Sweet and Sour Pork Tenderloin
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/Chinese/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (1 1/4 pound) pork tenderloin
• trimmed of silver skin
• salt and ground black pepper
• ⅓ cup ketchup
• ⅓ cup seasoned rice vinegar
• 1 (8 ounce) can pineapple chunks
• drained with juice reserved
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• 4 cloves garlic
• minced
• 2 teaspoons hot chili sauce (such as Sriracha®)
• 1 teaspoon soy sauce
• 1 pinch red pepper flakes
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• 1 teaspoon butter
• ¼ cup chopped green onion (white part only)
• 2 tablespoons chopped green onion tops

DIRECTIONS:
1. Cut tenderloin into 4 pieces
2. Arrange in a single layer between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound with a meat mallet until each is about 1-inch thick
3. Generously season with salt and black pepper
4. Whisk ketchup, rice vinegar, reserved pineapple juice, brown sugar, garlic, hot chili sauce, soy sauce, and red pepper flakes in a bowl
5. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over high heat
6. Place pork in pan; reduce heat to medium
7. Cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes per side
8. Transfer to a plate
9. Return skillet to medium heat
10. Stir butter into hot pan
11. When butter melts and starts to brown, stir in pineapple chunks
12. Cook, stirring, until pineapple is golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes
13. Stir in ketchup mixture and 1/4 cup green onion (white parts)
14. Reduce heat to low and simmer until garlic and onion have softened, 5 minutes
15. Return pork to skillet; cook, stirring, until pork is heated through
16. Garnish with 2 tablespoons green onion tops

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 15%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 82mg 27%, Sodium 515mg 22%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 26g, Vitamin C 12mg 62%, Calcium 35mg 3%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 573mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/222342/sweet-and-sour-pork-tenderloin/

============================================================

RECIPE 771: Cranberry JELL-O Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Dessert Salad Recipes/Jell-O® Salad/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups boiling water
• 2 (0.3 ounce) packages sugar-free cherry-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®)
• 1 (16 ounce) can jellied cranberry sauce
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• ½ cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine boiling water and gelatin mix in a bowl; stir until gelatin is dissolved
2. Stir in cranberry sauce and crushed pineapple
3. Transfer to a large glass serving dish or 12 individual dishes
4. Sprinkle pecans over top
5. Chill until set, 3 to 4 hours for individual dishes, or 4 hours to overnight for one large serving dish

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Sodium 62mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 5mg 26%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 86mg 2%

RECIPE 772: Southern Pineapple Casserole
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 1/2 quart casserole
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Side Dish/Casseroles/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (20 ounce) can pineapple chunks
• 6 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ cup white sugar
• or to taste
• 2 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• 40 buttery round crackers (such as Ritz®)
• crushed
• ½ cup butter
• melted
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Drain pineapple chunks, reserving 1/4 cup of the juice
3. Transfer both chunks and juice into a large bowl
4. Add flour, sugar, Cheddar cheese, and drained, crushed pineapple; mix to combine
5. Pour into a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish
6. Mix cracker crumbs and melted butter in a small bowl; sprinkle over pineapple mixture
7. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 34%, Saturated Fat 15g 76%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 360mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 9mg 45%, Calcium 192mg 15%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 145mg 3%

RECIPE 773: Rosa Marina Fruit Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 9 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Pasta Salad/Fruit Pasta Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (16 ounce) package Rosa Marina (orzo) pasta
• 2 (15 ounce) cans mandarin oranges
• drained and juice reserved
• 1 (16 ounce) can pineapple chunks
• drained with juice reserved
• 1 (16 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained and juice reserved
• 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• drained and halved
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 large eggs
• 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 1 (16 ounce) container whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
2. Cook orzo in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 11 minutes
3. Drain and transfer to a large bowl
4. Add mandarin oranges, pineapple chunks, crushed pineapple, and maraschino cherries to orzo
5. Combine juice from mandarin oranges, juice from pineapple chunks, juice from crushed pineapple, sugar, eggs, and flour in a saucepan over low heat; cook, stirring often, until sauce is thickened, 5 to 7 minutes
6. Remove sauce from heat and cool, about 30 minutes
7. Pour cooled sauce over orzo mixture and toss to coat
8. Refrigerate until flavors blend, 8 hours to overnight
9. Fold whipped topping into orzo mixture before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 20mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 35g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 16mg 78%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 132mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/233943/rosa-marina-fruit-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 774: Hawaiian Chicken Kabobs
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/Healthy Chicken/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons soy sauce
• 3 tablespoons brown sugar
• 2 tablespoons sherry
• 1 tablespoon sesame oil
• ¼ teaspoon ground ginger
• ¼ teaspoon garlic powder
• 8 skinless
• boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 2 inch pieces
• 1 (20 ounce) can pineapple chunks
• drained
• skewers

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a shallow glass dish, mix the soy sauce, brown sugar, sherry, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic powder
2. Stir the chicken pieces and pineapple into the marinade until well coated
3. Cover, and marinate in the refrigerator at least 2 hours
4. Preheat grill to medium-high heat
5. Lightly oil the grill grate
6. Thread chicken and pineapple alternately onto skewers
7. Grill 15 to 20 minutes, turning occasionally, or until chicken juices run clear. lauralovinglife

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Cholesterol 61mg 20%, Sodium 413mg 18%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 24g, Vitamin C 7mg 34%, Calcium 26mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 257mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/20415/hawaiian-chicken-kabobs/

RECIPE 775: Slow Cooker Tacos al Pastor
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 tacos
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 7 hrs
Total Time: 7 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅔ large pineapple - peeled
• cored
• and chopped into small chunks
• 1 small white onion
• quartered
• 1 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
• or more to taste
• 2 dried guajillo chiles
• stemmed and seeded
• or more to taste
• 1 dried chile de arbol pepper
• stemmed and seeded
• or more to taste
• 3 cloves garlic
• halved
• 1 tablespoon minced fresh oregano
• ½ cup orange juice
• 2 tablespoons white vinegar
• 2 tablespoons achiote powder
• 2 teaspoons salt
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon lime zest
• or to taste
• ½ teaspoon ground ancho chile powder
• ¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
• 1 (3 pound) boneless pork loin
• cubed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place pineapple, onion, chipotle peppers plus 1 1/2 teaspoons adobo sauce, guajillo chiles, chile de arbol, garlic, and oregano in a food processor
2. Blend until smooth
3. Transfer to a bowl and add orange juice, vinegar, achiote powder, salt, cumin, lime zest, chile powder, and black pepper
4. Mix sauce well
5. Place pork in a slow cooker and cover with the sauce
6. Cover and cook on Low until pork is very tender, 7 to 9 hours
7. Begin heating tortillas 35 to 40 minutes before pork is done
8. Heat oil in a saucepan over high heat
9. Cook tortillas one at a time until brown spots appear, 30 seconds to 1 minute per side
10. Plate tortillas in stacks of two for each taco
11. Shred pork using 2 forks; mix to coat with the sauce
12. Scoop pork onto tacos using a slotted spoon
13. Top each with a portion of pineapple, cilantro, and onion

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 5g 23%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 543mg 24%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 16%, Dietary Fiber 5g 19%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 26g, Vitamin C 71mg 353%, Calcium 87mg 7%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 1635mg 35%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/266022/slow-cooker-tacos-al-pastor/

============================================================

RECIPE 776: Hawaiian Pineapple Chicken
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Baked and Roasted/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup butter
• ⅓ cup ketchup
• ¼ cup brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons cornstarch
• ¼ cup vinegar
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon soy sauce
• ½ teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
• 1 (9 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• 3 pounds assorted chicken pieces such as breasts
• thighs
• wings
• and drumsticks

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; stir ketchup and brown sugar into melted butter, stirring to dissolve brown sugar
3. Whisk cornstarch into vinegar until smooth; pour into pan
4. Whisk constantly and add salt, soy sauce, and Worcestershire sauce to mixture; bring to a simmer
5. Cook until thickened, about 2 minutes
6. Stir pineapple into sauce
7. Arrange chicken pieces in a 9x13-inch baking dish; pour pineapple sauce over chicken
8. Bake until sauce is bubbling, chicken is browned, and the juices run clear, about 45 minutes
9. An instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a thigh should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 31g 40%, Saturated Fat 11g 57%, Cholesterol 162mg 54%, Sodium 776mg 34%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 39g, Vitamin C 6mg 31%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 460mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/232116/hawaiian-pineapple-chicken/

============================================================

RECIPE 777: BBQ Teriyaki Pork Kabobs
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons soy sauce
• 3 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 clove garlic
• minced
• ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
• salt and pepper to taste
• 1 pound boneless pork loin
• cut into 1 inch cubes
• 1 (14.5 ounce) can low-sodium beef broth
• 2 tablespoons cornstarch
• 2 tablespoons soy sauce
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• 2 cloves garlic
• minced
• ¼ teaspoon ground ginger
• 3 portobello mushrooms
• cut into quarters
• 1 large red onion
• cut into 12 wedges
• 12 cherry tomatoes
• 12 bite-size chunks fresh pineapple

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a shallow dish, mix together 3 tablespoons soy sauce, olive oil, 1 clove minced garlic, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper
2. Add pork cubes, and turn to coat evenly with marinade
3. Cover, and refrigerate for 3 hours
4. In a saucepan, combine beef broth, cornstarch, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, brown sugar, 2 cloves minced garlic, and ginger
5. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly
6. Reduce heat, and simmer 5 minutes
7. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil grate
8. Thread pork cubes onto skewers, alternating with mushrooms, onion, tomatoes, and pineapple chunks
9. Cook on grill for 15 minutes, or until meat is cooked through
10. Turn skewers, and baste often with sauce during cooking

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 48mg 16%, Sodium 867mg 38%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 6%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 19g, Vitamin C 25mg 124%, Calcium 40mg 3%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 789mg 17%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/50870/bbq-teriyaki-pork-kabobs/

============================================================

RECIPE 778: Air Fryer Roasted Pineapple
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Everyday Cooking/Vegan/Side Dishes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 fresh pineapple

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the air fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Line the air fryer basket with parchment paper
3. Core pineapple using a pineapple corer or slicer and slice into rings
4. Place pineapple rings into the prepared basket
5. Air fry until slices start to roast, 8 to 10 minutes
6. Flip slices over and air fry an additional 3 to 5 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 7mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 89g 33%, Dietary Fiber 10g 34%, Total Sugars 67g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 326mg 1,629%, Calcium 89mg 7%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 743mg 16%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/278331/air-fryer-roasted-pineapple/

============================================================

RECIPE 779: Green Papaya Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cloves garlic
• peeled
• 3 Thai green chiles
• 6 green beans
• cut into 1 inch pieces
• 1 large unripe papaya
• peeled and cut into thin strips
• 1 tomato
• halved and seeded
• 2 tablespoons fish sauce
• 2 tablespoons lime juice
• 1 teaspoon palm sugar
• 2 tablespoons finely chopped unsalted
• dry-roasted peanuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine garlic, chiles, and green beans into a mortar and pound roughly
2. Add the papaya and pound again, to bruise the ingredients
3. Stir in fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar and pound again
4. Ad the tomato and pound to combine
5. Stir in the chopped peanuts and serve
6. If you don't have a mortar and pestle, you can make a version of this in your blender or food processor: coarsely chop the garlic, chile peppers, and green beans
7. Mix in the papaya, and pulse a few times
8. Mix in the tomato, fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar
9. Pulse to combine; salad should still have texture
10. Transfer to a serving dish and stir in the peanuts

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 368mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 7g 3%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 32mg 161%, Calcium 20mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 201mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/38507/green-papaya-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 780: Mango Papaya Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Salsa Recipes/Avocado Salsa Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 mango - peeled
• seeded and diced
• 1 papaya - peeled
• seeded and diced
• 1 large red bell pepper
• seeded and diced
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and diced
• ½ sweet onion
• peeled and diced
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
• 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
• salt and pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a medium bowl, mix mango, papaya, red bell pepper, avocado, sweet onion, cilantro, and balsamic vinegar
2. Season with salt and pepper
3. Cover, and chill in the refrigerator at least 30 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 49mg 245%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 274mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/37067/mango-papaya-salsa/

RECIPE 781: Fruit Batido
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Smoothie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk
• 1 cup chopped papaya
• ¼ cup white sugar
• or more to taste
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon
• 1 tray ice cubes

DIRECTIONS:
1. Blend milk, papaya, sugar, vanilla extract, and cinnamon together in a blender until smooth; add ice and blend until slushy

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 783: Grilled Macadamia-Crusted Tuna with Papaya Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 tuna steaks
Prep Time: 45 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Seafood/Fish/Tuna/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups diced papaya
• ½ red onion
• diced
• 1 red bell pepper
• diced
• ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• 2 tablespoons lime juice
• 1 clove garlic
• minced
• ¼ teaspoon hot chile paste
• or to taste
• 4 (6 ounce) tuna steaks
• ¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil
• salt and pepper to taste
• 3 eggs
• ½ cup chopped macadamia nuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine the papaya, onion, and red pepper in a bowl
2. Add the cilantro, lime juice, garlic, and hot chile paste
3. Toss to combine, then refrigerate until ready to serve
4. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil grate
5. Brush the tuna steaks with olive oil, then season with salt and pepper
6. Whisk the eggs in a shallow bowl until smooth
7. Dip the tuna steaks in the egg, and allow excess egg to run off
8. Press into the macadamia nuts
9. Cook the tuna steaks on the preheated grill to your desired degree of doneness, about 2 minutes per side for medium
10. Serve with the papaya salsa

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 32g 42%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 219mg 73%, Sodium 124mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 45g, Vitamin C 87mg 436%, Calcium 110mg 8%, Iron 4mg 21%, Potassium 1096mg 23%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/166163/grilled-macadamia-crusted-tuna-with-papaya-salsa/

============================================================

RECIPE 784: Papaya Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 large ripe papayas
• 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 2 tablespoons poppy seeds
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 ¼ cups white sugar
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 2 large eggs
• ½ cup buttermilk
• ½ cup guava juice
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan
3. Slice papayas in half lengthwise
4. Scoop out black seeds and discard
5. Peel and discard skin
6. Place flesh in a bowl and mash
7. Transfer to a strainer and allow to sit for 10 minutes to drain any liquid
8. Combine flour, poppy seeds, baking soda, and salt in a bowl
9. Cream sugar and butter together in a separate bowl
10. Mix in eggs, one at a time, until well blended
11. Mix in papaya flesh, buttermilk, guava juice, and vanilla
12. Slowly stir in dry ingredients until just moistened
13. Pour into the prepared loaf pan
14. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 1 hour 15 minutes
15. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then release loaf from the pan onto a wire rack
16. Let cool completely, about 30 minutes, before slicing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 15%, Saturated Fat 6g 32%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 389mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 27mg 136%, Calcium 62mg 5%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 190mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/284879/papaya-bread/

============================================================

RECIPE 785: Papaya Bruschetta
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Bruschetta Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 small papaya
• 5 medium Roma (plum) tomatoes
• diced
• ½ medium red onion
• diced
• 1 medium red bell pepper
• seeded and diced
• ¼ cup chopped fresh basil leaves
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• ¼ cup red wine vinegar
• ¼ cup vegetable oil
• ½ teaspoon mustard powder
• 2 stalks green onions
• chopped
• 1 (16 inch) French baguette
• cut into 1/2 inch pieces

DIRECTIONS:
1. Cut papaya in half and remove seeds
2. Reserve 2 tablespoons of seeds for the dressing
3. Peel and dice the papaya, and place in a medium bowl
4. Add tomatoes, red onion, red pepper and basil, and set aside
5. In a food processor or blender, combine the papaya seeds, sugar, wine vinegar, oil, mustard and green onions
6. Process until smooth and thick, and most of the seeds have broken up
7. Pour over the papaya mixture and stir to coat all of the ingredients
8. Serve with slices of baguette

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Sodium 373mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 38mg 189%, Calcium 42mg 3%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 280mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/68839/papaya-bruschetta/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------

Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins

• peeled papaya
• 1 cup orange juice
• ¼ cup lime juice
• ¼ cup white sugar
• or to taste
• 1 teaspoon grated orange zest
• 4 cups water

RECIPE 788: Green Papaya Salad (Som Tam Malakor)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/Thai/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup peanuts
• 2 Thai chiles
• chopped
• 3 cloves garlic
• 1 tablespoon dried shrimp
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• 2 medium limes
• juiced
• 2 tablespoons fish sauce
• 1 medium papaya - peeled
• seeded
• and sliced
• 1 cup cherry tomatoes
• halved
• ¼ cup fresh green beans
• cut into 1-inch pieces
• ½ medium carrot
• peeled and shredded
• salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Place peanuts on a baking sheet
3. Toast in the preheated oven until fragrant and browned, 7 to 8 minutes
4. Let cool for 5 minutes
5. Grind roasted peanuts, Thai chilies, garlic, dried shrimp, and sugar in a mortar and pestle or food processor
6. Stir in lime juice and fish sauce to make dressing
7. Toss papaya, tomatoes, green beans, and carrot with dressing
8. Season with salt and pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 1126mg 49%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 14%, Dietary Fiber 7g 26%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 197mg 985%, Calcium 89mg 7%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 855mg 18%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/283411/green-papaya-salad-som-tam-malakor/

============================================================

RECIPE 789: Papaya Boats
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup fat-free plain yogurt
• ¼ cup walnuts
• ¼ cup raisins
• 1 cup chopped fresh strawberries
• 2 medium papayas
• cut in half lengthwise and seeded
• 2 tablespoons honey

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a bowl, mix the yogurt, walnuts, and raisins
2. Fold in the strawberries
3. Spoon the mixture into the centers of the papaya halves
4. Drizzle with honey to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Cholesterol 1mg 0%, Sodium 52mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 73mg 366%, Calcium 160mg 12%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 537mg 11%

RECIPE 790: Mango Papaya Fruit Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup freshly squeezed lime juice
• ¼ cup honey
• 1 tablespoon finely grated lime zest
• 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• 2 mangos
• peeled and diced
• or to taste
• 1 large papaya
• peeled and diced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk lime juice, honey, lime zest, balsamic vinegar, and brown sugar together in a small bowl
2. Place mangos and papaya in a large bowl
3. Stir lime dressing again and pour over fruit
4. Lightly stir fruit and dressing, cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 3mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 29mg 146%, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 142mg 3%

RECIPE 791: Mexican Green Papaya Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 3.3/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• or to taste
• 3 cloves garlic
• minced
• or more to taste
• 2 limes
• juiced
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• 1 pinch chili powder
• or more to taste (Optional)
• salt to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Blend cilantro, garlic, lime juice, olive oil, brown sugar, chili powder, and salt in a blender until smooth
2. Toss shredded papaya, black beans, corn, and red bell pepper together in a large mixing bowl; add dressing and toss to coat
3. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Sodium 314mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 27g 10%, Dietary Fiber 8g 28%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 39mg 197%, Calcium 50mg 4%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 433mg 9%

RECIPE 792: Papaya-Stuffed Chicken and Basmati Rice
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 skinless
• boneless chicken breast halves
• 1 papaya
• peeled
• seeded and sliced
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon
• or to taste
• ⅓ cup melted margarine
• 1 cup crushed buttery round crackers (such as Ritz®)
• 1 tablespoon margarine
• 1 cup basmati rice
• 1 ½ cups water
• 1 tablespoon margarine
• 1 cup orange juice
• 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple in its own juice
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 pinch cayenne pepper
• 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil
3. Lay a chicken breast flat onto your work surface
4. Use the tip of a sharp boning or paring knife to cut a pocket in the chicken breast through a 2 inch slit in the side
5. Repeat with the remaining chicken breasts
6. Place the slices into the pocket of each chicken breasts, then sprinkle papaya slices with cinnamon to taste
7. Dip the chicken breast halves one at a time into the melted margarine, then the cracker crumbs
8. Heat 1 tablespoons of margarine in a skillet over medium-high heat
9. Arrange the chicken breasts in the skillet and cook until golden brown on each side, about 10 minutes
10. Place browned chicken breasts on the prepared baking sheet
11. Bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, then flip each chicken breast
12. Continue baking until the chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes more
13. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
14. Bring the rice and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat
15. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes
16. Meanwhile, melt the remaining 1 tablespoon of margarine in the same skillet used to brown the chicken over medium-high heat, scraping up any browned bits
17. Stir in the orange juice, pineapple, brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon, nutmeg, cayenne, salt and pepper
18. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until reduced, about 30 minutes
19. Reduce the heat once more to low and continue simmering until the sauce is thickened
20. Serve the chicken breasts over the rice with the pineapple sauce spooned on top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 40g 51%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 814mg 35%, Total Carbohydrate 96g 35%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 32g, Vitamin C 61mg 306%, Calcium 107mg 8%, Iron 5mg 29%, Potassium 560mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/213549/papaya-stuffed-chicken-and-basmati-rice/

============================================================

RECIPE 793: Georgie's Mango Papaya Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 large mango - peeled
• seeded and halved
• 1 medium papaya - peeled
• seeded and halved
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and diced
• 3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
• 1 tablespoon butter
• ¼ cup blanched slivered almonds
• 1 teaspoon brown sugar
• 1 head romaine lettuce
• torn into bite-size pieces
• salt to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place half of the mango and half of the papaya into the container of a food processor or blender along with balsamic vinegar
2. Puree until smooth, and set aside
3. Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat
4. Add almonds, and cook stirring constantly until lightly browned
5. Add brown sugar, and stir to coat
6. Remove from heat, and pour candied almonds onto a piece of waxed paper, separating any clumps
7. Set aside to cool
8. Just before serving, place romaine lettuce in a large serving bowl
9. Cube remaining mango and papaya halves, and toss gently with avocado and lettuce
10. Drizzle the pureed fruit over the salad and lightly salt
11. Sprinkle with candied almonds, and serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 25mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 16g 6%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 43mg 215%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 459mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/57832/georgies-mango-papaya-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 794: Thai-Inspired Confetti Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 Roma tomato
• chopped
• 1 ½ cups fresh green beans
• cut into 1/2 inch pieces
• 1 cucumber
• cut into 1/2 inch cubes
• 1 ½ cups cubed papaya
• 2 cloves cloves garlic
• minced
• 1 fresh Thai or Serrano chile
• finely minced
• 1 lemon
• juiced
• 2 limes
• juiced
• 2 tablespoons fish sauce
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• ½ cup roasted peanuts
• chopped
• ¼ cup cilantro leaves
• chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine tomato, beans, cucumber, and papaya in a large bowl
2. Toss with garlic and chile pepper
3. Stir together lemon juice, lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar in a small bowl
4. Pour over papaya mixture and toss
5. Sprinkle peanuts and cilantro on top and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Sodium 704mg 31%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 7g 23%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 101mg 505%, Calcium 77mg 6%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 532mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/141790/thai-inspired-confetti-salad/

RECIPE 795: Baby Back Ribs with Papaya Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs
Rating: 3.3/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Pork/Pork Rib Recipes/Spare Ribs/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 clove garlic
• minced
• 1 cup papaya - peeled
• seeded and cubed
• ½ cup water
• ½ cup white wine
• ½ cup honey
• ¼ cup tomato paste
• 4 pounds pork spareribs

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the garlic, papaya, water, wine, honey, and tomato paste into a food processor
2. Pulse until until the mixture is finely chopped, about 15 seconds
3. Place the ribs into a 9x13-inch glass baking dish and pour the marinade overtop
4. Mix the ribs around in the marinade to ensure they are evenly coated
5. Cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, or overnight for best results
6. Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
7. Remove ribs from the marinade, and shake off excess
8. Scrape the marinade into a small saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat
9. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for 10 minutes; set aside
10. Bake the ribs in the preheated oven until the meat pulls away easily from the bone, about 1 1/2 hours
11. Baste every 15 minutes with the reserved marinade

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 60g 77%, Saturated Fat 22g 111%, Cholesterol 240mg 80%, Sodium 319mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 39g, Protein 59g, Vitamin C 26mg 129%, Calcium 115mg 9%, Iron 5mg 25%, Potassium 938mg 20%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/169923/baby-back-ribs-with-papaya-sauce/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------

• 1 cup vanilla yogurt
• 2 tablespoons cream cheese

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place papaya, milk, sugar, condensed milk, yogurt, cream cheese, and ice in a blender

3. Serve immediately

RECIPE 797: Watermelon Fish Snack for Kids
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 1
Yield: 1 serving
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 5 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Everyday Cooking/Vegan/Desserts/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 small slice (0.5 oz) triangular slice of watermelon
• 5 fresh blueberries
• 1 small triangular slice of papaya

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place watermelon triangle on a plate with the pointed side facing to the left
2. Place 1 blueberry into the triangle for the fish eye
3. Place the other 4 blueberries above the fish's mouth as if they are bubbles coming up
4. Cut off a tiny curved sliver of papaya for the mouth
5. Flip the papaya triangle over and place at the end of the fish as the tail fin

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 16g 6%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 91mg 457%, Calcium 36mg 3%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 394mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/271094/watermelon-fish-snack-for-kids/

RECIPE 798: Cobb Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Salads/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 slices bacon
• 3 eggs
• 1 head iceberg lettuce
• shredded
• 3 cups chopped
• cooked chicken meat
• 2 tomatoes
• seeded and chopped
• ¾ cup blue cheese
• crumbled
• 3 green onions
• chopped
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and diced
• 1 (8 ounce) bottle Ranch-style salad dressing

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place eggs in a saucepan and cover completely with cold water; bring to a boil, then cover and remove from heat
2. Let eggs sit for 10 to 12 minutes, then cool, peel and chop
3. While the eggs are cooking, place bacon in a large, deep skillet
4. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown, 7 to 10 minutes
5. Drain, crumble, and set aside
6. Divide shredded lettuce among individual plates
7. Top with rows of bacon, eggs, chicken, tomatoes, blue cheese, green onions, and avocado
8. Drizzle with dressing. dotdash meredith food studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 40g 51%, Saturated Fat 10g 50%, Cholesterol 179mg 60%, Sodium 915mg 40%, Total Carbohydrate 10g 4%, Dietary Fiber 4g 15%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 32g, Vitamin C 13mg 63%, Calcium 153mg 12%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 720mg 15%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/14415/cobb-salad/
