RECIPE 799: Avocado Breakfast Sandwich
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 1
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 6 mins
Total Time: 16 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Sandwich Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 2 large eggs
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 1 tablespoon butter
• softened
• 2 slices Italian bread
• 1 ounce Swiss cheese
• sliced
• 1 ounce Cheddar cheese
• sliced
• ½ ripe avocado
• sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat
2. Crack eggs into skillet; cook for 1 to 2 minutes
3. Flip and cook egg until done, 2 to 5 minutes more
4. Transfer eggs to a plate and season with salt and pepper
5. Spread butter onto 1 side of each bread slice
6. Heat a skillet over medium heat
7. Lay bread slices in the hot skillet, butter-side down
8. Quickly layer Swiss cheese, 1 fried egg, Cheddar cheese, 1 fried egg, avocado, and remaining bread slice, butter-side up
9. Carefully flip sandwich to grill other side until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes
10. Remove sandwich from skillet and cut in half
11. Buckwheat Queen

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 44g 56%, Saturated Fat 21g 103%, Cholesterol 86mg 29%, Sodium 546mg 24%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Protein 18g, Calcium 463mg 36%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 97mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/258099/avocado-breakfast-sandwich/

RECIPE 800: Seven-Layer Dip
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 64
Yield: 1 9x13-inch dish
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Cheese Dips and Spreads Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 avocados - peeled
• pitted and diced
• ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• ¼ cup salsa
• 1 ½ tablespoons fresh lime juice
• ¼ teaspoon garlic salt
• ground black pepper to taste
• 1 (8 ounce) container sour cream
• 1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix
• 1 (16 ounce) can refried beans
• 4 roma (plum) tomatoes
• diced
• 1 bunch green onions
• finely chopped
• 2 cups shredded Mexican-style cheese blend
• 1 (2.25 ounce) can black olives - drained and finely chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mash avocados in a medium bowl to desired consistency
2. Mix in cilantro, salsa, lime juice, garlic salt, and pepper
3. Blend sour cream and taco seasoning in a small bowl until combined
4. Spread refried beans in a 9x13-inch dish or on a large serving platter
5. Top with sour cream mixture; cover with guacamole
6. Top with tomatoes, green onions, Mexican-style cheese blend, and black olives
7. Allrecipes Magazine

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 92mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 3g 1%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 0g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 2mg 12%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 78mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/23176/seven-layer-dip-ii/

RECIPE 802: Homemade Sushi
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 4 cut rolls
Prep Time: 40 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Spicy/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ⅓ cups water
• ⅔ cup uncooked short-grain white rice
• 3 tablespoons rice vinegar
• 3 tablespoons white sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons salt
• 4 sheets nori seaweed sheets
• ½ pound imitation crabmeat
• flaked
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted
• and sliced
• ½ cucumber
• peeled
• cut into small strips
• 2 tablespoons pickled ginger

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
2. Bring water to a boil in a medium pot; stir in rice
3. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes
4. Mix rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl
5. Gently stir into cooked rice in the pot and set aside
6. Lay nori sheets on a baking sheet
7. Heat nori in the preheated oven until warm, 1 to 2 minutes
8. Center 1 nori sheet on a bamboo sushi mat
9. Use wet hands to spread a thin layer of rice on top
10. Arrange 1/4 of the crabmeat, avocado, cucumber, and pickled ginger over rice in a line down the center
11. Lift one end of the mat and roll it tightly over filling to make a complete roll
12. Repeat with remaining ingredients
13. Use a wet, sharp knife to cut each roll into 4 to 6 slices

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Cholesterol 6mg 2%, Sodium 703mg 31%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 9%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 186mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/24228/sushi-roll/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------

Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5

INGREDIENTS:

• chopped
• 1 green bell pepper
• chopped
• 1 large ripe tomato
• chopped
• ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• ½ lime
• juiced
• salt and pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine avocados, onion, bell pepper, tomato, cilantro, and lime juice in a large bowl
2. Gently toss until evenly coated
3. Season with salt and pepper

RECIPE 804: Chocolate Avocado Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/Chocolate Pudding Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 large avocados - peeled
• pitted
• and cubed
• ½ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
• ½ cup brown sugar
• ⅓ cup coconut milk
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Blend avocados, cocoa powder, brown sugar, coconut milk, vanilla, and cinnamon in a blender until smooth
2. Transfer pudding to a container with a lid, then refrigerate until chilled, about 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 34%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Sodium 23mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 46g 17%, Dietary Fiber 13g 48%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 14mg 72%, Calcium 60mg 5%, Iron 3mg 17%, Potassium 935mg 20%

RECIPE 805: Traditional Mexican Guacamole
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Guacamole Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 avocados
• peeled and pitted
• 1 cup chopped tomatoes
• ¼ cup chopped onion
• ¼ cup chopped cilantro
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• 1 jalapeno pepper
• seeded and minced (Optional)
• salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mash avocados in a bowl until creamy
2. Mix tomatoes, onion, cilantro, lemon juice, and jalapeño pepper into mashed avocado until well combined
3. Season with salt and pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Sodium 50mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 8g 27%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 22mg 112%, Calcium 22mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 641mg 14%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/221286/traditional-mexican-guacamole/

RECIPE 806: Mexican Chicken Soup
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Soup Recipes/Tortilla Soup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ pounds skinless
• boneless chicken breast halves
• 2 tablespoons taco seasoning mix
• divided
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• ½ cup chopped onions
• ½ cup chopped celery
• 2 teaspoons ground cumin
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
• 3 (14 ounce) cans chicken broth
• 1 cup water
• 1 cup diced tomatoes
• 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Lay chicken breasts evenly onto a baking sheet
3. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon taco seasoning mix
4. Bake chicken in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 30 to 35 minutes
5. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
6. Allow to cool enough to handle, then shred or cut into strips
7. While chicken is cooking, warm oil in a stockpot over medium-high heat
8. Cook and stir onions and celery in hot oil until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes
9. Stir in chicken broth and water; bring to a boil
10. Add remaining 1 tablespoon taco seasoning mix, cumin, and black pepper
11. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until flavors blend, about 30 minutes
12. Add chicken, tomatoes, and cilantro; simmer for 5 minutes
13. Serve soup hot topped with cheese, tortilla chips, and avocado

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 21%, Saturated Fat 6g 28%, Cholesterol 80mg 27%, Sodium 1368mg 59%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 29g, Vitamin C 10mg 49%, Calcium 175mg 13%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 565mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/23245/mexican-chicken-soup/

============================================================

RECIPE 807: Roquefort Pear Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup pecans
• ¼ cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make the pecans: Combine pecans and sugar in a skillet over medium heat
2. Cook, stirring gently, until sugar has melted and pecans are caramelized, 5 to 7 minutes
3. Carefully transfer nuts onto a sheet of waxed paper to cool
4. While the nuts are cooling, make the dressing: Whisk oil, vinegar, sugar, mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper together in a bowl
5. Make the salad: Layer lettuce, pears, Roquefort cheese, avocado, and green onions in a large serving bowl
6. Pour dressing over top
7. Break cooled pecans into pieces and sprinkle over salad

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 32g 41%, Saturated Fat 8g 38%, Cholesterol 21mg 7%, Sodium 654mg 28%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 7g 26%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 18mg 91%, Calcium 203mg 16%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 478mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/34613/roquefort-pear-salad/

RECIPE 809: Paleo Baked Eggs in Avocado
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Eggs/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 small eggs
• 1 avocado
• halved and pitted
• 2 teaspoons chopped fresh chives
• or to taste
• 1 pinch dried parsley
• or to taste
• 1 pinch sea salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 2 slices cooked bacon
• crumbled

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Crack eggs into a bowl, being careful to keep the yolks intact
3. Arrange avocado halves in a baking dish, resting them along the edge so avocado won't tip over
4. Gently spoon 1 egg yolk into the avocado hole
5. Continue spooning egg white into the hole until full
6. Repeat with remaining egg yolk, egg white, and avocado
7. Season each filled avocado with chives, parsley, sea salt, and pepper
8. Gently place baking dish in the preheated oven and bake until eggs are cooked, about 15 minutes
9. Sprinkle bacon over avocado

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 30%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 151mg 50%, Sodium 498mg 22%, Total Carbohydrate 9g 3%, Dietary Fiber 7g 25%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 11g, Vitamin C 11mg 56%, Calcium 41mg 3%, Iron 4mg 21%, Potassium 628mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/240744/paleo-baked-eggs-in-avocado/

============================================================

RECIPE 810: Cucumber and Avocado Sushi
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 24 rolls
Prep Time: 35 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ cups water
• 1 cup uncooked glutinous white rice (sushi rice)
• 3 tablespoons rice vinegar
• 1 pinch salt
• 4 sheets nori (dry seaweed)
• ½ medium cucumber
• sliced into thin strips
• 1 medium avocado - peeled
• pitted and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine water and rice in a saucepan and bring to a boil
2. Cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer until rice is tender and water has been absorbed, about 20 minutes
3. Remove from the heat, stir in vinegar and salt, and set aside to cool for at least 5 minutes
4. Cover a bamboo sushi mat with plastic wrap to keep rice from sticking
5. Place one nori sheet over the plastic
6. Spread rice evenly onto nori sheet, leaving about a 1/2 inch uncovered at the bottom
7. Arrange cucumber and avocado across the center of the rice
8. Lift the mat, roll over vegetables once, and press down
9. Unroll, then roll again towards the uncovered end of the nori to make a long roll
10. Seal roll with a little water if necessary
11. Repeat to make remaining rolls
12. Use a sharp, wet knife to slice each roll into 6 pieces

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Sodium 6mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 10%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 5mg 23%, Calcium 11mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 217mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/99204/cucumber-and-avocado-sushi/

============================================================

RECIPE 811: Honduran Baleadas
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 2 mins
Total Time: 47 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Sandwich Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 cup water
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 1 egg
• ½ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix flour, water, vegetable oil, egg, and salt in a large bowl; knead until dough is smooth and no longer sticky
2. Form the dough into 8 golf ball-sized balls
3. Cover and let rest, about 20 minutes
4. Stretch each ball of dough into a thick tortilla
5. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
6. Cook each tortilla until browned and lightly puffed, about 1 minute per side
7. Layer refried beans, avocado, and queso fresco over tortillas
8. Drizzle crema on top; fold tortillas in half over filling

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 30%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 44mg 15%, Sodium 369mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 6g 21%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 6mg 32%, Calcium 78mg 6%, Iron 3mg 16%, Potassium 352mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/255917/honduran-baleadas/

RECIPE 812: Mexican Shrimp Cocktail
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Seafood/Shrimp/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds cooked shrimp
• peeled and deveined
• ½ cup finely chopped red onion
• ¼ cup fresh cilantro
• chopped
• 1 tablespoon crushed garlic
• 1 ½ cups tomato and clam juice cocktail
• ¼ cup ketchup
• ¼ cup fresh lime juice
• ¼ cup prepared horseradish
• 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce
• or to taste
• salt to taste
• 1 ripe avocado - peeled
• pitted and chopped

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place shrimp in a large bowl
2. Stir in red onion, cilantro, and garlic
3. Add tomato and clam juice, ketchup, lime juice, horseradish, and hot pepper sauce; mix well to combine
4. Season with salt
5. Gently stir in avocado
6. Cover, and refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 295mg 98%, Sodium 711mg 31%, Total Carbohydrate 16g 6%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 33g, Vitamin C 19mg 94%, Calcium 84mg 6%, Iron 5mg 28%, Potassium 604mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/87778/mexican-shrimp-cocktail/

RECIPE 814: Avocado Tomatillo Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------

Yield: 1 -1/4 cup
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Salsa Recipes/Salsa Verde Recipes/

• and halved
• 1 tablespoon thinly sliced serrano chiles
• or to taste
• 1 large ripe avocado - halved
• seeded
• and flesh scooped out of peel
• ¼ cup packed cilantro leaves
• ½ lime
• juiced
• salt to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place tomatillos into a food processor

3. Season with salt to taste

5. Transfer to a serving bowl

RECIPE 817: Black Bean Avocado Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Salsa Recipes/Corn Salsa Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (15 ounce) can black beans (such as Bush's®)
• rinsed and drained
• 1 (11 ounce) can whole kernel sweet corn
• drained
• 4 roma (plum) tomatoes
• seeded and chopped
• 1 small red bell pepper
• diced
• 1 jalapeno pepper
• seeded and minced
• ⅓ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• ¼ cup diced red onion
• ¼ cup fresh lime juice
• 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
• 1 teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon ground black pepper
• 2 avocados
• diced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix black beans, corn, tomatoes, red bell pepper, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, red onion, lime juice, vinegar, salt, and black pepper in a bowl; fold avocado into the mixture
2. Cover bowl with plastic wrap, putting it right on top of salsa; chill at least 2 hours

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Sodium 493mg 21%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 7g 25%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 21mg 106%, Calcium 28mg 2%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 471mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229020/black-bean-avocado-salsa/

RECIPE 818: Spinach Salad with Chicken, Avocado, and Goat Cheese
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Spinach Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup pine nuts
• 8 cups chopped spinach
• 1 cup halved cherry tomatoes
• 1 ½ cups chopped cooked chicken
• 1 large avocado - peeled
• pitted
• and sliced
• ½ cup corn kernels
• ⅓ cup crumbled goat cheese

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat a small skillet over medium-high heat
2. Toast pine nuts in hot skillet until lightly browned and fragrant, 3 to 5 minutes
3. Put spinach into a large salad bowl; top with pine nuts, tomatoes, chicken, avocado, corn kernels, and goat cheese
4. Beat white wine vinegar, olive oil, and Dijon mustard together in a small bowl until smooth; season with salt and pepper
5. Drizzle dressing over the salad and toss lightly to coat

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 32g 41%, Saturated Fat 8g 41%, Cholesterol 54mg 18%, Sodium 355mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 8g 30%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 26g, Vitamin C 46mg 228%, Calcium 176mg 14%, Iron 5mg 28%, Potassium 1229mg 26%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/240327/spinach-salad-with-chicken-avocado-and-goat-cheese/

RECIPE 819: Best Guacamole
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 2 cups
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Guacamole Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 avocados
• ½ lemon
• juiced
• 2 tablespoons chopped onion
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 2 tablespoons olive oil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Cut the avocados into halves
2. Remove the seeds, and scoop out the pulp into a small bowl
3. Use a fork to mash the avocado
4. Stir in lemon juice, onion, salt, and olive oil
5. Cover the bowl, and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 820: Avocado Quick Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 2 - 9x5 inch loaves
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ⅔ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ¾ teaspoon salt
• ¾ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¾ teaspoon ground allspice
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• 1 ⅞ cups white sugar
• 3 eggs
• 1 ½ cups mashed ripe avocado
• ¾ cup buttermilk
• ¾ cup chopped pecans
• ½ cup raisins
• 1 tablespoon grated orange zest

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour two 9x5 inch loaf pans
3. Sift together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon and allspice
4. In a medium bowl, cream together the sugar and butter until light and fluffy
5. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then mix in the mashed avocado
6. Stir in the dry ingredients alternately with the buttermilk until just mixed
7. Fold in the chopped pecans, raisins and orange zest
8. Divide the batter evenly between the two loaf pans
9. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean
10. Allow loaves to cool in pan for at least 20 minutes before removing

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 255mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 2mg 12%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 177mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/27341/avocado-quick-bread/

============================================================

RECIPE 821: Chicken Stuffed Baked Avocados
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 avocado halves
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 8 mins
Total Time: 18 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/Cheesy Chicken/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 avocados
• halved and pitted
• 2 cooked chicken breasts
• shredded
• 4 ounces cream cheese
• softened
• ¼ cup chopped tomatoes
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
• 1 pinch cayenne pepper
• ½ cup shredded Parmesan cheese
• or more to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Scoop out some of the flesh in the center of each avocado; place into mixing bowl
3. Add chicken, cream cheese, tomatoes, salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper; mix well to combine
4. Scoop spoonfuls of chicken mixture into the wells of each avocado; top each with generous amount of Parmesan cheese
5. Place avocado halves, face-up, in muffin cups to stabilize
6. Bake avocados in preheated oven until cheese is melted, 8 to 10 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 61mg 20%, Sodium 233mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 9g 3%, Dietary Fiber 7g 24%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 20g, Vitamin C 11mg 54%, Calcium 87mg 7%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 623mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/245863/chicken-stuffed-baked-avocados/

RECIPE 822: Mexican Pizza I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 pizzas
Prep Time: 17 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Beans and Peas/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (16 ounce) can refried beans
• 1 pound ground beef
• 1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• 4 (6 inch) corn tortillas
• 8 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese
• 8 tablespoons sour cream
• 2 roma (plum) tomatoes
• chopped
• 2 green onion
• chopped
• 1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles
• drained
• ½ avocado
• diced
• 1 tablespoon black olives
• sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat the refried beans
2. In a large skillet, brown the ground beef
3. Stir in the seasoning packet
4. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
5. Place a small amount of vegetable oil in a large skillet
6. Let the oil heat, then place one corn tortilla in the skillet
7. After 15 seconds, flip the tortilla over and let it fry another 15 seconds
8. Repeat this process with the remaining tortillas, letting them drain on paper towels once they have been heated
9. When the tortillas have drained, arrange them on a cookie sheet
10. Spread a thin layer of beans on the tortillas, followed by a layer of beef, and cheese
11. Bake the tortillas in the preheated oven for 20 to 30 minutes
12. Slice the tortillas into wedges and arrange them on plates or a serving platter and garnish them with the sour cream, tomatoes, green onions, chiles, avocado, and olives

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 48g 62%, Saturated Fat 23g 114%, Cholesterol 150mg 50%, Sodium 1542mg 67%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 10g 37%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 42g, Vitamin C 24mg 122%, Calcium 534mg 41%, Iron 5mg 29%, Potassium 866mg 18%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17368/mexican-pizza-i/

============================================================

RECIPE 823: Carne Asada Tacos
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Taco Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ pounds boneless beef top sirloin
• cut into thin bite-size slices
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
• crushed red pepper to taste
• 1 lime
• 1 (28 ounce) can tomatillos
• 2 fresh jalapeno peppers
• seeded
• 4 tablespoons canola oil
• divided
• 1 (10.5 ounce) can beef broth
• 12 (6 inch) corn tortillas
• ½ large onion
• chopped
• 2 tomatoes
• chopped
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and sliced
• 1 bunch fresh cilantro
• chopped
• 1 lemon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place sliced meat into a shallow bowl, and season with salt, black pepper, and crushed red pepper
2. Squeeze the lime juice over the meat, and turn until evenly coated
3. Cover, and refrigerate for 30 minutes
4. In a blender or food processor, combine tomatillo and jalapeno
5. Puree for 15 to 20 seconds, or until thick
6. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium high heat
7. Carefully pour in tomatillo mixture
8. Cook, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes
9. Stir in beef broth
10. Reduce heat, and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, or until mixture coats a spoon
11. Transfer mixture to a serving dish
12. Heat tablespoon oil in a large skillet over high heat
13. Stir in 1/3 of the beef, and saute for 1 minute
14. Transfer to serving dish
15. Repeat with remaining beef
16. Meanwhile, heat tortillas in the oven or microwave, according to package instructions
17. To serve, place two tortillas on top of each other
18. Add desired amount of meat, spoon over some tomatillo mixture
19. Top with onions, tomatoes, avocado and cilantro
20. Garnish with a wedge of lemon, to be squeezed over taco before eating

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 29%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 69mg 23%, Sodium 873mg 38%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 15%, Dietary Fiber 13g 46%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 30g, Vitamin C 32mg 161%, Calcium 128mg 10%, Iron 5mg 29%, Potassium 1128mg 24%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/37336/carne-asada-tacos/

============================================================

RECIPE 824: Smoked Salmon Sushi Roll
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 rolls
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 5 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Seafood/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups Japanese sushi rice
• 6 tablespoons rice wine vinegar
• 6 sheets nori (dry seaweed)
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and sliced
• 1 cucumber
• peeled and sliced
• 8 ounces smoked salmon
• cut into long strips
• 2 tablespoons wasabi paste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Soak rice for 4 hours
2. Drain rice and cook in a rice cooker with 2 cups of water
3. Rice must be slightly dry as vinegar will be added later
4. Immediately after rice is cooked, mix in 6 tablespoons rice vinegar to the hot rice
5. Spread rice on a plate until completely cool
6. Place 1 sheet of seaweed on bamboo mat, press a thin layer of cool rice on the seaweed
7. Leave at least 1/2 inch top and bottom edge of the seaweed uncovered
8. This is for easier sealing later
9. Dot some wasabi on the rice
10. Arrange cucumber, avocado and smoked salmon to the rice
11. Position them about 1 inch away from the bottom edge of the seaweed
12. Slightly wet the top edge of the seaweed
13. Roll from bottom to the top edge with the help of the bamboo mat tightly
14. Cut roll into 8 equal pieces and serve
15. Repeat for other rolls

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 9mg 3%, Sodium 405mg 18%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 0g, Protein 11g, Vitamin C 5mg 27%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 323mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/19511/smoked-salmon-sushi-roll/

============================================================

RECIPE 825: Avocado Deviled Eggs
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Deviled Eggs/Bacon Deviled Egg Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 hard-boiled eggs
• peeled and halved
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted
• and diced
• 3 slices cooked turkey bacon
• chopped
• divided
• 2 ½ tablespoons mayonnaise
• 2 teaspoons lime juice
• 1 clove garlic
• crushed
• ⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper
• sea salt to taste
• 1 jalapeno pepper
• sliced (Optional)
• 1 dash hot sauce
• or to taste (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Scoop egg yolks into a bowl; add avocado, 2/3 of chopped turkey bacon, mayonnaise, lime juice, garlic, cayenne pepper, and salt
2. Mash egg yolk mixture until filling is evenly combined
3. Spoon filling into a piping bag or plastic bag with a snipped corner
4. Pipe filling into each egg white; top with a turkey bacon piece, jalapeno slice, and dash hot sauce

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 113mg 38%, Sodium 162mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 2g 1%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 18mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 133mg 3%

RECIPE 826: Mexican Chicken and Rice Soup (Sopa de Pollo y Arroz)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Soup Recipes/Chicken Soup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ quarts chicken stock
• 2 pounds skin-on
• bone-in whole chicken legs (drumsticks and thighs)
• 3 carrots
• chopped
• 1 white onion
• chopped
• 2 stalks celery
• chopped
• ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• 1 clove garlic
• 1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 3 cups cooked rice
• 1 avocado
• peeled and chopped
• 2 serrano peppers
• minced
• 2 limes
• quartered

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring stock to a boil in a large pot over high heat
2. Add chicken legs; return to a boil
3. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes, skimming away foam that forms on the surface
4. Add carrots, onion, celery, cilantro, garlic, and mint
5. Cover pot and cook until chicken is no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 30 minutes more
6. Remove chicken from the pot; discard skin and bones
7. Shred meat using 2 forks
8. Return chicken meat to the pot and season with salt and pepper
9. Let chicken and rice warm up, about 5 minutes
10. Remove from heat and pour soup into serving bowls
11. Top with avocado and serrano peppers and squeeze in lime juice

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 4g 18%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 957mg 42%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 10%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 22g, Vitamin C 12mg 59%, Calcium 49mg 4%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 450mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/262306/mexican-chicken-and-rice-soup-sopa-de-pollo-y-arroz/

============================================================

RECIPE 827: Easy Arugula Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Arugula Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups young arugula leaves
• rinsed and dried
• 1 cup cherry tomatoes
• halved
• ¼ cup pine nuts
• 2 tablespoons grapeseed oil or olive oil
• 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
• salt to taste
• freshly ground black pepper to taste
• ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese
• 1 large avocado - peeled
• pitted and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large plastic bowl with a lid, combine arugula, cherry tomatoes, pine nuts, oil, vinegar, and Parmesan cheese
2. Season with salt and pepper to taste
3. Cover, and shake to mix
4. Divide salad onto plates, and top with slices of avocado

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 30%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 381mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 10g 4%, Dietary Fiber 6g 21%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 17mg 87%, Calcium 101mg 8%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 560mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/71600/easy-arugula-salad/

RECIPE 828: California Roll Sushi
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 rolls
Prep Time: 45 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup uncooked short-grain white rice
• 1 cup water
• ¼ cup rice vinegar
• 1 tablespoon white sugar
• ½ cup imitation crabmeat
• finely chopped
• ¼ cup mayonnaise
• 8 sheets nori (dry seaweed)
• 2 ½ tablespoons sesame seeds
• 1 cucumber
• cut into thin spears
• 2 avocados - pitted
• peeled
• and sliced the long way

DIRECTIONS:
1. Wash the rice in several changes of water until the rinse water is no longer cloudy, drain well, and place in a covered pan or rice cooker with 1 cup water
2. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, and cover the pan
3. Allow the rice to simmer until the top looks dry, about 15 minutes
4. Turn off the heat, and let stand for 10 minutes to absorb the rest of the water
5. Mix the rice vinegar and sugar in a small bowl until the sugar has dissolved, and stir the mixture into the cooked rice until well combined
6. Allow the rice to cool, and set aside
7. Mix the imitation crabmeat with mayonnaise in a bowl, and set aside
8. To roll the sushi, cover a bamboo rolling mat with plastic wrap
9. Lay a sheet of nori, shiny side down, on the plastic wrap
10. With wet fingers, firmly pat a thin, even layer of prepared rice over the nori, leaving 1/4 inch uncovered at the bottom edge of the sheet
11. Sprinkle the rice with about 1/2 teaspoon of sesame seeds, and gently press them into the rice
12. Carefully flip the nori sheet over so the seaweed side is up
13. Place 2 or 3 long cucumber spears, 2 or 3 slices of avocado, and about 1 tablespoon of imitation crab mixture in a line across the nori sheet, about 1/4 from the uncovered edge
14. Pick up the edge of the bamboo rolling sheet, fold the bottom edge of the sheet up, enclosing the filling, and tightly roll the sushi into a cylinder about 1 1/2 inch in diameter
15. Once the sushi is rolled, wrap it in the mat and gently squeeze to compact it tightly
16. Cut each roll into 1 inch pieces with a very sharp knife dipped in water

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 135mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 4g 16%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 7mg 34%, Calcium 43mg 3%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 327mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/189477/california-roll-sushi/

============================================================

RECIPE 829: Avocado Shrimp Ceviche-Estillo Sarita
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Seafood/Ceviche Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds large shrimp - peeled
• deveined and chopped
• ¾ cup fresh lime juice
• 5 roma (plum) tomatoes
• diced
• 1 white onion
• chopped
• ½ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
• 1 tablespoon ketchup
• 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce
• salt and pepper to taste
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and diced
• 16 saltine crackers

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the shrimp and lime juice into a large bowl, and stir to coat
2. Let stand for about 5 minutes, or until shrimp are opaque
3. The lime juice will cook them
4. Mix in the tomatoes, onion, and cilantro until coated with lime juice; cover and refrigerate for 1 hour
5. Remove from the refrigerator, and mix in the Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, hot sauce, salt and pepper
6. We have our own hot sauce recipe, but you can use whatever hot sauce you like, or leave it out and let people add their own when serving
7. Serve in glass tumblers and top with avocado pieces
8. Set out extra Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, lime wedges and hot sauce for people to individualize their dish
9. Serve with saltine crackers

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 346mg 115%, Sodium 691mg 30%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 6g 20%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 41g, Vitamin C 38mg 191%, Calcium 113mg 9%, Iron 7mg 39%, Potassium 943mg 20%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/90396/avocado-shrimp-ceviche-estillo-sarita/

============================================================

RECIPE 830: Avocado Toast (Vegan)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 toasts
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Everyday Cooking/Vegan/Breakfast and Brunch/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 slices whole-grain bread
• 1 avocado
• halved and pitted
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
• 1 ½ teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil
• ½ lemon
• juiced
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon ground black pepper
• ½ teaspoon onion powder
• ½ teaspoon garlic powder

DIRECTIONS:
1. Toast bread in a toaster or toaster oven
2. Scoop avocado into a bowl
3. Add parsley, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper, onion powder, and garlic powder; mash together using a potato masher
4. Spread avocado mixture into each piece of toast

RECIPE 831: Quesadillas I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 5
Yield: 5 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 (6 inch) corn tortillas
• 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
• 1 (2 ounce) can sliced black olives
• 2 avocados - peeled
• pitted and sliced
• 2 teaspoons hot pepper sauce

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat a large frying pan or griddle over a medium heat
2. Place one tortilla flat on the frying pan
3. After 1 minute flip the tortilla over
4. Sprinkle a little more than 1/4 cup cheese on the tortilla, followed by some olives, avocado, and hot pepper sauce
5. Place another tortilla on top to make a sandwich
6. Cover the quesadilla with a lid
7. After one minute, flip the quesadilla
8. When the cheese has melted on the inside, remove the quesadilla
9. Repeat with remaining ingredients
10. Cut the quesadillas into triangles and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 31%, Saturated Fat 8g 40%, Cholesterol 35mg 12%, Sodium 457mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 9g 32%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 15g, Vitamin C 10mg 48%, Calcium 288mg 22%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 524mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/14847/quesadillas-i/

RECIPE 832: Avocado Toast with Egg
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Sandwich Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon butter
• 2 eggs
• 2 slices multigrain bread
• 1 ripe avocado
• pitted
• peeled
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• or to taste
• 1 pinch cayenne pepper
• sea salt to taste
• ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a skillet over medium-low heat
2. Crack eggs into the skillet side by side and cook until eggs are white on the bottom layer and firm enough to flip, 2 to 3 minutes
3. Flip eggs, trying not to crack the yolk, and cook until egg reaches desired doneness, 2 to 5 minutes more
4. Meanwhile, toast bread slices to desired doneness, 3 to 5 minutes
5. Mash avocado in a bowl; stir in lemon juice, cayenne pepper, and sea salt
6. Spread avocado mixture onto toast
7. Top with fried egg and season with sea salt and pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 29%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 191mg 64%, Sodium 361mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 21g 8%, Dietary Fiber 9g 31%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 12g, Vitamin C 12mg 58%, Calcium 69mg 5%, Iron 4mg 23%, Potassium 628mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/265304/avocado-toast-with-egg/

RECIPE 833: Kale, Quinoa, and Avocado Salad with Lemon Dijon Vinaigrette
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 1 large salad
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Salad Dressing Recipes/Vinaigrette Dressing Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅔ cup quinoa
• 1 ⅓ cups water
• 1 bunch kale
• torn into bite-sized pieces
• ½ avocado - peeled
• pitted
• and diced
• ½ cup chopped cucumber
• ⅓ cup chopped red bell pepper
• 2 tablespoons chopped red onion
• 1 tablespoon crumbled feta cheese

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring the quinoa and 1 1/3 cup water to a boil in a saucepan
2. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the quinoa is tender, and the water has been absorbed, about 15 to 20 minutes
3. Set aside to cool
4. Place kale in a steamer basket over 1 inch of boiling water in a saucepan
5. Cover saucepan with a lid and steam kale until hot, about 45 seconds; transfer to a large plate
6. Top kale with quinoa, avocado, cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, and feta cheese
7. Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, sea salt, and black pepper together in a bowl until the oil emulsifies into the dressing; pour over the salad
8. Grace Magyar

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 3g 16%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 552mg 24%, Total Carbohydrate 35g 13%, Dietary Fiber 6g 23%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 157mg 786%, Calcium 188mg 14%, Iron 8mg 42%, Potassium 856mg 18%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/230050/kale-quinoa-and-avocado-salad-with-lemon-dijon-vinaigrette/

============================================================

RECIPE 834: Awesome Turkey Sandwich
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 1
Yield: 1 sandwich
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Turkey/Turkey Breast/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 slices whole wheat bread
• toasted (Optional)
• 1 tablespoon mayonnaise
• 2 teaspoons Dijon-style prepared mustard
• 3 slices smoked turkey breast
• 2 tablespoons guacamole
• ½ cup mixed salad greens
• ¼ cup bean sprouts
• ¼ avocado - peeled
• pitted and sliced
• 3 ounces Colby-Monterey Jack cheese
• sliced
• 2 slices tomato

DIRECTIONS:
1. Spread mayonnaise on one slice of toast, then spread mustard on the other
2. Arrange the sliced turkey on one side
3. Spread guacamole over the turkey
4. Pile on the salad greens, bean sprouts, avocado and cheese
5. Finish with tomato slices, then place the remaining slice of toast on top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 57g 73%, Saturated Fat 25g 124%, Cholesterol 124mg 41%, Sodium 1988mg 86%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 9g 31%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 38g, Vitamin C 22mg 111%, Calcium 94mg 7%, Iron 4mg 21%, Potassium 928mg 20%

RECIPE 835: Grilled Avocados
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 3.9/5
Category: /BBQ & Grilling/Side Dishes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup olive oil
• or as needed
• 1 pinch ground chipotle pepper
• or more to taste
• 1 pinch chili powder
• or more to taste
• 4 avocados
• halved and pitted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate
2. Whisk olive oil, ground chipotle pepper, and chili powder together in a bowl; brush over the entire surface of the cut-side of each avocado
3. Grill avocados, cut-side down, on the preheated grill until grill-lines begin to form on the avocado flesh, about 5 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 22g 28%, Saturated Fat 3g 16%, Sodium 8mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 9g 3%, Dietary Fiber 7g 24%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 10mg 51%, Calcium 13mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 490mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/238173/grilled-avocados/

============================================================

RECIPE 836: Taco Salad III
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Taco Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 16 ounces lean ground beef
• 1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix
• 1 head iceberg lettuce
• shredded
• 1 red onion
• sliced
• 1 bunch green onions
• chopped
• 1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans
• drained
• 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans
• drained
• 2 large tomatoes
• chopped
• 1 avocados - peeled
• pitted
• and cubed
• 8 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese
• 1 (16 ounce) package corn chips
• 1 (16 ounce) bottle Catalina salad dressing

DIRECTIONS:
1. Prepare the ground beef as directed by taco seasoning package and set aside
2. In a large bowl, combine the beef mixture, lettuce, red onion, green onion, pinto beans, kidney beans, tomatoes, avocado and cheese
3. Before serving, add the corn chips and enough dressing to coat
4. Mix well and serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 837: Vegetarian Tortilla Soup
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Soup Recipes/Vegetable Soup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
• 1 (1 pound) package frozen pepper and onion stir fry mix
• 2 cloves garlic
• minced
• 3 tablespoons ground cumin
• 1 (28 ounce) can crushed tomatoes
• 3 (4 ounce) cans chopped green chile peppers
• drained
• 4 (14 ounce) cans vegetable broth
• salt and pepper to taste
• 1 (11 ounce) can whole kernel corn
• 12 ounces tortilla chips
• 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and diced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat
2. Stir in the pepper and onion stir fry mix, garlic, and cumin, and cook 5 minutes, until vegetables are tender
3. Mix in the tomatoes and chile peppers
4. Pour in the broth, and season with salt and pepper
5. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer 30 minutes
6. Mix corn into the soup, and continue cooking 5 minutes
7. Serve in bowls over equal amounts of tortilla chips
8. Top with cheese and avocado

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 21%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 12mg 4%, Sodium 1152mg 50%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 14%, Dietary Fiber 6g 21%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 27mg 136%, Calcium 186mg 14%, Iron 3mg 18%, Potassium 461mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/80743/vegetarian-tortilla-soup/

============================================================

RECIPE 838: Easy Keto Beef Tacos
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 18 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese
• 1 pound ground beef
• ½ package taco seasoning mix
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
• 1 avocado
• diced
• 1 cup shredded lettuce
• ½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese
• ½ cup tomatoes
• diced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone mat
3. Spread Cheddar cheese into four 6-inch circles, placed 2 inches apart
4. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese melts and is lightly brown, 6 to 8 minutes
5. Cool for 2 to 3 minutes before lifting with a spatula
6. Place over wooden spoon handle wrapped in aluminum foil balanced over 2 cups/cans
7. Let taco shells cool completely, about 10 minutes
8. Cook beef in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned, stirring often to separate meat, about 7 minutes
9. Season with taco seasoning, salt, and pepper; cook for 1 minute more
10. Divide beef mixture among cheese taco shells
11. Top with avocado, lettuce, Cheddar cheese, and tomatoes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 53g 67%, Saturated Fat 26g 128%, Cholesterol 157mg 52%, Sodium 1197mg 52%, Total Carbohydrate 10g 4%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 41g, Vitamin C 8mg 42%, Calcium 619mg 48%, Iron 3mg 16%, Potassium 634mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/261032/easy-keto-beef-tacos/

============================================================

RECIPE 839: Turkey Avocado Panini
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 sandwiches
Prep Time: 17 mins
Cook Time: 8 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/Italian/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ ripe avocado
• ¼ cup mayonnaise
• 2 ciabatta rolls
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• divided
• 2 slices provolone cheese
• 1 cup whole fresh spinach leaves
• divided
• ¼ pound thinly sliced mesquite smoked turkey breast
• 2 roasted red peppers
• sliced into strips

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mash the avocado and the mayonnaise together in a bowl until thoroughly mixed
2. Preheat a panini sandwich press
3. To make the sandwiches, split the ciabatta rolls in half the flat way, and brush the bottom of each roll with olive oil
4. Place the bottoms of the rolls onto the panini press, olive oil side down
5. Place a provolone cheese slice, half the spinach leaves, half the sliced turkey breast, and a sliced roasted red pepper on each sandwich
6. Spread half of the avocado mixture on the cut surface of each top, and place the top of the roll on the sandwich
7. Brush the top of the roll with olive oil
8. Close the panini press and cook until the bun is toasted and crisp, with golden brown grill marks, and the cheese has melted, about 5 to 8 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 51g 66%, Saturated Fat 13g 63%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 1720mg 75%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 6g 21%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 25g, Vitamin C 59mg 297%, Calcium 328mg 25%, Iron 4mg 23%, Potassium 623mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/201117/turkey-avocado-panini/

============================================================

RECIPE 840: Corn and Avocado Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 cups
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Salsa Recipes/Corn Salsa Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ears fresh corn
• husks and silks removed
• 2 avocados - peeled
• pitted
• and cubed
• 1 red onion
• finely diced
• 1 red bell pepper
• seeded and diced
• 1 tablespoon minced garlic
• 1 tablespoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
• ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• ⅓ cup red wine vinegar
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• ¼ cup fresh lime juice
• salt and black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the corn in a large pot with enough water to cover, and bring to a boil
2. Cook until kernels are tender but crisp, about 5 minutes
3. Drain, and cool in cold water
4. Use a knife to scrape kernels from the cobs
5. Place kernels in a medium bowl
6. Stir in avocados, red onion, bell pepper, and garlic
7. Add cumin, red pepper flakes, and cilantro
8. Mix in vinegar, olive oil, and lime juice
9. Season with salt and pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 29%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Sodium 65mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 11%, Dietary Fiber 10g 36%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 62mg 308%, Calcium 46mg 4%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 856mg 18%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/74692/corn-and-avocado-salsa/

============================================================

RECIPE 841: Harvest Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Spinach Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• 1 bunch spinach
• rinsed and torn into bite-size pieces
• ½ cup dried cranberries
• ½ cup crumbled blue cheese
• 2 tomatoes
• chopped
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and diced
• ½ red onion
• thinly sliced
• 2 tablespoons red raspberry jam (with seeds)
• 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
• ⅓ cup walnut oil
• freshly ground black pepper to taste
• salt to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Arrange walnuts in a single layer on a baking sheet
3. Toast in oven for 5 minutes, or until nuts begin to brown
4. In a large bowl, toss together the spinach, walnuts, cranberries, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado, and red onion
5. In a small bowl, whisk together jam, vinegar, walnut oil, pepper, and salt
6. Pour over the salad just before serving, and toss to coat

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 27g 35%, Saturated Fat 5g 23%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 207mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 5g 19%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 25mg 127%, Calcium 136mg 10%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 670mg 14%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/23783/harvest-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 842: Warm Shrimp Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 3
Yield: 2 to 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Salad/Seafood Salad Recipes/Shrimp Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pound medium shrimp - peeled and deveined
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 2 lemons
• juiced
• 2 heads butter lettuce
• 2 tomatoes
• chopped
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and diced
• 2 stalks celery
• chopped
• 1 cucumber
• cleaned and chopped
• ½ cup shredded carrots
• ⅓ cup vinaigrette salad dressing

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large saute pan melt butter over medium heat
2. Add the shrimp and lemon juice, cook until shrimp just turn pink
3. Remove from heat and drain
4. In a large bowl tear lettuce into bite-size pieces, add the tomatoes, avocado, celery, cucumber carrots and cooked shrimp, toss to combine
5. Top with your favorite dressing or vinaigrette

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 33%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 250mg 83%, Sodium 566mg 25%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 11%, Dietary Fiber 12g 43%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 37g, Vitamin C 90mg 449%, Calcium 218mg 17%, Iron 7mg 37%, Potassium 1474mg 31%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/14189/warm-shrimp-salad/

RECIPE 843: Avocado Soup with Chicken and Lime
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Soup Recipes/Vegetable Soup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 (6 inch) corn tortillas
• julienned
• 1 ½ tablespoons olive oil
• 1 white onion
• sliced thinly
• 8 cloves garlic
• thinly sliced
• 4 fresh jalapeno peppers
• sliced
• 8 ounces skinless
• boneless chicken breast halves - cut into thin strips
• 1 quart chicken broth
• ¼ cup fresh lime juice
• 1 tomato
• seeded and diced
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and diced
• ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Arrange tortilla strips on a baking sheet
3. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 3 to 5 minutes
4. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat
5. Cook onion, garlic, and jalapenos in oil until lightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes
6. Stir in chicken, chicken broth, lime juice, tomato, salt and pepper
7. Gently simmer until chicken is no longer pink, about 10 minutes
8. Stir in avocado and cilantro and heat through, 3 to 5 minutes
9. Adjust seasonings to taste
10. Ladle soup into bowls and sprinkle with tortilla strips to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 20%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 37mg 12%, Sodium 1048mg 46%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 7g 23%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 17g, Vitamin C 24mg 122%, Calcium 59mg 5%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 590mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/20809/avocado-soup-with-chicken-and-lime/

============================================================

RECIPE 844: Meyer Lemon Avocado Toast
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 3 mins
Total Time: 13 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Sandwich Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 slices whole grain bread
• ½ avocado
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
• or more to taste
• 1 teaspoon Meyer lemon juice
• or to taste
• ¼ teaspoon Meyer lemon zest
• 1 pinch cayenne pepper
• 1 pinch fine sea salt
• ¼ teaspoon chia seeds

DIRECTIONS:
1. Toast bread slices to desired doneness, 3 to 5 minutes
2. Mash avocado in a bowl; stir in cilantro, Meyer lemon juice, Meyer lemon zest, cayenne pepper, and sea salt
3. Spread avocado mixture onto toast and top with chia seeds

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 271mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 31mg 2%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 82mg 2%

RECIPE 845: Mexican Baked Fish
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ pounds cod
• 1 cup salsa
• 1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
• ½ cup coarsely crushed corn chips
• 1 avocado - peeled
• pitted and sliced
• ¼ cup sour cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease one 8x12 inch baking dish
3. Rinse fish fillets under cold water, and pat dry with paper towels
4. Lay fillets side by side in the prepared baking dish
5. Pour the salsa over the top, and sprinkle evenly with the shredded cheese
6. Top with the crushed corn chips
7. Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until fish is opaque and flakes with a fork
8. Serve topped with sliced avocado and sour cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 7g 36%, Cholesterol 69mg 23%, Sodium 529mg 23%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 28g, Vitamin C 7mg 34%, Calcium 213mg 16%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 717mg 15%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12745/mexican-baked-fish/

RECIPE 846: Easy Never Forgotten Guacamole
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 2 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Guacamole Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 avocados - peeled
• pitted and diced
• 1 tablespoon sour cream
• 2 (3 ounce) packages cream cheese
• softened
• 2 tablespoons salsa
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 dash ground black pepper
• 1 dash garlic salt
• 1 dash onion powder

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a small bowl, mix together the avocados, sour cream, cream cheese and salsa
2. Blend to desired consistency
3. In a small bowl mix the salt, pepper, garlic salt and onion powder
4. Stir into the avocado mixture
5. Cover and chill in the refrigerator 1/2 hour before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Cholesterol 12mg 4%, Sodium 67mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 4g 1%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 0g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 204mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/22972/easy-never-forgotten-guacamole/

RECIPE 847: Avocado Dressing
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 1/2 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Salad Dressing Recipes/Yogurt Dressing Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 avocado
• peeled and pitted
• ½ cup plain yogurt
• ¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil
• 3 tablespoons lemon juice
• 2 cloves garlic
• 1 teaspoon sea salt
• ¼ teaspoon hot pepper sauce
• ⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Blend avocado, yogurt, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, sea salt, hot sauce, and black pepper together in a blender until smooth

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 848: Avocado Egg Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Egg Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 hard-boiled eggs
• peeled
• 2 avocados - peeled
• pitted
• and cubed
• ½ cup minced red onion
• 3 tablespoons chopped sweet pickles
• 1 tablespoon prepared yellow mustard
• ⅓ cup mayonnaise
• salt and pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mash the eggs with a fork in a mixing bowl to break up
2. Add the avocado, onion, pickle, mustard, and mayonnaise
3. Gently smash the ingredients together until blended
4. Season to taste with salt and pepper

RECIPE 849: Absolutely Amazing Ahi
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Seafood/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ pound sashimi grade tuna steak
• diced
• ½ cup diced cucumber
• 1 avocados - peeled
• pitted and diced
• ¼ cup chopped green onion
• 1 ½ teaspoons red pepper flakes
• 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds
• 1 ½ teaspoons lemon juice
• 2 teaspoons sesame oil
• ½ cup soy sauce

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a medium bowl, combine the tuna, cucumber, avocado, green onion, red pepper flakes and sesame seeds
2. Pour in the lemon juice, sesame oil and soy sauce, and stir carefully to blend so as not to mash the avocado
3. Place this bowl into a larger bowl that has been filled with ice
4. Chill in the refrigerator for 15 minutes, but no longer - the terrific freshness of the fish will be lost
5. Once chilled, remove the bowl from the ice, and invert onto a serving plate
6. Serve with toasted bread or your favorite crackers

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 26mg 9%, Sodium 1227mg 53%, Total Carbohydrate 6g 2%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 16g, Vitamin C 6mg 31%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 513mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/33247/absolutely-amazing-ahi/

============================================================

RECIPE 850: Quick and Easy Guacamole
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Guacamole Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 avocados - peeled
• pitted
• and diced
• 2 green onions
• chopped
• 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro
• 1 teaspoon seasoned salt
• 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
• 1 teaspoon garlic
• minced
• ½ lime
• juiced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine avocado, green onion, cilantro, seasoned salt, black pepper, garlic, and lime juice in a bowl; mash with a spoon or potato masher until mostly smooth with small chunks

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Sodium 238mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 10g 4%, Dietary Fiber 7g 25%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 14mg 68%, Calcium 27mg 2%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 532mg 11%

RECIPE 851: Mexican Botana Platter
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 40 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Mexican/Main Dishes/Fajita Recipes/Chicken/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds beef skirt steak
• 2 pounds boneless chicken thighs
• 2 teaspoons fajita seasoning
• 2 ½ teaspoons garlic powder
• divided
• 2 cups refried beans
• salt to taste
• lemon pepper to taste
• 4 avocados - peeled
• pitted
• and mashed
• 1 cup corn oil
• 24 corn tortillas
• 1 medium green bell pepper
• chopped
• 1 medium onion
• chopped
• ⅓ bunch cilantro
• chopped
• 1 (16 ounce) package shredded American cheese
• 12 ounces sour cream
• 2 large tomatoes
• chopped
• 4 pickled jalapeno peppers
• sliced (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Rub beef and chicken with fajita seasoning and 2 teaspoons garlic powder
3. Cut beef and chicken into 1-inch strips, and set aside
4. In a saucepan, warm refried beans over medium-low heat
5. Stir salt, lemon pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder into mashed avocados
6. Heat corn oil in a deep skillet over medium-high heat
7. Cut tortillas in half, then cut in half again to make 4 triangular pieces per tortilla
8. Place into the skillet as many tortilla pieces as will fit without overlapping, and fry until crisp; repeat this process until all the tortilla pieces have been fried
9. Remove crisp tortillas to paper towels
10. Discard oil, and wipe out skillet
11. Return skillet to medium heat, and stir in beef, chicken, bell pepper, and onion
12. Cook, stirring occasionally, about 7 minutes; then stir in cilantro
13. Layer the tortilla pieces along the bottom of a large baking dish
14. Spread refried beans evenly over tortilla pieces
15. Sprinkle cheese over beans, then spread meat mixture evenly on top
16. Bake in preheated oven until cheese and beans are bubbly, about 20 minutes
17. Remove from oven, and drop sour cream and guacamole by tablespoonfuls in various places across the top
18. Sprinkle tomatoes and jalapenos on top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 40g 51%, Saturated Fat 16g 80%, Cholesterol 120mg 40%, Sodium 958mg 42%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 11g 39%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 40g, Vitamin C 23mg 116%, Calcium 326mg 25%, Iron 3mg 19%, Potassium 1008mg 21%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/86322/mexican-botana-platter/

============================================================

RECIPE 852: Salsa Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Vegetable Salad Recipes/Tomato Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 large ripe tomatoes
• cut into bite-size pieces
• 1 bunch cilantro
• stems cut off and leaves coarsely chopped
• 1 large green bell pepper
• cut into bite-size pieces
• 1 large red bell pepper
• cut into bite-size pieces
• 2 jalapeno peppers
• finely chopped
• 3 green onions
• chopped
• ½ sweet red onion
• chopped
• 2 large avocados
• pitted and cut into bite-sized pieces
• 1 lime
• juiced
• ½ teaspoon salt
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large salad bowl, lightly mix the tomatoes, cilantro, green and red bell peppers, jalapeno peppers, green onions, and sweet red onion until thoroughly combined
2. Gently toss with avocado pieces, and squeeze lime juice over the salad
3. Sprinkle with salt to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Sodium 214mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 10g 34%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 90mg 452%, Calcium 43mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 952mg 20%

RECIPE 853: Avocado Dessert
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 avocado
• peeled and pitted
• ½ cup milk
• ¼ cup white sugar
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mash avocado with an electric mixer, or use a food processor
2. Blend in the milk, sugar and vanilla until smooth
3. Chill for about 20 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 854: Black Bean Breakfast Bowl
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Eggs/Scrambled/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 4 eggs
• beaten
• 1 (15 ounce) can black beans
• drained and rinsed
• 1 avocado
• peeled and sliced
• ¼ cup salsa
• salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat olive oil in a small pan over medium heat
2. Cook and stir eggs until eggs are set, 3 to 5 minutes
3. Place black beans in a microwave-safe bowl
4. Heat on High in the microwave until warm, about 1 minute
5. Divide warmed black beans between two bowls
6. Top each bowl with scrambled eggs, avocado, and salsa
7. Season with salt and black pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 39g 50%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 372mg 124%, Sodium 1158mg 50%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 22g 78%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 28g, Vitamin C 16mg 82%, Calcium 148mg 11%, Iron 7mg 37%, Potassium 1372mg 29%

RECIPE 855: Avocado Cream Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Pasta Sauces/Creamy/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 avocados
• 2 cloves garlic
• ½ lime
• juiced
• or to taste
• 2 tablespoons chopped green onions
• 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro
• ½ tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon
• 2 tablespoons butter
• ¼ cup heavy cream
• salt to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine avocados, garlic, lime juice, green onions, cilantro, and tarragon in a food processor; puree until smooth
2. Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat
3. Stir in avocado puree and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 5 minutes
4. Add cream and cook until heated through, but not boiling
5. Season with salt

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 26g 33%, Saturated Fat 9g 46%, Cholesterol 36mg 12%, Sodium 93mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 10g 4%, Dietary Fiber 7g 25%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 12mg 59%, Calcium 30mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 522mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/272445/avocado-cream-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 856: Mean Green Guacamole Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Salsa Recipes/Salsa Verde Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 fresh tomatillos
• husks removed
• 2 fresh jalapeno peppers
• stems removed
• 1 bunch fresh cilantro
• stems trimmed
• 3 avocados
• peeled and pitted
• 1 tablespoon garlic powder
• salt to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring a pot of water to a boil and stir in tomatillos and jalapenos
2. Boil until tomatillos turn bright green and soft, about 10 minutes
3. Place cilantro, avocados, cooked tomatillos, and cooked jalapenos into a blender, working in batches if necessary
4. Blend until smooth, 1 to 2 minutes
5. Add about 1 tablespoon of tomatillo cooking water, or as needed, if salsa is too thick
6. Stop the blender, and season the salsa with garlic powder and salt to taste
7. Blend again briefly to mix in the seasonings
8. Transfer to a bowl for serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Sodium 6mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 7g 2%, Dietary Fiber 4g 15%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 11mg 54%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 357mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/220166/mean-green-guacamole-salsa/

============================================================

RECIPE 857: Apricot Pork Tenderloin
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Pork/Pork Tenderloin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds pork tenderloin
• ¼ cup softened butter
• salt and pepper to taste
• 1 teaspoon ground thyme
• 2 teaspoons garlic powder
• 1 (18 ounce) jar apricot preserves
• 2 tablespoons honey
• or to taste
• ¼ cup dry sherry

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread butter all over the pork tenderloin
3. Season with salt, pepper, and thyme
4. Combine garlic powder, apricot preserves, honey, and sherry in a separate bowl
5. Roast the pork in the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes
6. Remove the pork from the oven and brush with the apricot sauce
7. Return the pork to the oven
8. Continue roasting, basting occasionally with the remaining sauce, until the pork is no longer pink in the center, about 15 minutes
9. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 15%, Saturated Fat 6g 31%, Cholesterol 86mg 29%, Sodium 200mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 63g 23%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 43g, Protein 24g, Vitamin C 8mg 40%, Calcium 31mg 2%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 465mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/201010/apricot-pork-tenderloin/

============================================================

RECIPE 858: Apricot Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 cup butter-flavored shortening
• 6 tablespoons water
• or as needed
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¼ cup all-purpose flour
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• 5 cups fresh apricots
• pitted and quartered
• 1 teaspoon sugar for sprinkling
• or as desired

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Mix 2 1/2 cups of flour and the salt in a bowl; cut the shortening into the flour mixture with a pastry cutter until the mixture is crumbly
3. Using a fork, mix in water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the dough just holds together
4. Divide the dough in half and form each half into a ball
5. Working on a floured work surface, roll each ball out into a crust big enough for a 9-inch pie dish with an inch or so to spare
6. Carefully lift a crust, fold into quarters, position into pie dish, and unfold the crust
7. Set the other crust aside
8. Mix the sugar, 1/4 cup flour, and cinnamon together in a large bowl until thoroughly combined; stir in the lemon juice and apricots
9. Spoon the apricot filling over the pie crust in the dish, and top with the reserved crust
10. Crimp the edges of the crusts together with a fork, cut away the excess crust, and cut slits into the pie to allow steam to escape
11. Cover the edges of the pie crust with strips of aluminum foil to prevent burning
12. Bake on center rack of the preheated oven until the pie is browned and the filling is bubbling and thickened, 35 to 45 minutes
13. Remove to a rack to cool and sprinkle top with 1 teaspoon of sugar

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 28g 35%, Saturated Fat 7g 34%, Sodium 293mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 70g 25%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 11mg 53%, Calcium 21mg 2%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 315mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/214747/apricot-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 859: Apricot Brown Sugar Ham
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 15
Cook Time: 2 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Ham/Whole/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (10 pound) fully-cooked spiral cut ham
• ⅔ cup brown sugar
• ⅓ cup apricot jam
• 1 teaspoon dry mustard powder

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C)
2. Place the ham cut side down onto a sheet of aluminum foil
3. I like to put the shiny side up
4. Mix together the brown sugar, apricot jam, and mustard powder in a small bowl
5. Brush onto the ham using a pastry or barbeque brush
6. Reserve any leftover glaze
7. Enclose the foil around the ham and place on a rimmed baking sheet
8. Roast for 2 hours in the preheated oven, or if your ham is a different size, figure 14 minutes per pound
9. Apply the remaining glaze 20 minutes before the ham is done
10. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 56g 72%, Saturated Fat 20g 101%, Cholesterol 170mg 57%, Sodium 3895mg 169%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 56g, Vitamin C 106mg 532%, Calcium 31mg 2%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 958mg 20%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/102159/apricot-brown-sugar-ham/
