RECIPE 860: Fresh Apricot Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cobblers/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup water
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 6 cups halved fresh apricots
• 1 tablespoon butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Bring water, 3/4 cup sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and nutmeg to a boil; stir until thickened, about 1 minutes
3. Reduce heat to medium and add apricots and 1 tablespoon butter
4. Simmer until heated through, about 5 minutes
5. Transfer mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish
6. Combine flour, 1/4 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl
7. Cut 7 tablespoons butter into flour mixture until mixture resembles a coarse crumb
8. Stir milk into crumbles until topping is just moistened
9. Spoon topping over apricot mixture
10. Sprinkle remaining 2 tablespoons sugar over topping
11. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 30 to 35 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 27%, Cholesterol 23mg 8%, Sodium 385mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 46g 17%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 8mg 39%, Calcium 120mg 9%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 272mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/233090/fresh-apricot-cobbler/

============================================================

RECIPE 861: Apricot-Glazed Pork Chops
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Pork Chop Recipes/Boneless/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅓ cup apricot preserves
• ⅓ cup fruity white wine
• such as Gewurztraminer
• ½ teaspoon ground ginger
• salt and pepper to taste
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 4 boneless pork chops
• 1/2 inch thick

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix the apricot preserves, wine, and ground ginger together in a small bowl; set aside
2. Season the pork chops with salt and pepper
3. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat
4. Add the pork chops and cook until brown on each side, and no longer pink in the center, about 4 minutes per side
5. Remove chops from the skillet
6. Reduce heat to medium low
7. Using the same skillet, pour in the apricot preserves mixture and simmer until thickened, about 4 minutes
8. Return pork chops to the skillet, turning to coat each side in the sauce; cook 1 minute

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 63mg 21%, Sodium 54mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 24g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 426mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/141975/apricot-glazed-pork-chops/

============================================================

RECIPE 862: Dried Apricot Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 144
Yield: 10 cups
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 ½ cups dried apricots
• 4 ½ cups boiling water
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 (1.75 ounce) package powdered fruit pectin
• 7 cups white sugar
• ¼ cup lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Soak apricots in boiling water in a bowl until hydrated, about 30 minutes
2. Blend apricots, remaining water, and vanilla extract in a food processor, working in batches, until blended but still slightly chunky
3. Combine apricot mixture with pectin in a large pot over medium heat; cook until just boiling
4. Add sugar and lemon juice; boil until sugar has dissolved, 1 to 2 minutes
5. Sterilize jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
6. Pack the apricot jam into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4-inch of the top
7. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
8. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
9. Top with lids, and screw on rings
10. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
11. Bring to a boil, then carefully lower the jars into the pot using a holder
12. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
13. Pour in more boiling water if necessary until the water level is at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
14. Bring the water to a full boil, cover the pot, and process for 10 minutes
15. Remove jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool, about 1 hour
16. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
17. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 48mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/223062/dried-apricot-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 863: Slow Cooker Chicken Tagine
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 5 hrs
Total Time: 5 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Thigh Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 skinless
• boneless chicken thighs
• 2 large onions
• thinly sliced
• 4 large carrots
• thinly sliced
• ½ cup raisins
• ½ cup dried apricots
• chopped
• 2 cups chicken broth
• 2 tablespoons tomato paste
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons garlic salt
• 2 teaspoons ground cumin
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground ginger
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon Hungarian paprika
• 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
• 3 cups water
• 2 cups couscous
• 1 tablespoon butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Layer chicken thighs, onions, carrots, raisins, and apricots in a slow cooker
2. Whisk chicken broth, tomato paste, lemon juice, flour, garlic salt, cumin, ginger, cinnamon, paprika, and pepper together in a bowl
3. Pour over chicken and vegetables
4. Cook on High 4 1/2 hours or on Low for 7 1/2 hours
5. Shred chicken slightly using 2 forks
6. Continue cooking 30 minutes
7. Bring 3 cups water to a boil in a saucepan; remove from heat and stir in couscous and butter
8. Cover saucepan and let stand until water is absorbed completely, 5 to 10 minutes
9. Fluff couscous with a fork
10. Serve chicken tagine over couscous

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 12%, Saturated Fat 3g 16%, Cholesterol 73mg 24%, Sodium 590mg 26%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 5g 19%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 27g, Vitamin C 8mg 41%, Calcium 64mg 5%, Iron 3mg 16%, Potassium 622mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/257106/slow-cooker-chicken-tagine/

============================================================

RECIPE 864: Apricot Chutney
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 50
Yield: 3 1/4 cups
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Chutney Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ whole head garlic
• ¼ teaspoon olive oil
• 1 large onion
• chopped
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 3 cups apricot preserves
• 1 cup white vinegar
• 2 teaspoons ground ginger
• ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper
• ½ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
2. Slice the top off the half head of garlic with a sharp knife, exposing the cloves
3. Discard the top
4. Place the head of garlic on a piece of aluminum foil, drizzle with 1/4 teaspoon of olive oil, and wrap the foil around the garlic
5. Roast in the preheated oven until golden brown, 30 to 40 minutes
6. While garlic is roasting, place the onion and 1 tablespoon of olive oil into a saucepan over medium heat and cook and stir until the onion is browned, 10 to 15 minutes
7. Remove from heat
8. Stir in the apricot preserves, vinegar, ginger, cayenne pepper, and salt until thoroughly combined
9. Squeeze the roasted garlic cloves out of their skins, and mash them in a bowl with a spoon
10. Mix the garlic into the chutney; bring to a boil over medium heat
11. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened, about 25 minutes, stirring occasionally
12. Stir carefully because any splashes of chutney will be burning hot
13. Pack the chutney into sterilized jars and process to seal

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 31mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 23mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/214692/apricot-chutney/

============================================================

RECIPE 865: Apricot Cream Cheese Thumbprints
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 84
Yield: 7 dozen
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Thumbprint Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups butter
• softened
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• 2 eggs
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• 1 ½ teaspoons lemon zest
• 4 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• 1 cup apricot preserves
• ⅓ cup confectioners' sugar for decoration

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, sugar, and cream cheese until smooth
2. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the lemon juice and lemon zest
3. Combine the flour and baking powder; stir into the cream cheese mixture until just combined
4. Cover, and chill until firm, about 1 hour
5. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
6. Roll tablespoonfuls of dough into balls, and place them 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets
7. Using your finger, make an indention in the center of each ball, and fill with 1/2 teaspoon of apricot preserves
8. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are golden
9. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely
10. Sprinkle with confectioner's sugar

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 6%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 43mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 10mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 16mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/10201/apricot-cream-cheese-thumbprints/

============================================================

RECIPE 866: Moroccan Beef and Lentil Stew
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Stews/Beef/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
• 2 carrots
• chopped
• 1 celery stalk
• chopped
• 1 onion
• chopped
• 4 cloves garlic
• minced
• 1 ½ pounds chuck roast
• cut into 1-inch cubes
• 1 teaspoon salt
• or to taste
• 1 teaspoon ground turmeric
• 1 teaspoon onion powder
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• ½ teaspoon ground black pepper
• or to taste
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground ginger
• ½ teaspoon ground cumin
• ½ teaspoon ground coriander
• ¼ teaspoon ground allspice
• 3 tablespoons tomato paste
• 4 cups low-sodium beef broth
• 1 tablespoon molasses
• 2 bay leaves
• 1 cup dried red lentils
• ½ cup dried apricots
• chopped
• ½ lemon
• juiced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat
2. Add carrots, celery, and onion; cook until slightly softened, about 3 minutes
3. Stir in garlic and cook for 1 minute
4. Sprinkle salt, turmeric, onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, cinnamon, ginger, cumin, coriander, and allspice over beef and vegetables
5. Stir to mix
6. Continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until beef is browned, about 5 minutes
7. Stir in tomato paste until combined and cook for 1 minute
8. Add beef broth, molasses, and bay leaves
9. Bring stew to a simmer
10. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, until beef is tender, about 50 minutes
11. Mix in lentils and dried apricots
12. Bring stew back to a simmer
13. Cover and cook on low, stirring occasionally, until lentils soften, about 15 minutes
14. Remove and discard bay leaves
15. Adjust salt and pepper; mix in fresh lemon juice just before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 53mg 18%, Sodium 571mg 25%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 8g 28%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 29g, Vitamin C 13mg 67%, Calcium 78mg 6%, Iron 5mg 29%, Potassium 988mg 21%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/278891/moroccan-beef-and-lentil-stew/

============================================================

RECIPE 867: Dried Apricot Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 3.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• 18 ounces dried apricots
• 1 ¾ cups water
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• 1 tablespoon orange liqueur
• 1 ¾ cups white sugar
• 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C)
2. Slice the dried apricots in half
3. Rinse them with water
4. Place them in a sauce pan with the water, bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes
5. Combine the cornstarch with the orange liqueur and about 1 tablespoon of the apricots' cooking liquid
6. Mix until smooth then stir into the cooked apricots
7. Add the white sugar and combine
8. Pour mixture into the unbaked pie shell and seal with the top crust
9. Brush milk over top crust for color, if desired
10. Bake at 400 degrees F (205 degrees C) for 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 20%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Sodium 240mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 105g 38%, Dietary Fiber 6g 23%, Total Sugars 78g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 40mg 3%, Iron 3mg 16%, Potassium 762mg 16%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12524/dried-apricot-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 868: Instant Pot Chicken Tagine with Apricots and Chickpeas
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Cuisine/African/North African/Moroccan/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 4 skin-on
• bone-in chicken thighs
• 1 large onion
• sliced
• 3 cloves garlic
• minced
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon ground turmeric
• 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes
• 1 pinch saffron
• 1 (15 ounce) can diced tomatoes
• 1 cup chicken broth
• ⅓ cup halved dried apricots
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas
• rinsed and drained
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint

DIRECTIONS:
1. Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Saute function
2. Place olive oil in the hot cooker and fry chicken thighs until browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side
3. Remove chicken from the inner pot and set aside
4. Add onion and garlic to the pot, followed by cinnamon, cumin, turmeric, red pepper flakes, and saffron
5. Cook and stir until onion is soft, about 5 minutes
6. Press Cancel to leave Saute mode
7. Place chicken back into the pot on top of onion mixture
8. Pour in tomatoes and chicken broth
9. Sprinkle apricots over the top
10. Season with salt and pepper
11. Close and lock the lid
12. Select high pressure according to the manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 15 minutes
13. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
14. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to the manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes
15. Unlock and remove the lid
16. Stir in chickpeas and mint leaves

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 3g 13%, Cholesterol 48mg 16%, Sodium 517mg 22%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 4g 15%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 17g, Vitamin C 10mg 52%, Calcium 67mg 5%, Iron 4mg 21%, Potassium 439mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/274397/instant-pot-chicken-tagine-with-apricots-and-chickpeas/

============================================================

RECIPE 869: Fruity Couscous Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Salad/Pasta Salad/Fruit Pasta Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ⅓ cups dry couscous
• 2 cups boiling water
• ⅔ cup sweetened dried cranberries
• ⅔ cup slivered almonds
• ½ cup packed dried apricots
• chopped
• 3 medium scallions
• thinly sliced with greens
• 1 teaspoon cumin
• salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place couscous in a bowl and pour boiling water over top
2. Gently stir, then cover and let sit for 5 minutes
3. Meanwhile, place cranberries in a glass liquid measure and add water to cover
4. Microwave on high for 1 minute; drain
5. Add cranberries to the couscous, along with almonds, apricots, scallions, cumin, salt, and pepper
6. Toss well to combine
7. Serve at room temperature or chilled

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Sodium 6mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 41mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 223mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/86338/fruity-couscous-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 870: Moroccan Chicken Tagine
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Cuisine/African/North African/Moroccan/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup ground cinnamon
• ¼ cup ground cumin
• 2 tablespoons ground turmeric
• 2 tablespoons ground coriander
• 2 tablespoons ground ginger
• 2 tablespoons crushed dried mint
• 1 tablespoon salt
• 2 teaspoons ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make the spice mix: Mix cinnamon, cumin, turmeric, coriander, ginger, mint, salt, and pepper together in a bowl
2. Measure out 1/2 cup spice mix and set remaining mix aside for another use
3. Make the tagine: Bring a small pot of water to a boil
4. Add apricots and raisins and cook until soft, about 5 minutes
5. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup cooking water
6. Place chicken and 1/2 cup reserved spice mix into a bowl; toss until thoroughly coated
7. Pour enough olive oil into a large skillet or Dutch oven to coat the bottom; turn heat to medium
8. Cook chicken in the hot skillet until golden brown and it releases easily from the skillet, 3 to 4 minutes per side
9. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes
10. Add apricots, raisins, and reserved 1/2 cup cooking water; stir in chicken broth and honey
11. Cover, reduce the heat to low, and cook until chicken is very tender, 1 1/2 to 2 hours
12. Serve chicken garnished with cilantro and almonds

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 44mg 15%, Sodium 1375mg 60%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 7g 24%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 15g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 148mg 11%, Iron 6mg 35%, Potassium 523mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/257104/moroccan-chicken-tagine/

============================================================

RECIPE 871: Simple Apricot-Glazed Meatloaf
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 1 9x5-inch meatloaf
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Meatloaf Recipes/Beef Meatloaf Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ pounds ground beef
• 1 cup bread crumbs
• 1 small onion
• minced
• 1 large egg
• beaten
• 2 cloves garlic
• minced
• 1 ½ tablespoons apricot preserves
• 1 tablespoon kosher salt
• 1 ½ teaspoons freshly ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Make the meatloaf: Combine ground beef, bread crumbs, onion, egg, garlic, apricot preserves, kosher salt, and pepper in a large mixing bowl; mix well until thoroughly combined
3. Transfer to a 9x5-inch loaf pan
4. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes
5. Meanwhile, make the glaze: Mix ketchup, apricot preserves, brown sugar, hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and cider vinegar together in a medium bowl
6. Remove meatloaf from the oven and pour glaze over top
7. Continue cooking until no longer pink in the center, about 15 minutes longer
8. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)
9. Let rest 5 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 25%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 101mg 34%, Sodium 1782mg 77%, Total Carbohydrate 55g 20%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 34g, Protein 23g, Vitamin C 14mg 70%, Calcium 78mg 6%, Iron 4mg 21%, Potassium 529mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/281342/simple-apricot-glazed-meatloaf/

============================================================

RECIPE 872: Apricot Chicken Curry
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Leg Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 chicken drumsticks
• salt and pepper to taste
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 3 cloves garlic
• minced
• ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes
• or to taste
• 4 cups apricot nectar
• 1 teaspoon cornstarch
• or as needed
• 1 tablespoon water
• 3 tablespoons Madras curry powder
• 1 cup dried apricots
• 1 large onion
• roughly chopped
• 1 large green bell pepper
• roughly chopped
• 4 carrots
• thinly sliced
• 1 fresh green chile pepper
• minced (Optional)
• ½ cup chopped water chestnuts (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Season the chicken drumsticks with salt and pepper
3. Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat
4. Stir in garlic and red pepper flakes; cook and stir until garlic is softened and is fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes
5. Place the drumsticks in the skillet, and brown the chicken on all sides, about 3 minutes on each side
6. Transfer the skillet to the oven
7. Bake the chicken drumsticks in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, 7 to 10 minutes
8. Bring the apricot nectar to a boil in a large pot over medium-high eat, then reduce heat to medium-low
9. Mix cornstarch and water together in a small bowl; stir cornstarch mixture and curry powder into the apricot nectar
10. Add dried apricots
11. Transfer the baked drumsticks into the apricot mixture
12. Heat the skillet used to cook the chicken over medium heat
13. Stir in the onion, green bell pepper, carrots, and green chile pepper; cook and stir until the onion has softened
14. Pour the drumsticks and apricot sauce into the skillet
15. Cover and simmer until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes
16. Season with salt and pepper
17. Stir in water chestnuts just before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 30%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 117mg 39%, Sodium 168mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 75g 27%, Dietary Fiber 9g 33%, Total Sugars 59g, Protein 40g, Vitamin C 70mg 351%, Calcium 114mg 9%, Iron 6mg 33%, Potassium 1393mg 30%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215207/apricot-chicken-curry/

============================================================

RECIPE 873: Apricot Leather
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 6 hrs
Total Time: 6 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice
• 2 cups pitted and diced fresh apricots
• ½ cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 150 degrees F (165 degrees C), or the lowest setting you have
2. Combine lemon juice, apricots, and sugar in a saucepan
3. Cook over medium heat until sugar has dissolved
4. Transfer to a blender and puree until smooth
5. Cover an 11x17-inch pan or cookie sheet with a layer of plastic wrap
6. Pour pureed fruit onto the prepared pan and spread evenly to within 1 inch of the edge
7. Bake for 4 to 6 hours in the preheated oven, using a spoon or a pair of tongs to keep the door slightly ajar, or until puree has dried and is no longer sticky
8. Once dry, you can cut it into strips; store in an airtight container

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 10g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 62mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/62392/apricot-leather/

============================================================

RECIPE 874: Fresh Apricot Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups apricot halves
• ¼ cup white sugar
• ¾ cup brown sugar
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup butter
• ¾ cup rolled oats

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Arrange apricots in a 9x12-inch baking dish and sprinkle with white sugar
3. Mix together brown sugar and flour in a bowl; cut in butter with a pastry cutter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs
4. Lightly stir in rolled oats and spoon mixture over apricots
5. Bake in the preheated oven until fruit is soft and topping is browned and crisp, 35 to 40 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 10g 50%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 116mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 52g 19%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 36g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 10mg 52%, Calcium 40mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 344mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215112/fresh-apricot-crisp/

RECIPE 875: Apricot Lentil Soup
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Soup Recipes/Beans and Peas/Lentil Soup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 onion
• chopped
• 2 cloves garlic
• minced
• ⅓ cup dried apricots
• 1 ½ cups red lentils
• 5 cups chicken stock
• 3 roma (plum) tomatoes - peeled
• seeded and chopped
• ½ teaspoon ground cumin
• ½ teaspoon dried thyme
• salt to taste
• ground black pepper to taste
• 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Saute onion, garlic, and apricots in olive oil
2. Add lentils and stock
3. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes
4. Stir in tomatoes, and season with cumin, thyme, and salt and pepper to taste
5. Simmer for 10 minutes
6. Stir in lemon juice
7. Puree 1/2 of the soup in a blender, then return to the pot

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Sodium 7mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 14%, Dietary Fiber 16g 57%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 13g, Vitamin C 10mg 51%, Calcium 44mg 3%, Iron 4mg 24%, Potassium 657mg 14%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12979/apricot-lentil-soup/

RECIPE 876: Oat-Free and Gluten-Free Granola Bars (Clean Eating)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 20 bars
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 3 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 13 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Snacks/Kids/Healthy/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ cups almonds
• divided
• 1 ¼ cups sunflower seeds
• divided
• 2 cups shredded unsweetened coconut
• 1 cup diced dried apricots
• 1 ½ cups coconut oil
• ½ cup honey
• ¼ cup ground cinnamon
• or as needed
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ½ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place 3/4 cups almonds and 3/4 cups sunflower seeds into a food processor; chop until nuts are in 1/4-inch pieces, 1 to 2 minutes
2. Remove from food processor and pour in a bowl
3. Place the remaining almonds and sunflower seeds into the food processor; roughly chop into larger pieces, about 1 minute
4. Mix remaining nuts, seeds, shredded coconut, and dried apricot into the 1/4-inch nuts until fruit and nut mixture is combined
5. Combine coconut oil, honey, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract, and salt in a sauce pan over medium-low heat; cook until the coconut oil mixture bubbles and turns a lighter color, 3 to 5 minutes
6. Pour coconut oil mixture over the fruit and nut mixture; stir until the granola mixture takes on the consistency of wet sand, about 1 minute
7. Line a baking sheet with waxed paper
8. Pour granola mixture onto the sheet; place a second sheet of waxed paper on top of the granola mixture
9. Push down on the waxed paper with you hands until the granola mixture has been evenly spread
10. Pack tightly to ensure that the granola will not fall apart
11. Cool until granola has hardened, 2 to 3 hours
12. Cut into bars

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 32g 40%, Saturated Fat 20g 101%, Sodium 64mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 49mg 4%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 259mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/254370/oat-free-and-gluten-free-granola-bars-clean-eating/

============================================================

RECIPE 877: Honey Apricot Pork Chops
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Pork Chop Recipes/Pan Fried/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 boneless pork chops
• Kosher salt and fresh cracked pepper to taste
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 2 tablespoons honey
• 4 fresh apricots
• pitted and cut into wedges
• 3 cloves garlic
• minced
• or to taste
• 1 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley

DIRECTIONS:
1. Pat the pork chops dry with paper towels, and sprinkle both sides with salt and black pepper
2. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat, and brown the chops well on both sides, about 5 minutes per side
3. Stir in honey, apricots, and garlic; cover, and simmer until the pork is tender, about 8 minutes
4. An instant-read thermometer, inserted into the center of a chop, should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
5. Sprinkle with parsley, and serve chops topped with the apricots and pan juices

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 36mg 12%, Sodium 122mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 15g, Vitamin C 5mg 24%, Calcium 21mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 314mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/217136/honey-apricot-pork-chops/

RECIPE 878: Apricot Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 4 dozen
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Apricot/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup butter
• 1 cup white sugar
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 egg
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup apricot preserves
• ⅓ cup confectioners' sugar for decoration

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Cream the butter and sugar in a medium size mixing bowl
3. Mix flour, baking powder, salt, egg and vanilla extract into the butter-sugar mixture
4. Cool dough in the refrigerator for 1 hour
5. On a lightly floured surface roll dough out to 1/4 inch thick
6. Cut the dough into rounds with a round cookie cutter or glass
7. Using the tip of a teaspoon place a small drop of apricot preserves into the middle of the circle
8. Brush edges with water and fold the dough over so that the cookie is in the shape of a half moon; seal edges Arrange on ungreased cookie sheets
9. Bake for 8 to 12 minutes, or until golden brown
10. Dust the cookies with powdered sugar while still hot

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 28mg 9%, Sodium 127mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 2g, Calcium 17mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 22mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/11408/apricot-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 879: Apricot Danish Coffee Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 15
Yield: 1 10x15 inch jellyroll pan
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cake Mix Cake Recipes/Coffee Cake/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (18.25 ounce) package white cake mix
• 3 eggs
• 1 ½ cups sour cream
• 1 (15 ounce) can apricot halves
• drained
• 1 tablespoon butter
• ½ cup slivered almonds
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• 2 tablespoons milk
• ⅔ cup confectioners' sugar
• 2 teaspoons water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 10x15 inch jellyroll pan
3. Set aside 1/2 cup of the dry cake mix
4. In a medium bowl, mix together eggs and sour cream
5. Stir in the package of cake mix
6. Batter will be lumpy
7. Spread batter into the prepared pan
8. Using the back of a spoon, make 15 wells in the batter, 3 rows of 5
9. In another bowl, beat together the cream cheese and milk until fluffy
10. Place one tablespoon of the cream cheese mixture into each well
11. Place 1 apricot half, cut side up, onto each blob of cream cheese
12. In a small bowl, combine the 1/2 cup of reserved cake mix with the butter. stir in the butter until the mixture is crumbly
13. Stir in the slivered almonds, and sprinkle the mixture evenly over the Danish
14. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean
15. To make the glaze, stir together the confectioners' sugar and water until smooth, adding another teaspoon of water if necessary
16. Drizzle over the Danish when cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 66mg 22%, Sodium 303mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 121mg 9%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 170mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17478/apricot-danish-coffee-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 880: Apricot Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 muffins
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup chopped dried apricots
• 1 cup boiling water
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ cup melted butter
• ¼ cup vegetable oil
• 1 cup buttermilk
• 1 egg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease a 12 cup muffin pan, or line with paper muffin cups
3. Place apricots into a small bowl, and pour the boiling water over them
4. Let stand for 5 minutes
5. In a medium bowl stir together the flour, sugar, baking soda and salt
6. In a separate bowl, whisk together the melted butter, oil, buttermilk and egg
7. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, and stir until just blended
8. It is okay for the batter to have some lumps
9. Drain water from apricots, and mix them into the batter
10. Spoon into the prepared muffin cups
11. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top springs back when lightly pressed
12. Cool in the pan over a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Cholesterol 27mg 9%, Sodium 258mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 186mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/27294/apricot-muffins/

------------------------------------------------------------

Yield: 6 servings

DIRECTIONS:

3. Mix onion soup mix, Russian dressing and apricot preserves together
4. Pour mixture over chops and bake for 1 hour

RECIPE 883: Apricot Brandy Pound Cake III
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 15
Yield: 1 to 10 - inch tube pan
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Liqueur Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups sifted all-purpose flour
• ¼ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup sour cream
• ½ teaspoon rum flavored extract
• 1 teaspoon orange extract
• ¼ teaspoon almond extract
• ½ teaspoon lemon extract
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ½ cup apricot brandy
• 1 cup butter
• 3 cups white sugar
• 6 eggs

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 10 inch tube pan
3. Mix together the flour, baking soda and salt
4. Combine the sour cream, rum flavoring, orange extract, almond extract, lemon extract, vanilla extract and apricot brandy
5. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy
6. Beat in the eggs one at a time
7. Beat in the flour mixture alternately with the sour cream and flavorings mixture, stirring just until incorporated
8. Pour batter into prepared pan
9. Bake in the preheated oven for 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean
10. Allow to cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 10g 52%, Cholesterol 114mg 38%, Sodium 222mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 60g 22%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 40g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 36mg 3%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 81mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/23732/apricot-brandy-pound-cake-iii/

============================================================

RECIPE 884: Moroccan Lamb Stew with Apricots
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 55 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes/Stews/Lamb/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds boneless leg of lamb
• cut into 1-inch cubes
• 2 teaspoons ground coriander
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon sweet paprika
• ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper
• ½ teaspoon ground cardamom
• ½ teaspoon ground turmeric
• 2 teaspoons kosher salt
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 2 cups finely chopped onion
• 4 cloves garlic
• minced
• 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root
• 2 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks
• 2 cups low-sodium chicken stock
• 1 cup dried apricots
• halved
• 2 (3 inch) orange peel strips
• 1 tablespoon honey
• ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro
• ¼ cup toasted pine nuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine lamb, coriander, cumin, paprika, cayenne, cardamom, turmeric, and salt in a large bowl; toss together until lamb is evenly coated
2. Heat oil in a large Dutch oven or tagine over medium heat
3. Add onions; cook, stirring occasionally until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes
4. Stir in garlic, ginger, and cinnamon; cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1 minute
5. Add seasoned lamb; cook, stirring frequently until light brown, being careful not to caramelize, about 2 minutes
6. Add chicken stock and bring to a gentle boil over medium heat
7. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, until the lamb is just tender, about 1 hour and 15 minutes
8. Stir in apricots, orange peels, and honey; continue to simmer over low heat, uncovered, until the liquid has thickened slightly and lamb is fork-tender, about 30 minutes
9. Remove from the heat, discard cinnamon sticks and orange peels
10. Divide evenly among 4 bowls
11. Garnish each bowl with a tablespoon each of cilantro and pine nuts

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 126mg 42%, Sodium 1130mg 49%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 7g 26%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 45g, Vitamin C 22mg 108%, Calcium 117mg 9%, Iron 6mg 32%, Potassium 1113mg 24%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/282831/moroccan-lamb-stew-with-apricots/

============================================================

RECIPE 885: Apricot Nectar Cake II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 -10 inch Bundt or tube pan
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cake Mix Cake Recipes/Yellow Cake/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (18.25 ounce) package yellow cake mix
• 4 eggs
• ¾ cup vegetable oil
• ¾ cup apricot nectar
• ⅓ cup hot water
• 2 cups confectioners' sugar
• 6 tablespoons lemon juice
• 1 (3 ounce) package lemon flavored Jell-O® mix

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease one 10 inch tube or Bundt pan
3. Mix the cake mix, eggs, vegetable oil, and apricot nectar together
4. Dissolve the gelatin in the hot water and add to cake batter
5. Mix well and pour the batter into the prepared pan
6. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 to 60 minutes
7. Invert cake onto a plate and cool for several minutes
8. Pour glaze over cake while it is still warm
9. To Make Glaze: Combine the confectioner's sugar and the lemon juice
10. Use immediately to pour over still warm cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 3g 16%, Cholesterol 63mg 21%, Sodium 346mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 63g 23%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 47g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 4mg 18%, Calcium 69mg 5%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 85mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7840/apricot-nectar-cake-ii/

============================================================

RECIPE 886: Homemade Apricot Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 56
Yield: 7 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 1 day 20 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ pounds fresh apricots
• pitted and finely chopped
• ⅓ cup lemon juice
• 5 ¾ cups white sugar
• ½ teaspoon butter
• 1 (1.75 ounce) package powdered fruit pectin

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir apricots, lemon juice, and sugar together in a large pot over medium heat; add butter to reduce foaming
2. Bring apricot mixture to a rolling boil, stirring constantly
3. Quickly stir in pectin; return to a full boil until pectin is dissolved, 1 minute
4. Remove from heat and skim off any foam with a metal spoon
5. Sterilize jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes
6. Pack apricot jam into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top
7. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles
8. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue
9. Top with lids, and screw on rings
10. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
11. Bring to a boil, then carefully lower the jars into the pot using a holder
12. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars
13. Pour in more boiling water if necessary until the water level is at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars
14. Bring the water to a full boil, cover the pot, and process for 5 minutes
15. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, for at least 24 hours
16. Press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all)
17. It may take up to 2 weeks for jam to set
18. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Cholesterol 0mg 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 14%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 55mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/223063/homemade-apricot-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 887: Apricot-Glazed Pork Ribs
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Total Time: 9 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Pork/Pork Rib Recipes/Baby Back Ribs/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ½ pounds baby back pork ribs
• 1 (16 ounce) jar apricot preserves
• ⅓ cup soy sauce
• ¼ cup packed light brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons garlic powder
• aluminum foil
• salt and ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place ribs in a large roasting pan
2. Whisk together apricot preserves, soy sauce, brown sugar, and garlic powder until blended
3. Pour apricot marinade over ribs, cover, and place in the refrigerator, 8 hours to overnight
4. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
5. Line a baking pan with aluminum foil
6. Remove ribs from the marinade and shake off excess
7. Place ribs in the prepared baking pan and season with salt and pepper
8. Pour marinade into a small saucepan and bring to a boil
9. Reduce heat and simmer marinade for 5 minutes; set aside
10. Bake ribs in the preheated oven, basting frequently with the cooked marinade, until ribs are tender and meat pulls away easily from the bone, about 1 hour 30 minutes
11. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 6g 32%, Cholesterol 68mg 23%, Sodium 489mg 21%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 11%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 15g, Vitamin C 4mg 18%, Calcium 39mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 238mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/275587/apricot-glazed-pork-ribs/

RECIPE 888: Energy Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 9
Yield: 9 bars
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Snacks/Granola Bar Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 eggs
• 1 large ripe banana
• mashed
• 1 cup quick-cooking rolled oats
• ½ cup unsalted raw sunflower seeds
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ cup nonfat dry milk powder
• ½ cup chopped pitted dates
• ½ cup raisins
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• ½ cup chopped dried apricots
• ½ cup toasted wheat germ
• ⅓ cup pure maple syrup
• ¼ cup whole-wheat pastry flour

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Lightly oil a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. Mix the eggs, banana, oats, sunflower seeds, cinnamon, milk powder, dates, raisins, walnuts, apricots, wheat germ, maple syrup, and whole-wheat pastry flour together in a large bowl until thoroughly combined; spread the mixture evenly into the prepared baking dish
4. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes; set aside to cool
5. Cut into 9 bars and wrap with plastic to store

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 43mg 14%, Sodium 56mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 5g 19%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 11g, Vitamin C 3mg 14%, Calcium 133mg 10%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 599mg 13%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/217069/energy-bars/

RECIPE 889: Apricot Chicken with Balsamic Vinegar
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/Healthy Chicken/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
• 2 pounds chicken breast tenderloins
• cut into bite-size pieces
• salt and pepper to taste
• 1 large onion
• chopped (Optional)
• ¼ cup balsamic vinegar
• or to taste
• 20 dried apricots
• 1 cup chicken stock
• 1 cup apricot preserves
• 1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme
• 3 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet with a lid over medium-high heat
2. Season the chicken with salt and pepper, and cook in the hot oil until golden brown around the edges, but still pink in the center, about 5 minutes
3. Stir in the onion, and cook for about 3 minutes more
4. Pour in the balsamic vinegar, bring it to a simmer, and allow it to reduce for a few minutes
5. Cut half of the apricots in half, leaving the others whole
6. Place the apricots into the skillet, and pour in the chicken stock
7. Bring to a simmer, then stir in the apricot preserves and thyme
8. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the apricots have softened, 10 to 15 minutes
9. Sprinkle with chopped parsley to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 164mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 25g, Vitamin C 8mg 38%, Calcium 44mg 3%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 560mg 12%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/166101/apricot-chicken-with-balsamic-vinegar/

============================================================

RECIPE 890: Apricot Cheesecake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 40 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 8 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 48 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cheesecake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ⅓ cups almond flour
• 3 tablespoons brown sugar
• 2 tablespoons sliced almonds
• chopped
• 2 tablespoons butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line a 9-inch springform pan with parchment paper
3. Combine almond flour, brown sugar, and almonds in a bowl
4. Add melted butter; stir with a fork until the mixture resembles wet sand
5. Spread on the bottom of the parchment-lined pan
6. Combine apricots and water in a saucepan; bring to a boil and simmer until very soft, about 10 minutes
7. Drain; mash apricots into a pulp
8. Add amaretto; mix well
9. Sweeten with 1 teaspoon white sugar
10. Beat cream cheese, 3/4 cup white sugar, 1/2 cup sour cream, cornstarch, and 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract in a bowl using an electric mixer on low speed
11. Add eggs one at a time; mix well
12. Fold in 2 tablespoons of apricot pulp; reserve remainder for topping
13. Pour cheesecake batter into the pan, covering the crust
14. Bake in the preheated oven until edges are puffed and surface of cheesecake is firm except for a small spot in the center that will jiggle when the pan is gently shaken, about 45 minutes
15. Beat 1 1/2 cups sour cream, 3 tablespoons white sugar, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract together until combined
16. Remove cheesecake from the hot oven; spoon topping over the surface and return cake to the oven for 8 minutes more
17. Cool to room temperature, about 1 hour
18. Refrigerate for 6 to 8 hours
19. Top with remaining apricot pulp

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 38g 49%, Saturated Fat 20g 98%, Cholesterol 130mg 43%, Sodium 221mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 15%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 11g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 113mg 9%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 369mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/239539/apricot-cheesecake/

============================================================

RECIPE 891: Apricot Noodle Kugel
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Side Dish/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (8 ounce) package wide egg noodles
• ¼ cup butter
• softened
• 1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• 3 eggs
• beaten
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup apricot nectar
• 1 cup milk
• ½ cup golden raisins (Optional)
• 1 ½ cups cornflake crumbs
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease a 9x9 inch baking pan
3. Bring a large saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil
4. Stir in egg noodles, and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain
5. In a medium bowl, thoroughly mix egg noodles with 1/4 cup butter, cream cheese, eggs, 1/2 cup sugar, and vanilla
6. Stir in apricot nectar and milk
7. Mix in raisins
8. Transfer to the prepared baking pan
9. In a separate medium bowl, mix cornflake crumbs, 1/2 cup butter, 1/4 cup sugar, remaining vanilla, and cinnamon
10. Spread over the egg noodle mixture
11. Bake 45 minutes in the preheated oven, until bubbly and lightly browned

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 10g 49%, Cholesterol 102mg 34%, Sodium 219mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 46g 17%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 53mg 4%, Iron 5mg 25%, Potassium 182mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/39936/apricot-noodle-kugel/

RECIPE 892: Great-Grandmother Bubbie's Hamantaschen
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 36
Yield: 3 dozen
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Apricot/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups pitted prunes
• cooked
• drained and mashed
• 2 cups dried apricots
• cooked drained and mashed
• 3 eggs
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup safflower oil
• 1 lemon
• zested
• 1 orange
• zested
• 4 cups unbleached all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• ⅓ cup white sugar
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place prunes and apricots into a large pot filled with water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat
2. Cook the fruit uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the fruit is tender, about 15 minutes
3. Drain fruit in a colander and mash together in a bowl using a fork
4. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
5. Whisk eggs, 1 cup sugar, oil, lemon zest, and orange zest together in a bowl and set aside
6. Sift flour and baking powder together in a large bowl
7. Stir in the egg mixture, kneading with hands until the dough comes together
8. Roll out dough to about 1/4 inch in thickness on a lightly floured surface
9. Cut circles out using a cookie cutter or the rim of a drinking glass
10. Mix prune and apricot mixture, lemon juice, walnuts, and 1/3 cup sugar in a bowl
11. Place a tablespoon of the filling in the center of the cookie
12. Pinch the edges firmly together to create a triangle, leaving the center open to expose the filling
13. Repeat with the remaining cookies
14. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes
15. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 34mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 30mg 2%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 183mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/191359/great-grandmother-bubbies-hamantaschen/

============================================================

RECIPE 893: Apricot and Cranberry Stuffed Roast Pork Loin With Port Wine Pan Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 16 servings
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Pork Roast Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons olive oil
• 16 whole peeled garlic cloves
• 2 tablespoons minced garlic cloves
• 1 (8 pound) whole boneless pork loin
• patted dry
• at room temperature
• Salt and freshly ground pepper
• 3 tablespoons minced fresh rosemary (snip with scissors)
• divided
• 16 dried apricots (or similar amount of your favorite dried fruit)
• ⅓ cup dried cranberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Adjust oven rack to upper-middle position and heat oven to 250 degrees
2. Heat oil in a small skillet over medium-low heat
3. Add whole garlic cloves and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft and golden, about 5 minutes
4. Remove with a slotted spoon; reserve oil
5. Turn pork loin fat-side down
6. Slit lengthwise, almost but not quite all the way through, to form a long pocket, leaving a 1/2-inch border of unslit meat at each end
7. Brush cavity with some of the reserved garlic cooking oil, and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper and 1 Tb. of the rosemary
8. Line cavity with sauteed garlic and apricots; sprinkle in cranberries
9. Tie loin together with kitchen twine or heavy-duty string at 1 1/2-inch intervals
10. Brush with remaining oil, and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper
11. Set roast, fat-side up, diagonally or curved (so it fits) on a large, lipped cookie sheet or jellyroll pan
12. Warm 1/4 cup apple jelly along with the minced garlic and remaining rosemary
13. Brush mixture onto meat
14. Roast until a meat thermometer stuck into the center registers 125 to 130 degrees. (Start checking at about 1 1/2 hours.) Remove from oven; raise oven temperature to 400 degrees
15. Brush loin with pan drippings, return to oven, and continue to roast until the loin is golden brown and a meat thermometer stuck into the center registers 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), about 20 minutes longer
16. For even more attractive coloring, broil until spotty brown, 3 to 5 minutes
17. Let roast rest 15 to 20 minutes; transfer to a carving board
18. Stir juices around pan to loosen brown bits
19. Pour through a strainer into a small pan, and stir in port, chicken broth and remaining 2 Tbs. of jelly; bring to a simmer
20. Mix cornstarch with a couple of tablespoons of cold water; whisk into sauce
21. Simmer until lightly thickened
22. Slice pork and serve with a little sauce

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 20%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 109mg 36%, Sodium 225mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 39g, Vitamin C 2mg 11%, Calcium 39mg 3%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 710mg 15%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/77008/rosemary-scented-pork-loin-stuffed-with-roasted-garlic-dried-apricots-and-cranberries-and-port-wine-pan-sauce/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 15
Yield: 5 cups
Prep Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Salsa Recipes/

• julienned
• ½ cup chopped green bell pepper
• ½ cup chopped red bell pepper

• ¼ cup chopped cherry tomatoes
• 1 habanero pepper
• seeded and minced
• 2 cloves garlic
• minced
• 1 teaspoon minced fresh cilantro
• ½ teaspoon cumin
• ¼ cup fresh lime juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix the apricots, shallots, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, pineapple, cherry tomatoes, habanero pepper, garlic, cilantro, cumin, and lime juice together in a bowl; refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 3mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 7g 3%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 19mg 95%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 156mg 3%

RECIPE 895: Streamline Hungarian Torte
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 32
Yield: 1 -11x17 inch torte
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/Eastern European/Hungarian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups chopped walnuts
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
• 1 (.25 ounce) envelope active dry yeast
• 1 teaspoon white sugar
• 4 egg yolks
• ½ cup sour cream
• 1 ⅓ cups butter or margarine
• softened
• 4 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 (16 ounce) jar apricot preserves
• 4 egg whites
• ⅔ cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease an 11x17 inch jelly roll pan
3. Mix together the walnuts, ground cinnamon, and 3/4 cup of sugar in a medium bowl and set aside
4. In a small bowl, dissolve the yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar in warm water
5. Let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes
6. In a large bowl, stir together the yeast mixture, egg yolks, sour cream, and butter
7. Gradually stir in the flour until the dough becomes too stiff to use a spoon
8. Use your hand to knead the dough in the bowl until it becomes smooth, about 5 minutes
9. Divide the dough into three equal parts, form into balls, cover, and set aside to rest for about 15 minutes
10. Roll one of the balls of dough between 2 sheets of waxed paper to fit the pan
11. Place the dough in the bottom of the prepared baking pan and spread with 3/4 of the nut mixture
12. Roll out another ball of dough in the same way, place this over the nut layer in the pan and spread the apricot preserves evenly over the dough
13. Roll the third ball in the same way and place on top of the layer of preserves
14. Place the torte in the preheated oven and set the timer for 40 minutes
15. When the timer goes off, the top of the torte should be golden brown, if not then wait a few minutes
16. Place the egg whites into a clean glass or metal bowl
17. Whip the egg whites to soft peaks, then gradually add 2/3 cup sugar while beating the egg whites to stiff peaks
18. Spread the meringue evenly over the top of the torte and sprinkle with the remaining nut mixture
19. Bake the meringue-covered torte for an additional 15 minutes
20. Cool the torte in the pan set on a wire rack
21. Trim the edges for a cleaner presentation
22. Serve at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 6g 30%, Cholesterol 48mg 16%, Sodium 71mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 84mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/142127/streamline-hungarian-torte/

============================================================

RECIPE 896: Capirotada (Mexican Dessert)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 9x13-inch pudding
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Mexican/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups water
• 16 ounces piloncillo (Mexican brown sugar cone)
• chopped
• 3 cinnamon sticks
• 2 tablespoons raw sugar
• 2 tablespoons vanilla extract
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
• ¼ cup butter
• 1 (18 ounce) loaf French bread
• sliced
• 1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese
• 1 ½ cups chopped walnuts
• ½ cup raisins
• ½ cup chopped dried apricots

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Combine water, piloncillo, cinnamon sticks, sugar, vanilla extract, and cloves in a pot
3. Bring to a boil
4. Reduce heat and cook until slightly thickened and reduced to a syrup, about 10 minutes
5. Remove cinnamon sticks
6. Lightly butter each slice of bread
7. Place slices in a large, flat baking pan
8. Bake in the preheated oven until toasted, 10 to 15 minutes
9. Let butter dry
10. Grease a 9x13-inch cake pan and add 1/2 of the toasted bread
11. Sprinkle 1/2 of the Monterey Jack cheese, walnuts, raisins, and apricots over the bread
12. Drizzle 1/2 of the syrup on top to fully coat the bread
13. Top with the remaining bread, cheese, walnuts, raisins, apricots, and syrup
14. Cover with aluminum foil
15. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes
16. Remove foil and continue baking until lightly browned and heated through, about 15 minutes more
17. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 288mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 36g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 117mg 9%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 196mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/266326/capirotada-mexican-dessert/

============================================================

RECIPE 897: Apricot Glazed Chicken
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 5
Yield: 4 to 6 servings
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/Skillet Chicken/

INGREDIENTS:
• 6 skinless
• boneless chicken breasts
• 1 (10.75 ounce) can low-sodium chicken broth
• ¾ cup apricot preserves
• 1 tablespoon light soy sauce
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• 1 tablespoon water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Spray a large skillet with nonstick cooking spray
2. Brown chicken in heated skillet
3. Add chicken broth, jam and soy sauce
4. Simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken is done (no longer pink in the center)
5. Remove chicken from skillet
6. Add 1 tablespoon cornstarch and 1 tablespoon water to sauce to thicken (equal amounts more of each if you like it thicker)
7. Return chicken to skillet and turn to coat thoroughly with sauce

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 2%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Cholesterol 83mg 28%, Sodium 227mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 35g 13%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 34g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 367mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8861/apricot-glazed-chicken/

RECIPE 898: Cranberry Sauce with Apricots, Raisins, and Orange
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Cranberry Sauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup orange juice
• 1 cup water
• 4 cups fresh cranberries
• ¾ cup sugar
• 1 cup chopped dried apricots
• 1 cup golden raisins
• 1 tablespoon grated orange zest

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large saucepan over medium heat, mix the orange juice, water, cranberries, sugar, apricots, raisins, and orange zest
2. Stir constantly until sugar has dissolved, about 5 minutes
3. Bring to a boil, and cook 10 minutes, or until cranberries have burst
4. Remove from heat, and chill at least 8 hours, or overnight, before serving cold

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 2mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 8mg 41%, Calcium 10mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 151mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/60280/cranberry-sauce-with-apricots-raisins-and-orange/

RECIPE 899: Apricot Glazed Carrots
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Side Dish/Vegetables/Carrots/Glazed Carrot Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds carrots
• peeled and diagonally sliced
• 3 tablespoons butter
• melted
• ⅓ cup apricot preserves
• ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon orange zest
• 2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice
• chopped fresh parsley for garnish

DIRECTIONS:
1. Add carrots to a pot of lightly salted water, and bring to a low boil
2. Simmer until carrots are tender
3. Put melted butter in a bowl, and stir in apricot preserves
4. Stir in nutmeg, salt, orange zest, and lemon juice
5. Add carrots, and stir well to coat
6. Sprinkle with chopped parsley

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 11mg 4%, Sodium 189mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 14mg 68%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 397mg 8%

RECIPE 900: Fruit-Stuffed Pork Loin
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 stuffed pork loin roast
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Pork/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup chopped pitted prunes
• ¾ cup chopped dried apricots
• 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger
• 1 teaspoon grated orange zest
• ½ teaspoon ground cumin
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 1 (4 pound) boneless pork loin roast
• butterflied
• ¼ cup packed brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons cider vinegar
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon mustard powder
• ½ cup water
• 1 teaspoon cornstarch
• 1 tablespoon water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Mix prunes, apricots, ginger, orange zest, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, and cinnamon in a bowl; season with salt and black pepper
3. Open pork roast and spoon stuffing down the center; fold meat over stuffing and tie securely in several places with kitchen twine
4. Set roast onto a rack in a roasting pan
5. Combine brown sugar, flour, cider vinegar, 1 teaspoon cumin, and mustard powder into a paste; spread brown sugar mixture over the roast
6. Bake in the preheated oven until a meat thermometer inserted into center of stuffing reads 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), about 1 1/2 hours
7. Transfer roast to a serving platter and tent with aluminum foil while you make gravy
8. Skim fat from roasting pan and transfer defatted drippings into a small saucepan
9. Pour 1/2 cup water into roasting pan and scrape up and dissolve any browned bits of food into water; pour into saucepan with pan juices
10. Bring pan juices to a boil over medium heat
11. Dissolve cornstarch in 1 tablespoon water in a small bowl and whisk cornstarch mixture into pan juices, stirring constantly until thickened, about 1 minute
12. Strain gravy into a gravy boat
13. Serve gravy with roast

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 26%, Saturated Fat 7g 36%, Cholesterol 110mg 37%, Sodium 85mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 9%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 38g, Vitamin C 2mg 10%, Calcium 53mg 4%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 831mg 18%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/230418/fruit-stuffed-pork-loin/

============================================================

RECIPE 901: Apricot-Pecan Sweet Potatoes
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9x13-inch casserole
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Vegetables/Sweet Potatoes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 pounds sweet potatoes
• peeled and cut into chunks
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• 5 teaspoons cornstarch
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 cup apricot nectar
• ½ cup hot water
• 2 teaspoons grated orange peel
• 2 tablespoons butter
• ½ cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place the sweet potatoes into a large pot and cover with water
2. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes
3. Drain and allow to steam dry for a minute or two
4. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
5. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish
6. Mix together brown sugar, cornstarch, salt, cinnamon, apricot nectar, water, and orange peel in a saucepan; bring to a boil over medium heat
7. Reduce heat to medium-low, and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly
8. When the sauce is thick, stir in the butter and pecans
9. Place the sweet potato chunks into the prepared baking dish, and pour the sauce over to coat all the potatoes
10. Bake in the preheated oven until tender and bubbling, 25 to 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 196mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 68g 25%, Dietary Fiber 6g 21%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 83mg 6%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 676mg 14%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/216386/apricot-pecan-sweet-potatoes/

============================================================

RECIPE 902: Ma Lipo's Apricot-Glazed Turkey with Roasted Onion and Shallot Gravy
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 30
Yield: 30 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 4 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 5 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Holidays and Events Recipes/Thanksgiving/Turkey/Roasted/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup apricot nectar
• 1 cup apricot preserves
• 2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger root
• 1 tablespoon honey
• ¾ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 3 tablespoons chopped fresh sage
• 1 ½ teaspoons salt
• 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
• 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
• 3 onions
• thinly sliced
• 6 ounces thinly sliced shallots
• 22 pounds whole turkey
• 2 cups low-sodium chicken broth
• 1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme
• ½ teaspoon dried sage
• 2 cups low-sodium chicken broth
• salt and pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine apricot nectar, preserves, ginger, and honey in a small saucepan and bring to boil
2. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until thickened and reduced to 1-1/4 cups, about 15 minutes
3. Blend 3/4 cup unsalted butter at room temperature, 3 tablespoons chopped fresh sage, salt, and pepper in small bowl
4. Melt 2 tablespoons unsalted butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat
5. Add onions and shallots; saute until very soft and light brown, about 20 minutes
6. Position rack in lowest third of oven
7. Preheat to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
8. Season turkey cavity with salt and pepper
9. Place turkey, breast side up, on a rack in a large roasting pan
10. Slide hand under skin of turkey breast to loosen skin
11. Spread half of herb butter over breast under skin
12. Rub remaining herb butter over outside of turkey
13. If stuffing turkey, spoon stuffing loosely into main cavity; it will expand as it cooks
14. Tie legs together loosely to hold shape of turkey
15. Roast turkey for 30 minutes in the preheated oven
16. Reduce oven temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C), and continue roasting 1 hour 30 minutes, basting occasionally with pan drippings
17. Tent turkey with aluminum foil; roast 45 minutes longer
18. Add onion mixture, 1 cup broth, thyme, and 1/2 teaspoon chopped fresh sage to the roasting pan
19. Roast 15 more minutes before brushing 1/2 cup apricot glaze over turkey
20. Continue to roast turkey uncovered, brushing occasionally with glaze
21. Add more broth to the pan if necessary
22. Bake 40 minutes longer for unstuffed turkey, and 1 hour 10 minutes longer for stuffed turkey, or until meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh registers 165 degrees F (75 degrees C)
23. Place turkey on a platter, and tent with foil
24. Let stand 30 minutes
25. Reserve mixture in pan for gravy
26. Pour contents of roasting pan into a strainer set over a large bowl
27. Skim fat from pan juices using a large spoon
28. Transfer the onion mixture to a blender
29. Add 1 cup pan juices, and puree until smooth, adding more pan juices and chicken broth if necessary to thin sauce to desired consistency
30. Transfer sauce to a large saucepan, and bring to a boil
31. Cook until color deepens, skimming off any foam, about 5 minutes
32. Season with salt and pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 29g 37%, Saturated Fat 10g 52%, Cholesterol 211mg 70%, Sodium 301mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 68g, Vitamin C 2mg 12%, Calcium 73mg 6%, Iron 5mg 25%, Potassium 729mg 16%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13539/ma-lipos-apricot-glazed-turkey-with-roasted-onion-and-shallot-gravy/

============================================================

RECIPE 903: Apricot Glazed Ham
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Yield: 1 to 8 - pound ham
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 55 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Ham/Whole/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (8 pound) fully-cooked
• bone-in ham
• ¼ cup whole cloves (Optional)
• ½ cup apricot preserves
• 3 tablespoons honey mustard

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Score the fatty side of the ham with a sharp knife in a diamond pattern, spacing the lines about 1 inch apart
3. Insert whole cloves at the intersections, if desired
4. Place the ham in a shallow roasting pan and cover with aluminum foil
5. Bake the ham in the preheated oven for about 90 minutes
6. About 10 minutes before the ham is finished, measure the apricot preserves into a small saucepan
7. Warm over medium heat until liquid, then remove from the heat and stir in the honey mustard
8. Brush the glaze onto the ham, and return to the oven, uncovered, and bake for an additional 15 to 20 minutes, or until the glaze is nicely browned
9. Let the ham stand for about 10 minutes before carving and serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 48g 62%, Saturated Fat 17g 86%, Cholesterol 145mg 48%, Sodium 3363mg 146%, Total Carbohydrate 10g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 48g, Vitamin C 92mg 458%, Calcium 32mg 2%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 817mg 17%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/162826/apricot-glazed-ham/

============================================================

RECIPE 904: Apricot Brandy and Peach Schnapps Pound Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 40 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Pound Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups white sugar
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• 6 eggs
• beaten
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• ¼ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup sour cream
• ¼ cup apricot brandy
• 1 teaspoon lemon zest
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup peach schnapps
• 1 cup water
• 1 teaspoon lemon zest
• 1 cup apricot preserves
• ½ cup apricot brandy
• 1 teaspoon lemon zest
• ½ cup almonds

DIRECTIONS:
1. Butter and flour one angle food tube cake pan
2. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (175 degrees C)
3. In a mixing bowl, cream together butter and sugar for 5 minutes
4. Add eggs one at a time
5. Sift flour with soda and salt; add sour cream and brandy ending with flour
6. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes
7. Prepare the syrup in a sauce pan by combining the sugar, peach flavored liqueur, water and lemon zest
8. Boil for 1 minute
9. Turn cake out onto plate and punch holes in bottom of cake with ice pick or something similar
10. Slowly pour all of syrup into holes until cake is penetrated and syrup is absorbed
11. Immediately turn cake right side up onto serving plate
12. Prepare the topping/glaze by combining the apricot preserves, apricot brandy and lemon zest in a sauce pan and boiling for 1 minute
13. Drizzle over top of cake
14. Place sliced almonds on top of glaze along with a little lemon zest if desired
15. Serve the cake with sliced fresh peaches and coat with 1/2 cup citrus juice
16. Add one basket blueberries and mix together
17. Pour 1/2 cup peach flavored liqueur and 1/2 cup simple syrup over fruit. (simple syrup made from 1/2 cup sugar boiled in 1 cup water for 1 minute and cooled)

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 13g 67%, Cholesterol 142mg 47%, Sodium 289mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 114g 42%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 83g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 3mg 16%, Calcium 66mg 5%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 167mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13699/apricot-brandy-and-peach-schnapps-pound-cake/

============================================================

------------------------------------------------------------

Yield: 30 servings

1. In a punch bowl combine pineapple juice, apricot nectar and limeade; finally, pour in the lemon-lime soda

NUTRITION INFO:
