RECIPE 906: Southern Apricot Chicken
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/

INGREDIENTS:
• 12 boneless
• skinless chicken breast halves
• 1 cup apricot preserves
• 1 cup sour cream
• 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard
• salt and pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Arrange the chicken pieces in a single layer in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish
3. Bake uncovered for 25 to 30 minutes, or until no longer pink in the center, and juices run clear
4. While the chicken is cooking, stir together the apricot preserves, sour cream, mustard, salt and pepper in a small bowl
5. When the chicken is done, remove from the oven, and coat with the sauce
6. Return to the oven for 10 to 12 minutes, or until sauce is bubbly and hot

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Cholesterol 76mg 25%, Sodium 142mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 25g, Vitamin C 3mg 13%, Calcium 39mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 251mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/86060/southern-apricot-chicken/

============================================================

RECIPE 907: Spicy Air Fryer Pork Chops with Apricot Glaze
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Pork Chop Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups water
• 2 tablespoons kosher salt
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 4 (5 ounce) bone-in center loin pork chops
• about 3/4-inch thick
• 1 teaspoon chili powder
• or to taste
• 1 teaspoon onion powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon white pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine water, salt, and sugar in a bowl and stir until the crystals are dissolved
2. Add pork chops, cover, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or up to 4 hours
3. Remove pork chops from the brine and shake off excess
4. Discard the remaining brine
5. Pat chops dry with paper towels and place on a plate or cutting board
6. Combine chili powder, onion powder, salt, and white pepper in a small bowl
7. Distribute 1/2 of the rub mixture among the 4 chops and rub to coat the entire surface
8. Turn the chops and repeat
9. Allow chops to come to room temperature, about 30 minutes
10. Meanwhile, combine apricot all-fruit spread, hoisin sauce, ginger, garlic, chili-garlic sauce, and lime juice for the glaze in a medium, microwave-safe bowl
11. Microwave mixture on high for 3 minutes, stirring halfway through
12. Carefully remove glaze and set aside
13. Preheat air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) if recommended by manufacturer
14. Spray each side of seasoned and rubbed chops with cooking spray
15. Place chops in the air fryer in a single layer and air-fry for 8 minutes, turning halfway through
16. Brush the tops of the chops with prepared glaze and air-fry until pork chops are no longer pink in the center, 2 to 3 minutes
17. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
18. Sprinkle chops with minced parsley, and serve with remaining glaze

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 3517mg 153%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 17g, Vitamin C 10mg 49%, Calcium 48mg 4%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 309mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/285573/spicy-air-fryer-pork-chops-with-apricot-glaze/

============================================================

RECIPE 908: Boozy Apricot Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 144
Yield: 9 half-pint jars
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ½ pounds firm-ripe apricots
• halved and pitted
• 1 (1.75 ounce) package fruit pectin (such as Sure-Jell Premium Fruit Pectin®)
• 7 cups white sugar
• ⅓ cup apricot brandy

DIRECTIONS:
1. Inspect 9 half-pint jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones
2. Immerse in simmering water until jam is ready
3. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water
4. Finely chop apricots and measure; you should have 5 cups prepared fruit
5. Transfer apricots to a large saucepan over medium heat
6. Stir in pectin and slowly bring mixture to a full rolling boil
7. Add sugar and stir to dissolve
8. Return to a full rolling boil over high heat and boil for exactly 1 minute, stirring constantly
9. Skim off any foam with a ladle or a large spoon
10. Remove from heat and stir in the apricot brandy
11. Pack apricot jam into the prepared jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top
12. Run a clean knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars to remove any air bubbles
13. Wipe rims with a moist paper towel to remove any spills
14. Top with lids and tightly screw on rings
15. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
16. Bring to a boil and lower jars 2 inches apart into the boiling water using a holder
17. Pour in more boiling water to cover jars by at least 1 inch
18. Bring to a rolling boil, cover, and process for 10 minutes
19. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart
20. Let rest for 24 hours without moving the jars
21. Gently press the center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down
22. Remove the rings for storage and store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 6%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Potassium 29mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/264865/boozy-apricot-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 909: Espresso Biscotti
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 biscotti
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Cranberry/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¼ cup unsalted butter
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 3 eggs
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 3 ¼ cups pastry flour
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon instant espresso powder
• 2 teaspoons grated orange zest
• ½ cup chocolate chips
• ½ cup dried apricots
• ½ cup dried cranberries
• ½ cup slivered almonds
• 1 egg white
• lightly beaten

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a cookie sheet or line it with parchment paper
3. Cream together butter and sugar in a bowl until light and fluffy
4. Beat in eggs and vanilla
5. Sift together the flour, cinnamon, and baking powder in a separate bowl
6. Mix dry ingredients into the egg mixture
7. Stir in the espresso powder, orange zest, chocolate chips, dried apricots, dried cranberries and almonds
8. Shape dough into two equal logs approximately 12 inches long by 2 inches diameter
9. Place logs on baking sheet, and flatten out to about 1 inch thickness
10. Brush the log with egg wash
11. Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden and the center is firm, about 35 to 40 minutes
12. Remove from oven to cool on the pans
13. When loaves are cool enough to handle, use a serrated knife to slice the loaves diagonally into 1/2 inch thick slices
14. Return the slices to the baking sheet
15. Reduce oven temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
16. Bake until they start turning light brown, 15 to 20 minutes
17. Cool completely, and store in an airtight container at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 28mg 9%, Sodium 33mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 143mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/152952/espresso-biscotti/

============================================================

RECIPE 910: Apricot Balls
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 3.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/No-Bake Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ pound dried apricots
• ½ cup brown sugar
• ½ cup flaked coconut
• ½ (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 cup flaked coconut for rolling

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mince apricots in a food processor
2. Place in a bowl and toss with brown sugar
3. Stir in 1/2 cup coconut and condensed milk
4. Shape into 1 inch balls and roll in coconut
5. Keep refrigerated

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 8g 38%, Cholesterol 6mg 2%, Sodium 30mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 67mg 5%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 356mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/25647/apricot-balls/

RECIPE 911: Nectarine Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 40
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 day 40 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 pounds nectarines - peeled
• pitted
• and chopped
• 2 tablespoons lemon juice
• 3 cups sugar
• 1 (1.75 ounce) package fruit pectin (such as Sure-Jell® Pectin Light for less or no sugar)
• 3 drops almond extract
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Inspect five (1/2-pint) jars for cracks and rings for rust; discard any defective ones
2. Immerse the jars and rings in simmering water until jam is ready
3. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water
4. Measure finely chopped, peeled nectarines; you should have 4 1/2 cups
5. Add to a heavy pot and immediately mix with lemon juice so they don't turn brown
6. Combine 1/4 cup sugar and fruit pectin in a small bowl
7. Add to nectarines in the pot; stir well
8. Slowly bring mixture to a full rolling boil that does not stop bubbling when stirred
9. Add remaining 2 3/4 cups sugar and stir to dissolve, making sure to scrape over the bottom of the pot
10. Boil for exactly 1 minute, stirring constantly
11. Remove from heat and stir in almond extract
12. Pack jam into the prepared jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top
13. Run a clean knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars to remove any air bubbles
14. Wipe the rims with a moist paper towel to remove any spills
15. Top with the lids and tightly screw on the rings
16. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water
17. Bring to a boil and lower jars 2 inches apart into the boiling water using a holder
18. Pour in more boiling water to cover jars by at least 1 inch
19. Bring to a rolling boil, cover, and process for 10 minutes
20. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart
21. Let rest for 24 hours without moving the jars
22. Gently press the center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down
23. Remove the rings for storage and store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 3mg 14%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 93mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/265910/nectarine-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 912: Nectarine Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Custard and Cream Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅔ cup white sugar
• 4 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 cup heavy whipping cream
• ¼ teaspoon almond extract
• 5 nectarines
• 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie shell

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C)
2. Place a large pot of water over high heat, and bring to a boil
3. Combine sugar, flour, cinnamon, heavy cream and almond extract
4. Place the nectarines in boiling water for 30 to 45 seconds
5. Immediately place nectarines under cold running water and remove skins
6. Cut nectarines in half and remove pits
7. Place halves in the pie shell with the cut side down
8. Pour the cream mixture around the nectarines
9. Bake at 400 degrees F (205 degrees C) for 35 to 40 minutes
10. Good served warm or cold

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 9g 44%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 128mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 14%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 5mg 24%, Calcium 29mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 213mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12392/nectarine-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 913: Summer Fruit Salad with a Lemon, Honey, and Mint Dressing
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Strawberry Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups cubed seeded watermelon
• 2 cups sliced fresh strawberries
• 2 large fresh peaches
• cut into cubes
• 2 large nectarines
• cut into cubes
• 1 red Anjou pear
• cut into cubes
• 1 cup seedless grapes
• halved
• 2 lemons
• juiced
• ¼ cup minced fresh mint (chocolate mint preferred)
• ½ lemon
• zested
• 1 tablespoon honey (fireweed honey preferred)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine watermelon, strawberries, peaches, nectarines, pear, and grapes in a large mixing bowl
2. Whisk lemon juice, mint, lemon zest, and honey together in a small bowl; drizzle over the fruit mixture and toss to coat
3. Refrigerate 1 hour before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 3mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 51mg 256%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 316mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228231/summer-fruit-salad-with-a-lemon-honey-and-mint-dressing/

RECIPE 914: Chef John's Nectarine Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 2 cups
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Salsa Recipes/Peach Salsa Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup finely diced nectarine
• ½ cup finely diced red bell pepper
• ⅓ cup finely diced onions
• 2 tablespoons finely diced jalapeno pepper
• 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro
• 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice
• 2 teaspoons olive oil
• ½ teaspoon salt
• plus more to taste
• 1 pinch cayenne pepper
• 1 pinch freshly ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine nectarines, bell pepper, onions, jalapeno pepper, and cilantro in a bowl
2. Stir in lime juice, olive oil, salt, and cayenne pepper
3. Cover bowl with plastic wrap
4. Refrigerate to let flavors develop, 30 minutes to 1 hour
5. Before serving, stir in black pepper
6. Add a pinch more salt, if needed

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 2%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 195mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 5g 2%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 20mg 98%, Calcium 6mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 98mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/244391/chef-johns-nectarine-salsa/

RECIPE 915: Easy Grilled Nectarines
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 fresh nectarines
• pitted and halved
• 2 tablespoons melted unsalted butter
• 4 tablespoons brown sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Brush each nectarine half with 1/4 tablespoon melted butter and sprinkle with 1/2 tablespoon brown sugar
2. Preheat the grill on medium heat
3. Place nectarines into an aluminum grill dish or directly onto the grill
4. Grill until lightly browned, turning occasionally, 3 to 5 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 24g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 7mg 37%, Calcium 21mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 293mg 6%

RECIPE 916: Fabulous Fruit Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Cranberry Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 red apple
• cored and chopped
• 1 Granny Smith apple
• cored and chopped
• 1 nectarine
• pitted and sliced
• 2 stalks celery
• chopped
• ½ cup dried cranberries
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• 1 (8 ounce) container nonfat lemon yogurt

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large bowl, combine red apple, Granny Smith apple, nectarine, celery, dried cranberries, and walnuts
2. Mix in yogurt
3. Chill until ready to serve

RECIPE 917: Summer Fruit Salad with Whipped Cream
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Strawberry Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅓ cup water
• 5 tablespoons white sugar
• ¼ cup raspberry-flavored liqueur (such as Chambord®)
• 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir water, 5 tablespoons sugar, 1/4 cup raspberry-flavored liqueur, and lemon juice together in a saucepan over medium-low heat
2. Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer, stirring frequently, until the sugar dissolves completely, about 8 minutes
3. Set aside to cool
4. Mix nectarines, cherries, strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries in a large bowl
5. Pour the cooled sugar mixture over the fruit and toss gently to coat
6. Beat heavy whipping cream and 2 teaspoons sugar in a bowl with an electric hand mixer on high until stiff peaks form
7. Fold 1 teaspoon raspberry-flavored liqueur into the whipped cream; spoon over the fruit salad and sprinkle evenly with almonds

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 10%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 22mg 110%, Calcium 26mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 205mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/233648/summer-fruit-salad-with-whipped-cream/

============================================================

RECIPE 918: Spinach, Nectarine, and Halloumi Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Spinach Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons white wine vinegar
• 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
• 3 teaspoons honey
• 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
• ¼ teaspoon dried basil
• 4 cups baby spinach
• 1 nectarine
• pitted and sliced
• ¼ cup sliced almonds
• toasted
• 2 tablespoons thinly sliced red onion
• 2 tablespoons thinly sliced red bell pepper
• 1 (8.8 ounce) package halloumi cheese
• sliced into 1/2-inch strips

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk vinegar, olive oil, honey, mustard, salt, pepper, and basil together in a medium bowl
2. Set vinaigrette aside
3. Toss 1/2 of the vinaigrette together with spinach, nectarine, almonds, red onion, and bell pepper in a large bowl
4. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat
5. Add strips of halloumi and let cook until the undersides are golden brown and all liquid has been released and evaporates, about 4 minutes
6. Flip and cook until other side is golden brown, about 1 minute more
7. Plate servings of salad, top with warm halloumi slices, and serve with remaining vinaigrette

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 29g 37%, Saturated Fat 11g 55%, Cholesterol 47mg 16%, Sodium 888mg 39%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 16g, Vitamin C 17mg 84%, Calcium 52mg 4%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 296mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/266537/spinach-nectarine-and-halloumi-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 919: Grilled Pork Chops with Fresh Nectarine Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 8 mins
Total Time: 33 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Pork/Pork Chop Recipes/Boneless/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 nectarines
• pitted and diced
• 1 ripe tomato
• seeded and diced
• ¼ cup diced onion
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
• 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice
• ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
• or to taste
• salt to taste
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon chili powder
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 8 (4 ounce) boneless pork loin chops

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat
2. Lightly oil grate, and set 4 inches from the heat
3. To make the salsa, place the nectarines, tomato, onion, cilantro, lime juice, and red pepper flakes in a bowl; toss to blend
4. Season to taste with salt
5. Cover, and refrigerate 30 minutes to blend flavors
6. Stir the cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper together in a small bowl
7. Place the olive oil in a small bowl
8. Brush the pork chops with oil, and season both sides evenly with the cumin mixture
9. Place pork loin chops on the preheated grill
10. Cook until lightly browned and juices run clear, about 4 minutes on each side
11. Place pork chops on serving plates, and top with a generous spoonful of salsa

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Cholesterol 130mg 43%, Sodium 92mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 51g, Vitamin C 12mg 59%, Calcium 28mg 2%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 931mg 20%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/143355/grilled-pork-chops-with-fresh-nectarine-salsa/

RECIPE 920: Flavored Water
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 2 liters
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ small cucumber
• sliced thin
• ½ nectarine
• pitted and chopped
• ½ lemon
• sliced
• ½ lemon
• juiced
• ½ lime
• sliced
• ½ lime
• juiced
• 4 slices ginger root
• peeled
• or more to taste
• 10 melissa leaves (lemon balm)
• or more to taste
• 2 quarts water
• 1 drop liquid stevia
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place cucumber, nectarine, lemon slices, lemon juice, lime slices, lime juice, ginger, and melissa leaves in a large pitcher; mash gently with a wooden spoon
2. Pour in water, stir, and refrigerate until flavors blend, 2 hours to overnight
3. Strain; serve over ice

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 8mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 2g 1%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 8mg 39%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 53mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/246155/flavored-water/

RECIPE 921: Peach and Nectarine Crumble
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9-inch baking pan
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups soft peaches
• or as needed
• 3 cups soft nectarines
• or as needed
• ½ cup white sugar (Optional)
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9-inch baking pan
3. Boil peaches and nectarines 1 fruit at a time in a pot until very soft, about 30 seconds each
4. Let cool until ready to handle
5. Peel, core, and chop into bite-sized pieces
6. Mix the fruit, sugar, cornstarch, and vanilla extract together in a large bowl
7. Pour into the prepared pan
8. Combine flour, brown sugar, coconut oil, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl
9. Mix with hands or a fork until crumbly
10. Sprinkle evenly over the fruit mixture
11. Bake in the preheated oven until top is browned and juice appears bubbly, about 30 minutes
12. Let cool for at least 15 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Sodium 112mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 49g 18%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 34g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 24mg 119%, Calcium 54mg 4%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 351mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/258812/peach-and-nectarine-crumble/

RECIPE 922: Caramelized Nectarine
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 2 mins
Total Time: 7 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 nectarine
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 2 tablespoons plain yogurt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Cut nectarine all the way around and twist open
2. Sprinkle sugar on the cut side of each nectarine half
3. Place nectarine, cut-side down, onto a griddle or in a skillet over medium heat; cook for 1 1/2 minutes
4. Transfer nectarines to a plate, cut-side up, and top each with plain yogurt

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Cholesterol 1mg 0%, Sodium 11mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 21g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 33mg 3%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 173mg 4%

RECIPE 923: Vegan Overnight Oats with Chia Seeds and Fruit
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Cereals/Oatmeal Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ⅓ cups almond milk
• 2 ripe bananas
• mashed
• 1 ¼ cups rolled oats
• ¾ cup water
• 4 tablespoons chia seeds
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ cup fresh blueberries
• ¼ cup fresh blackberries
• 1 nectarine
• peeled and diced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine almond milk, bananas, oats, water, chia seeds, and cinnamon in a jar or airtight container; stir together
2. Cover and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight
3. Place oat mixture in a saucepan over low heat and gently cook for about 5 minutes
4. Divide between 2 bowls and top with blueberries, blackberries, and nectarine

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Sodium 118mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 88g 32%, Dietary Fiber 20g 70%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 13g, Vitamin C 23mg 114%, Calcium 326mg 25%, Iron 5mg 29%, Potassium 950mg 20%

RECIPE 924: Nectarine Upside-Down Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9-inch cake
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Upside-Down Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons butter
• at room temperature
• ¼ cup brown sugar (such as muscovado)
• 4 fresh nectarines
• sliced into bite-size pieces

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 340 degrees F (170 degrees C)
2. Place butter in a 9-inch round cake pan and melt in the oven as it preheats
3. Remove pan from oven and sprinkle brown sugar evenly over melted butter
4. Arrange nectarine pieces on the brown sugar layer
5. Gently whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl
6. Beat unsalted butter and white sugar together in a separate bowl until creamy and smooth; add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition
7. Beat vanilla extract into the creamed butter mixture
8. Add flour mixture to creamed butter mixture; beat on low speed just until batter is combined, about 1 minute
9. Spread batter over nectarine layer
10. Increase oven temperature to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)
11. Bake in the preheated oven until cake is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes
12. Cool cake in pan on a wire rack for 15 minutes
13. Run a knife around edge of pan and invert cake onto a serving plate
14. Serve warm or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 22%, Saturated Fat 11g 53%, Cholesterol 80mg 27%, Sodium 265mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 161mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/247291/nectarine-upside-down-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 925: Nectarine Salsa
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Dips and Spreads Recipes/Salsa Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 nectarines
• pitted and chopped
• ¼ medium red onion
• finely chopped
• ¼ cup balsamic vinegar
• 1 teaspoon white sugar
• ½ teaspoon dried cilantro
• ½ teaspoon kosher salt
• freshly ground black pepper to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a bowl, mix the nectarines, onion, vinegar, sugar, cilantro, salt, and pepper
2. Allow to sit 5 minutes
3. In a skillet over medium heat, cook and stir the nectarine mixture 10 minutes, until onion and nectarines are tender and lightly browned

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Sodium 489mg 21%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 10mg 48%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 331mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/73729/nectarine-salsa/

RECIPE 926: Caribbean Chicken
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Caribbean/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon paprika
• 1 teaspoon onion powder
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 teaspoon dried parsley
• ½ teaspoon dried oregano
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon pepper
• 4 boneless
• skinless chicken breast halves
• ¼ cup duck sauce
• ¼ cup marinara sauce
• 1 teaspoon mango hot sauce
• ¾ cup fresh pink grapefruit juice
• divided
• 1 cup Italian seasoned bread crumbs
• 1 ripe nectarine
• pitted and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Line a baking dish with parchment paper
3. In a large bowl, mix together paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, parsley, oregano, salt and pepper
4. Toss with chicken breasts until evenly coated
5. In a bowl, combine duck sauce, marinara sauce, mango hot sauce and 1/4 cup grapefruit juice
6. Coat chicken evenly with sauce mixture
7. Place bread crumbs in a shallow dish, and dredge chicken until evenly breaded
8. Place chicken in baking dish
9. Place nectarine slices around the edge of baking dish
10. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes
11. Turn the chicken, pour 1/2 cup grapefruit juice over chicken, and continue cooking for another 15 minutes or until done

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Cholesterol 68mg 23%, Sodium 1240mg 54%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 33g, Vitamin C 23mg 115%, Calcium 73mg 6%, Iron 3mg 18%, Potassium 517mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/36908/caribbean-chicken/

============================================================

RECIPE 927: Grilled Honey-Nectarine Ricotta Toast
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Main Dishes/Sandwich Recipes/Cheese/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 teaspoon olive oil
• 1 large nectarine
• pitted and cut into 8 wedges
• 2 thick slices crusty bread
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• ¼ cup whole-milk ricotta cheese
• 1 tablespoon crushed sliced almonds
• 2 leaves fresh mint
• minced
• 2 teaspoons honey
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil grate
2. Drizzle 1 teaspoon olive oil onto a small plate
3. Place nectarine wedges on the plate and cover all sides with oil
4. Brush both sides of bread with 2 tablespoons olive oil
5. Place nectarines onto the hot grate and grill 1 to 2 minutes per side; remove to a plate
6. When nectarine wedges have cooled slightly, cut each wedge in 1/2 lengthwise so you now have 16 pieces
7. Place bread slices onto the hot grate and cook until grill marks appear and bread is toasted, about 1 minute per side; remove to a plate
8. Spread ricotta cheese onto each slice of toast
9. Arrange 8 nectarine slices onto each toast and top with almonds
10. Sprinkle with mint and drizzle with honey
11. Cut each toast in half and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 9mg 3%, Sodium 200mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 114mg 9%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 271mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/275175/grilled-honey-nectarine-ricotta-toast/

============================================================

RECIPE 928: Apple and Nectarine Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Pie Crusts/

INGREDIENTS:
• cooking spray
• 4 apples - peeled
• cored and sliced
• peel reserved
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup light brown sugar
• ½ cup water
• ¼ cup brandy
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 pastry for 9-inch double-crust pie
• ½ (8.5 ounce) package corn muffin mix (such as Jiffy®)
• ¼ cup milk
• 4 nectarines
• peeled and sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate
3. Combine apple peels, white sugar, brown sugar, water, brandy, cinnamon, and vanilla extract in a saucepan; bring to a boil
4. Reduce temperature and simmer until fragrant, about 5 minutes
5. Remove apple peels with a fork
6. Roll 1 crust into a 12-inch circle; place in the prepared pie plate
7. Roll out second crust into a 10-inch circle
8. Cut a few slits in the center to vent steam
9. Mix corn muffin mix and milk in a bowl
10. Pour into pie plate
11. Bake in the preheated oven for 5 to 8 minutes
12. Remove from oven
13. Layer apple slices and nectarine slices on top
14. Pour sugar mixture slowly over fruit; cover with second crust
15. Press crusts together to seal; flute edges
16. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
17. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
18. Continue baking until top crust is golden brown, 35 to 45 minutes
19. Let cool to room temperature before slicing, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 1mg 0%, Sodium 365mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 64g 23%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 40g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 7mg 35%, Calcium 69mg 5%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 257mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/259034/apple-and-nectarine-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 931: Sticky Orange Chicken with Nectarines
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 chicken breast halves
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup orange juice
• ¼ cup light soy sauce
• 2 tablespoons buckwheat honey
• 2 tablespoons hot sauce
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons chopped fresh ginger
• 2 teaspoons chopped fresh garlic
• 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 1 pinch Italian seasoning
• 4 skinless
• boneless chicken breast halves
• 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil
• or as needed
• 2 nectarines
• sliced

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix orange juice, soy sauce, honey, hot sauce, brown sugar, ginger, and garlic together in a small bowl to make the sauce
2. Season flour lightly with salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning
3. Cut chicken breasts into 1/2-inch strips
4. Dredge chicken pieces in the seasoned flour; sprinkle more salt and pepper on top
5. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat
6. Add chicken strips and brown on both sides, 1 to 2 minutes per side
7. Pour in the orange sauce
8. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until sauce thickens and chicken is no longer pink in the centers, 8 to 10 minutes
9. Plate the chicken and top with nectarine slices

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 1g 6%, Cholesterol 61mg 20%, Sodium 808mg 35%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 24g, Protein 26g, Vitamin C 25mg 126%, Calcium 35mg 3%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 420mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/263800/sticky-orange-chicken-with-nectarines/

RECIPE 932: Nectarine-Raspberry Crumble
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Raspberry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ½ pounds nectarines
• 1 (6 ounce) container fresh raspberries
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• ¾ cup brown sugar
• 7 tablespoons unsalted butter
• room temperature and cut into chunks
• ¾ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup rolled oats
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• ¼ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil
3. Submerge nectarines for about 30 seconds
4. Remove with a slotted spoon and let cool until safe to handle
5. Peel, halve, remove pit, and slice
6. Combine sliced nectarines, raspberries, and white sugar in a bowl
7. Transfer to a baking dish
8. Combine brown sugar, butter, flour, oats, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt in a bowl
9. Rub between your fingers to create streusel
10. Sprinkle streusel evenly over fruit
11. Bake in the preheated oven until crumble is lightly browned, 45 to 60 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 9g 44%, Cholesterol 36mg 12%, Sodium 107mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 79g 29%, Dietary Fiber 8g 28%, Total Sugars 53g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 21mg 107%, Calcium 59mg 5%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 660mg 14%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/265422/nectarine-raspberry-crumble/

============================================================

RECIPE 933: Nectarine Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch baking pan
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 55 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Bar Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• divided
• ½ cup butter
• 3 nectarines
• sliced
• divided
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• 2 eggs

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Combine flour and 1/2 cup sugar in a 9x13-inch baking pan; cut in butter until mixture is crumbly
3. Press firmly into an even layer
4. Bake in preheated oven until crust is slightly browned, about 25 minutes
5. Place 1/3 of the nectarine slices in a blender and puree until smooth
6. Stir cornstarch into the mixture until evenly distributed
7. Beat eggs in a large bowl until light, using an electric mixer; gradually beat in 1 cup sugar until well combined
8. Stir in the blended nectarine mixture; pour over hot baked crust
9. Bake until almost set, about 30 minutes
10. Let cool completely on a rack, 30 minutes to 1 hour; cut into bars
11. Top bars with remaining nectarine slices

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 48mg 16%, Sodium 65mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 103mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/258417/nectarine-bars/

============================================================

• chopped
• or to taste

2. Stir together olive oil, vinegar, mustard, and honey
3. Season with salt and pepper
4. Drizzle dressing over salad

RECIPE 935: Drupey Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 50 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Cherry Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon salt
• .79100000858307 cup butter
• 7 tablespoons ice water
• 2 cups pitted sour cherries
• 3 nectarines
• pitted and chopped
• 3 fresh apricots
• pitted and sliced
• ⅝ cup turbinado sugar
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 2 tablespoons butter
• cut into pieces
• 1 teaspoon water
• 1 egg yolk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Place cherries, nectarines and apricots into a colander to drain off any excess liquid
3. To Make Dough: In a medium bowl, combine flour and salt
4. Cut 3/4 cup of butter into flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs
5. Pour in one tablespoon of water at a time until the dough sticks together
6. Add additional water if necessary
7. Divide dough into two parts
8. Roll out one half toa circle 1/8 of an inch thick, then place in a 9 inch pie pan
9. Roll out the other half of the dough and cut into long strips about 1/2 inch wide
10. To Make Filling: Place the drained fruit mixture into a medium bowl, Stir in the sugar, cinnamon, cornstarch and flour; pour into the prepared pie pan
11. Dot with the remaining two tablespoons of butter
12. Arrange the pastry strips into a lattice top and crimp edges
13. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolk and teaspoon of water, and use a pastry brush to coat just the lattice strips--not the edges
14. Bake in the preheated oven and bake for 25 minutes, until the crust begins to brown
15. Reduce the heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for an additional 20 to 25 minutes
16. Remove from oven and let cool a bit before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 22g 29%, Saturated Fat 14g 68%, Cholesterol 82mg 27%, Sodium 450mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 53g 19%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 8mg 40%, Calcium 40mg 3%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 301mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/19869/drupey-pie/

============================================================

RECIPE 936: Fresh Fruit Basket Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8x13-inch dish
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Peach Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups sliced fresh peaches
• 2 cups sliced fresh nectarines
• 2 cups pitted and quartered plums
• 1 teaspoon cornstarch
• 1 cup currant jelly
• ½ teaspoon apple pie spice
• ⅛ teaspoon white pepper
• 1 (16.3 ounce) can refrigerated flaky biscuits (such as Pillsbury Grands!®)
• ¼ cup white sugar
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spray an 8x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray
3. In a large bowl, lightly mix together the peach, nectarine, and plum slices until well mixed, and toss with the cornstarch to dust the fruit
4. Pour in the currant jelly, apple pie spice, and white pepper, and lightly mix again with your hands to coat the fruit with the jelly and seasonings
5. Spread the fruit into the prepared baking dish
6. Pop open the can of biscuits, and cut them in half
7. Arrange the biscuit dough halves on top of the fruit
8. Mix the sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl, and sprinkle the mixture evenly on the biscuit dough
9. Bake in the preheated oven until the biscuits are golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes
10. Allow to cool on a rack for at least 20 minutes to let the dish set up

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 1mg 0%, Sodium 571mg 25%, Total Carbohydrate 69g 25%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 45g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 20mg 98%, Calcium 39mg 3%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 238mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215149/fresh-fruit-basket-cobbler/

============================================================

RECIPE 937: Summer Fruit Salad II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 6 cups
Prep Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Blueberry Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups cubed (1-inch) seedless watermelon
• 1 large white peach
• pitted and cut into small cubes
• 1 large nectarine
• pitted and cut into small cubes
• 1 black plum
• pitted and cut into small cubes
• 1 cup fresh blueberries
• ½ cup seedless red grapes
• halved
• ½ cup shredded coconut
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ cup nondairy whipped topping (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Gently toss the watermelon, peach, nectarine, plum, blueberries, and grapes together in a large bowl
2. Sprinkle the coconut and cinnamon over the fruit mixture and lightly stir to mix
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and chill in refrigerator at least 1 hour before serving
4. Top with whipped topping as desired

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 2%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Sodium 11mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 7mg 36%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 140mg 3%

RECIPE 938: KK's Three Fruit Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9x13-inch dish
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Raspberry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 nectarines
• pitted and cut into bite-size pieces
• 3 tart plums
• pitted and cut into bite-size pieces
• ½ pint fresh raspberries
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup packed brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon ground ginger
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ⅔ cup cold unsalted butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread the nectarine and plum pieces into the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking dish
3. Sprinkle the raspberries over the fruit
4. Whisk together the flour, white sugar, brown sugar, ginger, and cinnamon in a bowl; cut the butter into the flour mixture with a pastry cutter until it resembles coarse crumbs
5. Spread the crumb mixture evenly over the fruit and raspberries
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, and turn the dish around in the oven for even cooking
7. Bake another 10 to 15 minutes; if crumb topping is pale, place dish under broiler for 1 to 3 minutes to brown

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 20%, Saturated Fat 10g 49%, Cholesterol 41mg 14%, Sodium 4mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 17%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 9mg 45%, Calcium 22mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 199mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215148/kks-three-fruit-cobbler/

RECIPE 939: Fresh Nectarine Cake with Blackberries
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch cake
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• at room temperature
• 2 eggs
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ¼ teaspoons baking powder
• 1 tablespoon milk
• or more as needed (Optional)
• 3 fresh nectarines - peeled
• halved
• and pitted
• or more to taste
• 1 (6 ounce) container fresh blackberries
• or more to taste
• 1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9-inch springform pan
3. Beat butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until creamy
4. Add sugar and salt gradually and mix in well
5. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition
6. Combine flour and baking powder, sift, and quickly beat into the batter on low speed
7. Thin batter with a little milk if needed
8. Pour batter into the prepared springform pan
9. Arrange nectarines and blackberries on top in a decorative pattern
10. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes
11. Dust with confectioners' sugar and cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes
12. Run a table knife around the edges to loosen
13. Invert carefully onto a serving plate or cooling rack
14. Let cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 72mg 24%, Sodium 114mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 7mg 36%, Calcium 67mg 5%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 184mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/263853/fresh-nectarine-cake-with-blackberries/

============================================================

RECIPE 940: Seven Layer Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 36
Yield: 3 dozen bar cookies
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Bar Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• 1 ½ cups graham cracker crumbs
• 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
• 1 cup butterscotch chips
• 1 cup chopped walnuts
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 ⅓ cups shredded coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Put butter in 13x9-inch baking pan and place in oven until melted
3. Swirl to coat bottom and sides with butter
4. Spread graham cracker crumbs evenly over bottom of pan
5. Layer chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and walnuts over crumbs
6. Pour condensed milk over walnuts and sprinkle with coconut
7. Bake in preheated oven until edges are golden brown, about 25 minutes
8. Cool and cut into 36 bars
9. Melissa Goff

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 12%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 11mg 4%, Sodium 49mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 96mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/9889/seven-layer-bars/

RECIPE 941: Nanaimo Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 8x8-inch pan
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/No-Bake Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• divided
• 5 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• beaten
• 1 ¾ cups graham cracker crumbs
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• ½ cup finely chopped almonds (Optional)
• 3 tablespoons heavy cream
• 2 tablespoons custard powder
• 2 cups confectioners' sugar
• 4 (1 ounce) squares semisweet baking chocolate
• 2 teaspoons butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. In the top of a double boiler, combine 1/2 cup softened butter, cocoa powder, and sugar
2. Stir occasionally until melted and smooth
3. Beat in egg and stir until thick, 2 to 3 minutes
4. Remove from the heat and mix in graham cracker crumbs, coconut, and almonds
5. Press into the bottom of an ungreased 8x8-inch pan
6. For the middle layer, beat remaining 1/2 cup softened butter, heavy cream, and custard powder until light and fluffy
7. Mix in confectioners' sugar until smooth
8. Spread over the bottom layer in the pan
9. Chill to set
10. While the second layer is chilling, melt semisweet chocolate and 2 teaspoons butter together in the microwave or over low heat
11. Spread melted chocolate mixture over chilled bars
12. Let the chocolate set before cutting into squares

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 25%, Saturated Fat 11g 56%, Cholesterol 47mg 16%, Sodium 160mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 34g 12%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 3g, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 87mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/25095/nanaimo-bars-iii/

============================================================

RECIPE 942: German Chocolate Cake Frosting
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Frostings and Icings/Chocolate/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup evaporated milk
• 1 cup brown sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 3 egg yolks
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 ⅓ cups flaked coconut
• 1 cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine evaporated milk, brown sugar, butter, egg yolks, and vanilla in a saucepan over medium heat
2. Cook, stirring constantly, at a low boil until mixture turns a light caramel color and thickens, about 10 minutes
3. Remove from heat and stir in coconut and pecans
4. Let cool to room temperature before spreading on cake
5. Princess Bakerella

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 25%, Saturated Fat 9g 45%, Cholesterol 78mg 26%, Sodium 107mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 9%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 85mg 7%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 162mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17765/german-chocolate-cake-frosting/

RECIPE 943: Frog Eye Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 9 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Pasta Salad/Fruit Pasta Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¾ cups unsweetened pineapple juice
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 eggs
• beaten
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 2 ½ teaspoons salt
• divided
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• 1 (16 ounce) package acini di pepe pasta
• 3 (11 ounce) cans mandarin oranges
• drained
• 2 (20 ounce) cans pineapple tidbits
• drained
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping
• thawed
• 1 cup miniature marshmallows
• 1 cup shredded coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine pineapple juice, sugar, eggs, flour, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a saucepan
2. Stir and cook over medium heat until thickened
3. Remove from heat; stir in lemon juice
4. Let cool to room temperature, about 1 hour
5. Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add oil and remaining 2 teaspoons salt
6. Add pasta and cook until al dente, 5 to 7 minutes
7. Drain and rinse under cold water
8. Combine cooked pasta, cooled egg mixture, mandarin oranges, pineapple tidbits, crushed pineapple, and whipped topping in a large bowl; mix well
9. Refrigerate until chilled, 8 hours to overnight
10. Before serving, add marshmallows and coconut; toss and serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 7g 37%, Cholesterol 37mg 12%, Sodium 648mg 28%, Total Carbohydrate 114g 41%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 75g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 30mg 150%, Calcium 55mg 4%, Iron 3mg 18%, Potassium 388mg 8%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/14439/frog-eye-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 944: Gingerbread Cookie Frosting
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 1/2 cup
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 3.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Frostings and Icings/Cookie Frosting/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup confectioners' sugar
• ¼ cup milk
• or as needed
• 10 drops food coloring

DIRECTIONS:
1. Sift confectioners' sugar into a small bowl
2. Stir in enough milk to make a smooth but not too runny consistency
3. Divide mixture into small containers, depending on how many colors you want
4. Drop food coloring into each container, using as much food coloring as needed to create desired hues

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 2%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 7mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 31g 11%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 1g, Calcium 18mg 1%, Potassium 22mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/11102/gingerbread-cookie-frosting/

RECIPE 945: Coconut Poke Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 1 9x13-inch cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 2 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Coconut Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (18.25 ounce) package white cake mix
• 1 (14 ounce) can cream of coconut
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 (16 ounce) package frozen whipped topping
• thawed
• 1 (8 ounce) package flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Prepare and bake white cake mix in a 9x13-inch dish according to package directions
2. While cake is still hot, poke holes with a utility fork all over the top
3. Mix cream of coconut and sweetened condensed milk together in a bowl
4. Pour over the top of hot cake
5. Let cake cool completely
6. Frost cake with whipped topping and cover with flaked coconut
7. Keep cake chilled in the refrigerator
8. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 946: Coconut Shrimp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 24 coconut shrimp
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Seafood/Shrimp/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup all-purpose flour
• divided
• ⅔ cup beer
• 1 large egg
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• 2 cups flaked coconut
• 24 medium raw shrimp
• shelled
• deveined
• with tails attached
• 3 cups oil for frying

DIRECTIONS:
1. Line a baking sheet with wax paper; set aside
2. Whisk together 1/2 cup flour, beer, egg, and baking powder in a medium bowl until smooth
3. Place coconut and remaining 1/4 cup flour in 2 separate bowls
4. One at a time, hold shrimp by the tail and dredge in flour, shaking off excess
5. Dip in beer batter; allow excess to drip off
6. Roll in coconut, then place on the prepared baking sheet
7. Refrigerate for 30 minutes
8. Heat oil in a deep fryer or large skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
9. Working in batches, fry shrimp in hot oil, turning once, until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes
10. Use tongs to remove shrimp to paper towels to drain. jenniwun

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 118g 151%, Saturated Fat 21g 105%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 205mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 9%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Protein 4g, Calcium 78mg 6%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 125mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17753/coconut-shrimp-i/

============================================================

RECIPE 947: Chia Coconut Pudding with Coconut Milk
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Everyday Cooking/Vegan/Desserts/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups sweetened coconut milk
• 6 tablespoons unsweetened coconut milk
• 1 tablespoon agave nectar
• or more to taste
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• 1 pinch salt
• ½ cup chia seeds
• ½ cup diced fresh strawberries (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk together sweetened and unsweetened coconut milks, agave nectar, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl; stir in chia seeds
2. Allow mixture to soak until thickened, at least 20 minutes, or cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight
3. Stir pudding and top with strawberries

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 22g 29%, Saturated Fat 17g 87%, Sodium 40mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 5g 19%, Total Sugars 3g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 11mg 53%, Calcium 83mg 6%, Iron 4mg 22%, Potassium 237mg 5%

RECIPE 948: Tembleque Puerto Rican Coconut Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 6 4-ounce servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Caribbean/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 (14 ounce) cans coconut milk
• ¾ cup sugar
• ¼ teaspoon kosher salt
• ½ cup cornstarch
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir together coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a saucepan
2. Spoon 3 to 4 tablespoons coconut milk mixture into a small bowl and stir in cornstarch until dissolved; pour into the saucepan
3. Bring mixture to a boil while stirring constantly; cook until smooth and thick, about 5 minutes
4. Pour into molds, cover each with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until cold and firm, 3 hours to 2 days
5. Run a thin knife around the edges of each mold; invert onto serving plates
6. Garnish tops with cinnamon

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 28g 36%, Saturated Fat 25g 124%, Sodium 98mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 25g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 26mg 2%, Iron 4mg 24%, Potassium 289mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/238693/tembleque-puerto-rican-coconut-pudding/

RECIPE 949: Oatmeal Chocolate Coconut Macaroons
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 15
Yield: 15 macaroons
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Macaroon Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups quick-cooking oats
• 1 cup shredded coconut
• ¼ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
• 2 cups white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• ½ cup milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix together oats, coconut, and cocoa powder in a large bowl
2. Bring sugar, butter, and milk to a boil in a saucepan, stirring occasionally; remove immediately from heat and stir into oat mixture until well combined
3. Drop 15 spoonfuls of dough onto a sheet of waxed paper
4. Let cool completely at room temperature before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 6g 28%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 62mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 38g 14%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 2g, Calcium 20mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 93mg 2%

RECIPE 950: No-Bake Chocolate Coconut Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 cookies
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Oatmeal Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups quick cooking oats
• 1 cup sweetened flaked coconut
• 2 cups white sugar
• ½ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
• ½ cup milk
• ½ cup margarine

DIRECTIONS:
1. Line a baking sheet with waxed paper
2. Mix oats and coconut in a large bowl until thoroughly combined
3. Stir together sugar, cocoa powder, milk, and margarine in a saucepan over medium heat until smooth
4. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes
5. Pour over oats and coconut; mix quickly to coat
6. Drop tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet
7. Let cookies cool and harden, then store in an airtight container

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 7%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 0mg 0%, Sodium 56mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 10%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 2g, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 85mg 2%

RECIPE 951: Irish Potato Candy
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 60
Yield: 5 dozen
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/UK and Ireland/Irish/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 ounces cream cheese
• softened
• ¼ cup butter
• softened
• 4 cups confectioners' sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 ½ cups flaked coconut
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Beat cream cheese and butter together in a large bowl until smooth
2. Add confectioners' sugar and vanilla; beat until smooth
3. Mix in flaked coconut
4. Roll mixture into balls or potato shapes; roll balls in cinnamon
5. Place onto a cookie sheet and chill to set, at least 10 minutes
6. If desired, roll potatoes in cinnamon again for a darker color

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 3%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 20mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 10g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 0g, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 14mg 0%

RECIPE 952: Incredibly Delicious Italian Cream Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 3-layer
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/Italian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup buttermilk
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ cup butter
• ½ cup shortening
• 2 cups white sugar
• 5 large eggs
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 2 cups all-purpose flour

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease three 9-inch round cake pans
3. Make the cake: Combine buttermilk and baking soda together in a small bowl; set aside
4. Beat butter, shortening, and sugar together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
5. Mix in eggs, buttermilk mixture, vanilla, coconut, baking powder, and flour; stir until just combined
6. Pour batter into the prepared pans
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes
8. Cool in the pans for 5 minutes; transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely, 20 to 25 minutes
9. Make the frosting (while cakes are cooling): Beat cream cheese, butter, vanilla, and confectioners' sugar in a medium bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
10. Beat in cream, a little at a time, to attain the desired consistency
11. Stir in walnuts and coconut
12. Spread frosting between the cake layers and on the top and sides of cooled cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 40g 51%, Saturated Fat 20g 102%, Cholesterol 140mg 47%, Sodium 397mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 98g 36%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 79g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 87mg 7%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 177mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7871/incredibly-delicious-italian-cream-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 953: Coconut Custard Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 3.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Custard and Cream Pies/Coconut Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 2 large eggs
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• 1 cup milk
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust
• 1 tablespoon flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Beat together sugar, butter, and eggs in a large bowl with an electric mixer on low speed
3. Blend in flour
4. Mix in milk, 1/2 cup at a time
5. Add 1 cup coconut flakes and vanilla; mix well
6. Pour filling into unbaked pie crust
7. Sprinkle top with 1 tablespoon coconut flakes
8. Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set, 40 to 50 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 30%, Saturated Fat 13g 63%, Cholesterol 79mg 26%, Sodium 257mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Total Sugars 43g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 50mg 4%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 119mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12580/coconut-custard-pie-i/

RECIPE 954: Air Fryer Coconut Shrimp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Seafood/Shrimp/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons ground black pepper
• 2 large eggs
• ⅔ cup unsweetened flaked coconut
• ⅓ cup panko bread crumbs
• 12 ounces uncooked medium shrimp
• peeled and deveined
• cooking spray
• ½ teaspoon kosher salt
• divided
• ¼ cup honey
• ¼ cup lime juice
• 1 serrano chile
• thinly sliced
• 2 teaspoons chopped fresh cilantro

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir together flour and pepper in a shallow dish
2. Lightly beat eggs in a second shallow dish
3. Stir together coconut and panko in a third shallow dish
4. Working one at a time, dredge shrimp in flour mixture; shake off excess
5. Dip floured shrimp in egg; allow any excess to drip off
6. Finally, dredge in coconut mixture, pressing to adhere
7. Place shrimp on a plate
8. Coat shrimp well with cooking spray
9. Preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
10. Place 1/2 of the shrimp in the air fryer and cook about 3 minutes
11. Turn shrimp over and continue cooking until golden, about 3 minutes more
12. Season with 1/4 teaspoon salt
13. Repeat with remaining shrimp
14. Meanwhile, whisk together honey, lime juice, and serrano chile in a small bowl
15. Sprinkle fried shrimp with cilantro and serve with honey-lime dip

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 147mg 49%, Sodium 316mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 14g, Vitamin C 5mg 25%, Calcium 35mg 3%, Iron 3mg 15%, Potassium 200mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/270712/air-fryer-coconut-shrimp/

============================================================

RECIPE 955: Chococonut Chip Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 72
Yield: 6 dozen
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Coconut/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup butter
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup light brown sugar
• 2 eggs
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
• 2 cups flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Beat butter, white sugar, and brown sugar together with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy
3. Beat first egg into butter mixture
4. Beat second egg into mixture along with vanilla extract
5. Combine flour, baking soda, and salt together in a separate bowl; stir into butter mixture until just combined
6. Fold in chocolate chips and coconut
7. Drop spoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets
8. Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 8 to 10 minutes
9. Cool on the cookie sheets briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 3g 15%, Cholesterol 12mg 4%, Sodium 77mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 1g, Calcium 5mg 0%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 33mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/19205/chococonut-chip-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 956: Five Flavor Pound Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Yield: 1 10-inch tube pan
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Pound Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• 1 cup milk
• 1 teaspoon coconut extract
• 1 teaspoon rum flavored extract
• 1 teaspoon butter flavored extract
• 1 teaspoon lemon extract
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 3 cups white sugar
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• ½ cup shortening
• 5 large eggs
• beaten

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Grease a 10-inch tube pan
3. Combine flour and baking powder in a medium bowl; set aside
4. Combine milk and extracts in a liquid measure; set aside
5. Cream sugar, butter, and shortening in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
6. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition
7. Beat in flour mixture alternately with milk mixture in batches, beginning and ending with flour mixture
8. Spoon mixture into the prepared pan
9. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 hours
10. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes
11. While cake is cooling, make glaze: Combine sugar, water, and extracts in a saucepan
12. Bring to a boil, stirring until sugar is dissolved
13. Turn cake out onto the wire rack
14. Place waxed paper under the rack to catch glaze drippings
15. Slowly spoon glaze over the top of hot cake
16. Cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 29%, Saturated Fat 11g 55%, Cholesterol 103mg 34%, Sodium 144mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 72g 26%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 51g, Protein 6g, Calcium 48mg 4%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 86mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8072/five-flavor-pound-cake-i/

============================================================

RECIPE 957: Moist Carrot Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch pan
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Sheet Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 ½ cups vegetable oil
• 4 large eggs
• 2 ¾ cups shredded carrots
• 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• ¾ cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan
3. Combine flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl; set aside
4. Mix sugar, oil, and eggs together in a separate bowl
5. Beat in flour mixture
6. Stir in carrots, pineapple, coconut, and walnuts
7. Pour cake batter into the prepared pan
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 35 to 40 minutes
9. Allow to cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 36g 46%, Saturated Fat 7g 35%, Cholesterol 62mg 21%, Sodium 470mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 59g 22%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 40g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 69mg 5%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 206mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/25553/moist-carrot-cake/

RECIPE 958: Impossible Coconut Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups milk
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ½ cup baking mix
• ¼ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 4 large eggs
• 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 cup flaked coconut (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9-inch pie plate
3. Combine milk, sugar, baking mix, butter, eggs, and vanilla in blender; blend on low speed for 3 minutes
4. Pour into the prepared pie plate and let stand for 5 minutes
5. Sprinkle coconut over top
6. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes
7. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 8g 38%, Cholesterol 113mg 38%, Sodium 272mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 89mg 7%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 171mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12161/impossible-coconut-pie-i/

RECIPE 959: Ginataang Manok (Chicken Cooked in Coconut Milk)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/Filipino/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 tablespoons canola oil
• ½ cup sliced fresh ginger
• 1 (5 pound) whole chicken
• cut into pieces
• salt and ground black pepper to taste
• 2 (14 ounce) cans coconut milk
• 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach
• thawed and drained

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat and stir in ginger
2. Cook and stir until fragrant and lightly browned
3. Remove ginger and set aside
4. Season chicken with salt and pepper
5. Place chicken in the same skillet over medium-high heat without crowding
6. Cook until chicken is lightly brown on all sides
7. Return ginger to the skillet and add coconut milk
8. Bring to a boil, then cover with the lid tilted to allow steam to escape
9. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until chicken is no longer pink at the bone, about 30 minutes
10. Stir in spinach and simmer uncovered until spinach is warmed through, 8 to 12 minutes
11. Season with salt and pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 60g 77%, Saturated Fat 32g 160%, Cholesterol 103mg 34%, Sodium 148mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 7g 3%, Dietary Fiber 3g 11%, Total Sugars 0g, Protein 39g, Vitamin C 4mg 22%, Calcium 103mg 8%, Iron 7mg 39%, Potassium 719mg 15%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/204821/ginataang-manok-chicken-cooked-in-coconut-milk/

============================================================

RECIPE 960: Coquito
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Eggnog Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk
• 2 large egg yolks
• beaten
• 1 (14 ounce) can cream of coconut
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• ½ cup white rum
• ½ cup water
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon ground cloves

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine evaporated milk and egg yolks in the top of a double boiler over simmering water
2. Cook over the simmering water, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, and reaches a temperature of 160 degrees F (71 degrees C)
3. Transfer mixture to a blender
4. Add cream of coconut, sweetened condensed milk, rum, water, vanilla, cinnamon, and cloves; blend until combined, about 30 seconds
5. Pour into glass bottles and chill 8 hours to overnight before serving
6. Oana Ennis/Allrecipes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 17%, Saturated Fat 10g 52%, Cholesterol 65mg 22%, Sodium 106mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 46g 17%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Protein 7g, Potassium 305mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/44187/coquito/

============================================================

RECIPE 961: Maja Blanca
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 slices
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/Filipino/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups thin coconut milk
• 3 tablespoons white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make the latik: Bring coconut milk to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat
2. Cook, stirring constantly, until oil begins to separate from the milk, about 30 minutes
3. Skim and reserve oil in a bowl
4. Reduce the heat to medium-low and add sugar; continue to cook and stir until milk becomes brown and crumbly, about 30 minutes
5. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool
6. Grease an 8-inch mold or pie pan with reserved coconut oil
7. Make the pudding: Heat coconut milk, cream-style corn, cornstarch, sugar, and corn kernels in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes
8. Pour corn mixture into the prepared mold
9. Cool for 30 minutes, then refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour
10. Invert pudding carefully onto a serving plate and cut into 12 slices
11. Sprinkle latik over each slice

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 21%, Saturated Fat 14g 72%, Sodium 56mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 12g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 194mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/221333/maja-blanca/

============================================================

RECIPE 962: Oatmeal Chocolate Coconut Chewy
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 30
Yield: 5 dozen
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Oatmeal Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• 1 ¼ cups packed brown sugar
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 eggs
• 2 tablespoons milk
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 ¾ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt (Optional)
• 3 cups rolled oats
• 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
• 1 cup chopped walnuts (Optional)
• 1 cup shredded coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, brown sugar and white sugar until smooth
3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the milk and vanilla
4. Combine the flour, baking soda and salt; stir into the sugar mixture until well blended
5. Stir in the oats, chocolate chips. walnuts and coconut until evenly distributed
6. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheet
7. Bake 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven for a chewy cookie or 14 minutes for a firmer cookie
8. Cool for 1 minute on the cookie sheet and then remove to wire rack
9. Cool completely and then store in tightly sealed container

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 7g 35%, Cholesterol 29mg 10%, Sodium 141mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 26mg 2%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 125mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/10245/oatmeal-chocolate-coconut-chewy/
