RECIPE 963: Hello Dollies I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 dozen
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Bar Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups graham cracker crumbs
• ¼ cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• melted
• 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Combine the graham cracker crumbs, sugar and melted butter
3. Press into the bottom of an 9x9 inch baking pan
4. Layer the chocolate chips, coconut and pecans over the crumbs
5. Pour the sweetened condensed milk over the top
6. Bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 25 to 30 minutes
7. Let cool and cut into squares

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 16%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 100mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 55mg 4%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 127mg 3%

RECIPE 964: Haystacks I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 4 dozen
Rating: 4.4/5

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups white sugar
• ⅓ cup unsweetened cocoa powder

• 1 pinch salt

RECIPE 965: Cream Cheese Fruit Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Apple Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• ¼ cup white sugar
• or to taste
• 1 (12 ounce) container frozen whipped topping
• thawed
• 3 bananas
• peeled and sliced
• 1 (15.25 ounce) can crushed pineapple
• drained
• 1 (15.25 ounce) can fruit cocktail
• drained
• 1 large Jonagold apple
• peeled and chopped
• ½ cup sweetened flaked coconut
• 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries
• drained and halved (Optional)
• ½ cup chopped pecans (Optional)
• ½ cup golden raisins (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Beat the cream cheese and sugar together in a large bowl
2. On high speed, beat in the whipped topping
3. Fold in the bananas, pineapple, fruit cocktail, apple, and coconut
4. If desired, mix in the maraschino cherries, pecans, and raisins
5. Pour the salad into a serving bowl, and chill 1 hour before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 27g 35%, Saturated Fat 17g 86%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 111mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 61g 22%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 46g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 12mg 61%, Calcium 54mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 486mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/137346/cream-cheese-fruit-salad/

RECIPE 966: Coconut Oil Popcorn
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 large servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Snacks/Popcorn Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 tablespoons coconut oil
• ¼ cup unpopped popcorn
• sea salt to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place popcorn and oil in a 3-quart pot over medium heat and cover the pot with a lid
2. Shake the pot constantly as popcorn pops
3. When popping slows to a few seconds in-between pops, after about 3 to 5 minutes, remove pot from heat and pour popcorn into a large bowl
4. Season with sea salt

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 13g 63%, Sodium 161mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 0g, Protein 3g, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 74mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/241449/coconut-oil-popcorn/

RECIPE 967: Thirty Day Friendship Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 2 9x13-inch cakes
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 19 days 19 hrs 2 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups Friendship Fruit Starter
• 1 (15 ounce) can sliced peaches with juice
• 2 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 (15 ounce) can pineapple chunks with juice
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 (10 ounce) jars maraschino cherries
• 2 ½ cups white sugar
• 2 (18.25 ounce) packages yellow cake mix
• 2 (3.4 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix
• 1 ⅓ cups vegetable oil
• 8 eggs
• 2 cups golden raisins
• 2 cups chopped walnuts
• 2 cups flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Day One: In a large glass jar or bowl, combine 2 cups of the starter with 1 can of the sliced peaches and their juice (each slice chopped into 4 pieces)
2. Add 2 1/2 cups of the white sugar and stir once every day for 10 days
3. When not stirring mixture, keep it covered with a paper towel, foil, or a loose lid
4. Let sit at room temperature
5. Don't refrigerate it or cover it airtight
6. A pan of water underneath the jar or bowl will keep the ants out
7. Day Ten: Add 1 can of chunk pineapple and its juice
8. Cut each chunk of pineapple in half
9. Stir in 1/2 cup of white sugar
10. Stir once everyday for 10 days
11. The color should change, and the mixture should foam when stirred
12. Day Twenty: Slice each cherry in half, and stir in
13. Add 2 1/2 cups of the white sugar
14. Stir once every day for the final 10 days
15. The cherries will give the juice back its pinkish color
16. Day Thirty: Drain fruit and reserve it and the liquid
17. The fruit will be used in the cake
18. Pour the liquid into 3 glass or ceramic pint jars
19. One for you to start your next cake, and two for friends
20. Cake must be started within 3 days after receiving the starter, or you should freeze the starter to use at a later date
21. Do not use plastic or metal containers to store liquid! Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
22. Grease and flour two 9x13-inch baking pans
23. It's best to mix the two cakes separately
24. Combine 1 box of the cake mix, 1 box of the instant vanilla pudding, 2/3 cup of the vegetable oil, and 4 of the eggs
25. Stir, then add 1/2 of the drained reserved fruit from the starter
26. Stir, then add 1 cup of the golden raisins, 1 cup of the chopped nuts and 1 cup of the coconut
27. Stir until all ingredients are combined
28. The batter will be stiff
29. Pour batter into the prepared cake pan
30. Repeat for cake number two
31. Bake cakes at in the preheated oven for 55 to 65 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 17%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 220mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 20%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 39g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 45mg 3%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 121mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7900/thirty-day-friendship-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 968: Granola Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Snacks/Granola Bar Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• cooking spray
• 2 cups rolled oats
• ½ cup shredded coconut
• ½ cup honey
• 2 tablespoons creamy peanut butter
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ⅛ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9-inch square baking dish
3. Spread oats and coconut evenly across a baking sheet
4. Toast oats and coconut in the preheated oven until browned, about 10 minutes; transfer to a large mixing bowl
5. Mix honey, peanut butter, vanilla, and salt in a saucepan over medium-low heat
6. Cook and stir until smooth
7. Pour honey mixture over oats and coconut
8. Stir to coat
9. Spread mixture evenly into the prepared baking dish
10. Bake in the preheated oven until beginning to dry, about 15 minutes for crunchy granola bars, less if you like them chewy
11. Cool completely before cutting

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Sodium 64mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 34g 13%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 14mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 128mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/223467/granola-bars/

============================================================

RECIPE 969: Earthquake Cake II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 1 - 9x13 inch pan
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cake Mix Cake Recipes/Coconut Cake/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 1 (18.25 ounce) package German chocolate cake mix
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• 4 cups confectioners' sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease the bottom and sides of one 9 x 13 inch baking pan
3. Layer coconut and pecans in the bottom of pan
4. Prepare cake mix according to package instructions and pour over pecans and coconut
5. Combine cream cheese, butter or margarine, vanilla and confectioners sugar and beat until smooth
6. Pour over cake mix
7. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 minutes
8. Toothpick will not come out clean

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 16%, Saturated Fat 6g 31%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 222mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 14%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 2g, Calcium 32mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 72mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8295/earthquake-cake-ii/

RECIPE 970: Coconut Jasmine Rice
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Rice Side Dish Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk
• 1 ¼ cups water
• 1 teaspoon white sugar
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 ½ cups jasmine rice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir coconut milk, water, sugar, and salt together in a saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves
2. Add rice and bring to a boil
3. Cover the saucepan, reduce the heat to low, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, 18 to 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 12g 62%, Sodium 10mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 1g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 13mg 1%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 144mg 3%

RECIPE 971: Umm Ali
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Cuisine/African/North African/Egyptian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (17.25 ounce) package frozen puff pastry
• thawed
• 5 cups milk
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ¼ cup raisins
• ¼ cup slivered almonds
• ¼ cup pine nuts
• ¼ cup chopped pistachio nuts
• ¼ cup sweetened
• flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Unroll the puff pastry sheets, and place flat on a baking sheet
3. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until puffed and golden brown
4. Break the puff pastry into pieces, and place in a large bowl
5. Add the raisins, almonds, pine nuts, pistachios, and coconut, and toss to distribute
6. Pour into a 9x13 inch glass baking dish, and spread evenly
7. Pour the milk into a saucepan, and stir in the sugar and vanilla
8. Heat until hot but not quite boiling
9. Pour over the mixture in the baking dish
10. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven
11. Turn the oven to broil, and broil for 2 minutes to brown the top
12. Remove from the oven and let stand for 5 minutes
13. Serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 33g 42%, Saturated Fat 9g 45%, Cholesterol 12mg 4%, Sodium 237mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 67g 24%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 37g, Protein 12g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 204mg 16%, Iron 2mg 13%, Potassium 406mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/73059/umm-ali/

============================================================

RECIPE 972: Lamingtons
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 servings
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 day 1 hrs 55 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Yellow Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 4 teaspoons baking powder
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup butter
• room temperature
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 eggs
• room temperature
• ½ cup milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour an 8x12-inch pan
3. Sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt
4. Beat 1/2 cup butter and 3/4 cup sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy
5. The mixture should be noticeably lighter in color
6. Add the room-temperature eggs one at a time, allowing each egg to blend into the butter mixture before adding the next
7. Beat in the vanilla with the last egg
8. Pour in the flour mixture alternately with the milk, mixing until just incorporated
9. Pour batter into the prepared pan
10. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean, 30 to 40 minutes
11. Let stand 5 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely
12. Wrap with plastic wrap and store overnight at room temperature to give the cake a chance to firm up before slicing
13. To make the icing: In a large bowl, combine confectioners' sugar and cocoa
14. Add the melted butter and warm milk and mix well to create a fluid, but not too runny, icing
15. Cut the cake into 24 squares
16. Place parchment paper or waxed paper on a work surface, and set a wire rack on the paper
17. Pour the shredded coconut into a shallow bowl
18. Using a fork, dip each square into the icing, coating all sides, then roll it in the coconut
19. Place onto rack to dry
20. Continue until all lamingtons are coated

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 14g 72%, Cholesterol 29mg 10%, Sodium 124mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 40g 15%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 80mg 6%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 154mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/17201/lamingtons/

============================================================

RECIPE 973: Coconut Pecan Frosting II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 2 1/2 cups
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Frostings and Icings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup evaporated milk
• 1 cup white sugar
• 3 egg yolks
• ½ cup butter
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 ½ cups flaked coconut
• 1 cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine milk, sugar, egg yolks, butter and vanilla
2. Cook, stirring frequently, until thickened
3. Remove from heat and stir in coconut and pecans

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 20g 25%, Saturated Fat 9g 46%, Cholesterol 78mg 26%, Sodium 105mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 70mg 5%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 142mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/26014/coconut-pecan-frosting-ii/

RECIPE 974: Bionicos (Mexican Fruit Bowls)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 fruit bowls
Prep Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/Apple Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅓ cup plain yogurt
• ⅓ cup sweetened condensed milk
• ⅓ cup Mexican crema
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix yogurt, sweetened condensed milk, and crema in a bowl
2. Add vanilla extract and stir until well incorporated
3. Divide cantaloupe, papaya, apple, and banana among 4 individual bowls, arranging them in separate sections
4. Place strawberries in the center of each bowl
5. Top each bowl with 1/8 cup each granola, raisins, and coconut
6. Drizzle 1/4 cup of the crema mixture over each fruit bowl

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 975: Queen Elizabeth Cake I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 9 to 13 x inch cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/UK and Ireland/English/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup boiling water
• 1 cup dates
• pitted and chopped
• ¼ cup butter
• softened
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• ⅔ cup packed brown sugar
• 6 tablespoons butter
• ¼ cup cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Pour boiling water over dates in a small bowl, and let stand until cool
2. Measure flour, baking powder, soda, salt, and nuts into a small bowl
3. Stir to mix
4. Cream 1/4 cup butter or margarine and white sugar together in a mixing bowl; beat in egg and vanilla
5. Add flour mixture to creamed mixture in three parts alternately with date mixture in two parts, beginning and ending with dry mixture
6. Spread batter into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan
7. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 to 40 minutes, or until an inserted wooden pick comes out clean
8. To Make Topping: Mix coconut, brown sugar, 6 tablespoons butter and cream in a small saucepan over medium heat
9. Boil for three minutes
10. Spread over warm cake, and brown under broiler

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 9g 47%, Cholesterol 48mg 16%, Sodium 340mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 54g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 39g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 54mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 170mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7666/queen-elizabeth-cake-i/

RECIPE 976: Sweet Coconut Rice
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Side Dish/Rice Side Dish Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups long-grain white rice
• 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk
• 1 ¼ cups water
• 1 teaspoon white sugar
• or more to taste
• 1 tablespoon shredded coconut
• or to taste (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir rice, coconut milk, and water together in a saucepan
2. Dissolve sugar into the liquid
3. Bring the mixture to a simmer, reduce heat to medium-low, place a cover on the saucepan, and simmer until the majority of the liquid has been absorbed by the rice, 15 to 20 minutes
4. Leaving saucepan on the burner, turn heat off and let rice steam until sticky, about 5 to 10 minutes more
5. Garnish with shredded coconut

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 22g 28%, Saturated Fat 19g 95%, Sodium 22mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 60g 22%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 39mg 3%, Iron 6mg 34%, Potassium 300mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/237021/sweet-coconut-rice/

RECIPE 977: Coconut Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 -9-inch pie
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• ½ cup butter
• 3 eggs
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup milk
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch single crust pie

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix flour with sugar
2. Cream in butter and eggs
3. Mix in vanilla and milk until well combined
4. Fold in coconut
5. Pour into prepared pie crust
6. Bake at 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) for one hour
7. Cool completely before cutting

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 978: Coconut Cream Pie I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/No-Bake Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (9 inch) pie shell
• baked
• 1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix
• 1 ½ cups milk
• 1 ½ cups flaked coconut
• 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping
• thawed

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large bowl, combine the pudding mix and milk until the pudding mixture thickens
2. Fold 1 cup of coconut and half of the nondairy whipped topping into the pudding
3. Pour the combination into the prepared pie crust
4. Spread the remainder of the nondairy whipped topping on top of the pie
5. Sprinkle with the remainder of the coconut
6. Refrigerate, and serve chilled

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 979: Instant Pot Coconut Curry Chicken
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Chicken/Chicken Breast/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 tablespoon coconut oil
• 1 medium onion
• chopped
• 3 tablespoons curry powder
• or to taste
• divided
• 2 cloves garlic
• chopped
• 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes
• drained
• 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce
• ½ cup chicken broth
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 2 pounds chicken breasts
• salt to taste
• ground black pepper to taste
• 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Sauté function
2. Add coconut oil; when hot, add onion and cook for 1 minute
3. Add 2 tablespoons curry powder and garlic
4. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes
5. Turn off Sauté function
6. Stir in diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, chicken broth, and sugar
7. Poke holes into each chicken breast using a fork
8. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and remaining curry powder
9. Add seasoned chicken to the pot
10. Close and lock the lid
11. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 10 minutes
12. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
13. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions for 10 minutes
14. Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes
15. Unlock and remove the lid
16. Remove chicken; use 2 forks to shred the meat and return it to the pot
17. Turn on Sauté function; cook and stir until liquid is lightly boiling, 2 to 3 minutes
18. Turn the pressure cooker to the Keep Warm setting
19. Add coconut milk and stir well; cook for 10 minutes more to allow flavors to come together

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 31g 39%, Saturated Fat 23g 116%, Cholesterol 130mg 43%, Sodium 766mg 33%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 5g 18%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 52g, Vitamin C 16mg 78%, Calcium 114mg 9%, Iron 9mg 51%, Potassium 1038mg 22%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/263511/instant-pot-coconut-curry-chicken/

============================================================

RECIPE 980: Coconut Lime Rice
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Yield: 2 cups
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Rice Side Dish Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup basmati rice
• 1 tablespoon coconut oil
• 1 teaspoon butter
• ¼ cup flaked coconut
• 1 cup coconut milk
• 1 cup chicken broth
• salt
• to taste
• 1 lime
• zested and juiced
• ground black pepper
• to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Rinse rice until the water runs clear; drain
2. Heat coconut oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat
3. Cook and stir rice and coconut flakes for 3 to 4 minutes
4. Stir in the lime juice, then add the coconut milk, chicken broth, salt and lime zest
5. Bring to a low boil, then cover and reduce heat to low
6. Cook for 20 minutes
7. Remove from heat and keep covered for 5 minutes
8. Fluff with fork and season with pepper

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 37g 47%, Saturated Fat 32g 159%, Cholesterol 5mg 2%, Sodium 56mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 85g 31%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 11mg 56%, Calcium 42mg 3%, Iron 5mg 26%, Potassium 323mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/202656/coconut-lime-rice/

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 7
Yield: 6 to 8 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Side Dish/Rice Side Dish Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups Basmati rice
• 4 (10 ounce) cans coconut milk
• 1 pinch salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a large saucepan over high heat, combine rice, coconut milk and salt; bring to a boil
2. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 33g 43%, Saturated Fat 29g 145%, Sodium 20mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 0g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 32mg 2%, Iron 5mg 29%, Potassium 334mg 7%

RECIPE 982: Flan de Coco (Coconut Flan)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 9 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/Flan Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk
• ½ cup milk
• 6 eggs
• ½ cup fresh shredded coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Place 1 cup of the sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat
3. Cook gently, without stirring, but shaking occasionally until the sugar has melted
4. Continue cooking until the sugar has completely melted, and turned golden brown
5. Pour into a large, glass baking dish
6. Spread the caramel evenly over the bottom of the dish, then set aside to cool for 15 minutes before proceeding
7. Once the caramel has hardened, pour the condensed milk, evaporated milk, milk, eggs, 1/2 cup sugar, and coconut into a blender
8. Blend for 3 minutes until smooth
9. Pour into baking dish over the caramel
10. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes until set
11. When done, remove from oven and let cool for 30 minutes
12. Run a knife around the edges of the dish to separate the flan from the sides
13. Refrigerate overnight

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 12%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 114mg 38%, Sodium 115mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 47g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 2mg 8%, Calcium 201mg 15%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 278mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/108362/flan-de-coco-coconut-flan/

============================================================

RECIPE 983: Sweet Coconut Oatmeal
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 3
Yield: 3 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Cereals/Oatmeal Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk
• 1 cup rolled oats
• 2 tablespoons honey
• ¼ cup coconut flakes (Optional)
• 2 tablespoons brown sugar
• or more to taste
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring coconut milk to a gentle boil in a small saucepan over medium-low heat
2. Stir in oats and honey; lower heat and simmer until milk has mostly been absorbed, about 15 minutes
3. Sprinkle coconut flakes, brown sugar, and cinnamon into oatmeal
4. Cook until oats are creamy and flavors are combined, about 5 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 35g 44%, Saturated Fat 30g 148%, Sodium 25mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 6g 21%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 2mg 8%, Calcium 56mg 4%, Iron 6mg 33%, Potassium 450mg 10%

RECIPE 984: No Crust Coconut Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 pie
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Custard and Cream Pies/Coconut Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 eggs
• beaten
• ¼ cup butter
• ½ cup self-rising flour
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 ¾ cups white sugar
• 2 cups milk
• 7 ounces flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. In a large bowl, combine eggs, butter or margarine, flour, vanilla, sugar, milk and coconut
3. Pour into 10 inch deep dish pie plate
4. Bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 30 to 40 minutes
5. Crust will form on the bottom

RECIPE 985: Coconut Coconut Milk Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Coconut Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• 4 eggs
• separated
• 1 cup unsweetened shredded coconut
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 tablespoons baking powder
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13-inch cake pan
3. Beat sugar, butter, and egg yolks together in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy; add shredded coconut
4. Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl
5. Stir creamed butter mixture, alternating with coconut milk, into flour mixture until batter is just mixed
6. Beat egg whites in a glass or metal bowl until until soft peaks form
7. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the egg whites will form soft mounds rather than a sharp peak
8. Fold egg whites into batter
9. Pour batter into the prepared cake pan
10. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean, about 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 19%, Saturated Fat 10g 52%, Cholesterol 51mg 17%, Sodium 289mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 26g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 80mg 6%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 82mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/237023/coconut-coconut-milk-cake/

RECIPE 987: Creamy Coconut Milk Rice Pudding
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Custards and Puddings/Rice/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups water
• 1 ½ cups basmati rice
• 3 cups coconut milk
• 1 ½ cups raw sugar
• ½ teaspoon sea salt
• 1 cup whole milk
• 2 eggs
• beaten
• ¼ cup unsalted butter
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 1 (15 ounce) can sliced peaches
• drained and chopped (Optional)
• 1 cup raisins
• or more to taste (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan
2. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, about 20 minutes
3. Combine rice, coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a large saucepan; bring to a boil
4. Reduce heat and simmer until pudding is thick and creamy, 18 to 20 minutes
5. Stir milk and eggs into pudding, stirring constantly to keep pudding from sticking, at least 2 minutes
6. Remove pudding from heat and stir in butter, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg until thoroughly mixed
7. Fold peaches and raisins into pudding; serve warm

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 17g 84%, Cholesterol 52mg 17%, Sodium 138mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 72g 26%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 44g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 3mg 14%, Calcium 92mg 7%, Iron 5mg 26%, Potassium 484mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/234371/creamy-coconut-milk-rice-pudding/

RECIPE 988: Mango Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 2 8x4x2-inch loaves
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Breakfast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking soda
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 3 eggs
• ¾ cup softened butter
• 1 ¼ cups white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 cups chopped mango
• ½ cup shredded coconut
• ¼ cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour 2 loaf pans
3. Sift flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together in a large bowl; make a well in the center
4. Whisk eggs, butter, sugar, and vanilla extract together in a separate bowl
5. Fold mango, coconut, and walnuts into the egg mixture; pour resulting mixture into the well in the center of the flour and mix well
6. Pour batter into prepared loaf pans and let sit at room temperature for 20 minutes
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour
8. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 58mg 19%, Sodium 312mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 20g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 6mg 29%, Calcium 17mg 1%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 83mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/222325/mango-bread/

RECIPE 989: Chewy Coconut Bibingka (Filipino Rice Cake)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 24 servings
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Cuisine/Asian/Filipino/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (13.5 ounce) can coconut milk
• 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
• 1 stick butter
• melted
• 4 eggs
• 2 (12 ounce) jars macapuno strings in heavy syrup
• 2 ½ cups sweet rice flour (mochiko)
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Butter a 12x17-inch rimmed baking sheet
3. Beat condensed milk, coconut milk, and melted butter together in a large mixing bowl until combined
4. Add eggs, 1 at a time, and beat until combined
5. Add macapuno, 1 jar at a time, and beat until combined
6. Gradually beat in mochiko flour
7. Beat in brown sugar; beat in vanilla extract
8. Pour batter onto the prepared baking sheet
9. Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown and sides are slightly dark brown, 45 to 50 minutes
10. Allow to cool, about 20 minutes, before loosening the sides and cutting into squares

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 47mg 16%, Sodium 70mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 50g 18%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 65mg 5%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 126mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/269034/chewy-coconut-bibingka-filipino-rice-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 990: Ono Butter Mochi
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 - 9x13 inch pan
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pound mochiko (glutinous rice flour)
• 2 ½ cups white sugar
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ cup butter
• melted
• 3 cups whole milk
• 5 eggs
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup sweetened
• flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish
3. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, vanilla and milk
4. In a separate larger bowl, stir together the rice flour, sugar, and baking powder
5. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, and stir to blend
6. Mix in melted butter and coconut
7. Pour into the prepared pan
8. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven
9. Cool completely, then cut into squares to serve

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 8g 42%, Cholesterol 104mg 35%, Sodium 156mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 78g 28%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 47g, Protein 7g, Calcium 104mg 8%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 170mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/84857/ono-butter-mochi/

RECIPE 991: Swedish Chocolate Balls (or Coconut Balls)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 48 servings
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/Scandinavian/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups regular rolled oats
• 1 ¼ cups white sugar
• ½ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
• 1 cup butter or margarine
• softened
• 2 tablespoons strong coffee
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 (1 ounce) squares unsweetened baking chocolate
• melted
• ⅓ cup coconut flakes

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix the oats, sugar, and cocoa together in a bowl
2. Add the butter, and use your hands to mix the ingredients together to make a thick dough
3. Mix in the coffee, vanilla, and chocolate until thoroughly blended
4. Place the coconut flakes in a small bowl
5. Pinch off small amounts of dough and roll between your hands to make small balls, about 1-1/2 inches in diameter
6. Roll the balls in the coconut flakes
7. Balls are ready to eat, or may be refrigerated 2 hours to become firmer

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 3g 16%, Cholesterol 10mg 3%, Sodium 30mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 1g, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 51mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/150106/swedish-chocolate-balls-or-coconut-balls/

============================================================

RECIPE 992: Willard Family German Chocolate Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 3-layer cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Chocolate Cake Recipes/German Chocolate Cake/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (4 ounce) package sweet baking chocolate (such as Baker's German's Sweet Chocolate®) - broken into pieces
• ½ cup boiling water
• 1 cup margarine
• softened
• 2 cups white sugar
• 4 eggs
• separated
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 ½ cups sifted all purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup buttermilk
• 1 cup evaporated milk
• 1 cup white sugar
• 3 egg yolks
• ¼ cup margarine
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 ⅓ cups sweetened flake coconut
• 1 cup chopped pecans

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour 3 8-inch cake pans and line bottoms with parchment paper
3. Place the chunks of chocolate into the boiling water and stir until the chocolate has melted; set aside to cool
4. In a large bowl, beat 1 cup of softened margarine with 2 cups of sugar with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
5. Stir in 4 egg yolks, one at a time, beating well after each addition
6. Beat in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract and the chocolate-water mixture until thoroughly blended
7. Sift the flour, baking soda, and salt into a bowl
8. Beat the flour mixture into the liquid ingredients, alternating with buttermilk, in 3 or 4 additions
9. Beat until batter is smooth, about 1 minute
10. In a metal or glass bowl, beat the reserved egg whites until they hold stiff peaks when the beaters are lifted straight up
11. Gently fold the beaten egg whites into the batter, keeping as much volume as possible
12. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pans
13. Bake in the preheated oven until the cakes have browned lightly and a toothpick inserted into the center of a cake comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes
14. Allow the cakes to cool in pans before removing
15. To make frosting, pour the evaporated milk into a large saucepan, and mix in 1 cup of sugar, 3 egg yolks, 1/4 cup of margarine, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
16. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium, and cook until thickened, stirring constantly, about 12 minutes
17. Remove from heat, and mix in the coconut and pecans, beating the frosting until cooled and spreadable
18. Frost and fill the cake with the coconut frosting

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 42g 54%, Saturated Fat 11g 57%, Cholesterol 144mg 48%, Sodium 617mg 27%, Total Carbohydrate 102g 37%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 74g, Protein 12g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 134mg 10%, Iron 3mg 16%, Potassium 274mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/219065/willard-family-german-chocolate-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 993: Coconut Cream Pound Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 10-inch tube cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 45 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Wedding Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• 3 cups white sugar
• 6 eggs
• 1 teaspoon coconut extract
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• 2 cups flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan
3. Beat butter and cream cheese together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until blended; add sugar and beat until light and fluffy
4. Blend in eggs one at a time, then stir in coconut extract
5. Mix in flour and baking powder until just moistened; stir in flaked coconut
6. Spoon batter into the prepared pan
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour 20 minutes
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes; run a table knife around the edges to loosen, then invert carefully onto a serving plate or cooling rack
9. Let cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 13g 67%, Cholesterol 116mg 39%, Sodium 192mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 61g 22%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 41g, Protein 6g, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 2mg 10%, Potassium 105mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/71003/coconut-cream-pound-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 994: No-Bake Chocolate-Oatmeal Drop Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 20 cookies
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/No-Bake Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup milk
• 2 cups white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• ½ cup cocoa powder
• 3 cups quick oats
• ½ cup shredded coconut
• ½ cup peanut butter
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix milk, sugar, butter, and cocoa powder in a large saucepan and bring to a rolling boil
2. Boil, stirring frequently, for about 1 minute
3. Remove from heat and add oats, coconut, peanut butter, and vanilla
4. Mix thoroughly
5. Drop tablespoon-sized balls of cookie dough onto waxed paper and let cool in refrigerator for at least 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Cholesterol 13mg 4%, Sodium 72mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 32g 12%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 4g, Calcium 21mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 138mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/274285/no-bake-chocolate-oatmeal-drop-cookies/

RECIPE 995: Guyanese Coconut Buns
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 dozen
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup butter
• cut into pieces
• 2 eggs
• ½ cup milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ½ teaspoon almond extract
• ¾ cup flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. In a large bowl, stir together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt
3. Add butter, and cut in using a pastry blender or a fork until the mixture resembles fine crumbs
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and almond extract
5. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients, and pour in the wet ingredients
6. Add coconut, and mix just enough to blend
7. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets
8. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 7g 34%, Cholesterol 36mg 12%, Sodium 133mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 17g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 24mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 43mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/83218/guyanese-coconut-buns/

RECIPE 996: Limber de Coco (Coconut Ice)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/Latin American/Caribbean/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ (14 ounce) can coconut milk
• ½ (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix coconut milk, evaporated milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and cinnamon together in a bowl or blender until sugar dissolves and mixture is thoroughly combined
2. Pour mixture into ice trays or popsicle molds
3. Freeze 8 hours to overnight

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 14g 18%, Saturated Fat 11g 57%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 57mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 135mg 10%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 254mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/274460/limber-de-coco-coconut-ice/

RECIPE 997: Coconut-Cream Cheese Frosting
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 5 1/2 cups
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Frostings and Icings/Cream Cheese/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 4 cups confectioners' sugar
• 2 tablespoons heavy cream
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon coconut flavoring
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ½ cup sweetened shredded coconut
• 1 cup sweetened shredded coconut
• toasted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Beat the cream cheese and butter in a mixer bowl until light and fluffy
2. Gradually add the confectioners' sugar, one cup at a time, alternating with heavy cream
3. Beat in the salt, coconut flavoring, and vanilla extract
4. Continue beating until mixture is smooth and spreadable
5. Add additional confectioners' sugar if necessary to thicken the frosting, or more cream to thin
6. Stir in the coconut
7. If desired, spoon toasted coconut evenly over frosted cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 7g 36%, Cholesterol 27mg 9%, Sodium 109mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 28g 10%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 1g, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 37mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/142715/coconut-cream-cheese-frosting/

RECIPE 998: Anzac Biscuits (Australian Coconut-Oat Cookies)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 2 dozen
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/International Cookie Recipes/Australian Cookies/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup quick cooking oats
• ¾ cup flaked coconut
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• 1 tablespoon golden syrup
• 2 tablespoons boiling water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix oats, flour, sugar and coconut together
2. In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the syrup and butter together
3. Mix the soda and the boiling water and add to the melted butter and syrup
4. Add butter mixture to the dry ingredients
5. Drop by teaspoons on greased cookie sheets (or baking paper)
6. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 18 to 20 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 12%, Saturated Fat 6g 31%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 174mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 19g, Protein 2g, Calcium 8mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 55mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/9816/anzac-biscuits-australian-coconut-oat-cookies/

RECIPE 999: Cranberry Pumpkin Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 36
Yield: 3 dozen
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Pumpkin Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• 1 cup solid pack pumpkin puree
• 1 large egg
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup halved fresh cranberries
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• 1 tablespoon orange zest

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease two cookie sheets
3. Cream sugar and butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
4. Mix in pumpkin purée, egg, and vanilla
5. Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together into a medium bowl
6. Stir flour mixture into pumpkin mixture until well blended
7. Stir in cranberries, walnuts, and orange zest
8. Drop teaspoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheets
9. Bake in the preheated oven until the edges are golden, 10 to 12 minutes
10. Remove from the oven and transfer to wire racks to cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 2g 9%, Cholesterol 12mg 4%, Sodium 131mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 22mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 36mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/9707/cranberry-pumpkin-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 1000: To Die For Blueberry Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 large muffins
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/Blueberry Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ⅓ cup vegetable oil
• 1 egg
• ⅓ cup milk
• or more as needed
• 1 cup fresh blueberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease 8 muffin cups or line with paper liners
3. For the muffins: Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl
4. Pour oil into a small liquid measuring cup
5. Add egg and enough milk to reach the 1-cup mark; stir until combined
6. Pour into flour mixture and mix just until batter is combined
7. Fold in blueberries; set batter aside
8. For the crumb topping: Combine sugar, flour, butter, and cinnamon in a small bowl
9. Mix with a fork until crumbly
10. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling right to the top
11. Sprinkle with crumb topping
12. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 21%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 39mg 13%, Sodium 322mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 57g 21%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 34g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 95mg 7%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 73mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/6865/to-die-for-blueberry-muffins/

============================================================

RECIPE 1001: Perfect Summer Fruit Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Salad/Fruit Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅔ cup fresh orange juice
• ⅓ cup fresh lemon juice
• ⅓ cup packed brown sugar
• ½ teaspoon grated orange zest
• ½ teaspoon grated lemon zest
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. For the sauce: Bring orange juice, lemon juice, brown sugar, orange zest, and lemon zest to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat
2. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes
3. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract
4. Set aside to cool
5. For the salad: Layer fruit in a large, clear glass bowl in this order: pineapple, strawberries, kiwi fruit, bananas, oranges, grapes, and blueberries
6. Pour cooled sauce over fruit; cover and refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 39g 14%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 94mg 471%, Calcium 45mg 3%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 451mg 10%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/214947/perfect-summer-fruit-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 1002: Strawberry Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 40
Yield: 5 cups
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds fresh strawberries
• hulled
• 4 cups white sugar
• ¼ cup lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Crush strawberries in a wide bowl in batches until you have 4 cups of mashed berries
2. Combine mashed strawberries, sugar, and lemon juice in a heavy-bottomed saucepan; stir over low heat until sugar is dissolved
3. Increase heat to high, and bring the mixture to a full rolling boil
4. Continue to boil, stirring often, until the mixture reaches 220 degrees F (105 degrees C)
5. Check doneness after 10 to 15 minutes by dropping a small spoonful of jam onto a frozen plate
6. Let sit for 1 to 2 minutes; if jam appears to gel, it is ready
7. Continue cooking if jam appears thin and runny
8. Transfer jam into hot sterile jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top
9. Top with lids and screw rings on tightly
10. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill it halfway with water
11. Bring to a boil and lower jars 2 inches apart into the boiling water using a holder
12. Pour in more boiling water to cover jars by at least 1 inch
13. Bring to a rolling boil, cover, and process for 10 minutes
14. Remove the jars from the stockpot and let rest, several inches apart, for 12 to 24 hours
15. Store in a cool, dark area

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 14mg 70%, Calcium 4mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 37mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/38410/strawberry-jam/

============================================================

RECIPE 1003: Strawberry Pretzel Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x13-inch dish
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 2 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Strawberry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups crushed pretzels
• ¾ cup butter
• melted
• 3 tablespoons white sugar
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping
• thawed
• 2 (3 ounce) packages strawberry flavored Jell-O®
• 2 cups boiling water
• 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen strawberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Stir crushed pretzels, melted butter, and 3 tablespoons sugar together until well-combined; mix well and press mixture into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish
3. Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 8 to 10 minutes; set aside to cool
4. Place cream cheese and 1 cup sugar in a large bowl
5. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth; fold in whipped topping
6. Spread mixture onto cooled crust
7. Dissolve gelatin in boiling water
8. Stir in still-frozen strawberries and allow to set briefly
9. Pour and spread over cream cheese layer; refrigerate until set, at least 2 hours
10. Humblepieliving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 23g 30%, Saturated Fat 16g 78%, Cholesterol 51mg 17%, Sodium 442mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 52g 19%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 38g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 19mg 96%, Calcium 33mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 119mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/20338/strawberry-pretzel-salad/

============================================================

RECIPE 1004: Homemade Blueberry Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 pie
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Blueberry Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 4 cups fresh blueberries
• 1 (14.1 ounce) package double-crust pie pastry
• thawed
• 1 tablespoon butter

DIRECTIONS:
1. Set an oven rack to the lowest position and preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Mix sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and salt together in a bowl; sprinkle over blueberries
3. Line a pie dish with one pie crust
4. Pour berry mixture into the crust and dot with butter
5. Cut remaining pastry into 1/2- to 3/4-inch-wide strips
6. Use the strips to weave a lattice top
7. Crimp and flute the edges
8. Bake pie on the lowest oven rack until filling is bubbling and crust is golden brown, about 50 minutes. justamom

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 318mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 53g 19%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 7mg 35%, Calcium 11mg 1%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 86mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12196/blueberry-pie/

RECIPE 1005: Supreme Strawberry Topping
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Dessert Sauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pint fresh strawberries
• hulled and halved
• ⅓ cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine strawberries, sugar, and vanilla in a saucepan over medium-high heat
2. Cook, stirring occasionally, until mixture sizzles and juice begins to form
3. Continue stirring; mash a few strawberries with a wooden spoon or heat-proof spatula to help produce the syrup
4. Cook until sauce thickens, about 15 minutes
5. Remove from the heat
6. Transfer 1/3 of the strawberry sauce to a blender
7. Cover and hold the lid down with a potholder while you puree the mixture
8. Add pureed mixture back into the remaining sauce and stir until blended
9. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 24g 9%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 53mg 263%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 139mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/43914/supreme-strawberry-topping/

RECIPE 1006: Crustless Cranberry Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Cranberry Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 cup white sugar
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 2 cups cranberries
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• ½ cup butter
• melted
• 2 large eggs
• beaten
• 1 teaspoon almond extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease a 9-inch pie pan
3. Combine flour, sugar, and salt in a bowl
4. Add cranberries and walnuts, and toss to coat
5. Stir in melted butter, beaten eggs, and almond extract
6. Spread the batter into the prepared pan
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted near the center comes our clean, about 40 minutes
8. Victoria Jempty/Allrecipes

RECIPE 1007: Apple-Cranberry Crisp
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8-inch crisp
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Crisps and Crumbles Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 pounds Granny Smith apples - peeled
• cored and thinly sliced
• ¾ cup cranberries
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C.) Butter an 8-inch square baking dish
2. Mix apples, cranberries, white sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large bowl
3. Place in an even layer in the prepared baking dish
4. In the same bowl, combine oats, flour, and brown sugar for topping
5. Add butter pieces and mix with a fork until crumbly
6. Stir in pecans
7. Sprinkle topping over apples in the baking dish
8. Bake in the preheated oven until apples are tender and topping is golden brown, 40 to 50 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 47mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 16%, Dietary Fiber 4g 16%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 7mg 36%, Calcium 37mg 3%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 207mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/41893/apple-cranberry-crisp/

RECIPE 1008: Blueberry Smoothie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 5 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Smoothie Recipes/Blueberry/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup blueberries (frozen or fresh)
• 1 (8 ounce) container plain yogurt
• ¾ cup 2% reduced-fat milk
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• ⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg

DIRECTIONS:
1. Blend blueberries, yogurt, milk, sugar, vanilla, and nutmeg in a blender until frothy, scraping down the sides of the blender if needed
2. Divide between 2 glasses and serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 118mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 8mg 41%, Calcium 320mg 25%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 461mg 10%

RECIPE 1009: Baked Oatmeal
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Cereals/Oatmeal Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 cups rolled oats
• 1 cup brown sugar
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 2 eggs
• 1 cup milk
• ½ cup melted butter
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• ¾ cup dried cranberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Mix together oats, brown sugar, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl
3. Beat in eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract
4. Stir in dried cranberries
5. Spread into a 9x13-inch baking dish
6. Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden, about 40 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 20%, Saturated Fat 8g 42%, Cholesterol 79mg 26%, Sodium 502mg 22%, Total Carbohydrate 59g 22%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 36g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 140mg 11%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 217mg 5%

RECIPE 1010: Strawberry Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Strawberry Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 quart fresh strawberries
• hulled
• 1 (9 inch) pie crust
• baked
• 1 cup white sugar
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• ¾ cup water
• ½ cup heavy whipping cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Arrange 1/2 of strawberries in baked pastry shell
2. Place remaining strawberries in a medium saucepan
3. Add sugar to the strawberries in the saucepan; place over medium heat and bring to a boil, stirring frequently
4. Whisk cornstarch and water together in a small bowl
5. Gradually stir cornstarch mixture into boiling strawberry mixture
6. Reduce heat and simmer mixture until thickened, about 10 minutes, stirring constantly
7. Pour cooked strawberry mixture over berries in pastry shell
8. Refrigerate until chilled and set, at least 3 hours
9. Before serving, whip cream in a medium bowl until soft peaks form
10. Serve each slice of pie with a dollop of whipped cream

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 109mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 45mg 226%, Calcium 26mg 2%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 147mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15836/strawberry-pie-ii/

============================================================

RECIPE 1011: Blackberry Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 40 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Blackberry Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups fresh blackberries
• ¾ cup white sugar
• divided
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 (9 inch) double crust ready-to-use pie crust
• 2 tablespoons milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
2. Combine 3 1/2 cups of blackberries with 1/2 cup sugar and flour in a large bowl
3. Spoon mixture into the unbaked pie crust
4. Spread remaining 1/2 cup berries on top of sweetened berries, and cover with the top crust
5. Seal and crimp the edges, and cut vents in the top crust for steam to escape
6. Brush the top crust with milk and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup sugar
7. Bake pie in the preheated oven for 15 minutes
8. Reduce the temperature of the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and bake until filling is bubbly and crust is golden brown, an additional 20 to 25 minutes
9. Cool on wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 10%, Saturated Fat 2g 10%, Cholesterol 0mg 0%, Sodium 119mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 5g 16%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 15mg 76%, Calcium 29mg 2%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 145mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12284/blackberry-pie-i/

RECIPE 1012: Easy Cranberry Orange Relish
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Relish Recipes/Cranberry Relish Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 medium navel orange
• 1 (12 ounce) package fresh cranberries
• ½ cup white sugar
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Grate 2 teaspoons of zest from orange; discard remaining peel and pith from orange
2. Divide orange into sections
3. Place orange sections, 2 teaspoons orange zest, cranberries, sugar, and cinnamon in a food processor; pulse until finely chopped
4. Transfer relish to a bowl
5. Cover and refrigerate until flavors have blended, at least 2 hours and up to 3 days

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 20g 7%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 16mg 80%, Calcium 11mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 65mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/229740/easy-cranberry-orange-relish/

============================================================

RECIPE 1013: Overnight Blueberry French Toast
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 9x13-inch casserole
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 55 mins
Total Time: 9 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/French Toast Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 12 slices day-old bread
• cut into 1-inch cubes
• 2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese
• cut into 1 inch cubes
• 1 cup fresh blueberries
• 12 eggs
• beaten
• 2 cups milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ⅓ cup maple syrup

DIRECTIONS:
1. Prepare casserole: Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish
2. Arrange 1/2 of the bread cubes in the dish and top with cream cheese cubes
3. Sprinkle blueberries over the cream cheese, then top with remaining bread cubes
4. Whisk eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and syrup together in a large bowl until well-combined; pour over the bread cubes
5. Cover and refrigerate overnight
6. Remove casserole from the refrigerator about 30 minutes before baking
7. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
8. Bake casserole in the preheated oven, covered, for 30 minutes
9. Uncover, and continue baking until center is firm and surface is lightly browned, about 25 to 30 minutes
10. Meanwhile, prepare blueberry sauce: Mix sugar, water, and cornstarch together in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, 3 to 4 minutes
11. Stir in blueberries, reduce heat to low, and simmer until all the blueberries burst, about 10 minutes
12. Stir in butter
13. Serve portions of casserole on plates and pour warm syrup over top
14. Melissa Goff

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 25g 32%, Saturated Fat 13g 67%, Cholesterol 279mg 93%, Sodium 451mg 20%, Total Carbohydrate 52g 19%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 15g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 180mg 14%, Iron 3mg 17%, Potassium 282mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15057/overnight-blueberry-french-toast/

============================================================

RECIPE 1014: Chocolate-Covered Strawberries
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Strawberry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 16 ounces milk chocolate chips
• 2 tablespoons shortening
• toothpicks
• 1 pound fresh strawberries with leaves

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt chocolate and shortening in a double boiler, stirring occasionally until smooth
2. Insert toothpicks into tops (stem ends) of strawberries
3. Hold a strawberry by the toothpick and dip it into the chocolate mixture
4. Turn the strawberry upside down and insert the toothpick into a Styrofoam block or place strawberry on a sheet of waxed paper; allow chocolate coating to cool
5. Repeat with remaining strawberries
6. Cathy Van de Moortele

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 6mg 2%, Sodium 31mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 13g 5%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 11mg 56%, Calcium 28mg 2%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 29mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/21712/chocolate-covered-strawberries/

============================================================

RECIPE 1015: Rhubarb and Strawberry Pie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 9-inch pie
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Pies/Fruit Pies/Rhubarb Pie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup all-purpose flour
• 1 pound rhubarb
• cut into 1/4 inch slices
• 2 pints strawberries
• hulled and quartered
• 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 1 large egg yolk
• 2 tablespoons white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. In a large bowl, mix flour and sugar
3. Add strawberries and chopped rhubarb
4. Toss with sugar and flour and let stand for 30 minutes
5. Pour filling into prepared pie crust
6. Dot top with butter, and cover with top crust
7. Seal edges of top and bottom crust with water
8. Apply yolk to top of pie, using a pastry brush
9. Sprinkle with sugar
10. Cut small holes in top to let steam escape
11. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C), for 35 to 40 minutes, or until bubbly and brown
12. Cool on rack. dotdash meredith food studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 6g 29%, Cholesterol 33mg 11%, Sodium 259mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 64g 23%, Dietary Fiber 5g 17%, Total Sugars 33g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 57mg 285%, Calcium 72mg 6%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 341mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12612/rhubarb-and-strawberry-pie/

------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 cup
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups fresh blueberries
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
• 1 pinch ground cinnamon (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix blueberries, sugar, lemon juice, and cinnamon in a saucepan
2. Cook, stirring constantly, over medium heat until thickened, about 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 4mg 20%, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 30mg 1%

RECIPE 1017: Melt in Your Mouth Blueberry Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 8-inch square cake
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 15 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Blueberry Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup butter
• ¾ cup white sugar
• divided
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 egg yolks
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ⅓ cup milk
• 1 ½ cups fresh blueberries
• 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
• 2 egg whites
• 1 tablespoon white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour an 8-inch pan
3. Beat butter and 1/2 cup sugar together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until soft and fluffy; mix in vanilla and salt
4. Add egg yolks and beat until creamy
5. Combine 1 1/2 cups flour and baking powder in a bowl; add alternately with milk to creamed mixture
6. Toss blueberries with 1 tablespoon flour in a small bowl
7. Add to the batter and fold in gently
8. Beat egg whites in a separate bowl until soft peaks form
9. Add remaining 1/4 cup of sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, and beat until stiff peaks form
10. Fold egg whites into cake batter
11. Pour batter into the prepared pan
12. Sprinkle remaining 1 tablespoon sugar over top
13. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 50 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 26%, Cholesterol 55mg 18%, Sodium 157mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 29g 11%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 2mg 9%, Calcium 40mg 3%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 57mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7358/melt-in-your-mouth-blueberry-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 1018: Raspberry and Almond Shortbread Thumbprints
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 36
Yield: 3 dozen
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Nut Dessert Recipes/Almond Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• ⅔ cup white sugar
• 1 ¼ teaspoons almond extract
• divided
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• ½ cup seedless raspberry jam
• ½ cup confectioners' sugar
• 1 teaspoon milk

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Beat butter and white sugar together in a medium bowl until creamy
3. Mix in 1/2 teaspoon almond extract
4. Add flour and mix until dough comes together
5. Form dough into 1 1/2-inch balls and place on ungreased cookie sheets about 2 inches apart
6. Use your thumb to press down and make a dent in the center of each ball, then fill with jam
7. Bake in batches the preheated oven until edges are lightly browned, about 14 to 18 minutes; allow to cool on cookie sheet for a few minutes
8. Mix confectioners' sugar, milk, and remaining 3/4 teaspoon almond extract together in a medium bowl until smooth; drizzle lightly over warm cookies
9. Victoria Jempty/Allrecipes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 37mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 1g, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 9mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/10222/raspberry-and-almond-shortbread-thumbprints/

============================================================

RECIPE 1019: Todd's Famous Blueberry Pancakes
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 12 pancakes
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Pancake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 tablespoon baking powder
• 1 ¼ teaspoons white sugar
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup milk
• 1 egg
• ½ tablespoon butter
• melted
• ½ cup frozen blueberries
• thawed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Sift flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt together in a large bowl
2. Combine milk and egg in a small bowl
3. Stir egg mixture into flour mixture until just combined
4. Stir in melted butter, then fold in blueberries
5. Set aside for 1 hour
6. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat
7. Pour or scoop the batter onto the hot griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake; cook until bubbles appear on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown on both sides

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 37mg 12%, Sodium 397mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 25g 9%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 4g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 150mg 12%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 108mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/20177/todds-famous-blueberry-pancakes/

============================================================

RECIPE 1020: Fresh Raspberry Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 3 cups
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 55 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Dessert Sauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ pounds fresh raspberries
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 tablespoon water
• or as needed (Optional)
• 2 teaspoons lemon juice
• or more to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine raspberries, sugar, water, and lemon juice in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until raspberries break down, sugar dissolves, and sauce is heated through, 3 to 7 minutes
2. Press sauce through a fine-mesh strainer to remove seeds
3. Cool to room temperature; cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, at least 45 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 15mg 73%, Calcium 13mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 88mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/241308/fresh-raspberry-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 1021: Strawberry Freezer Jam
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 80
Yield: 5 pints
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 1 day 30 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups crushed fresh strawberries
• 4 cups sugar
• 1 (1.75 ounce) package dry pectin
• ¾ cup water

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix crushed strawberries with sugar in a bowl, and let stand for 10 minutes
2. Meanwhile, stir pectin into water in a small saucepan
3. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, and boil for 1 minute
4. Stir boiling water into strawberries
5. Allow the mixture to stand for 3 minutes before pouring into clean jars or other storage containers, leaving a little space at the top to allow for expansion
6. Place tops on the containers, and leave out at room temperature for 24 hours
7. Place into freezer, and store frozen until ready to use

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 0mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 10g 4%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 10g, Vitamin C 3mg 17%, Calcium 1mg 0%, Potassium 9mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/51835/strawberry-freezer-jam/

============================================================

DIRECTIONS:

RECIPE 1024: Strawberry Spinach Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Spinach Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup olive oil
• ¼ cup distilled white vinegar
• 2 tablespoons sesame seeds
• 1 tablespoon poppy seeds
• 1 tablespoon minced onion
• ¼ teaspoon paprika
• ¼ teaspoon Worcestershire sauce

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make dressing: Whisk together sugar, oil, vinegar, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, onion, paprika, and Worcestershire in a medium bowl
2. Cover and chill for 1 hour
3. Make salad: Combine strawberries, spinach, and almonds in a large bowl
4. Pour dressing over salad; toss to coat
5. Refrigerate for 10 to 15 minutes before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 35g 45%, Saturated Fat 5g 23%, Sodium 63mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 43g 16%, Dietary Fiber 6g 22%, Total Sugars 34g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 110mg 552%, Calcium 191mg 15%, Iron 4mg 22%, Potassium 725mg 15%
