RECIPE 1026: Fruit Pizza
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 1 fruit pizza
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Specialty Dessert Recipes/Fruit Pizza Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon cream of tartar
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• 1 ¼ cups white sugar
• divided
• 1 large egg
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• ½ cup fresh blueberries
• or more to taste
• ½ cup sliced fresh strawberries
• or more to taste
• ½ cup sliced banana
• or more to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Make the cookie crust: Combine flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl and set aside
3. Cream together butter and 3/4 cup sugar until smooth in a large bowl
4. Add in egg and beat well
5. Stir dry ingredients into the creamed mixture until just blended
6. Press dough into an ungreased pizza pan
7. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes
8. Prepare the filling: Beat cream cheese with remaining 1/2 cup sugar and vanilla in a large bowl until light and fluffy
9. Spread evenly over the top of the cooled crust
10. Arrange blueberries, strawberries, and banana on top of the filling, and chill
11. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 18g 23%, Saturated Fat 11g 55%, Cholesterol 68mg 23%, Sodium 251mg 11%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 6mg 31%, Calcium 28mg 2%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 149mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/12604/fruit-pizza-i/

RECIPE 1028: Strawberry Shortcake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8-inch round cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Shortcake Recipes/Strawberry Shortcake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 pints fresh strawberries
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
• 4 teaspoons baking powder
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ⅓ cup shortening
• 1 egg
• ⅔ cup milk
• 2 cups whipped heavy cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Slice the strawberries and toss them with 1/2 cup of white sugar
2. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
3. Grease and flour one 8 inch round cake pan
4. In a medium bowl combine the flour, baking powder, 2 tablespoons white sugar and the salt
5. With a pastry blender cut in the shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
6. Make a well in the center and add the beaten egg and milk
7. Stir until just combined
8. Spread the batter into the prepared pan
9. Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown
10. Let cool partially in pan on wire rack
11. Slice partially cooled cake in half, making two layers
12. Place half of the strawberries on one layer and top with the other layer
13. Top with remaining strawberries and cover with the whipped cream
14. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 10g 48%, Cholesterol 66mg 22%, Sodium 347mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 55g 20%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 79mg 395%, Calcium 209mg 16%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 305mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8201/strawberry-shortcake/

============================================================

RECIPE 1029: Strawberry Cheesecake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Prep Time: 1 hrs
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 11 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cheesecake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ cups graham cracker crumbs
• ⅓ cup butter
• melted
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make crust: Combine graham cracker crumbs, butter, sugar, and cinnamon in a bowl; mix well
2. Press onto the bottom of an ungreased 9-inch springform pan
3. Place in the refrigerator to chill for 30 minutes
4. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
5. Make filling: Place strawberries and cornstarch into a blender
6. Cover and puree until smooth
7. Pour strawberry sauce into a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat
8. Boil and stir until sauce is thick and shiny, about 2 minutes
9. Set aside 1/3 cup strawberry sauce; cool
10. Cover and refrigerate remaining sauce for serving
11. Beat cream cheese in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy; gradually beat in condensed milk
12. Mix in lemon juice and vanilla extract, then beat in eggs on low speed until just combined
13. Pour 1/2 of the cream cheese mixture over crust; drop 1/2 of the reserved strawberry sauce by 1/2 teaspoonfuls on cream cheese layer
14. Carefully spoon remaining cream cheese mixture over sauce; drop remaining strawberry sauce by 1/2 teaspoonfuls on top
15. Cut through the top layer only with a knife to swirl strawberry sauce
16. Bake in the preheated oven until the center is almost set, 45 to 50 minutes
17. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes
18. Carefully run a knife around the edge of the pan to loosen; cool for 1 hour at room temperature
19. Refrigerate 8 hours to overnight before serving
20. Serve reserved strawberry sauce with cheesecake
21. If sauce is too thick, stir in water
22. Freakboy107

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 30g 38%, Saturated Fat 18g 90%, Cholesterol 133mg 44%, Sodium 315mg 14%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 34g, Protein 9g, Vitamin C 22mg 110%, Calcium 157mg 12%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 273mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/222588/strawberry-cheesecake/

============================================================

RECIPE 1031: Strawberry Cake Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 28
Yield: 3 to 3 1/2 cups
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 45 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fillings/Fruit Fillings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup water
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• 2 ½ cups frozen strawberries
• thawed and cut into bite size pieces
• ¾ cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Whisk water and cornstarch together in a large saucepan
2. Stir in strawberries and sugar
3. Cook over medium heat until thickened, about 10 minutes
4. Allow to cool completely before use

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 1032: The Ultimate Berry Crumble
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 2-quart baking dish
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Raspberry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¾ teaspoon baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon fine salt
• ¾ cup frozen unsalted butter
• 2 large egg yolks
• 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Make crumble: Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl
3. Whisk until thoroughly combined
4. Grate in frozen butter, stopping occasionally to toss butter into flour mixture until coated
5. Stir in egg yolks and vanilla with a fork until egg is mostly absorbed
6. Add 1 teaspoon vinegar; mix briefly
7. Use your hands to finish mixing, squeezing until clumps form, but mixture remains mostly dry
8. Add more vinegar if needed
9. Set crumble aside
10. Make filling: Combine blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries in another large bowl
11. Add sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, lemon zest, and cayenne pepper
12. Mix until well combined and sugar and cornstarch are mostly dissolved
13. Place about 1/2 of the crumble mixture into the bottom of a 2-quart baking dish
14. Press mixture down using a flat cup until well compacted
15. Spread berry filling on top
16. Sprinkle remaining crumble mixture over berries, squeezing some of the crumble into clumps
17. Bake in the preheated oven until top is beautifully browned and berry filling bubbles, 40 to 45 minutes
18. Let cool to room temperature before serving, about 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 19g 24%, Saturated Fat 11g 57%, Cholesterol 97mg 32%, Sodium 124mg 5%, Total Carbohydrate 58g 21%, Dietary Fiber 3g 12%, Total Sugars 31g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 10mg 52%, Calcium 51mg 4%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 114mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/264590/the-ultimate-berry-crumble/

============================================================

RECIPE 1033: B and L's Strawberry Smoothie
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 2
Prep Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 5 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Drinks Recipes/Smoothie Recipes/Strawberry/

INGREDIENTS:
• 8 strawberries
• hulled
• ½ cup skim milk
• ½ cup plain yogurt
• 3 tablespoons white sugar
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 6 cubes ice
• crushed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine strawberries, milk, yogurt, sugar, and vanilla in a blender
2. Add ice and blend until smooth and creamy
3. Pour into glasses and serve immediately

NUTRITION INFO:

RECIPE 1034: Creamy Strawberry Crepes
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 6
Yield: 12 filled crepes
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Crepes/Sweet/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup all-purpose flour
• ½ cup milk
• ½ cup water
• 3 eggs
• 3 tablespoons butter
• melted
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 ¼ cups sifted confectioners' sugar
• 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
• softened
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• 1 teaspoon lemon zest
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup heavy cream
• whipped
• 4 cups sliced strawberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place flour, milk, water, eggs, melted butter, and salt into a blender; blend until smooth and set aside
2. Beat confectioners' sugar, cream cheese, lemon juice, lemon zest, and vanilla with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth
3. Gently fold in whipped cream
4. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or non-stick skillet over medium heat
5. Pour or scoop batter onto the griddle, using approximately 2 tablespoons for each crepe
6. Tip and rotate the pan to spread batter as thinly as possible
7. Flip over when batter is set and edges begin to brown
8. Continue cooking until bottom begins to brown
9. Stack finished crepes on a plate; cover with a damp towel
10. Fill each crepe with 1/4 cup sliced strawberries and 1/3 cup cream cheese filling
11. Roll up and top with a dollop of cream cheese filling and more sliced strawberries
12. Christine Johanson

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 37g 47%, Saturated Fat 22g 111%, Cholesterol 205mg 68%, Sodium 406mg 18%, Total Carbohydrate 49g 18%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 32g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 62mg 312%, Calcium 115mg 9%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 319mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/143886/creamy-strawberry-crepes/

============================================================

RECIPE 1035: Awesome Sausage, Apple and Cranberry Stuffing
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Stuffing and Dressing Recipes/Sausage Stuffing and Dressing Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ¾ cups cubed white bread
• 1 ½ cups cubed whole wheat bread
• 1 pound ground turkey sausage
• 1 cup chopped onion
• ¾ cup chopped celery
• 2 ½ teaspoons dried sage
• 1 ½ teaspoons dried rosemary
• ½ teaspoon dried thyme
• 1 Golden Delicious apple
• cored and chopped
• ¾ cup dried cranberries
• ⅓ cup minced fresh parsley
• 1 cooked turkey liver
• finely chopped
• ¾ cup turkey stock
• 4 tablespoons unsalted butter
• melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Spread white and whole wheat bread cubes in a single layer on a large baking sheet
3. Bake in the preheated oven until evenly toasted, 5 to 7 minutes
4. Transfer toasted bread cubes to a large bowl
5. Cook sausage and onions in a large skillet over medium heat, stirring and breaking up lumps, until evenly browned, 6 to 8 minutes
6. Add celery, sage, rosemary, and thyme; cook and stir until flavors blend, about 2 minutes
7. Pour sausage mixture over bread in bowl
8. Mix in chopped apple, dried cranberries, parsley, and liver
9. Drizzle with turkey stock and melted butter; mix lightly
10. Allow stuffing to cool completely before loosely stuffing a turkey
11. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 80mg 27%, Sodium 548mg 24%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 13g, Vitamin C 9mg 44%, Calcium 47mg 4%, Iron 3mg 17%, Potassium 268mg 6%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/13651/awesome-sausage-apple-and-cranberry-stuffing/

RECIPE 1036: Strawberry Muffins
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 8 muffins
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Muffin Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup milk
• ¼ cup canola oil
• 1 large egg
• 1 ¾ cups all-purpose flour
• ½ cup white sugar
• 2 teaspoons baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup chopped strawberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) Line 8 standard-sized muffin cups with paper liners
2. Lightly beat milk, oil, and egg in a small bowl
3. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl
4. Toss in chopped strawberries and stir to coat with flour
5. Fold in the milk mixture until just combined
6. Divide batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups
7. Bake in the preheated oven until the tops bounce back from the touch and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes
8. Remove from the oven and cool for 10 minutes in the pan before removing to a wire rack to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Cholesterol 25mg 8%, Sodium 283mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 11mg 57%, Calcium 96mg 7%, Iron 2mg 9%, Potassium 91mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8449/strawberry-muffins/

RECIPE 1037: Cranberry Orange Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 loaf
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Bread/Quick Bread Recipes/Fruit Bread Recipes/Cranberry Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups flour
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ¾ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ¼ cup unsalted butter
• cut into pieces and softened
• ¾ cup orange juice
• 1 tablespoon grated orange zest
• 1 large egg
• beaten
• 1 cup chopped cranberries
• ½ cup chopped walnuts (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease an 8 1/2x4 1/2-inch loaf pan
3. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and baking soda in a bowl
4. Stir butter into flour mixture until combined
5. Add orange juice, orange zest, and egg; mix well
6. Fold in cranberries and walnuts
7. Spoon batter into the prepared pan
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 60 to 75 minutes
9. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 39mg 13%, Sodium 439mg 19%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 22g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 15mg 73%, Calcium 73mg 6%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 136mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228118/cranberry-orange-bread/

RECIPE 1038: Raspberry Jam without Pectin
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 56
Yield: 7 8-ounce jars
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Canning and Preserving Recipes/Jams and Jellies Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups mashed raspberries
• 4 cups white sugar
• 1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring raspberries to a boil in a very large pot
2. Cook for 4 minutes
3. Add sugar and lemon juice; stir well
4. Bring back to a boil, stirring constantly
5. Cook for another 4 minutes
6. Remove pot from heat and divide jam into sterilized jars, leaving 1/4-inch of space at the top
7. Seal and transfer jars into a boiling water bath
8. Make sure jars are covered with at least 1 inch of water; let sit for 5 minutes
9. Lift jars and let them cool in a draft-free place without touching, 8 hours to overnight

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Carbohydrate 15g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 2mg 12%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 14mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/263781/raspberry-jam-without-pectin/

============================================================

RECIPE 1039: Cocktail Meatballs
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Meat and Poultry/Meatball Appetizer Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pound lean ground beef
• ½ cup bread crumbs
• 3 tablespoons minced onion
• 2 tablespoons water
• 1 large egg
• 1 (8 ounce) can jellied cranberry sauce
• ¾ cup chili sauce
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• 1 ½ teaspoons lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Mix together ground beef, bread crumbs, onion, water, and egg in a large bowl
3. Form into small meatballs and arrange on a nonstick baking sheet
4. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, turning once
5. Stir together cranberry sauce, chili sauce, brown sugar, and lemon juice in a large saucepan over low heat until smooth
6. Add meatballs; simmer for 1 hour before serving
7. Allrecipes Magazine

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 53mg 18%, Sodium 85mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 10g, Vitamin C 9mg 46%, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 183mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15206/cocktail-meatballs/

RECIPE 1040: Simple Strawberry Syrup
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 15
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Syrup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup water
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 cups quartered strawberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine water and sugar in a saucepan over medium-high heat; stir until sugar is dissolved
2. Mix strawberries into saucepan and bring to a boil; boil for 10 minutes
3. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer until strawberries are mushy and sauce is thick, about 10 minutes
4. Strain liquid into a bottle and refrigerate

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 5%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 12mg 60%, Calcium 4mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 31mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/223462/simple-strawberry-syrup/

RECIPE 1044: Best Strawberry Cake from Scratch
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Yield: 1 2-layer 9-inch cake
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 25 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Strawberry Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 cup butter
• softened
• 1 (3 ounce) package strawberry flavored Jell-O®
• 4 large eggs (room temperature)
• 2 ¾ cups sifted cake flour
• 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• 1 cup whole milk
• room temperature
• ½ cup strawberry puree made from frozen sweetened strawberries
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans
3. Beat sugar, butter, and dry strawberry gelatin together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
4. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition
5. Combine flour and baking powder in a large bowl; stir into butter mixture alternately with milk
6. Blend in strawberry puree and vanilla
7. Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 25 to 30 minutes
9. Cool cakes on a wire rack for 10 minutes; run a table knife around the edges to loosen
10. Invert carefully onto a serving plate or cooling rack to cool completely. dotdash meredith food studios

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 20%, Saturated Fat 9g 46%, Cholesterol 90mg 30%, Sodium 233mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 59g 22%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 37g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 4mg 19%, Calcium 85mg 7%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 89mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/60564/strawberry-cake-from-scratch/

============================================================

RECIPE 1045: Fresh Cranberry Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 20 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Sauces/Cranberry Sauce Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup water
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 (12 ounce) package fresh cranberries (such as Ocean Spray®)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Bring water to a boil in a saucepan; add sugar and cook until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes
2. Stir cranberries into the saucepan and bring to a boil
3. Reduce heat to low, and simmer until cranberries have popped and sauce is chunky, about 10 minutes or longer for desired consistency
4. The longer you cook it, the less chunky it will be
5. Pour sauce into a serving dish or jars and cover until ready to use; the pectin in the cranberries will make the cranberry sauce gel as it cools
6. Mix cranberry sauce with a fork before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 13g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 3mg 14%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 18mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/239960/fresh-cranberry-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 1046: White Chocolate and Cranberry Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 dozen
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Chocolate Chip Cookie Recipes/White Chocolate/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 1 large egg
• 1 tablespoon brandy
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• 1 cup dried cranberries
• ¾ cup white chocolate chips

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Grease 2 cookie sheets
3. Beat brown sugar, white sugar, and butter with an electric mixer in a large bowl until creamy
4. Add egg and brandy and beat until incorporated
5. Combine flour and baking soda in a separate bowl
6. Stir flour mixture into the butter mixture until just combined
7. Fold in cranberries and white chocolate chips
8. Drop batter by heaping spoonful onto the prepared cookie sheets
9. Bake in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, switching racks halfway through; cookies will still appear slightly doughy
10. Remove from the oven and let cool briefly on the cookie sheets before transferring to wire racks to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 6g 8%, Saturated Fat 4g 19%, Cholesterol 19mg 6%, Sodium 64mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 2g, Calcium 23mg 2%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 19mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/10917/white-chocolate-and-cranberry-cookies/

RECIPE 1047: Spinach and Strawberry Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 10 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Spinach Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 bunches spinach
• rinsed and torn into bite-size pieces
• 4 cups sliced strawberries
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• ½ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup white wine vinegar
• 2 tablespoons sesame seeds
• 1 tablespoon poppy seeds
• ¼ teaspoon paprika

DIRECTIONS:
1. Toss together spinach and strawberries in a large bowl
2. Whisk oil, sugar, vinegar, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, and paprika together in a medium bowl
3. Pour over the spinach and strawberries, and toss to coat

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 20%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Sodium 69mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 73mg 365%, Calcium 135mg 10%, Iron 3mg 17%, Potassium 621mg 13%

RECIPE 1048: Cranberry Orange Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 48 cookies
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Cranberry/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• 1 large egg
• 2 tablespoons orange juice
• 1 teaspoon grated orange zest
• 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 2 cups chopped cranberries
• ½ cup chopped walnuts (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Make the cookies: Cream butter, white sugar, and brown sugar in a mixing bowl until smooth
3. Beat in egg until well blended
4. Mix in orange juice and zest
5. Whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl
6. Stir flour mixture into the butter mixture until combined
7. Mix in cranberries and walnuts until evenly distributed
8. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets
9. Bake in the preheated oven, switching racks halfway through, until edges are golden, 12 to 14 minutes
10. Transfer cookies to wire racks to cool completely
11. Meanwhile, make the glaze: Mix together confectioners' sugar, orange juice, and zest in a small bowl until smooth
12. Spread glaze over the tops of the cooled cookies; let stand until set
13. Kimberly Kahmann Harvey

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 3g 13%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 67mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 16g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 2mg 8%, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 26mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/40180/cranberry-orange-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 1049: Easy Blueberry Cobbler
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 8-inch cobbler
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Blueberry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ½ cup butter
• 1 cup self-rising flour
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup milk
• 4 cups fresh blueberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Place butter in an 8-inch, square baking dish
3. Melt butter in the preheating oven, about 5 minutes
4. Remove from oven
5. Meanwhile, mix flour, sugar, and milk in a bowl until combined; pour batter over melted butter in the baking dish
6. Scatter blueberries over batter
7. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 16%, Saturated Fat 8g 39%, Cholesterol 33mg 11%, Sodium 293mg 13%, Total Carbohydrate 49g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 34g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 7mg 36%, Calcium 97mg 7%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 125mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/223253/easy-blueberry-cobbler/

RECIPE 1050: White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 9-inch cheesecake
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 9 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Cheesecake Recipes/Chocolate Cheesecake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup chocolate cookie crumbs
• ¼ cup butter
• melted
• 3 tablespoons white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Make crust: Mix together cookie crumbs, melted butter, and sugar in a medium bowl
2. Press mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan
3. Make sauce: Combine raspberries, water, sugar, and cornstarch in a saucepan
4. Bring to a boil and continue boiling until sauce is thick, about 5 minutes
5. Strain through a mesh strainer to remove seeds
6. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
7. Make cheesecake: Melt white chocolate chips with half-and-half in a metal bowl over a pan of simmering water; stir occasionally until smooth
8. Mix together cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl until smooth
9. Beat in eggs one at a time
10. Blend in vanilla and melted white chocolate mixture
11. Pour 1/2 of the batter over crust
12. Spoon 3 tablespoons raspberry sauce over batter
13. Pour remaining cheesecake batter on top
14. Spoon 3 tablespoons raspberry sauce over batter
15. Swirl batter with the tip of a knife to create a marbled effect
16. Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set, 55 to 60 minutes
17. Cool cheesecake at room temperature, then cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, 8 hours to overnight
18. Remove cheesecake from the pan and serve with remaining raspberry sauce
19. Alberta Rose

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 28g 36%, Saturated Fat 17g 85%, Cholesterol 96mg 32%, Sodium 226mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 34g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 7g, Vitamin C 3mg 15%, Calcium 116mg 9%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 109mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/25642/white-chocolate-raspberry-cheesecake/

============================================================

RECIPE 1051: Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 9
Yield: 1 8x8-inch pan
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 35 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Oatmeal Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 cup rolled oats
• ½ cup packed light brown sugar
• ¼ teaspoon baking soda
• ⅛ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup butter
• softened
• ¾ cup seedless raspberry jam

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease an 8x8-inch square pan; line with greased foil
3. Combine flour, oats, brown sugar, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl
4. Rub in butter using your hands or a pastry blender to form a crumbly mixture
5. Press 2 cups oat mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan
6. Spread jam to within 1/4 inch of the edge
7. Sprinkle remaining crumb mixture on top; press down lightly into jam
8. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 35 to 40 minutes
9. Allow to cool before cutting into bars. raph_2122

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 11g 14%, Saturated Fat 7g 33%, Cholesterol 27mg 9%, Sodium 144mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 29g, Protein 3g, Calcium 20mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 67mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/11314/delicious-raspberry-oatmeal-cookie-bars/

RECIPE 1052: Cranberry Pistachio Biscotti
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 36
Yield: 36 cookies
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Nut Dessert Recipes/Pistachio Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup white sugar
• ¼ cup light olive oil
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• ½ teaspoon almond extract
• 2 large eggs
• 1 ¾ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 ½ cups pistachio nuts
• ½ cup dried cranberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
2. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper
3. Mix together sugar and oil in a large bowl until well blended
4. Mix in vanilla and almond extracts, then beat in eggs
5. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl; gradually stir into egg mixture until combined
6. Fold in pistachios and cranberries by hand
7. Divide dough in half
8. Form each piece into a 12x2-inch log on the prepared cookie sheet
9. Dough may be sticky; wet hands with cool water to handle dough more easily
10. Bake in the preheated oven until logs are light brown, about 35 minutes
11. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool for 10 minutes
12. Reduce oven temperature to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C)
13. Cut logs on the diagonal into 3/4-inch-thick slices
14. Lay cookies cut-side down on the cookie sheet
15. Bake cookies until dry, 8 to 10 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 6%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Cholesterol 10mg 3%, Sodium 55mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 6g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 16mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 66mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/10638/cranberry-pistachio-biscotti/

============================================================

RECIPE 1053: Strawberry Pie Filling
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fillings/Fruit Fillings/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup mashed strawberries
• ¾ cup water
• or more if needed
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 3 tablespoons cornstarch
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 4 cups sliced strawberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine mashed strawberries and water in a saucepan; bring to a boil and simmer for about 3 minutes
2. Strain juice from cooked strawberries and add enough water to make 1 cup of juice
3. Discard pulp
4. Combine sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and salt in a saucepan; stir strawberry juice into the sugar mixture
5. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until clear and thick, 3 to 5 minutes
6. Remove from heat and cool slightly
7. Stir sliced strawberries into the strawberry sauce

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 0g 0%, Sodium 75mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 30g 11%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 24g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 63mg 317%, Calcium 18mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 166mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/223204/strawberry-pie-filling/

============================================================

RECIPE 1054: Blueberry Simple Syrup
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 1/2 cups
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 35 mins
Rating: 4.4/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/Syrup Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup blueberries
• 1 cup warm water
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix blueberries, water, and sugar together using a whisk in a small saucepan over low heat until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes
2. Increase heat to medium and bring a gentle boil, stirring often, until syrup is thickened, about 15 minutes
3. Whisk lemon juice into syrup; serve immediately or cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Sodium 1mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 18g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 7%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Potassium 10mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/239712/blueberry-simple-syrup/

============================================================

RECIPE 1055: Jamie's Cranberry Spinach Salad
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 15 mins
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Salad/Green Salad Recipes/Spinach Salad Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 tablespoon butter
• ¾ cup almonds
• blanched and slivered
• 1 pound spinach
• rinsed and torn into bite-size pieces
• 1 cup dried cranberries

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat
2. Cook and stir almonds in butter until lightly toasted
3. Remove from heat and let cool
4. Make dressing: Whisk together oil, sugar, cider vinegar, white wine vinegar, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, minced onion, and paprika in a medium bowl
5. Combine spinach with toasted almonds and cranberries in a large serving bowl
6. Pour dressing over spinach mixture; toss well

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 24g 30%, Saturated Fat 3g 17%, Cholesterol 4mg 1%, Sodium 58mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 30g 11%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 16mg 81%, Calcium 127mg 10%, Iron 3mg 14%, Potassium 423mg 9%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/14469/jamies-cranberry-spinach-salad/

RECIPE 1056: Food for the Gods
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 3 dozen
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Date/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¼ cups sifted all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup dates
• pitted and chopped
• 1 cup butter
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• 3 eggs
• 1 cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)
2. Grease and line a 9 x 13 inch pan
3. Combine first 4 ingredients
4. Take 1/2 cup of flour mixture and dredge the dates
5. Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy
6. Add eggs, one at a time, and beat well after every addition
7. Gradually stir in flour mixture
8. Add dates and walnuts and stir until completely combined
9. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 10 minutes
10. Lower heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and bake for 30-40 minutes or until done
11. Cool on a wire rack for 20 minutes and cut into bars
12. Wrap individually with foil or colored cellophane wrap

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 15g 20%, Saturated Fat 7g 36%, Cholesterol 58mg 19%, Sodium 169mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 28g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 36mg 3%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 122mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/9892/food-for-the-gods/

============================================================

RECIPE 1057: Bacon Wrapped Dates Stuffed with Blue Cheese
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 32
Yield: 32 appetizers
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Meat and Poultry/Pork/Bacon/Appetizers/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 pound sliced bacon
• cut in half
• 1 pound pitted dates
• 4 ounces blue cheese

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Slice dates in half, and open them up
3. Pinch off pieces of blue cheese, and place them into the center of the dates
4. Close the halves of the dates, and wrap a half-slice of bacon around the outside
5. Secure each one with a toothpick
6. Arrange in a baking dish or on a baking sheet with sides to catch any grease
7. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the bacon is crisp
8. Turn dates over after the first 20 minutes for even cooking

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 157mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 9g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 128mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/75417/bacon-wrapped-dates-stuffed-with-blue-cheese/

RECIPE 1058: Queen Elizabeth Cake I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 9 to 13 x inch cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 40 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/UK and Ireland/English/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup boiling water
• 1 cup dates
• pitted and chopped
• ¼ cup butter
• softened
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 egg
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• 1 cup flaked coconut
• ⅔ cup packed brown sugar
• 6 tablespoons butter
• ¼ cup cream

DIRECTIONS:
1. Pour boiling water over dates in a small bowl, and let stand until cool
2. Measure flour, baking powder, soda, salt, and nuts into a small bowl
3. Stir to mix
4. Cream 1/4 cup butter or margarine and white sugar together in a mixing bowl; beat in egg and vanilla
5. Add flour mixture to creamed mixture in three parts alternately with date mixture in two parts, beginning and ending with dry mixture
6. Spread batter into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan
7. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 to 40 minutes, or until an inserted wooden pick comes out clean
8. To Make Topping: Mix coconut, brown sugar, 6 tablespoons butter and cream in a small saucepan over medium heat
9. Boil for three minutes
10. Spread over warm cake, and brown under broiler

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 9g 47%, Cholesterol 48mg 16%, Sodium 340mg 15%, Total Carbohydrate 54g 20%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 39g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 54mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 170mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7666/queen-elizabeth-cake-i/

============================================================

RECIPE 1059: Low-Sugar Date Brownies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 16 brownies
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Date/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup pitted Deglet Noor dates
• 1 cup hot water
• ½ cup unsalted butter
• softened
• 2 large eggs
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• ⅓ cup whole wheat flour
• ⅓ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ½ cup bittersweet chocolate chips (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place dates in a small bowl and pour in hot water
2. Soak for 10 to 15 minutes
3. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
4. Line an 8x8-inch baking dish with parchment paper, leaving enough paper to hang over the sides of the dish
5. Drain dates and transfer to a food processor
6. Pulse until dates are completely smooth, 1 to 2 minutes
7. If date paste is too thick, add hot water 1 tablespoon at a time until completely pureed
8. Add softened butter to the food processor and pulse to combine, about 30 seconds
9. Add eggs and vanilla extract and process until light and fluffy, about 1 minute
10. Add whole wheat flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt
11. Pulse until mixture is just combined, about 30 seconds
12. Gently stir in chocolate chips by hand
13. Pour batter into the prepared baking dish
14. Bake in the preheated oven until edges just begin to set, 20 to 25 minutes
15. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove brownies from pan by gently lifting up edges of parchment paper
16. Allow to cool completely on a cooling rack
17. Cut into 16 pieces

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 39mg 13%, Sodium 87mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 5%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 2g, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 141mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/267402/low-sugar-date-brownies/

============================================================

RECIPE 1060: Date Nut Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 loaves
Prep Time: 40 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 40 mins
Rating: 4.0/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Breakfast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups dates
• pitted and chopped
• 2 ¼ cups boiling water
• 3 teaspoons baking soda
• 1 cup chopped walnuts
• 2 cups white sugar
• 3 tablespoons margarine
• 2 eggs
• beaten
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 4 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Combine baking soda with the boiling water
2. Soak the dates in the water and baking soda solution for 30 minutes
3. Cream sugar and butter together
4. Add eggs, vanilla, dates, nuts, flour, and salt
5. Divide batter equally between two 9 x 5 (or 8 1/2 x 4 1/2) inch greased loaf pans
6. Bake 1 hour at 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) (or until loaf tests done)
7. Can be frozen when cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 7%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Cholesterol 16mg 5%, Sodium 276mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 42g 15%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 23g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 114mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/6852/date-nut-bread/

============================================================

RECIPE 1061: Date Balls
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 dozen cookies
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.1/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/No-Bake Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 (8 ounce) package pitted dates
• chopped
• 1 cup white sugar
• ½ cup butter or margarine
• 3 cups crispy rice cereal
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• ½ cup confectioners' sugar
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place dates, sugar, and margarine in a large saucepan over low heat; cook and stir until sugar dissolves
2. Remove from heat and fold in crispy rice cereal, pecans, and vanilla extract until evenly mixed
3. Roll date mixture into 1-inch balls using lightly greased hands; allow balls to cool
4. Spread confectioners' sugar into a shallow dish; roll date balls in confectioners' sugar to coat

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Sodium 71mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 17g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 2mg 12%, Calcium 9mg 1%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 86mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/230456/date-balls/

RECIPE 1062: Sticky Toffee Pudding Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 9
Yield: 1 8-inch cake
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 5 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Holidays and Events Recipes/Christmas/Desserts/Cakes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¾ cups pitted
• chopped dates
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• ¾ cup boiling water
• ⅓ cup butter
• ¾ cup white sugar
• 2 eggs
• beaten
• 1 ⅛ cups self-rising flour
• ¾ cup packed brown sugar
• ⅓ cup butter
• ⅔ cup evaporated milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease an 8-inch square baking dish
3. In a small bowl combine the dates and baking soda
4. Pour enough boiling water over the dates to just cover them
5. Cream 1/3 cup of butter with the white sugar until light
6. Beat in the eggs and mix well to combine
7. Add the flour and date mixture (including water) to the egg mixture and fold to combine
8. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish
9. Bake in the preheated oven until a tester comes out clean, 30 to 40 minutes
10. Let cool slightly and prepare the sauce
11. To Make Caramel Sauce: In a small saucepan combine the brown sugar, 1/3 cup butter, and evaporated milk
12. Cook over medium heat and bring to boil
13. Turn heat down and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally
14. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla
15. Pour the sauce over individual servings of warm cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 16g 21%, Saturated Fat 10g 50%, Cholesterol 83mg 28%, Sodium 477mg 21%, Total Carbohydrate 70g 25%, Dietary Fiber 3g 10%, Total Sugars 55g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 139mg 11%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 308mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8148/sticky-toffee-pudding-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 1063: Date Nut Loaf Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 - 9x5 inch loaf pan
Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs
Total Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup dates
• pitted and chopped
• 1 cup water
• ½ cup butter
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 egg
• beaten
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup chopped walnuts
• ¼ cup butter
• ⅓ cup heavy cream
• ½ cup brown sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan
3. In a saucepan over medium heat, bring dates and water to a boil
4. Stir in 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup sugar until melted
5. Remove from heat and stir in baking soda
6. Let cool for 10 minutes
7. Place date mixture into a large bowl
8. Blend in flour, eggs and vanilla
9. Stir in chopped walnuts
10. Pour batter into prepared pan
11. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean
12. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely
13. Serve slices with Warm Sauce
14. To make Warm Sauce: In a saucepan over medium heat, combine 1/4 cup butter with cream and brown sugar
15. Heat, stirring constantly, until mixture boils and sugar is dissolved

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 21g 27%, Saturated Fat 10g 48%, Cholesterol 55mg 18%, Sodium 198mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 48g 18%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 34g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 34mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 167mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/25567/date-nut-loaf-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 1064: Mother's Applesauce Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 1 tube cake
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 30 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Apple Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 3 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
• 1 teaspoon ground cloves
• 3 teaspoons baking soda
• ½ cup butter
• 2 cups packed brown sugar
• 2 eggs
• beaten
• 3 cups unsweetened applesauce
• ½ cup raisins
• ½ cup dates
• pitted and chopped
• 1 cup chopped walnuts
• ½ cup butter
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• ¼ cup milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 cups sifted confectioners' sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a tube pan
3. Whisk together flour, salt, cinnamon, cloves, and soda
4. Cream together 1/2 cup butter and 2 cups brown sugar, beating until light and fluffy
5. Mix in eggs
6. Add flour mixture into creamed mixture alternately with applesauce, beginning and ending with flour mixture
7. Stir in the raisins, dates, and walnuts
8. Pour batter into prepared pan
9. Bake in preheated oven until a tester inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean, about 1 1/2 hours
10. Cool on wire rack
11. To make icing, melt 1/2 cup butter or margarine in a small saucepan over low heat; stir in 1 cup brown sugar
12. Boil for 2 minutes
13. Stir in milk, and continue to stir until the mixture returns to a boil
14. Remove from heat, and cool for 5 minutes
15. Beat in vanilla and confectioners' sugar
16. Frost cooled cake

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 8g 40%, Cholesterol 54mg 18%, Sodium 415mg 18%, Total Carbohydrate 91g 33%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 66g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 1mg 5%, Calcium 66mg 5%, Iron 2mg 12%, Potassium 236mg 5%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8079/mothers-applesauce-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 1065: Devils on Horseback
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 20
Yield: 20 stuffed dates
Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Wraps and Rolls/

INGREDIENTS:
• 20 wooden toothpicks
• ¼ cup reduced-sodium soy sauce
• ½ teaspoon ground ginger
• ¾ cup dark brown sugar
• 20 dates
• pitted and left whole
• 20 whole smoked almonds
• 10 bacon slices
• cut in half crosswise

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Soak the toothpicks in a bowl of water
3. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish
4. In a bowl, mix together the soy sauce and ground ginger
5. Place the brown sugar into a shallow bowl
6. Spread open a pitted date, then stuff it with a smoked almond
7. Wrap the date with half a bacon slice, secure it with a toothpick, dip the bundle in soy sauce mixture, and then dip it into brown sugar
8. Place the wrapped dates into the prepared baking dish
9. If desired, sprinkle a little more brown sugar over the bundles
10. Bake in the preheated oven until the bacon is brown and crisp, 15 to 25 minutes
11. Allow to cool for about 15 minutes before serving; serve warm or at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 9%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 10mg 3%, Sodium 226mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 2g, Calcium 12mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 106mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/215385/devils-on-horseback/

RECIPE 1066: Coconut Date Balls
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 dozen
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 5 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/No-Bake Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 eggs
• beaten
• 1 cup white sugar
• 1 cup chopped dates
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 tablespoon butter
• 3 cups crispy rice cereal
• 1 cup flaked coconut

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the eggs sugar and dates
2. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally, and boil for 5 minutes
3. Remove from heat and stir in the butter and vanilla
4. Mix in crispy rice cereal
5. Butter hands and roll the mixture into walnut sized balls
6. Roll the balls in coconut

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 2g 2%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 45mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 18g 6%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 14g, Protein 1g, Vitamin C 2mg 12%, Calcium 5mg 0%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 61mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/25786/coconut-date-balls/

RECIPE 1067: Ma'amoul (Lebanese Date Cookies)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 4 dozen
Prep Time: 45 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 9 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Cuisine/Middle Eastern/Lebanese/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups semolina flour
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• ½ teaspoon ground mahlab
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup clarified butter
• at room temperature
• 5 tablespoons milk
• 2 tablespoons white sugar
• 1 teaspoon active dry yeast
• 4 tablespoons orange blossom water
• or more as needed
• 10 tablespoons date paste (such as Ziyad®)
• cut into small pieces
• 2 tablespoons powdered sugar
• or to taste

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix semolina flour, all-purpose flour, mahlab, and salt together in a large bowl
2. Work clarified butter into the dry ingredients with your fingertips until thoroughly incorporated
3. Cover bowl and let dough rest at room temperature, 8 hours to overnight
4. Pour milk into a microwave-safe bowl
5. Microwave until just warm, about 15 seconds
6. Stir in sugar and yeast until dissolved
7. Let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes
8. Pour yeast mixture and orange blossom water over the dough and mix until evenly moistened
9. Pinch off a piece of dough and roll into a ball; it should hold its shape without cracking
10. Add more milk or orange blossom water if needed
11. Cover and let rest for 15 minutes
12. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
13. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats
14. Sprinkle some flour over the ma'amoul molds and tap out the excess
15. Pinch off a walnut-sized piece of dough and roll into a ball
16. Press your thumb into the ball to create space for the filling
17. Work the edges with your fingers so the sides are even and fairly thin
18. Drop in a piece of date paste and pinch dough over it to seal
19. Place cookie into the mold cavity seam-side up
20. Press down so that the top is flush with edges of the mold
21. Trim off any excess dough
22. Invert the mold and tap it against your work surface to release the cookie
23. Repeat with remaining dough and date paste, arranging cookies 1 inch apart on the baking sheets
24. Bake in the preheated oven, 1 baking sheet at a time, until edges and bottoms are golden but tops are still mostly pale, about 15 minutes
25. Sift powdered sugar over the cookies while still slightly warm
26. Let cool completely
27. Store in an airtight container at room temperature

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 6%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 11mg 4%, Sodium 25mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 4g 2%, Dietary Fiber 0g 1%, Total Sugars 2g, Protein 0g, Calcium 3mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 20mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/278238/maamoul-lebanese-date-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 1068: Sugar-Free Date Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 18 cookies
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Banana Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup chopped dates
• ¼ cup chopped pecans
• ¼ cup water
• ½ very ripe banana
• mashed
• 1 large egg
• lightly beaten
• 2 tablespoons butter
• melted
• ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon salt

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Combine the dates, pecans, water, banana, egg, butter, and vanilla extract in a bowl
4. Whisk flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt together in a separate bowl
5. Add to the date mixture and stir until well combined
6. Drop dough by tablespoonfuls about 1 inch apart onto the prepared baking sheet and flatten lightly with the palm of your hand
7. Bake in the preheated oven until cookies start to brown around the edges, being careful not to over-bake, for 11 to 13 minutes
8. Transfer cookies immediately to a wire rack to cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 73mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 14g 5%, Dietary Fiber 1g 5%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 24mg 2%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 95mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/275260/sugar-free-date-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 1069: Energy Balls without Peanut Butter
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 45
Yield: 45 balls
Prep Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 2 hrs 20 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Snacks/Energy Ball Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup rolled oats
• ½ cup pumpkin seeds
• ½ cup walnuts
• ½ cup pecans
• 15 pitted Medjool dates
• ½ cup brown rice syrup
• 1 cup mini chocolate chips
• ½ cup shredded coconut
• ½ cup raisins
• ¼ cup sunflower seeds

DIRECTIONS:
1. Burst oats into a coarse meal in the bowl of a food processor
2. Add pumpkin seeds, walnuts, and pecans; pulse 10 to 15 times, until chunks are desired size
3. Toss dates into the food processor and mix for 30 seconds
4. Pour rice syrup in slowly, with the processor running, until combined and starting to ball up
5. Transfer to a bowl and mix in chocolate chips, coconut, raisins, and sunflower seeds
6. Pull off dough in 25 gram sections and roll into balls
7. Place in a single layer on a cookie sheet; it's okay if they touch but make sure they are not stacked
8. Refrigerate for 2 to 24 hours before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 6%, Saturated Fat 1g 7%, Sodium 5mg 0%, Total Carbohydrate 11g 4%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 10mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 98mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/283043/energy-balls-without-peanut-butter/

============================================================

RECIPE 1070: Date Loaf Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 - 9x5 inch loaf pan
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 45 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Cuisine/European/UK and Ireland/English/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup dates
• pitted and chopped
• 1 cup dark brown sugar
• ¼ cup margarine
• 1 cup boiling water
• 1 ¾ cups self-rising flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
2. Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan
3. In a large bowl, combine dates, brown sugar, margarine and boiling water
4. Let stand 15 minutes
5. Stir in flour, soda and vanilla
6. Pour batter into prepared pan
7. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes
8. Allow to cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 1g 4%, Sodium 386mg 17%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 26g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 83mg 6%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 130mg 3%

RECIPE 1071: Bacon Wrapped Dates
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 16
Yield: 16 appetizer servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/

INGREDIENTS:
• 16 fresh or dried pitted dates
• such as Medjool
• 16 smoked almonds
• 8 thick slices applewood-smoked bacon
• halved crosswise
• Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F
2. Cut a slit in each date
3. Place almonds inside slits
4. Press together the dates to close slits
5. Wrap each date with a piece of bacon
6. Line a shallow baking pan with Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil
7. Add a roasting rack; place the dates on rack
8. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes or until bacon is crisp
9. Serve immediately with toothpicks
10. Dates will be hot inside

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 3g 4%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Cholesterol 7mg 2%, Sodium 145mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 7g 2%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 5g, Protein 3g, Calcium 7mg 1%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 99mg 2%

RECIPE 1072: Matrimonial Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 1 -13x9 inch baking pan
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Date/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ¾ cups quick cooking oats
• 1 ¾ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• 1 cup butter
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 2 cups dates
• pitted and chopped
• ½ cup water
• ½ cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Grease one 13x9 inch baking pan
3. Combine the oats, flour, brown sugar, butter, salt and baking soda
4. The mixture will be crumbly
5. In a saucepan over low heat, cook the chopped dates with the water and the white sugar until the pulp is soft and well mixed
6. Layer 1/2 of the oat mixture onto the bottom of the prepared pan
7. Top with the date mixture and then finish off with the remaining oat mixture
8. Press down slightly on layers to compact
9. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes or until top crust begins to brown

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 5g 25%, Cholesterol 20mg 7%, Sodium 207mg 9%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 2g 6%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 2g, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 1mg 5%, Potassium 126mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/11192/matrimonial-bars/

RECIPE 1074: Date Nut Pinwheel Cookies II
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 60
Yield: 5 dozen
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Date/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup butter (at room temperature)
• 2 cups packed brown sugar
• 3 eggs
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon salt
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• 4 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 8 ounces dates
• pitted and chopped
• 1 cup finely chopped pecans
• ½ cup water
• ½ cup white sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. Cream the butter and brown sugar together in a mixing bowl until smooth
2. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition
3. Stir in the vanilla
4. Sift the cinnamon, salt, baking soda, and flour together in a second mixing bowl
5. Slowly stir the flour mixture into the egg mixture until evenly blended
6. Divide the dough evenly into three portions and place each on a square of waxed paper
7. Wrap and refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour
8. Meanwhile, make the filling by combine the dates, pecans, water and white sugar in a saucepan set over low heat
9. Cook and stir until the filling has a paste-like consistency
10. Cool slightly
11. Working with one portion at a time, roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to make a rectangle about 1/4 inch thick
12. Spread 1/3 of the filling evenly over the dough; roll up to make a log
13. Repeat the process with the remaining dough
14. Refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour
15. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)
16. Lightly grease two baking sheets
17. Using a sharp, serrated knife, cut the rolls into 1/4 inch slices
18. Place the slices on prepared baking sheets
19. Bake in preheated oven until set and lightly browned, about 15 minutes
20. Cool on racks

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 2g 11%, Cholesterol 17mg 6%, Sodium 48mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 19g 7%, Dietary Fiber 1g 3%, Total Sugars 11g, Protein 2g, Calcium 13mg 1%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 56mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/10088/date-nut-pinwheel-cookies-ii/

============================================================

RECIPE 1075: Date and Nut Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 2 dozen
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Spice Cookie Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅓ cup boiling water
• 2 cups dates
• pitted and chopped
• ½ cup shortening
• 1 cup white sugar
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¾ teaspoon salt
• ⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg
• 2 eggs
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• ¼ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• ¼ cup confectioners' sugar

DIRECTIONS:
1. In a small bowl, pour boiling water over dates, and set aside to cool
2. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
3. Grease a 10x10 inch baking pan
4. In a medium bowl, cream together the shortening and white sugar
5. Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition
6. Add the dates, including any water; mix well
7. Sift together the flour, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg, and baking soda; stir into the date mixture
8. Then stir in the nuts
9. Spread the mixture evenly into the prepared 10x10 inch pan, and bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven
10. When cool, cut into bars, and roll each bar in confectioners' sugar

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 16%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 184mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 46g 17%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 35g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 21mg 2%, Iron 1mg 6%, Potassium 205mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/11629/date-and-nut-bars/

============================================================

RECIPE 1077: Cherry Winks
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 30
Yield: 5 dozen
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Cherry Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup shortening
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 eggs
• 2 tablespoons milk
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 2 ¼ cups sifted all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon salt
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 1 cup dates
• pitted and chopped
• ⅓ cup maraschino cherries
• chopped
• 2 ½ cups crushed cornflakes cereal
• 10 maraschino cherries
• quartered

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Lightly grease baking sheets
3. Cream the shortening with the sugar
4. Blend in the eggs, milk and vanilla
5. Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt
6. Add the flour mixture to the creamed mixture and mix well
7. Stir in the chopped pecans, chopped dates and 1/3 cup maraschino cherries
8. Shape teaspoonful sized chunks of dough into balls
9. Roll each ball in the crushed corn flakes
10. Place balls on the prepared baking sheets and top each cookie with 1/4 maraschino cherry
11. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 10 to 12 minutes
12. Let cool completely before storing in airtight containers

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 8g 11%, Saturated Fat 2g 8%, Cholesterol 13mg 4%, Sodium 98mg 4%, Total Carbohydrate 22g 8%, Dietary Fiber 1g 4%, Total Sugars 10g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 19mg 1%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 72mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/11223/cherry-winks/

============================================================

RECIPE 1078: Pecan Pie Energy Bites
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 2-inch balls
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 25 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Snacks/Energy Ball Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup pecan halves
• ⅓ cup rolled oats
• 1 cup pitted Medjool dates
• ⅛ teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ¼ teaspoon kosher salt
• ¼ teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 tablespoon maple syrup

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Arrange a single layer of pecans on the prepared baking sheet
4. Top with rolled oats
5. Bake in the preheated oven until toasted, about 10 minutes
6. Allow to cool completely
7. Pulse pecans, oats, dates, cinnamon, salt, vanilla extract, and maple syrup in a food processor until nuts are ground to desired consistency
8. Shape mixture into twelve 2-inch tightly-packed balls
9. Refrigerate before serving

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 7g 8%, Saturated Fat 1g 3%, Sodium 41mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 15g 5%, Dietary Fiber 2g 7%, Protein 2g, Potassium 144mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8381294/pecan-pie-energy-bites/

RECIPE 1079: Date Nut Pinwheel Cookies I
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 4 dozen
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Date/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 ½ cups pitted dates
• ¼ cup white sugar
• 1 pinch salt
• 1 ¼ cups water
• 1 teaspoon lemon zest
• 4 teaspoons lemon juice
• ⅔ cup finely chopped walnuts
• 3 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
• ¼ teaspoon baking soda
• ¾ teaspoon salt
• ¾ cup butter
• ½ cup white sugar
• 1 cup packed brown sugar
• 2 eggs
• 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Chop pitted dates in food chopper
2. Place dates into small saucepan and add 1/4 cup sugar, dash of salt, and 1 1/4 cups of water
3. Cook, stirring constantly until mixture is of a soft consistency
4. Remove from heat
5. Add grated lemon rind, lemon juice, and chopped nuts
6. Mix well and chill
7. Cream together 3/4 cup butter and gradually add 1/2 cup white sugar and 1cup lightly packed brown sugar
8. Beat 2 eggs until thick and add to creamed mixture part at a time, beating well after each addition
9. Stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
10. Measure into a sifter 3 1/2 cups flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon baking soda, and 3/4 teaspoon of salt
11. Sift together twice
12. Sift dry ingredients into creamed mixture about 1/4 at a time
13. Combine thoroughly after each addition
14. Chill until firm
15. Divide dough into 3 parts
16. Roll out 1 part at a time into a rectangle
17. Spread with date filling
18. Roll up jelly roll fashion in waxed paper
19. Chill several hours
20. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)
21. With sharp knife, slice 1/4 inch thick slices off of rolls and place on greased cookie sheets
22. Bake 10 - 13 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 9g 11%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 31mg 10%, Sodium 173mg 8%, Total Carbohydrate 37g 13%, Dietary Fiber 2g 5%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 1mg 3%, Calcium 39mg 3%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 116mg 2%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/10087/date-nut-pinwheel-cookies-i/

============================================================

RECIPE 1080: Eggless Date Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 8
Yield: 1 loaf
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Cakes/Coffee Cake Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• ¾ cup milk
• 18 dates
• pitted and left whole
• ½ cup brown sugar
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract (Optional)
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon (Optional)
• ¼ cup chopped walnuts (Optional)

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat milk in a saucepan until almost boiling and stir in dates; let soak for several hours, refrigerated
2. For best flavor, refrigerate dates and milk overnight
3. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
4. Grease a medium loaf pan
5. Transfer milk and dates to food processor, add brown sugar, and process into a smooth paste
6. Mix in vegetable oil and vanilla extract with a few pulses
7. Whisk flour, baking soda, and cinnamon in a bowl until thoroughly combined
8. Pulse flour mixture, about 1/4 cup at a time, into the date paste until batter is smooth; do not overmix
9. Stir walnuts into batter with a fork and transfer to the prepared loaf pan
10. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the middle of the cake comes out clean, about 40 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 21%, Saturated Fat 3g 14%, Cholesterol 2mg 1%, Sodium 171mg 7%, Total Carbohydrate 41g 15%, Dietary Fiber 2g 8%, Total Sugars 27g, Protein 3g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 54mg 4%, Iron 1mg 7%, Potassium 210mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/228297/eggless-date-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 1081: Coconut Date Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 4
Yield: 4 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 40 mins
Rating: 4.7/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Date/

INGREDIENTS:
• ⅓ cup slivered almonds
• ½ cup flaked coconut
• 10 pitted dates
• or to taste
• ¼ cup cashews
• or to taste
• 1 teaspoon coconut oil

DIRECTIONS:
1. Blend almonds and coconut in a food processor; add dates and pulse until combined
2. Add cashews and coconut oil; pulse until mixture is thick and sticks together
3. Transfer to a sheet of waxed paper; form into a square, folding sides of waxed paper over the top
4. Refrigerate until solid, at least 30 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 17g 22%, Saturated Fat 9g 44%, Sodium 61mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%, Dietary Fiber 5g 17%, Total Sugars 15g, Protein 5g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 38mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 304mg 6%
