RECIPE 1082: Great-Grandma Cathy's Date Loaf Candy
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 servings
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 8 hrs 30 mins
Rating: 4.3/5
Category: /Desserts/Candy Recipes/Nut Candy Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 cup milk
• ¼ cup butter
• 1 cup chopped dates
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Stir sugar, milk, and butter together in a saucepan; bring to a boil without stirring once the boiling begins
2. Heat until a small amount of syrup dropped into cold water forms a rigid ball or until the mixture reaches 250 degrees F (120 degrees C), about 20 minutes
3. Immediately remove saucepan from heat and stir dates, pecans, and vanilla into the milk mixture
4. Thoroughly wet a piece of cheesecloth and lay out onto a flat work surface
5. Pour the candy mixture into the middle of the cloth and roll the cloth around it to shape into a log
6. Refrigerate until hard, 8 hours to overnight
7. Remove log from cloth and slice

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 4g 20%, Cholesterol 14mg 5%, Sodium 43mg 2%, Total Carbohydrate 56g 20%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 53g, Protein 2g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 45mg 3%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 201mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/238901/great-grandma-cathys-date-loaf-candy/

============================================================

RECIPE 1083: Power Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 18
Yield: 18 cookies
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.2/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Date/

INGREDIENTS:
• 4 cups rolled oats
• 1 (15 ounce) can cannellini beans
• drained and rinsed
• ½ cup white sugar
• ½ cup brown sugar
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
• ½ cup chopped pitted dates
• ½ cup flaked coconut
• ½ cup raisins
• ½ cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
2. Grease cookie sheets
3. Grind the oats in a blender until resembling coarse flour
4. In a medium bowl, mash beans to a smooth paste
5. Stir in the white sugar, brown sugar and vanilla until well blended
6. Combine the ground oats, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamon; blend into the bean mixture
7. Stir in the dates, coconut, raisins and walnuts
8. Drop dough by heaping spoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheet
9. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden
10. Cool on baking sheets for 5 minutes then remove to wire racks to cool completely

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 4g 5%, Saturated Fat 1g 5%, Sodium 147mg 6%, Total Carbohydrate 33g 12%, Dietary Fiber 4g 13%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 40mg 3%, Iron 1mg 8%, Potassium 154mg 3%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/20340/power-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 1084: Reshteh Polo (Persian Noodle Rice)
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 10
Yield: 10 servings
Prep Time: 35 mins
Cook Time: 1 hrs 10 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 5.0/5
Category: /Side Dish/Rice Side Dish Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 1 cup basmati rice
• 3 ½ tablespoons kosher salt
• divided
• ¼ teaspoon saffron threads
• 2 tablespoons boiling water
• ½ (8 ounce) package roasted noodles
• ¼ cup grapeseed oil
• kosher salt to taste (such as Diamond Crystal®)
• 2 medium gold potatoes
• sliced into quarter rounds
• ¼ cup boiling water
• 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
• melted
• 3 tablespoons unsalted butter
• 6 Medjool dates
• pitted and quartered
• ½ cup golden raisins
• rinsed and drained
• ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place rice in a medium bowl and cover with tepid water
2. Gently swish it around with your finger to activate the starches, then tip the bowl to drain water
3. Repeat this process until water runs clear, about 7 rinses
4. Cover rice with cold water, add 1/2 tablespoon salt, stir gently, and soak for 1 hour
5. Drain rice without rinsing
6. Crush saffron threads to a powder in a small mortar and pestle
7. Transfer to a small bowl with 2 tablespoons boiling water
8. Stir, cover, and set saffron water aside
9. Fill a 5-quart nonstick pot with 9 cups water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat
10. Add 3 tablespoons salt and stir until dissolved
11. Break roasted noodles into thirds and add to the boiling water with the rice
12. Stir once gently, and watch carefully as it cooks so water does not boil over
13. Taste water for salt and adjust accordingly
14. Cook until the first rice grain pops up to the surface
15. Set a timer for 4 minutes and cook, scooping off any foam from the surface, until the timer goes off
16. Test rice and continue to cook until tender on the outside but still firm to the bite on the inside, 6 to 8 minutes more
17. Drain rice and noodles in a colander and rinse quickly with lukewarm water and a spray faucet to rinse off extra starch
18. Taste and gently rinse again if too salty
19. Set aside to drain completely
20. Wash and dry the pot
21. Place the clean pot over medium heat
22. Add oil, 1 tablespoon saffron water, and a pinch of salt; swirl the pot until the bottom and lower sides are coated with the oil mixture
23. Tightly overlap potato slices in a single layer covering the bottom of the pot to create the tahdig layer
24. Gently scatter rice-noodle mixture over the tahdig in a pyramid shape, making sure potatoes are completely covered and moving noodles away from the sides of the pot
25. Gently poke the handle of a wooden spoon into the rice and noodles a few times, being careful not to hit the tahdig; this will allow steam to escape while cooking
26. Cover and cook until you see steam escaping from the sides of the lid and tahdig starts to set, about 10 minutes
27. Meanwhile, combine 1/4 cup boiling water with 2 tablespoons melted butter and remaining saffron water
28. Lay a kitchen towel out on a heatproof surface
29. Test the tahdig by quickly tapping the side of the pot with a wooden spoon
30. When the pot sizzles, remove it from the heat
31. Remove the lid and place it on the kitchen towel, being careful that none of the condensation drips into the pot
32. Wrap the towel around the lid and secure the ends at the top by the handle so they will not hang near the heat source
33. Drizzle the butter mixture over the rice and cover with the towel-wrapped lid
34. Place a heat diffuser on a burner over low or medium-low heat and return the pot to the stove
35. Cook until crispy, rotating the pot a few times, about 35 minutes
36. Remove from the heat and place on a damp kitchen towel; let sit, uncovered, for 5 minutes so tahdig will release easily
37. Meanwhile, melt 3 tablespoons butter in a small pan over medium heat
38. Add dates, raisins, and cinnamon; sprinkle with a little salt
39. Cook and stir until dates are glistening and soft, 3 to 5 minutes
40. Gently scatter rice on a platter and remove potato tahdig pieces and serve on the side
41. Sprinkle raisin-date sauce over top

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 12g 15%, Saturated Fat 4g 22%, Cholesterol 15mg 5%, Sodium 2124mg 92%, Total Carbohydrate 45g 16%, Dietary Fiber 2g 9%, Total Sugars 16g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 15mg 1%, Iron 0mg 2%, Potassium 176mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/279194/reshteh-polo-persian-noodle-rice/

============================================================

RECIPE 1085: Paleo Almond Date Cookies
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 24
Yield: 2 dozen
Prep Time: 25 mins
Cook Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 50 mins
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Nut Dessert Recipes/Almond Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups blanched almond flour
• 1 cup pitted and chopped dates
• ½ cup chopped dried cherries
• ½ cup chopped walnuts
• 2 tablespoons chia seeds
• or more to taste
• ½ teaspoon baking soda
• ½ teaspoon sea salt
• ½ cup coconut oil
• 1 egg
• 2 tablespoons maple syrup
• 1 tablespoon vanilla extract

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
2. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper
3. Combine almond flour, dates, cherries, walnuts, chia seeds, baking soda, and sea salt in a large bowl; whisk to blend
4. Add coconut oil, egg, maple syrup, and vanilla extract; blend well with a spoon or fork until dough comes together
5. Scoop dough onto prepared baking sheets with a small cookie scoop
6. Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 15 minutes
7. Turn off oven and let cookies sit with oven door closed, about 10 minutes more
8. Remove from oven and let cool

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 13g 17%, Saturated Fat 5g 24%, Cholesterol 8mg 3%, Sodium 67mg 3%, Total Carbohydrate 12g 4%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 8g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 13mg 1%, Iron 1mg 4%, Potassium 68mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/246422/paleo-almond-date-cookies/

============================================================

RECIPE 1086: Date-Nut Balls
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 48
Yield: 4 dozen balls
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 3.8/5
Category: /Desserts/Cookies/Fruit Cookie Recipes/Date/

INGREDIENTS:
• 14 tablespoons butter
• 1 cup pitted chopped dates
• 1 cup white sugar
• 2 cups crispy rice cereal (such as Rice Krispies®)
• 1 cup chopped pecans
• 2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar
• or as needed

DIRECTIONS:
1. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir dates and white sugar in melted butter until thick and golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes
2. Remove saucepan from heat
3. Stir crispy rice cereal and pecans into hot date mixture
4. Let cool until easily handled, 5 to 10 minutes
5. Form mixture into small balls with your hands
6. Pour confectioners' sugar into a resealable plastic bag; add date-nut balls, seal the bag, and lightly shake until well-coated

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 5g 6%, Saturated Fat 2g 12%, Cholesterol 9mg 3%, Sodium 33mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 8g 3%, Dietary Fiber 1g 2%, Total Sugars 7g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 1mg 4%, Calcium 4mg 0%, Iron 1mg 3%, Potassium 32mg 1%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/240653/date-nut-balls/

============================================================

RECIPE 1087: Jamaica Cake
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 14
Yield: 1 - 13x9 inch pan
Rating: 4.6/5
Category: /Desserts/Fruit Desserts/Banana Dessert Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups white sugar
• 1 ½ cups vegetable oil
• 1 ½ cups chopped pecans
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 bananas
• peeled and diced
• 3 eggs
• 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple with juice
• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 teaspoon baking soda

DIRECTIONS:
1. Mix together sugar, vegetable oil, pecans, flour, and bananas in a 13 x 9 inch pan
2. Stir in the eggs, pineapple (with juice), vanilla, salt and baking soda
3. Do not mash the bananas
4. Bake in a preheated 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven for 60 minutes or until cake tests done

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 33g 43%, Saturated Fat 4g 21%, Cholesterol 40mg 13%, Sodium 272mg 12%, Total Carbohydrate 61g 22%, Dietary Fiber 3g 9%, Total Sugars 37g, Protein 6g, Vitamin C 5mg 27%, Calcium 25mg 2%, Iron 2mg 11%, Potassium 201mg 4%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/7509/jamaica-cake/

============================================================

RECIPE 1088: Best Hot Sauce
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 100
Yield: 2 cups
Prep Time: 10 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 30 mins
Rating: 4.9/5
Category: /Side Dish/Sauces and Condiments/

INGREDIENTS:
• 10 fresh hot chile peppers
• stems removed
• 1 onion
• coarsely chopped
• ¼ cup pitted fresh dates
• or more to taste
• ¼ cup fresh basil leaves
• ¼ cup fresh parsley leaves
• 1 roma (plum) tomato
• roughly chopped
• 2 tablespoons beef bouillon powder
• 4 garlic cloves
• ½ cup vegetable oil
• or as needed
• salt to taste
• 1 squeeze lemon juice

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place peppers, onion, dates, basil, parsley, tomato, bouillon powder, and garlic in the bowl of a food processor; pour in the oil
2. Pulse mixture until finely chopped, adding more oil if needed to thin; season with salt
3. Pour pepper mixture into a small saucepan; bring to a boil
4. Squeeze lemon juice into pepper mixture, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 15 minutes
5. Allow pepper mixture to cool; pour into a glass jar with a lid
6. Store pepper sauce in the refrigerator

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 1g 1%, Saturated Fat 0g 1%, Sodium 29mg 1%, Total Carbohydrate 1g 0%, Dietary Fiber 0g 0%, Total Sugars 0g, Protein 0g, Vitamin C 11mg 57%, Calcium 2mg 0%, Iron 0mg 1%, Potassium 21mg 0%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/242153/best-hot-sauce/

============================================================

RECIPE 1089: Moist Date Nut Bread
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf
Prep Time: 15 mins
Cook Time: 50 mins
Total Time: 1 hrs 35 mins
Rating: 4.5/5
Category: /Breakfast and Brunch/Breakfast Bread Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 ½ cups chopped dates
• ¼ cup butter
• 1 cup boiling water
• ½ cup packed brown sugar
• 1 large egg
• 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon baking soda
• 1 teaspoon baking powder
• 1 teaspoon salt
• 1 cup chopped walnuts

DIRECTIONS:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees F)
2. Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan
3. In a medium bowl, combine dates and butter
4. Pour boiling water over top and let stand until cool
5. Stir cooled date mixture to break up any clumps
6. Add brown sugar and egg; mix until well blended
7. Combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a bowl
8. Stir flour mixture into date mixture until just blended
9. Stir in walnuts
10. Pour batter into the prepared pan
11. Bake in the preheated oven until a wooden pick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 50 minutes

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 10g 13%, Saturated Fat 3g 16%, Cholesterol 26mg 9%, Sodium 365mg 16%, Total Carbohydrate 47g 17%, Dietary Fiber 4g 14%, Total Sugars 30g, Protein 4g, Vitamin C 0mg 2%, Calcium 51mg 4%, Iron 2mg 8%, Potassium 312mg 7%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/51446/moist-date-nut-bread/

============================================================

RECIPE 1090: Chef John's Chocolate Energy Bars
------------------------------------------------------------
Servings: 12
Yield: 12 bars
Prep Time: 15 mins
Total Time: 3 hrs
Rating: 4.8/5
Category: /Appetizers and Snacks/Snacks/Granola Bar Recipes/

INGREDIENTS:
• 2 cups pitted Medjool dates
• roughly chopped
• 2 cups raw cashews
• 1 cup raw or roasted unsalted almonds
• ¾ cup high-quality unsweetened cocoa powder (such as Guittard® Cocoa Rouge)
• 2 tablespoons coconut oil
• melted
• ½ cup unsweetened shredded coconut
• 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
• 1 tablespoon cold espresso
• or more as needed (or water)
• ½ teaspoon kosher salt
• ½ pinch cayenne pepper

DIRECTIONS:
1. Place cashews, almonds, coconut, dates, cocoa, coconut oil, vanilla, cold coffee, cayenne and salt in the bowl of a food processor
2. Pulse on and off to start
3. Process about 1 minute; check to ensure mixture is sticky and moist enough to stick together
4. Add more coffee if needed
5. Continue to process until mixture becomes a chunky mass
6. Line a baking pan with plastic wrap
7. Scoop mixture into pan
8. Press down with a spatula until mixture is even
9. Place a layer of plastic wrap on the surface and smooth again with your hands
10. Refrigerate until cold and firm, 2 or 3 hours
11. Remove from the pan and unwrap
12. Cut into bars of your preferred size
13. Store in a zip top back in the refrigerator

NUTRITION INFO:
Total Fat 22g 28%, Saturated Fat 7g 36%, Sodium 230mg 10%, Total Carbohydrate 36g 13%, Dietary Fiber 7g 25%, Total Sugars 21g, Protein 8g, Vitamin C 0mg 1%, Calcium 59mg 5%, Iron 3mg 17%, Potassium 515mg 11%

Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/254452/chef-johns-chocolate-energy-bars/

============================================================
